a10_server.description: Manage A10 Networks AX/SoftAX/Thunder/vThunder devices' server object.
body: a10_server:
password: ${1:null} # required. Password for the C(username) account.
server_name: ${2:undefined} # required. The SLB (Server Load Balancer) server name.
host: ${3:null} # required. Hostname or IP of the A10 Networks device.
username: ${4:null} # required. An account with administrator privileges.
url_password: ${5:undefined} # not required. The password for use in HTTP basic authentication.,If the I(url_username) parameter is not specified, the I(url_password) parameter will not be used.

validate_certs: ${6|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled devices using self-signed certificates.

client_key: ${7:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for SSL client authentication. If C(client_cert) contains both the certificate and key, this option is not required.

server_ports: ${8:null} # not required. A list of ports to create for the server. Each list item should be a dictionary which specifies the C(port:) and C(protocol:), but can also optionally specify the C(status:). See the examples below for details. This parameter is required when C(state) is C(present).
force: ${9:false} # not required. If C(yes) do not get a cached copy.
partition: ${10:null} # not required. set active-partition
server_status: ${11|enabled,disabled|} # not required. choices: enabled;disabled. The SLB virtual server status.
url_username: ${12:undefined} # not required. The username for use in HTTP basic authentication.,This parameter can be used without I(url_password) for sites that allow empty passwords
server_ip: ${13:null} # not required. The SLB server IPv4 address.
url: ${14:undefined} # not required. HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP URL in the form (http|https|ftp)://[user[:pass]]@host.domain[:port]/path
state: ${15|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. This is to specify the operation to create, update or remove SLB server.
force_basic_auth: ${16:false} # not required. Credentials specified with I(url_username) and I(url_password) should be passed in HTTP Header.

client_cert: ${17:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted certificate chain file to be used for SSL client authentication. This file can also include the key as well, and if the key is included, C(client_key) is not required.

write_config: ${18|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(yes), any changes will cause a write of the running configuration to non-volatile memory. This will save I(all) configuration changes, including those that may have been made manually or through other modules, so care should be taken when specifying C(yes).
use_proxy: ${19:true} # not required. If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
http_agent: ${20:ansible-httpget} # not required. Header to identify as, generally appears in web server logs.
a10_server_axapi3:
password: ${1:null} # required. Password for the C(username) account.
server_name: ${2:undefined} # required. The SLB (Server Load Balancer) server name.
server_ip: ${3:undefined} # required. The SLB (Server Load Balancer) server IPv4 address.
host: ${4:null} # required. Hostname or IP of the A10 Networks device.
username: ${5:null} # required. An account with administrator privileges.
url_password: ${6:undefined} # not required. The password for use in HTTP basic authentication.,If the I(url_username) parameter is not specified, the I(url_password) parameter will not be used.

validate_certs: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled devices using self-signed certificates.

client_key: ${8:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for SSL client authentication. If C(client_cert) contains both the certificate and key, this option is not required.
server_ports: ${9:null} # not required. A list of ports to create for the server. Each list item should be a dictionary which specifies the C(port:) and C(protocol:).
force: ${10:false} # not required. If C(yes) do not get a cached copy.
url: ${11:undefined} # not required. HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP URL in the form (http|https|ftp)://[user[:pass]]@host.domain[:port]/path
server_status: ${12|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. The SLB (Server Load Balancer) virtual server status.
url_username: ${13:undefined} # not required. The username for use in HTTP basic authentication.,This parameter can be used without I(url_password) for sites that allow empty passwords
force_basic_auth: ${14:false} # not required. Credentials specified with I(url_username) and I(url_password) should be passed in HTTP Header.

client_cert: ${15:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted certificate chain file to be used for SSL client authentication. This file can also include the key as well, and if the key is included, C(client_key) is not required.

operation: ${16|create,update,remove|} # not required. choices: create;update;remove. Create, Update or Remove SLB server. For create and update operation, we use the IP address and server name specified in the POST message. For delete operation, we use the server name in the request URI.

write_config: ${17|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(yes), any changes will cause a write of the running configuration to non-volatile memory. This will save I(all) configuration changes, including those that may have been made manually or through other modules, so care should be taken when specifying C(yes).
use_proxy: ${18:true} # not required. If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
http_agent: ${19:ansible-httpget} # not required. Header to identify as, generally appears in web server logs.

a10_service_group.description: Manage A10 Networks AX/SoftAX/Thunder/vThunder devices' service groups.
body: a10_service_group:
password: ${1:null} # required. Password for the C(username) account.
service_group: ${2:null} # required. The SLB (Server Load Balancing) service-group name
host: ${3:null} # required. Hostname or IP of the A10 Networks device.
username: ${4:null} # required. An account with administrator privileges.
url_password: ${5:undefined} # not required. The password for use in HTTP basic authentication.,If the I(url_username) parameter is not specified, the I(url_password) parameter will not be used.

validate_certs: ${6|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled devices using self-signed certificates.

client_key: ${7:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for SSL client authentication. If C(client_cert) contains both the certificate and key, this option is not required.
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. If the specified service group should exists.
service_group_protocol: ${9|tcp,udp|} # not required. choices: tcp;udp. The SLB service-group protocol of TCP or UDP.
partition: ${10:null} # not required. set active-partition

client_cert: ${11:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted certificate chain file to be used for SSL client authentication. This file can also include the key as well, and if the key is included, C(client_key) is not required.

servers: ${12:null} # not required. A list of servers to add to the service group. Each list item should be a dictionary which specifies the C(server:) and C(port:), but can also optionally specify the C(status:). See the examples below for details.
url_username: ${13:undefined} # not required. The username for use in HTTP basic authentication.,This parameter can be used without I(url_password) for sites that allow empty passwords
url: ${14:undefined} # not required. HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP URL in the form (http|https|ftp)://[user[:pass]]@host.domain[:port]/path
force: ${15:false} # not required. If C(yes) do not get a cached copy.
force_basic_auth: ${16:false} # not required. Credentials specified with I(url_username) and I(url_password) should be passed in HTTP Header.

service_group_method: ${17|round-robin,weighted-rr,least-connection,weighted-least-connection,service-least-connection,service-weighted-least-connection,fastest-response,least-request,round-robin-strict,src-ip-only-hash,src-ip-hash|} # not required. choices: round-robin;weighted-rr;least-connection;weighted-least-connection;service-least-connection;service-weighted-least-connection;fastest-response;least-request;round-robin-strict;src-ip-only-hash;src-ip-hash. The SLB service-group load balancing method, such as round-robin or weighted-rr.

write_config: ${18|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(yes), any changes will cause a write of the running configuration to non-volatile memory. This will save I(all) configuration changes, including those that may have been made manually or through other modules, so care should be taken when specifying C(yes).
use_proxy: ${19:true} # not required. If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
http_agent: ${20:ansible-httpget} # not required. Header to identify as, generally appears in web server logs.

a10_virtual_server.description: Manage A10 Networks AX/SoftAX/Thunder/vThunder devices' virtual servers.
body: a10_virtual_server:
password: ${1:null} # required. Password for the C(username) account.
virtual_server: ${2:null} # required. The SLB (Server Load Balancing) virtual server name.
host: ${3:null} # required. Hostname or IP of the A10 Networks device.
username: ${4:null} # required. An account with administrator privileges.
url_password: ${5:undefined} # not required. The password for use in HTTP basic authentication.,If the I(url_username) parameter is not specified, the I(url_password) parameter will not be used.

validate_certs: ${6|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled devices using self-signed certificates.

virtual_server_ports: ${10:undefined} # not required. A list of ports to create for the virtual server. Each list item should be a dictionary which specifies the C(port:) and C(type:), but can also optionally specify the C(service_group:) as well as the C(status:). See the examples below for details. This parameter is required when C(state) is C(present).

client_key: ${11:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for SSL client authentication. If C(client_cert) contains both the certificate and key, this option is not required.

force_basic_auth: ${15:false} # not required. Credentials specified with I(url_username) and I(url_password) should be passed in HTTP Header.

virtual_server_status: ${17|enabled,disabled|} # not required. choices: enabled;disabled. The SLB virtual server status, such as enabled or disabled.

write_config: ${18|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(yes), any changes will cause a write of the running configuration to non-volatile memory. This will save I(all) configuration changes, including those that may have been made manually or through other modules, so care should be taken when specifying C(yes).
use_proxy: ${19:true} # not required. If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
virtual_server_ip: ${20:null} # not required. The SLB virtual server IPv4 address.

accelerate.description: Enable accelerated mode on remote node
body: accelerate:

multi_key: ${1:false} # not required. When enabled, the daemon will open a local socket file which can be used by future daemon executions to upload a new key to the already running daemon, so that multiple users can connect using different keys. This access still requires an ssh connection as the uid for which the daemon is currently running.
ipv6: ${2:false} # not required. The listener daemon on the remote host will bind to the ipv6 localhost socket if this parameter is set to true.
port: ${3:5099} # not required. TCP port for the socket connection
timeout: ${4:300} # not required. The number of seconds the socket will wait for data. If none is received when the timeout value is reached, the connection will be closed.
minutes: ${5:30} # not required. The I(accelerate) listener daemon is started on nodes and will stay around for this number of minutes before turning itself off.
aci_aaa_user:
host: ${1:undefined} # required. IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password to use for authentication.
username: ${3:admin} # required. The username to use for authentication.
validate_certs: ${4:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

certificate_name: ${5:C(private_key) basename} # not required. The X.509 certificate name attached to the APIC AAA user used for signature-based authentication.,It defaults to the C(private_key) basename, without extension.
use_ssl: ${6:yes} # not required. If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.

private_key: ${7:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for signature-based authentication.,The name of the key (without extension) is used as the certificate name in ACI, unless C(certificate_name) is specified.

output_level: ${8|debug,info,normal|} # not required. choices: debug;info;normal. Influence the output of this ACI module.,C(normal) means the standard output, incl. C(current) dict,C(info) means informational output, incl. C(previous), C(proposed) and C(sent) dicts,C(debug) means debugging output, incl. C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information
port: ${9:443 (for https) and 80 (for http)} # not required. Port number to be used for REST connection.
aaa_password: ${10:undefined} # not required. The password of the locally-authenticated user.
enabled: ${11:undefined} # not required. The status of the locally-authenticated user account.
phone: ${12:undefined} # not required. The phone number of the locally-authenticated user.
clear_password_history: ${13:undefined} # not required. Whether to clear the password history of a locally-authenticated user.
expires: ${14:undefined} # not required. Whether to enable an expiration date for the locally-authenticated user account.
use_proxy: ${15:yes} # not required. If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
email: ${16:undefined} # not required. The email address of the locally-authenticated user.
description: ${17:undefined} # not required. Description for the AAA user.
aaa_password_update_required: ${18:undefined} # not required. Whether this account needs password update.
aaa_password_lifetime: ${19:undefined} # not required. The lifetime of the locally-authenticated user password.
aaa_user: ${20:undefined} # not required. The name of the locally-authenticated user user to add.
first_name: ${21:undefined} # not required. The first name of the locally-authenticated user.
last_name: ${22:undefined} # not required. The last name of the locally-authenticated user.
timeout: ${23:30} # not required. The socket level timeout in seconds.
state: ${24|absent,present,query|} # not required. choices: absent;present;query. Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
expiration: ${25:undefined} # not required. The expiration date of the locally-authenticated user account.
aci_aaa_user_certificate:
host: ${1:undefined} # required. IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password to use for authentication.
username: ${3:admin} # required. The username to use for authentication.
validate_certs: ${4:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
certificate_name: ${5:C(private_key) basename} # not required. The name of the user certificate entry in ACI.

private_key: ${6:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for signature-based authentication.,The name of the key (without extension) is used as the certificate name in ACI, unless C(certificate_name) is specified.
aaa_user_type: ${7|user,appuser|} # not required. choices: user;appuser. Whether this is a normal user or an appuser.
port: ${8:443 (for https) and 80 (for http)} # not required. Port number to be used for REST connection.

output_level: ${9|debug,info,normal|} # not required. choices: debug;info;normal. Influence the output of this ACI module.,C(normal) means the standard output, incl. C(current) dict,C(info) means informational output, incl. C(previous), C(proposed) and C(sent) dicts,C(debug) means debugging output, incl. C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information
aaa_user: ${10:undefined} # not required. The name of the user to add a certificate to.
certificate: ${11:undefined} # not required. The PEM format public key extracted from the X.509 certificate.
timeout: ${12:30} # not required. The socket level timeout in seconds.
state: ${13|absent,present,query|} # not required. choices: absent;present;query. Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
use_proxy: ${14:yes} # not required. If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.

aci_bd.description: Manage Bridge Domains (BD) on Cisco ACI Fabrics (fv:BD)
body: aci_bd:
host: ${1:undefined} # required. IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
username: ${2:admin} # required. The username to use for authentication.
password: ${3:undefined} # required. The password to use for authentication.
validate_certs: ${4:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
endpoint_retention_policy: ${5:undefined} # not required. The name of the End Point Retention Policy the Bridge Domain should use when overriding the default End Point Retention Policy.
ipv6_nd_policy: ${6:undefined} # not required. The name of the IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Policy the Bridge Domain should use when overridding the default IPV6 ND Policy.

private_key: ${7:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for signature-based authentication.,The name of the key (without extension) is used as the certificate name in ACI, unless C(certificate_name) is specified.

endpoint_clear: ${8:no} # not required. Clears all End Points in all Leaves when C(yes).,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(no).,The value is not reset to disabled once End Points have been cleared; that requires a second task.
mac_address: ${9:00:22:BD:F8:19:FF} # not required. The MAC Address to assign to the C(bd) instead of using the default.

endpoint_retention_action: ${10|inherit,resolve|} # not required. choices: inherit;resolve. Determines if the Bridge Domain should inherit or resolve the End Point Retention Policy.,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domain to End Point Retention Policies to C(resolve).
port: ${11:443 (for https) and 80 (for http)} # not required. Port number to be used for REST connection.

certificate_name: ${12:C(private_key) basename} # not required. The X.509 certificate name attached to the APIC AAA user used for signature-based authentication.,It defaults to the C(private_key) basename, without extension.

output_level: ${13|debug,info,normal|} # not required. choices: debug;info;normal. Influence the output of this ACI module.,C(normal) means the standard output, incl. C(current) dict,C(info) means informational output, incl. C(previous), C(proposed) and C(sent) dicts,C(debug) means debugging output, incl. C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information
l2_unknown_unicast: ${14|proxy,flood|} # not required. choices: proxy;flood. Determines what forwarding method to use for unknown l2 destinations.,The APIC defaults new Bridge domains to C(proxy).
use_proxy: ${15:yes} # not required. If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
bd_type: ${16|ethernet,fc|} # not required. choices: ethernet;fc. The type of traffic on the Bridge Domain.,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(ethernet).
timeout: ${17:30} # not required. The socket level timeout in seconds.
arp_flooding: ${18:no} # not required. Determines if the Bridge Domain should flood ARP traffic.,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(no).
bd: ${19:undefined} # not required. The name of the Bridge Domain.

l3_unknown_multicast: ${20|flood,opt-flood|} # not required. choices: flood;opt-flood. Determines the forwarding method to use for unknown multicast destinations.,The APCI defaults new Bridge Domains to C(flood).
description: ${21:undefined} # not required. Description for the Bridge Domain.
vrf: ${22:undefined} # not required. The name of the VRF.
ip_learning: ${23:undefined} # not required. Determines if the Bridge Domain should learn End Point IPs.,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(yes).
enable_multicast: ${24:no} # not required. Determines if PIM is enabled,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(no).
tenant: ${25:undefined} # not required. The name of the Tenant.
enable_routing: ${26:yes} # not required. Determines if IP forwarding should be allowed.,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(yes).
endpoint_move_detect: ${27|default,garp|} # not required. choices: default;garp. Determines if GARP should be enabled to detect when End Points move.,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(garp).
igmp_snoop_policy: ${28:undefined} # not required. The name of the IGMP Snooping Policy the Bridge Domain should use when overriding the default IGMP Snooping Policy.
state: ${29|absent,present,query|} # not required. choices: absent;present;query. Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
limit_ip_learn: ${30:yes} # not required. Determines if the BD should limit IP learning to only subnets owned by the Bridge Domain.,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(yes).

multi_dest: ${31|bd-flood,drop,encap-flood|} # not required. choices: bd-flood;drop;encap-flood. Determines the forwarding method for L2 multicast, broadcast, and link layer traffic.,The APIC defaults new Bridge Domains to C(bd-flood).
use_ssl: ${32:yes} # not required. If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.

aci_bd_subnet.description: Manage Subnets on Cisco ACI fabrics (fv:Subnet)
body: aci_bd_subnet:
host: ${1:undefined} # required. IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password to use for authentication.
username: ${3:admin} # required. The username to use for authentication.

scope: ${4|private,public,shared,private,shared,public,shared|} # not required. choices: private;public;shared;private,shared;public,shared. Determines the scope of the Subnet.,The C(private) option only allows communication with hosts in the same VRF.,The C(public) option allows the Subnet to be advertised outside of the ACI Fabric, and allows communication with hosts in other VRFs.,The shared option limits communication to hosts in either the same VRF or the shared VRF.,The value is a list of options, C(private) and C(public) are mutually exclusive, but both can be used with C(shared).,The APIC defaults new Subnets to C(private).

certificate_name: ${5:C(private_key) basename} # not required. The X.509 certificate name attached to the APIC AAA user used for signature-based authentication.,It defaults to the C(private_key) basename, without extension.
gateway: ${6:undefined} # not required. The IPv4 or IPv6 gateway address for the Subnet.

private_key: ${7:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for signature-based authentication.,The name of the key (without extension) is used as the certificate name in ACI, unless C(certificate_name) is specified.

output_level: ${8|debug,info,normal|} # not required. choices: debug;info;normal. Influence the output of this ACI module.,C(normal) means the standard output, incl. C(current) dict,C(info) means informational output, incl. C(previous), C(proposed) and C(sent) dicts,C(debug) means debugging output, incl. C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information
port: ${9:443 (for https) and 80 (for http)} # not required. Port number to be used for REST connection.

preferred: ${10:no} # not required. Determines if the Subnet is preferred over all available Subnets. Only one Subnet per Address Family (IPv4/IPv6). can be preferred in the Bridge Domain.,The APIC defaults new Subnets to C(no).

mask: ${11|Any 0 to 32 for IPv4 Addresses,0-128 for IPv6 Addresses|} # not required. choices: Any 0 to 32 for IPv4 Addresses;0-128 for IPv6 Addresses. The subnet mask for the Subnet.,This is the number assocated with CIDR notation.

subnet_control: ${12|nd_ra,no_gw,querier_ip,unspecified|} # not required. choices: nd_ra;no_gw;querier_ip;unspecified. Determines the Subnet's Control State.,The C(querier_ip) option is used to treat the gateway_ip as an IGMP querier source IP.,The C(nd_ra) option is used to treate the gateway_ip address as a Neighbor Discovery Router Advertisement Prefix.,The C(no_gw) option is used to remove default gateway functionality from the gateway address.,The APIC defaults new Subnets to C(nd_ra).
use_proxy: ${13:yes} # not required. If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
enable_vip: ${14:no} # not required. Determines if the Subnet should be treated as a VIP; used when the BD is extended to multiple sites.,The APIC defaults new Subnets to C(no).
timeout: ${15:30} # not required. The socket level timeout in seconds.
tenant: ${16:undefined} # not required. The name of the Tenant.
subnet_name: ${17:undefined} # not required. The name of the Subnet.
description: ${18:undefined} # not required. The description for the Subnet.
nd_prefix_policy: ${19:undefined} # not required. The IPv6 Neighbor Discovery Prefix Policy to associate with the Subnet.
bd: ${20:undefined} # not required. The name of the Bridge Domain.
route_profile: ${21:undefined} # not required. The Route Profile to the associate with the Subnet.
validate_certs: ${22:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
route_profile_l3_out: ${23:undefined} # not required. The L3 Out that contains the assocated Route Profile.
state: ${24|absent,present,query|} # not required. choices: absent;present;query. Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
use_ssl: ${25:yes} # not required. If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.

output_level: ${9|debug,info,normal|} # not required. choices: debug;info;normal. Influence the output of this ACI module.,C(normal) means the standard output, incl. C(current) dict,C(info) means informational output, incl. C(previous), C(proposed) and C(sent) dicts,C(debug) means debugging output, incl. C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information
bd: ${10:undefined} # not required. The name of the Bridge Domain.
l3out: ${11:undefined} # not required. The name of the l3out to associate with th Bridge Domain.
timeout: ${12:30} # not required. The socket level timeout in seconds.
state: ${13|absent,present,query|} # not required. choices: absent;present;query. Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
use_proxy: ${14:yes} # not required. If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
use_ssl: ${15:yes} # not required. If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.

aci_config_rollback.description: Provides rollback and rollback preview functionality for Cisco ACI fabrics (config:ImportP)
body: aci_config_rollback:
host: ${1:undefined} # required. IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password to use for authentication.

snapshot: ${3:undefined} # required. The name of the snapshot to rollback to, or the base snapshot to use for comparison.,The C(aci_snapshot) module can be used to query the list of available snapshots.
export_policy: ${4:undefined} # required. The export policy that the C(snapshot) is associated to.
username: ${5:admin} # required. The username to use for authentication.
fail_on_decrypt: ${6:yes} # not required. Determines if the APIC should fail the rollback if unable to decrypt secured data.,The APIC defaults new Import Policies to C(yes).
validate_certs: ${7:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

certificate_name: ${8:C(private_key) basename} # not required. The X.509 certificate name attached to the APIC AAA user used for signature-based authentication.,It defaults to the C(private_key) basename, without extension.
description: ${9:undefined} # not required. The description for the Import Policy.

private_key: ${10:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for signature-based authentication.,The name of the key (without extension) is used as the certificate name in ACI, unless C(certificate_name) is specified.
port: ${11:443 (for https) and 80 (for http)} # not required. Port number to be used for REST connection.

output_level: ${12|debug,info,normal|} # not required. choices: debug;info;normal. Influence the output of this ACI module.,C(normal) means the standard output, incl. C(current) dict,C(info) means informational output, incl. C(previous), C(proposed) and C(sent) dicts,C(debug) means debugging output, incl. C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information
compare_snapshot: ${13:undefined} # not required. The name of the snapshot to compare with C(snapshot).
use_ssl: ${14:yes} # not required. If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.
use_proxy: ${15:yes} # not required. If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
timeout: ${16:30} # not required. The socket level timeout in seconds.
compare_export_policy: ${17:undefined} # not required. The export policy that the C(compare_snapshot) is associated to.

import_type: ${18|merge,replace|} # not required. choices: merge;replace. Determines how the current and snapshot configuration should be compared for replacement.,The APIC defaults new Import Policies to C(replace).

state: ${19|preview,rollback|} # not required. choices: preview;rollback. Use C(preview) for previewing the diff between two snapshots.,Use C(rollback) for reverting the configuration to a previous snapshot.
import_policy: ${20:undefined} # not required. The name of the Import Policy to use for config rollback.
import_mode: ${21|atomic,best-effort|} # not required. choices: atomic;best-effort. Determines how the import should be handled by the APIC.,The APIC defaults new Import Policies to C(atomic).

aci_config_snapshot.description: Manage Config Snapshots on Cisco ACI fabrics (config:Snapshot, config:ExportP)
body: aci_config_snapshot:
host: ${1:undefined} # required. IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password to use for authentication.
username: ${3:admin} # required. The username to use for authentication.
use_ssl: ${4:yes} # not required. If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.
validate_certs: ${5:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

max_count: ${6|range between 1 and 10|} # not required. choices: range between 1 and 10. Determines how many snapshots can exist for the Export Policy before the APIC starts to rollover.,The APIC defaults new Export Policies to C(3).
description: ${7:undefined} # not required. The description for the Config Export Policy.

private_key: ${8:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for signature-based authentication.,The name of the key (without extension) is used as the certificate name in ACI, unless C(certificate_name) is specified.
format: ${9|json,xml|} # not required. choices: json;xml. Sets the config backup to be formatted in JSON or XML.,The APIC defaults new Export Policies to C(json)

output_level: ${10|debug,info,normal|} # not required. choices: debug;info;normal. Influence the output of this ACI module.,C(normal) means the standard output, incl. C(current) dict,C(info) means informational output, incl. C(previous), C(proposed) and C(sent) dicts,C(debug) means debugging output, incl. C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information
port: ${11:443 (for https) and 80 (for http)} # not required. Port number to be used for REST connection.

certificate_name: ${12:C(private_key) basename} # not required. The X.509 certificate name attached to the APIC AAA user used for signature-based authentication.,It defaults to the C(private_key) basename, without extension.
snapshot: ${13:undefined} # not required. The name of the snapshot to delete.
export_policy: ${14:undefined} # not required. The name of the Export Policy to use for Config Snapshots.
timeout: ${15:30} # not required. The socket level timeout in seconds.
state: ${16|absent,present,query|} # not required. choices: absent;present;query. Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
use_proxy: ${17:yes} # not required. If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
include_secure: ${18:yes} # not required. Determines if secure information should be included in the backup.,The APIC defaults new Export Policies to C(yes).

certificate_name: ${7:C(private_key) basename} # not required. The X.509 certificate name attached to the APIC AAA user used for signature-based authentication.,It defaults to the C(private_key) basename, without extension.
description: ${8:undefined} # not required. Description for the contract.

private_key: ${9:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for signature-based authentication.,The name of the key (without extension) is used as the certificate name in ACI, unless C(certificate_name) is specified.
validate_certs: ${10:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
port: ${11:443 (for https) and 80 (for http)} # not required. Port number to be used for REST connection.

output_level: ${12|debug,info,normal|} # not required. choices: debug;info;normal. Influence the output of this ACI module.,C(normal) means the standard output, incl. C(current) dict,C(info) means informational output, incl. C(previous), C(proposed) and C(sent) dicts,C(debug) means debugging output, incl. C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information
priority: ${13|level1,level2,level3,unspecified|} # not required. choices: level1;level2;level3;unspecified. The desired QoS class to be used.

dscp: ${14|AF11,AF12,AF13,AF21,AF22,AF23,AF31,AF32,AF33,AF41,AF42,AF43,CS0,CS1,CS2,CS3,CS4,CS5,CS6,CS7,EF,VA,unspecified|} # not required. choices: AF11;AF12;AF13;AF21;AF22;AF23;AF31;AF32;AF33;AF41;AF42;AF43;CS0;CS1;CS2;CS3;CS4;CS5;CS6;CS7;EF;VA;unspecified. aci_domain.description: Manage physical, virtual, bridged, routed or FC domain profiles (*:DomP)
body: aci_domain:
host: ${1:undefined} # required. IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password to use for authentication.
username: ${3:admin} # required. The username to use for authentication.
validate_certs: ${4:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

certificate_name: ${5:C(private_key) basename} # not required. The X.509 certificate name attached to the APIC AAA user used for signature-based authentication.,It defaults to the C(private_key) basename, without extension.
encap_mode: ${6|unknown,vlan,vxlan|} # not required. choices: unknown;vlan;vxlan. The layer 2 encapsulation protocol to use with the virtual switch.

private_key: ${7:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for signature-based authentication.,The name of the key (without extension) is used as the certificate name in ACI, unless C(certificate_name) is specified.

body: aci_filter_entry:
host: ${1:undefined} # required. IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.

icmp6_msg_type: ${7|dst_unreachable,echo_request,echo_reply,neighbor_advertisement,neighbor_solicitation,redirect,time_exceeded,unspecified|} # not required. choices: dst_unreachable;echo_request;echo_reply;neighbor_advertisement;neighbor_solicitation;redirect;time_exceeded;unspecified. ICMPv6 message type; used when ip_protocol is icmpv6.,The APIC defaults new Filter Entries to C(unspecified).

private_key: ${8:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for signature-based authentication.,The name of the key (without extension) is used as the certificate name in ACI, unless C(certificate_name) is specified.

C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information

arp_flag: ${10|arp_reply,arp_request,unspecified|} # not required. choices: arp_reply;arp_request;unspecified. The arp flag to use when the ether_type is arp.,The APIC defaults new Filter Entries to C(unspecified).

dst_port: ${12|Valid TCP/UDP Port Ranges|} # not required. choices: Valid TCP/UDP Port Ranges. Used to set both destination start and end ports to the same value when ip_protocol is tcp or udp.,The APIC defaults new Filter Entries to C(unspecified).

tenant: ${19:undefined} # not required. The name of the tenant.

icmp_msg_type: ${20|dst_unreachable,echo,echo_reply,src_quench,time_exceeded,unspecified|} # not required. choices: dst_unreachable;echo;echo_reply;src_quench;time_exceeded;unspecified. ICMPv4 message type; used when ip_protocol is icmp.,The APIC defaults new Filter Entries to C(unspecified).
timeout: ${21:30} # not required. The socket level timeout in seconds.

ip_protocol: ${24|eigrp,egp,icmp,icmpv6,igmp,igp,l2tp,ospfigp,pim,tcp,udp,unspecified|} # not required. choices: eigrp;egp;icmp;icmpv6;igmp;igp;l2tp;ospfigp;pim;tcp;udp;unspecified. The IP Protocol type when ether_type is ip.,The APIC defaults new Filter Entries to C(unspecified).

aci_rest.description: Direct access to the Cisco APIC REST API
body: aci_rest:

method: ${1|delete,get,post|} # required. choices: delete;get;post. The HTTP method of the request.,Using C(delete) is typically used for deleting objects.,Using C(get) is typically used for querying objects.,Using C(post) is typically used for modifying objects.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password to use for authentication.
path: ${3:undefined} # required. URI being used to execute API calls.,Must end in C(.xml) or C(.json).
host: ${4:undefined} # required. IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
username: ${5:admin} # required. The username to use for authentication.

content: ${6:undefined} # not required. When used instead of C(src), sets the payload of the API request directly.,This may be convenient to template simple requests, for anything complex use the M(template) module.
validate_certs: ${7:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

certificate_name: ${8:C(private_key) basename} # not required. The X.509 certificate name attached to the APIC AAA user used for signature-based authentication.,It defaults to the C(private_key) basename, without extension.

private_key: ${9:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for signature-based authentication.,The name of the key (without extension) is used as the certificate name in ACI, unless C(certificate_name) is specified.

output_level: ${10|debug,info,normal|} # not required. choices: debug;info;normal. Influence the output of this ACI module.,C(normal) means the standard output, incl. C(current) dict,C(info) means informational output, incl. C(previous), C(proposed) and C(sent) dicts,C(debug) means debugging output, incl. C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information
port: ${11:443 (for https) and 80 (for http)} # not required. Port number to be used for REST connection.
src: ${12:undefined} # not required. Name of the absolute path of the filname that includes the body of the http request being sent to the ACI fabric.
timeout: ${13:30} # not required. The socket level timeout in seconds.
use_proxy: ${14:yes} # not required. If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
use_ssl: ${15:yes} # not required. If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.

aci_static_binding_to_epg.description: Bind static paths to EPGs on Cisco ACI fabrics (fv:RsPathAtt)
body: aci_static_binding_to_epg:
host: ${1:undefined} # required. IP Address or hostname of APIC resolvable by Ansible control host.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password to use for authentication.
username: ${3:admin} # required. The username to use for authentication.
validate_certs: ${4:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

certificate_name: ${5:C(private_key) basename} # not required. The X.509 certificate name attached to the APIC AAA user used for signature-based authentication.,It defaults to the C(private_key) basename, without extension.

interface: ${6:undefined} # not required. The C(interface) string value part of the tDn.,Usually a policy group like "test-IntPolGrp" or an interface of the following format "1/7" depending on C(interface_type).

private_key: ${7:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for signature-based authentication.,The name of the key (without extension) is used as the certificate name in ACI, unless C(certificate_name) is specified.

output_level: ${8|debug,info,normal|} # not required. choices: debug;info;normal. Influence the output of this ACI module.,C(normal) means the standard output, incl. C(current) dict,C(info) means informational output, incl. C(previous), C(proposed) and C(sent) dicts,C(debug) means debugging output, incl. C(filter_string), C(method), C(response), C(status) and C(url) information
epg: ${9:undefined} # not required. The name of the end point group.

leafs: ${10:undefined} # not required. The switch ID(s) that the C(interface) belongs to.,When C(interface_type) is C(switch_port), C(port_channel), or C(fex), then C(leafs) is a string of the leaf ID.,When C(interface_type) is C(vpc), then C(leafs) is a list with both leaf IDs.,The C(leafs) value is usually something like '101' or '101-102' depending on C(connection_type).
port: ${11:443 (for https) and 80 (for http)} # not required. Port number to be used for REST connection.

deploy_immediacy: ${12|immediate,lazy|} # not required. choices: immediate;lazy. The Deployement Immediacy of Static EPG on PC, VPC or Interface.,The APIC defaults the Deployement Immediacy to C(lazy).
ap: ${13:undefined} # not required. Name of an existing application network profile, that will contain the EPGs.
use_proxy: ${14:yes} # not required. If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.

encap_id: ${15|Valid encap IDs for specified encap,currently 1 to 4096|} # not required. choices: Valid encap IDs for specified encap;currently 1 to 4096. The encapsulation ID associating the C(epg) with the interface path.,This acts as the secondary C(encap_id) when using micro-segmentation.

interface_mode: ${16|802.1p,access,native,regular,tagged,trunk,untagged|} # not required. choices: 802.1p;access;native;regular;tagged;trunk;untagged. Determines how layer 2 tags will be read from and added to frames.,Values C(802.1p) and C(native) are identical.,Values C(access) and C(untagged) are identical.,Values C(regular), C(tagged) and C(trunk) are identical.,The APIC defaults the mode to C(trunk).

primary_encap_id: ${17|Valid encap IDs for specified encap,currently 1 to 4096|} # not required. choices: Valid encap IDs for specified encap;currently 1 to 4096. Determines the primary encapsulation ID associating the C(epg) with the interface path when using micro-segmentation.

interface_type: ${18|fex,port_channel,switch_port,vpc|} # not required. choices: fex;port_channel;switch_port;vpc. The type of interface for the static EPG deployement.,The APIC defaults the C(interface_type) to C(switch_port).
pod_id: ${19:undefined} # not required. The pod number part of the tDn.,C(pod_id) is usually an integer below 10.
tenant: ${20:undefined} # not required. Name of an existing tenant.
extpaths: ${21:undefined} # not required. The C(extpaths) integer value part of the tDn.,C(extpaths) is only used if C(interface_type) is C(fex).,Usually something like '1011'.
timeout: ${22:30} # not required. The socket level timeout in seconds.
state: ${23|absent,present,query|} # not required. choices: absent;present;query. Use C(present) or C(absent) for adding or removing.,Use C(query) for listing an object or multiple objects.
use_ssl: ${24:yes} # not required. If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection.

bounce_age: ${10:630} # not required. Bounce Entry Aging Interval (range 150secs - 65535secs),0 is used for infinite.
