aws_acm_facts.description: Retrieve certificate facts from AWS Certificate Manager service
body: aws_acm_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

region: ${2:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

status: ${4|PENDING_VALIDATION,ISSUED,INACTIVE,EXPIRED,VALIDATION_TIMED_OUT|} # not required. choices: PENDING_VALIDATION;ISSUED;INACTIVE;EXPIRED;VALIDATION_TIMED_OUT. Status to filter the certificate results
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${6:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
name: ${8:undefined} # not required. The name of an ACM certificate
profile: ${9:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

api_id: ${4:undefined} # not required. The ID of the API you want to manage.
swagger_dict: ${5:undefined} # not required. Swagger definitions API ansible dictionary which will be converted to JSON and uploaded.
deploy_desc: ${6:Automatic deployment by Ansible.} # not required. Description of the deployment - recorded and visible in the AWS console.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
swagger_file: ${9:undefined} # not required. JSON or YAML file containing swagger definitions for API. Exactly one of swagger_file, swagger_text or swagger_dict must be present.
aws_access_key: ${10:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${11:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${12|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. NOT IMPLEMENTED Create or delete API - currently we always create.
stage: ${13:undefined} # not required. The name of the stage the API should be deployed to.
swagger_text: ${14:undefined} # not required. Swagger definitions for API in JSON or YAML as a string direct from playbook.

aws_application_scaling_policy.description: Manage Application Auto Scaling Scaling Policies
body: aws_application_scaling_policy:

scalable_dimension: ${1|ecs:service:DesiredCount,ec2:spot-fleet-request:TargetCapacity,elasticmapreduce:instancegroup:InstanceCount,appstream:fleet:DesiredCapacity,dynamodb:table:ReadCapacityUnits,dynamodb:table:WriteCapacityUnits,dynamodb:index:ReadCapacityUnits,dynamodb:index:WriteCapacityUnits|} # required. choices: ecs:service:DesiredCount;ec2:spot-fleet-request:TargetCapacity;elasticmapreduce:instancegroup:InstanceCount;appstream:fleet:DesiredCapacity;dynamodb:table:ReadCapacityUnits;dynamodb:table:WriteCapacityUnits;dynamodb:index:ReadCapacityUnits;dynamodb:index:WriteCapacityUnits. The scalable dimension associated with the scalable target.
resource_id: ${2:undefined} # required. The identifier of the resource associated with the scalable target.
policy_name: ${3:undefined} # required. The name of the scaling policy.
service_namespace: ${4|ecs,elasticmapreduce,ec2,appstream,dynamodb|} # required. choices: ecs;elasticmapreduce;ec2;appstream;dynamodb. The namespace of the AWS service.
policy_type: ${5|StepScaling,TargetTrackingScaling|} # required. choices: StepScaling;TargetTrackingScaling. The policy type.

target_tracking_scaling_policy_configuration: ${6:undefined} # not required. A target tracking policy. This parameter is required if you are creating a new policy and the policy type is TargetTrackingScaling.
aws_secret_key: ${7:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
step_scaling_policy_configuration: ${8:undefined} # not required. A step scaling policy. This parameter is required if you are creating a policy and the policy type is StepScaling.
validate_certs: ${9:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_access_key: ${10:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

region: ${11:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_url: ${12:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
security_token: ${13:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
profile: ${14:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

aws_az_facts.description: Gather facts about availability zones in AWS.
body: aws_az_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

filters: ${2:[object Object]} # not required. A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See U(https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeAvailabilityZones.html) for possible filters. Filter names and values are case sensitive. You can also use underscores instead of dashes (-) in the filter keys, which will take precedence in case of conflict.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

security_token: ${6:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_batch_compute_environment:
type: ${1|MANAGED,UNMANAGED|} # required. choices: MANAGED;UNMANAGED. The type of the compute environment.
instance_role: ${2:undefined} # required. The Amazon ECS instance role applied to Amazon EC2 instances in a compute environment.
compute_environment_name: ${3:undefined} # required. The name for your compute environment. Up to 128 letters (uppercase and lowercase), numbers, and underscores are allowed.
maxv_cpus: ${4:undefined} # required. The maximum number of EC2 vCPUs that an environment can reach.
security_group_ids: ${5:undefined} # required. The EC2 security groups that are associated with instances launched in the compute environment.
compute_resource_type: ${6|EC2,SPOT|} # required. choices: EC2;SPOT. The type of compute resource.
minv_cpus: ${7:undefined} # required. The minimum number of EC2 vCPUs that an environment should maintain.
service_role: ${8:undefined} # required. The full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that allows AWS Batch to make calls to other AWS services on your behalf.
instance_types: ${9:undefined} # required. The instance types that may be launched.
subnets: ${10:undefined} # required. The VPC subnets into which the compute resources are launched.
state: ${11|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Describes the desired state.
validate_certs: ${12:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
tags: ${13:undefined} # not required. Key-value pair tags to be applied to resources that are launched in the compute environment.

compute_environment_state: ${14|ENABLED,DISABLED|} # not required. choices: ENABLED;DISABLED. The state of the compute environment. If the state is ENABLED, then the compute environment accepts jobs from a queue and can scale out automatically based on queues.

ec2_url: ${15:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
aws_secret_key: ${16:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

bid_percentage: ${17:undefined} # not required. The minimum percentage that a Spot Instance price must be when compared with the On-Demand price for that instance type before instances are launched. For example, if your bid percentage is 20%, then the Spot price must be below 20% of the current On-Demand price for that EC2 instance.

region: ${18:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
spot_iam_fleet_role: ${19:undefined} # not required. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EC2 Spot Fleet IAM role applied to a SPOT compute environment.
security_token: ${20:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
ec2_key_pair: ${21:undefined} # not required. The EC2 key pair that is used for instances launched in the compute environment.
profile: ${22:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${23:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
image_id: ${24:undefined} # not required. The Amazon Machine Image (AMI) ID used for instances launched in the compute environment.
desiredv_cpus: ${25:undefined} # not required. The desired number of EC2 vCPUS in the compute environment.
aws_batch_job_definition:
type: ${1:undefined} # required. The type of job definition
job_definition_name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name for the job definition
state: ${3|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Describes the desired state.

memory: ${4:undefined} # not required. The hard limit (in MiB) of memory to present to the container. If your container attempts to exceed the memory specified here, the container is killed. This parameter maps to Memory in the Create a container section of the Docker Remote API and the --memory option to docker run.
validate_certs: ${5:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

attempts: ${6:undefined} # not required. Retry strategy - The number of times to move a job to the RUNNABLE status. You may specify between 1 and 10 attempts. If attempts is greater than one, the job is retried if it fails until it has moved to RUNNABLE that many times.

command: ${7:undefined} # not required. The command that is passed to the container. This parameter maps to Cmd in the Create a container section of the Docker Remote API and the COMMAND parameter to docker run. For more information, see https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/builder/#cmd.

parameters: ${8:undefined} # not required. Default parameter substitution placeholders to set in the job definition. Parameters are specified as a key-value pair mapping. Parameters in a SubmitJob request override any corresponding parameter defaults from the job definition.

ec2_url: ${9:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
volumes: ${10:undefined} # not required. A list of data volumes used in a job. List of dictionaries.
aws_secret_key: ${11:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

region: ${12:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
security_token: ${13:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
job_definition_arn: ${14:undefined} # not required. The arn for the job definition

privileged: ${15:undefined} # not required. When this parameter is true, the container is given elevated privileges on the host container instance (similar to the root user). This parameter maps to Privileged in the Create a container section of the Docker Remote API and the --privileged option to docker run.
job_role_arn: ${16:undefined} # not required. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that the container can assume for AWS permissions.
profile: ${17:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

ulimits: ${18:undefined} # not required. A list of ulimits to set in the container. This parameter maps to Ulimits in the Create a container section of the Docker Remote API and the --ulimit option to docker run. List of dictionaries.

mount_points: ${19:undefined} # not required. The mount points for data volumes in your container. This parameter maps to Volumes in the Create a container section of the Docker Remote API and the --volume option to docker run. List of dictionaries.

image: ${20:undefined} # not required. The image used to start a container. This string is passed directly to the Docker daemon. Images in the Docker Hub registry are available by default. Other repositories are specified with `` repository-url /image <colon>tag ``. Up to 255 letters (uppercase and lowercase), numbers, hyphens, underscores, colons, periods, forward slashes, and number signs are allowed. This parameter maps to Image in the Create a container section of the Docker Remote API and the IMAGE parameter of docker run.

environment: ${21:undefined} # not required. The environment variables to pass to a container. This parameter maps to Env in the Create a container section of the Docker Remote API and the --env option to docker run. List of dictionaries.

readonly_root_filesystem: ${22:undefined} # not required. When this parameter is true, the container is given read-only access to its root file system. This parameter maps to ReadonlyRootfs in the Create a container section of the Docker Remote API and the --read-only option to docker run.

vcpus: ${23:undefined} # not required. The number of vCPUs reserved for the container. This parameter maps to CpuShares in the Create a container section of the Docker Remote API and the --cpu-shares option to docker run. Each vCPU is equivalent to 1,024 CPU shares.
aws_access_key: ${24:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

user: ${25:undefined} # not required. The user name to use inside the container. This parameter maps to User in the Create a container section of the Docker Remote API and the --user option to docker run.
aws_batch_job_queue:

compute_environment_order: ${1:undefined} # required. The set of compute environments mapped to a job queue and their order relative to each other. The job scheduler uses this parameter to determine which compute environment should execute a given job. Compute environments must be in the VALID state before you can associate them with a job queue. You can associate up to 3 compute environments with a job queue.
job_queue_name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name for the job queue

priority: ${3:undefined} # required. The priority of the job queue. Job queues with a higher priority (or a lower integer value for the priority parameter) are evaluated first when associated with same compute environment. Priority is determined in ascending order, for example, a job queue with a priority value of 1 is given scheduling preference over a job queue with a priority value of 10.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Describes the desired state.
validate_certs: ${5:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${6:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${7:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${8:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

region: ${9:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_url: ${10:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
security_token: ${11:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
job_queue_state: ${12|ENABLED,DISABLED|} # not required. choices: ENABLED;DISABLED. The state of the job queue. If the job queue state is ENABLED , it is able to accept jobs.

aws_direct_connect_connection.description: Creates, deletes, modifies a DirectConnect connection
body: aws_direct_connect_connection:
location: ${1:undefined} # not required. Where the Direct Connect connection is located. Required when I(state=present).
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
bandwidth: ${3|1Gbps,10Gbps|} # not required. choices: 1Gbps;10Gbps. The bandwidth of the Direct Connect connection. Required when I(state=present).
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

connection_id: ${5:undefined} # not required. The ID of the Direct Connect connection. I(name) or I(connection_id) is required to recreate or delete a connection. Modifying attributes of a connection with I(forced_update) will result in a new Direct Connect connection ID.

ec2_url: ${6:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: ${7:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
forced_update: ${8:undefined} # not required. To modify bandwidth or location the connection will need to be deleted and recreated. By default this will not happen - this option must be set to True.
link_aggregation_group: ${9:undefined} # not required. The ID of the link aggregation group you want to associate with the connection. This is optional in case a stand-alone connection is desired.
aws_access_key: ${10:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${11:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${12|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The state of the Direct Connect connection.

name: ${13:undefined} # not required. The name of the Direct Connect connection. This is required to create a new connection. To recreate or delete a connection I(name) or I(connection_id) is required.
profile: ${14:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_direct_connect_gateway:
amazon_asn: ${1:undefined} # required. amazon side asn
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

region: ${6:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
virtual_gateway_id: ${7:undefined} # not required. vpn gateway id of an existing virtual gateway
direct_connect_gateway_id: ${8:undefined} # not required. id of an existing direct connect gateway

ec2_url: ${9:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
security_token: ${10:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${11|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. present to ensure resource is created.,absent to remove resource
name: ${12:undefined} # not required. name of the dxgw to be created or deleted
aws_direct_connect_link_aggregation_group:
location: ${1:undefined} # not required. The location of the link aggregation group.
min_links: ${2:undefined} # not required. The minimum number of physical connections that must be operational for the LAG itself to be operational.
bandwidth: ${3:undefined} # not required. The bandwidth of the link aggregation group.
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
connection_id: ${6:undefined} # not required. A connection ID to link with the link aggregation group upon creation.
num_connections: ${7:undefined} # not required. The number of connections with which to intialize the link aggregation group.
validate_certs: ${8:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
link_aggregation_group_id: ${9:undefined} # not required. The ID of the Direct Connect link aggregation group.
profile: ${10:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

region: ${11:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
wait_timeout: ${12:120} # not required. The duration in seconds to wait if I(wait) is True.

ec2_url: ${13:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
force_delete: ${14:undefined} # not required. This allows the minimum number of links to be set to 0, any hosted connections disassociated, and any virtual interfaces associated to the LAG deleted.

wait: ${15:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to wait for the operation to complete. May be useful when waiting for virtual interfaces to be deleted. May modify the time of waiting with C(wait_timeout).
security_token: ${16:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${17|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The state of the Direct Connect link aggregation group.
name: ${18:undefined} # not required. The name of the Direct Connect link aggregation group.
delete_with_disassociation: ${19:undefined} # not required. To be used with I(state=absent) to delete connections after disassociating them with the LAG.
aws_direct_connect_virtual_interface:
security_token: ${1:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
virtual_gateway_id: ${2:undefined} # not required. The virtual gateway ID required for creating a private virtual interface.
customer_address: ${3:undefined} # not required. The customer address CIDR with which to create the virtual interface.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
authentication_key: ${5:undefined} # not required. The authentication key for BGP configuration.
vlan: ${6:100} # not required. The VLAN ID.
aws_access_key: ${7:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
id_to_associate: ${9:undefined} # not required. The ID of the link aggrecation group or connection to associate with the virtual interface.
virtual_interface_id: ${10:undefined} # not required. The virtual interface ID.

ec2_url: ${11:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
validate_certs: ${12:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${13:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
amazon_address: ${14:undefined} # not required. The amazon address CIDR with which to create the virtual interface.
address_type: ${15:undefined} # not required. The type of IP address for the BGP peer.
public: ${16:undefined} # not required. The type of virtual interface.
state: ${17|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The desired state of the Direct Connect virtual interface.
cidr: ${18:undefined} # not required. A list of route filter prefix CIDRs with which to create the public virtual interface.
bgp_asn: ${19:65000} # not required. The autonomous system (AS) number for Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) configuration.
name: ${20:undefined} # not required. The name of the virtual interface.

aws_elasticbeanstalk_app.description: create, update, and delete an elastic beanstalk application
body: aws_elasticbeanstalk_app:
terminate_by_force: ${1:false} # not required. when set to true, running environments will be terminated before deleting the application
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
state: ${3|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. whether to ensure the application is present or absent
description: ${4:undefined} # not required. the description of the application
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

ec2_url: ${6:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
aws_access_key: ${7:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_secret_key: ${8:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${9:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
app_name: ${10:undefined} # not required. name of the beanstalk application you wish to manage

region: ${11:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_kms:
mode: ${1|grant,deny|} # required. choices: grant;deny. Grant or deny access.
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
grant_types: ${6:undefined} # not required. List of grants to give to user/role. Likely "role,role grant" or "role,role grant,admin". Required when C(mode=grant).

region: ${7:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
key_alias: ${8:undefined} # not required. Alias label to the key. One of C(key_alias) or C(key_arn) are required.

ec2_url: ${9:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
role_name: ${10:undefined} # not required. Role to allow/deny access. One of C(role_name) or C(role_arn) are required.
role_arn: ${11:undefined} # not required. ARN of role to allow/deny access. One of C(role_name) or C(role_arn) are required.
security_token: ${12:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
key_arn: ${13:undefined} # not required. Full ARN to the key. One of C(key_alias) or C(key_arn) are required.

clean_invalid_entries: ${14:true} # not required. If adding/removing a role and invalid grantees are found, remove them. These entries will cause an update to fail in all known cases.,Only cleans if changes are being made.

aws_kms_facts.description: Gather facts about AWS KMS keys
body: aws_kms_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

filters: ${2:undefined} # not required. A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. The filters aren't natively supported by boto3, but are supported to provide similar functionality to other modules. Standard tag filters (C(tag-key), C(tag-value) and C(tag:tagName)) are available, as are C(key-id) and C(alias)
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${4:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
pending_deletion: ${6:false} # not required. Whether to get full details (tags, grants etc.) of keys pending deletion
security_token: ${7:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: ${8:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

region: ${9:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_region_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

filters: ${2:[object Object]} # not required. A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See U(https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeRegions.html) for possible filters. Filter names and values are case sensitive. You can also use underscores instead of dashes (-) in the filter keys, which will take precedence in case of conflict.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${6:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_s3:
bucket: ${1:undefined} # required. Bucket name.

mode: ${2|get,put,delete,create,geturl,getstr,delobj,list|} # required. choices: get;put;delete;create;geturl;getstr;delobj;list. Switches the module behaviour between put (upload), get (download), geturl (return download url, Ansible 1.3+), getstr (download object as string (1.3+)), list (list keys, Ansible 2.0+), create (bucket), delete (bucket), and delobj (delete object, Ansible 2.0+).
validate_certs: ${3:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
object: ${5:undefined} # not required. Keyname of the object inside the bucket. Can be used to create "virtual directories", see examples.
rgw: ${6:false} # not required. Enable Ceph RGW S3 support. This option requires an explicit url via s3_url.

permission: ${7:private} # not required. This option lets the user set the canned permissions on the object/bucket that are created. The permissions that can be set are 'private', 'public-read', 'public-read-write', 'authenticated-read' for a bucket or 'private', 'public-read', 'public-read-write', 'aws-exec-read', 'authenticated-read', 'bucket-owner-read', 'bucket-owner-full-control' for an object. Multiple permissions can be specified as a list.

ec2_url: ${8:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

overwrite: ${9:always} # not required. Force overwrite either locally on the filesystem or remotely with the object/key. Used with PUT and GET operations. Boolean or one of [always, never, different], true is equal to 'always' and false is equal to 'never', new in 2.0. When this is set to 'different', the md5 sum of the local file is compared with the 'ETag' of the object/key in S3. The ETag may or may not be an MD5 digest of the object data. See the ETag response header here U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonS3/latest/API/RESTCommonResponseHeaders.html)
marker: ${10:undefined} # not required. Specifies the key to start with when using list mode. Object keys are returned in alphabetical order, starting with key after the marker in order.
prefix: ${11:} # not required. Limits the response to keys that begin with the specified prefix for list mode
security_token: ${12:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
dest: ${13:undefined} # not required. The destination file path when downloading an object/key with a GET operation.
version: ${14:undefined} # not required. Version ID of the object inside the bucket. Can be used to get a specific version of a file if versioning is enabled in the target bucket.
metadata: ${15:undefined} # not required. Metadata for PUT operation, as a dictionary of 'key=value' and 'key=value,key=value'.
retries: ${16:0} # not required. On recoverable failure, how many times to retry before actually failing.
profile: ${17:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
s3_url: ${18:undefined} # not required. S3 URL endpoint for usage with Ceph, Eucalypus, fakes3, etc.  Otherwise assumes AWS

region: ${19:undefined} # not required. AWS region to create the bucket in. If not set then the value of the AWS_REGION and EC2_REGION environment variables are checked, followed by the aws_region and ec2_region settings in the Boto config file. If none of those are set the region defaults to the S3 Location: US Standard. Prior to ansible 1.8 this parameter could be specified but had no effect.
src: ${20:undefined} # not required. The source file path when performing a PUT operation.

ignore_nonexistent_bucket: ${21:undefined} # not required. Overrides initial bucket lookups in case bucket or iam policies are restrictive. Example: a user may have the GetObject permission but no other permissions. In this case using the option mode: get will fail without specifying ignore_nonexistent_bucket: True.
aws_access_key: ${22:null} # not required. AWS access key id. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
max_keys: ${23:1000} # not required. Max number of results to return in list mode, set this if you want to retrieve fewer than the default 1000 keys.
encrypt: ${24:true} # not required. When set for PUT mode, asks for server-side encryption.
headers: ${25:undefined} # not required. Custom headers for PUT operation, as a dictionary of 'key=value' and 'key=value,key=value'.
expiration: ${26:600} # not required. Time limit (in seconds) for the URL generated and returned by S3/Walrus when performing a mode=put or mode=geturl operation.
aws_s3_bucket_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${2:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${3:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${5:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${6:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: ${7:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

aws_s3_cors.description: Manage CORS for S3 buckets in AWS
body: aws_s3_cors:
state: ${1|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Create or remove cors on the s3 bucket
name: ${2:null} # required. Name of the s3 bucket
rules: ${3:undefined} # not required. Cors rules to put on the s3 bucket

region: ${4:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_secret_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: ${6:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${7:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

ec2_url: ${8:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
validate_certs: ${9:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
security_token: ${10:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

aws_ses_identity.description: Manages SES email and domain identity
body: aws_ses_identity:
identity: ${1:undefined} # required. This is the email address or domain to verify / delete.,If this contains an '@' then it will be considered an email. Otherwise it will be considered a domain.
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
delivery_notifications: ${3:undefined} # not required. Setup the SNS topic used to report delivery notifications.,If omitted, delivery notifications will not be delivered to a SNS topic.

bounce_notifications: ${4:undefined} # not required. Setup the SNS topic used to report bounce notifications.,If omitted, bounce notifications will not be delivered to a SNS topic.,If bounce notifications are not delivered to a SNS topic, I(feedback_forwarding) must be enabled.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

ec2_url: ${6:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
feedback_forwarding: ${7:true} # not required. Whether or not to enable feedback forwarding.,This can only be false if both I(bounce_notifications) and I(complaint_notifications) specify SNS topics.

complaint_notifications: ${8:undefined} # not required. Setup the SNS topic used to report complaint notifications.,If omitted, complaint notifications will not be delivered to a SNS topic.,If complaint notifications are not delivered to a SNS topic, I(feedback_forwarding) must be enabled.
aws_secret_key: ${9:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

region: ${10:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_access_key: ${11:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${12:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${13|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether to create(or update) or delete the identity.

aws_ssm_parameter_store.description: Manage key-value pairs in aws parameter store.
body: aws_ssm_parameter_store:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. parameter key name.
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Creates or modifies an existing parameter,Deletes a parameter
description: ${4:undefined} # not required. parameter key desciption.
key_id: ${5:aws/ssm (this key is automatically generated at the first parameter created).} # not required. aws KMS key to decrypt the secrets.
value: ${6:undefined} # not required. Parameter value.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
region: ${8:undefined} # not required. region.
overwrite: ${9:true} # not required. Overwrite the value when create or update parameter,Boolean
aws_secret_key: ${10:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: ${11:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${12:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
string_type: ${13|String,StringList,SecureString|} # not required. choices: String;StringList;SecureString. Parameter String type
decryption: ${14:true} # not required. Work with SecureString type to get plain text secrets,Boolean
profile: ${15:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_waf_condition:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the Web Application Firewall condition to manage
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
type: ${3|byte,geo,ip,regex,size,sql,xss|} # not required. choices: byte;geo;ip;regex;size;sql;xss. the type of matching to perform
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
purge_filters: ${5:undefined} # not required. Whether to remove existing filters from a condition if not passed in I(filters). Defaults to false

ec2_url: ${6:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: ${7:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

filters: ${8:undefined} # not required. A list of the filters against which to match,For I(type)=C(byte), valid keys are C(field_to_match), C(position), C(header), C(transformation),For I(type)=C(geo), the only valid key is C(country),For I(type)=C(ip), the only valid key is C(ip_address),For I(type)=C(regex), valid keys are C(field_to_match), C(transformation) and C(regex_pattern),For I(type)=C(size), valid keys are C(field_to_match), C(transformation), C(comparison) and C(size),For I(type)=C(sql), valid keys are C(field_to_match) and C(transformation),For I(type)=C(xss), valid keys are C(field_to_match) and C(transformation),I(field_to_match) can be one of C(uri), C(query_string), C(header) C(method) and C(body),If I(field_to_match) is C(header), then C(header) must also be specified,I(transformation) can be one of C(none), C(compress_white_space), C(html_entity_decode), C(lowercase), C(cmd_line), C(url_decode),I(position), can be one of C(exactly), C(starts_with), C(ends_with), C(contains), C(contains_word),,I(comparison) can be one of C(EQ), C(NE), C(LE), C(LT), C(GE), C(GT),,I(target_string) is a maximum of 50 bytes,I(regex_pattern) is a dict with a C(name) key and C(regex_strings) list of strings to match
aws_secret_key: ${9:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: ${10:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${11:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${12|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the condition should be C(present) or C(absent)

aws_waf_facts.description: Retrieve facts for WAF ACLs, Rule , Conditions and Filters.
body: aws_waf_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

region: ${2:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${6:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
name: ${8:undefined} # not required. The name of a Web Application Firewall
aws_waf_rule:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the Web Application Firewall rule
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

metric_name: ${4:undefined} # not required. A friendly name or description for the metrics for the rule,The name can contain only alphanumeric characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9); the name can't contain whitespace.,You can't change metric_name after you create the rule,Defaults to the same as name with disallowed characters removed
purge_conditions: ${5:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to remove conditions that are not passed when updating `conditions`. Defaults to false.
aws_access_key: ${6:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

region: ${7:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_url: ${8:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
security_token: ${9:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. whether the rule should be present or absent

conditions: ${11:undefined} # not required. list of conditions used in the rule. Each condition should contain I(type): which is one of [C(byte), C(geo), C(ip), C(size), C(sql) or C(xss)] I(negated): whether the condition should be negated, and C(condition), the name of the existing condition. M(aws_waf_condition) can be used to create new conditions
profile: ${12:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

aws_waf_web_acl.description: create and delete WAF Web ACLs
body: aws_waf_web_acl:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the Web Application Firewall ACL to manage

rules: ${2:undefined} # not required. A list of rules that the Web ACL will enforce.,Each rule must contain I(name), I(action), I(priority) keys.,Priorities must be unique, but not necessarily consecutive. Lower numbered priorities are evalauted first.,The I(type) key can be passed as C(rate_based), it defaults to C(regular)
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

metric_name: ${4:undefined} # not required. A friendly name or description for the metrics for this WebACL,The name can contain only alphanumeric characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9); the name can't contain whitespace.,You can't change metric_name after you create the WebACL,Metric name will default to I(name) with disallowed characters stripped out
validate_certs: ${5:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

ec2_url: ${6:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
purge_rules: ${7:undefined} # not required. Whether to remove rules that aren't passed with C(rules). Defaults to false

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_access_key: ${9:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${10:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${11|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. whether the Web ACL should be present or absent

default_action: ${12|block,allow,count|} # not required. choices: block;allow;count. The action that you want AWS WAF to take when a request doesn't match the criteria specified in any of the Rule objects that are associated with the WebACL
profile: ${13:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

azure.description: create or terminate a virtual machine in azure
body: azure:
storage_account: ${1:undefined} # required. the azure storage account in which to store the data disks.
location: ${2:null} # required. the azure location to use (e.g. 'East US')
image: ${3:null} # required. system image for creating the virtual machine (e.g., b39f27a8b8c64d52b05eac6a62ebad85__Ubuntu_DAILY_BUILD-precise-12_04_3-LTS-amd64-server-20131205-en-us-30GB)
name: ${4:null} # required. name of the virtual machine and associated cloud service.
virtual_network_name: ${5:null} # not required. Name of virtual network.
endpoints: ${6:22} # not required. a comma-separated list of TCP ports to expose on the virtual machine (e.g., "22,80")
management_cert_path: ${7:null} # not required. path to an azure management certificate associated with the subscription id. Overrides the AZURE_CERT_PATH environment variable.
auto_updates: ${8|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Enable Auto Updates on Windows Machines
wait_timeout: ${9:600} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
wait_timeout_redirects: ${10:300} # not required. how long before wait gives up for redirects, in seconds

ssh_cert_path: ${11:null} # not required. path to an X509 certificate containing the public ssh key to install in the virtual machine. See http://www.windowsazure.com/en-us/manage/linux/tutorials/intro-to-linux/ for more details.,if this option is specified, password-based ssh authentication will be disabled.
subscription_id: ${12:null} # not required. azure subscription id. Overrides the AZURE_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environment variable.

role_size: ${13:Small} # not required. azure role size for the new virtual machine (e.g., Small, ExtraLarge, A6). You have to pay attention to the fact that instances of type G and DS are not available in all regions (locations). Make sure if you selected the size and type of instance available in your chosen location.
state: ${14:present} # not required. create or terminate instances
wait: ${15|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the instance to be in state 'running' before returning
password: ${16:null} # not required. the unix password for the new virtual machine.
user: ${17:null} # not required. the unix username for the new virtual machine.
os_type: ${18|windows,linux|} # not required. choices: windows;linux. The type of the os that is gettings provisioned
enable_winrm: ${19|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Enable winrm on Windows Machines
hostname: ${20:null} # not required. hostname to write /etc/hostname. Defaults to <name>.cloudapp.net.

azure_rm_acs.description: Manage an Azure Container Service Instance (ACS).
body: azure_rm_acs:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the Container Services instance.
orchestration_platform: ${2:undefined} # required. Specifies the Container Orchestration Platform to use. Currently can be either DCOS, Kubernetes or Swarm.
linux_profile: ${3:undefined} # required. The linux profile suboptions.
agent_pool_profiles: ${4:undefined} # required. The agent pool profile suboptions.
resource_group: ${5:undefined} # required. Name of a resource group where the Container Services exists or will be created.
diagnostics_profile: ${6:undefined} # required. Should VM Diagnostics be enabled for the Container Service VM's.
master_profile: ${7:undefined} # required. Master profile suboptions.

tags: ${8:null} # not required. Dictionary of string:string pairs to assign as metadata to the object. Metadata tags on the object will be updated with any provided values. To remove tags set append_tags option to false.

auth_source: ${9|auto,cli,credential_file,env|} # not required. choices: auto;cli;credential_file;env. Controls the source of the credentials to use for authentication.,C(auto) will follow the default precedence of module parameters -> environment variables -> default profile in credential file C(~/.azure/credentials).,When set to C(cli), the credentials will be sources from the default Azure CLI profile.,Can also be set via the C(ANSIBLE_AZURE_AUTH_SOURCE) environment variable.
ad_user: ${10:null} # not required. Active Directory username. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.
subscription_id: ${11:null} # not required. Your Azure subscription Id.
state: ${12|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Assert the state of the ACS. Use 'present' to create or update an ACS and 'absent' to delete it.

api_profile: ${13|latest|} # not required. choices: latest. Selects an API profile to use when communicating with Azure services. Default value of C(latest) is appropriate for public clouds; future values will allow use with Azure Stack.

append_tags: ${14:true} # not required. Use to control if tags field is canonical or just appends to existing tags. When canonical, any tags not found in the tags parameter will be removed from the object's metadata.

cert_validation_mode: ${15|validate,ignore|} # not required. choices: validate;ignore. Controls the certificate validation behavior for Azure endpoints. By default, all modules will validate the server certificate, but when an HTTPS proxy is in use, or against Azure Stack, it may be necessary to disable this behavior by passing C(ignore). Can also be set via credential file profile or the C(AZURE_CERT_VALIDATION) environment variable.
profile: ${16:null} # not required. Security profile found in ~/.azure/credentials file.
location: ${17:resource_group location} # not required. Valid azure location. Defaults to location of the resource group.
service_principal: ${18:null} # not required. The service principal suboptions.
password: ${19:null} # not required. Active Directory user password. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.

cloud_environment: ${20:AzureCloud} # not required. For cloud environments other than the US public cloud, the environment name (as defined by Azure Python SDK, eg, C(AzureChinaCloud), C(AzureUSGovernment)), or a metadata discovery endpoint URL (required for Azure Stack). Can also be set via credential file profile or the C(AZURE_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT) environment variable.
tenant: ${21:null} # not required. Azure tenant ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
client_id: ${22:null} # not required. Azure client ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
secret: ${23:null} # not required. Azure client secret. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
azure_rm_availabilityset:
resource_group: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of a resource group where the availability set exists or will be created.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the availability set.
location: ${3:resource_group location} # not required. Valid azure location. Defaults to location of the resource group.
subscription_id: ${4:null} # not required. Your Azure subscription Id.
secret: ${5:null} # not required. Azure client secret. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
profile: ${6:null} # not required. Security profile found in ~/.azure/credentials file.
platform_update_domain_count: ${7:5} # not required. Update domains indicate groups of virtual machines and underlying physical hardware that can be rebooted at the same time. Default is 5.
password: ${8:null} # not required. Active Directory user password. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.

auth_source: ${9|auto,cli,credential_file,env|} # not required. choices: auto;cli;credential_file;env. Controls the source of the credentials to use for authentication.,C(auto) will follow the default precedence of module parameters -> environment variables -> default profile in credential file C(~/.azure/credentials).,When set to C(cli), the credentials will be sources from the default Azure CLI profile.,Can also be set via the C(ANSIBLE_AZURE_AUTH_SOURCE) environment variable.

cert_validation_mode: ${10|validate,ignore|} # not required. choices: validate;ignore. Controls the certificate validation behavior for Azure endpoints. By default, all modules will validate the server certificate, but when an HTTPS proxy is in use, or against Azure Stack, it may be necessary to disable this behavior by passing C(ignore). Can also be set via credential file profile or the C(AZURE_CERT_VALIDATION) environment variable.

tags: ${11:null} # not required. Dictionary of string:string pairs to assign as metadata to the object. Metadata tags on the object will be updated with any provided values. To remove tags set append_tags option to false.
ad_user: ${12:null} # not required. Active Directory username. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.

api_profile: ${13|latest|} # not required. choices: latest. Selects an API profile to use when communicating with Azure services. Default value of C(latest) is appropriate for public clouds; future values will allow use with Azure Stack.
client_id: ${14:null} # not required. Azure client ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
tenant: ${15:null} # not required. Azure tenant ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
sku: ${16|Classic,Aligned|} # not required. choices: Classic;Aligned. Define if the availability set supports managed disks.
platform_fault_domain_count: ${17:3} # not required. Fault domains define the group of virtual machines that share a common power source and network switch. Should be between 1 and 3. Default is 3

cloud_environment: ${18:AzureCloud} # not required. For cloud environments other than the US public cloud, the environment name (as defined by Azure Python SDK, eg, C(AzureChinaCloud), C(AzureUSGovernment)), or a metadata discovery endpoint URL (required for Azure Stack). Can also be set via credential file profile or the C(AZURE_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT) environment variable.

azure_rm_deployment.description: Create or destroy Azure Resource Manager template deployments
body: azure_rm_deployment:
resource_group_name: ${1:undefined} # required. The resource group name to use or create to host the deployed template

deployment_name: ${2:ansible-arm} # not required. The name of the deployment to be tracked in the resource group deployment history. Re-using a deployment name will overwrite the previous value in the resource group's deployment history.

auth_source: ${3|auto,cli,credential_file,env|} # not required. choices: auto;cli;credential_file;env. Controls the source of the credentials to use for authentication.,C(auto) will follow the default precedence of module parameters -> environment variables -> default profile in credential file C(~/.azure/credentials).,When set to C(cli), the credentials will be sources from the default Azure CLI profile.,Can also be set via the C(ANSIBLE_AZURE_AUTH_SOURCE) environment variable.

parameters: ${4:null} # not required. A hash of all the required template variables for the deployment template. This parameter is mutually exclusive with 'parameters_link'. Either one of them is required if "state" parameter is "present".

deployment_mode: ${5|complete,incremental|} # not required. choices: complete;incremental. In incremental mode, resources are deployed without deleting existing resources that are not included in the template. In complete mode resources are deployed and existing resources in the resource group not included in the template are deleted.
ad_user: ${6:null} # not required. Active Directory username. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.
wait_for_deployment_polling_period: ${7:10} # not required. Time (in seconds) to wait between polls when waiting for deployment completion.
subscription_id: ${8:null} # not required. Your Azure subscription Id.

cloud_environment: ${9:AzureCloud} # not required. For cloud environments other than the US public cloud, the environment name (as defined by Azure Python SDK, eg, C(AzureChinaCloud), C(AzureUSGovernment)), or a metadata discovery endpoint URL (required for Azure Stack). Can also be set via credential file profile or the C(AZURE_CLOUD_ENVIRONMENT) environment variable.
wait_for_deployment_completion: ${10|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether or not to block until the deployment has completed.
client_id: ${11:null} # not required. Azure client ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.
location: ${12:westus} # not required. The geo-locations in which the resource group will be located.

cert_validation_mode: ${13|validate,ignore|} # not required. choices: validate;ignore. Controls the certificate validation behavior for Azure endpoints. By default, all modules will validate the server certificate, but when an HTTPS proxy is in use, or against Azure Stack, it may be necessary to disable this behavior by passing C(ignore). Can also be set via credential file profile or the C(AZURE_CERT_VALIDATION) environment variable.

state: ${14|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. If state is "present", template will be created. If state is "present" and if deployment exists, it will be updated. If state is "absent", stack will be removed.

template: ${15:null} # not required. A hash containing the templates inline. This parameter is mutually exclusive with 'template_link'. Either one of them is required if "state" parameter is "present".
profile: ${16:null} # not required. Security profile found in ~/.azure/credentials file.
password: ${17:null} # not required. Active Directory user password. Use when authenticating with an Active Directory user rather than service principal.

api_profile: ${18|latest|} # not required. choices: latest. Selects an API profile to use when communicating with Azure services. Default value of C(latest) is appropriate for public clouds; future values will allow use with Azure Stack.
tenant: ${19:null} # not required. Azure tenant ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.

parameters_link: ${20:null} # not required. Uri of file containing the parameters body. This parameter is mutually exclusive with 'parameters'. Either one of them is required if "state" parameter is "present".
secret: ${21:null} # not required. Azure client secret. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.

template_link: ${22:null} # not required. Uri of file containing the template body. This parameter is mutually exclusive with 'template'. Either one of them is required if "state" parameter is "present".

tenant: ${24:null} # not required. Azure tenant ID. Use when authenticating with a Service Principal.

os_type: ${25|Windows,Linux|} # not required. choices: Windows;Linux. Determines any rules to be added to a default security group. When creating a network interface, if no security group name is provided, a default security group will be created. If the os_type is 'Windows', a rule will be added allowing RDP access. If the os_type is 'Linux', a rule allowing SSH access will be added.

open_ports: ${26:null} # not required. When a default security group is created for a Linux host a rule will be added allowing inbound TCP connections to the default SSH port 22, and for a Windows host rules will be added allowing inbound access to RDP ports 3389 and 5986. Override the default ports by providing a list of open ports.

private_ip_allocation_method: ${27|Dynamic,Static|} # not required. choices: Dynamic;Static. (Deprecate) Specify whether or not the assigned IP address is permanent. NOTE: when creating a network interface specifying a value of 'Static' requires that a private_ip_address value be provided. You can update the allocation method to 'Static' after a dynamic private ip address has been assigned.,This option will be deprecated in 2.9, use I(ip_configurations) instead.

public_ip: ${28:true} # not required. (Deprecate) When creating a network interface, if no public IP address name is provided a default public IP address will be created. recovery_services_recovery_point_resource_id: ${20:undefined} # not required. Required if I(create_mode) is C(restore_long_term_retention_backup), then this value is required. Specifies the resource ID of the recovery point to restore from.

state: ${27|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Assert the state of the SQL Database. Use 'present' to create or update an SQL Database and 'absent' to delete it.

max_size_bytes: ${28:undefined} # not required. The max size of the database expressed in bytes. If I(create_mode) is not C(default), this value is ignored. create_mode: ${29|copy,default,non_readable_secondary,online_secondary,point_in_time_restore,recovery,restore,restore_long_term_retention_backup|} # not required. choices: copy;default;non_readable_secondary;online_secondary;point_in_time_restore;recovery;restore;restore_long_term_retention_backup. Specifies the mode of database creation.,C(default): regular database creation.,C(copy): creates a database as a copy of an existing database.,C(online_secondary)/C(non_readable_secondary): creates a database as a (readable or nonreadable) secondary replica of an existing database.,C(point_in_time_restore): Creates a database by restoring a point in time backup of an existing database.,C(recovery): Creates a database by restoring a geo-replicated backup.,C(restore): Creates a database by restoring a backup of a deleted database.,C(restore_long_term_retention_backup): Creates a database by restoring from a long term retention vault.,C(copy), C(non_readable_secondary), C(online_secondary) and C(restore_long_term_retention_backup) are not supported for C(data_warehouse) edition.
