mtu: ${9:undefined} # not required. Specifies the maximum transmission unit (MTU) for traffic on this VLAN. When creating a new VLAN, if this parameter is not specified, the default value used will be C(1500).,This number must be between 576 to 9198.
provider: ${10:null} # not required. A dict object containing connection details.

dag_tunnel: ${11:undefined} # not required. Specifies how the disaggregator (DAG) distributes received tunnel-encapsulated packets to TMM instances. Select C(inner) to distribute packets based on information in inner headers. Select C(outer) to distribute packets based on information in outer headers without inspecting inner headers.,When creating a new VLAN, if this parameter is not specified, the default of C(outer) is used.,This parameter is not supported on Virtual Editions of BIG-IP.

validate_certs: ${12:true} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. Use this only on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
server_port: ${13:443} # not required. The BIG-IP server port. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
untagged_interfaces: ${14:undefined} # not required. Specifies a list of untagged interfaces and trunks that you want to configure for the VLAN.

tagged_interfaces: ${15:undefined} # not required. Specifies a list of tagged interfaces and trunks that you want to configure for the VLAN. Use tagged interfaces or trunks when you want to assign a single interface or trunk to multiple VLANs.

state: ${16|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. The state of the VLAN on the system. When C(present), guarantees that the VLAN exists with the provided attributes. When C(absent), removes the VLAN from the system.
tag: ${17:undefined} # not required. Tag number for the VLAN. The tag number can be any integer between 1 and 4094. The system automatically assigns a tag number if you do not specify a value.

bigip_wait.description: Wait for a BIG-IP condition before continuing
body: bigip_wait:

user: ${1:undefined} # required. The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server: ${2:undefined} # required. The BIG-IP host. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
password: ${3:undefined} # required. The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: ${4:true} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. Use this only on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
delay: ${5:0} # not required. Number of seconds to wait before starting to poll.
server_port: ${6:443} # not required. The BIG-IP server port. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.
msg: ${7:undefined} # not required. This overrides the normal error message from a failure to meet the required conditions.

timeout: ${8:7200} # not required. Maximum number of seconds to wait for.,When used without other conditions it is equivalent of just sleeping.,The default timeout is deliberately set to 2 hours because no individual REST API.
provider: ${9:null} # not required. A dict object containing connection details.
sleep: ${10:1} # not required. Number of seconds to sleep between checks, before 2.3 this was hardcoded to 1 second.

bigiq_regkey_license.description: Manages licenses in a BIG-IQ registration key pool
body: bigiq_regkey_license:

user: ${1:undefined} # required. The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.

regkey_pool: ${2:undefined} # required. The registration key pool that you want to place the license in.,You must be mindful to name your registration pools unique names. While BIG-IQ does not require this, this module does. If you do not do this, the behavior of the module is undefined and you may end up putting licenses in the wrong registration key pool.
server: ${3:undefined} # required. The BIG-IP host. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
license_key: ${4:undefined} # required. The license key to put in the pool.
password: ${5:undefined} # required. The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

validate_certs: ${6:true} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. Use this only on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
description: ${7:undefined} # not required. Description of the license.
server_port: ${8:443} # not required. The BIG-IP server port. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.

accept_eula: ${9:undefined} # not required. A key that signifies that you accept the F5 EULA for this license.,A copy of the EULA can be found here https://askf5.f5.com/csp/article/K12902,This is required when C(state) is C(present).

state: ${10|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. The state of the regkey license in the pool on the system.,When C(present), guarantees that the license exists in the pool.,When C(absent), removes the license from the pool.
provider: ${11:null} # not required. A dict object containing connection details.

bigiq_regkey_pool.description: Manages registration key pools on BIG-IQ
body: bigiq_regkey_pool:

user: ${1:undefined} # required. The username to connect to the BIG-IP with. This user must have administrative privileges on the device. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_USER) is set.
server: ${2:undefined} # required. The BIG-IP host. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER) is set.
password: ${3:undefined} # required. The password for the user account used to connect to the BIG-IP. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_PASSWORD) is set.

name: ${4:undefined} # required. Specifies the name of the registration key pool.,You must be mindful to name your registration pools unique names. While BIG-IQ does not require this, this module does. If you do not do this, the behavior of the module is undefined and you may end up putting licenses in the wrong registration key pool.

validate_certs: ${5:true} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. Use this only on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_VALIDATE_CERTS) is set.
description: ${6:undefined} # not required. A description to attach to the pool.
server_port: ${7:443} # not required. The BIG-IP server port. You can omit this option if the environment variable C(F5_SERVER_PORT) is set.

state: ${8|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. The state of the regkey pool on the system.,When C(present), guarantees that the pool exists.,When C(absent), removes the pool, and the licenses it contains, from the system.
provider: ${9:null} # not required. A dict object containing connection details.

bigmon_chain.description: Create and remove a bigmon inline service chain.
body: bigmon_chain:
controller: ${1:undefined} # required. The controller IP address.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the chain.
access_token: ${3:undefined} # not required. Bigmon access token. If this isn't set, the environment variable C(BIGSWITCH_ACCESS_TOKEN) is used.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the service chain should be present or absent.

validate_certs: ${5|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. If C(false), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled devices using self-signed certificates.

bigmon_policy.description: Create and remove a bigmon out-of-band policy.
body: bigmon_policy:
controller: ${1:undefined} # required. The controller address.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the policy.

validate_certs: ${3|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. If C(false), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled devices using self-signed certificates.
duration: ${4:0} # not required. Run policy for duration duration or until delivery_packet_count packets are delivered, whichever comes first.

action: ${5|forward,drop,flow-gen|} # not required. choices: forward;drop;flow-gen. Forward matching packets to delivery interfaces, Drop is for measure rate of matching packets, but do not forward to delivery interfaces, capture packets and write to a PCAP file, or enable NetFlow generation.
policy_description: ${6:undefined} # not required. Description of policy.
access_token: ${7:undefined} # not required. Bigmon access token. If this isn't set, the environment variable C(BIGSWITCH_ACCESS_TOKEN) is used.
priority: ${8:100} # not required. A priority associated with this policy. The higher priority policy takes precedence over a lower priority.
delivery_packet_count: ${9:0} # not required. Run policy until delivery_packet_count packets are delivered.
state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the policy should be present or absent.
start_time: ${11:ansible_date_time.iso8601} # not required. Date the policy becomes active
bigpanda:
component: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the component being deployed. Ex: billing
token: ${2:undefined} # required. API token.
version: ${3:undefined} # required. The deployment version.
state: ${4|started,finished,failed|} # required. choices: started;finished;failed. State of the deployment.
env: ${5:undefined} # not required. The environment name, typically 'production', 'staging', etc.
description: ${6:undefined} # not required. Free text description of the deployment.

validate_certs: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates for the target url will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
owner: ${8:undefined} # not required. The person responsible for the deployment.
url: ${9:https://api.bigpanda.io} # not required. Base URL of the API server.
hosts: ${10:machine's hostname} # not required. Name of affected host name. Can be a list.

blockinfile.description: Insert/update/remove a text block surrounded by marker lines
body: blockinfile:
path: ${1:undefined} # required. The file to modify.,Before 2.3 this option was only usable as I(dest), I(destfile) and I(name).
selevel: ${2:s0} # not required. Level part of the SELinux file context. This is the MLS/MCS attribute, sometimes known as the C(range). C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

insertafter: ${3|EOF,*regex*|} # not required. choices: EOF;*regex*. If specified, the block will be inserted after the last match of specified regular expression. A special value is available; C(EOF) for inserting the block at the end of the file.  If specified regular expression has no matches, C(EOF) will be used instead.

insertbefore: ${4|BOF,*regex*|} # not required. choices: BOF;*regex*. If specified, the block will be inserted before the last match of specified regular expression. A special value is available; C(BOF) for inserting the block at the beginning of the file.  If specified regular expression has no matches, the block will be inserted at the end of the file.
backup: ${5:no} # not required. Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.
marker_end: ${6:END} # not required. This will be inserted at {mark} in the closing ansible block marker.
serole: ${7:null} # not required. Role part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
owner: ${8:null} # not required. Name of the user that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).
setype: ${9:null} # not required. Type part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
marker: ${10:# {mark} ANSIBLE MANAGED BLOCK} # not required. The marker line template. "{mark}" will be replaced with the values in marker_begin (default="BEGIN") and marker_end (default="END").

mode: ${11:null} # not required. Mode the file or directory should be. For those used to I(/usr/bin/chmod) remember that modes are actually octal numbers (like C(0644) or C(01777)). Leaving off the leading zero will likely have unexpected results. As of version 1.8, the mode may be specified as a symbolic mode (for example, C(u+rwx) or C(u=rw,g=r,o=r)).

validate: ${12:None} # not required. The validation command to run before copying into place. The path to the file to validate is passed in via '%s' which must be present as in the example below. The command is passed securely so shell features like expansion and pipes won't work.

attributes: ${13:None} # not required. Attributes the file or directory should have. To get supported flags look at the man page for I(chattr) on the target system. This string should contain the attributes in the same order as the one displayed by I(lsattr).
create: ${14:no} # not required. Create a new file if it doesn't exist.
block: ${15:} # not required. The text to insert inside the marker lines. If it's missing or an empty string, the block will be removed as if C(state) were specified to C(absent).
marker_begin: ${16:BEGIN} # not required. This will be inserted at {mark} in the opening ansible block marker.
state: ${17|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Whether the block should be there or not.
seuser: ${18:null} # not required. User part of SELinux file context. Will default to system policy, if applicable. If set to C(_default), it will use the C(user) portion of the policy if available.
group: ${19:null} # not required. Name of the group that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).

unsafe_writes: ${20:false} # not required. Normally this module uses atomic operations to prevent data corruption or inconsistent reads from the target files, sometimes systems are configured or just broken in ways that prevent this. One example are docker mounted files, they cannot be updated atomically and can only be done in an unsafe manner.,This boolean option allows ansible to fall back to unsafe methods of updating files for those cases in which you do not have any other choice. Be aware that this is subject to race conditions and can lead to data corruption.
bower:
path: ${1:undefined} # required. The base path where to install the bower packages
version: ${2:undefined} # not required. The version to be installed
offline: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Install packages from local cache, if the packages were installed before
state: ${4|present,absent,latest|} # not required. choices: present;absent;latest. The state of the bower package
production: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Install with --production flag
name: ${6:undefined} # not required. The name of a bower package to install
relative_execpath: ${7:null} # not required. Relative path to bower executable from install path

bundler.description: Manage Ruby Gem dependencies with Bundler
body: bundler:
chdir: ${1:temporary working directory} # not required. The directory to execute the bundler commands from. This directoy needs to contain a valid Gemfile or .bundle/ directory
executable: ${2:null} # not required. The path to the bundler executable

binstub_directory: ${3:null} # not required. Only applies if state is C(present). Specifies the directory to install any gem bins files to. When executed the bin files will run within the context of the Gemfile and fail if any required gem dependencies are not installed. If C(chdir) is set then this path is relative to C(chdir)
user_install: ${4|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Only applies if state is C(present). Installs gems in the local user's cache or for all users

deployment_mode: ${5|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Only applies if state is C(present). If set it will only install gems that are in the default or production groups. Requires a Gemfile.lock file to have been created prior
clean: ${6|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Only applies if state is C(present). If set removes any gems on the target host that are not in the gemfile
gemfile: ${7:Gemfile in current directory} # not required. Only applies if state is C(present). The path to the gemfile to use to install gems.
extra_args: ${8:null} # not required. A space separated string of additional commands that can be applied to the Bundler command. Refer to the Bundler documentation for more information
local: ${9|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. If set only installs gems from the cache on the target host
gem_path: ${10:RubyGems gem paths} # not required. Only applies if state is C(present). Specifies the directory to install the gems into. If C(chdir) is set then this path is relative to C(chdir)

exclude_groups: ${11:null} # not required. A list of Gemfile groups to exclude during operations. This only applies when state is C(present). Bundler considers this a 'remembered' property for the Gemfile and will automatically exclude groups in future operations even if C(exclude_groups) is not set
state: ${12|present,latest|} # not required. choices: present;latest. The desired state of the Gem bundle. C(latest) updates gems to the most recent, acceptable version

bzr.description: Deploy software (or files) from bzr branches
body: bzr:
dest: ${1:undefined} # required. Absolute path of where the branch should be cloned to.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. SSH or HTTP protocol address of the parent branch.
version: ${3:head} # not required. What version of the branch to clone.  This can be the bzr revno or revid.
force: ${4:no} # not required. If C(yes), any modified files in the working tree will be discarded.  Before 1.9 the default value was C(yes).
executable: ${5:undefined} # not required. Path to bzr executable to use. If not supplied, the normal mechanism for resolving binary paths will be used.
campfire:
msg: ${1:undefined} # required. The message body.
subscription: ${2:undefined} # required. The subscription name to use.
room: ${3:undefined} # required. Room number to which the message should be sent.
token: ${4:undefined} # required. API token.

notify: ${5|56k,bell,bezos,bueller,clowntown,cottoneyejoe,crickets,dadgummit,dangerzone,danielsan,deeper,drama,greatjob,greyjoy,guarantee,heygirl,horn,horror,inconceivable,live,loggins,makeitso,noooo,nyan,ohmy,ohyeah,pushit,rimshot,rollout,rumble,sax,secret,sexyback,story,tada,tmyk,trololo,trombone,unix,vuvuzela,what,whoomp,yeah,yodel|} # not required. choices: 56k;bell;bezos;bueller;clowntown;cottoneyejoe;crickets;dadgummit;dangerzone;danielsan;deeper;drama;greatjob;greyjoy;guarantee;heygirl;horn;horror;inconceivable;live;loggins;makeitso;noooo;nyan;ohmy;ohyeah;pushit;rimshot;rollout;rumble;sax;secret;sexyback;story;tada;tmyk;trololo;trombone;unix;vuvuzela;what;whoomp;yeah;yodel. Send a notification sound before the message.
capabilities:
capability: ${1:undefined} # required. Desired capability to set (with operator and flags, if state is C(present)) or remove (if state is C(absent))
path: ${2:undefined} # required. Specifies the path to the file to be managed.
state: ${3|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Whether the entry should be present or absent in the file's capabilities.

catapult.description: Send a sms / mms using the catapult bandwidth api
body: catapult:
src: ${1:null} # required. One of your catapult telephone numbers the message should come from (must be in E.164 format, like C(+19195551212)).
dest: ${2:null} # required. The phone number or numbers the message should be sent to (must be in E.164 format, like C(+19195551212)).
api_secret: ${3:null} # required. Api Secret from Api account page.
api_token: ${4:null} # required. Api Token from Api account page.
msg: ${5:null} # required. The contents of the text message (must be 2048 characters or less).
user_id: ${6:null} # required. User Id from Api account page.
media: ${7:undefined} # not required. For MMS messages, a media url to the location of the media to be sent with the message.

ce_aaa_server.description: Manages AAA server global configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_aaa_server:
hwtacas_template: ${1:null} # not required. Name of a HWTACACS template. The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-insensitive characters.
local_user_group: ${2:null} # not required. Name of the user group where the user belongs. The user inherits all the rights of the user group. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
authen_scheme_name: ${3:null} # not required. Name of an authentication scheme. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
first_authen_mode: ${4|invalid,local,hwtacacs,radius,none|} # not required. choices: invalid;local;hwtacacs;radius;none. Preferred authentication mode.
acct_scheme_name: ${5:null} # not required. Accounting scheme name. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
domain_name: ${6:null} # not required. Name of a domain. The value is a string of 1 to 64 characters.
radius_server_group: ${7:null} # not required. RADIUS server group's name. The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-insensitive characters.
author_scheme_name: ${8:null} # not required. Name of an authorization scheme. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
state: ${9|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.
first_author_mode: ${10|invalid,local,hwtacacs,if-authenticated,none|} # not required. choices: invalid;local;hwtacacs;if-authenticated;none. Preferred authorization mode.
accounting_mode: ${11|invalid,hwtacacs,radius,none|} # not required. choices: invalid;hwtacacs;radius;none. Accounting Mode.

ce_aaa_server_host.description: Manages AAA server host configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_aaa_server_host:
local_ftp_dir: ${1:null} # not required. FTP user directory. The value is a string of 1 to 255 characters.
radius_server_port: ${2:null} # not required. Configured server port for a particular server. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.
local_user_name: ${3:null} # not required. Name of a local user. The value is a string of 1 to 253 characters.
hwtacacs_template: ${4:null} # not required. Name of a HWTACACS template. The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-insensitive characters.
local_password: ${5:null} # not required. Login password of a user. The password can contain letters, numbers, and special characters. The value is a string of 1 to 255 characters.
radius_server_type: ${6|Authentication,Accounting|} # not required. choices: Authentication;Accounting. Type of Radius Server.
hwtacacs_is_secondary_server: ${7|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Whether the server is secondary.
hwtacacs_server_type: ${8|Authentication,Authorization,Accounting,Common|} # not required. choices: Authentication;Authorization;Accounting;Common. Hwtacacs server type.
radius_group_name: ${9:null} # not required. RADIUS server group's name. The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-insensitive characters.
radius_server_mode: ${10|Secondary-server,Primary-server|} # not required. choices: Secondary-server;Primary-server. Configured primary or secondary server for a particular server.
local_user_level: ${11:null} # not required. Login level of a local user. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 15.
hwtacacs_server_ip: ${12:null} # not required. Server IPv4 address. Must be a valid unicast IP address. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters, in dotted decimal notation.
local_service_type: ${13:null} # not required. The type of local user login through, such as ftp ssh snmp telnet.
local_user_group: ${14:null} # not required. Name of the user group where the user belongs. The user inherits all the rights of the user group. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
radius_server_ipv6: ${15:null} # not required. IPv6 address of configured server. The total length is 128 bits.
hwtacacs_server_host_name: ${16:null} # not required. Hwtacacs server host name.
hwtacacs_server_ipv6: ${17:null} # not required. Server IPv6 address. Must be a valid unicast IP address. The total length is 128 bits.
radius_server_name: ${18:null} # not required. Hostname of configured server. The value is a string of 0 to 255 case-sensitive characters.
radius_server_ip: ${19:null} # not required. IPv4 address of configured server. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters, in dotted decimal notation.
hwtacacs_vpn_name: ${20:null} # not required. VPN instance name.
state: ${21|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.
radius_vpn_name: ${22:null} # not required. Set VPN instance. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters.
hwtacacs_is_public_net: ${23|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Set the public-net.

ce_acl.description: Manages base ACL configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_acl:

acl_name: ${1:undefined} # required. ACL number or name. For a numbered rule group, the value ranging from 2000 to 2999 indicates a basic ACL. For a named rule group, the value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters starting with a letter, spaces not supported.
rule_name: ${2:null} # not required. Name of a basic ACL rule. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters. The value is case-insensitive, and cannot contain spaces or begin with an underscore (_).
acl_description: ${3:null} # not required. ACL description. The value is a string of 1 to 127 characters.
log_flag: ${4|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Flag of logging matched data packets.
rule_action: ${5|permit,deny|} # not required. choices: permit;deny. Matching mode of basic ACL rules.
source_ip: ${6:null} # not required. Source IP address. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters.The default value is 0.0.0.0. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
vrf_name: ${7:null} # not required. VPN instance name. The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.The default value is _public_.
acl_step: ${8:null} # not required. ACL step. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 20. The default value is 5.
acl_num: ${9:null} # not required. ACL number. The value is an integer ranging from 2000 to 2999.

time_range: ${10:null} # not required. Name of a time range in which an ACL rule takes effect. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters. The value is case-insensitive, and cannot contain spaces. The name must start with an uppercase or lowercase letter. In addition, the word "all" cannot be specified as a time range name.
rule_id: ${11:null} # not required. ID of a basic ACL rule in configuration mode. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967294.
frag_type: ${12|fragment,clear_fragment|} # not required. choices: fragment;clear_fragment. Type of packet fragmentation.
rule_description: ${13:null} # not required. Description about an ACL rule. The value is a string of 1 to 127 characters.
state: ${14|present,absent,delete_acl|} # not required. choices: present;absent;delete_acl. Specify desired state of the resource.
src_mask: ${15:null} # not required. Mask of a source IP address. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 32.

ce_acl_advance.description: Manages advanced ACL configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_acl_advance:

acl_name: ${1:undefined} # required. ACL number or name. For a numbered rule group, the value ranging from 3000 to 3999 indicates a advance ACL. For a named rule group, the value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters starting with a letter, spaces not supported.
precedence: ${2:null} # not required. Data packets can be filtered based on the priority field. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7.
src_port_end: ${3:null} # not required. End port number of the source port. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.
dest_port_pool_name: ${4:null} # not required. Name of a destination port pool. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
source_ip: ${5:null} # not required. Source IP address. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters.The default value is 0.0.0.0. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
src_pool_name: ${6:null} # not required. Name of a source pool. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
time_range: ${7:null} # not required. Name of a time range in which an ACL rule takes effect.

igmp_type: ${8|host-query,mrouter-adver,mrouter-solic,mrouter-termi,mtrace-resp,mtrace-route,v1host-report,v2host-report,v2leave-group,v3host-report|} # not required. choices: host-query;mrouter-adver;mrouter-solic;mrouter-termi;mtrace-resp;mtrace-route;v1host-report;v2host-report;v2leave-group;v3host-report. Internet Group Management Protocol.
src_port_pool_name: ${9:null} # not required. Name of a source port pool. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
dest_port_op: ${10|lt,eq,gt,range|} # not required. choices: lt;eq;gt;range. Range type of the destination port.
src_port_op: ${11|lt,eq,gt,range|} # not required. choices: lt;eq;gt;range. Range type of the source port.
dest_pool_name: ${12:null} # not required. Name of a destination pool. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
ttl_expired: ${13|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Whether TTL Expired is matched, with the TTL value of 1.
dest_port_begin: ${14:null} # not required. Start port number of the destination port. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.
tos: ${15:null} # not required. ToS value on which data packet filtering is based. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 15.
dscp: ${16:null} # not required. Differentiated Services Code Point. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 63.
frag_type: ${17|fragment,clear_fragment|} # not required. choices: fragment;clear_fragment. Type of packet fragmentation.
rule_description: ${18:null} # not required. Description about an ACL rule.
rule_name: ${19:null} # not required. Name of a basic ACL rule. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
dest_port_end: ${20:null} # not required. End port number of the destination port. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.
icmp_code: ${21:null} # not required. ICMP message code. Data packets can be filtered based on the ICMP message code. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 255.
rule_action: ${22|permit,deny|} # not required. choices: permit;deny. Matching mode of basic ACL rules.
dest_ip: ${23:null} # not required. Destination IP address. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters.The default value is 0.0.0.0. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
syn_flag: ${24:null} # not required. TCP flag value. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 63.
acl_num: ${25:null} # not required. ACL number. The value is an integer ranging from 3000 to 3999.

icmp_name: ${26|unconfiged,echo,echo-reply,fragmentneed-DFset,host-redirect,host-tos-redirect,host-unreachable,information-reply,information-request,net-redirect,net-tos-redirect,net-unreachable,parameter-problem,port-unreachable,protocol-unreachable,reassembly-timeout,source-quench,source-route-failed,timestamp-reply,timestamp-request,ttl-exceeded,address-mask-reply,address-mask-request,custom|} # not required. choices: unconfiged;echo;echo-reply;fragmentneed-DFset;host-redirect;host-tos-redirect;host-unreachable;information-reply;information-request;net-redirect;net-tos-redirect;net-unreachable;parameter-problem;port-unreachable;protocol-unreachable;reassembly-timeout;source-quench;source-route-failed;timestamp-reply;timestamp-request;ttl-exceeded;address-mask-reply;address-mask-request;custom. ICMP name.
dest_mask: ${27:null} # not required. Destination IP address mask. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 32.
tcp_flag_mask: ${28:null} # not required. TCP flag mask value. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 63.
src_mask: ${29:null} # not required. Source IP address mask. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 32.
state: ${30|present,absent,delete_acl|} # not required. choices: present;absent;delete_acl. Specify desired state of the resource.
protocol: ${31|ip,icmp,igmp,ipinip,tcp,udp,gre,ospf|} # not required. choices: ip;icmp;igmp;ipinip;tcp;udp;gre;ospf. Protocol type.
acl_description: ${32:null} # not required. ACL description. The value is a string of 1 to 127 characters.
log_flag: ${33|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Flag of logging matched data packets.
rule_id: ${34:null} # not required. ID of a basic ACL rule in configuration mode. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967294.
acl_step: ${35:null} # not required. ACL step. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 20. The default value is 5.
established: ${36|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Match established connections.
src_port_begin: ${37:null} # not required. Start port number of the source port. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.
icmp_type: ${38:null} # not required. ICMP type. This parameter is available only when the packet protocol is ICMP. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 255.
vrf_name: ${39:null} # not required. VPN instance name. The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.The default value is _public_.

ce_acl_interface.description: Manages applying ACLs to interfaces on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_acl_interface:

acl_name: ${1:undefined} # required. ACL number or name. For a numbered rule group, the value ranging from 2000 to 4999. For a named rule group, the value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters starting with a letter, spaces not supported.
interface: ${2:undefined} # required. Interface name. Only support interface full name, such as "40GE2/0/1".
direction: ${3|inbound,outbound|} # required. choices: inbound;outbound. Direction ACL to be applied in on the interface.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.

ce_bfd_global.description: Manages BFD global configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_bfd_global:
bfd_enable: ${1|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Enables the global Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) function.

tos_exp_dynamic: ${2:null} # not required. Indicates the priority of BFD control packets for dynamic BFD sessions. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7. The default priority is 7, which is the highest priority of BFD control packets.

tos_exp_static: ${3:null} # not required. Indicates the priority of BFD control packets for static BFD sessions. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7. The default priority is 7, which is the highest priority of BFD control packets.

delay_up_time: ${4:null} # not required. Specifies the delay before a BFD session becomes Up. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 600, in seconds. The default value is 0, indicating that a BFD session immediately becomes Up.

damp_max_wait_time: ${5:null} # not required. Specifies a maximum flapping suppression time for a BFD session. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 3600000, in milliseconds. The default value is 15000.

damp_init_wait_time: ${6:null} # not required. Specifies an initial flapping suppression time for a BFD session. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 3600000, in milliseconds. The default value is 2000.

damp_second_wait_time: ${7:null} # not required. Specifies a secondary flapping suppression time for a BFD session. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 3600000, in milliseconds. The default value is 5000.
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
default_ip: ${9:null} # not required. Specifies the default multicast IP address. The value ranges from 224.0.0.107 to 224.0.0.250.

ce_bfd_session.description: Manages BFD session configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_bfd_session:
session_name: ${1:null} # required. Specifies the name of a BFD session. The value is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters without spaces.
dest_addr: ${2:null} # not required. Specifies the peer IP address bound to the BFD session.
out_if_name: ${3:null} # not required. Specifies the type and number of the interface bound to the BFD session.
src_addr: ${4:null} # not required. Indicates the source IP address carried in BFD packets.
create_type: ${5|static,auto|} # not required. choices: static;auto. BFD session creation mode, the currently created BFD session only supports static or static auto-negotiation mode.

vrf_name: ${6:null} # not required. Specifies the name of a Virtual Private Network (VPN) instance that is bound to a BFD session. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string. The value _public_ is reserved and cannot be used as the VPN instance name.

use_default_ip: ${7:false} # not required. Indicates the default multicast IP address that is bound to a BFD session. By default, BFD uses the multicast IP address 224.0.0.184. You can set the multicast IP address by running the default-ip-address command. The value is a bool type.
addr_type: ${8|ipv4|} # not required. choices: ipv4. Specifies the peer IP address type.
state: ${9|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.

ce_bfd_view.description: Manages BFD session view configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_bfd_view:
session_name: ${1:null} # required. Specifies the name of a BFD session. The value is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters without spaces.
remote_discr: ${2:null} # not required. Specifies the remote discriminator of a BFD session. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 4294967295.
min_rx_interval: ${3:null} # not required. Specifies the minimum interval for sending BFD packets. The value is an integer that ranges from 50 to 1000, in milliseconds.
description: ${4:null} # not required. Specifies the description of a BFD session. The value is a string of 1 to 51 case-sensitive characters with spaces.
detect_multi: ${5:null} # not required. Specifies the local detection multiplier of a BFD session. The value is an integer that ranges from 3 to 50.
tos_exp: ${6:null} # not required. Specifies a priority for BFD control packets. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7. The default value is 7, which is the highest priority.
min_tx_interval: ${7:null} # not required. Specifies the minimum interval for receiving BFD packets. The value is an integer that ranges from 50 to 1000, in milliseconds.
wtr_interval: ${8:null} # not required. Specifies the WTR time of a BFD session. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 60, in minutes. The default value is 0.
local_discr: ${9:null} # not required. Specifies the local discriminator of a BFD session. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 16384.
state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
admin_down: ${11:false} # not required. Enables the BFD session to enter the AdminDown state. By default, a BFD session is enabled. The default value is bool type.

ce_bgp.description: Manages BGP configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_bgp:

keepalive_time: ${1:null} # not required. If the value of a timer changes, the BGP peer relationship between the routers is disconnected. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 21845. The default value is 60.
time_wait_for_rib: ${2:null} # not required. Period of waiting for the End-Of-RIB flag. The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 3000. The default value is 600.

keep_all_routes: ${3|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the system stores all route update messages received from all peers (groups) after BGP connection setup. If the value is false, the system stores only BGP update messages that are received from peers and pass the configured import policy.
confed_peer_as_num: ${4:null} # not required. Confederation AS number, in two-byte or four-byte format. The value is a string of 1 to 11 characters.
gr_peer_reset: ${5|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Peer disconnection through GR.
suppress_interval: ${6:null} # not required. Suppress interval.
router_id: ${7:null} # not required. ID of a router that is in IPv4 address format.
clear_interval: ${8:null} # not required. Clear interval.

ebgp_if_sensitive: ${9|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, After the fast EBGP interface awareness function is enabled, EBGP sessions on an interface are deleted immediately when the interface goes Down. If the value is  false, After the fast EBGP interface awareness function is enabled, EBGP sessions on an interface are not deleted immediately when the interface goes Down.
memory_limit: ${10|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Support BGP RIB memory protection.
bgp_rid_auto_sel: ${11|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. The function to automatically select router IDs for all VPN BGP instances is enabled.
hold_interval: ${12:null} # not required. Hold interval.
default_af_type: ${13|ipv4uni,ipv6uni|} # not required. choices: ipv4uni;ipv6uni. Type of a created address family, which can be IPv4 unicast or IPv6 unicast. The default type is IPv4 unicast.
confed_nonstanded: ${14|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Configure the device to be compatible with devices in a nonstandard confederation.
is_shutdown: ${15|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Interrupt BGP all neighbor.
graceful_restart: ${16|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Enable GR of the BGP speaker in the specified address family, peer address, or peer group.
min_hold_time: ${17:null} # not required. Min hold time, in seconds. The value of the hold time can be 0 or range from 20 to 65535.
as_path_limit: ${18:null} # not required. Maximum number of AS numbers in the AS_Path attribute. The default value is 255.
vrf_name: ${19:null} # not required. Name of a BGP instance. The name is a case-sensitive string of characters.
check_first_as: ${20|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Check the first AS in the AS_Path of the update messages from EBGP peers.

vrf_rid_auto_sel: ${21|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, VPN BGP instances are enabled to automatically select router IDs. If the value is false, VPN BGP instances are disabled from automatically selecting router IDs.
hold_time: ${22:null} # not required. Hold time, in seconds. The value of the hold time can be 0 or range from 3 to 65535.
as_number: ${23:null} # not required. Local AS number. The value is a string of 1 to 11 characters.
state: ${24|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.
confed_id_number: ${25:null} # not required. Confederation ID. The value is a string of 1 to 11 characters.
conn_retry_time: ${26:null} # not required. ConnectRetry interval. The value is an integer, in seconds. The default value is 32s.

ce_bgp_af.description: Manages BGP Address-family configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_bgp_af:
af_type: ${1|ipv4uni,ipv4multi,ipv4vpn,ipv6uni,ipv6vpn,evpn|} # required. choices: ipv4uni;ipv4multi;ipv4vpn;ipv6uni;ipv6vpn;evpn. Address family type of a BGP instance.

vrf_name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of a BGP instance. The name is a case-sensitive string of characters. The BGP instance can be used only after the corresponding VPN instance is created. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters.

allow_invalid_as: ${3|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Allow routes with BGP origin AS validation result Invalid to be selected. If the value is true, invalid routes can participate in route selection. If the value is false, invalid routes cannot participate in route selection.
originator_prior: ${4|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Originator prior.

rib_only_enable: ${5|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, BGP routes cannot be advertised to the IP routing table. If the value is false, Routes preferred by BGP are advertised to the IP routing table.
preference_external: ${6:null} # not required. Set the protocol priority of EBGP routes. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.
default_local_pref: ${7:null} # not required. Set the Local-Preference attribute. The value is an integer. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.
reflector_cluster_ipv4: ${8:null} # not required. Set a cluster ipv4 address. The value is expressed in the format of an IPv4 address.

supernet_uni_adv: ${9|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the function to advertise supernetwork unicast routes is enabled. If the value is false, the function to advertise supernetwork unicast routes is disabled.
next_hop_sel_depend_type: ${10|default,dependTunnel,dependIp|} # not required. choices: default;dependTunnel;dependIp. Next hop select depend type.

reflect_chg_path: ${11|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the route reflector is enabled to modify route path attributes based on an export policy. If the value is false, the route reflector is disabled from modifying route path attributes based on an export policy.
router_id: ${12:null} # not required. ID of a router that is in IPv4 address format. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters. The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ebgp_if_sensitive: ${13|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, after the fast EBGP interface awareness function is enabled, EBGP sessions on an interface are deleted immediately when the interface goes Down. If the value is false, after the fast EBGP interface awareness function is enabled, EBGP sessions on an interface are not deleted immediately when the interface goes Down.

igp_metric_ignore: ${14|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the metrics of next-hop IGP routes are not compared when BGP selects an optimal route. If the value is false, the metrics of next-hop IGP routes are not compared when BGP selects an optimal route. A route with a smaller metric has a higher priority.
load_balancing_as_path_ignore: ${15|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Load balancing as path ignore.

prefrence_policy_name: ${16:null} # not required. Set a routing policy to filter routes so that a configured priority is applied to the routes that match the specified policy. The value is a string of 1 to 40 characters.

supernet_label_adv: ${17|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the function to advertise supernetwork label is enabled. If the value is false, the function to advertise supernetwork label is disabled.

ecmp_nexthop_changed: ${18|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the next hop of an advertised route is changed to the advertiser itself in BGP load-balancing scenarios. If the value is false, the next hop of an advertised route is not changed to the advertiser itself in BGP load-balancing scenarios.
max_load_ibgp_num: ${19:null} # not required. Specify the maximum number of equal-cost IBGP routes. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.

reflect_between_client: ${20|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, route reflection is enabled between clients. If the value is false, route reflection is disabled between clients.

always_compare_med: ${21|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the MEDs of routes learned from peers in different autonomous systems are compared when BGP selects an optimal route. If the value is false, the MEDs of routes learned from peers in different autonomous systems are not compared when BGP selects an optimal route.
determin_med: ${22|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, BGP deterministic-MED is enabled. If the value is false, BGP deterministic-MED is disabled.

policy_ext_comm_enable: ${23|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, modifying extended community attributes is allowed. If the value is false, modifying extended community attributes is not allowed.
rr_filter_number: ${24:null} # not required. Set the number of the extended community filter supported by an RR group. The value is a string of 1 to 51 characters.
maximum_load_balance: ${25:null} # not required. Specify the maximum number of equal-cost routes in the BGP routing table. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.

policy_vpn_target: ${26|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, VPN-Target filtering function is performed for received VPN routes. If the value is false, VPN-Target filtering function is not performed for received VPN routes.

active_route_advertise: ${27|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, BGP is enabled to advertise only optimal routes in the RM to peers. If the value is false, BGP is not enabled to advertise only optimal routes in the RM to peers.

med_none_as_maximum: ${28|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, when BGP selects an optimal route, the system uses 4294967295 as the MED value of a route if the route's attribute does not carry a MED value. If the value is false, the system uses 0 as the MED value of a route if the route's attribute does not carry a MED value.

ibgp_ecmp_nexthop_changed: ${29|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the next hop of an advertised route is changed to the advertiser itself in IBGP load-balancing scenarios. If the value is false, the next hop of an advertised route is not changed to the advertiser itself in IBGP load-balancing scenarios.
import_process_id: ${30:null} # not required. Process ID of an imported routing protocol. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.
state: ${31|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.

reflector_cluster_id: ${32:null} # not required. Set a cluster ID. Configuring multiple RRs in a cluster can enhance the stability of the network. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.
rib_only_policy_name: ${33:null} # not required. Specify the name of a routing policy. The value is a string of 1 to 40 characters.
preference_local: ${34:null} # not required. Set the protocol priority of a local BGP route. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.
network_address: ${35:null} # not required. Specify the IP address advertised by BGP. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters.
relay_delay_enable: ${36|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, relay delay enable. If the value is false, relay delay disable.
route_sel_delay: ${37:null} # not required. Route selection delay. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 3600.

as_path_neglect: ${38|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the AS path attribute is ignored when BGP selects an optimal route. If the value is false, the AS path attribute is not ignored when BGP selects an optimal route. An AS path with a smaller length has a higher priority.
mask_len: ${39:null} # not required. Specify the mask length of an IP address. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 128.

ebgp_ecmp_nexthop_changed: ${40|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the next hop of an advertised route is changed to the advertiser itself in EBGP load-balancing scenarios. If the value is false, the next hop of an advertised route is not changed to the advertiser itself in EBGP load-balancing scenarios.

router_id_neglect: ${41|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the router ID attribute is ignored when BGP selects the optimal route. If the value is false, the router ID attribute is not ignored when BGP selects the optimal route.
add_path_sel_num: ${42:null} # not required. Number of Add-Path routes. The value is an integer ranging from 2 to 64.

default_rt_import_enable: ${43|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, importing default routes to the BGP routing table is allowed. If the value is false, importing default routes to the BGP routing table is not allowed.

summary_automatic: ${44|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, automatic aggregation is enabled for locally imported routes. If the value is false, automatic aggregation is disabled for locally imported routes.
preference_internal: ${45:null} # not required. Set the protocol priority of IBGP routes. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.
nhp_relay_route_policy_name: ${46:null} # not required. Specify the name of a route-policy for route iteration. The value is a string of 1 to 40 characters.

vrf_rid_auto_sel: ${47|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, VPN BGP instances are enabled to automatically select router IDs. If the value is false, VPN BGP instances are disabled from automatically selecting router IDs.
max_load_ebgp_num: ${48:null} # not required. Specify the maximum number of equal-cost EBGP routes. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.

nexthop_third_party: ${49|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the third-party next hop function is enabled. If the value is false, the third-party next hop function is disabled.
auto_frr_enable: ${50|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, BGP auto FRR is enabled. If the value is false, BGP auto FRR is disabled.

lowest_priority: ${51|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, enable reduce priority to advertise route. If the value is false, disable reduce priority to advertise route.
import_protocol: ${52|direct,ospf,isis,static,rip,ospfv3,ripng|} # not required. choices: direct;ospf;isis;static;rip;ospfv3;ripng. Routing protocol from which routes can be imported.
default_med: ${53:null} # not required. Specify the Multi-Exit-Discriminator (MED) of BGP routes. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.
ingress_lsp_policy_name: ${54:null} # not required. Ingress lsp policy name.

ce_bgp_neighbor.description: Manages BGP peer configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_bgp_neighbor:
vrf_name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of a BGP instance. The name is a case-sensitive string of characters. The BGP instance can be used only after the corresponding VPN instance is created.
remote_as: ${2:undefined} # required. AS number of a peer. The value is a string of 1 to 11 characters.
peer_addr: ${3:undefined} # required. Connection address of a peer, which can be an IPv4 or IPv6 address.
rx_interval: ${4:null} # not required. Specify the minimum interval at which BFD packets are received. The value is an integer ranging from 50 to 1000, in milliseconds.

dual_as: ${5|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the EBGP peer can use either a fake AS number or the actual AS number. If the value is false, the EBGP peer can only use a fake AS number.
key_chain_name: ${6:null} # not required. Specify the Keychain authentication name used when BGP peers establish a TCP connection. The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-insensitive characters.

is_bfd_block: ${7|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, peers are enabled to inherit the BFD function from the peer group. If the value is false, peers are disabled to inherit the BFD function from the peer group.
pswd_cipher_text: ${8:null} # not required. The character string in a password identifies the contents of the password, spaces not supported. The value is a string of 1 to 255 characters.
ebgp_max_hop: ${9:null} # not required. Maximum number of hops in an indirect EBGP connection. The value is an ranging from 1 to 255.
connect_mode: ${10:null} # not required. The value can be Connect-only, Listen-only, or Both.

route_refresh: ${11|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, BGP is enabled to advertise REFRESH packets. If the value is false, the route refresh function is enabled.
min_hold_time: ${12:null} # not required. Specify the Min hold time of a peer or peer group.

conventional: ${13|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the router has all extended capabilities. If the value is false, the router does not have all extended capabilities.
multiplier: ${14:null} # not required. Specify the detection multiplier. The default value is 3. The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 50.

pswd_type: ${15|null,cipher,simple|} # not required. choices: null;cipher;simple. Enable BGP peers to establish a TCP connection and perform the Message Digest 5 (MD5) authentication for BGP messages.
hold_time: ${16:null} # not required. Specify the Hold time of a peer or peer group. The value is 0 or an integer ranging from 3 to 65535.
is_bfd_enable: ${17|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, BFD is enabled. If the value is false, BFD is disabled.

valid_ttl_hops: ${18:null} # not required. Enable GTSM on a peer or peer group. The valid-TTL-Value parameter is used to specify the number of TTL hops to be detected. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.
state: ${19|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.
keep_alive_time: ${20:null} # not required. Specify the Keepalive time of a peer or peer group. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 21845. The default value is 60.

is_single_hop: ${21|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the system is enabled to preferentially use the single-hop mode for BFD session setup between IBGP peers. If the value is false, the system is disabled from preferentially using the single-hop mode for BFD session setup between IBGP peers.

is_ignore: ${22|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the session with a specified peer is torn down and all related routing entries are cleared. If the value is false, the session with a specified peer is retained.
tcp_MSS: ${23:null} # not required. Maximum TCP MSS value used for TCP connection establishment for a peer. The value is an integer ranging from 176 to 4096.

is_log_change: ${24|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, BGP is enabled to record peer session status and event information. If the value is false, BGP is disabled from recording peer session status and event information.
description: ${25:null} # not required. Description of a peer, which can be letters or digits. The value is a string of 1 to 80 characters.
local_if_name: ${26:null} # not required. Name of a source interface that sends BGP packets. The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.
prepend_fake_as: ${27|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Add the Fake AS number to received Update packets.

mpls_local_ifnet_disable: ${28|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, peer create MPLS Local IFNET disable. If the value is false, peer create MPLS Local IFNET enable.
prepend_global_as: ${29|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Add the global AS number to the Update packets to be advertised.
fake_as: ${30:null} # not required. Fake AS number that is specified for a local peer. The value is a string of 1 to 11 characters.
tx_interval: ${31:null} # not required. Specify the minimum interval at which BFD packets are sent. The value is an integer ranging from 50 to 1000, in milliseconds.
conn_retry_time: ${32:null} # not required. ConnectRetry interval. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.

ce_bgp_neighbor_af.description: Manages BGP neighbor Address-family configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_bgp_neighbor_af:
vrf_name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of a BGP instance. The name is a case-sensitive string of characters. The BGP instance can be used only after the corresponding VPN instance is created.
af_type: ${2|ipv4uni,ipv4multi,ipv4vpn,ipv6uni,ipv6vpn,evpn|} # required. choices: ipv4uni;ipv4multi;ipv4vpn;ipv6uni;ipv6vpn;evpn. Address family type of a BGP instance.
remote_address: ${3:undefined} # required. IPv4 or IPv6 peer connection address.

keep_all_routes: ${4|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the system stores all route update messages received from all peers (groups) after BGP connection setup. If the value is false, the system stores only BGP update messages that are received from peers and pass the configured import policy.
export_as_path_name_or_num: ${5:null} # not required. Application of a AS path list based filtering policy to the routing of a specified peer.
preferred_value: ${6:null} # not required. Assign a preferred value for the routes learned from a specified peer. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.

default_rt_adv_enable: ${7|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the function to advertise default routes to peers is enabled. If the value is false, the function to advertise default routes to peers is disabled.

discard_ext_community: ${8|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the extended community attribute in the peer route information is discarded. If the value is false, the extended community attribute in the peer route information is not discarded.
orftype: ${9:null} # not required. ORF Type. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.
import_as_path_filter: ${10:null} # not required. Apply an AS_Path-based filtering policy to the routes received from a specified peer. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 256.

is_nonstd_ipprefix_mod: ${11|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, Non-standard capability codes are used during capability negotiation. If the value is false, RFC-defined standard ORF capability codes are used during capability negotiation.
import_rt_policy_name: ${12:null} # not required. Specify the filtering policy applied to the routes learned from a peer. The value is a string of 1 to 40 characters.
rt_updt_interval: ${13:null} # not required. Specify the minimum interval at which Update packets are sent. The value is an integer, in seconds. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 600.
redirect_ip: ${14|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Redirect ip.

advertise_community: ${15|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the community attribute is advertised to peers. If the value is false, the community attribute is not advertised to peers.

substitute_as_enable: ${16|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the function to replace a specified peer's AS number in the AS-Path attribute with the local AS number is enabled. If the value is false, the function to replace a specified peer's AS number in the AS-Path attribute with the local AS number is disabled.

advertise_remote_nexthop: ${17|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the remote next-hop attribute is advertised to peers. If the value is false, the remote next-hop attribute is not advertised to any peers.
export_acl_name_or_num: ${18:null} # not required. Apply an IPv4 ACL-based filtering policy to the routes to be advertised to a specified peer. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
public_as_only_skip_peer_as: ${19|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Public as only skip peer as.

allow_as_loop_enable: ${20|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, repetitive local AS numbers are allowed. If the value is false, repetitive local AS numbers are not allowed.
export_as_path_filter: ${21:null} # not required. Apply an AS_Path-based filtering policy to the routes to be advertised to a specified peer. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 256.
redirect_ip_vaildation: ${22|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Redirect ip vaildation.

orf_mode: ${23|null,receive,send,both|} # not required. choices: null;receive;send;both. ORF mode. null, Default value. receive, ORF for incoming packets. send, ORF for outgoing packets. both, ORF for incoming and outgoing packets.

public_as_only_force: ${24|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, sent BGP update messages carry only the public AS number but do not carry private AS numbers. If the value is false, sent BGP update messages can carry private AS numbers.
import_pref_filt_name: ${25:null} # not required. Specify the IPv4 filtering policy applied to the routes received from a specified peer. The value is a string of 1 to 169 characters.
soostring: ${26:null} # not required. Configure the Site-of-Origin (SoO) extended community attribute. The value is a string of 3 to 21 characters.

public_as_only: ${27|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, sent BGP update messages carry only the public AS number but do not carry private AS numbers. If the value is false, sent BGP update messages can carry private AS numbers.
public_as_only_limited: ${28|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Limited use public as number.

advertise_arp: ${29|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, advertised ARP routes are distinguished. If the value is false, advertised ARP routes are not distinguished.

origin_as_valid: ${30|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, Application results of route announcement. If the value is false, Routing application results are not notified.

route_limit_idle_timeout: ${31:null} # not required. Specify the value of the idle-timeout timer to automatically reestablish the connections after they are cut off when the number of routes exceeds the set threshold. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 1200.

reflect_client: ${32|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the local device functions as the route reflector and a peer functions as a client of the route reflector. If the value is false, the route reflector and client functions are not configured.

advertise_irb: ${33|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, advertised IRB routes are distinguished. If the value is false, advertised IRB routes are not distinguished.
route_limit: ${34:null} # not required. Configure the maximum number of routes that can be accepted from a peer. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.
default_rt_adv_policy: ${35:null} # not required. Specify the name of a used policy. The value is a string. The value is a string of 1 to 40 characters.
adv_add_path_num: ${36:null} # not required. The number of addPath advertise route. The value is an integer ranging from 2 to 64.

ipprefix_orf_enable: ${37|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the address prefix-based Outbound Route Filter (ORF) capability is enabled for peers. If the value is false, the address prefix-based Outbound Route Filter (ORF) capability is disabled for peers.
import_acl_name_or_num: ${38:null} # not required. Apply an IPv4 ACL-based filtering policy to the routes received from a specified peer. The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters.
allow_as_loop_limit: ${39:null} # not required. Set the maximum number of repetitive local AS number. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10.
export_pref_filt_name: ${40:null} # not required. Specify the IPv4 filtering policy applied to the routes to be advertised to a specified peer. The value is a string of 1 to 169 characters.
public_as_only_replace: ${41|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Private as replaced by public as number.

advertise_ext_community: ${42|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, the extended community attribute is advertised to peers. If the value is false, the extended community attribute is not advertised to peers.

route_limit_type: ${43|noparameter,alertOnly,idleForever,idleTimeout|} # not required. choices: noparameter;alertOnly;idleForever;idleTimeout. Noparameter, After the number of received routes exceeds the threshold and the timeout timer expires,no action. AlertOnly, An alarm is generated and no additional routes will be accepted if the maximum number of routes allowed have been received. IdleForever, The connection that is interrupted is not automatically re-established if the maximum number of routes allowed have been received. IdleTimeout, After the number of received routes exceeds the threshold and the timeout timer expires, the connection that is interrupted is automatically re-established.
route_limit_percent: ${44:null} # not required. Specify the percentage of routes when a router starts to generate an alarm. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 100.

default_rt_match_mode: ${45|null,matchall,matchany|} # not required. choices: null;matchall;matchany. null, Null. matchall, Advertise the default route if all matching conditions are met. matchany, Advertise the default route if any matching condition is met.

nexthop_configure: ${46|null,local,invariable|} # not required. choices: null;local;invariable. null, The next hop is not changed. local, The next hop is changed to the local IP address. invariable, Prevent the device from changing the next hop of each imported IGP route when advertising it to its BGP peers.
export_rt_policy_name: ${47:null} # not required. Specify the filtering policy applied to the routes to be advertised to a peer. The value is a string of 1 to 40 characters.
import_as_path_name_or_num: ${48:null} # not required. A routing strategy based on the AS path list for routing received by a designated peer.

update_pkt_standard_compatible: ${49|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, When the vpnv4 multicast neighbor receives and updates the message, the message has no label. If the value is false, When the vpnv4 multicast neighbor receives and updates the message, the message has label.
vpls_enable: ${50|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, vpls enable. If the value is false, vpls disable.

add_path_mode: ${51|null,receive,send,both|} # not required. choices: null;receive;send;both. null, Null. receive, Support receiving Add-Path routes. send, Support sending Add-Path routes. both, Support receiving and sending Add-Path routes.
vpls_ad_disable: ${52|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. If the value is true, enable vpls-ad. If the value is false, disable vpls-ad.

ce_command.description: Run arbitrary command on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_command:

commands: ${1:undefined} # required. The commands to send to the remote HUAWEI CloudEngine device over the configured provider.  The resulting output from the command is returned. If the I(wait_for) argument is provided, the module is not returned until the condition is satisfied or the number of I(retries) has been exceeded.

interval: ${2:1} # not required. Configures the interval in seconds to wait between retries of the command.  If the command does not pass the specified conditional, the interval indicates how to long to wait before trying the command again.

retries: ${3:10} # not required. Specifies the number of retries a command should by tried before it is considered failed.  The command is run on the target device every retry and evaluated against the I(wait_for) conditionals.

match: ${4:all} # not required. The I(match) argument is used in conjunction with the I(wait_for) argument to specify the match policy.  Valid values are C(all) or C(any).  If the value is set to C(all) then all conditionals in the I(wait_for) must be satisfied.  If the value is set to C(any) then only one of the values must be satisfied.

wait_for: ${5:null} # not required. Specifies what to evaluate from the output of the command and what conditionals to apply.  This argument will cause the task to wait for a particular conditional to be true before moving forward.   If the conditional is not true by the configured retries, the task fails.  See examples.
ce_config:

defaults: ${1:false} # not required. The I(defaults) argument will influence how the current-configuration is collected from the device.  When the value is set to true, the command used to collect the current-configuration is append with the all keyword.  When the value is set to false, the command is issued without the all keyword.

save: ${2:false} # not required. The C(save) argument instructs the module to save the current-configuration to saved-configuration.  This operation is performed after any changes are made to the current running config.  If no changes are made, the configuration is still saved to the startup config.  This option will always cause the module to return changed.

backup: ${3:false} # not required. This argument will cause the module to create a full backup of the current C(current-configuration) from the remote device before any changes are made.  The backup file is written to the C(backup) folder in the playbook root directory.  If the directory does not exist, it is created.

replace: ${4|line,block|} # not required. choices: line;block. Instructs the module on the way to perform the configuration on the device.  If the replace argument is set to I(line) then the modified lines are pushed to the device in configuration mode.  If the replace argument is set to I(block) then the entire command block is pushed to the device in configuration mode if any line is not correct.

src: ${5:null} # not required. The I(src) argument provides a path to the configuration file to load into the remote system.  The path can either be a full system path to the configuration file if the value starts with / or relative to the root of the implemented role or playbook. This argument is mutually exclusive with the I(lines) and I(parents) arguments.

match: ${6|line,strict,exact,none|} # not required. choices: line;strict;exact;none. Instructs the module on the way to perform the matching of the set of commands against the current device config.  If match is set to I(line), commands are matched line by line.  If match is set to I(strict), command lines are matched with respect to position.  If match is set to I(exact), command lines must be an equal match.  Finally, if match is set to I(none), the module will not attempt to compare the source configuration with the current-configuration on the remote device.

after: ${7:null} # not required. The ordered set of commands to append to the end of the command stack if a change needs to be made.  Just like with I(before) this allows the playbook designer to append a set of commands to be executed after the command set.

config: ${8:null} # not required. The module, by default, will connect to the remote device and retrieve the current current-configuration to use as a base for comparing against the contents of source.  There are times when it is not desirable to have the task get the current-configuration for every task in a playbook.  The I(config) argument allows the implementer to pass in the configuration to use as the base config for comparison.

before: ${9:null} # not required. The ordered set of commands to push on to the command stack if a change needs to be made.  This allows the playbook designer the opportunity to perform configuration commands prior to pushing any changes without affecting how the set of commands are matched against the system.

lines: ${10:null} # not required. The ordered set of commands that should be configured in the section.  The commands must be the exact same commands as found in the device current-configuration.  Be sure to note the configuration command syntax as some commands are automatically modified by the device config parser.

parents: ${11:null} # not required. The ordered set of parents that uniquely identify the section or hierarchy the commands should be checked against.  If the parents argument is omitted, the commands are checked against the set of top level or global commands.

ce_dldp.description: Manages global DLDP configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_dldp:
reset: ${1|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Specify whether reset DLDP state of disabled interfaces.

auth_pwd: ${2:null} # not required. Specifies authentication password. The value is a string of 1 to 16 case-sensitive plaintexts or 24/32/48/108/128 case-sensitive encrypted characters. The string excludes a question mark (?).
work_mode: ${3|enhance,normal|} # not required. choices: enhance;normal. Set global DLDP work-mode.

time_internal: ${4:null} # not required. Specifies the interval for sending Advertisement packets. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 100, in seconds. The default interval for sending Advertisement packets is 5 seconds.
enable: ${5|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Set global DLDP enable state.
auth_mode: ${6|md5,simple,sha,hmac-sha256,none|} # not required. choices: md5;simple;sha;hmac-sha256;none. Specifies authentication algorithm of DLDP.

ce_dldp_interface.description: Manages interface DLDP configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_dldp_interface:
interface: ${1:undefined} # required. Must be fully qualified interface name, i.e. GE1/0/1, 10GE1/0/1, 40GE1/0/22, 100GE1/0/1.
reset: ${2|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Specify whether reseting interface DLDP state.
local_mac: ${3:null} # not required. Set the source MAC address for DLDP packets sent in the DLDP-compatible mode. The value of MAC address is in H-H-H format. H contains 1 to 4 hexadecimal digits.
enable: ${4|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Set interface DLDP enable state.
