mode_enable: ${5|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Set DLDP compatible-mode enable state.
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.

ce_eth_trunk.description: Manages Eth-Trunk interfaces on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_eth_trunk:

trunk_id: ${1:undefined} # required. Eth-Trunk interface number. The value is an integer. The value range depends on the assign forward eth-trunk mode command. When 256 is specified, the value ranges from 0 to 255. When 512 is specified, the value ranges from 0 to 511. When 1024 is specified, the value ranges from 0 to 1023.

min_links: ${2:null} # not required. Specifies the minimum number of Eth-Trunk member links in the Up state. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to the maximum number of interfaces that can be added to a Eth-Trunk interface.
mode: ${3|manual,lacp-dynamic,lacp-static|} # not required. choices: manual;lacp-dynamic;lacp-static. Specifies the working mode of an Eth-Trunk interface.
members: ${4:null} # not required. List of interfaces that will be managed in a given Eth-Trunk. The interface name must be full name.
force: ${5:false} # not required. When true it forces Eth-Trunk members to match what is declared in the members param. This can be used to remove members.
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.

hash_type: ${7|src-dst-ip,src-dst-mac,enhanced,dst-ip,dst-mac,src-ip,src-mac|} # not required. choices: src-dst-ip;src-dst-mac;enhanced;dst-ip;dst-mac;src-ip;src-mac. Hash algorithm used for load balancing among Eth-Trunk member interfaces.

ce_evpn_bd_vni.description: Manages EVPN VXLAN Network Identifier (VNI) on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_evpn_bd_vni:
bridge_domain_id: ${1:undefined} # required. Specify an existed bridge domain (BD).The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.
vpn_target_import: ${2:undefined} # required. Add VPN targets to the import VPN target list of a BD EVPN instance. The format is the same as route_distinguisher.

route_distinguisher: ${3:null} # not required. Configures a route distinguisher (RD) for a BD EVPN instance. The format of an RD can be as follows,1) 2-byte AS number:4-byte user-defined number, for example, 1:3. An AS number is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535, and a user-defined number is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295. The AS and user-defined numbers cannot be both 0s. This means that an RD cannot be 0:0.,2) Integral 4-byte AS number:2-byte user-defined number, for example, 65537:3. An AS number is an integer ranging from 65536 to 4294967295, and a user-defined number is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.,3) 4-byte AS number in dotted notation:2-byte user-defined number, for example, 0.0:3 or 0.1:0. A 4-byte AS number in dotted notation is in the format of x.y, where x and y are integers ranging from 0 to 65535.,4) A user-defined number is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535. The AS and user-defined numbers cannot be both 0s. This means that an RD cannot be 0.0:0.,5) 32-bit IP address:2-byte user-defined number. For example, 192.168.122.15:1. An IP address ranges from 0.0.0.0 to 255.255.255.255, and a user-defined number is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535.,6) 'auto' specifies the RD that is automatically generated.
evpn: ${4|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Create or delete an EVPN instance for a VXLAN in BD view.
state: ${5|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.
vpn_target_export: ${6:null} # not required. Add VPN targets to the export VPN target list of a BD EVPN instance. The format is the same as route_distinguisher.
vpn_target_both: ${7:null} # not required. Add VPN targets to both the import and export VPN target lists of a BD EVPN instance. The format is the same as route_distinguisher.

ce_evpn_bgp.description: Manages BGP EVPN configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_evpn_bgp:
bgp_instance: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of a BGP instance. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.
peer_enable: ${2|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Enable or disable a BGP device to exchange routes with a specified peer or peer group in the address family view.
peer_address: ${3:null} # not required. Specifies the IPv4 address of a BGP EVPN peer. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
vpn_name: ${4:null} # not required. Associates a specified VPN instance with the IPv4 address family. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.
peer_group_name: ${5:null} # not required. Specify the name of a peer group that BGP peers need to join. The value is a string of 1 to 47 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.
advertise_l2vpn_evpn: ${6|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Enable or disable a device to advertise IP routes imported to a VPN instance to its EVPN instance.
as_number: ${7:null} # not required. Specifies integral AS number. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.
advertise_router_type: ${9|arp,irb|} # not required. choices: arp;irb. Configures a device to advertise routes to its BGP EVPN peers.

ce_evpn_bgp_rr.description: Manages RR for the VXLAN Network on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_evpn_bgp_rr:
as_number: ${1:null} # required. Specifies the number of the AS, in integer format. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 4294967295.
reflect_client: ${2|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Configure the local device as the route reflector and the peer or peer group as the client of the route reflector.
peer_type: ${3|group_name,ipv4_address|} # not required. choices: group_name;ipv4_address. Specify the peer type.
bgp_evpn_enable: ${4|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Enable or disable the BGP-EVPN address family.
policy_vpn_target: ${5|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Enable or disable the VPN-Target filtering.
bgp_instance: ${6:null} # not required. Specifies the name of a BGP instance. The value of instance-name can be an integer 1 or a string of 1 to 31.
peer: ${7:null} # not required. Specifies the IPv4 address or the group name of a peer.

ce_evpn_global.description: Manages global configuration of EVPN on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_evpn_global:
evpn_overlay_enable: ${1|enable,disable|} # required. choices: enable;disable. Configure EVPN as the VXLAN control plane.

ce_facts.description: Gets facts about HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_facts:

gather_subset: ${1:!config} # not required. When supplied, this argument will restrict the facts collected to a given subset.  Possible values for this argument include all, hardware, config, and interfaces.  Can specify a list of values to include a larger subset.  Values can also be used with an initial C(M(!)) to specify that a specific subset should not be collected.

ce_file_copy.description: Copy a file to a remote cloudengine device over SCP on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_file_copy:
local_file: ${1:undefined} # required. Path to local file. Local directory must exist. The maximum length of I(local_file) is C(4096).

file_system: ${2:flash:} # not required. The remote file system of the device. If omitted, devices that support a I(file_system) parameter will use their default values. File system indicates the storage medium and can be set to as follows, 1) C(flash) is root directory of the flash memory on the master MPU. 2) C(slave#flash) is root directory of the flash memory on the slave MPU. If no slave MPU exists, this drive is unavailable. 3) C(chassis ID/slot number#flash) is root directory of the flash memory on a device in a stack. For example, C(1/5#flash) indicates the flash memory whose chassis ID is 1 and slot number is 5.

remote_file: ${3:null} # not required. Remote file path of the copy. Remote directories must exist. If omitted, the name of the local file will be used. The maximum length of I(remote_file) is C(4096).

ce_info_center_debug.description: Manages information center debug configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_info_center_debug:
debug_enable: ${1|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Whether a device is enabled to output debugging information.
channel_id: ${2:null} # not required. Number of a channel. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 9. The default value is 0.

debug_time_stamp: ${3|date_boot,date_second,date_tenthsecond,date_millisecond,shortdate_second,shortdate_tenthsecond,shortdate_millisecond,formatdate_second,formatdate_tenthsecond,formatdate_millisecond|} # not required. choices: date_boot;date_second;date_tenthsecond;date_millisecond;shortdate_second;shortdate_tenthsecond;shortdate_millisecond;formatdate_second;formatdate_tenthsecond;formatdate_millisecond. Timestamp type of debugging information.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.

module_name: ${5:null} # not required. Module name of the rule. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-insensitive characters. The default value is default. Please use lower-case letter, such as [aaa, acl, arp, bfd].

debug_level: ${6|emergencies,alert,critical,error,warning,notification,informational,debugging|} # not required. choices: emergencies;alert;critical;error;warning;notification;informational;debugging. Debug level permitted to output.

ce_info_center_global.description: Manages outputting logs on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_info_center_global:
info_center_enable: ${1|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Whether the info-center function is enabled. The value is of the Boolean type.
source_ip: ${2:null} # not required. Log source ip address, IPv4 or IPv6 type. The value is a string of 0 to 255. The value can be an valid IPv4 or IPv6 address.

logfile_max_num: ${3:null} # not required. Maximum number of log files of the same type. The default value is 200.,The value range for log files is[3, 500], for security files is [1, 3],and for operation files is [1, 7].
transport_mode: ${4|tcp,udp|} # not required. choices: tcp;udp. Transport mode. The value is of the enumerated type and case-sensitive.
timestamp: ${5|UTC,localtime|} # not required. choices: UTC;localtime. Log server timestamp. The value is of the enumerated type and case-sensitive.

server_port: ${6:null} # not required. Number of a port sending logs.The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535. For UDP, the default value is 514. For TCP, the default value is 601. For TSL, the default value is 6514.
packet_priority: ${7:null} # not required. Set the priority of the syslog packet.The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7. The default value is 0.

level: ${8|emergencies,alert,critical,error,warning,notification,informational,debugging|} # not required. choices: emergencies;alert;critical;error;warning;notification;informational;debugging. Level of logs saved on a log server.
suppress_enable: ${9|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Whether a device is enabled to suppress duplicate statistics. The value is of the Boolean type.
server_domain: ${10:null} # not required. Server name. The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters.
facility: ${11|local0,local1,local2,local3,local4,local5,local6,local7|} # not required. choices: local0;local1;local2;local3;local4;local5;local6;local7. Log record tool.
channel_cfg_name: ${12:console} # not required. Channel name.The value is a string of 1 to 30 case-sensitive characters. The default value is console.
filter_log_name: ${13:null} # not required. Name of the filtered log. The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters.
ip_type: ${14|ipv4,ipv6|} # not required. choices: ipv4;ipv6. Log server address type, IPv4 or IPv6.
ssl_policy_name: ${15:null} # not required. SSL policy name. The value is a string of 1 to 23 case-sensitive characters.
channel_out_direct: ${16|console,monitor,trapbuffer,logbuffer,snmp,logfile|} # not required. choices: console;monitor;trapbuffer;logbuffer;snmp;logfile. Direction of information output.
vrf_name: ${17:null} # not required. VPN name on a log server. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. The default value is _public_.
is_default_vpn: ${18:false} # not required. Use the default VPN or not.
channel_name: ${19:null} # not required. Channel name. The value is a string of 1 to 30 case-sensitive characters.
filter_feature_name: ${20:null} # not required. Feature name of the filtered log. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-insensitive characters.

logfile_max_size: ${21|4,8,16,32|} # not required. choices: 4;8;16;32. Maximum size (in MB) of a log file. The default value is 32.,The value range for log files is [4, 8, 16, 32], for security files is [1, 4],,and for operation files is [1, 4].
channel_id: ${22:null} # not required. Number for channel. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 9. The default value is 0.
server_ip: ${23:null} # not required. Log server address, IPv4 or IPv6 type. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters. The value can be an valid IPv4 or IPv6 address.
state: ${24|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.

ce_info_center_log.description: Manages information center log configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_info_center_log:

log_level: ${1|emergencies,alert,critical,error,warning,notification,informational,debugging|} # not required. choices: emergencies;alert;critical;error;warning;notification;informational;debugging. Specifies a log severity.
log_buff_size: ${2:null} # not required. Specifies the maximum number of logs in the log buffer. The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 10240. If logbuffer-size is 0, logs are not displayed.
module_name: ${3:null} # not required. Specifies the name of a module. The value is a module name in registration logs.
channel_id: ${4:null} # not required. Specifies a channel ID. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 9.
log_buff_enable: ${5|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Enables the Switch to send logs to the log buffer.
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.

log_time_stamp: ${7|date_boot,date_second,date_tenthsecond,date_millisecond,shortdate_second,shortdate_tenthsecond,shortdate_millisecond,formatdate_second,formatdate_tenthsecond,formatdate_millisecond|} # not required. choices: date_boot;date_second;date_tenthsecond;date_millisecond;shortdate_second;shortdate_tenthsecond;shortdate_millisecond;formatdate_second;formatdate_tenthsecond;formatdate_millisecond. Sets the timestamp format of logs.
log_enable: ${8|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Indicates whether log filtering is enabled.

ce_info_center_trap.description: Manages information center trap configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_info_center_trap:
trap_buff_enable: ${1|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Whether a trap buffer is enabled to output information.

module_name: ${2:null} # not required. Module name of the rule. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-insensitive characters. The default value is default. Please use lower-case letter, such as [aaa, acl, arp, bfd].

trap_time_stamp: ${3|date_boot,date_second,date_tenthsecond,date_millisecond,shortdate_second,shortdate_tenthsecond,shortdate_millisecond,formatdate_second,formatdate_tenthsecond,formatdate_millisecond|} # not required. choices: date_boot;date_second;date_tenthsecond;date_millisecond;shortdate_second;shortdate_tenthsecond;shortdate_millisecond;formatdate_second;formatdate_tenthsecond;formatdate_millisecond. Timestamp format of alarm information.
channel_id: ${4:null} # not required. Number of a channel. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 9. The default value is 0.
trap_enable: ${5|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. Whether a device is enabled to output alarms.
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.

trap_level: ${7|emergencies,alert,critical,error,warning,notification,informational,debugging|} # not required. choices: emergencies;alert;critical;error;warning;notification;informational;debugging. Trap level permitted to output.
trap_buff_size: ${8:null} # not required. Size of a trap buffer. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 1024. The default value is 256.

ce_interface.description: Manages physical attributes of interfaces on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_interface:
state: ${1|present,absent,default|} # required. choices: present;absent;default. Specify desired state of the resource.
mode: ${2|layer2,layer3|} # not required. choices: layer2;layer3. Manage Layer 2 or Layer 3 state of the interface.
interface: ${3:null} # not required. Full name of interface, i.e. 40GE1/0/10, Tunnel1.

admin_state: ${4|up,down|} # not required. choices: up;down. Specifies the interface management status. The value is an enumerated type. up, An interface is in the administrative Up state. down, An interface is in the administrative Down state.
description: ${5:null} # not required. Specifies an interface description. The value is a string of 1 to 242 case-sensitive characters, spaces supported but question marks (?) not supported.
l2sub: ${6:false} # not required. Specifies whether the interface is a Layer 2 sub-interface.

interface_type: ${7|ge,10ge,25ge,4x10ge,40ge,100ge,vlanif,loopback,meth,eth-trunk,nve,tunnel,ethernet,fcoe-port,fabric-port,stack-port,null|} # not required. choices: ge;10ge;25ge;4x10ge;40ge;100ge;vlanif;loopback;meth;eth-trunk;nve;tunnel;ethernet;fcoe-port;fabric-port;stack-port;null. Interface type to be configured from the device.

ce_interface_ospf.description: Manages configuration of an OSPF interface instanceon HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_interface_ospf:
interface: ${1:undefined} # required. Full name of interface, i.e. 40GE1/0/10.
process_id: ${2:undefined} # required. Specifies a process ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.
area: ${3:undefined} # required. Ospf area associated with this ospf process. Valid values are a string, formatted as an IP address (i.e. "0.0.0.0") or as an integer between 1 and 4294967295.
hello_interval: ${4:null} # not required. Time between sending successive hello packets. Valid values are an integer in the range from 1 to 65535.
auth_text_simple: ${5:null} # not required. Specifies a password for simple authentication. The value is a string of 1 to 8 characters.
auth_mode: ${6|none,null,hmac-sha256,md5,hmac-md5,simple|} # not required. choices: none;null;hmac-sha256;md5;hmac-md5;simple. Specifies the authentication type.
cost: ${7:null} # not required. The cost associated with this interface. Valid values are an integer in the range from 1 to 65535.
auth_text_md5: ${8:null} # not required. Specifies a password for MD5, HMAC-MD5, or HMAC-SHA256 authentication. The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.
silent_interface: ${9:false} # not required. Setting to true will prevent this interface from receiving HELLO packets. Valid values are 'true' and 'false'.
state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
auth_key_id: ${11:null} # not required. Authentication key id when C(auth_mode) is 'hmac-sha256', 'md5' or 'hmac-md5. Valid value is an integer is in the range from 1 to 255.
dead_interval: ${12:null} # not required. Time interval an ospf neighbor waits for a hello packet before tearing down adjacencies. Valid values are an integer in the range from 1 to 235926000.

ce_ip_interface.description: Manages L3 attributes for IPv4 and IPv6 interfaces on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_ip_interface:
interface: ${1:undefined} # required. Full name of interface, i.e. 40GE1/0/22, vlanif10.
mask: ${2:null} # not required. Subnet mask for IPv4 or IPv6 Address in decimal format.
version: ${3|v4,v6|} # not required. choices: v4;v6. IP address version.
ipv4_type: ${4|main,sub|} # not required. choices: main;sub. Specifies an address type. The value is an enumerated type. main, primary IP address. sub, secondary IP address.
state: ${5|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.
addr: ${6:null} # not required. IPv4 or IPv6 Address.

ce_link_status.description: Get interface link status on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_link_status:

interface: ${1:undefined} # required. For the interface parameter, you can enter C(all) to display information about all interface, an interface type such as C(40GE) to display information about interfaces of the specified type, or full name of an interface such as C(40GE1/0/22) or C(vlanif10) to display information about the specific interface.

ce_mlag_config.description: Manages MLAG configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_mlag_config:
peer_link_id: ${1:null} # not required. Number of the peer-link interface. The value is 1.
ip_address: ${2:null} # not required. IP address bound to the DFS group. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
pseudo_nickname: ${3:null} # not required. A pseudo nickname of a DFS group. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 65471.
dfs_group_id: ${4:present} # not required. ID of a DFS group. The value is 1.

vpn_instance_name: ${5:null} # not required. Name of the VPN instance bound to the DFS group. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters without spaces. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces. The value _public_ is reserved and cannot be used as the VPN instance name.

pseudo_priority: ${6:null} # not required. The priority of a pseudo nickname. The value is an integer that ranges from 128 to 255. The default value is 192. A larger value indicates a higher priority.
nickname: ${7:null} # not required. The nickname bound to a DFS group. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 65471.
eth_trunk_id: ${8:null} # not required. Name of the peer-link interface. The value is in the range from 0 to 511.
state: ${9|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.
priority_id: ${10:null} # not required. Priority of a DFS group. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 254. The default value is 100.

ce_mlag_interface.description: Manages MLAG interfaces on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_mlag_interface:
mlag_priority_id: ${1:null} # not required. M-LAG global LACP system priority. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 65535. The default value is 32768.
mlag_system_id: ${2:null} # not required. M-LAG global LACP system MAC address. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters. The default value is the MAC address of the Ethernet port of MPU.
mlag_id: ${3:null} # not required. ID of the M-LAG. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 2048.
interface: ${4:null} # not required. Name of the interface that enters the Error-Down state when the peer-link fails. The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.
mlag_error_down: ${5|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Configure the interface on the slave device to enter the Error-Down state.
dfs_group_id: ${6:present} # not required. ID of a DFS group.The value is 1.
eth_trunk_id: ${7:null} # not required. Name of the local M-LAG interface. The value is ranging from 0 to 511.
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.

ce_mtu.description: Manages MTU settings on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_mtu:
jumbo_min: ${1:null} # not required. Non-jumbo frame size threshod. The default value is 1518. The value is an integer that ranges from 1518 to jumbo_max, in bytes.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.
interface: ${3:null} # not required. Full name of interface, i.e. 40GE1/0/22.

jumbo_max: ${4:null} # not required. Maximum frame size. The default value is 9216. The value is an integer and expressed in bytes. The value range is 1536 to 12224 for the CE12800 and 1536 to 12288 for ToR switches.
mtu: ${5:null} # not required. MTU for a specific interface. The value is an integer ranging from 46 to 9600, in bytes.

ce_netconf.description: Run an arbitrary netconf command on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_netconf:
rpc: ${1|get,edit-config,execute-action,execute-cli|} # required. choices: get;edit-config;execute-action;execute-cli. The type of rpc.
cfg_xml: ${2:undefined} # required. The config xml string.

ce_netstream_aging.description: Manages timeout mode of NetStream on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_netstream_aging:
state: ${1|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.
manual_slot: ${2:null} # not required. Specifies the slot number of netstream manual timeout.
type: ${3|ip,vxlan|} # not required. choices: ip;vxlan. Specifies the packet type of netstream timeout active interval.
timeout_interval: ${4:30} # not required. Netstream timeout interval. If is active type the interval is 1-60. If is inactive ,the interval is 5-600.
timeout_type: ${5|active,inactive,tcp-session,manual|} # not required. choices: active;inactive;tcp-session;manual. Netstream timeout type.

ce_netstream_export.description: Manages netstream export on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_netstream_export:
type: ${1|ip,vxlan|} # required. choices: ip;vxlan. Specifies NetStream feature.

bgp_nexthop: ${2|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Configures the statistics to carry BGP next hop information. Currently, only V9 supports the exported packets carrying BGP next hop information.
host_port: ${3:null} # not required. Specifies the destination UDP port number of the exported packets. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 65535.
source_ip: ${4:null} # not required. Specifies source address which can be IPv6 or IPv4 of the exported NetStream packet.
as_option: ${5|origin,peer|} # not required. choices: origin;peer. Specifies the AS number recorded in the statistics as the original or the peer AS number.
version: ${6|5,9|} # not required. choices: 5;9. Sets the version of exported packets.
host_vpn: ${7:null} # not required. Specifies the VPN instance of the exported packets carrying flow statistics. Ensure the VPN instance has been created on the device.
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.
host_ip: ${9:null} # not required. Specifies destination address which can be IPv6 or IPv4 of the exported NetStream packet.

ce_netstream_global.description: Manages global parameters of NetStream on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_netstream_global:
interface: ${1:null} # required. Netstream global interface.
type: ${2|ip,vxlan|} # not required. choices: ip;vxlan. Specifies the type of netstream global.
statistics_record: ${3:null} # not required. Specifies the flexible netstream statistic record, length is 1 - 32.
statistics_direction: ${4|inbound,outbound|} # not required. choices: inbound;outbound. Specifies the netstream statistic direction.
index_switch: ${5|16,32|} # not required. choices: 16;32. Specifies the netstream index-switch.
sampler_direction: ${6|inbound,outbound|} # not required. choices: inbound;outbound. Specifies the netstream sampler direction.
state: ${7|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.
sampler_interval: ${8:null} # not required. Specifies the netstream sampler interval, length is 1 - 65535.

ce_netstream_template.description: Manages NetStream template configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_netstream_template:
type: ${1|ip,vxlan|} # required. choices: ip;vxlan. Configure the type of netstream record.
record_name: ${2:null} # not required. Configure the name of netstream record. The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-insensitive characters.
description: ${3:null} # not required. Configure the description of netstream record. The value is a string of 1 to 80 case-insensitive characters.
collect_interface: ${4|input,output|} # not required. choices: input;output. Configure the input or output interface that are included in the flexible flow statistics sent to NSC.
state: ${5|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.
collect_counter: ${6|bytes,packets|} # not required. choices: bytes;packets. Configure the number of packets and bytes that are included in the flexible flow statistics sent to NSC.

match: ${7|destination-address,destination-port,tos,protocol,source-address,source-port|} # not required. choices: destination-address;destination-port;tos;protocol;source-address;source-port. Configure flexible flow statistics template keywords.

ce_ntp.description: Manages core NTP configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_ntp:
peer: ${1:null} # not required. Network address of NTP peer.

source_int: ${2:null} # not required. Local source interface from which NTP messages are sent. Must be fully qualified interface name, i.e. C(40GE1/0/22), C(vlanif10). Interface types, such as C(10GE), C(40GE), C(100GE), C(Eth-Trunk), C(LoopBack), C(MEth), C(NULL), C(Tunnel), C(Vlanif).
key_id: ${3:null} # not required. Authentication key identifier to use with given NTP server or peer.
server: ${4:null} # not required. Network address of NTP server.
is_preferred: ${5|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Makes given NTP server or peer the preferred NTP server or peer for the device.
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.
vpn_name: ${7:_public_} # not required. Makes the device communicate with the given NTP server or peer over a specific vpn.

ce_ntp_auth.description: Manages NTP authentication configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_ntp_auth:
key_id: ${1:undefined} # required. Authentication key identifier (numeric).
auth_pwd: ${2:null} # not required. Plain text with length of 1 to 255, encrypted text with length of 20 to 392.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.
authentication: ${4|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Configure ntp authentication enable or unconfigure ntp authentication enable.
trusted_key: ${5|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Whether the given key is required to be supplied by a time source for the device to synchronize to the time source.
auth_type: ${6|text,encrypt|} # not required. choices: text;encrypt. Whether the given password is in cleartext or has been encrypted. If in cleartext, the device will encrypt it before storing it.
auth_mode: ${7|hmac-sha256,md5|} # not required. choices: hmac-sha256;md5. Specify authentication algorithm.

ce_ospf.description: Manages configuration of an OSPF instance on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_ospf:
process_id: ${1:undefined} # required. Specifies a process ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.
nexthop_addr: ${2:null} # not required. IPv4 address for configure next-hop address's weight. Valid values are a string, formatted as an IP address.
auth_text_simple: ${3:null} # not required. Specifies a password for simple authentication. The value is a string of 1 to 8 characters.
max_load_balance: ${4:null} # not required. The maximum number of paths for forward packets over multiple paths. Valid value is an integer in the range from 1 to 64.

area: ${5:null} # not required. Specifies the area ID. The area with the area-id being 0 is a backbone area. Valid values are a string, formatted as an IP address (i.e. "0.0.0.0") or as an integer between 1 and 4294967295.
addr: ${6:null} # not required. Specifies the address of the network segment where the interface resides. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
mask: ${7:null} # not required. IP network wildcard bits in decimal format between 0 and 32.
auth_text_md5: ${8:null} # not required. Specifies a password for MD5, HMAC-MD5, or HMAC-SHA256 authentication. The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.
auth_mode: ${9|none,hmac-sha256,md5,hmac-md5,simple|} # not required. choices: none;hmac-sha256;md5;hmac-md5;simple. Specifies the authentication type.
state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
auth_key_id: ${11:null} # not required. Authentication key id when C(auth_mode) is 'hmac-sha256', 'md5' or 'hmac-md5. Valid value is an integer is in the range from 1 to 255.
nexthop_weight: ${12:null} # not required. Indicates the weight of the next hop. The smaller the value is, the higher the preference of the route is. It is an integer that ranges from 1 to 254.

ce_ospf_vrf.description: Manages configuration of an OSPF VPN instance on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_ospf_vrf:
ospf: ${1:null} # required. The ID of the ospf process. Valid values are an integer, 1 - 4294967295, the default value is 1.
bandwidth: ${2:null} # not required. Specifies the reference bandwidth used to assign ospf cost. Valid values are an integer, in Mbps, 1 - 2147483648, the default value is 100.

lsaalflag: ${3:false} # not required. Specifies the mode of timer to calculate interval of arrive LSA. If set the parameter but not specifies value, the default will be used. If true use general timer. If false use intelligent timer.

lsaointervalflag: ${4:false} # not required. Specifies whether cancel the interval of LSA originate or not. If set the parameter but noe specifies value, the default will be used. true:cancel the interval of LSA originate, the interval is 0. false:do not cancel the interval of LSA originate.

spfmaxinterval: ${5:null} # not required. Specifies the max interval to calculate SPF when use intelligent timer. Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 1 to 20000, the default value is 5000.

lsaastartinterval: ${6:null} # not required. Specifies the start interval of arrive LSA when use the intelligent timer. Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 0 to 10000, the default value is 500.
lsaointerval: ${7:null} # not required. Specifies the interval of originate LSA . Valid value is an integer, in second, from 0 to 10, the default value is 5.

spfintervaltype: ${8|intelligent-timer,timer,millisecond|} # not required. choices: intelligent-timer;timer;millisecond. Specifies the mode of timer which used to calculate SPF. If set the parameter but noe specifies value, the default will be used. If is intelligent-timer, then use intelligent timer. If is timer, then use second level timer. If is millisecond, then use millisecond level timer.
description: ${9:null} # not required. Specifies the description information of ospf process.

spfholdinterval: ${10:null} # not required. Specifies the hold interval to calculate SPF when use intelligent timer. Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 1 to 5000, the default value is 200.

spfstartinterval: ${11:null} # not required. Specifies the start interval to calculate SPF when use intelligent timer. Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 1 to 1000, the default value is 50.
lsaostartinterval: ${12:null} # not required. Specifies the start interval of originate LSA . Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 0 to 1000, the default value is 500.
spfinterval: ${13:null} # not required. Specifies the interval to calculate SPF when use second level  timer. Valid value is an integer, in second, from 1 to 10.
vrf: ${14:_public_} # not required. Specifies the vpn instance which use ospf,length is 1 - 31. Valid values are a string.
spfintervalmi: ${15:null} # not required. Specifies the interval to calculate SPF when use millisecond level  timer. Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 1 to 10000.
route_id: ${16:null} # not required. Specifies the ospf private route id,. Valid values are a string, formatted as an IP address (i.e. "10.1.1.1") the length is 0 - 20.
lsaomaxinterval: ${17:null} # not required. Specifies the max interval of originate LSA . Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 1 to 10000, the default value is 5000.
lsaainterval: ${18:null} # not required. Specifies the interval of arrive LSA when use the general timer. Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 0 to 10000.
state: ${19|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.

lsaamaxinterval: ${20:null} # not required. Specifies the max interval of arrive LSA when use the intelligent timer. Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 0 to 10000, the default value is 1000.
lsaoholdinterval: ${21:null} # not required. Specifies the hold interval of originate LSA . Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 0 to 5000, the default value is 1000.

lsaaholdinterval: ${22:null} # not required. Specifies the hold interval of arrive LSA when use the intelligent timer. Valid value is an integer, in millisecond, from 0 to 10000, the default value is 500.
ce_reboot:
save_config: ${1:false} # not required. Flag indicating whether to save the configuration.
confirm: ${2:false} # not required. Safeguard boolean. Set to true if you're sure you want to reboot.

ce_rollback.description: Set a checkpoint or rollback to a checkpoint on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_rollback:
action: ${1|rollback,clear,set,display,commit|} # required. choices: rollback;clear;set;display;commit. The operation of configuration rollback.

filename: ${2:null} # not required. Specifies a configuration file for configuration rollback. The value is a string of 5 to 64 case-sensitive characters in the format of *.zip, *.cfg, or *.dat, spaces not supported.

commit_id: ${3:undefined} # not required. Specifies the label of the configuration rollback point to which system configurations are expected to roll back. The value is an integer that the system generates automatically.
oldest: ${4:null} # not required. Specifies the number of configuration rollback points. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 80.
last: ${5:null} # not required. Specifies the number of configuration rollback points. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 80.

label: ${6:null} # not required. Specifies a user label for a configuration rollback point. The value is a string of 1 to 256 case-sensitive ASCII characters, spaces not supported. The value must start with a letter and cannot be presented in a single hyphen (-).

ce_sflow.description: Manages sFlow configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_sflow:
sflow_interface: ${1:null} # not required. Full name of interface for Flow Sampling or Counter. It must be a physical interface, Eth-Trunk, or Layer 2 subinterface.
collector_udp_port: ${2:null} # not required. Specifies the UDP destination port number of sFlow packets. The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 65535. The default value is 6343.
counter_interval: ${3:null} # not required. Indicates the counter sampling interval. The value is an integer that ranges from 10 to 4294967295, in seconds. The default value is 20.
collector_id: ${4|1,2|} # not required. choices: 1;2. Specifies the ID of an sFlow collector. This ID is used when you specify the collector in subsequent sFlow configuration.
sample_rate: ${5:null} # not required. Specifies the flow sampling rate in the format 1/rate. The value is an integer and ranges from 1 to 4294967295. The default value is 8192.
collector_ip: ${6:null} # not required. Specifies the IPv4/IPv6 address of the sFlow collector.

rate_limit_slot: ${7:null} # not required. Specifies the slot where the rate of output sFlow packets is limited. If this parameter is not specified, the rate of sFlow packets sent from all cards to the control plane is limited. The value is an integer or a string of characters.
sample_length: ${8:null} # not required. Specifies the maximum length of sampled packets. The value is an integer and ranges from 18 to 512, in bytes. The default value is 128.
export_route: ${9|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Configures the sFlow packets sent by the switch not to carry routing information.
rate_limit: ${10:null} # not required. Specifies the rate of sFlow packets sent from a card to the control plane. The value is an integer that ranges from 100 to 1500, in pps.
counter_collector: ${11:null} # not required. Indicates the ID list of the counter collector.

forward_enp_slot: ${12:null} # not required. Enable the Embedded Network Processor (ENP) chip function. The switch uses the ENP chip to perform sFlow sampling, and the maximum sFlow sampling interval is 65535. If you set the sampling interval to be larger than 65535, the switch automatically restores it to 65535. The value is an integer or 'all'.

collector_meth: ${13|meth,enhanced|} # not required. choices: meth;enhanced. Configures the device to send sFlow packets through service interfaces, enhancing the sFlow packet forwarding capability. The enhanced parameter is optional. No matter whether you configure the enhanced mode, the switch determines to send sFlow packets through service cards or management port based on the routing information on the collector. When the value is meth, the device forwards sFlow packets at the control plane. When the value is enhanced, the device forwards sFlow packets at the forwarding plane to enhance the sFlow packet forwarding capacity.
sample_direction: ${14|inbound,outbound,both|} # not required. choices: inbound;outbound;both. Enables flow sampling in the inbound or outbound direction.

collector_ip_vpn: ${15:null} # not required. Specifies the name of a VPN instance. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string. The value C(_public_) is reserved and cannot be used as the VPN instance name.
agent_ip: ${16:null} # not required. Specifies the IPv4/IPv6 address of an sFlow agent.
sample_collector: ${17:null} # not required. Indicates the ID list of the collector.
source_ip: ${18:null} # not required. Specifies the source IPv4/IPv6 address of sFlow packets.

collector_datagram_size: ${19:null} # not required. Specifies the maximum length of sFlow packets sent from an sFlow agent to an sFlow collector. The value is an integer, in bytes. It ranges from 1024 to 8100. The default value is 1400.
state: ${20|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
collector_description: ${21:null} # not required. Specifies the description of an sFlow collector. The value is a string of 1 to 255 case-sensitive characters without spaces.

ce_snmp_community.description: Manages SNMP community configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_snmp_community:
group_name: ${1:null} # not required. Unique name to identify the SNMPv3 group.
security_level: ${2|noAuthNoPriv,authentication,privacy|} # not required. choices: noAuthNoPriv;authentication;privacy. Security level indicating whether to use authentication and encryption.
read_view: ${3:null} # not required. Mib view name for read.
acl_number: ${4:null} # not required. Access control list number.
community_mib_view: ${5:null} # not required. Mib view name.
community_name: ${6:null} # not required. Unique name to identify the community.
notify_view: ${7:null} # not required. Mib view name for notification.
access_right: ${8|read,write|} # not required. choices: read;write. Access right read or write.
state: ${9|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.
write_view: ${10:null} # not required. Mib view name for write.

ce_snmp_contact.description: Manages SNMP contact configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_snmp_contact:
contact: ${1:null} # required. Contact information.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.

ce_snmp_location.description: Manages SNMP location configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_snmp_location:
location: ${1:null} # required. Location information.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.

ce_snmp_target_host.description: Manages SNMP target host configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_snmp_target_host:
address: ${1:null} # not required. Network Address.
vpn_name: ${2:null} # not required. VPN instance Name.
security_level: ${3|noAuthNoPriv,authentication,privacy|} # not required. choices: noAuthNoPriv;authentication;privacy. Security level indicating whether to use authentication and encryption.
security_name_v3: ${4:null} # not required. Security Name V3.
notify_type: ${5|trap,inform|} # not required. choices: trap;inform. To configure notify type as trap or inform.
connect_port: ${6:null} # not required. Udp port used by SNMP agent to connect the Network management.
security_model: ${7|v1,v2c,v3|} # not required. choices: v1;v2c;v3. Security Model.
version: ${8|none,v1,v2c,v3,v1v2c,v1v3,v2cv3,all|} # not required. choices: none;v1;v2c;v3;v1v2c;v1v3;v2cv3;all. Version(s) Supported by SNMP Engine.
recv_port: ${9:null} # not required. UDP Port number used by network management to receive alarm messages.
host_name: ${10:null} # not required. Unique name to identify target host entry.
security_name: ${11:null} # not required. Security Name.
is_public_net: ${12|no_use,true,false|} # not required. choices: no_use;true;false. To enable or disable Public Net-manager for target Host.
interface_name: ${13:null} # not required. Name of the interface to send the trap message.

ce_snmp_traps.description: Manages SNMP traps configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_snmp_traps:
interface_number: ${1:null} # not required. Interface number.

feature_name: ${2|aaa,arp,bfd,bgp,cfg,configuration,dad,devm,dhcpsnp,dldp,driver,efm,erps,error-down,fcoe,fei,fei_comm,fm,ifnet,info,ipsg,ipv6,isis,l3vpn,lacp,lcs,ldm,ldp,ldt,lldp,mpls_lspm,msdp,mstp,nd,netconf,nqa,nvo3,openflow,ospf,ospfv3,pim,pim-std,qos,radius,rm,rmon,securitytrap,smlktrap,snmp,ssh,stackmng,sysclock,sysom,system,tcp,telnet,trill,trunk,tty,vbst,vfs,virtual-perception,vrrp,vstm,all|} # not required. choices: aaa;arp;bfd;bgp;cfg;configuration;dad;devm;dhcpsnp;dldp;driver;efm;erps;error-down;fcoe;fei;fei_comm;fm;ifnet;info;ipsg;ipv6;isis;l3vpn;lacp;lcs;ldm;ldp;ldt;lldp;mpls_lspm;msdp;mstp;nd;netconf;nqa;nvo3;openflow;ospf;ospfv3;pim;pim-std;qos;radius;rm;rmon;securitytrap;smlktrap;snmp;ssh;stackmng;sysclock;sysom;system;tcp;telnet;trill;trunk;tty;vbst;vfs;virtual-perception;vrrp;vstm;all. Alarm feature name.

interface_type: ${3|Ethernet,Eth-Trunk,Tunnel,NULL,LoopBack,Vlanif,100GE,40GE,MTunnel,10GE,GE,MEth,Vbdif,Nve|} # not required. choices: Ethernet;Eth-Trunk;Tunnel;NULL;LoopBack;Vlanif;100GE;40GE;MTunnel;10GE;GE;MEth;Vbdif;Nve. Interface type.
port_number: ${4:null} # not required. Source port number.
trap_name: ${5:null} # not required. Alarm trap name.

ce_snmp_user.description: Manages SNMP user configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_snmp_user:
user_group: ${1:null} # not required. Name of the group where user belongs to.
remote_engine_id: ${2:null} # not required. Remote engine id of the USM user.
priv_protocol: ${3|noPriv,des56,3des168,aes128,aes192,aes256|} # not required. choices: noPriv;des56;3des168;aes128;aes192;aes256. Encryption protocol.
acl_number: ${4:null} # not required. Access control list number.
auth_key: ${5:null} # not required. The authentication password. Password length, 8-255 characters.
auth_protocol: ${6|noAuth,md5,sha|} # not required. choices: noAuth;md5;sha. Authentication protocol.
priv_key: ${7:null} # not required. The encryption password. Password length 8-255 characters.
aaa_local_user: ${8:null} # not required. Unique name to identify the local user.
usm_user_name: ${9:null} # not required. Unique name to identify the USM user.

ce_startup.description: Manages a system startup information on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_startup:
slot: ${1:null} # not required. Position of the device.The value is a string of 1 to 32 characters. The possible value of slot is all, slave-board, or the specific slotID.
cfg_file: ${2:present} # not required. Name of the configuration file that is applied for the next startup. The value is a string of 5 to 255 characters.
action: ${3|display|} # not required. choices: display. Display the startup information.
software_file: ${4:null} # not required. File name of the system software that is applied for the next startup. The value is a string of 5 to 255 characters.
patch_file: ${5:null} # not required. Name of the patch file that is applied for the next startup.

ce_static_route.description: Manages static route configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_static_route:
aftype: ${1|v4,v6|} # required. choices: v4;v6. Destination ip address family type of static route.
mask: ${2:undefined} # required. Destination ip mask of static route.
prefix: ${3:undefined} # required. Destination ip address of static route.
description: ${4:null} # not required. Name of the route. Used with the name parameter on the CLI.
next_hop: ${5:null} # not required. Next hop address of static route.
vrf: ${6:null} # not required. VPN instance of destination ip address.
nhp_interface: ${7:null} # not required. Next hop interface full name of static route.
pref: ${8:null} # not required. Preference or administrative difference of route (range 1-255).
state: ${9|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.
destvrf: ${10:null} # not required. VPN instance of next hop ip address.
tag: ${11:null} # not required. Route tag value (numeric).

ce_stp.description: Manages STP configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_stp:
bpdu_filter: ${1|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Specify a port as a BPDU filter port.
tc_protection: ${2|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Configure the TC BPDU protection function for an MSTP process.
interface: ${3:null} # not required. Interface name. If the value is C(all), will apply configuration to all interfaces. if the value is a special name, only support input the full name.
bpdu_protection: ${4|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Configure BPDU protection on an edge port. This function prevents network flapping caused by attack packets.
tc_protection_threshold: ${5:null} # not required. Set the maximum number of TC BPDUs that the MSTP can handle. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255. The default value is 1 on the switch.
edged_port: ${6|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Set the current port as an edge port.
cost: ${7:null} # not required. Set the path cost of the current port. The default instance is 0.
stp_converge: ${8|fast,normal|} # not required. choices: fast;normal. STP convergence mode. Fast means set STP aging mode to Fast. Normal means set STP aging mode to Normal.
stp_enable: ${9|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Enable or disable STP on a switch.
stp_mode: ${10|stp,rstp,mstp|} # not required. choices: stp;rstp;mstp. Set an operation mode for the current MSTP process. The mode can be STP, RSTP, or MSTP.
root_protection: ${11|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Enable root protection on the current port.
state: ${12|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.

tc_protection_interval: ${13:null} # not required. Set the time the MSTP device takes to handle the maximum number of TC BPDUs and immediately refresh forwarding entries. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 600, in seconds.
loop_protection: ${14|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Enable loop protection on the current port.

ce_switchport.description: Manages Layer 2 switchport interfaces on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_switchport:
interface: ${1:null} # required. Full name of the interface, i.e. 40GE1/0/22.
mode: ${2|access,trunk|} # not required. choices: access;trunk. The link type of an interface.
native_vlan: ${3:null} # not required. If C(mode=trunk), used as the trunk native VLAN ID, in the range from 1 to 4094.
access_vlan: ${4:null} # not required. If C(mode=access), used as the access VLAN ID, in the range from 1 to 4094.
trunk_vlans: ${5:null} # not required. If C(mode=trunk), used as the VLAN range to ADD or REMOVE from the trunk, such as 2-10 or 2,5,10-15, etc.
state: ${6|present,absent,unconfigured|} # not required. choices: present;absent;unconfigured. Manage the state of the resource.

ce_vlan.description: Manages VLAN resources and attributes on Huawei CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_vlan:
vlan_range: ${1:null} # not required. Range of VLANs such as C(2-10) or C(2,5,10-15), etc.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.
description: ${3:null} # not required. Specify VLAN description, in the range from 1 to 80.
vlan_id: ${4:null} # not required. Single VLAN ID, in the range from 1 to 4094.
name: ${5:null} # not required. Name of VLAN, in the range from 1 to 31.

ce_vrf.description: Manages VPN instance on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_vrf:
vrf: ${1:undefined} # required. VPN instance, the length of vrf name is 1 - 31, i.e. "test", but can not be C(_public_).
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.
description: ${3:null} # not required. Description of the vrf, the string length is 1 - 242 .

ce_vrf_af.description: Manages VPN instance address family on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_vrf_af:
vrf: ${1:null} # required. VPN instance.

vpn_target_value: ${2:undefined} # not required. VPN instance target value. Such as X.X.X.X:number<0-65535> or number<0-65535>:number<0-4294967295> or number<0-65535>.number<0-65535>:number<0-65535> or number<65536-4294967295>:number<0-65535> but not support 0:0 and 0.0:0.
evpn: ${3|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Is extend vpn or normal vpn.
vpn_target_state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the vpn target.
vrf_aftype: ${5|v4,v6|} # not required. choices: v4;v6. VPN instance address family.

route_distinguisher: ${6:undefined} # not required. VPN instance route distinguisher,the RD used to distinguish same route prefix from different vpn. The RD must be setted before setting vpn_target_value.
vpn_target_type: ${7|export_extcommunity,import_extcommunity|} # not required. choices: export_extcommunity;import_extcommunity. VPN instance vpn target type.
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the af.

ce_vrf_interface.description: Manages interface specific VPN configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine switches.
body: ce_vrf_interface:
vrf: ${1:undefined} # required. VPN instance, the length of vrf name is 1 ~ 31, i.e. "test", but can not be C(_public_).

vpn_interface: ${2:undefined} # required. An interface that can binding VPN instance, i.e. 40GE1/0/22, Vlanif10. Must be fully qualified interface name. Interface types, such as 10GE, 40GE, 100GE, LoopBack, MEth, Tunnel, Vlanif....
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.

ce_vrrp.description: Manages VRRP interfaces on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_vrrp:
fast_resume: ${1|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. mVRRP's fast resume mode.
interface: ${2:null} # not required. Name of an interface. The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.
is_plain: ${3:false} # not required. Select the display mode of an authentication key. By default, an authentication key is displayed in ciphertext.

recover_delay: ${4:null} # not required. Delay in recovering after an interface goes Up. The delay is used for interface flapping suppression. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 3600. The default value is 0 seconds.

auth_key: ${5:null} # not required. This object is set based on the authentication type. When noAuthentication is specified, the value is empty. When simpleTextPassword or md5Authentication is specified, the value is a string of 1 to 8 characters in plaintext and displayed as a blank text for security.

auth_mode: ${6|simple,md5,none|} # not required. choices: simple;md5;none. Authentication type used for VRRP packet exchanges between virtual routers. The values are noAuthentication, simpleTextPassword, md5Authentication. The default value is noAuthentication.
priority: ${7:null} # not required. Configured VRRP priority. The value ranges from 1 to 254. The default value is 100. A larger value indicates a higher priority.
version: ${8|v2,v3|} # not required. choices: v2;v3. VRRP version. The default version is v2.

advertise_interval: ${9:null} # not required. Configured interval between sending advertisements, in milliseconds. Only the master router sends VRRP advertisements. The default value is 1000 milliseconds.
admin_interface: ${10:null} # not required. Tracked mVRRP interface name. The value is a string of 1 to 63 characters.
gratuitous_arp_interval: ${11:null} # not required. Interval at which gratuitous ARP packets are sent, in seconds. The value ranges from 30 to 1200.The default value is 300.
admin_vrid: ${12:null} # not required. Tracked mVRRP ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.
admin_ignore_if_down: ${13:false} # not required. mVRRP ignores an interface Down event.
holding_multiplier: ${14:null} # not required. The configured holdMultiplier.The value is an integer ranging from 3 to 10. The default value is 3.
virtual_ip: ${15:null} # not required. Virtual IP address. The value is a string of 0 to 255 characters.
vrid: ${16:present} # not required. VRRP backup group ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.
admin_flowdown: ${17:false} # not required. Disable the flowdown function for service VRRP.
vrrp_type: ${18|normal,member,admin|} # not required. choices: normal;member;admin. Type of a VRRP backup group.
state: ${19|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.
preempt_timer_delay: ${20:null} # not required. Preemption delay. The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 3600. The default value is 0.

ce_vxlan_arp.description: Manages ARP attributes of VXLAN on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_vxlan_arp:
evn_source_ip: ${1:null} # not required. Specifies the source address of an EVN BGP peer. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
bridge_domain_id: ${2:null} # not required. Specifies a BD(bridge domain) ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.
evn_peer_ip: ${3:null} # not required. Specifies the IP address of an EVN BGP peer. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
host_collect_protocol: ${4|bgp,none|} # not required. choices: bgp;none. Enables EVN BGP or BGP EVPN to advertise host information.
arp_suppress: ${5|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Enables ARP broadcast suppression in a BD.
evn_server: ${6|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Configures the local device as the router reflector (RR) on the EVN network.
arp_collect_host: ${7|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Enables EVN BGP or BGP EVPN to collect host information.
evn_bgp: ${8|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Enables EVN BGP.
evn_reflect_client: ${9|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Configures the local device as the route reflector (RR) and its peer as the client.
state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
vbdif_name: ${11:null} # not required. Full name of VBDIF interface, i.e. Vbdif100.

ce_vxlan_gateway.description: Manages gateway for the VXLAN network on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_vxlan_gateway:
dfs_udp_port: ${1:null} # not required. Specifies the UDP port number of the DFS group. The value is an integer that ranges from 1025 to 65535.
arp_direct_route: ${2|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Enable VLINK direct route on VBDIF interface.

vbdif_bind_vpn: ${3:null} # not required. Specifies the name of the VPN instance that is associated with the interface. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string. The value C(_public_) is reserved and cannot be used as the VPN instance name.
dfs_id: ${4:null} # not required. Specifies the ID of a DFS group. The value must be 1.
arp_distribute_gateway: ${5|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Enable the distributed gateway function on VBDIF interface.

vpn_instance: ${6:null} # not required. Specifies the name of a VPN instance. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string. The value C(_public_) is reserved and cannot be used as the VPN instance name.
dfs_all_active: ${7|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Creates all-active gateways.
vpn_vni: ${8:null} # not required. Specifies a VNI ID. Binds a VXLAN network identifier (VNI) to a virtual private network (VPN) instance. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16000000.

dfs_source_vpn: ${9:null} # not required. Specifies the name of a VPN instance bound to a DFS group. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters without spaces. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces. The value C(_public_) is reserved and cannot be used as the VPN instance name.
dfs_peer_ip: ${10:null} # not required. Configure the IP address of an all-active gateway peer. The value is in dotted decimal notation.

dfs_peer_vpn: ${11:null} # not required. Specifies the name of the VPN instance that is associated with all-active gateway peer. The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string. The value C(_public_) is reserved and cannot be used as the VPN instance name.
dfs_source_ip: ${12:null} # not required. Specifies the IPv4 address bound to a DFS group. The value is in dotted decimal notation.
state: ${13|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.

vbdif_mac: ${14:null} # not required. Specifies a MAC address for a VBDIF interface. The value is in the format of H-H-H. Each H is a 4-digit hexadecimal number, such as C(00e0) or C(fc01). If an H contains less than four digits, 0s are added ahead. For example,  C(e0) is equal to C(00e0). A MAC address cannot be all 0s or 1s or a multicast MAC address.
vbdif_name: ${15:null} # not required. Full name of VBDIF interface, i.e. Vbdif100.

ce_vxlan_global.description: Manages global attributes of VXLAN and bridge domain on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_vxlan_global:
bridge_domain_id: ${1:null} # not required. Specifies a bridge domain ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.
nvo3_gw_enhanced: ${2|l2,l3|} # not required. choices: l2;l3. Configuring the Layer 3 VXLAN Gateway to Work in Non-loopback Mode.
nvo3_service_extend: ${3|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Enabling or disabling the VXLAN service extension function.

nvo3_prevent_loops: ${4|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Loop prevention of VXLAN traffic in non-enhanced mode. When the device works in non-enhanced mode, inter-card forwarding of VXLAN traffic may result in loops.
tunnel_mode_vxlan: ${5|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Set the tunnel mode to VXLAN when configuring the VXLAN feature.
nvo3_acl_extend: ${6|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Enabling or disabling the VXLAN ACL extension function.
nvo3_eth_trunk_hash: ${7|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Eth-Trunk from load balancing VXLAN packets in optimized mode.
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
nvo3_ecmp_hash: ${9|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Load balancing of VXLAN packets through ECMP in optimized mode.

ce_vxlan_tunnel.description: Manages VXLAN tunnel configuration on HUAWEI CloudEngine devices.
body: ce_vxlan_tunnel:
bridge_domain_id: ${1:null} # not required. Specifies a bridge domain ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.
protocol_type: ${2|bgp,null|} # not required. choices: bgp;null. The operation type of routing protocol.
peer_list_ip: ${3:null} # not required. Specifies the IP address of a remote VXLAN tunnel endpoints (VTEP). The value is in dotted decimal notation.
nve_name: ${4:null} # not required. Specifies the number of an NVE interface. The value ranges from 1 to 2.
vni_id: ${5:null} # not required. Specifies a VXLAN network identifier (VNI) ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16000000.
nve_mode: ${6|mode-l2,mode-l3|} # not required. choices: mode-l2;mode-l3. Specifies the working mode of an NVE interface.
state: ${7|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.
source_ip: ${8:null} # not required. Specifies an IP address for a source VTEP. The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ce_vxlan_vap.description: Manages VXLAN virtual access point on HUAWEI CloudEngine Devices.
body: ce_vxlan_vap:
bridge_domain_id: ${1:null} # not required. Specifies a bridge domain ID. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.
encapsulation: ${2|dot1q,default,untag,qinq,none|} # not required. choices: dot1q;default;untag;qinq;none. Specifies an encapsulation type of packets allowed to pass through a Layer 2 sub-interface.
bind_vlan_id: ${3:null} # not required. Specifies the VLAN binding to a BD(Bridge Domain). The value is an integer ranging ranging from 1 to 4094.
l2_sub_interface: ${4:null} # not required. Specifies an Sub-Interface full name, i.e. "10GE1/0/41.1". The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-insensitive characters, spaces supported.
state: ${5|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.

ce_vid: ${6:null} # not required. When I(encapsulation) is 'dot1q', specifies a VLAN ID in the outer VLAN tag. When I(encapsulation) is 'qinq', specifies an outer VLAN ID for double-tagged packets to be received by a Layer 2 sub-interface. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

pe_vid: ${7:null} # not required. When I(encapsulation) is 'qinq', specifies an inner VLAN ID for double-tagged packets to be received by a Layer 2 sub-interface. The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.
circonus_annotation:
api_key: ${1:undefined} # required. Circonus API key
category: ${2:undefined} # required. Annotation Category
description: ${3:undefined} # required. Description of annotation
title: ${4:undefined} # required. Title of annotation
start: ${5:I(now)} # not required. Unix timestamp of event start
duration: ${6:0} # not required. Duration in seconds of annotation
stop: ${7:I(now) + I(duration)} # not required. Unix timestamp of event end

cisco_spark.description: Send a message to a Cisco Spark Room or Individual.
body: cisco_spark:
recipient_id: ${1:undefined} # required. The unique identifier associated with the supplied C(recipient_type).
personal_token: ${2:undefined} # required. Your personal access token required to validate the Spark API.

recipient_type: ${3|roomId,toPersonEmail,toPersonId|} # required. choices: roomId;toPersonEmail;toPersonId. The request parameter you would like to send the message to.,Messages can be sent to either a room or individual (by ID or E-Mail).
message: ${4:undefined} # required. The message you would like to send.
message_type: ${5|text,markdown|} # not required. choices: text;markdown. Specifies how you would like the message formatted.

cl_bond.description: Configures a bond port on Cumulus Linux
body: cl_bond:
slaves: ${1:undefined} # required. Bond members.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the interface.
mstpctl_bpduguard: ${3|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Enables BPDU Guard on a port in vlan-aware mode.
lacp_bypass_priority: ${4:undefined} # not required. List of ports and priorities. Example I("swp1=10, swp2=20").
alias_name: ${5:undefined} # not required. Description of the port.
xmit_hash_policy: ${6:layer3+4} # not required. Transmit load balancing algorithm. As of Cumulus Linux 2.5 only I(layer3+4) policy is supported.
lacp_bypass_period: ${7:undefined} # not required. Period for enabling LACP bypass. Max value is 900.
ipv4: ${8:undefined} # not required. List of IPv4 addresses to configure on the interface. In the form I(X.X.X.X/YY).
lacp_bypass_allow: ${9:undefined} # not required. Enable LACP bypass.
addr_method: ${10|dhcp|} # not required. choices: dhcp. Configures the port to use DHCP. To enable this feature use the option I(dhcp).
miimon: ${11:100} # not required. The mii link monitoring interval.
virtual_mac: ${12:undefined} # not required. Define Ethernet mac associated with Cumulus Linux VRR feature.
location: ${13:/etc/network/interfaces.d} # not required. Interface directory location.
min_links: ${14:1} # not required. Minimum number of links.
vids: ${15:undefined} # not required. In vlan-aware mode, lists VLANs defined under the interface.
mtu: ${16:undefined} # not required. Set MTU. Configure Jumbo Frame by setting MTU to I(9000).
mstpctl_portadminedge: ${17|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Enables admin edge port.
lacp_bypass_all_active: ${18:undefined} # not required. Activate all interfaces for bypass. It is recommended to configure all_active instead of using bypass_priority.
pvid: ${19:undefined} # not required. In vlan-aware mode, defines vlan that is the untagged vlan.
mstpctl_portnetwork: ${20|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Enables bridge assurance in vlan-aware mode.
mode: ${21:802.3ad} # not required. The bond mode, as of Cumulus Linux 2.5 only LACP bond mode is supported.
ipv6: ${22:undefined} # not required. List of IPv6 addresses to configure on the interface. In the form I(X:X:X::X/YYY).

clag_id: ${23:undefined} # not required. Specify a unique clag_id for every dual connected bond on each peer switch. The value must be between 1 and 65535 and must be the same on both peer switches in order for the bond to be considered dual-connected.
lacp_rate: ${24:1} # not required. The lacp rate.
virtual_ip: ${25:undefined} # not required. Define IPv4 virtual IP used by the Cumulus Linux VRR feature.

cl_bridge.description: Configures a bridge port on Cumulus Linux
body: cl_bridge:
ports: ${1:undefined} # required. List of bridge members.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the interface.
location: ${3:/etc/network/interfaces.d} # not required. Interface directory location.
ipv4: ${4:undefined} # not required. List of IPv4 addresses to configure on the interface. In the form I(X.X.X.X/YY).
vids: ${5:undefined} # not required. In vlan-aware mode, lists VLANs defined under the interface.
mtu: ${6:undefined} # not required. Set MTU. Configure Jumbo Frame by setting MTU to I(9000).

stp: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Enables spanning tree Protocol. As of Cumulus Linux 2.5 the default bridging mode, only per vlan RSTP or 802.1d is supported. For the vlan aware mode, only common instance STP is supported
alias_name: ${8:undefined} # not required. Description of the port.
virtual_ip: ${9:undefined} # not required. Define IPv4 virtual IP used by the Cumulus Linux VRR feature.
pvid: ${10:undefined} # not required. In vlan-aware mode, defines vlan that is the untagged vlan.
vlan_aware: ${11|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Enables vlan-aware mode.
ipv6: ${12:undefined} # not required. List of IPv6 addresses to configure on the interface. In the form I(X:X:X::X/YYY).
mstpctl_treeprio: ${13:undefined} # not required. Set spanning tree root priority. Must be a multiple of 4096.
virtual_mac: ${14:undefined} # not required. Define Ethernet mac associated with Cumulus Linux VRR feature.
addr_method: ${15|dhcp|} # not required. choices: dhcp. Configures the port to use DHCP. To enable this feature use the option I(dhcp).

cl_img_install.description: Install a different Cumulus Linux version.
body: cl_img_install:

src: ${1:undefined} # required. The full path to the Cumulus Linux binary image. Can be a local path, http or https URL. If the code version is in the name of the file, the module will assume this is the version of code you wish to install.

version: ${2:None} # not required. Inform the module of the exact version one is installing. This overrides the automatic check of version in the file name. For example, if the binary file name is called CumulusLinux-2.2.3.bin, and version is set to '2.5.0', then the module will assume it is installing '2.5.0' not '2.2.3'. If version is not included, then the module will assume '2.2.3' is the version to install.
switch_slot: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Switch slots after installing the image. To run the installed code, reboot the switch.

cl_interface.description: Configures a front panel port, loopback or management port on Cumulus Linux.
body: cl_interface:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the interface.
virtual_ip: ${2:undefined} # not required. Define IPv4 virtual IP used by the Cumulus Linux VRR feature.
ipv4: ${3:undefined} # not required. List of IPv4 addresses to configure on the interface. In the form I(X.X.X.X/YY).
alias_name: ${4:undefined} # not required. Description of the port.
vids: ${5:undefined} # not required. In vlan-aware mode, lists VLANs defined under the interface.
addr_method: ${6|loopback,dhcp|} # not required. choices: loopback;dhcp. Address method.

clagd_priority: ${7:undefined} # not required. Integer that changes the role the switch has in the clag domain. The lower priority switch will assume the primary role. The number can be between 0 and 65535.
virtual_mac: ${8:undefined} # not required. Define Ethernet mac associated with Cumulus Linux VRR feature.
location: ${9:/etc/network/interfaces.d} # not required. Interface directory location
mstpctl_bpduguard: ${10:undefined} # not required. Enables BPDU Guard on a port in vlan-aware mode.
clagd_enable: ${11:undefined} # not required. Enables the clagd daemon. This command should only be applied to the clag peerlink interface.
mtu: ${12:undefined} # not required. Set MTU. Configure Jumbo Frame by setting MTU to I(9000).
mstpctl_portadminedge: ${13:undefined} # not required. Enables admin edge port.
pvid: ${14:undefined} # not required. In vlan-aware mode, defines vlan that is the untagged vlan.
mstpctl_portnetwork: ${15:undefined} # not required. Enables bridge assurance in vlan-aware mode.
speed: ${16:undefined} # not required. Set speed of the swp(front panel) or management(eth0) interface. speed is in MB.
ipv6: ${17:undefined} # not required. List of IPv6 addresses to configure on the interface. In the form I(X:X:X::X/YYY).
clagd_peer_ip: ${18:undefined} # not required. IP address of the directly connected peer switch interface.
clagd_sys_mac: ${19:undefined} # not required. Clagd system mac address. Recommended to use the range starting with 44:38:39:ff. Needs to be the same between 2 Clag switches.

cl_interface_policy.description: Configure interface enforcement policy on Cumulus Linux
body: cl_interface_policy:
allowed: ${1:undefined} # required. List of ports to run initial run at 10G.
location: ${2:/etc/network/interfaces.d/} # not required. Directory to store interface files.
cl_license:
src: ${1:undefined} # required. The full path to the license. Can be local path or HTTP URL.

force: ${2|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Force installation of a license. Typically not needed. It is recommended to manually run this command via the ansible command. A reload of switchd is not required. Running the force option in a playbook will break the idempotent state machine of the module and cause the switchd notification to kick in all the time, causing a disruption.
cl_ports:
speed_40g: ${1:undefined} # not required. List of ports to run initial run at 40G.
speed_40g_div_4: ${2:undefined} # not required. List of 10G ports that will be ganged to form a 40G port.
speed_10g: ${3:undefined} # not required. List of ports to run initial run at 10G.
speed_4_by_10g: ${4:undefined} # not required. List of 40G ports that will be unganged to run as 4 10G ports.

clc_aa_policy.description: Create or Delete Anti Affinity Policies at CenturyLink Cloud.
body: clc_aa_policy:
location: ${1:undefined} # required. Datacenter in which the policy lives/should live.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the Anti Affinity Policy.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether to create or delete the policy.
wait: ${4|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Whether to wait for the tasks to finish before returning.

clc_alert_policy.description: Create or Delete Alert Policies at CenturyLink Cloud.
body: clc_alert_policy:
alias: ${1:undefined} # required. The alias of your CLC Account
metric: ${2|cpu,memory,disk|} # not required. choices: cpu;memory;disk. The metric on which to measure the condition that will trigger the alert. This is required for state 'present'
duration: ${3:None} # not required. The length of time in minutes that the condition must exceed the threshold. This is required for state 'present'
alert_recipients: ${4:None} # not required. A list of recipient email ids to notify the alert. This is required for state 'present'
id: ${5:None} # not required. The alert policy id. This is mutually exclusive with name

threshold: ${6:None} # not required. The threshold that will trigger the alert when the metric equals or exceeds it. This is required for state 'present' This number represents a percentage and must be a value between 5.0 - 95.0 that is a multiple of 5.0
state: ${7|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether to create or delete the policy.
name: ${8:None} # not required. The name of the alert policy. This is mutually exclusive with id

clc_blueprint_package.description: deploys a blue print package on a set of servers in CenturyLink Cloud.
body: clc_blueprint_package:
server_ids: ${1:undefined} # required. A list of server Ids to deploy the blue print package.
package_id: ${2:undefined} # required. The package id of the blue print.
state: ${3|present|} # not required. choices: present. Whether to install or un-install the package. Currently it supports only "present" for install action.
