free_form: ${1:undefined} # required. The command module takes a free form command to run.  There is no parameter actually named 'free form'. See the examples!
chdir: ${2:undefined} # not required. Change into this directory before running the command.
stdin: ${3:null} # not required. Set the stdin of the command directly to the specified value.
creates: ${4:undefined} # not required. A filename or (since 2.0) glob pattern, when it already exists, this step will B(not) be run.
removes: ${5:undefined} # not required. A filename or (since 2.0) glob pattern, when it does not exist, this step will B(not) be run.
warn: ${6:yes} # not required. If command_warnings are on in ansible.cfg, do not warn about this particular line if set to C(no).
composer:
executable: ${1:undefined} # not required. Path to PHP Executable on the remote host, if PHP is not in PATH.
no_plugins: ${2|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Disables all plugins ( see --no-plugins ).
no_dev: ${3|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Disables installation of require-dev packages (see --no-dev).
prefer_dist: ${4|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Forces installation from package dist even for dev versions (see --prefer-dist).
command: ${5:install} # not required. Composer command like "install", "update" and so on.
working_dir: ${6:undefined} # not required. Directory of your project (see --working-dir). This is required when the command is not run globally.,Will be ignored if C(global_command=true).
prefer_source: ${7|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Forces installation from package sources when possible (see --prefer-source).
global_command: ${8|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Runs the specified command globally.

optimize_autoloader: ${9|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Optimize autoloader during autoloader dump (see --optimize-autoloader).,Convert PSR-0/4 autoloading to classmap to get a faster autoloader.,Recommended especially for production, but can take a bit of time to run.
arguments: ${10:undefined} # not required. Composer arguments like required package, version and so on.
no_scripts: ${11|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Skips the execution of all scripts defined in composer.json (see --no-scripts).

ignore_platform_reqs: ${12|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Ignore php, hhvm, lib-* and ext-* requirements and force the installation even if the local machine does not fulfill these.

consul.description: Add, modify & delete services within a consul cluster.
body: consul:
state: ${1|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. register or deregister the consul service, defaults to present
validate_certs: ${2:true} # not required. whether to verify the tls certificate of the consul agent
service_id: ${3:service_name if supplied} # not required. the ID for the service, must be unique per node, defaults to the service name if the service name is supplied
tags: ${4:None} # not required. a list of tags that will be attached to the service registration.
check_name: ${5:None} # not required. a name for the service check, defaults to the check id. required if standalone, ignored if part of service definition.
port: ${6:8500} # not required. the port on which the consul agent is running

service_address: ${7:None} # not required. the address to advertise that the service will be listening on. This value will be passed as the I(Address) parameter to Consul's U(/v1/agent/service/register) API method, so refer to the Consul API documentation for further details.
check_id: ${8:None} # not required. an ID for the service check, defaults to the check name, ignored if part of a service definition.
scheme: ${9:http} # not required. the protocol scheme on which the consul agent is running
service_port: ${10:None} # not required. the port on which the service is listening. Can optionally be supplied for registration of a service, i.e. if service_name or service_id is set
host: ${11:localhost} # not required. host of the consul agent defaults to localhost
notes: ${12:None} # not required. Notes to attach to check when registering it.
script: ${13:None} # not required. the script/command that will be run periodically to check the health of the service. Scripts require an interval and vise versa

ttl: ${14:None} # not required. checks can be registered with a ttl instead of a script and interval this means that the service will check in with the agent before the ttl expires. If it doesn't the check will be considered failed. Required if registering a check and the script an interval are missing Similar to the interval this is a number with a s or m suffix to signify the units of seconds or minutes e.g 15s or 1m. If no suffix is supplied, m will be used by default e.g. 1 will be 1m
service_name: ${15:undefined} # not required. Unique name for the service on a node, must be unique per node, required if registering a service. May be omitted if registering a node level check

http: ${16:None} # not required. checks can be registered with an http endpoint. This means that consul will check that the http endpoint returns a successful http status. Interval must also be provided with this option.
token: ${17:None} # not required. the token key indentifying an ACL rule set. May be required to register services.

interval: ${18:None} # not required. the interval at which the service check will be run. This is a number with a s or m suffix to signify the units of seconds or minutes e.g 15s or 1m. If no suffix is supplied, m will be used by default e.g. 1 will be 1m. Required if the script param is specified.

timeout: ${19:None} # not required. A custom HTTP check timeout. The consul default is 10 seconds. Similar to the interval this is a number with a s or m suffix to signify the units of seconds or minutes, e.g. 15s or 1m.

consul_acl.description: Manipulate Consul ACL keys and rules
body: consul_acl:
rules: ${1:undefined} # not required. a list of the rules that should be associated with a given token
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. whether the ACL pair should be present or absent
name: ${3:undefined} # not required. the name that should be associated with the acl key, this is opaque to Consul
validate_certs: ${4:true} # not required. whether to verify the tls certificate of the consul agent
port: ${5:8500} # not required. the port on which the consul agent is running
token: ${6:undefined} # not required. the token key indentifying an ACL rule set. If generated by consul this will be a UUID
scheme: ${7:http} # not required. the protocol scheme on which the consul agent is running
host: ${8:localhost} # not required. host of the consul agent defaults to localhost
mgmt_token: ${9:undefined} # not required. a management token is required to manipulate the acl lists
token_type: ${10|client,management|} # not required. choices: client;management. the type of token that should be created, either management or client

consul_kv.description: Manipulate entries in the key/value store of a consul cluster
body: consul_kv:
value: ${1:undefined} # required. The value should be associated with the given key, required if C(state) is C(present).
key: ${2:undefined} # required. The key at which the value should be stored.

cas: ${3:undefined} # not required. Used when acquiring a lock with a session. If the C(cas) is C(0), then Consul will only put the key if it does not already exist. If the C(cas) value is non-zero, then the key is only set if the index matches the ModifyIndex of that key.
validate_certs: ${4:yes} # not required. Whether to verify the tls certificate of the consul agent.
session: ${5:undefined} # not required. The session that should be used to acquire or release a lock associated with a key/value pair.
flags: ${6:undefined} # not required. Opaque integer value that can be passed when setting a value.
host: ${7:localhost} # not required. Host of the consul agent.
recurse: ${8:no} # not required. If the key represents a prefix, each entry with the prefix can be retrieved by setting this to C(yes).
port: ${9:8500} # not required. The port on which the consul agent is running.
token: ${10:undefined} # not required. The token key indentifying an ACL rule set that controls access to the key value pair
scheme: ${11:http} # not required. The protocol scheme on which the consul agent is running.

state: ${12|absent,acquire,present,release|} # not required. choices: absent;acquire;present;release. The action to take with the supplied key and value. If the state is 'present', the key contents will be set to the value supplied, 'changed' will be set to true only if the value was different to the current contents. The state 'absent' will remove the key/value pair, again 'changed' will be set to true only if the key actually existed prior to the removal. An attempt can be made to obtain or free the lock associated with a key/value pair with the states 'acquire' or 'release' respectively. a valid session must be supplied to make the attempt changed will be true if the attempt is successful, false otherwise.
consul_session:

checks: ${1:undefined} # not required. A list of checks that will be used to verify the session health. If all the checks fail, the session will be invalidated and any locks associated with the session will be release and can be acquired once the associated lock delay has expired.
validate_certs: ${2:true} # not required. Whether to verify the tls certificate of the consul agent.
datacenter: ${3:undefined} # not required. The name of the datacenter in which the session exists or should be created.

state: ${4|absent,info,list,node,present|} # not required. choices: absent;info;list;node;present. Whether the session should be present i.e. created if it doesn't exist, or absent, removed if present. If created, the ID for the session is returned in the output. If absent, the name or ID is required to remove the session. Info for a single session, all the sessions for a node or all available sessions can be retrieved by specifying info, node or list for the state; for node or info, the node name or session id is required as parameter.

behavior: ${5|delete,release|} # not required. choices: delete;release. The optional behavior that can be attached to the session when it is created. This controls the behavior when a session is invalidated.

delay: ${6:15} # not required. The optional lock delay that can be attached to the session when it is created. Locks for invalidated sessions ar blocked from being acquired until this delay has expired. Durations are in seconds.
port: ${7:8500} # not required. The port on which the consul agent is running.
node: ${8:undefined} # not required. The name of the node that with which the session will be associated. by default this is the name of the agent.
scheme: ${9:http} # not required. The protocol scheme on which the consul agent is running.
host: ${10:localhost} # not required. The host of the consul agent defaults to localhost.
name: ${11:undefined} # not required. The name that should be associated with the session. This is opaque to Consul and not required.
copy:

dest: ${1:undefined} # required. Remote absolute path where the file should be copied to. If I(src) is a directory, this must be a directory too. If I(dest) is a nonexistent path and if either I(dest) ends with "/" or I(src) is a directory, I(dest) is created. If I(src) and I(dest) are files, the parent directory of I(dest) isn't created: the task fails if it doesn't already exist.

content: ${2:undefined} # not required. When used instead of I(src), sets the contents of a file directly to the specified value. For anything advanced or with formatting also look at the template module.
selevel: ${3:s0} # not required. Level part of the SELinux file context. This is the MLS/MCS attribute, sometimes known as the C(range). C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

force: ${4:yes} # not required. the default is C(yes), which will replace the remote file when contents are different than the source. If C(no), the file will only be transferred if the destination does not exist.

unsafe_writes: ${5:false} # not required. Normally this module uses atomic operations to prevent data corruption or inconsistent reads from the target files, sometimes systems are configured or just broken in ways that prevent this. One example are docker mounted files, they cannot be updated atomically and can only be done in an unsafe manner.,This boolean option allows ansible to fall back to unsafe methods of updating files for those cases in which you do not have any other choice. Be aware that this is subject to race conditions and can lead to data corruption.
backup: ${6:no} # not required. Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.

remote_src: ${7:no} # not required. If C(no), it will search for I(src) at originating/master machine.,If C(yes) it will go to the remote/target machine for the I(src). Default is C(no).,Currently I(remote_src) does not support recursive copying.

directory_mode: ${8:undefined} # not required. When doing a recursive copy set the mode for the directories. If this is not set we will use the system defaults. The mode is only set on directories which are newly created, and will not affect those that already existed.
setype: ${9:null} # not required. Type part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
decrypt: ${10:Yes} # not required. This option controls the autodecryption of source files using vault.

src: ${11:undefined} # not required. Local path to a file to copy to the remote server; can be absolute or relative. If path is a directory, it is copied recursively. In this case, if path ends with "/", only inside contents of that directory are copied to destination. Otherwise, if it does not end with "/", the directory itself with all contents is copied. This behavior is similar to Rsync.

mode: ${12:null} # not required. Mode the file or directory should be. For those used to I(/usr/bin/chmod) remember that modes are actually octal numbers (like C(0644) or C(01777)). Leaving off the leading zero will likely have unexpected results. As of version 1.8, the mode may be specified as a symbolic mode (for example, C(u+rwx) or C(u=rw,g=r,o=r)).
owner: ${13:null} # not required. Name of the user that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).

validate: ${14:None} # not required. The validation command to run before copying into place. The path to the file to validate is passed in via '%s' which must be present as in the example below. The command is passed securely so shell features like expansion and pipes won't work.

attributes: ${15:None} # not required. Attributes the file or directory should have. To get supported flags look at the man page for I(chattr) on the target system. This string should contain the attributes in the same order as the one displayed by I(lsattr).
seuser: ${16:null} # not required. User part of SELinux file context. Will default to system policy, if applicable. If set to C(_default), it will use the C(user) portion of the policy if available.

checksum: ${17:undefined} # not required. SHA1 checksum of the file being transferred. Used to valdiate that the copy of the file was successful.,If this is not provided, ansible will use the local calculated checksum of the src file.
local_follow: ${18:yes} # not required. This flag indicates that filesystem links in the source tree, if they exist, should be followed.
serole: ${19:null} # not required. Role part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
group: ${20:null} # not required. Name of the group that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).
follow: ${21:no} # not required. This flag indicates that filesystem links in the destination, if they exist, should be followed.
cpanm:
executable: ${1:null} # not required. Override the path to the cpanm executable
mirror_only: ${2:false} # not required. Use the mirror's index file instead of the CPAN Meta DB
version: ${3:false} # not required. minimum version of perl module to consider acceptable

system_lib: ${4:false} # not required. Use this if you want to install modules to the system perl include path. You must be root or have "passwordless" sudo for this to work.,This uses the cpanm commandline option '--sudo', which has nothing to do with ansible privilege escalation.
name: ${5:null} # not required. The name of the Perl library to install. You may use the "full distribution path", e.g.  MIYAGAWA/Plack-0.99_05.tar.gz
locallib: ${6:false} # not required. Specify the install base to install modules
from_path: ${7:null} # not required. The local directory from where to install
notest: ${8:false} # not required. Do not run unit tests
mirror: ${9:false} # not required. Specifies the base URL for the CPAN mirror to use
installdeps: ${10:false} # not required. Only install dependencies
cron:
reboot: ${1:no} # not required. If the job should be run at reboot. This option is deprecated. Users should use special_time.
backup: ${2:no} # not required. If set, create a backup of the crontab before it is modified. The location of the backup is returned in the C(backup_file) variable by this module.
day: ${3:*} # not required. Day of the month the job should run ( 1-31, *, */2, etc )

env: ${4:no} # not required. If set, manages a crontab's environment variable. New variables are added on top of crontab. "name" and "value" parameters are the name and the value of environment variable.
disabled: ${5:no} # not required. If the job should be disabled (commented out) in the crontab.,Only has effect if C(state=present).
month: ${6:*} # not required. Month of the year the job should run ( 1-12, *, */2, etc )
special_time: ${7|reboot,yearly,annually,monthly,weekly,daily,hourly|} # not required. choices: reboot;yearly;annually;monthly;weekly;daily;hourly. Special time specification nickname.

cron_file: ${8:undefined} # not required. If specified, uses this file instead of an individual user's crontab. If this is a relative path, it is interpreted with respect to /etc/cron.d. (If it is absolute, it will typically be /etc/crontab). Many linux distros expect (and some require) the filename portion to consist solely of upper- and lower-case letters, digits, underscores, and hyphens. To use the C(cron_file) parameter you must specify the C(user) as well.
job: ${9:undefined} # not required. The command to execute or, if env is set, the value of environment variable. The command should not contain line breaks. Required if state=present.
hour: ${10:*} # not required. Hour when the job should run ( 0-23, *, */2, etc )
insertafter: ${11:undefined} # not required. Used with C(state=present) and C(env). If specified, the environment variable will be inserted after the declaration of specified environment variable.
weekday: ${12:*} # not required. Day of the week that the job should run ( 0-6 for Sunday-Saturday, *, etc )
user: ${13:root} # not required. The specific user whose crontab should be modified.
insertbefore: ${14:undefined} # not required. Used with C(state=present) and C(env). If specified, the environment variable will be inserted before the declaration of specified environment variable.

name: ${15:undefined} # not required. Description of a crontab entry or, if env is set, the name of environment variable. Required if state=absent. Note that if name is not set and state=present, then a new crontab entry will always be created, regardless of existing ones.
state: ${16|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Whether to ensure the job or environment variable is present or absent.
minute: ${17:*} # not required. Minute when the job should run ( 0-59, *, */2, etc )
cronvar:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the crontab variable.
insertafter: ${2:undefined} # not required. If specified, the variable will be inserted after the variable specified.,Used with C(state=present).
backup: ${3:no} # not required. If set, create a backup of the crontab before it is modified. The location of the backup is returned in the C(backup) variable by this module.
value: ${4:undefined} # not required. The value to set this variable to.,Required if C(state=present).
user: ${5:root} # not required. The specific user whose crontab should be modified.
insertbefore: ${6:undefined} # not required. Used with C(state=present). If specified, the variable will be inserted just before the variable specified.
state: ${7|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Whether to ensure that the variable is present or absent.

cron_file: ${8:undefined} # not required. If specified, uses this file instead of an individual user's crontab. Without a leading /, this is assumed to be in /etc/cron.d.  With a leading /, this is taken as absolute.
crypttab:

state: ${1|absent,opts_absent,opts_present,present|} # required. choices: absent;opts_absent;opts_present;present. Use I(present) to add a line to C(/etc/crypttab) or update it's definition if already present. Use I(absent) to remove a line with matching I(name). Use I(opts_present) to add options to those already present; options with different values will be updated. Use I(opts_absent) to remove options from the existing set.

name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the encrypted block device as it appears in the C(/etc/crypttab) file, or optionally prefixed with C(/dev/mapper/), as it appears in the filesystem. I(/dev/mapper/) will be stripped from I(name).
backing_device: ${3:undefined} # not required. Path to the underlying block device or file, or the UUID of a block-device prefixed with I(UUID=).
path: ${4:/etc/crypttab} # not required. Path to file to use instead of C(/etc/crypttab). This might be useful in a chroot environment.
opts: ${5:undefined} # not required. A comma-delimited list of options. See C(crypttab(5) ) for details.
password: ${6:none} # not required. Encryption password, the path to a file containing the password, or C(none) or C(-) if the password should be entered at boot.

cs_account.description: Manages accounts on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_account:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of account.
timezone: ${2:null} # not required. Timezone of the user to be created if account did not exist.

api_timeout: ${3:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.

api_key: ${4:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_http_method: ${5|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.
password: ${6:null} # not required. Password of the user to be created if account did not exist.,Required on C(state=present).

api_url: ${7:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
poll_async: ${8:true} # not required. Poll async jobs until job has finished.
network_domain: ${9:null} # not required. Network domain of the account.
email: ${10:null} # not required. Email of the user to be created if account did not exist.,Required on C(state=present).
domain: ${11:ROOT} # not required. Domain the account is related to.
first_name: ${12:null} # not required. First name of the user to be created if account did not exist.,Required on C(state=present).
account_type: ${13|user,root_admin,domain_admin|} # not required. choices: user;root_admin;domain_admin. Type of the account.
last_name: ${14:null} # not required. Last name of the user to be created if account did not exist.,Required on C(state=present).

api_secret: ${15:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
api_region: ${16:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.
state: ${17|present,absent,enabled,disabled,locked,unlocked|} # not required. choices: present;absent;enabled;disabled;locked;unlocked. State of the account.,C(unlocked) is an alias for C(enabled).
username: ${18:null} # not required. Username of the user to be created if account did not exist.,Required on C(state=present).

cs_affinitygroup.description: Manages affinity groups on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_affinitygroup:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the affinity group.

api_timeout: ${2:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.
description: ${3:null} # not required. Description of the affinity group.

api_http_method: ${4|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.
poll_async: ${5:true} # not required. Poll async jobs until job has finished.

api_url: ${6:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
account: ${7:null} # not required. Account the affinity group is related to.
domain: ${8:null} # not required. Domain the affinity group is related to.

api_secret: ${9:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
project: ${10:null} # not required. Name of the project the affinity group is related to.

api_key: ${11:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
api_region: ${12:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.
state: ${13|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the affinity group.
affinity_type: ${14:null} # not required. Type of the affinity group. If not specified, first found affinity type is used.

cs_cluster.description: Manages host clusters on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_cluster:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. name of the cluster.
vms_password: ${2:null} # not required. Password for the VSM associated with this cluster.

api_secret: ${3:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
vms_username: ${4:null} # not required. Username for the VSM associated with this cluster.

api_url: ${5:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
ovm3_pool: ${6:null} # not required. Ovm3 native pooling enabled for cluster.
ovm3_vip: ${7:null} # not required. Ovm3 vip to use for pool (and cluster).
zone: ${8:null} # not required. Name of the zone in which the cluster belongs to.,If not set, default zone is used.
pod: ${9:null} # not required. Name of the pod in which the cluster belongs to.
api_region: ${10:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.
ovm3_cluster: ${11:null} # not required. Ovm3 native OCFS2 clustering enabled for cluster.
guest_vswitch_name: ${12:null} # not required. Name of virtual switch used for guest traffic in the cluster.,This would override zone wide traffic label setting.
vms_ip_address: ${13:null} # not required. IP address of the VSM associated with this cluster.

api_timeout: ${14:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.

api_key: ${15:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_http_method: ${16|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.

guest_vswitch_type: ${17|vmwaresvs,vmwaredvs|} # not required. choices: vmwaresvs;vmwaredvs. Type of virtual switch used for guest traffic in the cluster.,Allowed values are, vmwaresvs (for VMware standard vSwitch) and vmwaredvs (for VMware distributed vSwitch)
password: ${18:null} # not required. Password for the cluster.

hypervisor: ${19|KVM,VMware,BareMetal,XenServer,LXC,HyperV,UCS,OVM|} # not required. choices: KVM;VMware;BareMetal;XenServer;LXC;HyperV;UCS;OVM. Name the hypervisor to be used.,Required if C(state=present).
public_vswitch_name: ${20:null} # not required. Name of virtual switch used for public traffic in the cluster.,This would override zone wide traffic label setting.

public_vswitch_type: ${21|vmwaresvs,vmwaredvs|} # not required. choices: vmwaresvs;vmwaredvs. Type of virtual switch used for public traffic in the cluster.,Allowed values are, vmwaresvs (for VMware standard vSwitch) and vmwaredvs (for VMware distributed vSwitch)
url: ${22:null} # not required. URL for the cluster
state: ${23|present,absent,disabled,enabled|} # not required. choices: present;absent;disabled;enabled. State of the cluster.
username: ${24:null} # not required. Username for the cluster.
cluster_type: ${25|CloudManaged,ExternalManaged|} # not required. choices: CloudManaged;ExternalManaged. Type of the cluster.,Required if C(state=present)

cs_configuration.description: Manages configuration on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_configuration:
value: ${1:undefined} # required. Value of the configuration.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the configuration.
cluster: ${3:null} # not required. Ensure the value for corresponding cluster.

api_timeout: ${4:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.

api_key: ${5:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_http_method: ${6|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.

api_url: ${7:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
account: ${8:null} # not required. Ensure the value for corresponding account.
domain: ${9:ROOT} # not required. Domain the account is related to.,Only considered if C(account) is used.
zone: ${10:null} # not required. Ensure the value for corresponding zone.

api_secret: ${11:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
api_region: ${12:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.
storage: ${13:null} # not required. Ensure the value for corresponding storage pool.

cs_domain.description: Manages domains on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_domain:
path: ${1:undefined} # required. Path of the domain.,Prefix C(ROOT/) or C(/ROOT/) in path is optional.

api_timeout: ${2:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.

api_key: ${3:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
clean_up: ${4:false} # not required. Clean up all domain resources like child domains and accounts.,Considered on C(state=absent).
poll_async: ${5:true} # not required. Poll async jobs until job has finished.

api_secret: ${6:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_url: ${7:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the domain.
network_domain: ${9:undefined} # not required. Network domain for networks in the domain.
api_region: ${10:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.

api_http_method: ${11|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.

cs_facts.description: Gather facts on instances of Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_facts:
meta_data_host: ${1:undefined} # not required. Host or IP of the meta data API service.,If not set, determination by parsing the dhcp lease file.

filter: ${2|cloudstack_service_offering,cloudstack_availability_zone,cloudstack_public_hostname,cloudstack_public_ipv4,cloudstack_local_hostname,cloudstack_local_ipv4,cloudstack_instance_id,cloudstack_user_data|} # not required. choices: cloudstack_service_offering;cloudstack_availability_zone;cloudstack_public_hostname;cloudstack_public_ipv4;cloudstack_local_hostname;cloudstack_local_ipv4;cloudstack_instance_id;cloudstack_user_data. Filter for a specific fact.

cs_firewall.description: Manages firewall rules on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_firewall:
type: ${1|ingress,egress|} # not required. choices: ingress;egress. Type of the firewall rule.
icmp_code: ${2:undefined} # not required. Error code for this icmp message.,Considered if C(protocol=icmp).
tags: ${3:undefined} # not required. List of tags. Tags are a list of dictionaries having keys C(key) and C(value).,To delete all tags, set a empty list e.g. C(tags: []).

api_url: ${4:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
ip_address: ${5:undefined} # not required. Public IP address the ingress rule is assigned to.,Required if C(type=ingress).
cidrs: ${6:0.0.0.0/0} # not required. List of CIDRs (full notation) to be used for firewall rule.,Since version 2.5, it is a list of CIDR.
start_port: ${7:undefined} # not required. Start port for this rule.,Considered if C(protocol=tcp) or C(protocol=udp).
zone: ${8:undefined} # not required. Name of the zone in which the virtual machine is in.,If not set, default zone is used.

api_secret: ${9:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
network: ${10:undefined} # not required. Network the egress rule is related to.,Required if C(type=egress).
api_region: ${11:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.

api_timeout: ${12:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.
protocol: ${13|tcp,udp,icmp,all|} # not required. choices: tcp;udp;icmp;all. Protocol of the firewall rule.,C(all) is only available if C(type=egress).

api_key: ${14:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_http_method: ${15|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.
poll_async: ${16:true} # not required. Poll async jobs until job has finished.
account: ${17:undefined} # not required. Account the firewall rule is related to.
domain: ${18:undefined} # not required. Domain the firewall rule is related to.
project: ${19:undefined} # not required. Name of the project the firewall rule is related to.
end_port: ${20:undefined} # not required. End port for this rule. Considered if C(protocol=tcp) or C(protocol=udp).,If not specified, equal C(start_port).
icmp_type: ${21:undefined} # not required. Type of the icmp message being sent.,Considered if C(protocol=icmp).
state: ${22|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the firewall rule.

cs_host.description: Manages hosts on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_host:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the host.
cluster: ${2:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster.

api_timeout: ${3:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.

api_key: ${4:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_http_method: ${5|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.
password: ${6:undefined} # not required. Password for the host.,Required if C(state=present) and host does not yet exist.

hypervisor: ${7|KVM,VMware,BareMetal,XenServer,LXC,HyperV,UCS,OVM,Simulator|} # not required. choices: KVM;VMware;BareMetal;XenServer;LXC;HyperV;UCS;OVM;Simulator. Name of the cluster.,Required if C(state=present) and host does not yet exist.

api_url: ${8:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
allocation_state: ${9|enabled,disabled|} # not required. choices: enabled;disabled. Allocation state of the host.
pod: ${10:undefined} # not required. Name of the pod.,Required if C(state=present) and host does not yet exist.
api_region: ${11:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.

api_secret: ${12:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

url: ${13:undefined} # not required. Url of the host used to create a host.,If not provided, C(http://) and param C(name) is used as url.,Only considered if C(state=present) and host does not yet exist.
state: ${14|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the host.
username: ${15:undefined} # not required. Username for the host.,Required if C(state=present) and host does not yet exist.
host_tags: ${16:undefined} # not required. Tags of the host.
zone: ${17:undefined} # not required. Name of the zone in which the host should be deployed.,If not set, default zone is used.

cs_instance.description: Manages instances and virtual machines on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_instance:
memory: ${1:undefined} # not required. The memory allocated to the instance, used with custom service offerings
security_groups: ${2:undefined} # not required. List of security groups the instance to be applied to.
disk_size: ${3:undefined} # not required. Disk size in GByte required if deploying instance from ISO.
service_offering: ${4:undefined} # not required. Name or id of the service offering of the new instance.,If not set, first found service offering is used.

api_secret: ${5:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
iso: ${6:undefined} # not required. Name or id of the ISO to be used for creating the new instance.,Required when using C(state=present).,Mutually exclusive with C(template) option.
tags: ${7:undefined} # not required. List of tags. Tags are a list of dictionaries having keys C(key) and C(value).,If you want to delete all tags, set a empty list e.g. C(tags: []).

api_url: ${8:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
ip_address: ${9:undefined} # not required. IPv4 address for default instance's network during creation.

template_filter: ${10|featured,self,selfexecutable,sharedexecutable,executable,community|} # not required. choices: featured;self;selfexecutable;sharedexecutable;executable;community. Name of the filter used to search for the template or iso.,Used for params C(iso) or C(template) on C(state=present).
ip_to_networks: ${11:undefined} # not required. List of mappings in the form {'network': NetworkName, 'ip': 1.2.3.4},Mutually exclusive with C(networks) option.
networks: ${12:undefined} # not required. List of networks to use for the new instance.

name: ${13:undefined} # not required. Host name of the instance. C(name) can only contain ASCII letters.,Name will be generated (UUID) by CloudStack if not specified and can not be changed afterwards.,Either C(name) or C(display_name) is required.
cpu_speed: ${14:undefined} # not required. The clock speed/shares allocated to the instance, used with custom service offerings

keyboard: ${15|de,de-ch,es,fi,fr,fr-be,fr-ch,is,it,jp,nl-be,false,pt,uk,us|} # not required. choices: de;de-ch;es;fi;fr;fr-be;fr-ch;is;it;jp;nl-be;false;pt;uk;us. Keyboard device type for the instance.

api_key: ${16:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
display_name: ${17:undefined} # not required. Custom display name of the instances.,Display name will be set to C(name) if not specified.,Either C(name) or C(display_name) is required.
group: ${18:undefined} # not required. Group in where the new instance should be in.

api_http_method: ${19|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.

api_timeout: ${20:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.

root_disk_size: ${21:undefined} # not required. Root disk size in GByte required if deploying instance with KVM hypervisor and want resize the root disk size at startup (need CloudStack >= 4.4, cloud-initramfs-growroot installed and enabled in the template)
template: ${22:undefined} # not required. Name or id of the template to be used for creating the new instance.,Required when using C(state=present).,Mutually exclusive with C(ISO) option.
affinity_groups: ${23:undefined} # not required. Affinity groups names to be applied to the new instance.
poll_async: ${24:true} # not required. Poll async jobs until job has finished.

hypervisor: ${25|KVM,VMware,BareMetal,XenServer,LXC,HyperV,UCS,OVM,Simulator|} # not required. choices: KVM;VMware;BareMetal;XenServer;LXC;HyperV;UCS;OVM;Simulator. Name the hypervisor to be used for creating the new instance.,Relevant when using C(state=present), but only considered if not set on ISO/template.,If not set or found on ISO/template, first found hypervisor will be used.
cpu: ${26:undefined} # not required. The number of CPUs to allocate to the instance, used with custom service offerings

user_data: ${27:undefined} # not required. Optional data (ASCII) that can be sent to the instance upon a successful deployment.,The data will be automatically base64 encoded.,Consider switching to HTTP_POST by using C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD=post) to increase the HTTP_GET size limit of 2KB to 32 KB.
account: ${28:undefined} # not required. Account the instance is related to.
force: ${29:false} # not required. Force stop/start the instance if required to apply changes, otherwise a running instance will not be changed.
domain: ${30:undefined} # not required. Domain the instance is related to.
ssh_key: ${31:undefined} # not required. Name of the SSH key to be deployed on the new instance.
project: ${32:undefined} # not required. Name of the project the instance to be deployed in.
api_region: ${33:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.

state: ${34|deployed,started,stopped,restarted,restored,destroyed,expunged,present,absent|} # not required. choices: deployed;started;stopped;restarted;restored;destroyed;expunged;present;absent. State of the instance.
disk_offering: ${35:undefined} # not required. Name of the disk offering to be used.
ip6_address: ${36:undefined} # not required. IPv6 address for default instance's network.
zone: ${37:undefined} # not required. Name of the zone in which the instance should be deployed.,If not set, default zone is used.

cs_instance_facts.description: Gathering facts from the API of instances from Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_instance_facts:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name or display name of the instance.
domain: ${2:undefined} # not required. Domain the instance is related to.

api_key: ${3:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_http_method: ${4|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.
project: ${5:undefined} # not required. Project the instance is related to.
api_region: ${6:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.

api_secret: ${7:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_url: ${8:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_timeout: ${9:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.
account: ${10:undefined} # not required. Account the instance is related to.

cs_instance_nic.description: Manages NICs of an instance on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_instance_nic:
vm: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of instance.
network: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the network.

api_timeout: ${3:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.

api_key: ${4:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_http_method: ${5|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.
poll_async: ${6:true} # not required. Poll async jobs until job has finished.
vpc: ${7:null} # not required. Name of the VPC the C(vm) is related to.
ip_address: ${8:null} # not required. IP address to be used for the nic.
account: ${9:null} # not required. Account the instance is related to.
domain: ${10:null} # not required. Domain the instance is related to.
zone: ${11:null} # not required. Name of the zone in which the instance is deployed in.,If not set, default zone is used.
project: ${12:null} # not required. Name of the project the instance is deployed in.

api_secret: ${13:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
api_region: ${14:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.
state: ${15|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the nic.

api_url: ${16:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

cs_instance_nic_secondaryip.description: Manages secondary IPs of an instance on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_instance_nic_secondaryip:
vm: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of instance.

api_timeout: ${2:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.

api_key: ${3:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_http_method: ${4|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.
poll_async: ${5:true} # not required. Poll async jobs until job has finished.
vpc: ${6:undefined} # not required. Name of the VPC the C(vm) is related to.
account: ${7:undefined} # not required. Account the instance is related to.
domain: ${8:undefined} # not required. Domain the instance is related to.
zone: ${9:undefined} # not required. Name of the zone in which the instance is deployed in.,If not set, default zone is used.
project: ${10:undefined} # not required. Name of the project the instance is deployed in.
vm_guest_ip: ${11:undefined} # not required. Secondary IP address to be added to the instance nic.,If not set, the API always returns a new IP address and idempotency is not given.

api_secret: ${12:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
api_region: ${13:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.
state: ${14|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the ipaddress.
network: ${15:undefined} # not required. Name of the network.,Required to find the NIC if instance has multiple networks assigned.

api_url: ${16:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

cs_instancegroup.description: Manages instance groups on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_instancegroup:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the instance group.
domain: ${2:null} # not required. Domain the instance group is related to.
api_region: ${3:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.

api_key: ${4:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_http_method: ${5|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.
project: ${6:null} # not required. Project the instance group is related to.

api_timeout: ${7:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.

api_secret: ${8:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_url: ${9:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the instance group.
account: ${11:null} # not required. Account the instance group is related to.

cs_ip_address.description: Manages public IP address associations on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_ip_address:

api_timeout: ${1:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.

api_key: ${2:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_http_method: ${3|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.
poll_async: ${4:true} # not required. Poll async jobs until job has finished.
vpc: ${5:undefined} # not required. VPC the IP address is related to.
ip_address: ${6:undefined} # not required. Public IP address.,Required if C(state=absent)
account: ${7:undefined} # not required. Account the IP address is related to.
domain: ${8:undefined} # not required. Domain the IP address is related to.
zone: ${9:undefined} # not required. Name of the zone in which the IP address is in.,If not set, default zone is used.
project: ${10:undefined} # not required. Name of the project the IP address is related to.

api_secret: ${11:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
api_region: ${12:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.
state: ${13|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the IP address.
network: ${14:undefined} # not required. Network the IP address is related to.

api_url: ${15:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

cs_iso.description: Manages ISO images on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_iso:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the ISO.
cross_zones: ${2:false} # not required. Whether the ISO should be synced or removed across zones.,Mutually exclusive with C(zone).

api_secret: ${3:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
tags: ${4:null} # not required. List of tags. Tags are a list of dictionaries having keys C(key) and C(value).,To delete all tags, set a empty list e.g. C(tags: []).
bootable: ${5:null} # not required. Register the ISO to be bootable. Only used if C(state) is present.

api_url: ${6:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
is_public: ${7:null} # not required. Register the ISO to be publicly available to all users. Only used if C(state) is present.
zone: ${8:null} # not required. Name of the zone you wish the ISO to be registered or deleted from.,If not specified, first zone found will be used.
checksum: ${9:null} # not required. The MD5 checksum value of this ISO. If set, we search by checksum instead of name.

iso_filter: ${10|featured,self,selfexecutable,sharedexecutable,executable,community|} # not required. choices: featured;self;selfexecutable;sharedexecutable;executable;community. Name of the filter used to search for the ISO.
display_text: ${11:null} # not required. Display text of the ISO.,If not specified, C(name) will be used.
api_region: ${12:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.

api_timeout: ${13:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.
is_dynamically_scalable: ${14:null} # not required. Register the ISO having XS/VMWare tools installed inorder to support dynamic scaling of VM cpu/memory. Only used if C(state) is present.

api_key: ${15:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_http_method: ${16|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.
poll_async: ${17:true} # not required. Poll async jobs until job has finished.

is_ready: ${18:false} # not required. This flag is used for searching existing ISOs. If set to C(true), it will only list ISO ready for deployment e.g. successfully downloaded and installed. Recommended to set it to C(false).
account: ${19:null} # not required. Account the ISO is related to.
is_featured: ${20:null} # not required. Register the ISO to be featured. Only used if C(state) is present.
domain: ${21:null} # not required. Domain the ISO is related to.
os_type: ${22:null} # not required. Name of the OS that best represents the OS of this ISO. If the iso is bootable this parameter needs to be passed. Required if C(state) is present.
project: ${23:null} # not required. Name of the project the ISO to be registered in.
url: ${24:null} # not required. URL where the ISO can be downloaded from. Required if C(state) is present.
state: ${25|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the ISO.

cs_loadbalancer_rule.description: Manages load balancer rules on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_loadbalancer_rule:
state: ${1|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. State of the rule.

public_port: ${2:null} # required. The public port from where the network traffic will be load balanced from.,Required when using C(state=present).,Can not be changed once the rule exists due API limitation.
ip_address: ${3:undefined} # required. Public IP address from where the network traffic will be load balanced from.
name: ${4:undefined} # required. The name of the load balancer rule.

private_port: ${5:null} # not required. The private port of the private ip address/virtual machine where the network traffic will be load balanced to.,Required when using C(state=present).,Can not be changed once the rule exists due API limitation.
protocol: ${6:null} # not required. The protocol to be used on the load balancer
description: ${7:null} # not required. The description of the load balancer rule.

api_http_method: ${8|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.

api_key: ${9:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_timeout: ${10:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.

api_url: ${11:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
account: ${12:null} # not required. Account the rule is related to.
domain: ${13:null} # not required. Domain the rule is related to.

api_secret: ${14:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
zone: ${15:null} # not required. Name of the zone in which the rule should be created.,If not set, default zone is used.
project: ${16:null} # not required. Name of the project the load balancer IP address is related to.
cidr: ${17:null} # not required. CIDR (full notation) to be used for firewall rule if required.
api_region: ${18:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.
open_firewall: ${19:false} # not required. Whether the firewall rule for public port should be created, while creating the new rule.,Use M(cs_firewall) for managing firewall rules.
algorithm: ${20|source,roundrobin,leastconn|} # not required. choices: source;roundrobin;leastconn. Load balancer algorithm,Required when using C(state=present).

cs_loadbalancer_rule_member.description: Manages load balancer rule members on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_loadbalancer_rule_member:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the load balancer rule.
vms: ${2:undefined} # required. List of VMs to assign to or remove from the rule.

api_timeout: ${3:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.

api_key: ${4:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_http_method: ${5|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.

api_url: ${6:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
ip_address: ${7:null} # not required. Public IP address from where the network traffic will be load balanced from.,Only needed to find the rule if C(name) is not unique.
account: ${8:null} # not required. Account the rule is related to.
domain: ${9:null} # not required. Domain the rule is related to.
zone: ${10:null} # not required. Name of the zone in which the rule should be located.,If not set, default zone is used.
project: ${11:null} # not required. Name of the project the firewall rule is related to.

api_secret: ${12:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
api_region: ${13:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.
state: ${14|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the VMs be present or absent from the rule.

cs_network.description: Manages networks on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_network:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name (case sensitive) of the network.
start_ipv6: ${2:undefined} # not required. The beginning IPv6 address of the network belongs to.,Only considered on create.

api_secret: ${3:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
clean_up: ${4:false} # not required. Cleanup old network elements.,Only considered on C(state=restarted).
api_region: ${5:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.
vlan: ${6:undefined} # not required. The ID or VID of the network.
vpc: ${7:undefined} # not required. Name of the VPC of the network.
netmask: ${8:undefined} # not required. The netmask of the network.,Required for shared networks and isolated networks when it belongs to a VPC.,Only considered on create.
isolated_pvlan: ${9:undefined} # not required. The isolated private VLAN for this network.
zone: ${10:undefined} # not required. Name of the zone in which the network should be deployed.,If not set, default zone is used.
end_ip: ${11:undefined} # not required. The ending IPv4 address of the network belongs to.,If not specified, value of C(start_ip) is used.,Only considered on create.
acl: ${12:undefined} # not required. The name of the access control list for the VPC network tier.
display_text: ${13:undefined} # not required. Display text of the network.,If not specified, C(name) will be used as C(display_text).
cidr_ipv6: ${14:undefined} # not required. CIDR of IPv6 network, must be at least /64.,Only considered on create.
gateway: ${15:undefined} # not required. The gateway of the network.,Required for shared networks and isolated networks when it belongs to a VPC.,Only considered on create.

api_url: ${16:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_timeout: ${17:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.

api_key: ${18:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_http_method: ${19|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.
poll_async: ${20:true} # not required. Poll async jobs until job has finished.
gateway_ipv6: ${21:undefined} # not required. The gateway of the IPv6 network.,Required for shared networks.,Only considered on create.
network_offering: ${22:undefined} # not required. Name of the offering for the network.,Required if C(state=present).
network_domain: ${23:undefined} # not required. The network domain.
account: ${24:undefined} # not required. Account the network is related to.
domain: ${25:undefined} # not required. Domain the network is related to.
start_ip: ${26:undefined} # not required. The beginning IPv4 address of the network belongs to.,Only considered on create.
end_ipv6: ${27:undefined} # not required. The ending IPv6 address of the network belongs to.,If not specified, value of C(start_ipv6) is used.,Only considered on create.
project: ${28:undefined} # not required. Name of the project the network to be deployed in.

subdomain_access: ${29:undefined} # not required. Defines whether to allow subdomains to use networks dedicated to their parent domain(s).,Should be used with C(acl_type=domain).,Only considered on create.
state: ${30|present,absent,restarted|} # not required. choices: present;absent;restarted. State of the network.
acl_type: ${31|account,domain|} # not required. choices: account;domain. Access control type for the VPC network tier.,Only considered on create.

cs_network_acl.description: Manages network access control lists (ACL) on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_network_acl:
vpc: ${1:undefined} # required. VPC the network ACL is related to.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the network ACL.

api_timeout: ${3:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.
description: ${4:null} # not required. Description of the network ACL.,If not set, identical to C(name).

api_http_method: ${5|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.
poll_async: ${6:true} # not required. Poll async jobs until job has finished.
account: ${7:null} # not required. Account the network ACL rule is related to.
domain: ${8:null} # not required. Domain the network ACL rule is related to.

api_secret: ${9:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
zone: ${10:null} # not required. Name of the zone the VPC is related to.,If not set, default zone is used.
project: ${11:null} # not required. Name of the project the network ACL is related to.

api_key: ${12:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
api_region: ${13:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.
state: ${14|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the network ACL.

api_url: ${15:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

cs_network_acl_rule.description: Manages network access control list (ACL) rules on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_network_acl_rule:
rule_position: ${1:undefined} # required. CIDR of the rule.
vpc: ${2:undefined} # required. VPC the network ACL is related to.
network_acl: ${3:undefined} # required. Name of the network ACL.
icmp_code: ${4:null} # not required. Error code for this icmp message.,Considered if C(protocol=icmp).
tags: ${5:null} # not required. List of tags. Tags are a list of dictionaries having keys C(key) and C(value).,If you want to delete all tags, set a empty list e.g. C(tags: []).
action_policy: ${6|allow,deny|} # not required. choices: allow;deny. Action policy of the rule.
start_port: ${7:null} # not required. Start port for this rule.,Considered if C(protocol=tcp) or C(protocol=udp).
zone: ${8:null} # not required. Name of the zone the VPC related to.,If not set, default zone is used.
api_region: ${9:cloudstack} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(cloustack.ini) file.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_REGION) env variable is considered.
cidr: ${10:0.0.0.0/0} # not required. CIDR of the rule.
protocol_number: ${11:null} # not required. Protocol number from 1 to 256 required if C(protocol=by_number).
traffic_type: ${12|ingress,egress|} # not required. choices: ingress;egress. Traffic type of the rule.

api_timeout: ${13:undefined} # not required. HTTP timeout in seconds.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_TIMEOUT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is 10 seconds if not specified.
protocol: ${14|tcp,udp,icmp,all,by_number|} # not required. choices: tcp;udp;icmp;all;by_number. Protocol of the rule

api_key: ${15:undefined} # not required. API key of the CloudStack API.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_KEY) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

api_http_method: ${16|get,post|} # not required. choices: get;post. HTTP method used to query the API endpoint.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_METHOD) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.,Fallback value is C(get) if not specified.
poll_async: ${17:true} # not required. Poll async jobs until job has finished.
account: ${18:null} # not required. Account the VPC is related to.
domain: ${19:null} # not required. Domain the VPC is related to.

api_secret: ${20:undefined} # not required. Secret key of the CloudStack API.,If not set, the C(CLOUDSTACK_SECRET) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.
project: ${21:null} # not required. Name of the project the VPC is related to.
end_port: ${22:null} # not required. End port for this rule.,Considered if C(protocol=tcp) or C(protocol=udp).,If not specified, equal C(start_port).
icmp_type: ${23:null} # not required. Type of the icmp message being sent.,Considered if C(protocol=icmp).
state: ${24|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the network ACL rule.

api_url: ${25:undefined} # not required. URL of the CloudStack API e.g. https://cloud.example.com/client/api.,If not given, the C(CLOUDSTACK_ENDPOINT) env variable is considered.,As the last option, the value is taken from the ini config file, also see the notes.

cs_network_offering.description: Manages network offerings on Apache CloudStack based clouds.
body: cs_network_offering:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the network offering.
service_offering: ${2:undefined} # not required. The service offering name or ID used by virtual router provider.
