cv_server_provision.description: Provision server port by applying or removing template configuration to an Arista CloudVision Portal configlet that is applied to a switch.
body: cv_server_provision:

template: ${1:undefined} # required. A path to a Jinja formatted template file that contains the configuration block that will be applied to the specified switch port. This template will have variable fields replaced by the module before being applied to the switch configuration.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the user that will be used to connect to CVP for API calls.
switch_name: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname of the switch is being configured for the server being provisioned.
server_name: ${4:undefined} # required. The hostname or identifier for the server that is having it's switch port provisioned.
switch_port: ${5:undefined} # required. The physical port number on the switch that the new server is connected to.
host: ${6:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the CVP node being connected to.
username: ${7:undefined} # required. The user that will be used to connect to CVP for making API calls.
protocol: ${8|https,http|} # not required. choices: https;http. The protocol to use when making API calls to CVP. CVP defaults to https and newer versions of CVP no longer support http.

port: ${9:None} # not required. The port number to use when making API calls to the CVP node. This will default to the default port for the specified protocol. Port 80 for http and port 443 for https.

port_vlan: ${10:None} # not required. The vlan that should be applied to the port for this server. This parameter is dependent on a proper template that supports single vlan provisioning with it. If a port vlan is specified by the template specified does not support this the module will exit out with no changes. If a template is specified that requires a port vlan but no port vlan is specified the module will exit out with no changes.

auto_run: ${11:false} # not required. Flag that determines whether or not the module will execute the CVP task spawned as a result of changes to a switch configlet. When an add or remove action is taken which results in a change to a switch configlet, CVP will spawn a task that needs to be executed for the configuration to be applied to the switch. If this option is True then the module will determined the task number created by the configuration change, execute it and wait for the task to complete. If the option is False then the task will remain in the Pending state in CVP for a network administrator to review and execute.

action: ${12|show,add,remove|} # not required. choices: show;add;remove. The action for the module to take. The actions are add, which applies the specified template config to port, remove, which defaults the specified interface configuration, and show, which will return the current port configuration with no changes.

cyberark_authentication.description: Module for CyberArk Vault Authentication using PAS Web Services SDK
body: cyberark_authentication:
api_base_url: ${1:undefined} # not required. A string containing the base URL of the server hosting CyberArk's Privileged Account Security Web Services SDK.
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. If C(false), SSL certificates will not be validated.  This should only set to C(false) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
new_password: ${3:undefined} # not required. The new password of the user. This parameter is optional, and enables you to change a password.
password: ${4:undefined} # not required. The password of the user.
use_radius_authentication: ${5:no} # not required. Whether or not users will be authenticated via a RADIUS server. Valid values are true/false.
cyberark_session: ${6:undefined} # not required. Dictionary set by a CyberArk authentication containing the different values to perform actions on a logged-on CyberArk session.
use_shared_logon_authentication: ${7:no} # not required. Whether or not Shared Logon Authentication will be used.
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specifies if an authentication logon/logoff and a cyberark_session should be added/removed.
username: ${9:undefined} # not required. The name of the user who will logon to the Vault.

cyberark_user.description: Module for CyberArk User Management using PAS Web Services SDK
body: cyberark_user:

cyberark_session: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary set by a CyberArk authentication containing the different values to perform actions on a logged-on CyberArk session, please see M(cyberark_authentication) module for an example of cyberark_session.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the user who will be queried (for details), added, updated or deleted.
location: ${3:undefined} # not required. The Vault Location for the user.
group_name: ${4:undefined} # not required. The name of the group the user will be added to.
new_password: ${5:undefined} # not required. The user updated password. Make sure that this password meets the password policy requirements.
user_type_name: ${6:EPVUser} # not required. The type of user.

initial_password: ${7:undefined} # not required. The password that the new user will use to log on the first time. This password must meet the password policy requirements. this parameter is required when state is present -- Add User.
email: ${8:undefined} # not required. The user email address.
disabled: ${9:no} # not required. Whether or not the user will be disabled. Valid values = true/false.
first_name: ${10:undefined} # not required. The user first name.
expiry_date: ${11:undefined} # not required. The date and time when the user account will expire and become disabled.
last_name: ${12:undefined} # not required. The user last name.
state: ${13|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specifies the state needed for the user present for create user, absent for delete user.
change_password_on_the_next_logon: ${14:no} # not required. Whether or not the user must change their password in their next logon. Valid values = true/false.
data_pipeline:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the Datapipeline to create/modify/delete.
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
description: ${4:} # not required. An optional description for the pipeline being created.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
tags: ${6:null} # not required. A dict of key:value pair(s) to add to the pipeline.
parameters: ${7:undefined} # not required. A list of parameter objects (dicts) in the pipeline definition.

ec2_url: ${8:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: ${9:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
values: ${10:undefined} # not required. A list of parameter values (dicts) in the pipeline definition. Each dict takes the keys C(id) and C(stringValue) both of which are strings.
objects: ${11:undefined} # not required. A list of pipeline object definitions, each of which is a dict that takes the keys C(id), C(name) and C(fields).
aws_access_key: ${12:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${13:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
timeout: ${14:300} # not required. Time in seconds to wait for the pipeline to transition to the requested state, fail otherwise.
state: ${15|present,absent,active,inactive|} # not required. choices: present;absent;active;inactive. The requested state of the pipeline.
datadog_event:
app_key: ${1:undefined} # required. Your DataDog app key.
api_key: ${2:null} # required. Your DataDog API key.
text: ${3:null} # required. The body of the event.
title: ${4:null} # required. The event title.
validate_certs: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
tags: ${6:null} # not required. Comma separated list of tags to apply to the event.
alert_type: ${7|error,warning,info,success|} # not required. choices: error;warning;info;success. Type of alert.
priority: ${8|normal,low|} # not required. choices: normal;low. The priority of the event.
host: ${9:{{ ansible_hostname }}} # not required. Host name to associate with the event.
date_happened: ${10:now} # not required. POSIX timestamp of the event.,Default value is now.
aggregation_key: ${11:null} # not required. An arbitrary string to use for aggregation.
datadog_monitor:
app_key: ${1:undefined} # required. Your DataDog app key.
api_key: ${2:undefined} # required. Your DataDog API key.
name: ${3:undefined} # required. The name of the alert.
state: ${4|present,absent,mute,unmute|} # required. choices: present;absent;mute;unmute. The designated state of the monitor.
type: ${5|metric alert,service check,event alert|} # not required. choices: metric alert;service check;event alert. The type of the monitor.,The 'event alert'is available starting at Ansible 2.1
notify_audit: ${6:false} # not required. A boolean indicating whether tagged users will be notified on changes to this monitor.
tags: ${7:None} # not required. A list of tags to associate with your monitor when creating or updating. This can help you categorize and filter monitors.

message: ${8:null} # not required. A message to include with notifications for this monitor. Email notifications can be sent to specific users by using the same '@username' notation as events. Monitor message template variables can be accessed by using double square brackets, i.e '[[' and ']]'.
timeout_h: ${9:null} # not required. The number of hours of the monitor not reporting data before it will automatically resolve from a triggered state.
silenced: ${10:} # not required. Dictionary of scopes to timestamps or None. Each scope will be muted until the given POSIX timestamp or forever if the value is None.

no_data_timeframe: ${11:2x timeframe for metric, 2 minutes for service} # not required. The number of minutes before a monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Must be at least 2x the monitor timeframe for metric alerts or 2 minutes for service checks.
query: ${12:null} # not required. The monitor query to notify on with syntax varying depending on what type of monitor you are creating.
new_host_delay: ${13:null} # not required. A positive integer representing the number of seconds to wait before evaluating the monitor for new hosts. This gives the host time to fully initialize.

require_full_window: ${14:null} # not required. A boolean indicating whether this monitor needs a full window of data before it's evaluated. We highly recommend you set this to False for sparse metrics, otherwise some evaluations will be skipped.
locked: ${15:false} # not required. A boolean indicating whether changes to this monitor should be restricted to the creator or admins.

thresholds: ${16:[object Object]} # not required. A dictionary of thresholds by status. This option is only available for service checks and metric alerts. Because each of them can have multiple thresholds, we don't define them directly in the query."]
id: ${17:null} # not required. The id of the alert. If set, will be used instead of the name to locate the alert.
notify_no_data: ${18:false} # not required. A boolean indicating whether this monitor will notify when data stops reporting..
escalation_message: ${19:null} # not required. A message to include with a re-notification. Supports the '@username' notification we allow elsewhere. Not applicable if renotify_interval is None
renotify_interval: ${20:null} # not required. The number of minutes after the last notification before a monitor will re-notify on the current status. It will only re-notify if it's not resolved.
dconf:
key: ${1:undefined} # required. A dconf key to modify or read from the dconf database.

value: ${2:undefined} # not required. Value to set for the specified dconf key. Value should be specified in GVariant format. Due to complexity of this format, it is best to have a look at existing values in the dconf database. Required for C(state=present).
state: ${3|read,present,absent|} # not required. choices: read;present;absent. The action to take upon the key/value.
debconf:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of package to configure.

vtype: ${2|boolean,error,multiselect,note,password,seen,select,string,text,title,text|} # not required. choices: boolean;error;multiselect;note;password;seen;select;string;text;title;text. The type of the value supplied.,C(seen) was added in 2.2.
value: ${3:undefined} # not required. Value to set the configuration to.
unseen: ${4:false} # not required. Do not set 'seen' flag when pre-seeding.
question: ${5:undefined} # not required. A debconf configuration setting.
debug:
msg: ${1:Hello world!} # not required. The customized message that is printed. If omitted, prints a generic message.
verbosity: ${2:0} # not required. A number that controls when the debug is run, if you set to 3 it will only run debug when -vvv or above
var: ${3:undefined} # not required. A variable name to debug.  Mutually exclusive with the 'msg' option.

dellos10_command.description: Run commands on remote devices running Dell OS10
body: dellos10_command:

commands: ${1:undefined} # required. List of commands to send to the remote dellos10 device over the configured provider. The resulting output from the command is returned. If the I(wait_for) argument is provided, the module is not returned until the condition is satisfied or the number of retries has expired.

match: ${2|any,all|} # not required. choices: any;all. The I(match) argument is used in conjunction with the I(wait_for) argument to specify the match policy.  Valid values are C(all) or C(any).  If the value is set to C(all) then all conditionals in the wait_for must be satisfied.  If the value is set to C(any) then only one of the values must be satisfied.

retries: ${3:10} # not required. Specifies the number of retries a command should be tried before it is considered failed. The command is run on the target device every retry and evaluated against the I(wait_for) conditions.

wait_for: ${4:null} # not required. List of conditions to evaluate against the output of the command. The task will wait for each condition to be true before moving forward. If the conditional is not true within the configured number of I(retries), the task fails. See examples.

interval: ${5:1} # not required. Configures the interval in seconds to wait between retries of the command. If the command does not pass the specified conditions, the interval indicates how long to wait before trying the command again.
provider: ${6:null} # not required. A dict object containing connection details.

dellos10_config.description: Manage Dell EMC Networking OS10 configuration sections
body: dellos10_config:

save: ${1|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. The C(save) argument instructs the module to save the running- config to the startup-config at the conclusion of the module running.  If check mode is specified, this argument is ignored.

backup: ${2:false} # not required. This argument will cause the module to create a full backup of the current C(running-config) from the remote device before any changes are made.  The backup file is written to the C(backup) folder in the playbook root directory.  If the directory does not exist, it is created.
provider: ${3:null} # not required. A dict object containing connection details.

replace: ${4|line,block|} # not required. choices: line;block. Instructs the module on the way to perform the configuration on the device.  If the replace argument is set to I(line) then the modified lines are pushed to the device in configuration mode.  If the replace argument is set to I(block) then the entire command block is pushed to the device in configuration mode if any line is not correct.

src: ${5:null} # not required. Specifies the source path to the file that contains the configuration or configuration template to load.  The path to the source file can either be the full path on the Ansible control host or a relative path from the playbook or role root directory. This argument is mutually exclusive with I(lines).

match: ${6|line,strict,exact,none|} # not required. choices: line;strict;exact;none. Instructs the module on the way to perform the matching of the set of commands against the current device config.  If match is set to I(line), commands are matched line by line.  If match is set to I(strict), command lines are matched with respect to position.  If match is set to I(exact), command lines must be an equal match.  Finally, if match is set to I(none), the module will not attempt to compare the source configuration with the running configuration on the remote device.

after: ${7:null} # not required. The ordered set of commands to append to the end of the command stack if a change needs to be made.  Just like with I(before) this allows the playbook designer to append a set of commands to be executed after the command set.

update: ${8|merge,check|} # not required. choices: merge;check. The I(update) argument controls how the configuration statements are processed on the remote device.  Valid choices for the I(update) argument are I(merge) and I(check).  When you set this argument to I(merge), the configuration changes merge with the current device running configuration.  When you set this argument to I(check) the configuration updates are determined but not actually configured on the remote device.

config: ${9:null} # not required. The module, by default, will connect to the remote device and retrieve the current running-config to use as a base for comparing against the contents of source.  There are times when it is not desirable to have the task get the current running-config for every task in a playbook.  The I(config) argument allows the implementer to pass in the configuration to use as the base config for comparison.

before: ${10:null} # not required. The ordered set of commands to push on to the command stack if a change needs to be made.  This allows the playbook designer the opportunity to perform configuration commands prior to pushing any changes without affecting how the set of commands are matched against the system.

lines: ${11:null} # not required. The ordered set of commands that should be configured in the section.  The commands must be the exact same commands as found in the device running-config. Be sure to note the configuration command syntax as some commands are automatically modified by the device config parser. This argument is mutually exclusive with I(src).

parents: ${12:null} # not required. The ordered set of parents that uniquely identify the section or hierarchy the commands should be checked against.  If the parents argument is omitted, the commands are checked against the set of top level or global commands.

dellos10_facts.description: Collect facts from remote devices running Dell EMC Networking OS10
body: dellos10_facts:
provider: ${1:null} # not required. A dict object containing connection details.

gather_subset: ${2:!config} # not required. When supplied, this argument will restrict the facts collected to a given subset.  Possible values for this argument include all, hardware, config, and interfaces.  Can specify a list of values to include a larger subset.  Values can also be used with an initial C(M(!)) to specify that a specific subset should not be collected.

deploy_helper.description: Manages some of the steps common in deploying projects.
body: deploy_helper:
path: ${1:undefined} # required. the root path of the project. Alias I(dest). Returned in the C(deploy_helper.project_path) fact.

release: ${2:None} # not required. the release version that is being deployed. Defaults to a timestamp format %Y%m%d%H%M%S (i.e. '20141119223359'). This parameter is optional during C(state=present), but needs to be set explicitly for C(state=finalize). You can use the generated fact C(release={{ deploy_helper.new_release }}).
clean: ${3:true} # not required. Whether to run the clean procedure in case of C(state=finalize).
releases_path: ${4:releases} # not required. the name of the folder that will hold the releases. This can be relative to C(path) or absolute. Returned in the C(deploy_helper.releases_path) fact.
current_path: ${5:current} # not required. the name of the symlink that is created when the deploy is finalized. Used in C(finalize) and C(clean). Returned in the C(deploy_helper.current_path) fact.

unfinished_filename: ${6:DEPLOY_UNFINISHED} # not required. the name of the file that indicates a deploy has not finished. All folders in the releases_path that contain this file will be deleted on C(state=finalize) with clean=True, or C(state=clean). This file is automatically deleted from the I(new_release_path) during C(state=finalize).

shared_path: ${7:shared} # not required. the name of the folder that will hold the shared resources. This can be relative to C(path) or absolute. If this is set to an empty string, no shared folder will be created. Returned in the C(deploy_helper.shared_path) fact.

state: ${8|present,finalize,absent,clean,query|} # not required. choices: present;finalize;absent;clean;query. the state of the project. C(query) will only gather facts, C(present) will create the project I(root) folder, and in it the I(releases) and I(shared) folders, C(finalize) will remove the unfinished_filename file, create a symlink to the newly deployed release and optionally clean old releases, C(clean) will remove failed & old releases, C(absent) will remove the project folder (synonymous to the M(file) module with C(state=absent))

keep_releases: ${9:5} # not required. the number of old releases to keep when cleaning. Used in C(finalize) and C(clean). Any unfinished builds will be deleted first, so only correct releases will count. The current version will not count.
digital_ocean:
ssh_key_ids: ${1:undefined} # not required. Optional, array of SSH key (numeric) ID that you would like to be added to the server.
ipv6: ${2|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Optional, Boolean, enable IPv6 for your droplet.
image_id: ${3:undefined} # not required. This is the slug of the image you would like the droplet created with.
command: ${4|droplet,ssh|} # not required. choices: droplet;ssh. Which target you want to operate on.

unique_name: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Bool, require unique hostnames.  By default, DigitalOcean allows multiple hosts with the same name.  Setting this to "yes" allows only one host per name.  Useful for idempotence.
wait_timeout: ${6:300} # not required. How long before wait gives up, in seconds.
backups_enabled: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Optional, Boolean, enables backups for your droplet.
private_networking: ${8|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Bool, add an additional, private network interface to droplet for inter-droplet communication.
wait: ${9|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Wait for the droplet to be in state 'running' before returning.  If wait is "no" an ip_address may not be returned.
name: ${10:undefined} # not required. String, this is the name of the droplet - must be formatted by hostname rules, or the name of a SSH key.
api_token: ${11:undefined} # not required. DigitalOcean api token.
virtio: ${12|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Bool, turn on virtio driver in droplet for improved network and storage I/O.
user_data: ${13:None} # not required. opaque blob of data which is made available to the droplet
region_id: ${14:undefined} # not required. This is the slug of the region you would like your server to be created in.
size_id: ${15:undefined} # not required. This is the slug of the size you would like the droplet created with.
id: ${16:undefined} # not required. Numeric, the droplet id you want to operate on.
state: ${17|present,active,absent,deleted|} # not required. choices: present;active;absent;deleted. Indicate desired state of the target.
ssh_pub_key: ${18:undefined} # not required. The public SSH key you want to add to your account.

digital_ocean_block_storage.description: Create/destroy or attach/detach Block Storage volumes in DigitalOcean
body: digital_ocean_block_storage:
api_token: ${1:undefined} # required. DigitalOcean api token.
command: ${2|create,attach|} # required. choices: create;attach. Which operation do you want to perform.
region: ${3:undefined} # required. The slug of the region where your Block Storage volume should be located in. If snapshot_id is included, this will be ignored.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the target.
volume_name: ${5:undefined} # required. The name of the Block Storage volume.
description: ${6:undefined} # not required. Description of the Block Storage volume.
snapshot_id: ${7:undefined} # not required. The snapshot id you would like the Block Storage volume created with. If included, region and block_size will be ignored and changed to null.
droplet_id: ${8:undefined} # not required. The droplet id you want to operate on. Required when command=attach.
block_size: ${9:undefined} # not required. The size of the Block Storage volume in gigabytes. Required when command=create and state=present. If snapshot_id is included, this will be ignored.
timeout: ${10:10} # not required. The timeout in seconds used for polling DigitalOcean's API.
digital_ocean_certificate:
oauth_token: ${1:undefined} # required. DigitalOcean OAuth token.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the certificate.
certificate_chain: ${3:undefined} # not required. The full PEM-formatted trust chain between the certificate authority's certificate and your domain's SSL certificate.
private_key: ${4:undefined} # not required. A PEM-formatted private key content of SSL Certificate.
leaf_certificate: ${5:undefined} # not required. A PEM-formatted public SSL Certificate.
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the certificate should be present or absent.

digital_ocean_domain.description: Create/delete a DNS record in DigitalOcean
body: digital_ocean_domain:
id: ${1:undefined} # not required. Numeric, the droplet id you want to operate on.
ip: ${2:undefined} # not required. The IP address to point a domain at.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the target.
oauth_token: ${4:undefined} # not required. DigitalOcean api token.
name: ${5:undefined} # not required. String, this is the name of the droplet - must be formatted by hostname rules, or the name of a SSH key, or the name of a domain.
digital_ocean_floating_ip:
oauth_token: ${1:undefined} # required. DigitalOcean OAuth token.
ip: ${2:None} # not required. Public IP address of the Floating IP. Used to remove an IP
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the target.
droplet_id: ${4:None} # not required. The Droplet that the Floating IP has been assigned to.
region: ${5:None} # not required. The region that the Floating IP is reserved to.
digital_ocean_floating_ip_facts:
oauth_token: ${1:undefined} # required. DigitalOcean OAuth token.
timeout: ${2:30} # not required. The timeout in seconds used for polling DigitalOcean's API.
digital_ocean_sshkey:
oauth_token: ${1:undefined} # required. DigitalOcean OAuth token.
name: ${2:None} # not required. The name for the SSH key
ssh_pub_key: ${3:None} # not required. The Public SSH key to add.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the target.
fingerprint: ${5:None} # not required. This is a unique identifier for the SSH key used to delete a key
digital_ocean_sshkey_facts:
oauth_token: ${1:undefined} # required. DigitalOcean API token.
timeout: ${2:30} # not required. The timeout in seconds used for polling DigitalOcean's API.

digital_ocean_tag.description: Create and remove tag(s) to DigitalOcean resource.
body: digital_ocean_tag:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the tag. The supported characters for names include alphanumeric characters, dashes, and underscores.
api_token: ${2:undefined} # not required. DigitalOcean api token.
resource_type: ${3|droplet|} # not required. choices: droplet. The type of resource to operate on. Currently, only tagging of droplets is supported.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the tag should be present or absent on the resource.
resource_id: ${5:undefined} # not required. The ID of the resource to operate on.,The data type of resource_id is changed from integer to string, from version 2.5.

dimensiondata_network.description: Create, update, and delete MCP 1.0 & 2.0 networks
body: dimensiondata_network:
location: ${1:undefined} # required. The target datacenter.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the network domain to create.
validate_certs: ${3:true} # not required. If C(false), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only be used on private instances of the CloudControl API that use self-signed certificates.
description: ${4:undefined} # not required. Additional description of the network domain.
wait_poll_interval: ${5:2} # not required. The amount of time (in seconds) to wait between checks for task completion.,Only applicable if I(wait=true).
mcp_user: ${6:undefined} # not required. The username used to authenticate to the CloudControl API.,If not specified, will fall back to C(MCP_USER) from environment variable or C(~/.dimensiondata).
wait_time: ${7:600} # not required. The maximum amount of time (in seconds) to wait for the task to complete.,Only applicable if I(wait=true).

region: ${8|Regions are defined in Apache libcloud project [libcloud/common/dimensiondata.py],They are also listed in U(https://libcloud.readthedocs.io/en/latest/compute/drivers/dimensiondata.html),Note that the default value "na" stands for "North America".,The module prepends 'dd-' to the region choice.|} # not required. choices: Regions are defined in Apache libcloud project [libcloud/common/dimensiondata.py];They are also listed in U(https://libcloud.readthedocs.io/en/latest/compute/drivers/dimensiondata.html);Note that the default value "na" stands for "North America".;The module prepends 'dd-' to the region choice.. The target region.
service_plan: ${9|ESSENTIALS,ADVANCED|} # not required. choices: ESSENTIALS;ADVANCED. The service plan, either "ESSENTIALS" or "ADVANCED".,MCP 2.0 Only.
wait: ${10:false} # not required. Should we wait for the task to complete before moving onto the next.

mcp_password: ${11:undefined} # not required. The password used to authenticate to the CloudControl API.,If not specified, will fall back to C(MCP_PASSWORD) from environment variable or C(~/.dimensiondata).,Required if I(mcp_user) is specified.
state: ${12|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the resource be present or absent.

dimensiondata_vlan.description: Manage a VLAN in a Cloud Control network domain.
body: dimensiondata_vlan:
location: ${1:undefined} # required. The target datacenter.
network_domain: ${2:undefined} # required. The Id or name of the target network domain.
validate_certs: ${3:true} # not required. If C(false), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only be used on private instances of the CloudControl API that use self-signed certificates.
description: ${4:null} # not required. A description of the VLAN.
wait_poll_interval: ${5:2} # not required. The amount of time (in seconds) to wait between checks for task completion.,Only applicable if I(wait=true).
mcp_user: ${6:undefined} # not required. The username used to authenticate to the CloudControl API.,If not specified, will fall back to C(MCP_USER) from environment variable or C(~/.dimensiondata).
private_ipv4_base_address: ${7:undefined} # not required. The base address for the VLAN's IPv4 network (e.g. 192.168.1.0).
wait_time: ${8:600} # not required. The maximum amount of time (in seconds) to wait for the task to complete.,Only applicable if I(wait=true).

region: ${9|Regions are defined in Apache libcloud project [libcloud/common/dimensiondata.py],They are also listed in U(https://libcloud.readthedocs.io/en/latest/compute/drivers/dimensiondata.html),Note that the default value "na" stands for "North America".,The module prepends 'dd-' to the region choice.|} # not required. choices: Regions are defined in Apache libcloud project [libcloud/common/dimensiondata.py];They are also listed in U(https://libcloud.readthedocs.io/en/latest/compute/drivers/dimensiondata.html);Note that the default value "na" stands for "North America".;The module prepends 'dd-' to the region choice.. The target region.
private_ipv4_prefix_size: ${10:undefined} # not required. The size of the IPv4 address space, e.g 24.,Required, if C(private_ipv4_base_address) is specified.

allow_expand: ${11:false} # not required. Permit expansion of the target VLAN's network if the module parameters specify a larger network than the VLAN currently posesses?,If C(False), the module will fail under these conditions.,This is intended to prevent accidental expansion of a VLAN's network (since this operation is not reversible).
wait: ${12:false} # not required. Should we wait for the task to complete before moving onto the next.

mcp_password: ${13:undefined} # not required. The password used to authenticate to the CloudControl API.,If not specified, will fall back to C(MCP_PASSWORD) from environment variable or C(~/.dimensiondata).,Required if I(mcp_user) is specified.

state: ${14|present,absent,readonly|} # not required. choices: present;absent;readonly. The desired state for the target VLAN.,C(readonly) ensures that the state is only ever read, not modified (the module will fail if the resource does not exist).
name: ${15:undefined} # not required. The name of the target VLAN.,Required if C(state) is C(present).
django_manage:

command: ${1|cleanup,collectstatic,flush,loaddata,migrate,runfcgi,syncdb,test,validate|} # required. choices: cleanup;collectstatic;flush;loaddata;migrate;runfcgi;syncdb;test;validate. The name of the Django management command to run. Built in commands are cleanup, collectstatic, flush, loaddata, migrate, runfcgi, syncdb, test, and validate.,Other commands can be entered, but will fail if they're unknown to Django.  Other commands that may prompt for user input should be run with the I(--noinput) flag.
app_path: ${2:undefined} # required. The path to the root of the Django application where B(manage.py) lives.
virtualenv: ${3:undefined} # not required. An optional path to a I(virtualenv) installation to use while running the manage application.
settings: ${4:undefined} # not required. The Python path to the application's settings module, such as 'myapp.settings'.
merge: ${5:undefined} # not required. Will run out-of-order or missing migrations as they are not rollback migrations, you can only use this parameter with 'migrate' command
apps: ${6:undefined} # not required. A list of space-delimited apps to target. Used by the 'test' command.
cache_table: ${7:undefined} # not required. The name of the table used for database-backed caching. Used by the 'createcachetable' command.
link: ${8:undefined} # not required. Will create links to the files instead of copying them, you can only use this parameter with 'collectstatic' command
skip: ${9:undefined} # not required. Will skip over out-of-order missing migrations, you can only use this parameter with I(migrate)
pythonpath: ${10:undefined} # not required. A directory to add to the Python path. Typically used to include the settings module if it is located external to the application directory.
database: ${11:undefined} # not required. The database to target. Used by the 'createcachetable', 'flush', 'loaddata', and 'syncdb' commands.
failfast: ${12|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Fail the command immediately if a test fails. Used by the 'test' command.
fixtures: ${13:undefined} # not required. A space-delimited list of fixture file names to load in the database. B(Required) by the 'loaddata' command.
dladm_etherstub:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Etherstub name.
temporary: ${2|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Specifies that the etherstub is temporary. Temporary etherstubs do not persist across reboots.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Create or delete Solaris/illumos etherstub.

dladm_iptun.description: Manage IP tunnel interfaces on Solaris/illumos systems.
body: dladm_iptun:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. IP tunnel interface name.
local_address: ${2:undefined} # not required. Literat IP address or hostname corresponding to the tunnel source.
type: ${3|ipv4,ipv6,6to4|} # not required. choices: ipv4;ipv6;6to4. Specifies the type of tunnel to be created.
temporary: ${4:false} # not required. Specifies that the IP tunnel interface is temporary. Temporary IP tunnel interfaces do not persist across reboots.
state: ${5|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Create or delete Solaris/illumos VNIC.
remote_address: ${6:undefined} # not required. Literal IP address or hostname corresponding to the tunnel destination.

dladm_linkprop.description: Manage link properties on Solaris/illumos systems.
body: dladm_linkprop:
property: ${1:undefined} # required. Specifies the name of the property we want to manage.
link: ${2:undefined} # required. Link interface name.
value: ${3:undefined} # not required. Specifies the value we want to set for the link property.
temporary: ${4:false} # not required. Specifies that lin property configuration is temporary. Temporary link property configuration does not persist across reboots.
state: ${5|present,absent,reset|} # not required. choices: present;absent;reset. Set or reset the property value.

dladm_vlan.description: Manage VLAN interfaces on Solaris/illumos systems.
body: dladm_vlan:
link: ${1:undefined} # required. VLAN underlying link name.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. VLAN interface name.
temporary: ${3:false} # not required. Specifies that the VLAN interface is temporary. Temporary VLANs do not persist across reboots.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Create or delete Solaris/illumos VNIC.
vlan_id: ${5:false} # not required. VLAN ID value for VLAN interface.
dladm_vnic:
link: ${1:undefined} # required. VNIC underlying link name.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. VNIC name.
mac: ${3:false} # not required. Sets the VNIC's MAC address. Must be valid unicast MAC address.
vlan: ${4:false} # not required. Enable VLAN tagging for this VNIC. The VLAN tag will have id I(vlan).
temporary: ${5|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Specifies that the VNIC is temporary. Temporary VNICs do not persist across reboots.
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Create or delete Solaris/illumos VNIC.

dnf.description: Manages packages with the I(dnf) package manager
body: dnf:

name: ${1:null} # required. A list of package names, or package specifier with version, like C(name-1.0) When using state=latest, this can be '*' which means run: dnf -y update. You can also pass a url or a local path to a rpm file.

autoremove: ${2|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(yes), removes all "leaf" packages from the system that were originally installed as dependencies of user-installed packages but which are no longer required by any such package. Should be used alone or when state is I(absent)
list: ${3:null} # not required. Various (non-idempotent) commands for usage with C(/usr/bin/ansible) and I(not) playbooks. See examples.
conf_file: ${4:null} # not required. The remote dnf configuration file to use for the transaction.
installroot: ${5:/} # not required. Specifies an alternative installroot, relative to which all packages will be installed.

enablerepo: ${6:null} # not required. I(Repoid) of repositories to enable for the install/update operation. These repos will not persist beyond the transaction. When specifying multiple repos, separate them with a ",".
disable_gpg_check: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether to disable the GPG checking of signatures of packages being installed. Has an effect only if state is I(present) or I(latest).
state: ${8|present,latest,absent|} # not required. choices: present;latest;absent. Whether to install (C(present), C(latest)), or remove (C(absent)) a package.

disablerepo: ${9:null} # not required. I(Repoid) of repositories to disable for the install/update operation. These repos will not persist beyond the transaction. When specifying multiple repos, separate them with a ",".

dnsimple.description: Interface with dnsimple.com (a DNS hosting service).
body: dnsimple:
account_api_token: ${1:null} # not required. Account API token. See I(account_email) for info.
solo: ${2:null} # not required. Whether the record should be the only one for that record type and record name. Only use with state=present on a record

type: ${3|A,ALIAS,CNAME,MX,SPF,URL,TXT,NS,SRV,NAPTR,PTR,AAAA,SSHFP,HINFO,POOL|} # not required. choices: A;ALIAS;CNAME;MX;SPF;URL;TXT;NS;SRV;NAPTR;PTR;AAAA;SSHFP;HINFO;POOL. The type of DNS record to create
ttl: ${4:3600 (one hour)} # not required. The TTL to give the new record
value: ${5:null} # not required. Record value,Must be specified when trying to ensure a record exists

account_email: ${6:null} # not required. Account email. If omitted, the env variables DNSIMPLE_EMAIL and DNSIMPLE_API_TOKEN will be looked for. If those aren't found, a C(.dnsimple) file will be looked for, see: U(https://github.com/mikemaccana/dnsimple-python#getting-started)
priority: ${7:null} # not required. Record priority

domain: ${8:null} # not required. Domain to work with. Can be the domain name (e.g. "mydomain.com") or the numeric ID of the domain in DNSimple. If omitted, a list of domains will be returned.,If domain is present but the domain doesn't exist, it will be created.
record_ids: ${9:null} # not required. List of records to ensure they either exist or don't exist
state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. whether the record should exist or not
record: ${11:null} # not required. Record to add, if blank a record for the domain will be created, supports the wildcard (*)

dnsmadeeasy.description: Interface with dnsmadeeasy.com (a DNS hosting service).
body: dnsmadeeasy:

autoFailover: ${1|yes,no|} # required. choices: yes;no. If true, fallback to the primary IP address is manual after a failover.,If false, fallback to the primary IP address is automatic after a failover.
failover: ${2|yes,no|} # required. choices: yes;no. If C(yes), add or change the failover.  This is applicable only for A records.
maxEmails: ${3:1} # required. Number of emails sent to the contact list by the monitor.
port: ${4:80} # required. Port used by the monitor.
systemDescription: ${5:} # required. Description used by the monitor.
protocol: ${6|TCP,UDP,HTTP,DNS,SMTP,HTTPS|} # required. choices: TCP;UDP;HTTP;DNS;SMTP;HTTPS. Protocol used by the monitor.
sensitivity: ${7|Low,Medium,High|} # required. choices: Low;Medium;High. Number of checks the monitor performs before a failover occurs where Low = 8, Medium = 5,and High = 3.
account_key: ${8:null} # required. Account API Key.
monitor: ${9|yes,no|} # required. choices: yes;no. If C(yes), add or change the monitor.  This is applicable only for A records.
domain: ${10:null} # required. Domain to work with. Can be the domain name (e.g. "mydomain.com") or the numeric ID of the domain in DNS Made Easy (e.g. "839989") for faster resolution
account_secret: ${11:null} # required. Account Secret Key.
state: ${12|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. whether the record should exist or not
contactList: ${13:} # required. Name or id of the contact list that the monitor will notify.,The default C('') means the Account Owner.

validate_certs: ${14|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
record_ttl: ${15:1800} # not required. record's "Time to live".  Number of seconds the record remains cached in DNS servers.
ip2: ${16:undefined} # not required. Secondary IP address for the failover.,Required if adding or changing the failover.
ip5: ${17:undefined} # not required. Quinary IP address for the failover.
httpQueryString: ${18:undefined} # not required. The string in the httpFile that the monitor queries for HTTP or HTTPS.

record_name: ${19:null} # not required. Record name to get/create/delete/update. If record_name is not specified; all records for the domain will be returned in "result" regardless of the state argument.
ip4: ${20:undefined} # not required. Quaternary IP address for the failover.
ip1: ${21:undefined} # not required. Primary IP address for the failover.,Required if adding or changing the monitor or failover.

record_value: ${22:null} # not required. Record value. HTTPRED: <redirection URL>, MX: <priority> <target name>, NS: <name server>, PTR: <target name>, SRV: <priority> <weight> <port> <target name>, TXT: <text value>"
,If record_value is not specified; no changes will be made and the record will be returned in 'result' (in other words, this module can be used to fetch a record's current id, type, and ttl)
httpFqdn: ${23:undefined} # not required. The fully qualified domain name used by the monitor.
ip3: ${24:undefined} # not required. Tertiary IP address for the failover.
record_type: ${25|A,AAAA,CNAME,ANAME,HTTPRED,MX,NS,PTR,SRV,TXT|} # not required. choices: A;AAAA;CNAME;ANAME;HTTPRED;MX;NS;PTR;SRV;TXT. Record type.
httpFile: ${26:undefined} # not required. The file at the Fqdn that the monitor queries for HTTP or HTTPS.
docker:
image: ${1:undefined} # required. Container image used to match and launch containers.

expose: ${2:undefined} # not required. List of additional container ports to expose for port mappings or links. If the port is already exposed using EXPOSE in a Dockerfile, you don't need to expose it again.

log_driver: ${3|awslogs,fluentd,gelf,journald,json-file,none,syslog|} # not required. choices: awslogs;fluentd;gelf;journald;json-file;none;syslog. You can specify a different logging driver for the container than for the daemon.,C(awslogs) - (added in 2.1) Awslogs logging driver for Docker. Writes log messages to AWS Cloudwatch Logs.,C(fluentd) - Fluentd logging driver for Docker. Writes log messages to "fluentd" (forward input).,C(gelf) - Graylog Extended Log Format (GELF) logging driver for Docker. Writes log messages to a GELF endpoint likeGraylog or Logstash.,C(journald) - Journald logging driver for Docker. Writes log messages to "journald".,C(json-file) - Default logging driver for Docker. Writes JSON messages to file. docker logs command is available only for this logging driver.,C(none) - disables any logging for the container.,C(syslog) - Syslog logging driver for Docker. Writes log messages to syslog. docker logs command is not available for this logging driver.,Requires docker >= 1.6.0.
lxc_conf: ${4:undefined} # not required. LXC configuration parameters, such as C(lxc.aa_profile:unconfined).
net: ${5:no} # not required. Network mode for the launched container: bridge, none, container:<name|id>,or host.,Requires docker >= 0.11.
stop_timeout: ${6:10} # not required. How many seconds to wait for the container to stop before killing it.

volumes: ${7:undefined} # not required. List of volumes to mount within the container.,Use docker CLI-style syntax: C(/host:/container[:mode]),You can specify a read mode for the mount with either C(ro) or C(rw). Starting at version 2.1, SELinux hosts can additionally use C(z) or C(Z) mount options to use a shared or private label for the volume.

restart_policy: ${8|always,false,on-failure,unless-stopped|} # not required. choices: always;false;on-failure;unless-stopped. Container restart policy.,The 'unless-stopped' choice is only available starting in Ansible 2.1 and for Docker 1.9 and above.
memory_limit: ${9:0} # not required. RAM allocated to the container as a number of bytes or as a human-readable string like "512MB".,Leave as "0" to specify no limit.
tls_client_key: ${10:${DOCKER_CERT_PATH}/key.pem} # not required. Path to the PEM-encoded key used to authenticate docker client. If specified tls_client_cert must be valid
privileged: ${11:no} # not required. Whether the container should run in privileged mode or not.
insecure_registry: ${12:no} # not required. Use insecure private registry by HTTP instead of HTTPS.,Needed for docker-py >= 0.5.0.
cap_add: ${13:no} # not required. Add capabilities for the container.,Requires docker-py >= 0.5.0.
tls_client_cert: ${14:${DOCKER_CERT_PATH}/cert.pem} # not required. Path to the PEM-encoded certificate used to authenticate docker client. If specified tls_client_key must be valid
devices: ${15:undefined} # not required. List of host devices to expose to container.
restart_policy_retry: ${16:0} # not required. Maximum number of times to restart a container.,Leave as "0" for unlimited retries.

env_file: ${17:undefined} # not required. Pass in a path to a file with environment variable (FOO=BAR). If a key value is present in both explicitly presented (i.e. as 'env') and in the environment file, the explicit value will override. Requires docker-py >= 1.4.0.
password: ${18:undefined} # not required. Remote API password.
hostname: ${19:undefined} # not required. Container hostname.
read_only: ${20:undefined} # not required. Mount the container's root filesystem as read only.
tty: ${21:no} # not required. Allocate a pseudo-tty within the container.
extra_hosts: ${22:undefined} # not required. Dict of custom host-to-IP mappings to be defined in the container
email: ${23:undefined} # not required. Remote API email.
command: ${24:undefined} # not required. Command used to match and launch containers.

name: ${25:undefined} # not required. Name used to match and uniquely name launched containers. Explicit names are used to uniquely identify a single container or to link among containers. Mutually exclusive with a "count" other than "1".
timeout: ${26:60} # not required. Docker daemon response timeout in seconds.

state: ${27|absent,killed,present,reloaded,restarted,started,stopped|} # not required. choices: absent;killed;present;reloaded;restarted;started;stopped. Assert the container's desired state. "present" only asserts that the matching containers exist. "started" asserts that the matching containers both exist and are running, but takes no action if any configuration has changed. "reloaded" (added in Ansible 1.9) asserts that all matching containers are running and restarts any that have any images or configuration out of date. "restarted" unconditionally restarts (or starts) the matching containers. "stopped" and '"killed" stop and kill all matching containers. "absent" stops and then' removes any matching containers.
cap_drop: ${28:no} # not required. Drop capabilities for the container.,Requires docker-py >= 0.5.0.
detach: ${29:yes} # not required. Enable detached mode to leave the container running in background. If disabled, fail unless the process exits cleanly.
links: ${30:undefined} # not required. List of other containers to link within this container with an optional.,alias. Use docker CLI-style syntax: C(redis:myredis).
tls_hostname: ${31:Taken from docker_url} # not required. A hostname to check matches what's supplied in the docker server's certificate.  If unspecified, the hostname is taken from the docker_url.
count: ${32:1} # not required. Number of matching containers that should be in the desired state.

use_tls: ${33|encrypt,false,verify|} # not required. choices: encrypt;false;verify. Whether to use tls to connect to the docker server.  "no" means not to use tls (and ignore any other tls related parameters). "encrypt" means to use tls to encrypt the connection to the server.  "verify" means to also verify that the server's certificate is valid for the server (this both verifies the certificate against the CA and that the certificate was issued for that host. If this is unspecified, tls will only be used if one of the other tls options require it.
dns: ${34:undefined} # not required. List of custom DNS servers for the container.
docker_user: ${35:undefined} # not required. Username or UID to use within the container
publish_all_ports: ${36:no} # not required. Publish all exposed ports to the host interfaces.
signal: ${37:KILL} # not required. With the state "killed", you can alter the signal sent to the container.
registry: ${38:DockerHub} # not required. Remote registry URL to pull images from.

ports: ${39:undefined} # not required. List containing private to public port mapping specification. Use docker 'CLI-style syntax: C(8000), C(9000:8000), or C(0.0.0.0:9000:8000)' where 8000 is a container port, 9000 is a host port, and 0.0.0.0 is - a host interface. The container ports need to be exposed either in the Dockerfile or via the C(expose) option.
env: ${40:undefined} # not required. Pass a dict of environment variables to the container.
volumes_from: ${41:undefined} # not required. List of names of containers to mount volumes from.

log_opt: ${42:undefined} # not required. Additional options to pass to the logging driver selected above. See Docker `log-driver <https://docs.docker.com/reference/logging/overview/>` documentation for more information. Requires docker >=1.7.0.
cpu_shares: ${43:0} # not required. CPU shares (relative weight).,Requires docker-py >= 0.6.0.

pull: ${44|always,missing|} # not required. choices: always;missing. Control when container images are updated from the C(docker_url) registry.,If C(missing), images will be pulled only when missing from the host;,if C(always), the registry will be checked for a newer version of the image each time the task executes.
stdin_open: ${45:no} # not required. Keep stdin open after a container is launched.
entrypoint: ${46:undefined} # not required. Corresponds to C(--entrypoint) option of C(docker run) command and C(ENTRYPOINT) directive of Dockerfile.,Used to match and launch containers.
domainname: ${47:undefined} # not required. Container domain name.
pid: ${48:undefined} # not required. Set the PID namespace mode for the container (currently only supports 'host').,Requires docker-py >= 1.0.0 and docker >= 1.5.0
ulimits: ${49:undefined} # not required. ulimits, list ulimits with name, soft and optionally hard limit separated by colons. e.g. C(nofile:1024:2048),Requires docker-py >= 1.2.0 and docker >= 1.6.0
docker_url: ${50:${DOCKER_HOST} or unix://var/run/docker.sock} # not required. URL of the host running the docker daemon. This will default to the env var DOCKER_HOST if unspecified.
cpu_set: ${51:undefined} # not required. CPUs in which to allow execution.,Requires docker-py >= 0.6.0.
labels: ${52:undefined} # not required. Set container labels.,Requires docker >= 1.6 and docker-py >= 1.2.0.
tls_ca_cert: ${53:${DOCKER_CERT_PATH}/ca.pem} # not required. Path to a PEM-encoded certificate authority to secure the Docker connection. This has no effect if use_tls is encrypt.
docker_api_version: ${54:docker-py default remote API version} # not required. Remote API version to use. This defaults to the current default as specified by docker-py.
username: ${55:undefined} # not required. Remote API username.
docker_container:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Assign a name to a new container or match an existing container.,When identifying an existing container name may be a name or a long or short container ID.
uts: ${2:null} # not required. Set the UTS namespace mode for the container.
cpu_shares: ${3:null} # not required. CPU shares (relative weight).
mac_address: ${4:null} # not required. Container MAC address (e.g. 92:d0:c6:0a:29:33)

volumes: ${5:null} # not required. List of volumes to mount within the container.,Use docker CLI-style syntax: C(/host:/container[:mode]),You can specify a read mode for the mount with either C(ro) or C(rw).,SELinux hosts can additionally use C(z) or C(Z) to use a shared or private label for the volume.
force_kill: ${6:false} # not required. Use the kill command when stopping a running container.

docker_host: ${7:unix://var/run/docker.sock} # not required. The URL or Unix socket path used to connect to the Docker API. To connect to a remote host, provide the TCP connection string. For example, 'tcp://192.0.2.23:2376'. If TLS is used to encrypt the connection, the module will automatically replace 'tcp' in the connection URL with 'https'.
groups: ${8:null} # not required. List of additional group names and/or IDs that the container process will run as.
devices: ${9:null} # not required. List of host device bindings to add to the container. Each binding is a mapping expressed in the format: <path_on_host>:<path_in_container>:<cgroup_permissions>
volumes_from: ${10:null} # not required. List of container names or Ids to get volumes from.
tty: ${11:false} # not required. Allocate a pseudo-TTY.
memory_reservation: ${12:0} # not required. Memory soft limit (format: <number>[<unit>]). Number is a positive integer. Unit can be one of b, k, m, or g
tls: ${13:false} # not required. Secure the connection to the API by using TLS without verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
userns_mode: ${14:null} # not required. User namespace to use

state: ${15|absent,present,stopped,started|} # not required. choices: absent;present;stopped;started. I(absent) - A container matching the specified name will be stopped and removed. Use force_kill to kill the container rather than stopping it. Use keep_volumes to retain volumes associated with the removed container.,I(present) - Asserts the existence of a container matching the name and any provided configuration parameters. If no container matches the name, a container will be created. If a container matches the name but the provided configuration does not match, the container will be updated, if it can be. If it cannot be updated, it will be removed and re-created with the requested config. Image version will be taken into account when comparing configuration. To ignore image version use the ignore_image option. Use the recreate option to force the re-creation of the matching container. Use force_kill to kill the container rather than stopping it. Use keep_volumes to retain volumes associated with a removed container.,I(started) - Asserts there is a running container matching the name and any provided configuration. If no container matches the name, a container will be created and started. If a container matching the name is found but the configuration does not match, the container will be updated, if it can be. If it cannot be updated, it will be removed and a new container will be created with the requested configuration and started. Image version will be taken into account when comparing configuration. To ignore image version use the ignore_image option. Use recreate to always re-create a matching container, even if it is running. Use restart to force a matching container to be stopped and restarted. Use force_kill to kill a container rather than stopping it. Use keep_volumes to retain volumes associated with a removed container.,I(stopped) - Asserts that the container is first I(present), and then if the container is running moves it to a stopped state. Use force_kill to kill a container rather than stopping it.
stop_timeout: ${16:null} # not required. Number of seconds to wait for the container to stop before sending SIGKILL.
cpu_quota: ${17:0} # not required. Limit CPU CFS (Completely Fair Scheduler) quota
memory_swap: ${18:0} # not required. Total memory limit (memory + swap, format:<number>[<unit>]). Number is a positive integer. Unit can be one of b, k, m, or g.
volume_driver: ${19:none} # not required. The container volume driver.
env: ${20:null} # not required. Dictionary of key,value pairs.
interactive: ${21:false} # not required. Keep stdin open after a container is launched, even if not attached.
domainname: ${22:null} # not required. Container domainname.

networks: ${23:null} # not required. List of networks the container belongs to.,Each network is a dict with keys C(name), C(ipv4_address), C(ipv6_address), C(links), C(aliases).,For each network C(name) is required, all other keys are optional.,If included, C(links) or C(aliases) are lists.,For examples of the data structure and usage see EXAMPLES below.,To remove a container from one or more networks, use the C(purge_networks) option.
trust_image_content: ${24:false} # not required. If true, skip image verification.

exposed_ports: ${25:null} # not required. List of additional container ports which informs Docker that the container listens on the specified network ports at runtime. If the port is already exposed using EXPOSE in a Dockerfile, it does not need to be exposed again.
pull: ${26:false} # not required. If true, always pull the latest version of an image. Otherwise, will only pull an image when missing.
network_mode: ${27|bridge,container:<name|id>,host,none|} # not required. choices: bridge;container:<name|id>;host;none. Connect the container to a network.
paused: ${28:false} # not required. Use with the started state to pause running processes inside the container.
capabilities: ${29:null} # not required. List of capabilities to add to the container.
keep_volumes: ${30:true} # not required. Retain volumes associated with a removed container.
api_version: ${31:default provided by docker-py} # not required. The version of the Docker API running on the Docker Host. Defaults to the latest version of the API supported by docker-py.

purge_networks: ${32:false} # not required. Remove the container from ALL networks not included in C(networks) parameter.,Any default networks such as I(bridge), if not found in C(networks), will be removed as well.
user: ${33:null} # not required. Sets the username or UID used and optionally the groupname or GID for the specified command.,Can be [ user | user:group | uid | uid:gid | user:gid | uid:group ]

detach: ${34:true} # not required. Enable detached mode to leave the container running in background. If disabled, the task will reflect the status of the container run (failed if the command failed).
cacert_path: ${35:null} # not required. Use a CA certificate when performing server verification by providing the path to a CA certificate file.
tmpfs: ${36:null} # not required. Mount a tmpfs directory
log_options: ${37:null} # not required. Dictionary of options specific to the chosen log_driver. See https://docs.docker.com/engine/admin/logging/overview/ for details.
oom_killer: ${38:false} # not required. Whether or not to disable OOM Killer for the container.

log_driver: ${39|none,json-file,syslog,journald,gelf,fluentd,awslogs,splunk|} # not required. choices: none;json-file;syslog;journald;gelf;fluentd;awslogs;splunk. Specify the logging driver. Docker uses json-file by default.
kill_signal: ${40:null} # not required. Override default signal used to kill a running container.
restart_policy: ${41|always,false,on-failure,unless-stopped|} # not required. choices: always;false;on-failure;unless-stopped. Container restart policy. Place quotes around I(no) option.
memory_swappiness: ${42:0} # not required. Tune a container's memory swappiness behavior. Accepts an integer between 0 and 100.

shm_size: ${43:null} # not required. Size of `/dev/shm`. The format is `<number><unit>`. `number` must be greater than `0`. Unit is optional and can be `b` (bytes), `k` (kilobytes), `m` (megabytes), or `g` (gigabytes).,Omitting the unit defaults to bytes. If you omit the size entirely, the system uses `64m`.
key_path: ${44:null} # not required. Path to the client's TLS key file.
cpuset_mems: ${45:null} # not required. Memory nodes (MEMs) in which to allow execution C(0-3) or C(0,1)
links: ${46:null} # not required. List of name aliases for linked containers in the format C(container_name:alias)
env_file: ${47:null} # not required. Path to a file containing environment variables I(FOO=BAR).,If variable also present in C(env), then C(env) value will override.,Requires docker-py >= 1.4.0.
tls_verify: ${48:false} # not required. Secure the connection to the API by using TLS and verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
dns_servers: ${49:null} # not required. List of custom DNS servers.

ipc_mode: ${50:null} # not required. Set the IPC mode for the container. Can be one of 'container:<name|id>' to reuse another container's IPC namespace or 'host' to use the host's IPC namespace within the container.
restart_retries: ${51:0} # not required. Use with restart policy to control maximum number of restart attempts.

image: ${52:null} # not required. Repository path and tag used to create the container. If an image is not found or pull is true, the image will be pulled from the registry. If no tag is included, 'latest' will be used.
cert_path: ${53:null} # not required. Path to the client's TLS certificate file.
read_only: ${54:false} # not required. Mount the container's root file system as read-only.
timeout: ${55:60} # not required. The maximum amount of time in seconds to wait on a response from the API.
pid_mode: ${56:null} # not required. Set the PID namespace mode for the container. Currently only supports 'host'.
hostname: ${57:null} # not required. Container hostname.
memory: ${58:0} # not required. Memory limit (format: <number>[<unit>]). Number is a positive integer. Unit can be one of b, k, m, or g
cpuset_cpus: ${59:null} # not required. CPUs in which to allow execution C(1,3) or C(1-3).
tls_hostname: ${60:localhost} # not required. When verifying the authenticity of the Docker Host server, provide the expected name of the server.
stop_signal: ${61:null} # not required. Override default signal used to stop the container.
oom_score_adj: ${62:0} # not required. An integer value containing the score given to the container in order to tune OOM killer preferences.
command: ${63:null} # not required. Command to execute when the container starts. A command may be either a string or a list. Prior to version 2.4, strings were split on commas.

ignore_image: ${64:false} # not required. When C(state) is I(present) or I(started) the module compares the configuration of an existing container to requested configuration. The evaluation includes the image version. If the image version in the registry does not match the container, the container will be recreated. Stop this behavior by setting C(ignore_image) to I(True).
ssl_version: ${65:1.0} # not required. Provide a valid SSL version number. Default value determined by docker-py, currently 1.0.
recreate: ${66:false} # not required. Use with present and started states to force the re-creation of an existing container.
cpu_period: ${67:0} # not required. Limit CPU CFS (Completely Fair Scheduler) period
privileged: ${68:false} # not required. Give extended privileges to the container.
kernel_memory: ${69:0} # not required. Kernel memory limit (format: <number>[<unit>]). Number is a positive integer. Unit can be one of b, k, m, or g. Minimum is 4M.
sysctls: ${70:null} # not required. Dictionary of key,value pairs.

published_ports: ${71:null} # not required. List of ports to publish from the container to the host.,Use docker CLI syntax: C(8000), C(9000:8000), or C(0.0.0.0:9000:8000), where 8000 is a container port, 9000 is a host port, and 0.0.0.0 is a host interface.,Container ports must be exposed either in the Dockerfile or via the C(expose) option.,A value of all will publish all exposed container ports to random host ports, ignoring any other mappings.,If C(networks) parameter is provided, will inspect each network to see if there exists a bridge network with optional parameter com.docker.network.bridge.host_binding_ipv4. If such a network is found, then published ports where no host IP address is specified will be bound to the host IP pointed to by com.docker.network.bridge.host_binding_ipv4. Note that the first bridge network with a com.docker.network.bridge.host_binding_ipv4 value encountered in the list of C(networks) is the one that will be used.
entrypoint: ${72:null} # not required. Command that overwrites the default ENTRYPOINT of the image.
restart: ${73:false} # not required. Use with started state to force a matching container to be stopped and restarted.
auto_remove: ${74:false} # not required. enable auto-removal of the container on daemon side when the container's process exits
ulimits: ${75:null} # not required. List of ulimit options. A ulimit is specified as C(nofile:262144:262144)
working_dir: ${76:null} # not required. Path to the working directory.
security_opts: ${77:null} # not required. List of security options in the form of C("label:user:User")
dns_search_domains: ${78:null} # not required. List of custom DNS search domains.
labels: ${79:null} # not required. Dictionary of key value pairs.
blkio_weight: ${80:null} # not required. Block IO (relative weight), between 10 and 1000.
cleanup: ${81:false} # not required. Use with I(detach=false) to remove the container after successful execution.
etc_hosts: ${82:null} # not required. Dict of host-to-IP mappings, where each host name is a key in the dictionary. Each host name will be added to the container's /etc/hosts file.
docker_image:

name: ${1:undefined} # required. Image name. Name format will be one of: name, repository/name, registry_server:port/name. When pushing or pulling an image the name can optionally include the tag by appending ':tag_name'.
dockerfile: ${2:Dockerfile} # not required. Use with state C(present) to provide an alternate name for the Dockerfile to use when building an image.
tls_hostname: ${3:localhost} # not required. When verifying the authenticity of the Docker Host server, provide the expected name of the server.
http_timeout: ${4:undefined} # not required. Timeout for HTTP requests during the image build operation. Provide a positive integer value for the number of seconds.
container_limits: ${5:undefined} # not required. A dictionary of limits applied to each container created by the build process.
cert_path: ${6:null} # not required. Path to the client's TLS certificate file.
ssl_version: ${7:1.0} # not required. Provide a valid SSL version number. Default value determined by docker-py, currently 1.0.
nocache: ${8:false} # not required. Do not use cache when building an image.

repository: ${9:undefined} # not required. Full path to a repository. Use with state C(present) to tag the image into the repository. Expects format I(repository:tag). If no tag is provided, will use the value of the C(tag) parameter or I(latest).
path: ${10:undefined} # not required. Use with state 'present' to build an image. Will be the path to a directory containing the context and Dockerfile for building an image.

docker_host: ${11:unix://var/run/docker.sock} # not required. The URL or Unix socket path used to connect to the Docker API. To connect to a remote host, provide the TCP connection string. For example, 'tcp://192.0.2.23:2376'. If TLS is used to encrypt the connection, the module will automatically replace 'tcp' in the connection URL with 'https'.
tls_verify: ${12:false} # not required. Secure the connection to the API by using TLS and verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
pull: ${13:true} # not required. When building an image downloads any updates to the FROM image in Dockerfile.
load_path: ${14:undefined} # not required. Use with state C(present) to load an image from a .tar file.
key_path: ${15:null} # not required. Path to the client's TLS key file.

use_tls: ${16|false,encrypt,verify|} # not required. choices: false;encrypt;verify. DEPRECATED. Whether to use tls to connect to the docker server. Set to C(no) when TLS will not be used. Set to C(encrypt) to use TLS. And set to C(verify) to use TLS and verify that the server's certificate is valid for the server. NOTE: If you specify this option, it will set the value of the tls or tls_verify parameters.

force: ${17:false} # not required. Use with state I(absent) to un-tag and remove all images matching the specified name. Use with state C(present) to build, load or pull an image when the image already exists.
rm: ${18:true} # not required. Remove intermediate containers after build.
api_version: ${19:default provided by docker-py} # not required. The version of the Docker API running on the Docker Host. Defaults to the latest version of the API supported by docker-py.

buildargs: ${20:undefined} # not required. Provide a dictionary of C(key:value) build arguments that map to Dockerfile ARG directive.,Docker expects the value to be a string. For convenience any non-string values will be converted to strings.,Requires Docker API >= 1.21 and docker-py >= 1.7.0.
archive_path: ${21:undefined} # not required. Use with state C(present) to archive an image to a .tar file.
push: ${22:false} # not required. Push the image to the registry. Specify the registry as part of the I(name) or I(repository) parameter.
tls: ${23:false} # not required. Secure the connection to the API by using TLS without verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
timeout: ${24:60} # not required. The maximum amount of time in seconds to wait on a response from the API.

state: ${25|absent,present,build|} # not required. choices: absent;present;build. Make assertions about the state of an image.,When C(absent) an image will be removed. Use the force option to un-tag and remove all images matching the provided name.,When C(present) check if an image exists using the provided name and tag. If the image is not found or the force option is used, the image will either be pulled, built or loaded. By default the image will be pulled from Docker Hub. To build the image, provide a path value set to a directory containing a context and Dockerfile. To load an image, specify load_path to provide a path to an archive file. To tag an image to a repository, provide a repository path. If the name contains a repository path, it will be pushed.,NOTE: C(build) is DEPRECATED and will be removed in release 2.3. Specifying C(build) will behave the same as C(present).
cacert_path: ${26:null} # not required. Use a CA certificate when performing server verification by providing the path to a CA certificate file.

tag: ${27:latest} # not required. Used to select an image when pulling. Will be added to the image when pushing, tagging or building. Defaults to I(latest).,If C(name) parameter format is I(name:tag), then tag value from C(name) will take precedence.
docker_image_facts:
name: ${1:null} # required. An image name or a list of image names. Name format will be name[:tag] or repository/name[:tag], where tag is optional. If a tag is not provided, 'latest' will be used.
tls: ${2:false} # not required. Secure the connection to the API by using TLS without verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
tls_hostname: ${3:localhost} # not required. When verifying the authenticity of the Docker Host server, provide the expected name of the server.
tls_verify: ${4:false} # not required. Secure the connection to the API by using TLS and verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
cacert_path: ${5:null} # not required. Use a CA certificate when performing server verification by providing the path to a CA certificate file.

docker_host: ${6:unix://var/run/docker.sock} # not required. The URL or Unix socket path used to connect to the Docker API. To connect to a remote host, provide the TCP connection string. For example, 'tcp://192.0.2.23:2376'. If TLS is used to encrypt the connection, the module will automatically replace 'tcp' in the connection URL with 'https'.
cert_path: ${7:null} # not required. Path to the client's TLS certificate file.
key_path: ${8:null} # not required. Path to the client's TLS key file.
ssl_version: ${9:1.0} # not required. Provide a valid SSL version number. Default value determined by docker-py, currently 1.0.
api_version: ${10:default provided by docker-py} # not required. The version of the Docker API running on the Docker Host. Defaults to the latest version of the API supported by docker-py.
timeout: ${11:60} # not required. The maximum amount of time in seconds to wait on a response from the API.
docker_login:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The plaintext password for the registry account
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The username for the registry account
tls_hostname: ${3:localhost} # not required. When verifying the authenticity of the Docker Host server, provide the expected name of the server.
tls_verify: ${4:false} # not required. Secure the connection to the API by using TLS and verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
config_path: ${5:~/.docker/config.json} # not required. Custom path to the Docker CLI configuration file.
cert_path: ${6:null} # not required. Path to the client's TLS certificate file.
key_path: ${7:null} # not required. Path to the client's TLS key file.
ssl_version: ${8:1.0} # not required. Provide a valid SSL version number. Default value determined by docker-py, currently 1.0.
api_version: ${9:default provided by docker-py} # not required. The version of the Docker API running on the Docker Host. Defaults to the latest version of the API supported by docker-py.
email: ${10:None} # not required. The email address for the registry account. NOTE: private registries may not require this, but Docker Hub requires it.
reauthorize: ${11|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Refresh exiting authentication found in the configuration file.

docker_host: ${12:unix://var/run/docker.sock} # not required. The URL or Unix socket path used to connect to the Docker API. To connect to a remote host, provide the TCP connection string. For example, 'tcp://192.0.2.23:2376'. If TLS is used to encrypt the connection, the module will automatically replace 'tcp' in the connection URL with 'https'.
tls: ${13:false} # not required. Secure the connection to the API by using TLS without verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
timeout: ${14:60} # not required. The maximum amount of time in seconds to wait on a response from the API.

state: ${15|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. This controls the current state of the user. C(present) will login in a user, C(absent) will log them out.,To logout you only need the registry server, which defaults to DockerHub.,Before 2.1 you could ONLY log in.,docker does not support 'logout' with a custom config file.
registry_url: ${16:https://index.docker.io/v1/} # not required. The registry URL.
