cacert_path: ${17:null} # not required. Use a CA certificate when performing server verification by providing the path to a CA certificate file.
docker_network:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the network to operate on.
driver: ${2:bridge} # not required. Specify the type of network. Docker provides bridge and overlay drivers, but 3rd party drivers can also be used.
ipam_options: ${3:null} # not required. Dictionary of IPAM options.

force: ${4:false} # not required. With state I(absent) forces disconnecting all containers from the network prior to deleting the network. With state I(present) will disconnect all containers, delete the network and re-create the network.  This option is required if you have changed the IPAM or driver options and want an existing network to be updated to use the new options.
cert_path: ${5:null} # not required. Path to the client's TLS certificate file.
api_version: ${6:default provided by docker-py} # not required. The version of the Docker API running on the Docker Host. Defaults to the latest version of the API supported by docker-py.
driver_options: ${7:null} # not required. Dictionary of network settings. Consult docker docs for valid options and values.
tls_verify: ${8:false} # not required. Secure the connection to the API by using TLS and verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
appends: ${9:false} # not required. By default the connected list is canonical, meaning containers not on the list are removed from the network. Use C(appends) to leave existing containers connected.
tls_hostname: ${10:localhost} # not required. When verifying the authenticity of the Docker Host server, provide the expected name of the server.
tls: ${11:false} # not required. Secure the connection to the API by using TLS without verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
cacert_path: ${12:null} # not required. Use a CA certificate when performing server verification by providing the path to a CA certificate file.

docker_host: ${13:unix://var/run/docker.sock} # not required. The URL or Unix socket path used to connect to the Docker API. To connect to a remote host, provide the TCP connection string. For example, 'tcp://192.0.2.23:2376'. If TLS is used to encrypt the connection, the module will automatically replace 'tcp' in the connection URL with 'https'.
ipam_driver: ${14:null} # not required. Specify an IPAM driver.
connected: ${15:null} # not required. List of container names or container IDs to connect to a network.
timeout: ${16:60} # not required. The maximum amount of time in seconds to wait on a response from the API.

state: ${17|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. I(absent) deletes the network. If a network has connected containers, it cannot be deleted. Use the C(force) option to disconnect all containers and delete the network.,I(present) creates the network, if it does not already exist with the specified parameters, and connects the list of containers provided via the connected parameter. Containers not on the list will be disconnected. An empty list will leave no containers connected to the network. Use the C(appends) option to leave existing containers connected. Use the C(force) options to force re-creation of the network.
key_path: ${18:null} # not required. Path to the client's TLS key file.
ssl_version: ${19:1.0} # not required. Provide a valid SSL version number. Default value determined by docker-py, currently 1.0.
docker_secret:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the secret.
tls_hostname: ${2:localhost} # not required. When verifying the authenticity of the Docker Host server, provide the expected name of the server.
force: ${3:false} # not required. Boolean. Use with state C(present) to always remove and recreate an existing secret.,If I(true), an existing secret will be replaced, even if it has not changed.
cert_path: ${4:null} # not required. Path to the client's TLS certificate file.
ssl_version: ${5:1.0} # not required. Provide a valid SSL version number. Default value determined by docker-py, currently 1.0.
api_version: ${6:default provided by docker-py} # not required. The version of the Docker API running on the Docker Host. Defaults to the latest version of the API supported by docker-py.
data: ${7:undefined} # not required. String. The value of the secret. Required when state is C(present).

labels: ${8:undefined} # not required. A map of key:value meta data, where both the I(key) and I(value) are expected to be a string.,If new meta data is provided, or existing meta data is modified, the secret will be updated by removing it and creating it again.
cacert_path: ${9:null} # not required. Use a CA certificate when performing server verification by providing the path to a CA certificate file.

docker_host: ${10:unix://var/run/docker.sock} # not required. The URL or Unix socket path used to connect to the Docker API. To connect to a remote host, provide the TCP connection string. For example, 'tcp://192.0.2.23:2376'. If TLS is used to encrypt the connection, the module will automatically replace 'tcp' in the connection URL with 'https'.
tls: ${11:false} # not required. Secure the connection to the API by using TLS without verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
tls_verify: ${12:false} # not required. Secure the connection to the API by using TLS and verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
timeout: ${13:60} # not required. The maximum amount of time in seconds to wait on a response from the API.
state: ${14|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Set to C(present), if the secret should exist, and C(absent), if it should not.
key_path: ${15:null} # not required. Path to the client's TLS key file.
docker_service:

project_src: ${1:undefined} # not required. Path to a directory containing a docker-compose.yml or docker-compose.yaml file.,Mutually exclusive with C(definition).,Required when no C(definition) is provided.
cacert_path: ${2:null} # not required. Use a CA certificate when performing server verification by providing the path to a CA certificate file.
cert_path: ${3:null} # not required. Path to the client's TLS certificate file.

build: ${4:false} # not required. Use with state I(present) to always build images prior to starting the application.,Same as running docker-compose build with the pull option.,Images will only be rebuilt if Docker detects a change in the Dockerfile or build directory contents.,Use the C(nocache) option to ignore the image cache when performing the build.,If an existing image is replaced, services using the image will be recreated unless C(recreate) is I(never).
ssl_version: ${5:1.0} # not required. Provide a valid SSL version number. Default value determined by docker-py, currently 1.0.

recreate: ${6|always,never,smart|} # not required. choices: always;never;smart. By default containers will be recreated when their configuration differs from the service definition.,Setting to I(never) ignores configuration differences and leaves existing containers unchanged.,Setting to I(always) forces recreation of all existing containers.
tls_hostname: ${7:localhost} # not required. When verifying the authenticity of the Docker Host server, provide the expected name of the server.
nocache: ${8:false} # not required. Use with the build option to ignore the cache during the image build process.
tls: ${9:false} # not required. Secure the connection to the API by using TLS without verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
restarted: ${10:false} # not required. Use with state I(present) to restart all containers.

docker_host: ${11:unix://var/run/docker.sock} # not required. The URL or Unix socket path used to connect to the Docker API. To connect to a remote host, provide the TCP connection string. For example, 'tcp://192.0.2.23:2376'. If TLS is used to encrypt the connection, the module will automatically replace 'tcp' in the connection URL with 'https'.

pull: ${12:false} # not required. Use with state I(present) to always pull images prior to starting the application.,Same as running docker-compose pull.,When a new image is pulled, services using the image will be recreated unless C(recreate) is I(never).
key_path: ${13:null} # not required. Path to the client's TLS key file.
files: ${14:undefined} # not required. List of file names relative to C(project_src). Overrides docker-compose.yml or docker-compose.yaml.,Files are loaded and merged in the order given.
api_version: ${15:default provided by docker-py} # not required. The version of the Docker API running on the Docker Host. Defaults to the latest version of the API supported by docker-py.
tls_verify: ${16:false} # not required. Secure the connection to the API by using TLS and verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
remove_images: ${17:null} # not required. Use with state I(absent) to remove the all images or only local images.
hostname_check: ${18:false} # not required. Whether or not to check the Docker daemon's hostname against the name provided in the client certificate.
dependencies: ${19:true} # not required. When C(state) is I(present) specify whether or not to include linked services.
remove_volumes: ${20:false} # not required. Use with state I(absent) to remove data volumes.
debug: ${21:false} # not required. Include I(actions) in the return values.
definition: ${22:undefined} # not required. Provide docker-compose yaml describing one or more services, networks and volumes.,Mutually exclusive with C(project_src) and C(files).

scale: ${23:undefined} # not required. When C(state) is I(present) scale services. Provide a dictionary of key/value pairs where the key is the name of the service and the value is an integer count for the number of containers.
project_name: ${24:undefined} # not required. Provide a project name. If not provided, the project name is taken from the basename of C(project_src).,Required when no C(definition) is provided.
timeout: ${25:60} # not required. The maximum amount of time in seconds to wait on a response from the API.

state: ${26|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Desired state of the project.,Specifying I(present) is the same as running I(docker-compose up).,Specifying I(absent) is the same as running I(docker-compose down).
services: ${27:undefined} # not required. When C(state) is I(present) run I(docker-compose up) on a subset of services.
stopped: ${28:false} # not required. Use with state I(present) to leave the containers in an exited or non-running state.
docker_volume:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the volume to operate on.
driver: ${2:local} # not required. Specify the type of volume. Docker provides the C(local) driver, but 3rd party drivers can also be used.

force: ${3:no} # not required. With state C(present) causes the volume to be deleted and recreated if the volume already exist and the driver, driver options or labels differ. This will cause any data in the existing volume to be lost.
cert_path: ${4:null} # not required. Path to the client's TLS certificate file.

driver_options: ${5:undefined} # not required. Dictionary of volume settings. Consult docker docs for valid options and values: U(https://docs.docker.com/engine/reference/commandline/volume_create/#driver-specific-options)
api_version: ${6:default provided by docker-py} # not required. The version of the Docker API running on the Docker Host. Defaults to the latest version of the API supported by docker-py.
tls_hostname: ${7:localhost} # not required. When verifying the authenticity of the Docker Host server, provide the expected name of the server.
labels: ${8:undefined} # not required. List of labels to set for the volume
cacert_path: ${9:null} # not required. Use a CA certificate when performing server verification by providing the path to a CA certificate file.

docker_host: ${10:unix://var/run/docker.sock} # not required. The URL or Unix socket path used to connect to the Docker API. To connect to a remote host, provide the TCP connection string. For example, 'tcp://192.0.2.23:2376'. If TLS is used to encrypt the connection, the module will automatically replace 'tcp' in the connection URL with 'https'.
tls: ${11:false} # not required. Secure the connection to the API by using TLS without verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
tls_verify: ${12:false} # not required. Secure the connection to the API by using TLS and verifying the authenticity of the Docker host server.
timeout: ${13:60} # not required. The maximum amount of time in seconds to wait on a response from the API.
state: ${14|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. C(absent) deletes the volume.,C(present) creates the volume, if it does not already exist.
key_path: ${15:null} # not required. Path to the client's TLS key file.
ssl_version: ${16:1.0} # not required. Provide a valid SSL version number. Default value determined by docker-py, currently 1.0.
dpkg_selections:
selection: ${1|install,hold,deinstall,purge|} # required. choices: install;hold;deinstall;purge. The selection state to set the package to.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the package

dynamodb_table.description: Create, update or delete AWS Dynamo DB tables.
body: dynamodb_table:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the table.
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
hash_key_name: ${3:null} # not required. Name of the hash key.,Required when C(state=present).
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
tags: ${6:null} # not required. a hash/dictionary of tags to add to the new instance or for starting/stopping instance by tag; '{"key":"value"}' and '{"key":"value","key":"value"}'
range_key_type: ${7|STRING,NUMBER,BINARY|} # not required. choices: STRING;NUMBER;BINARY. Type of the range key.

ec2_url: ${8:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
hash_key_type: ${9|STRING,NUMBER,BINARY|} # not required. choices: STRING;NUMBER;BINARY. Type of the hash key.
wait_for_active_timeout: ${10:60} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds. only used when tags is set

region: ${11:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
write_capacity: ${12:1} # not required. Write throughput capacity (units) to provision.

indexes: ${13:} # not required. list of dictionaries describing indexes to add to the table. global indexes can be updated. local indexes don't support updates or have throughput.,required options: ['name', 'type', 'hash_key_name'],valid types: ['all', 'global_all', 'global_include', 'global_keys_only', 'include', 'keys_only'],other options: ['hash_key_type', 'range_key_name', 'range_key_type', 'includes', 'read_capacity', 'write_capacity']
read_capacity: ${14:1} # not required. Read throughput capacity (units) to provision.
aws_access_key: ${15:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${16:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${17|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Create or delete the table
range_key_name: ${18:null} # not required. Name of the range key.

dynamodb_ttl.description: set TTL for a given DynamoDB table.
body: dynamodb_ttl:
table_name: ${1:undefined} # required. name of the DynamoDB table to work on

attribute_name: ${2:undefined} # required. the name of the Time to Live attribute used to store the expiration time for items in the table,this appears to be required by the API even when disabling TTL.
validate_certs: ${3:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${5:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
profile: ${6:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${7:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${8:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${9|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. state to set DynamoDB table to

region: ${10:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
easy_install:
name: ${1:null} # required. A Python library name

executable: ${2:null} # not required. The explicit executable or a pathname to the executable to be used to run easy_install for a specific version of Python installed in the system. For example C(easy_install-3.3), if there are both Python 2.7 and 3.3 installations in the system and you want to run easy_install for the Python 3.3 installation.
virtualenv_command: ${3:virtualenv} # not required. The command to create the virtual environment with. For example C(pyvenv), C(virtualenv), C(virtualenv2).
virtualenv: ${4:null} # not required. an optional I(virtualenv) directory path to install into. If the I(virtualenv) does not exist, it is created automatically

virtualenv_site_packages: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether the virtual environment will inherit packages from the global site-packages directory.  Note that if this setting is changed on an already existing virtual environment it will not have any effect, the environment must be deleted and newly created.
state: ${6|present,latest|} # not required. choices: present;latest. The desired state of the library. C(latest) ensures that the latest version is installed.

ec2.description: create, terminate, start or stop an instance in ec2
body: ec2:
image: ${1:null} # required. I(ami) ID to use for the instance
instance_type: ${2:null} # required. instance type to use for the instance, see U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/instance-types.html)
spot_wait_timeout: ${3:600} # not required. how long to wait for the spot instance request to be fulfilled
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
validate_certs: ${5:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
spot_type: ${6|one-time,persistent|} # not required. choices: one-time;persistent. Type of spot request; one of "one-time" or "persistent". Defaults to "one-time" if not supplied.

volumes: ${7:null} # not required. a list of hash/dictionaries of volumes to add to the new instance; '[{"key":"value", "key":"value"}]'; keys allowed are - device_name (str; required), delete_on_termination (bool; False), device_type (deprecated), ephemeral (str), encrypted (bool; False), snapshot (str), volume_type (str), iops (int) - device_type is deprecated use volume_type, iops must be set when volume_type='io1', ephemeral and snapshot are mutually exclusive.
key_name: ${8:null} # not required. key pair to use on the instance
kernel: ${9:null} # not required. kernel I(eki) to use for the instance

count_tag: ${10:null} # not required. Used with 'exact_count' to determine how many nodes based on a specific tag criteria should be running. This can be expressed in multiple ways and is shown in the EXAMPLES section.  For instance, one can request 25 servers that are tagged with "class=webserver". The specified tag must already exist or be passed in as the 'instance_tags' option.
security_token: ${11:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

network_interfaces: ${12:null} # not required. A list of existing network interfaces to attach to the instance at launch. When specifying existing network interfaces, none of the assign_public_ip, private_ip, vpc_subnet_id, group, or group_id parameters may be used. (Those parameters are for creating a new network interface at launch.)
assign_public_ip: ${13|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. when provisioning within vpc, assign a public IP address. Boto library must be 2.13.0+
source_dest_check: ${14|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Enable or Disable the Source/Destination checks (for NAT instances and Virtual Routers)
instance_tags: ${15:null} # not required. a hash/dictionary of tags to add to the new instance or for starting/stopping instance by tag; '{"key":"value"}' and '{"key":"value","key":"value"}'
instance_profile_name: ${16:null} # not required. Name of the IAM instance profile to use. Boto library must be 2.5.0+
ebs_optimized: ${17:false} # not required. whether instance is using optimized EBS volumes, see U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/EBSOptimized.html)

state: ${18|present,absent,running,restarted,stopped|} # not required. choices: present;absent;running;restarted;stopped. create, terminate, start, stop or restart instances. The state 'restarted' was added in 2.2
monitoring: ${19|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. enable detailed monitoring (CloudWatch) for instance

exact_count: ${20:null} # not required. An integer value which indicates how many instances that match the 'count_tag' parameter should be running. Instances are either created or terminated based on this value.
placement_group: ${21:null} # not required. placement group for the instance when using EC2 Clustered Compute
count: ${22:1} # not required. number of instances to launch
group_id: ${23:null} # not required. security group id (or list of ids) to use with the instance

tenancy: ${24|default,dedicated|} # not required. choices: default;dedicated. An instance with a tenancy of "dedicated" runs on single-tenant hardware and can only be launched into a VPC. Note that to use dedicated tenancy you MUST specify a vpc_subnet_id as well. Dedicated tenancy is not available for EC2 "micro" instances.

ec2_url: ${25:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
wait_timeout: ${26:300} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
vpc_subnet_id: ${27:null} # not required. the subnet ID in which to launch the instance (VPC)
zone: ${28:null} # not required. AWS availability zone in which to launch the instance
wait: ${29|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the instance to reach its desired state before returning.  Does not wait for SSH, see 'wait_for' example for details.
ramdisk: ${30:null} # not required. ramdisk I(eri) to use for the instance
group: ${31:null} # not required. security group (or list of groups) to use with the instance
private_ip: ${32:null} # not required. the private ip address to assign the instance (from the vpc subnet)
profile: ${33:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

spot_price: ${34:null} # not required. Maximum spot price to bid, If not set a regular on-demand instance is requested. A spot request is made with this maximum bid. When it is filled, the instance is started.
spot_launch_group: ${35:null} # not required. Launch group for spot request, see U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/how-spot-instances-work.html#spot-launch-group)
user_data: ${36:null} # not required. opaque blob of data which is made available to the ec2 instance

region: ${37:null} # not required. The AWS region to use.  Must be specified if ec2_url is not used. If not specified then the value of the EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

id: ${38:null} # not required. identifier for this instance or set of instances, so that the module will be idempotent with respect to EC2 instances. This identifier is valid for at least 24 hours after the termination of the instance, and should not be reused for another call later on. For details, see the description of client token at U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/Run_Instance_Idempotency.html).
aws_access_key: ${39:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
termination_protection: ${40|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Enable or Disable the Termination Protection

instance_initiated_shutdown_behavior: ${41|stop,terminate|} # not required. choices: stop;terminate. Set whether AWS will Stop or Terminate an instance on shutdown. This parameter is ignored when using instance-store images (which require termination on shutdown).
instance_ids: ${42:null} # not required. list of instance ids, currently used for states: absent, running, stopped

ec2_ami.description: create or destroy an image in ec2
body: ec2_ami:
delete_snapshot: ${1|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Delete snapshots when deregistering the AMI.
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
virtualization_type: ${3:undefined} # not required. The virtualization type of the image to register.
enhanced_networking: ${4:undefined} # not required. A boolean representing whether enhanced networking with ENA is enabled or not.
ramdisk_id: ${5:undefined} # not required. The ID of the RAM disk.
root_device_name: ${6:undefined} # not required. The root device name of the image to register.
tags: ${7:undefined} # not required. A dictionary of tags to add to the new image; '{"key":"value"}' and '{"key":"value","key":"value"}'

launch_permissions: ${8:undefined} # not required. Users and groups that should be able to launch the AMI. Expects dictionary with a key of user_ids and/or group_names. user_ids should be a list of account ids. group_name should be a list of groups, "all" is the only acceptable value currently.,You must pass all desired launch permissions if you wish to modify existing launch permissions (passing just groups will remove all users)
wait: ${9|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Wait for the AMI to be in state 'available' before returning.

no_reboot: ${10|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Flag indicating that the bundling process should not attempt to shutdown the instance before bundling. If this flag is True, the responsibility of maintaining file system integrity is left to the owner of the instance.
wait_timeout: ${11:900} # not required. How long before wait gives up, in seconds.
image_location: ${12:undefined} # not required. The s3 location of an image to use for the AMI.
aws_secret_key: ${13:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

region: ${14:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
kernel_id: ${15:undefined} # not required. The target kernel id of the image to register.
security_token: ${16:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

sriov_net_support: ${17:undefined} # not required. Set to simple to enable enhanced networking with the Intel 82599 Virtual Function interface for the AMI and any instances that you launch from the AMI.
purge_tags: ${18:no} # not required. Whether to remove existing tags that aren't passed in the C(tags) parameter
image_id: ${19:undefined} # not required. Image ID to be deregistered.
description: ${20:undefined} # not required. Human-readable string describing the contents and purpose of the AMI.
profile: ${21:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
architecture: ${22:undefined} # not required. The target architecture of the image to register
billing_products: ${23:undefined} # not required. A list of valid billing codes. To be used with valid accounts by aws marketplace vendors.

ec2_url: ${24:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

device_mapping: ${25:undefined} # not required. List of device hashes/dictionaries with custom configurations (same block-device-mapping parameters).,Valid properties include: device_name, volume_type, size/volume_size (in GB), delete_on_termination (boolean), no_device (boolean), snapshot_id, iops (for io1 volume_type), encrypted
name: ${26:undefined} # not required. The name of the new AMI.
instance_id: ${27:undefined} # not required. Instance ID to create the AMI from.
aws_access_key: ${28:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
state: ${29|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Register or deregister an AMI.

ec2_ami_copy.description: copies AMI between AWS regions, return new image id
body: ec2_ami_copy:
source_region: ${1:undefined} # required. The source region the AMI should be copied from.
source_image_id: ${2:undefined} # required. The ID of the AMI in source region that should be copied.
validate_certs: ${3:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
description: ${4:null} # not required. An optional human-readable string describing the contents and purpose of the new AMI.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
tags: ${6:null} # not required. A hash/dictionary of tags to add to the new copied AMI; '{"key":"value"}' and '{"key":"value","key":"value"}'
kms_key_id: ${7:null} # not required. KMS key id used to encrypt image. If not specified, uses default EBS Customer Master Key (CMK) for your account.
encrypted: ${8:null} # not required. Whether or not the destination snapshots of the copied AMI should be encrypted.

region: ${9:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
wait_timeout: ${10:1200} # not required. How long before wait gives up, in seconds. (As of 2.3 this option is deprecated. See boto3 Waiters)

ec2_url: ${11:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
aws_secret_key: ${12:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
wait: ${13|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Wait for the copied AMI to be in state 'available' before returning.
aws_access_key: ${14:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${15:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
name: ${16:default} # not required. The name of the new AMI to copy. (As of 2.3 the default is 'default', in prior versions it was 'null'.)
ec2_ami_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${2:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${3:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
describe_image_attributes: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Describe attributes (like launchPermission) of the images found.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
executable_users: ${6:undefined} # not required. Filter images by users with explicit launch permissions. Valid options are an AWS account ID, self, or all (public AMIs).

region: ${7:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

filters: ${8:undefined} # not required. A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value.,See U(https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeImages.html) for possible filters.,Filter names and values are case sensitive.
image_ids: ${9:undefined} # not required. One or more image IDs.
owners: ${10:undefined} # not required. Filter the images by the owner. Valid options are an AWS account ID, self,,or an AWS owner alias ( amazon | aws-marketplace | microsoft ).

ec2_url: ${11:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
security_token: ${12:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_ami_find.description: Searches for AMIs to obtain the AMI ID and other information
body: ec2_ami_find:
region: ${1:undefined} # required. The AWS region to use.
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
is_public: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether or not the image(s) are public.
virtualization_type: ${4:null} # not required. Virtualization type to match (e.g. hvm).

no_result_action: ${5|success,fail|} # not required. choices: success;fail. What to do when no results are found.,'success' reports success and returns an empty array,'fail' causes the module to report failure

ec2_url: ${6:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
ami_tags: ${7:null} # not required. A hash/dictionary of tags to match for the AMI.
ami_id: ${8:null} # not required. An AMI ID to match.
sort_tag: ${9:null} # not required. Tag name with which to sort results.,Required when specifying 'sort=tag'.
sort_order: ${10|ascending,descending|} # not required. choices: ascending;descending. Order in which to sort results.,Only used when the 'sort' parameter is specified.
sort_end: ${11:null} # not required. Which result to end with (when sorting).,Corresponds to Python slice notation.
sort_start: ${12:null} # not required. Which result to start with (when sorting).,Corresponds to Python slice notation.
security_token: ${13:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
name: ${14:null} # not required. An AMI name to match.
aws_secret_key: ${15:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
product_code: ${16:null} # not required. Marketplace product code to match.
profile: ${17:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
hypervisor: ${18:null} # not required. A hypervisor type type to match (e.g. xen).

sort: ${19|name,description,tag,architecture,block_device_mapping,creationDate,hypervisor,is_public,location,owner_id,platform,root_device_name,root_device_type,state,virtualization_type|} # not required. choices: name;description;tag;architecture;block_device_mapping;creationDate;hypervisor;is_public;location;owner_id;platform;root_device_name;root_device_type;state;virtualization_type. Optional attribute which with to sort the results.,If specifying 'tag', the 'tag_name' parameter is required.,Starting at version 2.1, additional sort choices of architecture, block_device_mapping, creationDate, hypervisor, is_public, location, owner_id, platform, root_device_name, root_device_type, state, and virtualization_type are supported.

owner: ${20:null} # not required. Search AMIs owned by the specified owner,Can specify an AWS account ID, or one of the special IDs 'self', 'amazon' or 'aws-marketplace',If not specified, all EC2 AMIs in the specified region will be searched.,You can include wildcards in many of the search options. An asterisk (*) matches zero or more characters, and a question mark (?) matches exactly one character. You can escape special characters using a backslash (\) before the character. For example, a value of \*amazon\?\\ searches for the literal string *amazon?\.
architecture: ${21:null} # not required. An architecture type to match (e.g. x86_64).
aws_access_key: ${22:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
root_device_type: ${23:null} # not required. Root device type to match (e.g. ebs, instance-store).
state: ${24:available} # not required. AMI state to match.
platform: ${25:null} # not required. Platform type to match.

ec2_ami_search.description: Retrieve AWS AMI information for a given operating system.
body: ec2_ami_search:
release: ${1:undefined} # required. short name of the release (e.g., C(precise))
distro: ${2|ubuntu|} # required. choices: ubuntu. Linux distribution (e.g., C(ubuntu))
stream: ${3|server,desktop|} # not required. choices: server;desktop. Type of release.
virt: ${4|paravirtual,hvm|} # not required. choices: paravirtual;hvm. virutalization type
store: ${5|ebs,ebs-io1,ebs-ssd,instance-store|} # not required. choices: ebs;ebs-io1;ebs-ssd;instance-store. Back-end store for instance
arch: ${6|i386,amd64|} # not required. choices: i386;amd64. CPU architecture

region: ${7|ap-northeast-1,ap-southeast-1,ap-northeast-2,ap-southeast-2,ca-central-1,eu-central-1,eu-west-1,eu-west-2,sa-east-1,us-east-1,us-east-2,us-west-1,us-west-2,us-gov-west-1|} # not required. choices: ap-northeast-1;ap-southeast-1;ap-northeast-2;ap-southeast-2;ca-central-1;eu-central-1;eu-west-1;eu-west-2;sa-east-1;us-east-1;us-east-2;us-west-1;us-west-2;us-gov-west-1. EC2 region

ec2_asg.description: Create or delete AWS Autoscaling Groups
body: ec2_asg:

launch_config_name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the Launch configuration to use for the group. See the ec2_lc module for managing these. If unspecified then the current group value will be used.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Unique name for group to be created or deleted
desired_capacity: ${3:undefined} # not required. Desired number of instances in group, if unspecified then the current group value will be used.
placement_group: ${4:None} # not required. Physical location of your cluster placement group created in Amazon EC2.
load_balancers: ${5:undefined} # not required. List of ELB names to use for the group. Use for classic load balancers.

notification_types: ${6:autoscaling:EC2_INSTANCE_LAUNCH,autoscaling:EC2_INSTANCE_LAUNCH_ERROR,autoscaling:EC2_INSTANCE_TERMINATE,autoscaling:EC2_INSTANCE_TERMINATE_ERROR} # not required. A list of auto scaling events to trigger notifications on.
tags: ${7:None} # not required. A list of tags to add to the Auto Scale Group. Optional key is 'propagate_at_launch', which defaults to true.
default_cooldown: ${8:300 seconds} # not required. The number of seconds after a scaling activity completes before another can begin.
vpc_zone_identifier: ${9:None} # not required. List of VPC subnets to use
replace_batch_size: ${10:1} # not required. Number of instances you'd like to replace at a time.  Used with replace_all_instances.
wait_timeout: ${11:300} # not required. how long before wait instances to become viable when replaced.  Used in conjunction with instance_ids option.

wait_for_instances: ${12:true} # not required. Wait for the ASG instances to be in a ready state before exiting.  If instances are behind an ELB, it will wait until the ELB determines all instances have a lifecycle_state of  "InService" and  a health_status of "Healthy".
aws_secret_key: ${13:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
lc_check: ${14:true} # not required. Check to make sure instances that are being replaced with replace_instances do not already have the current launch_config.
security_token: ${15:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
replace_all_instances: ${16:false} # not required. In a rolling fashion, replace all instances with an old launch configuration with one from the current launch configuration.
profile: ${17:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
notification_topic: ${18:None} # not required. A SNS topic ARN to send auto scaling notifications to.
health_check_period: ${19:500 seconds} # not required. Length of time in seconds after a new EC2 instance comes into service that Auto Scaling starts checking its health.

replace_instances: ${20:None} # not required. List of instance_ids belonging to the named ASG that you would like to terminate and be replaced with instances matching the current launch configuration.

ec2_url: ${21:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

availability_zones: ${22:undefined} # not required. List of availability zone names in which to create the group.  Defaults to all the availability zones in the region if vpc_zone_identifier is not set.
max_size: ${23:undefined} # not required. Maximum number of instances in group, if unspecified then the current group value will be used.

region: ${24:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
target_group_arns: ${25:undefined} # not required. List of target group ARNs to use for the group. Use for application load balancers.
validate_certs: ${26:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

termination_policies: ${27|OldestInstance,NewestInstance,OldestLaunchConfiguration,ClosestToNextInstanceHour,Default|} # not required. choices: OldestInstance;NewestInstance;OldestLaunchConfiguration;ClosestToNextInstanceHour;Default. An ordered list of criteria used for selecting instances to be removed from the Auto Scaling group when reducing capacity.,For 'Default', when used to create a new autoscaling group, the "Default"i value is used. When used to change an existent autoscaling group, the current termination policies are maintained.
aws_access_key: ${28:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
min_size: ${29:undefined} # not required. Minimum number of instances in group, if unspecified then the current group value will be used.

suspend_processes: ${30|Launch,Terminate,HealthCheck,ReplaceUnhealthy,AZRebalance,AlarmNotification,ScheduledActions,AddToLoadBalancer|} # not required. choices: Launch;Terminate;HealthCheck;ReplaceUnhealthy;AZRebalance;AlarmNotification;ScheduledActions;AddToLoadBalancer. A list of scaling processes to suspend.
state: ${31|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. register or deregister the instance
health_check_type: ${32|EC2,ELB|} # not required. choices: EC2;ELB. The service you want the health status from, Amazon EC2 or Elastic Load Balancer.

ec2_asg_facts.description: Gather facts about ec2 Auto Scaling Groups (ASGs) in AWS
body: ec2_asg_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

region: ${2:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${4:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
tags: ${6:undefined} # not required. A dictionary/hash of tags in the format { tag1_name: 'tag1_value', tag2_name: 'tag2_value' } to match against the auto scaling group(s) you are searching for.
security_token: ${7:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: ${8:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

name: ${9:undefined} # not required. The prefix or name of the auto scaling group(s) you are searching for.,Note: This is a regular expression match with implicit '^' (beginning of string). Append '$' for a complete name match.

ec2_asg_lifecycle_hook.description: Create, delete or update AWS ASG Lifecycle Hooks.
body: ec2_asg_lifecycle_hook:
lifecycle_hook_name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the lifecycle hook.
autoscaling_group_name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the Auto Scaling group to which you want to assign the lifecycle hook.

transition: ${3|autoscaling:EC2_INSTANCE_TERMINATING,autoscaling:EC2_INSTANCE_LAUNCHING|} # required. choices: autoscaling:EC2_INSTANCE_TERMINATING;autoscaling:EC2_INSTANCE_LAUNCHING. The instance state to which you want to attach the lifecycle hook.
validate_certs: ${4:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: ${6:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${7:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

default_result: ${8|ABANDON,CONTINUE|} # not required. choices: ABANDON;CONTINUE. Defines the action the Auto Scaling group should take when the lifecycle hook timeout elapses or if an unexpected failure occurs. This parameter can be either CONTINUE or ABANDON.
notification_meta_data: ${9:undefined} # not required. Contains additional information that you want to include any time Auto Scaling sends a message to the notification target.

region: ${10:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

heartbeat_timeout: ${11:3600 (1 hour)} # not required. The amount of time, in seconds, that can elapse before the lifecycle hook times out. When the lifecycle hook times out, Auto Scaling performs the default action. You can prevent the lifecycle hook from timing out by calling RecordLifecycleActionHeartbeat.

notification_target_arn: ${12:undefined} # not required. The ARN of the notification target that Auto Scaling will use to notify you when an instance is in the transition state for the lifecycle hook. This target can be either an SQS queue or an SNS topic. If you specify an empty string, this overrides the current ARN.

ec2_url: ${13:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
role_arn: ${14:undefined} # not required. The ARN of the IAM role that allows the Auto Scaling group to publish to the specified notification target.
security_token: ${15:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${16|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Create or delete Lifecycle Hook. Present updates existing one or creates if not found.
ec2_customer_gateway:
ip_address: ${1:undefined} # required. Internet-routable IP address for customers gateway, must be a static address.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the customer gateway.
validate_certs: ${3:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${6:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

region: ${7:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
routing: ${8|static,dynamic|} # not required. choices: static;dynamic. The type of routing.

ec2_url: ${9:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
security_token: ${10:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${11|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Create or terminate the Customer Gateway.
bgp_asn: ${12:null} # not required. Border Gateway Protocol (BGP) Autonomous System Number (ASN), required when state=present.

ec2_customer_gateway_facts.description: Gather facts about customer gateways in AWS
body: ec2_customer_gateway_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

filters: ${2:None} # not required. A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeCustomerGateways.html) for possible filters.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${6:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
customer_gateway_ids: ${8:None} # not required. Get details of a specific customer gateways using customer gateway ID/IDs. This value should be provided as a list.

region: ${9:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
ec2_eip:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
reuse_existing_ip_allowed: ${2:false} # not required. Reuse an EIP that is not associated to a device (when available), instead of allocating a new one.

state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. If present, allocate an EIP or associate an existing EIP with a device.,If absent, disassociate the EIP from the device and optionally release it.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
device_id: ${5:undefined} # not required. The id of the device for the EIP. Can be an EC2 Instance id or Elastic Network Interface (ENI) id.
private_ip_address: ${6:None} # not required. The primary or secondary private IP address to associate with the Elastic IP address.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
in_vpc: ${8:false} # not required. Allocate an EIP inside a VPC or not. Required if specifying an ENI.

region: ${9:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_secret_key: ${10:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: ${11:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${12:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
release_on_disassociation: ${13:false} # not required. whether or not to automatically release the EIP when it is disassociated

public_ip: ${14:undefined} # not required. The IP address of a previously allocated EIP.,If present and device is specified, the EIP is associated with the device.,If absent and device is specified, the EIP is disassociated from the device.

allow_reassociation: ${15:false} # not required. Specify this option to allow an Elastic IP address that is already associated with another network interface or instance to be re-associated with the specified instance or interface.

ec2_elb.description: De-registers or registers instances from EC2 ELBs
body: ec2_elb:
instance_id: ${1:undefined} # required. EC2 Instance ID
state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. register or deregister the instance
validate_certs: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

enable_availability_zone: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether to enable the availability zone of the instance on the target ELB if the availability zone has not already been enabled. If set to no, the task will fail if the availability zone is not enabled on the ELB.
profile: ${6:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
wait: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Wait for instance registration or deregistration to complete successfully before returning.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

wait_timeout: ${9:0} # not required. Number of seconds to wait for an instance to change state. If 0 then this module may return an error if a transient error occurs. If non-zero then any transient errors are ignored until the timeout is reached. Ignored when wait=no.

ec2_url: ${10:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
ec2_elbs: ${11:None} # not required. List of ELB names, required for registration. The ec2_elbs fact should be used if there was a previous de-register.
aws_access_key: ${12:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${13:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_elb_facts.description: Gather facts about EC2 Elastic Load Balancers in AWS
body: ec2_elb_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${2:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${3:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
names: ${5:null} # not required. List of ELB names to gather facts about. Pass this option to gather facts about a set of ELBs, otherwise, all ELBs are returned.

ec2_url: ${6:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
security_token: ${7:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
ec2_elb_lb:
state: ${1|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Create or destroy the ELB
name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the ELB
validate_certs: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
purge_listeners: ${5:true} # not required. Purge existing listeners on ELB that are not found in listeners
purge_instance_ids: ${6:false} # not required. Purge existing instance ids on ELB that are not found in instance_ids

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
cross_az_load_balancing: ${8|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Distribute load across all configured Availability Zones

scheme: ${9|internal,internet-facing|} # not required. choices: internal;internet-facing. The scheme to use when creating the ELB. For a private VPC-visible ELB use 'internal'. If you choose to update your scheme with a different value the ELB will be destroyed and recreated. To update scheme you must use the option wait.
wait: ${10|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. When specified, Ansible will check the status of the load balancer to ensure it has been successfully removed from AWS.
health_check: ${11:None} # not required. An associative array of health check configuration settings (see example)
access_logs: ${12:None} # not required. An associative array of access logs configuration settings (see example)
security_group_ids: ${13:None} # not required. A list of security groups to apply to the elb
security_token: ${14:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
idle_timeout: ${15:undefined} # not required. ELB connections from clients and to servers are timed out after this amount of time
wait_timeout: ${16:60} # not required. Used in conjunction with wait. Number of seconds to wait for the elb to be terminated. A maximum of 600 seconds (10 minutes) is allowed.
connection_draining_timeout: ${17:undefined} # not required. Wait a specified timeout allowing connections to drain before terminating an instance
profile: ${18:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
tags: ${19:undefined} # not required. An associative array of tags. To delete all tags, supply an empty dict.
stickiness: ${20:undefined} # not required. An associative array of stickiness policy settings. Policy will be applied to all listeners ( see example )
purge_subnets: ${21:false} # not required. Purge existing subnet on ELB that are not found in subnets

region: ${22:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
subnets: ${23:None} # not required. A list of VPC subnets to use when creating ELB. Zones should be empty if using this.
listeners: ${24:undefined} # not required. List of ports/protocols for this ELB to listen on (see example)
aws_access_key: ${25:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
zones: ${26:undefined} # not required. List of availability zones to enable on this ELB
security_group_names: ${27:None} # not required. A list of security group names to apply to the elb
instance_ids: ${28:false} # not required. List of instance ids to attach to this ELB
purge_zones: ${29:false} # not required. Purge existing availability zones on ELB that are not found in zones

ec2_eni.description: Create and optionally attach an Elastic Network Interface (ENI) to an instance
body: ec2_eni:

security_groups: ${1:null} # not required. List of security groups associated with the interface. Only used when state=present. Since version 2.2, you can specify security groups by ID or by name or a combination of both. Prior to 2.2, you can specify only by ID.
aws_secret_key: ${2:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
device_index: ${4:0} # not required. The index of the device for the network interface attachment on the instance.
validate_certs: ${5:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

delete_on_termination: ${6:undefined} # not required. Delete the interface when the instance it is attached to is terminated. You can only specify this flag when the interface is being modified, not on creation.
eni_id: ${7:null} # not required. The ID of the ENI (to modify); if null and state is present, a new eni will be created.

secondary_private_ip_address_count: ${8:undefined} # not required. The number of secondary IP addresses to assign to the network interface. This option is mutually exclusive of secondary_private_ip_addresses

force_detach: ${9:false} # not required. Force detachment of the interface. This applies either when explicitly detaching the interface by setting instance_id to None or when deleting an interface with state=absent.
security_token: ${10:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
attached: ${11:true} # not required. Specifies if network interface should be attached or detached from instance. If ommited, attachment status won't change

secondary_private_ip_addresses: ${12:undefined} # not required. A list of IP addresses to assign as secondary IP addresses to the network interface. This option is mutually exclusive of secondary_private_ip_address_count
subnet_id: ${13:undefined} # not required. ID of subnet in which to create the ENI.
description: ${14:null} # not required. Optional description of the ENI.
profile: ${15:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
private_ip_address: ${16:null} # not required. Private IP address.

source_dest_check: ${17:undefined} # not required. By default, interfaces perform source/destination checks. NAT instances however need this check to be disabled. You can only specify this flag when the interface is being modified, not on creation.

region: ${18:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

purge_secondary_private_ip_addresses: ${19:false} # not required. To be used with I(secondary_private_ip_addresses) to determine whether or not to remove any secondary IP addresses other than those specified. Set secondary_private_ip_addresses to an empty list to purge all secondary addresses.

instance_id: ${20:null} # not required. Instance ID that you wish to attach ENI to. Since version 2.2, use the 'attached' parameter to attach or detach an ENI. Prior to 2.2, to detach an ENI from an instance, use 'None'.

ec2_url: ${21:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
state: ${22|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Create or delete ENI

ec2_eni_facts.description: Gather facts about ec2 ENI interfaces in AWS
body: ec2_eni_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

filters: ${2:null} # not required. A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeNetworkInterfaces.html) for possible filters.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${6:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_metadata_facts.description: Gathers facts (instance metadata) about remote hosts within ec2
body: ec2_metadata_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:true} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
force: ${2:false} # not required. If C(yes) do not get a cached copy.
url_password: ${3:undefined} # not required. The password for use in HTTP basic authentication.,If the I(url_username) parameter is not specified, the I(url_password) parameter will not be used.
url_username: ${4:undefined} # not required. The username for use in HTTP basic authentication.,This parameter can be used without I(url_password) for sites that allow empty passwords

client_key: ${5:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for SSL client authentication. If C(client_cert) contains both the certificate and key, this option is not required.

client_cert: ${6:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted certificate chain file to be used for SSL client authentication. This file can also include the key as well, and if the key is included, C(client_key) is not required.
http_agent: ${7:ansible-httpget} # not required. Header to identify as, generally appears in web server logs.
force_basic_auth: ${8:false} # not required. Credentials specified with I(url_username) and I(url_password) should be passed in HTTP Header.
use_proxy: ${9:true} # not required. If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
url: ${10:undefined} # not required. HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP URL in the form (http|https|ftp)://[user[:pass]]@host.domain[:port]/path

ec2_group.description: maintain an ec2 VPC security group.
body: ec2_group:

rules: ${1:undefined} # not required. List of firewall inbound rules to enforce in this group (see example). If none are supplied, no inbound rules will be enabled. Rules list may include its own name in `group_name`. This allows idempotent loopback additions (e.g. allow group to access itself). Rule sources list support was added in version 2.4. This allows to define multiple sources per source type as well as multiple source types per rule. Prior to 2.4 an individual source is allowed. In version 2.5 support for rule descriptions was added.
aws_secret_key: ${2:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
description: ${3:undefined} # not required. Description of the security group. Required when C(state) is C(present).
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
name: ${5:undefined} # not required. Name of the security group.,One of and only one of I(name) or I(group_id) is required.,Required if I(state=present).
tags: ${6:undefined} # not required. A dictionary of one or more tags to assign to the security group.
group_id: ${7:undefined} # not required. Id of group to delete (works only with absent).,One of and only one of I(name) or I(group_id) is required.

ec2_url: ${8:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

rules_egress: ${9:undefined} # not required. List of firewall outbound rules to enforce in this group (see example). If none are supplied, a default all-out rule is assumed. If an empty list is supplied, no outbound rules will be enabled. Rule Egress sources list support was added in version 2.4. In version 2.5 support for rule descriptions was added.

region: ${10:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
validate_certs: ${11:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
vpc_id: ${12:undefined} # not required. ID of the VPC to create the group in.
purge_rules: ${13:true} # not required. Purge existing rules on security group that are not found in rules
aws_access_key: ${14:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
purge_rules_egress: ${15:true} # not required. Purge existing rules_egress on security group that are not found in rules_egress
security_token: ${16:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${17|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Create or delete a security group

purge_tags: ${18|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If yes, existing tags will be purged from the resource to match exactly what is defined by I(tags) parameter. If the I(tags) parameter is not set then tags will not be modified.

ec2_group_facts.description: Gather facts about ec2 security groups in AWS.
body: ec2_group_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

filters: ${2:[object Object]} # not required. A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See       U(https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeSecurityGroups.html) for       possible filters. Filter names and values are case sensitive. You can also use underscores (_)       instead of dashes (-) in the filter keys, which will take precedence in case of conflict.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${6:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
ec2_instance:
security_token: ${1:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
security_groups: ${2:undefined} # not required. A list of security group IDs or names (strings). Mutually exclusive with I(security_group).
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

availability_zone: ${4:undefined} # not required. Specify an availability zone to use the default subnet it. Useful if not specifying the I(vpc_subnet_id) parameter.,If no subnet, ENI, or availability zone is provided, the default subnet in the default VPC will be used in the first AZ (alphabetically sorted).
image_id: ${5:undefined} # not required. I(ami) ID to use for the instance. One of I(image) or I(image_id) are required when instance is not already present.,This is an alias for I(image.id).
tags: ${6:undefined} # not required. A hash/dictionary of tags to add to the new instance or to add/remove from an existing one.

cpu_credit_specification: ${7|unlimited,standard|} # not required. choices: unlimited;standard. For T2 series instances, choose whether to allow increased charges to buy CPU credits if the default pool is depleted.,Choose I(unlimited) to enable buying additional CPU credits.
