tenancy: ${8|dedicated,default|} # not required. choices: dedicated;default. What type of tenancy to allow an instance to use. Default is shared tenancy. Dedicated tenancy will incur additional charges.

ec2_url: ${9:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

volumes: ${10:undefined} # not required. A list of block device mappings, by default this will always use the AMI root device so the volumes option is primarily for adding more storage.,A mapping contains the (optional) keys device_name, virtual_name, ebs.device_type, ebs.device_size, ebs.kms_key_id, ebs.iops, and ebs.delete_on_termination.,For more information about each parameter, see U(https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_BlockDeviceMapping.html)
security_group: ${11:undefined} # not required. A security group ID or name. Mutually exclusive with I(security_groups).
wait_timeout: ${12:600} # not required. How long to wait (in seconds) for the instance to finish booting/terminating
key_name: ${13:undefined} # not required. Name of the SSH access key to assign to the instance - must exist in the region the instance is created.
vpc_subnet_id: ${14:undefined} # not required. The subnet ID in which to launch the instance (VPC) If none is provided, ec2_instance will chose the default zone of the default VPC

region: ${15:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
wait: ${16:true} # not required. Whether or not to wait for the desired state (use wait_timeout to customize this)

instance_role: ${17:undefined} # not required. The ARN or name of an EC2-enabled instance role to be used. If a name is not provided in arn format then the ListInstanceProfiles permission must also be granted. U(https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/APIReference/API_ListInstanceProfiles.html) If no full ARN is provided, the role with a matching name will be used from the active AWS account.

network: ${18:undefined} # not required. Either a dictionary containing the key 'interfaces' corresponding to a list of network interface IDs or containing specifications for a single network interface.,If specifications for a single network are given, accepted keys are assign_public_ip (bool), private_ip_address (str), ipv6_addresses (list), source_dest_check (bool), description (str), delete_on_termination (bool), device_index (int), groups (list of security group IDs), private_ip_addresses (list), subnet_id (str).,I(network.interfaces) should be a list of ENI IDs (strings) or a list of objects containing the key I(id).,Use the ec2_eni to create ENIs with special settings.

tower_callback: ${19:undefined} # not required. Preconfigured user-data to enable an instance to perform a Tower callback.,Requires parameters I(tower_callback.tower_address), I(tower_callback.job_template_id), and I(tower_callback.host_config_key).,Mutually exclusive with I(user_data).,For Windows instances, to enable remote access via Ansible set I(tower_callback.windows) to true, and optionally set an admin password.,If using 'windows' and 'set_password', callback to Tower will not be performed but the instance will be ready to receive winrm connections from Ansible.
name: ${20:undefined} # not required. The Name tag for the instance.

state: ${21|present,terminated,running,started,stopped,restarted,rebooted,absent|} # not required. choices: present;terminated;running;started;stopped;restarted;rebooted;absent. Goal state for the instances
profile: ${22:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
user_data: ${23:undefined} # not required. Opaque blob of data which is made available to the ec2 instance

filters: ${24:[object Object]} # not required. A dict of filters to apply when deciding whether existing instances match and should be altered. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeInstances.html) for possible filters. Filter names and values are case sensitive. By default, instances are filtered for counting by their "Name" tag, base AMI, state (running, by default), and subnet ID. Any queryable filter can be used. Good candidates are specific tags, SSH keys, or security groups.

image: ${25:undefined} # not required. An image to use for the instance. The ec2_ami_facts module may be used to retrieve images. One of I(image) or I(image_id) are required when instance is not already present.,Complex object containing I(image.id), I(image.ramdisk), and I(image.kernel).,I(image.id) is the AMI ID.,I(image.ramdisk) overrides the AMI's default ramdisk ID.,I(image.kernel) is a string AKI to override the AMI kernel.
validate_certs: ${26:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
purge_tags: ${27:false} # not required. Delete any tags not specified in the task that are on the instance. This means you have to specify all the desired tags on each task affecting an instance.
aws_access_key: ${28:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
ebs_optimized: ${29:undefined} # not required. Whether instance is should use optimized EBS volumes, see U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/EBSOptimized.html)
detailed_monitoring: ${30:undefined} # not required. Whether to allow detailed cloudwatch metrics to be collected, enabling more detailed alerting.

termination_protection: ${31:undefined} # not required. Whether to enable termination protection. This module will not terminate an instance with termination protection active, it must be turned off first.
instance_initiated_shutdown_behavior: ${32|stop,terminate|} # not required. choices: stop;terminate. Whether to stop or terminate an instance upon shutdown.

launch_template: ${33:undefined} # not required. The EC2 launch template to base instance configuration on.,I(launch_template.id) the ID or the launch template (optional if name is specified),I(launch_template.name) the pretty name of the launch template (optional if id is specified),I(launch_template.version) the specific version of the launch template to use. If unspecified, the template default is chosen.
instance_ids: ${34:undefined} # not required. If you specify one or more instance IDs, only instances that have the specified IDs are returned.

instance_type: ${35:t2.micro} # not required. Instance type to use for the instance, see U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/instance-types.html) Only required when instance is not already present

ec2_instance_facts.description: Gather facts about ec2 instances in AWS
body: ec2_instance_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

filters: ${2:[object Object]} # not required. A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeInstances.html) for possible filters. Filter names and values are case sensitive.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${6:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
instance_ids: ${8:undefined} # not required. If you specify one or more instance IDs, only instances that have the specified IDs are returned.

region: ${9:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_key.description: create or delete an ec2 key pair
body: ec2_key:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the key pair.
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
force: ${4:true} # not required. Force overwrite of already existing key pair if key has changed.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
key_material: ${6:undefined} # not required. Public key material.
wait: ${7:false} # not required. Wait for the specified action to complete before returning. This option has no effect since version 2.5.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
wait_timeout: ${9:300} # not required. How long before wait gives up, in seconds. This option has no effect since version 2.5.

ec2_url: ${10:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
aws_access_key: ${11:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${12:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${13|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. create or delete keypair

ec2_lc.description: Create or delete AWS Autoscaling Launch Configurations
body: ec2_lc:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Unique name for configuration
instance_type: ${2:null} # required. Instance type to use for the instance
state: ${3|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Register or deregister the instance

security_groups: ${4:undefined} # not required. A list of security groups to apply to the instances. Since version 2.4 you can specify either security group names or IDs or a mix.  Previous to 2.4, for VPC instances, specify security group IDs and for EC2-Classic, specify either security group names or IDs.
classic_link_vpc_id: ${5:undefined} # not required. Id of ClassicLink enabled VPC
image_id: ${6:undefined} # not required. The AMI unique identifier to be used for the group
validate_certs: ${7:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
user_data_path: ${8:undefined} # not required. Path to the file that contains userdata for the ec2 instances. Mutually exclusive with I(user_data).

volumes: ${9:undefined} # not required. A list of volume dicts, each containing device name and optionally ephemeral id or snapshot id. Size and type (and number of iops for io device type) must be specified for a new volume or a root volume, and may be passed for a snapshot volume. For any volume, a volume size less than 1 will be interpreted as a request not to create the volume.

ec2_url: ${10:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
instance_monitoring: ${11:false} # not required. Specifies whether instances are launched with detailed monitoring.
key_name: ${12:undefined} # not required. The SSH key name to be used for access to managed instances
vpc_id: ${13:undefined} # not required. VPC ID, used when resolving security group names to IDs.
placement_tenancy: ${14:default} # not required. Determines whether the instance runs on single-tenant harware or not.

region: ${15:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
classic_link_vpc_security_groups: ${16:undefined} # not required. A list of security group IDs with which to associate the ClassicLink VPC instances.
kernel_id: ${17:undefined} # not required. Kernel id for the EC2 instance
security_token: ${18:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
aws_secret_key: ${19:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
ramdisk_id: ${20:undefined} # not required. A RAM disk id for the instances.
profile: ${21:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
spot_price: ${22:undefined} # not required. The spot price you are bidding. Only applies for an autoscaling group with spot instances.

assign_public_ip: ${23:undefined} # not required. Used for Auto Scaling groups that launch instances into an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud. Specifies whether to assign a public IP address to each instance launched in a Amazon VPC.
user_data: ${24:undefined} # not required. Opaque blob of data which is made available to the ec2 instance. Mutually exclusive with I(user_data_path).
instance_profile_name: ${25:undefined} # not required. The name or the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the instance profile associated with the IAM role for the instances.
instance_id: ${26:undefined} # not required. The Id of a running instance to use as a basis for a launch configuration. Can be used in place of image_id and instance_type.
aws_access_key: ${27:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
ebs_optimized: ${28:false} # not required. Specifies whether the instance is optimized for EBS I/O (true) or not (false).

ec2_lc_facts.description: Gather facts about AWS Autoscaling Launch Configurations
body: ec2_lc_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
sort_start: ${2:null} # not required. Which result to start with (when sorting).,Corresponds to Python slice notation.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

sort: ${5|launch_configuration_name,image_id,created_time,instance_type,kernel_id,ramdisk_id,key_name|} # not required. choices: launch_configuration_name;image_id;created_time;instance_type;kernel_id;ramdisk_id;key_name. Optional attribute which with to sort the results.

ec2_url: ${6:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: ${7:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
sort_order: ${8|ascending,descending|} # not required. choices: ascending;descending. Order in which to sort results.,Only used when the 'sort' parameter is specified.
sort_end: ${9:null} # not required. Which result to end with (when sorting).,Corresponds to Python slice notation.
aws_access_key: ${10:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${11:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
name: ${12:} # not required. A name or a list of name to match.
ec2_lc_find:
name_regex: ${1:undefined} # required. A Launch Configuration to match,It'll be compiled as regex
region: ${2:undefined} # required. The AWS region to use.
validate_certs: ${3:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
sort_order: ${4|ascending,descending|} # not required. choices: ascending;descending. Order in which to sort results.
aws_secret_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${6:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${7:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${8:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
limit: ${9:null} # not required. How many results to show.,Corresponds to Python slice notation like list[:limit].

ec2_url: ${10:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

ec2_metric_alarm.description: Create/update or delete AWS Cloudwatch 'metric alarms'
body: ec2_metric_alarm:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Unique name for the alarm
state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. register or deregister the alarm
metric: ${3:undefined} # not required. Name of the monitored metric (e.g. CPUUtilization),Metric must already exist
comparison: ${4|<=,<,>,>=|} # not required. choices: <=;<;>;>=. Determines how the threshold value is compared
aws_secret_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: ${6:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
evaluation_periods: ${7:undefined} # not required. The number of times in which the metric is evaluated before final calculation

statistic: ${8|SampleCount,Average,Sum,Minimum,Maximum|} # not required. choices: SampleCount;Average;Sum;Minimum;Maximum. Operation applied to the metric,Works in conjunction with period and evaluation_periods to determine the comparison value
period: ${9:undefined} # not required. The time (in seconds) between metric evaluations
threshold: ${10:undefined} # not required. Sets the min/max bound for triggering the alarm
security_token: ${11:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
namespace: ${12:undefined} # not required. Name of the appropriate namespace ('AWS/EC2', 'System/Linux', etc.), which determines the category it will appear under in cloudwatch
alarm_actions: ${13:undefined} # not required. A list of the names action(s) taken when the alarm is in the 'alarm' status
insufficient_data_actions: ${14:undefined} # not required. A list of the names of action(s) to take when the alarm is in the 'insufficient_data' status
description: ${15:undefined} # not required. A longer description of the alarm
profile: ${16:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
dimensions: ${17:undefined} # not required. Describes to what the alarm is applied

region: ${18:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
validate_certs: ${19:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

ec2_url: ${20:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
ok_actions: ${21:undefined} # not required. A list of the names of action(s) to take when the alarm is in the 'ok' status

unit: ${22|Seconds,Microseconds,Milliseconds,Bytes,Kilobytes,Megabytes,Gigabytes,Terabytes,Bits,Kilobits,Megabits,Gigabits,Terabits,Percent,Count,Bytes/Second,Kilobytes/Second,Megabytes/Second,Gigabytes/Second,Terabytes/Second,Bits/Second,Kilobits/Second,Megabits/Second,Gigabits/Second,Terabits/Second,Count/Second,None|} # not required. choices: Seconds;Microseconds;Milliseconds;Bytes;Kilobytes;Megabytes;Gigabytes;Terabytes;Bits;Kilobits;Megabits;Gigabits;Terabits;Percent;Count;Bytes/Second;Kilobytes/Second;Megabytes/Second;Gigabytes/Second;Terabytes/Second;Bits/Second;Kilobits/Second;Megabits/Second;Gigabits/Second;Terabits/Second;Count/Second;None. The threshold's unit of measurement

ec2_placement_group.description: Create or delete an EC2 Placement Group
body: ec2_placement_group:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name for the placement group.
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

strategy: ${3|cluster,spread|} # not required. choices: cluster;spread. Placement group strategy. Cluster will cluster instances into a low-latency group in a single Availability Zone, while Spread spreads instances across underlying hardware.
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${5:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
profile: ${6:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${7:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${8:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${9|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Create or delete placement group.

region: ${10:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
ec2_placement_group_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${2:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${3:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
names: ${5:} # not required. A list of names to filter on. If a listed group does not exist, there will be no corresponding entry in the result; no error will be raised.

ec2_url: ${6:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
security_token: ${7:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_remote_facts.description: Gather facts about ec2 instances in AWS
body: ec2_remote_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

filters: ${2:null} # not required. A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeInstances.html) for possible filters.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${6:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_scaling_policy.description: Create or delete AWS scaling policies for Autoscaling groups
body: ec2_scaling_policy:
asg_name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the associated autoscaling group
state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. register or deregister the policy
name: ${3:undefined} # required. Unique name for the scaling policy
cooldown: ${4:undefined} # not required. The minimum period of time between which autoscaling actions can take place
validate_certs: ${5:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${6:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${7:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

adjustment_type: ${8|ChangeInCapacity,ExactCapacity,PercentChangeInCapacity|} # not required. choices: ChangeInCapacity;ExactCapacity;PercentChangeInCapacity. The type of change in capacity of the autoscaling group
scaling_adjustment: ${9:undefined} # not required. The amount by which the autoscaling group is adjusted by the policy

ec2_url: ${10:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: ${11:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
min_adjustment_step: ${12:undefined} # not required. Minimum amount of adjustment when policy is triggered
aws_access_key: ${13:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${14:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_snapshot.description: creates a snapshot from an existing volume
body: ec2_snapshot:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${2:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
description: ${3:undefined} # not required. description to be applied to the snapshot
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
snapshot_id: ${6:undefined} # not required. snapshot id to remove

region: ${7:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
volume_id: ${8:undefined} # not required. volume from which to take the snapshot
wait_timeout: ${9:0} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds,specify 0 to wait forever

ec2_url: ${10:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
instance_id: ${11:undefined} # not required. instance that has the required volume to snapshot mounted
wait: ${12|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the snapshot to be ready
snapshot_tags: ${13:undefined} # not required. a hash/dictionary of tags to add to the snapshot
state: ${14|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. whether to add or create a snapshot
security_token: ${15:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
last_snapshot_min_age: ${16:0} # not required. If the volume's most recent snapshot has started less than `last_snapshot_min_age' minutes ago, a new snapshot will not be created.
device_name: ${17:undefined} # not required. device name of a mounted volume to be snapshotted

ec2_snapshot_copy.description: copies an EC2 snapshot and returns the new Snapshot ID.
body: ec2_snapshot_copy:
source_region: ${1:undefined} # required. The source region the Snapshot should be copied from.
source_snapshot_id: ${2:undefined} # required. The ID of the Snapshot in source region that should be copied.
validate_certs: ${3:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
description: ${5:null} # not required. An optional human-readable string describing purpose of the new Snapshot.
profile: ${6:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
wait: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Wait for the copied Snapshot to be in 'Available' state before returning.
tags: ${8:null} # not required. A hash/dictionary of tags to add to the new Snapshot; '{"key":"value"}' and '{"key":"value","key":"value"}'
kms_key_id: ${9:null} # not required. KMS key id used to encrypt snapshot. If not specified, defaults to EBS Customer Master Key (CMK) for that account.

region: ${10:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_url: ${11:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
encrypted: ${12:false} # not required. Whether or not the destination Snapshot should be encrypted.
aws_access_key: ${13:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${14:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_snapshot_facts.description: Gather facts about ec2 volume snapshots in AWS
body: ec2_snapshot_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

filters: ${2:[object Object]} # not required. A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See       U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeSnapshots.html) for possible filters. Filter       names and values are case sensitive.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
restorable_by_user_ids: ${6:} # not required. If you specify a list of restorable users, only snapshots with create snapshot permissions for those users are       returned.
owner_ids: ${7:} # not required. If you specify one or more snapshot owners, only snapshots from the specified owners and for which you have       access are returned.

ec2_url: ${8:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
security_token: ${9:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

region: ${10:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
snapshot_ids: ${11:} # not required. If you specify one or more snapshot IDs, only snapshots that have the specified IDs are returned.

ec2_tag.description: create and remove tag(s) to ec2 resources.
body: ec2_tag:
tags: ${1:null} # required. a hash/dictionary of tags to add to the resource; '{"key":"value"}' and '{"key":"value","key":"value"}'
resource: ${2:null} # required. The EC2 resource id.
validate_certs: ${3:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${6:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
security_token: ${8:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${9|present,absent,list|} # not required. choices: present;absent;list. Whether the tags should be present or absent on the resource. Use list to interrogate the tags of an instance.

region: ${10:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_vol.description: create and attach a volume, return volume id and device map
body: ec2_vol:
instance: ${1:null} # not required. instance ID if you wish to attach the volume. Since 1.9 you can set to None to detach.
encrypted: ${2:false} # not required. Enable encryption at rest for this volume.

ec2_url: ${3:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
tags: ${5:[object Object]} # not required. tag:value pairs to add to the volume after creation
kms_key_id: ${6:null} # not required. Specify the id of the KMS key to use.
delete_on_termination: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. When set to "yes", the volume will be deleted upon instance termination.
volume_size: ${8:null} # not required. size of volume (in GB) to create.
snapshot: ${9:null} # not required. snapshot ID on which to base the volume
validate_certs: ${10|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

volume_type: ${11:standard} # not required. Type of EBS volume; standard (magnetic), gp2 (SSD), io1 (Provisioned IOPS), st1 (Throughput Optimized HDD), sc1 (Cold HDD). "Standard" is the old EBS default and continues to remain the Ansible default for backwards compatibility.

region: ${12:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_secret_key: ${13:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
zone: ${14:null} # not required. zone in which to create the volume, if unset uses the zone the instance is in (if set)
iops: ${15:100} # not required. the provisioned IOPs you want to associate with this volume (integer).
aws_access_key: ${16:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${17:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

state: ${18|absent,present,list|} # not required. choices: absent;present;list. whether to ensure the volume is present or absent, or to list existing volumes (The C(list) option was added in version 1.8).
id: ${19:null} # not required. volume id if you wish to attach an existing volume (requires instance) or remove an existing volume
name: ${20:null} # not required. volume Name tag if you wish to attach an existing volume (requires instance)
device_name: ${21:null} # not required. device id to override device mapping. Assumes /dev/sdf for Linux/UNIX and /dev/xvdf for Windows.

ec2_vol_facts.description: Gather facts about ec2 volumes in AWS
body: ec2_vol_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

filters: ${2:null} # not required. A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeVolumes.html) for possible filters.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${6:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
ec2_vpc:

resource_tags: ${1:undefined} # required. A dictionary array of resource tags of the form C({ tag1: value1, tag2: value2 }). - Tags in this list are used in conjunction with CIDR block to uniquely identify a VPC in lieu of vpc_id. Therefore, if CIDR/Tag combination does not exist, a new VPC will be created.  VPC tags not on this list will be ignored. Prior to 1.7, specifying a resource tag was optional.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Create or terminate the VPC.
validate_certs: ${3:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
dns_support: ${6|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Toggles the "Enable DNS resolution" flag.
dns_hostnames: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Toggles the "Enable DNS hostname support for instances" flag.

route_tables: ${8:null} # not required. A dictionary array of route tables to add of the form: C({ subnets: [172.22.2.0/24, 172.22.3.0/24,], routes: [{ dest: 0.0.0.0/0, gw: igw},], resource_tags: ... }). Where the subnets list is those subnets the route table should be associated with, and the routes list is a list of routes to be in the table.  The special keyword for the gw of igw specifies that you should the route should go through the internet gateway attached to the VPC. gw also accepts instance-ids, interface-ids, and vpc-peering-connection-ids in addition igw. resource_tags is optional and uses dictionary form: C({ "Name": "public", ... }). This module is currently unable to affect the "main" route table due to some limitations in boto, so you must explicitly define the associated subnets or they will be attached to the main table implicitly. As of 1.8, if the route_tables parameter is not specified, no existing routes will be modified.
cidr_block: ${9:undefined} # not required. The cidr block representing the VPC, e.g. C(10.0.0.0/16), required when I(state=present).
wait_timeout: ${10:300} # not required. How long before wait gives up, in seconds.

ec2_url: ${11:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
vpc_id: ${12:null} # not required. A VPC id to terminate when I(state=absent).

subnets: ${13:null} # not required. A dictionary array of subnets to add of the form C({ cidr: ..., az: ... , resource_tags: ... }).,Where C(az) is the desired availability zone of the subnet, optional.,Tags C(resource_tags) use dictionary form C({ "Environment":"Dev", "Tier":"Web", ...}), optional.,C(resource_tags) see resource_tags for VPC below. The main difference is subnet tags not specified here will be deleted.,All VPC subnets not in this list will be removed as well.,As of 1.8, if the subnets parameter is not specified, no existing subnets will be modified.'

region: ${14:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
wait: ${15|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Wait for the VPC to be in state 'available' before returning.
security_token: ${16:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
internet_gateway: ${17|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Toggle whether there should be an Internet gateway attached to the VPC.
instance_tenancy: ${18|default,dedicated|} # not required. choices: default;dedicated. The supported tenancy options for instances launched into the VPC.
profile: ${19:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

ec2_vpc_dhcp_option.description: Manages DHCP Options, and can ensure the DHCP options for the given VPC match what's requested
body: ec2_vpc_dhcp_option:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
domain_name: ${2:None} # not required. The domain name to set in the DHCP option sets
aws_access_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
dns_servers: ${5:None} # not required. A list of hosts to set the DNS servers for the VPC to. (Should be a list of IP addresses rather than host names.)
tags: ${6:None} # not required. Tags to be applied to a VPC options set if a new one is created, or if the resource_id is provided. (options must match)

delete_old: ${7:true} # not required. Whether to delete the old VPC DHCP option set when associating a new one. This is primarily useful for debugging/development purposes when you want to quickly roll back to the old option set. Note that this setting will be ignored, and the old DHCP option set will be preserved, if it is in use by any other VPC. (Otherwise, AWS will return an error.)
dhcp_options_id: ${8:None} # not required. The resource_id of an existing DHCP options set. If this is specified, then it will override other settings, except tags (which will be updated to match)

netbios_node_type: ${9:None} # not required. NetBIOS node type to advertise in the DHCP options. The AWS recommendation is to use 2 (when using netbios name services) http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonVPC/latest/UserGuide/VPC_DHCP_Options.html

region: ${10:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_url: ${11:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
vpc_id: ${12:None} # not required. VPC ID to associate with the requested DHCP option set. If no vpc id is provided, and no matching option set is found then a new DHCP option set is created.
aws_secret_key: ${13:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
netbios_name_servers: ${14:None} # not required. List of hosts to advertise as NetBIOS servers.
ntp_servers: ${15:None} # not required. List of hosts to advertise as NTP servers for the VPC.

state: ${16|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. create/assign or remove the DHCP options. If state is set to absent, then a DHCP options set matched either by id, or tags and options will be removed if possible.
security_token: ${17:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

inherit_existing: ${18:false} # not required. For any DHCP options not specified in these parameters, whether to inherit them from the options set already applied to vpc_id, or to reset them to be empty.

validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

filters: ${2:null} # not required. A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeRouteTables.html) for possible filters.

dhcp_options_ids: ${7:None} # not required. Get details of specific DHCP Option ID,Provide this value as a list

ec2_url: ${8:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

ec2_vpc_endpoint.description: Create and delete AWS VPC Endpoints.
body: ec2_vpc_endpoint:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${2:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
client_token: ${3:undefined} # not required. Optional client token to ensure idempotency
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

region: ${6:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
wait_timeout: ${7:320} # not required. Used in conjunction with wait. Number of seconds to wait for status. Unfortunately this is ignored for delete actions due to a difference in behaviour from AWS.

ec2_url: ${8:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
vpc_id: ${9:undefined} # not required. Required when creating a VPC endpoint.
route_table_ids: ${10:undefined} # not required. List of one or more route table ids to attach to the endpoint. A route is added to the route table with the destination of the endpoint if provided.

policy: ${11:undefined} # not required. A properly formatted json policy as string, see U(https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/7005#issuecomment-42894813). Cannot be used with I(policy_file).,Option when creating an endpoint. If not provided AWS will utilise a default policy which provides full access to the service.
vpc_endpoint_id: ${12:undefined} # not required. One or more vpc endpoint ids to remove from the AWS account

wait: ${13|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. When specified, will wait for either available status for state present. Unfortunately this is ignored for delete actions due to a difference in behaviour from AWS.
security_token: ${14:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${15|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. present to ensure resource is created.,absent to remove resource

policy_file: ${16:undefined} # not required. The path to the properly json formatted policy file, see U(https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/7005#issuecomment-42894813) on how to use it properly. Cannot be used with I(policy).,Option when creating an endpoint. If not provided AWS will utilise a default policy which provides full access to the service.
service: ${17:undefined} # not required. An AWS supported vpc endpoint service. Use the ec2_vpc_endpoint_facts module to describe the supported endpoint services.,Required when creating an endpoint.

egress: ${7:undefined} # not required. A list of rules for outgoing traffic.,Each rule must be specified as a list.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_url: ${9:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
vpc_id: ${10:undefined} # not required. VPC id of the requesting VPC.,Required when state present.
subnets: ${11:undefined} # not required. The list of subnets that should be associated with the network ACL.,Must be specified as a list,Each subnet can be specified as subnet ID, or its tagged name.
nacl_id: ${12:undefined} # not required. NACL id identifying a network ACL.,One and only one of the I(name) or I(nacl_id) is required.
security_token: ${13:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${14|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Creates or modifies an existing NACL,Deletes a NACL and reassociates subnets to the default NACL
name: ${15:undefined} # not required. Tagged name identifying a network ACL.,One and only one of the I(name) or I(nacl_id) is required.

client_token: ${4:undefined} # not required. Optional unique token to be used during create to ensure idempotency. When specifying this option, ensure you specify the eip_address parameter as well otherwise any subsequent runs will fail.

nat_gateway_id: ${16:None} # not required. The id AWS dynamically allocates to the NAT Gateway on creation. This is required when the absent option is present.

profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

tags: ${5:undefined} # not required. A dictionary of resource tags of the form: { tag1: value1, tag2: value2 }. Tags are used to uniquely identify route tables within a VPC when the route_table_id is not supplied.
aws_secret_key: ${6:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
purge_subnets: ${8:true} # not required. Purge existing subnets that are not found in subnets. Ignored unless the subnets option is supplied.

region: ${9:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
subnets: ${10:undefined} # not required. An array of subnets to add to this route table. Subnets may be specified by either subnet ID, Name tag, or by a CIDR such as '10.0.0.0/24'.

lookup: ${11|tag,id|} # not required. choices: tag;id. Look up route table by either tags or by route table ID. Non-unique tag lookup will fail. If no tags are specified then no lookup for an existing route table is performed and a new route table will be created. To change tags of a route table you must look up by id.
aws_access_key: ${12:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

routes: ${13:None} # not required. List of routes in the route table. Routes are specified as dicts containing the keys 'dest' and one of 'gateway_id', 'instance_id', 'interface_id', or 'vpc_peering_connection_id'. If 'gateway_id' is specified, you can refer to the VPC's IGW by using the value 'igw'. Routes are required for present states.

state: ${15|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Create or destroy the VPC route table

purge_tags: ${17:false} # not required. Purge existing tags that are not found in route table
purge_routes: ${18:true} # not required. Purge existing routes that are not found in routes.

state: ${7|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. present to ensure resource is created.,absent to remove resource
name: ${8:undefined} # not required. name of the vgw to be created or deleted

ec2_vpc_vgw_facts.description: Gather facts about virtual gateways in AWS
body: ec2_vpc_vgw_facts:
vpn_gateway_ids: ${1:None} # not required. Get details of a specific Virtual Gateway ID. This value should be provided as a list.
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

filters: ${3:None} # not required. A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeRouteTables.html) for possible filters.
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${6:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${7:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${8:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: ${9:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_vpc_vpn.description: Create, modify, and delete EC2 VPN connections.
body: ec2_vpc_vpn:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${2:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
connection_type: ${3|ipsec.1|} # not required. choices: ipsec.1. The type of VPN connection.
vpn_connection_id: ${4:undefined} # not required. The ID of the VPN connection. Required to modify or delete a connection if the filters option does not provide a unique match.
customer_gateway_id: ${5:undefined} # not required. The ID of the customer gateway.

tunnel_options: ${6:undefined} # not required. An optional list object containing no more than two dict members, each of which may contain 'TunnelInsideCidr' and/or 'PreSharedKey' keys with appropriate string values.  AWS defaults will apply in absence of either of the aforementioned keys.
tags: ${7:undefined} # not required. Tags to attach to the VPN connection.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
profile: ${9:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

ec2_url: ${10:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

filters: ${11:undefined} # not required. An alternative to using vpn_connection_id. If multiple matches are found, vpn_connection_id is required. If one of the following suboptions is a list of items to filter by, only one item needs to match to find the VPN that correlates. e.g. if the filter 'cidr' is ['194.168.2.0/24', '192.168.2.0/24'] and the VPN route only has the destination cidr block of '192.168.2.0/24' it will be found with this filter (assuming there are not multiple VPNs that are matched). Another example, if the filter 'vpn' is equal to ['vpn-ccf7e7ad', 'vpn-cb0ae2a2'] and one of of the VPNs has the state deleted (exists but is unmodifiable) and the other exists and is not deleted, it will be found via this filter. See examples.
vpn_gateway_id: ${12:undefined} # not required. The ID of the virtual private gateway.
aws_access_key: ${13:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
routes: ${14:undefined} # not required. Routes to add to the connection.
security_token: ${15:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${16|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The desired state of the VPN connection.
static_only: ${17:false} # not required. Indicates whether the VPN connection uses static routes only. Static routes must be used for devices that don't support BGP.
purge_tags: ${18:false} # not required. Whether or not to delete VPN connections tags that are associated with the connection but not specified in the task.
purge_routes: ${19:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to delete VPN connections routes that are not specified in the task.

ec2_win_password.description: gets the default administrator password for ec2 windows instances
body: ec2_win_password:
key_file: ${1:undefined} # required. Path to the file containing the key pair used on the instance.
instance_id: ${2:undefined} # required. The instance id to get the password data from.
validate_certs: ${3:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
wait: ${6|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether or not to wait for the password to be available before returning.
aws_access_key: ${7:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
wait_timeout: ${9:120} # not required. Number of seconds to wait before giving up.

ec2_url: ${10:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
security_token: ${11:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

key_passphrase: ${12:null} # not required. The passphrase for the instance key pair. The key must use DES or 3DES encryption for this module to decrypt it. You can use openssl to convert your password protected keys if they do not use DES or 3DES. ex) C(openssl rsa -in current_key -out new_key -des3).
ecs_attribute:
cluster: ${1:undefined} # required. The short name or full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the cluster that contains the resource to apply attributes.
attributes: ${2:undefined} # required. List of attributes.
ec2_instance_id: ${3:undefined} # required. EC2 instance ID of ECS cluster container instance.
validate_certs: ${4:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: ${6:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
profile: ${8:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
security_token: ${9:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The desired state of the attributes.

region: ${11:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
ecs_cluster:
state: ${1|present,absent,has_instances|} # required. choices: present;absent;has_instances. The desired state of the cluster
name: ${2:undefined} # required. The cluster name
validate_certs: ${3:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

region: ${4:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
repeat: ${5:undefined} # not required. The number of times to wait for the cluster to have an instance

ec2_url: ${6:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
profile: ${7:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
delay: ${8:undefined} # not required. Number of seconds to wait
aws_access_key: ${9:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
aws_secret_key: ${10:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${11:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
ecs_ecr:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. the name of the repository
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
delete_policy: ${5:false} # not required. if yes, remove the policy from the repository

ec2_url: ${6:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
registry_id: ${7:undefined} # not required. AWS account id associated with the registry.,If not specified, the default registry is assumed.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
force_set_policy: ${9:false} # not required. if no, prevents setting a policy that would prevent you from setting another policy in the future.
aws_access_key: ${10:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${11:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${12|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. create or destroy the repository
policy: ${13:undefined} # not required. JSON or dict that represents the new policy

ecs_service.description: create, terminate, start or stop a service in ecs
body: ecs_service:
state: ${1|present,absent,deleting|} # required. choices: present;absent;deleting. The desired state of the service
name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the service
cluster: ${3:undefined} # not required. The name of the cluster in which the service exists
validate_certs: ${4:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
client_token: ${6:undefined} # not required. Unique, case-sensitive identifier you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. Up to 32 ASCII characters are allowed.
delay: ${7:10} # not required. The time to wait before checking that the service is available
deployment_configuration: ${8:undefined} # not required. Optional parameters that control the deployment_configuration; format is '{"maximum_percent":<integer>, "minimum_healthy_percent":<integer>}

role: ${9:undefined} # not required. The name or full Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that allows your Amazon ECS container agent to make calls to your load balancer on your behalf. This parameter is only required if you are using a load balancer with your service.

ec2_url: ${10:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
placement_strategy: ${11:undefined} # not required. The placement strategy objects to use for tasks in your service. You can specify a maximum of 5 strategy rules per service

region: ${12:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
load_balancers: ${13:undefined} # not required. The list of ELBs defined for this service
repeat: ${14:10} # not required. The number of times to check that the service is available
task_definition: ${15:undefined} # not required. The task definition the service will run. This parameter is required when state=present
aws_access_key: ${16:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
placement_constraints: ${17:undefined} # not required. The placement constraints for the tasks in the service
security_token: ${18:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
desired_count: ${19:undefined} # not required. The count of how many instances of the service. This parameter is required when state=present
profile: ${20:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

ecs_service_facts.description: list or describe services in ecs
body: ecs_service_facts:
details: ${1|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Set this to true if you want detailed information about the services.
cluster: ${2:default} # not required. The cluster ARNS in which to list the services.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${4:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
validate_certs: ${6:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
security_token: ${7:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
aws_access_key: ${8:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

region: ${9:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
service: ${10:undefined} # not required. The service to get details for (required if details is true)

ecs_task.description: run, start or stop a task in ecs
body: ecs_task:
operation: ${1|run,start,stop|} # required. choices: run;start;stop. Which task operation to execute
cluster: ${2:undefined} # not required. The name of the cluster to run the task on
started_by: ${3:undefined} # not required. A value showing who or what started the task (for informational purposes)
count: ${4:undefined} # not required. How many new instances to start
task: ${5:undefined} # not required. The task to stop
profile: ${6:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
validate_certs: ${7:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

ec2_url: ${8:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: ${9:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
container_instances: ${10:undefined} # not required. The list of container instances on which to deploy the task
aws_secret_key: ${11:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
task_definition: ${12:undefined} # not required. The task definition to start or run
aws_access_key: ${13:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${14:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
overrides: ${15:undefined} # not required. A dictionary of values to pass to the new instances

ecs_taskdefinition.description: register a task definition in ecs
body: ecs_taskdefinition:
state: ${1|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. State whether the task definition should exist or be deleted
family: ${2:undefined} # not required. A Name that would be given to the task definition
validate_certs: ${3:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
