address: ${4:undefined} # not required. IPv4 or named IP address. Must be of the same scope (regional, global). Reserved addresses can (and probably should) be used for global forwarding rules. You may reserve IPs from the console or via the gce_eip module.
protocol: ${5:undefined} # not required. For global forwarding rules, TCP, UDP, ESP, AH, SCTP or ICMP. Default is TCP.
port_range: ${6:undefined} # not required. For global forwarding rules, must be set to 80 or 8080 for TargetHttpProxy, and 443 for TargetHttpsProxy or TargetSslProxy.
region: ${7:undefined} # not required. The region for this forwarding rule. Currently, only 'global' is supported.

gcp_healthcheck.description: Create, Update or Destroy a Healthcheck.
body: gcp_healthcheck:
state: ${1|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. State of the Healthcheck.
healthcheck_name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the Healthcheck.
healthcheck_type: ${3|HTTP,HTTPS|} # required. choices: HTTP;HTTPS. Type of Healthcheck.
host_header: ${4:} # required. The value of the host header in the health check request. If left empty, the public IP on behalf of which this health check is performed will be used.

service_account_permissions: ${5|bigquery,cloud-platform,compute-ro,compute-rw,useraccounts-ro,useraccounts-rw,datastore,logging-write,monitoring,sql-admin,storage-full,storage-ro,storage-rw,taskqueue,userinfo-email|} # not required. choices: bigquery;cloud-platform;compute-ro;compute-rw;useraccounts-ro;useraccounts-rw;datastore;logging-write;monitoring;sql-admin;storage-full;storage-ro;storage-rw;taskqueue;userinfo-email. service account permissions (see U(https://cloud.google.com/sdk/gcloud/reference/compute/instances/create), --scopes section for detailed information)
unhealthy_threshold: ${6:2} # not required. A so-far healthy instance will be marked unhealthy after this many consecutive failures.
project_id: ${7:null} # not required. Your GCP project ID
port: ${8:undefined} # not required. The TCP port number for the health check request. The default value is 443 for HTTPS and 80 for HTTP.
service_account_email: ${9:null} # not required. service account email
healthy_threshold: ${10:2} # not required. A so-far unhealthy instance will be marked healthy after this many consecutive successes.
request_path: ${11:/} # not required. The request path of the HTTPS health check request.
timeout: ${12:5} # not required. How long (in seconds) to wait for a response before claiming failure. It is invalid for timeout to have a greater value than check_interval.
check_interval: ${13:5} # not required. How often (in seconds) to send a health check.
credentials_file: ${14:null} # not required. Path to the JSON file associated with the service account email

gcp_target_proxy.description: Create, Update or Destroy a Target_Proxy.
body: gcp_target_proxy:
target_proxy_type: ${1:undefined} # required. Type of Target_Proxy. HTTP, HTTPS or SSL. Only HTTP is currently supported.
target_proxy_name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the Target_Proxy.
url_map_name: ${3:undefined} # not required. Name of the Url Map.  Required if type is HTTP or HTTPS proxy.

gcp_url_map.description: Create, Update or Destory a Url_Map.
body: gcp_url_map:
default_service: ${1:undefined} # required. Default Backend Service if no host rules match.
url_map_name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the Url_Map.

path_matchers: ${3:undefined} # not required. The list of named PathMatchers to use against the URL. Contains path_rules, which is a list of paths and an associated service. A default_service can also be specified for each path_matcher.,The 'name' parameter to which this path_matcher is referred by the host_rule.,The 'default_service' parameter is the name of the BackendService resource. This will be used if none of the path_rules defined by this path_matcher is matched by the URL's path portion.,The 'path_rules' parameter is a list of dictionaries containing a list of paths and a service to direct traffic to. Each path item must start with / and the only place a * is allowed is at the end following a /. The string fed to the path matcher does not include any text after the first ? or

host_rules: ${4:undefined} # not required. The list of HostRules to use against the URL. Contains a list of hosts and an associated path_matcher.,The 'hosts' parameter is a list of host patterns to match. They must be valid hostnames, except * will match any string of ([a-z0-9-.]*). In that case, * must be the first character and must be followed in the pattern by either - or ..,The 'path_matcher' parameter is name of the PathMatcher to use to match the path portion of the URL if the hostRule matches the URL's host portion.

gcpubsub.description: Create and Delete Topics/Subscriptions, Publish and pull messages on PubSub
body: gcpubsub:
topic: ${1:undefined} # required. GCP pubsub topic name.,Only the name, not the full path, is required.
ack_deadline: ${2:undefined} # not required. Subfield of subscription. Not required. Default deadline for subscriptions to ACK the message before it is resent. See examples.

push_endpoint: ${3:undefined} # not required. Subfield of subscription.  Not required.  If specified, message will be sent to an endpoint. See U(https://cloud.google.com/pubsub/docs/advanced#push_endpoints) for more information.
publish: ${4:undefined} # not required. List of dictionaries describing messages and attributes to be published.  Dictionary is in message(str):attributes(dict) format. Only message is required.

subscription: ${5:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing a subscripton name associated with a topic (required), along with optional ack_deadline, push_endpoint and pull. For pulling from a subscription, message_ack (bool), max_messages (int) and return_immediate are available as subfields. See subfields name, push_endpoint and ack_deadline for more information.

pull: ${6:undefined} # not required. Subfield of subscription. Not required. If specified, messages will be retrieved from topic via the provided subscription name. max_messages (int; default None; max number of messages to pull), message_ack (bool; default False; acknowledge the message) and return_immediately (bool; default True, don't wait for messages to appear). If the messages are acknowledged, changed is set to True, otherwise, changed is False.

state: ${7|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. State of the topic or queue.,Applies to the most granular resource.,If subscription isspecified we remove it.,If only topic is specified, that is what is removed.,NOTE - A topic can be removed without first removing the subscription.
name: ${8:undefined} # not required. Subfield of subscription. Required if subscription is specified. See examples.

gcpubsub_facts.description: List Topics/Subscriptions and Messages from Google PubSub.
body: gcpubsub_facts:
view: ${1:undefined} # required. Choices are 'topics' or 'subscriptions'
topic: ${2:undefined} # not required. GCP pubsub topic name.  Only the name, not the full path, is required.
state: ${3:undefined} # not required. list is the only valid option.

gcspanner.description: Create and Delete Instances/Databases on Spanner
body: gcspanner:
configuration: ${1:undefined} # required. Configuration the instance should use.,Examples are us-central1, asia-east1 and europe-west1.
instance_id: ${2:undefined} # required. GCP spanner instance name.
database_name: ${3:undefined} # not required. Name of database contained on the instance.
force_instance_delete: ${4:no} # not required. To delete an instance, this argument must exist and be true (along with state being equal to absent).

state: ${5|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. State of the instance or database. Applies to the most granular resource.,If a C(database_name) is specified we remove it.,If only C(instance_id) is specified, that is what is removed.
instance_display_name: ${6:undefined} # not required. Name of Instance to display.,If not specified, instance_id will be used instead.
node_count: ${7:1} # not required. Number of nodes in the instance.
gem:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the gem to be managed.
env_shebang: ${2:no} # not required. Rewrite the shebang line on installed scripts to use /usr/bin/env.
executable: ${3:undefined} # not required. Override the path to the gem executable
gem_source: ${4:undefined} # not required. The path to a local gem used as installation source.
include_doc: ${5:no} # not required. Install with or without docs.
build_flags: ${6:undefined} # not required. Allow adding build flags for gem compilation
user_install: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Install gem in user's local gems cache or for all users
version: ${8:undefined} # not required. Version of the gem to be installed/removed.
pre_release: ${9:no} # not required. Allow installation of pre-release versions of the gem.
repository: ${10:undefined} # not required. The repository from which the gem will be installed
state: ${11|present,absent,latest|} # not required. choices: present;absent;latest. The desired state of the gem. C(latest) ensures that the latest version is installed.
include_dependencies: ${12|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether to include dependencies or not.

get_url.description: Downloads files from HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP to node
body: get_url:

dest: ${1:undefined} # required. Absolute path of where to download the file to.,If C(dest) is a directory, either the server provided filename or, if none provided, the base name of the URL on the remote server will be used. If a directory, C(force) has no effect.,If C(dest) is a directory, the file will always be downloaded (regardless of the C(force) option), but replaced only if the contents changed..
url: ${2:undefined} # required. HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP URL in the form (http|https|ftp)://[user[:pass]]@host.domain[:port]/path
url_password: ${3:undefined} # not required. The password for use in HTTP basic authentication.,If the C(url_username) parameter is not specified, the C(url_password) parameter will not be used.
validate_certs: ${4:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
selevel: ${5:s0} # not required. Level part of the SELinux file context. This is the MLS/MCS attribute, sometimes known as the C(range). C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

sha256sum: ${6:} # not required. If a SHA-256 checksum is passed to this parameter, the digest of the destination file will be calculated after it is downloaded to ensure its integrity and verify that the transfer completed successfully. This option is deprecated. Use C(checksum) instead.

force_basic_auth: ${7:no} # not required. httplib2, the library used by the uri module only sends authentication information when a webservice responds to an initial request with a 401 status. Since some basic auth services do not properly send a 401, logins will fail. This option forces the sending of the Basic authentication header upon initial request.
backup: ${8:no} # not required. Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.
url_username: ${9:undefined} # not required. The username for use in HTTP basic authentication.,This parameter can be used without C(url_password) for sites that allow empty passwords.

client_key: ${10:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for SSL client authentication. If C(client_cert) contains both the certificate and key, this option is not required.

client_cert: ${11:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted certificate chain file to be used for SSL client authentication. This file can also include the key as well, and if the key is included, C(client_key) is not required.
owner: ${12:null} # not required. Name of the user that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).

checksum: ${13:} # not required. If a checksum is passed to this parameter, the digest of the destination file will be calculated after it is downloaded to ensure its integrity and verify that the transfer completed successfully. Format: <algorithm>:<checksum>, e.g. checksum="sha256:D98291AC[...]B6DC7B97",If you worry about portability, only the sha1 algorithm is available on all platforms and python versions.,The third party hashlib library can be installed for access to additional algorithms.,Additionally, if a checksum is passed to this parameter, and the file exist under the C(dest) location, the I(destination_checksum) would be calculated, and if checksum equals I(destination_checksum), the file download would be skipped (unless C(force) is true).

tmp_dest: ${14:undefined} # not required. Absolute path of where temporary file is downloaded to.,When run on Ansible 2.5 or greater, path defaults to ansible's remote_tmp setting,When run on Ansible prior to 2.5, it defaults to C(TMPDIR), C(TEMP) or C(TMP) env variables or a platform specific value.,U(https://docs.python.org/2/library/tempfile.html#tempfile.tempdir)
use_proxy: ${15:yes} # not required. if C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
group: ${16:null} # not required. Name of the group that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).

force: ${17:no} # not required. If C(yes) and C(dest) is not a directory, will download the file every time and replace the file if the contents change. If C(no), the file will only be downloaded if the destination does not exist. Generally should be C(yes) only for small local files.,Prior to 0.6, this module behaved as if C(yes) was the default.
serole: ${18:null} # not required. Role part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
setype: ${19:null} # not required. Type part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

mode: ${20:null} # not required. Mode the file or directory should be. For those used to I(/usr/bin/chmod) remember that modes are actually octal numbers (like C(0644) or C(01777)). Leaving off the leading zero will likely have unexpected results. As of version 1.8, the mode may be specified as a symbolic mode (for example, C(u+rwx) or C(u=rw,g=r,o=r)).
others: ${21:undefined} # not required. all arguments accepted by the M(file) module also work here

attributes: ${22:None} # not required. Attributes the file or directory should have. To get supported flags look at the man page for I(chattr) on the target system. This string should contain the attributes in the same order as the one displayed by I(lsattr).
seuser: ${23:null} # not required. User part of SELinux file context. Will default to system policy, if applicable. If set to C(_default), it will use the C(user) portion of the policy if available.

unsafe_writes: ${24:false} # not required. Normally this module uses atomic operations to prevent data corruption or inconsistent reads from the target files, sometimes systems are configured or just broken in ways that prevent this. One example are docker mounted files, they cannot be updated atomically and can only be done in an unsafe manner.,This boolean option allows ansible to fall back to unsafe methods of updating files for those cases in which you do not have any other choice. Be aware that this is subject to race conditions and can lead to data corruption.
headers: ${25:undefined} # not required. Add custom HTTP headers to a request in the format "key:value,key:value".
timeout: ${26:10} # not required. Timeout in seconds for URL request.

getent.description: A wrapper to the unix getent utility
body: getent:
database: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of a getent database supported by the target system (passwd, group, hosts, etc).
split: ${2:undefined} # not required. Character used to split the database values into lists/arrays such as ':' or '	', otherwise  it will try to pick one depending on the database.
key: ${3:} # not required. Key from which to return values from the specified database, otherwise the full contents are returned.
fail_key: ${4:yes} # not required. If a supplied key is missing this will make the task fail if C(yes).

git.description: Deploy software (or files) from git checkouts
body: git:
repo: ${1:undefined} # required. git, SSH, or HTTP(S) protocol address of the git repository.
dest: ${2:undefined} # required. The path of where the repository should be checked out. This parameter is required, unless C(clone) is set to C(no).
accept_hostkey: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. if C(yes), ensure that "-o StrictHostKeyChecking=no" is present as an ssh options.
key_file: ${4:None} # not required. Specify an optional private key file to use for the checkout.

version: ${5:HEAD} # not required. What version of the repository to check out.  This can be the the literal string C(HEAD), a branch name, a tag name. It can also be a I(SHA-1) hash, in which case C(refspec) needs to be specified if the given revision is not already available.

depth: ${6:null} # not required. Create a shallow clone with a history truncated to the specified number or revisions. The minimum possible value is C(1), otherwise ignored. Needs I(git>=1.9.1) to work correctly.
clone: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), do not clone the repository if it does not exist locally
bare: ${8|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. if C(yes), repository will be created as a bare repo, otherwise it will be a standard repo with a workspace.
umask: ${9:null} # not required. The umask to set before doing any checkouts, or any other repository maintenance.
recursive: ${10|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. if C(no), repository will be cloned without the --recursive option, skipping sub-modules.

verify_commit: ${11|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. if C(yes), when cloning or checking out a C(version) verify the signature of a GPG signed commit. This requires C(git) version>=2.1.0 to be installed. The commit MUST be signed and the public key MUST be present in the GPG keyring.
executable: ${12:null} # not required. Path to git executable to use. If not supplied, the normal mechanism for resolving binary paths will be used.

force: ${13|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(yes), any modified files in the working repository will be discarded.  Prior to 0.7, this was always 'yes' and could not be disabled.  Prior to 1.9, the default was `yes`

archive: ${14:undefined} # not required. Specify archive file path with extension. If specified, creates an archive file of the specified format containing the tree structure for the source tree. Allowed archive formats ["zip", "tar.gz", "tar", "tgz"]
remote: ${15:origin} # not required. Name of the remote.

update: ${16|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), do not retrieve new revisions from the origin repository,Operations like archive will work on the existing (old) repository and might not respond to changes to the options version or remote.

refspec: ${17:null} # not required. Add an additional refspec to be fetched. If version is set to a I(SHA-1) not reachable from any branch or tag, this option may be necessary to specify the ref containing the I(SHA-1). Uses the same syntax as the 'git fetch' command. An example value could be "refs/meta/config".

track_submodules: ${18|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. if C(yes), submodules will track the latest commit on their master branch (or other branch specified in .gitmodules).  If C(no), submodules will be kept at the revision specified by the main project. This is equivalent to specifying the --remote flag to git submodule update.

ssh_opts: ${19:None} # not required. Creates a wrapper script and exports the path as GIT_SSH which git then automatically uses to override ssh arguments. An example value could be "-o StrictHostKeyChecking=no"
reference: ${20:null} # not required. Reference repository (see "git clone --reference ...")
git_config:
value: ${1:null} # not required. When specifying the name of a single setting, supply a value to set that setting to the given value.

scope: ${2|local,global,system|} # not required. choices: local;global;system. Specify which scope to read/set values from. This is required when setting config values. If this is set to local, you must also specify the repo parameter. It defaults to system only when not using I(list_all)=yes.
repo: ${3:null} # not required. Path to a git repository for reading and writing values from a specific repo.
list_all: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. List all settings (optionally limited to a given I(scope))
name: ${5:null} # not required. The name of the setting. If no value is supplied, the value will be read from the config if it has been set.

github_deploy_key.description: Manages deploy keys for GitHub repositories.
body: github_deploy_key:
key: ${1:null} # required. The SSH public key to add to the repository as a deploy key.
owner: ${2:null} # required. The name of the individual account or organization that owns the GitHub repository.
repo: ${3:null} # required. The name of the GitHub repository.
name: ${4:null} # required. The name for the deploy key.
force: ${5:false} # not required. If C(true), forcefully adds the deploy key by deleting any existing deploy key with the same public key or title.
password: ${6:null} # not required. The password to authenticate with. A personal access token can be used here in place of a password.
read_only: ${7:true} # not required. If C(true), the deploy key will only be able to read repository contents. Otherwise, the deploy key will be able to read and write.
token: ${8:null} # not required. The OAuth2 token or personal access token to authenticate with. Mutually exclusive with I(password).
otp: ${9:null} # not required. The 6 digit One Time Password for 2-Factor Authentication. Required together with I(username) and I(password).
state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The state of the deploy key.
username: ${11:null} # not required. The username to authenticate with.
github_hooks:
user: ${1:undefined} # required. Github username.

repo: ${2:undefined} # required. This is the API url for the repository you want to manage hooks for. It should be in the form of: https://api.github.com/repos/user:/repo:. Note this is different than the normal repo url.
action: ${3|create,cleanall,list,clean504|} # required. choices: create;cleanall;list;clean504. This tells the githooks module what you want it to do.
oauthkey: ${4:undefined} # required. The oauth key provided by GitHub. It can be found/generated on GitHub under "Edit Your Profile" >> "Developer settings" >> "Personal Access Tokens"
content_type: ${5|json,form|} # not required. choices: json;form. Content type to use for requests made to the webhook

validate_certs: ${6|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates for the target repo will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
hookurl: ${7:undefined} # not required. When creating a new hook, this is the url that you want GitHub to post to. It is only required when creating a new hook.
github_issue:
organization: ${1:none} # required. Name of the GitHub organization in which the repository is hosted.
repo: ${2:none} # required. Name of repository from which issue needs to be retrieved.
issue: ${3:none} # required. Issue number for which information is required.
action: ${4|get_status|} # not required. choices: get_status. Get various details about issue depending upon action specified.
github_key:
token: ${1:undefined} # required. GitHub Access Token with permission to list and create public keys.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. SSH key name
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether to remove a key, ensure that it exists, or update its value.

force: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. The default is C(yes), which will replace the existing remote key if it's different than C(pubkey). If C(no), the key will only be set if no key with the given C(name) exists.
pubkey: ${5:none} # not required. SSH public key value. Required when C(state=present).
github_release:
action: ${1|latest_release,create_release|} # required. choices: latest_release;create_release. Action to perform
user: ${2:null} # required. The GitHub account that owns the repository
repo: ${3:null} # required. Repository name
password: ${4:null} # not required. The GitHub account password for the user
prerelease: ${5|True,False|} # not required. choices: True;False. Sets if the release is a prerelease or not. (boolean)
token: ${6:null} # not required. GitHub Personal Access Token for authenticating
target: ${7:undefined} # not required. Target of release when creating a release
body: ${8:undefined} # not required. Description of the release when creating a release
draft: ${9|True,False|} # not required. choices: True;False. Sets if the release is a draft or not. (boolean)
name: ${10:undefined} # not required. Name of release when creating a release
tag: ${11:undefined} # not required. Tag name when creating a release. Required when using action is set to C(create_release).
gitlab_group:
server_url: ${1:undefined} # required. Url of Gitlab server, with protocol (http or https).
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the group you want to create.
validate_certs: ${3:true} # not required. When using https if SSL certificate needs to be verified.
login_password: ${4:null} # not required. Gitlab password for login_user
login_token: ${5:null} # not required. Gitlab token for logging in.
path: ${6:null} # not required. The path of the group you want to create, this will be server_url/group_path,If not supplied, the group_name will be used.
login_user: ${7:null} # not required. Gitlab user name.
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. create or delete group.,Possible values are present and absent.
gitlab_project:
server_url: ${1:undefined} # required. Url of Gitlab server, with protocol (http or https).
name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the project
validate_certs: ${3:true} # not required. When using https if SSL certificate needs to be verified.

visibility_level: ${4:0} # not required. Private. visibility_level is 0. Project access must be granted explicitly for each user.,Internal. visibility_level is 10. The project can be cloned by any logged in user.,Public. visibility_level is 20. The project can be cloned without any authentication.,Possible values are 0, 10 and 20.
login_token: ${5:null} # not required. Gitlab token for logging in.
merge_requests_enabled: ${6:true} # not required. If merge requests can be made or not.,Possible values are true and false.
path: ${7:null} # not required. The path of the project you want to create, this will be server_url/<group>/path,If not supplied, name will be used.
login_user: ${8:null} # not required. Gitlab user name.

group: ${9:null} # not required. The name of the group of which this projects belongs to.,When not provided, project will belong to user which is configured in 'login_user' or 'login_token',When provided with username, project will be created for this user. 'login_user' or 'login_token' needs admin rights.
import_url: ${10:false} # not required. Git repository which will be imported into gitlab.,Gitlab server needs read access to this git repository.
description: ${11:null} # not required. An description for the project.
snippets_enabled: ${12:true} # not required. If creating snippets should be available or not.,Possible values are true and false.
issues_enabled: ${13:true} # not required. Whether you want to create issues or not.,Possible values are true and false.
public: ${14:false} # not required. If the project is public available or not.,Setting this to true is same as setting visibility_level to 20.,Possible values are true and false.
login_password: ${15:null} # not required. Gitlab password for login_user
state: ${16|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. create or delete project.,Possible values are present and absent.
wiki_enabled: ${17:true} # not required. If an wiki for this project should be available or not.,Possible values are true and false.
gitlab_user:
server_url: ${1:undefined} # required. Url of Gitlab server, with protocol (http or https).
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the user.,GitLab server enforces minimum password length to 8, set this value with 8 or more characters.
email: ${3:undefined} # required. The email that belongs to the user.
name: ${4:undefined} # required. Name of the user you want to create
username: ${5:undefined} # required. The username of the user.
validate_certs: ${6:true} # not required. When using https if SSL certificate needs to be verified.
login_password: ${7:null} # not required. Gitlab password for login_user
login_token: ${8:null} # not required. Gitlab token for logging in.
confirm: ${9:true} # not required. Require confirmation.
sshkey_file: ${10:null} # not required. The ssh key itself.
access_level: ${11:null} # not required. The access level to the group. One of the following can be used.,guest,reporter,developer,master,owner
login_user: ${12:null} # not required. Gitlab user name.
state: ${13|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. create or delete group.,Possible values are present and absent.
sshkey_name: ${14:null} # not required. The name of the sshkey
group: ${15:null} # not required. Add user as an member to this group.
gluster_volume:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The volume name.
state: ${2|absent,present,started,stopped|} # required. choices: absent;present;started;stopped. Use present/absent ensure if a volume exists or not. Use started/stopped to control its availability.
cluster: ${3:undefined} # not required. List of hosts to use for probing and brick setup.
arbiters: ${4:undefined} # not required. Arbiter count for volume.
disperses: ${5:undefined} # not required. Disperse count for volume.
options: ${6:undefined} # not required. A dictionary/hash with options/settings for the volume.
quota: ${7:undefined} # not required. Quota value for limit-usage (be sure to use 10.0MB instead of 10MB, see quota list).
transport: ${8|rdma,tcp,tcp,rdma|} # not required. choices: rdma;tcp;tcp;rdma. Transport type for volume.
rebalance: ${9:no} # not required. Controls whether the cluster is rebalanced after changes.
force: ${10:undefined} # not required. If brick is being created in the root partition, module will fail. Set force to true to override this behaviour.
host: ${11:undefined} # not required. Override local hostname (for peer probing purposes).
start_on_create: ${12:yes} # not required. Controls whether the volume is started after creation or not.
replicas: ${13:undefined} # not required. Replica count for volume.
stripes: ${14:undefined} # not required. Stripe count for volume.
bricks: ${15:undefined} # not required. Brick paths on servers. Multiple brick paths can be separated by commas.
redundancies: ${16:undefined} # not required. Redundancy count for volume.
directory: ${17:undefined} # not required. Directory for limit-usage.
grafana_dashboard:
grafana_url: ${1:undefined} # required. Grafana url
state: ${2|present,absent,export|} # required. choices: present;absent;export. State of the dashboard.
validate_certs: ${3:true} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used,on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
grafana_user: ${4:admin} # not required. Grafana API user

slug: ${5:undefined} # not required. slug of the dashboard. It's the friendly url name of the dashboard.,When state is present, this parameter can override the slug in the meta section of the json file.,If you want to import a json dashboard exported directly from the interface (not from the api),,you have to specify the slug parameter because there is no meta section in the exported json.
grafana_password: ${6:admin} # not required. Grafana API password
grafana_api_key: ${7:undefined} # not required. Grafana API key,If set, I(grafana_user) and I(grafana_password) will be ignored
message: ${8:undefined} # not required. Set a commit message for the version history.,Only used when state is present
overwrite: ${9:false} # not required. override existing dashboard when state is present.
path: ${10:undefined} # not required. path to the json file containing the grafana dashboard to import or export.

org_id: ${11:1} # not required. Grafana Organisation ID where the dashboard will be imported / exported,Not used when I(grafana_api_key) is set, because the grafana_api_key only belong to one organisation.
grafana_datasource:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the datasource
ds_type: ${2|graphite,prometheus,elasticsearch,influxdb,opentsdb,mysql,postgres|} # required. choices: graphite;prometheus;elasticsearch;influxdb;opentsdb;mysql;postgres. Type of the datasource
grafana_url: ${3:undefined} # required. Grafana url
url: ${4:undefined} # required. Url of the datasource
tsdb_resolution: ${5|second,millisecond|} # not required. choices: second;millisecond. opentsdb time resolution
validate_certs: ${6:true} # not required. Validate or not grafana certificate
basic_auth_password: ${7:undefined} # not required. Datasource basic auth password, when basic auth is true

es_version: ${8|2,5,56|} # not required. choices: 2;5;56. Elasticsearch version (for ds_type = elasticsearch only),Version 56 is for elasticsearch 5.6+ where tou can specify the max_concurrent_shard_requests option.
grafana_api_key: ${9:undefined} # not required. Grafana API key,If set, grafana_user and grafana_password will be ignored
basic_auth_user: ${10:undefined} # not required. Datasource basic auth user.,Setting this option with basic_auth_password will enable basic auth.
max_concurrent_shard_requests: ${11:256} # not required. Starting with elasticsearch 5.6, you can specify the max concurrent shard per requests.
tsdb_version: ${12|1,2,3|} # not required. choices: 1;2;3. opentsdb version (1 for <= 2.1, 2 for ==2.2, 3 for ==2.3)
tls_client_key: ${13:undefined} # not required. client tls private key,befins with ----- BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY -----
is_default: ${14:false} # not required. Make this datasource the default one
tls_client_cert: ${15:undefined} # not required. client tls certificate.,If tls_client_cert and tls_client_key are set, this will enable tls auth.,begins with ----- BEGIN CERTIFICATE -----
with_credentials: ${16:false} # not required. Whether credentials such as cookies or auth headers should be sent with cross-site requests.
access: ${17|proxy,direct|} # not required. choices: proxy;direct. Access mode for this datasource
state: ${18|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Status of the datasource
tls_ca_cert: ${19:undefined} # not required. tls ca certificate for self signed certificates.,only used when tls_client_cert and tls_client_key are set
password: ${20:undefined} # not required. Datasource password
interval: ${21|,Hourly,Daily,Weekly,Monthly,Yearly|} # not required. choices: ;Hourly;Daily;Weekly;Monthly;Yearly. for elasticsearch ds_type, this is the index pattern used.
grafana_password: ${22:admin} # not required. Grafana API password
sslmode: ${23|disable,require,verify-ca,verify-full|} # not required. choices: disable;require;verify-ca;verify-full. SSL mode for postgres datasoure type.
user: ${24:undefined} # not required. Datasource login user for influxdb datasources
org_id: ${25:1} # not required. Grafana Organisation ID in which the datasource should be created,Not used when grafana_api_key is set, because the grafana_api_key only belong to one organisation.
database: ${26:undefined} # not required. Name of the database for the datasource.,This options is required when the ds_type is influxdb, elasticsearch (index name), mysql or postgres
grafana_user: ${27:admin} # not required. Grafana API user
time_field: ${28:timestamp} # not required. Name of the time field in elasticsearch ds,For example C(@timestamp)
time_interval: ${29:undefined} # not required. Minimum group by interval for influxdb or elasticsearch datasources,for example '>10s'
grafana_plugin:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the plugin.
version: ${2:undefined} # not required. Version of the plugin to install.,Default to latest
grafana_plugin_url: ${3:undefined} # not required. Custom Grafana plugin URL,Require grafana 4.6.x or later
grafana_plugins_dir: ${4:undefined} # not required. Directory where Grafana plugin will be installed.
state: ${5|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Status of the Grafana plugin.,If latest is set, the version parameter will be ignored.
grafana_repo: ${6:undefined} # not required. Grafana repository. If not set, gafana-cli will use the default value C(https://grafana.net/api/plugins).
group:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the group to manage.
state: ${2|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Whether the group should be present or not on the remote host.
gid: ${3:undefined} # not required. Optional I(GID) to set for the group.
system: ${4:no} # not required. If I(yes), indicates that the group created is a system group.

group_by.description: Create Ansible groups based on facts
body: group_by:
key: ${1:undefined} # required. The variables whose values will be used as groups
parents: ${2:all} # not required. The list of the parent groups

grove.description: Sends a notification to a grove.io channel
body: grove:
channel_token: ${1:undefined} # required. Token of the channel to post to.
message: ${2:undefined} # required. Message content
validate_certs: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
icon_url: ${4:undefined} # not required. Icon for the service
url: ${5:undefined} # not required. Service URL for the web client
service: ${6:ansible} # not required. Name of the service (displayed as the "user" in the message)
gunicorn:
app: ${1:undefined} # required. The app module. A name refers to a WSGI callable that should be found in the specified module.
chdir: ${2:undefined} # not required. Chdir to specified directory before apps loading.
user: ${3:undefined} # not required. Switch worker processes to run as this user.

worker: ${4|sync,eventlet,gevent,tornado ,gthread,gaiohttp|} # not required. choices: sync;eventlet;gevent;tornado ;gthread;gaiohttp. The type of workers to use. The default class (sync) should handle most "normal" types of workloads.
pid: ${5:undefined} # not required. A filename to use for the PID file. If not set and not found on the configuration file a tmp pid file will be created to check a successful run of gunicorn.
venv: ${6:undefined} # not required. Path to the virtualenv directory.
config: ${7:undefined} # not required. Path to the gunicorn configuration file.
hall:
msg: ${1:undefined} # required. The message you wish to deliver as a notification
room_token: ${2:undefined} # required. Room token provided to you by setting up the Ansible room integation on U(https://hall.com)
title: ${3:undefined} # required. The title of the message

picture: ${4:undefined} # not required. The full URL to the image you wish to use for the Icon of the message. Defaults to U(http://cdn2.hubspot.net/hub/330046/file-769078210-png/Official_Logos/ansible_logo_black_square_small.png?t=1421076128627)

haproxy.description: Enable, disable, and set weights for HAProxy backend servers using socket commands.
body: haproxy:

state: ${1|enabled,disabled,drain|} # required. choices: enabled;disabled;drain. Desired state of the provided backend host.,Note that C(drain) state was added in version 2.4. It is supported only by HAProxy version 1.5 or later, if used on versions < 1.5, it will be ignored.
host: ${2:null} # required. Name of the backend host to change.
socket: ${3:/var/run/haproxy.sock} # not required. Path to the HAProxy socket file.

shutdown_sessions: ${4:false} # not required. When disabling a server, immediately terminate all the sessions attached to the specified server. This can be used to terminate long-running sessions after a server is put into maintenance mode. Overridden by the drain option.
backend: ${5:auto-detected} # not required. Name of the HAProxy backend pool.
fail_on_not_found: ${6:false} # not required. Fail whenever trying to enable/disable a backend host that does not exist

drain: ${7:false} # not required. Wait until the server has no active connections or until the timeout determined by wait_interval and wait_retries is reached.  Continue only after the status changes to 'MAINT'.  This overrides the shutdown_sessions option.
wait_interval: ${8:5} # not required. Number of seconds to wait between retries.
wait: ${9:false} # not required. Wait until the server reports a status of 'UP' when `state=enabled`, status of 'MAINT' when `state=disabled` or status of 'DRAIN' when `state=drain`
wait_retries: ${10:25} # not required. Number of times to check for status after changing the state.

weight: ${11:null} # not required. The value passed in argument. If the value ends with the `%` sign, then the new weight will be relative to the initially configured weight. Relative weights are only permitted between 0 and 100% and absolute weights are permitted between 0 and 256.

helm.description: Manages Kubernetes packages with the Helm package manager
body: helm:
host: ${1:localhost} # not required. Tiller's server host

chart: ${2:[object Object]} # not required. A map describing the chart to install. For example:
chart:
  name: memcached
  version: 0.4.0
  source:
    type: repo
    location: https://kubernetes-charts.storage.googleapis.com
port: ${3:44134} # not required. Tiller's server port
values: ${4:[object Object]} # not required. A map of value options for the chart.
namespace: ${5:default} # not required. Kubernetes namespace where the chart should be installed
state: ${6|absent,purged,present|} # not required. choices: absent;purged;present. Whether to install C(present), remove C(absent), or purge C(purged) a package.
name: ${7:null} # not required. Release name to manage
disable_hooks: ${8:false} # not required. Whether to disable hooks during the uninstall process
hg:
dest: ${1:undefined} # required. Absolute path of where the repository should be cloned to. This parameter is required, unless clone and update are set to no
repo: ${2:undefined} # required. The repository address.
executable: ${3:undefined} # not required. Path to hg executable to use. If not supplied, the normal mechanism for resolving binary paths will be used.
force: ${4:no} # not required. Discards uncommitted changes. Runs C(hg update -C).  Prior to 1.9, the default was `yes`.
purge: ${5:no} # not required. Deletes untracked files. Runs C(hg purge).
clone: ${6:yes} # not required. If C(no), do not clone the repository if it does not exist locally.
update: ${7:yes} # not required. If C(no), do not retrieve new revisions from the origin repository
revision: ${8:undefined} # not required. Equivalent C(-r) option in hg command which could be the changeset, revision number, branch name or even tag.
hipchat:
room: ${1:undefined} # required. ID or name of the room.
token: ${2:undefined} # required. API token.
msg: ${3:null} # required. The message body.
validate_certs: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
notify: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If true, a notification will be triggered for users in the room.
msg_format: ${6|text,html|} # not required. choices: text;html. Message format.
from: ${7:Ansible} # not required. Name the message will appear to be sent from. Max length is 15 characters - above this it will be truncated.
color: ${8|yellow,red,green,purple,gray,random|} # not required. choices: yellow;red;green;purple;gray;random. Background color for the message.
api: ${9:https://api.hipchat.com/v1} # not required. API url if using a self-hosted hipchat server. For Hipchat API version 2 use the default URI with C(/v2) instead of C(/v1).
homebrew:

path: ${1:/usr/local/bin} # not required. A ':' separated list of paths to search for 'brew' executable. Since a package (I(formula) in homebrew parlance) location is prefixed relative to the actual path of I(brew) command, providing an alternative I(brew) path enables managing different set of packages in an alternative location in the system.
install_options: ${2:null} # not required. options flags to install a package
upgrade_all: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. upgrade all homebrew packages
state: ${4|head,latest,present,absent,linked,unlinked|} # not required. choices: head;latest;present;absent;linked;unlinked. state of the package
update_homebrew: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. update homebrew itself first
name: ${6:None} # not required. list of names of packages to install/remove
homebrew_cask:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. name of cask to install/remove
upgrade_all: ${2:false} # not required. upgrade all casks (mutually exclusive with `upgrade`)
update_homebrew: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. update homebrew itself first. Note that C(brew cask update) is a synonym for C(brew update).
accept_external_apps: ${4:false} # not required. allow external apps
upgrade: ${5:false} # not required. upgrade all casks (mutually exclusive with `upgrade_all`)
path: ${6:/usr/local/bin} # not required. ':' separated list of paths to search for 'brew' executable.
install_options: ${7:null} # not required. options flags to install a package
state: ${8|present,absent,upgraded|} # not required. choices: present;absent;upgraded. state of the cask
homebrew_tap:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The GitHub user/organization repository to tap.

url: ${2:undefined} # not required. The optional git URL of the repository to tap. The URL is not assumed to be on GitHub, and the protocol doesn't have to be HTTP. Any location and protocol that git can handle is fine.,I(name) option may not be a list of multiple taps (but a single tap instead) when this option is provided.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. state of the repository.
honeybadger_deployment:
environment: ${1:undefined} # required. The environment name, typically 'production', 'staging', etc.
token: ${2:undefined} # required. API token.

validate_certs: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates for the target url will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
user: ${4:None} # not required. The username of the person doing the deployment
repo: ${5:None} # not required. URL of the project repository
url: ${6:https://api.honeybadger.io/v1/deploys} # not required. Optional URL to submit the notification to.
revision: ${7:None} # not required. A hash, number, tag, or other identifier showing what revision was deployed
hostname:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the host

hpilo_boot.description: Boot system using specific media through HP iLO interface
body: hpilo_boot:
host: ${1:undefined} # required. The HP iLO hostname/address that is linked to the physical system.

force: ${2|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether to force a reboot (even when the system is already booted).,As a safeguard, without force, hpilo_boot will refuse to reboot a server that is already running.
password: ${3:admin} # not required. The password to authenticate to the HP iLO interface.
ssl_version: ${4|SSLv3,SSLv23,TLSv1,TLSv1_1,TLSv1_2|} # not required. choices: SSLv3;SSLv23;TLSv1;TLSv1_1;TLSv1_2. Change the ssl_version used.

image: ${5:undefined} # not required. The URL of a cdrom, floppy or usb boot media image. protocol://username:password@hostname:port/filename,protocol is either 'http' or 'https',username:password is optional,port is optional
media: ${6|cdrom,floppy,hdd,network,normal,usb|} # not required. choices: cdrom;floppy;hdd;network;normal;usb. The boot media to boot the system from
login: ${7:Administrator} # not required. The login name to authenticate to the HP iLO interface.

state: ${8|boot_always,boot_once,connect,disconnect,no_boot,poweroff|} # not required. choices: boot_always;boot_once;connect;disconnect;no_boot;poweroff. The state of the boot media.,no_boot: Do not boot from the device,boot_once: Boot from the device once and then notthereafter,boot_always: Boot from the device each time the serveris rebooted,connect: Connect the virtual media device and set to boot_always,disconnect: Disconnects the virtual media device and set to no_boot,poweroff: Power off the server

hpilo_facts.description: Gather facts through an HP iLO interface
body: hpilo_facts:
host: ${1:undefined} # required. The HP iLO hostname/address that is linked to the physical system.
ssl_version: ${2|SSLv3,SSLv23,TLSv1,TLSv1_1,TLSv1_2|} # not required. choices: SSLv3;SSLv23;TLSv1;TLSv1_1;TLSv1_2. Change the ssl_version used.
login: ${3:Administrator} # not required. The login name to authenticate to the HP iLO interface.
password: ${4:admin} # not required. The password to authenticate to the HP iLO interface.

hponcfg.description: Configure HP iLO interface using hponcfg
body: hponcfg:
path: ${1:undefined} # required. The XML file as accepted by hponcfg.
executable: ${2:hponcfg} # not required. Path to the hponcfg executable (`hponcfg` which uses $PATH).
verbose: ${3:false} # not required. Run hponcfg in verbose mode (-v).
minfw: ${4:undefined} # not required. The minimum firmware level needed.

htpasswd.description: manage user files for basic authentication
body: htpasswd:
path: ${1:undefined} # required. Path to the file that contains the usernames and passwords
name: ${2:undefined} # required. User name to add or remove
selevel: ${3:s0} # not required. Level part of the SELinux file context. This is the MLS/MCS attribute, sometimes known as the C(range). C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
group: ${4:null} # not required. Name of the group that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).

crypt_scheme: ${5|apr_md5_crypt,des_crypt,ldap_sha1,plaintext|} # not required. choices: apr_md5_crypt;des_crypt;ldap_sha1;plaintext. Encryption scheme to be used.  As well as the four choices listed here, you can also use any other hash supported by passlib, such as md5_crypt and sha256_crypt, which are linux passwd hashes.  If you do so the password file will not be compatible with Apache or Nginx
password: ${6:undefined} # not required. Password associated with user.,Must be specified if user does not exist yet.
serole: ${7:null} # not required. Role part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
owner: ${8:null} # not required. Name of the user that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).
setype: ${9:null} # not required. Type part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

mode: ${10:null} # not required. Mode the file or directory should be. For those used to I(/usr/bin/chmod) remember that modes are actually octal numbers (like C(0644) or C(01777)). Leaving off the leading zero will likely have unexpected results. As of version 1.8, the mode may be specified as a symbolic mode (for example, C(u+rwx) or C(u=rw,g=r,o=r)).

attributes: ${11:None} # not required. Attributes the file or directory should have. To get supported flags look at the man page for I(chattr) on the target system. This string should contain the attributes in the same order as the one displayed by I(lsattr).

create: ${12|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Used with C(state=present). If specified, the file will be created if it does not already exist. If set to "no", will fail if the file does not exist
seuser: ${13:null} # not required. User part of SELinux file context. Will default to system policy, if applicable. If set to C(_default), it will use the C(user) portion of the policy if available.
state: ${14|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the user entry should be present or not

unsafe_writes: ${15:false} # not required. Normally this module uses atomic operations to prevent data corruption or inconsistent reads from the target files, sometimes systems are configured or just broken in ways that prevent this. One example are docker mounted files, they cannot be updated atomically and can only be done in an unsafe manner.,This boolean option allows ansible to fall back to unsafe methods of updating files for those cases in which you do not have any other choice. Be aware that this is subject to race conditions and can lead to data corruption.

iam.description: Manage IAM users, groups, roles and keys
body: iam:
iam_type: ${1|user,group,role|} # required. choices: user;group;role. Type of IAM resource
state: ${2|present,absent,update|} # required. choices: present;absent;update. Whether to create, delete or update the IAM resource. Note, roles cannot be updated.
name: ${3:undefined} # required. Name of IAM resource to create or identify
security_token: ${4:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
validate_certs: ${5:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
key_count: ${6:1} # not required. When access_key_state is create it will ensure this quantity of keys are present. Defaults to 1.
aws_secret_key: ${7:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${8:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
password: ${9:null} # not required. When type is user and state is present, define the users login password. Also works with update. Note that always returns changed.
new_path: ${10:null} # not required. When state is update, will replace the path with new_path on the IAM resource
access_key_ids: ${11:undefined} # not required. A list of the keys that you want impacted by the access_key_state parameter.
trust_policy: ${12:null} # not required. The inline (JSON or YAML) trust policy document that grants an entity permission to assume the role. Mutually exclusive with C(trust_policy_filepath).

region: ${13:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

access_key_state: ${14|create,remove,active,inactive|} # not required. choices: create;remove;active;inactive. When type is user, it creates, removes, deactivates or activates a user's access key(s). Note that actions apply only to keys specified.

ec2_url: ${15:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

path: ${16:/} # not required. When creating or updating, specify the desired path of the resource. If state is present, it will replace the current path to match what is passed in when they do not match.
aws_access_key: ${17:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
new_name: ${18:null} # not required. When state is update, will replace name with new_name on IAM resource
trust_policy_filepath: ${19:null} # not required. The path to the trust policy document that grants an entity permission to assume the role. Mutually exclusive with C(trust_policy).
groups: ${20:null} # not required. A list of groups the user should belong to. When update, will gracefully remove groups not listed.
update_password: ${21|always,on_create|} # not required. choices: always;on_create. C(always) will update passwords if they differ.  C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users.

iam_cert.description: Manage server certificates for use on ELBs and CloudFront
body: iam_cert:

state: ${1|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Whether to create(or update) or delete certificate.,If new_path or new_name is defined, specifying present will attempt to make an update these.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of certificate to add, update or remove.
validate_certs: ${3:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
cert: ${6:undefined} # not required. The path to, or content of the certificate body in PEM encoded format. As of 2.4 content is accepted. If the parameter is not a file, it is assumed to be content.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
key: ${8:undefined} # not required. The path to, or content of the private key in PEM encoded format. As of 2.4 content is accepted. If the parameter is not a file, it is assumed to be content.

region: ${9:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

dup_ok: ${10:false} # not required. By default the module will not upload a certificate that is already uploaded into AWS. If set to True, it will upload the certificate as long as the name is unique.
new_name: ${11:undefined} # not required. When state is present, this will update the name of the cert.,The cert, key and cert_chain parameters will be ignored if this is defined.
path: ${12:/} # not required. When creating or updating, specify the desired path of the certificate.
aws_access_key: ${13:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

cert_chain: ${14:undefined} # not required. The path to, or content of the CA certificate chain in PEM encoded format. As of 2.4 content is accepted. If the parameter is not a file, it is assumed to be content.
security_token: ${15:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
new_path: ${16:undefined} # not required. When state is present, this will update the path of the cert.,The cert, key and cert_chain parameters will be ignored if this is defined.

iam_server_certificate_facts.description: Retrieve the facts of a server certificate
body: iam_server_certificate_facts:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the server certificate you are retrieving attributes for.
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

region: ${3:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${6:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${7:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${8:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
iam_group:
state: ${1|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Create or remove the IAM group
name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the group to create.
validate_certs: ${3:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

ec2_url: ${6:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
managed_policy: ${7:undefined} # not required. A list of managed policy ARNs or friendly names to attach to the role. To embed an inline policy, use M(iam_policy).

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_access_key: ${9:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${10:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
users: ${11:undefined} # not required. A list of existing users to add as members of the group.
purge_users: ${12:false} # not required. Deatach users which not included in users list
purge_policy: ${13:false} # not required. Deatach policy which not included in managed_policy list
iam_managed_policy:
policy_name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the managed policy.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Should this managed policy be present or absent. Set to absent to detach all entities from this policy and remove it if found.
validate_certs: ${3:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
policy_description: ${5:} # not required. A helpful description of this policy, this value is immuteable and only set when creating a new policy.
profile: ${6:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${7:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_url: ${9:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
policy: ${10:undefined} # not required. A properly json formatted policy
only_version: ${11:false} # not required. Remove all other non default revisions, if this is used with C(make_default) it will result in all other versions of this policy being deleted.
security_token: ${12:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
make_default: ${13:true} # not required. Make this revision the default revision.

iam_mfa_device_facts.description: List the MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication) devices registered for a user
body: iam_mfa_device_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${2:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${3:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${4:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${5:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${6:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

region: ${7:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
user_name: ${8:null} # not required. The name of the user whose MFA devices will be listed

iam_policy.description: Manage IAM policies for users, groups, and roles
body: iam_policy:
iam_name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of IAM resource you wish to target for policy actions. In other words, the user name, group name or role name.
iam_type: ${2|user,group,role|} # required. choices: user;group;role. Type of IAM resource
policy_name: ${3:undefined} # required. The name label for the policy to create or remove.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Whether to create or delete the IAM policy.
validate_certs: ${5:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${6:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${7:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

ec2_url: ${8:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

skip_duplicates: ${9:/} # not required. By default the module looks for any policies that match the document you pass in, if there is a match it will not make a new policy object with the same rules. You can override this by specifying false which would allow for two policy objects with different names but same rules.

region: ${10:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_access_key: ${11:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${12:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

policy_json: ${13:undefined} # not required. A properly json formatted policy as string (mutually exclusive with C(policy_document), see https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/7005#issuecomment-42894813 on how to use it properly)
policy_document: ${14:undefined} # not required. The path to the properly json formatted policy file (mutually exclusive with C(policy_json))
iam_role:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the role to create.
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
description: ${4:undefined} # not required. Provide a description of the new role
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
purge_policies: ${6:true} # not required. Detaches any managed policies not listed in the "managed_policy" option. Set to false if you want to attach policies elsewhere.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

assume_role_policy_document: ${8:undefined} # not required. The trust relationship policy document that grants an entity permission to assume the role.,This parameter is required when C(state=present).

managed_policy: ${9:undefined} # not required. A list of managed policy ARNs or, since Ansible 2.4, a list of either managed policy ARNs or friendly names. To embed an inline policy, use M(iam_policy). To remove existing policies, use an empty list item.

region: ${10:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
path: ${11:/} # not required. The path to the role. For more information about paths, see U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/reference_identifiers.html).
create_instance_profile: ${12:true} # not required. Creates an IAM instance profile along with the role
aws_access_key: ${13:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${14:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${15|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Create or remove the IAM role
iam_role_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

region: ${2:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
path_prefix: ${4:None} # not required. Prefix of role I(path) to restrict IAM role search for,Mutually exclusive with C(name)
aws_access_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${6:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
name: ${8:None} # not required. Name of a role to search for,Mutually exclusive with C(prefix)
profile: ${9:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
iam_user:
state: ${1|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Create or remove the IAM user
name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the user to create.
purge_policy: ${3:false} # not required. Detach policies which are not included in managed_policy list
validate_certs: ${4:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

region: ${5:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
aws_secret_key: ${6:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${7:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
managed_policy: ${8:undefined} # not required. A list of managed policy ARNs or friendly names to attach to the user. To embed an inline policy, use M(iam_policy).
aws_access_key: ${9:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${10:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
profile: ${11:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
icinga2_feature:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. This is the feature name to enable or disable.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Apply feature state.
icinga2_host:
ip: ${1:undefined} # required. The IP address of the host.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name used to create / delete the host. This does not need to be the FQDN, but does needs to be unique.
url: ${3:undefined} # required. HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP URL in the form (http|https|ftp)://[user[:pass]]@host.domain[:port]/path
validate_certs: ${4:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
url_password: ${5:undefined} # not required. The password for use in HTTP basic authentication.,If the C(url_username) parameter is not specified, the C(url_password) parameter will not be used.

client_cert: ${6:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted certificate chain file to be used for SSL client authentication. This file can also include the key as well, and if the key is included, C(client_key) is not required.

client_key: ${7:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for SSL client authentication. If C(client_cert) contains both the certificate and key, this option is not required.
url_username: ${8:undefined} # not required. The username for use in HTTP basic authentication.,This parameter can be used without C(url_password) for sites that allow empty passwords.
zone: ${9:undefined} # not required. The zone from where this host should be polled.
use_proxy: ${10:yes} # not required. If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
display_name: ${11:if none is give it is the value of the <name> parameter} # not required. The name used to display the host.
template: ${12:None} # not required. The template used to define the host.,Template cannot be modified after object creation.
variables: ${13:None} # not required. List of variables.

force_basic_auth: ${14:no} # not required. httplib2, the library used by the uri module only sends authentication information when a webservice responds to an initial request with a 401 status. Since some basic auth services do not properly send a 401, logins will fail. This option forces the sending of the Basic authentication header upon initial request.
check_command: ${15:hostalive} # not required. The command used to check if the host is alive.
state: ${16|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Apply feature state.

imc_rest.description: Manage Cisco IMC hardware through its REST API
body: imc_rest:
hostname: ${1:undefined} # required. IP Address or hostname of Cisco IMC, resolvable by Ansible control host.

content: ${2:undefined} # not required. When used instead of C(path), sets the content of the API requests directly.,This may be convenient to template simple requests, for anything complex use the M(template) module.,You can collate multiple IMC XML fragments and they will be processed sequentially in a single stream, the Cisco IMC output is subsequently merged.,Parameter C(content) is mutual exclusive with parameter C(path).
validate_certs: ${3:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
protocol: ${4|http,https|} # not required. choices: http;https. Connection protocol to use.
password: ${5:password} # not required. The password to use for authentication.

path: ${6:undefined} # not required. Name of the absolute path of the filename that includes the body of the http request being sent to the Cisco IMC REST API.,Parameter C(path) is mutual exclusive with parameter C(content).

timeout: ${7:60} # not required. The socket level timeout in seconds.,This is the time that every single connection (every fragment) can spend. If this C(timeout) is reached, the module will fail with a C(Connection failure) indicating that C(The read operation timed out).
username: ${8:admin} # not required. Username used to login to the switch.
imgadm:

state: ${1|present,absent,deleted,imported,updated,vacuumed|} # required. choices: present;absent;deleted;imported;updated;vacuumed. State the object operated on should be in. C(imported) is an alias for for C(present) and C(deleted) for C(absent). When set to C(vacuumed) and C(uuid) to C(*), it will remove all unused images.
pool: ${2:zones} # not required. zpool to import to or delete images from.
type: ${3|imgapi,docker,dsapi|} # not required. choices: imgapi;docker;dsapi. Type for image sources.
force: ${4|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Force a given operation (where supported by imgadm(1M)).
uuid: ${5:undefined} # not required. Image UUID. Can either be a full UUID or C(*) for all images.
source: ${6:undefined} # not required. URI for the image source.
import_playbook:
