Content of the Let's Encrypt account RSA or Elliptic Curve key.,Mutually exclusive with C(account_key_src).,Required if C(account_key_src) is not used.,Warning: the content will be written into a temporary file, which will be deleted by Ansible when the module completes. Since this is an important private key — it can be used to change the account key, or to revoke your certificates without knowing their private keys —, this might not be acceptable.

remaining_days: ${11:10} # not required. The number of days the certificate must have left being valid. If C(cert_days < remaining_days), then it will be renewed. If the certificate is not renewed, module return values will not include C(challenge_data).
fullchain_dest: ${12:undefined} # not required. The destination file for the full chain (i.e. certificate followed by chain of intermediate certificates).,Required if C(dest) is not specified.
challenge: ${13|http-01,dns-01,tls-sni-02|} # not required. choices: http-01;dns-01;tls-sni-02. The challenge to be performed.
chain_dest: ${14:null} # not required. If specified, the intermediate certificate will be written to this file.

acme_directory: ${15:https://acme-staging.api.letsencrypt.org/directory} # not required. The ACME directory to use. This is the entry point URL to access CA server API.,For safety reasons the default is set to the Let's Encrypt staging server. This will create technically correct, but untrusted certificates.,You can find URLs of staging endpoints here: U(https://letsencrypt.org/docs/staging-environment/),The production Let's Encrypt ACME v1 directory URL, which produces properly trusted certificates, is U(https://acme-v01.api.letsencrypt.org/directory).
librato_annotation:
links: ${1:undefined} # required. See examples
api_key: ${2:undefined} # required. Librato account api key
title: ${3:undefined} # required. The title of an annotation is a string and may contain spaces,The title should be a short, high-level summary of the annotation e.g. v45 Deployment
user: ${4:undefined} # required. Librato account username

end_time: ${5:undefined} # not required. The unix timestamp indicating the time at which the event referenced by this annotation ended,For events that have a duration, this is a useful way to annotate the duration of the event

description: ${6:undefined} # not required. The description contains extra meta-data about a particular annotation,The description should contain specifics on the individual annotation e.g. Deployed 9b562b2 shipped new feature foo!
source: ${7:undefined} # not required. A string which describes the originating source of an annotation when that annotation is tracked across multiple members of a population
start_time: ${8:undefined} # not required. The unix timestamp indicating the time at which the event referenced by this annotation started
name: ${9:undefined} # not required. The annotation stream name,If the annotation stream does not exist, it will be created automatically

lightsail.description: Create or delete a virtual machine instance in AWS Lightsail
body: lightsail:
name: ${1:null} # required. Name of the instance
wait_timeout: ${2:300} # not required. How long before wait gives up, in seconds.
key_pair_name: ${3:null} # not required. Name of the key pair to use with the instance
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
validate_certs: ${5:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
user_data: ${6:null} # not required. Launch script that can configure the instance with additional data
aws_access_key: ${7:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
bundle_id: ${9:null} # not required. Bundle of specification info for the instance. Required when state='present'
blueprint_id: ${10:null} # not required. ID of the instance blueprint image. Required when state='present'

ec2_url: ${11:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
aws_secret_key: ${12:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
zone: ${13:null} # not required. AWS availability zone in which to launch the instance. Required when state='present'
wait: ${14|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Wait for the instance to be in state 'running' before returning.  If wait is "no" an ip_address may not be returned
security_token: ${15:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${16|present,absent,running,restarted,stopped|} # not required. choices: present;absent;running;restarted;stopped. Indicate desired state of the target.
lineinfile:
path: ${1:undefined} # required. The file to modify.,Before 2.3 this option was only usable as I(dest), I(destfile) and I(name).

regexp: ${2:undefined} # not required. The regular expression to look for in every line of the file. For C(state=present), the pattern to replace if found. Only the last line found will be replaced. For C(state=absent), the pattern of the line(s) to remove. Uses Python regular expressions. See U(http://docs.python.org/2/library/re.html).
selevel: ${3:s0} # not required. Level part of the SELinux file context. This is the MLS/MCS attribute, sometimes known as the C(range). C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

insertafter: ${4|EOF,*regex*|} # not required. choices: EOF;*regex*. Used with C(state=present). If specified, the line will be inserted after the last match of specified regular expression. If the first match is required, use(firstmatch=yes). A special value is available; C(EOF) for inserting the line at the end of the file. If specified regular expression has no matches, EOF will be used instead. May not be used with C(backrefs).

unsafe_writes: ${5:false} # not required. Normally this module uses atomic operations to prevent data corruption or inconsistent reads from the target files, sometimes systems are configured or just broken in ways that prevent this. One example are docker mounted files, they cannot be updated atomically and can only be done in an unsafe manner.,This boolean option allows ansible to fall back to unsafe methods of updating files for those cases in which you do not have any other choice. Be aware that this is subject to race conditions and can lead to data corruption.

insertbefore: ${6|BOF,*regex*|} # not required. choices: BOF;*regex*. Used with C(state=present). If specified, the line will be inserted before the last match of specified regular expression. If the first match is required, use(firstmatch=yes). A value is available; C(BOF) for inserting the line at the beginning of the file. If specified regular expression has no matches, the line will be inserted at the end of the file.  May not be used with C(backrefs).
backup: ${7:no} # not required. Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.
serole: ${8:null} # not required. Role part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
firstmatch: ${9:no} # not required. Used with C(insertafter) or C(insertbefore). If set, C(insertafter) and C(inserbefore) find a first line has regular expression matches.
owner: ${10:null} # not required. Name of the user that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).
setype: ${11:null} # not required. Type part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

mode: ${12:null} # not required. Mode the file or directory should be. For those used to I(/usr/bin/chmod) remember that modes are actually octal numbers (like C(0644) or C(01777)). Leaving off the leading zero will likely have unexpected results. As of version 1.8, the mode may be specified as a symbolic mode (for example, C(u+rwx) or C(u=rw,g=r,o=r)).

backrefs: ${13:no} # not required. Used with C(state=present). If set, line can contain backreferences (both positional and named) that will get populated if the C(regexp) matches. This flag changes the operation of the module slightly; C(insertbefore) and C(insertafter) will be ignored, and if the C(regexp) doesn't match anywhere in the file, the file will be left unchanged. If the C(regexp) does match, the last matching line will be replaced by the expanded line parameter.
others: ${14:undefined} # not required. All arguments accepted by the M(file) module also work here.

attributes: ${15:None} # not required. Attributes the file or directory should have. To get supported flags look at the man page for I(chattr) on the target system. This string should contain the attributes in the same order as the one displayed by I(lsattr).
create: ${16:no} # not required. Used with C(state=present). If specified, the file will be created if it does not already exist. By default it will fail if the file is missing.

validate: ${17:None} # not required. The validation command to run before copying into place. The path to the file to validate is passed in via '%s' which must be present as in the example below. The command is passed securely so shell features like expansion and pipes won't work.
seuser: ${18:null} # not required. User part of SELinux file context. Will default to system policy, if applicable. If set to C(_default), it will use the C(user) portion of the policy if available.
state: ${19|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Whether the line should be there or not.
group: ${20:null} # not required. Name of the group that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).

line: ${21:undefined} # not required. Required for C(state=present). The line to insert/replace into the file. If C(backrefs) is set, may contain backreferences that will get expanded with the C(regexp) capture groups if the regexp matches.

linode.description: Manage instances on the Linode Public Cloud
body: linode:
datacenter: ${1:undefined} # not required. datacenter to create an instance in (Linode Datacenter)
plan: ${2:undefined} # not required. plan to use for the instance (Linode plan)
alert_diskio_threshold: ${3:undefined} # not required. Set threshold for average IO ops/sec over 2 hour period.
alert_bwout_enabled: ${4:undefined} # not required. Set status of bandwidth out alerts.
wait: ${5:no} # not required. wait for the instance to be in state C(running) before returning
alert_bwquota_enabled: ${6:undefined} # not required. Set status of bandwidth quota alerts as percentage of network transfer quota.
private_ip: ${7:no} # not required. Add private IPv4 address when Linode is created.
payment_term: ${8|1,12,24|} # not required. choices: 1;12;24. payment term to use for the instance (payment term in months)
swap: ${9:512} # not required. swap size in MB
kernel_id: ${10:undefined} # not required. kernel to use for the instance (Linode Kernel)
alert_bwin_enabled: ${11:undefined} # not required. Set status of bandwidth in alerts.
linode_id: ${12:undefined} # not required. Unique ID of a linode server
backupweeklyday: ${13:undefined} # not required. Integer value for what day of the week to store weekly backups.
name: ${14:undefined} # not required. Name to give the instance (alphanumeric, dashes, underscore).,To keep sanity on the Linode Web Console, name is prepended with C(LinodeID_).

additional_disks: ${15:undefined} # not required. List of dictionaries for creating additional disks that are added to the Linode configuration settings.,Dictionary takes Size, Label, Type. Size is in MB.
wait_timeout: ${16:300} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
alert_cpu_enabled: ${17:undefined} # not required. Set status of receiving CPU usage alerts.
api_key: ${18:undefined} # not required. Linode API key
alert_cpu_threshold: ${19:undefined} # not required. Set percentage threshold for receiving CPU usage alerts. Each CPU core adds 100% to total.
password: ${20:undefined} # not required. root password to apply to a new server (auto generated if missing)
ssh_pub_key: ${21:undefined} # not required. SSH public key applied to root user
alert_bwin_threshold: ${22:undefined} # not required. Set threshold in MB of bandwidth in alerts.
distribution: ${23:undefined} # not required. distribution to use for the instance (Linode Distribution)
displaygroup: ${24:undefined} # not required. Add the instance to a Display Group in Linode Manager.
alert_diskio_enabled: ${25:undefined} # not required. Set status of receiving disk IO alerts.
watchdog: ${26:True} # not required. Set status of Lassie watchdog.
alert_bwquota_threshold: ${27:undefined} # not required. Set threshold in MB of bandwidth quota alerts.
state: ${28|absent,active,deleted,present,restarted,started,stopped|} # not required. choices: absent;active;deleted;present;restarted;started;stopped. Indicate desired state of the resource
alert_bwout_threshold: ${29:undefined} # not required. Set threshold in MB of bandwidth out alerts.
lldp:
locale_gen:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name and encoding of the locale, such as "en_GB.UTF-8".
state: ${2|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Whether the locale shall be present.

logentries.description: Module for tracking logs via logentries.com
body: logentries:
path: ${1:undefined} # required. path to a log file
name: ${2:undefined} # not required. name of the log
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. following state of the log
logtype: ${4:undefined} # not required. type of the log
logentries_msg:
msg: ${1:undefined} # required. The message body.
token: ${2:undefined} # required. Log token.
port: ${3:80} # not required. API endpoint port
api: ${4:data.logentries.com} # not required. API endpoint

logicmonitor.description: Manage your LogicMonitor account through Ansible Playbooks
body: logicmonitor:
company: ${1:null} # required. The LogicMonitor account company name. If you would log in to your account at "superheroes.logicmonitor.com" you would use "superheroes."

action: ${2|add,remove,update,sdt|} # required. choices: add;remove;update;sdt. The action you wish to perform on target.,Add: Add an object to your LogicMonitor account.,Remove: Remove an object from your LogicMonitor account.,Update: Update properties, description, or groups (target=host) for an object in your LogicMonitor account.,SDT: Schedule downtime for an object in your LogicMonitor account.

target: ${3|collector,host,datsource,hostgroup|} # required. choices: collector;host;datsource;hostgroup. The type of LogicMonitor object you wish to manage.,Collector: Perform actions on a LogicMonitor collector.,NOTE You should use Ansible service modules such as M(service) or M(supervisorctl) for managing the Collector 'logicmonitor-agent' and 'logicmonitor-watchdog' services. Specifically, you'll probably want to start these services after a Collector add and stop these services before a Collector remove.,Host: Perform actions on a host device.,Hostgroup: Perform actions on a LogicMonitor host group.,NOTE Host and Hostgroup tasks should always be performed via delegate_to: localhost. There are no benefits to running these tasks on the remote host and doing so will typically cause problems.
password: ${4:null} # required. The password of the specified LogicMonitor user
user: ${5:null} # required. A LogicMonitor user name. The module will authenticate and perform actions on behalf of this user.
duration: ${6:30} # not required. The duration (minutes) of the Scheduled Down Time (SDT).,Optional for putting an object into SDT (action=sdt).
starttime: ${7:Now} # not required. The time that the Scheduled Down Time (SDT) should begin.,Optional for managing SDT (action=sdt).,Y-m-d H:M
groups: ${8:} # not required. A list of groups that the host should be a member of.,Optional for managing hosts (target=host; action=add or action=update).
id: ${9:null} # not required. ID of the datasource to target.,Required for management of LogicMonitor datasources (target=datasource).

description: ${10:} # not required. The long text description of the object in your LogicMonitor account.,Optional for managing hosts and host groups (target=host or target=hostgroup; action=add or action=update).

collector: ${11:null} # not required. The fully qualified domain name of a collector in your LogicMonitor account.,This is required for the creation of a LogicMonitor host (target=host action=add).,This is required for updating, removing or scheduling downtime for hosts if 'displayname' isn't specified (target=host action=update action=remove action=sdt).

fullpath: ${12:null} # not required. The fullpath of the host group object you would like to manage.,Recommend running on a single Ansible host.,Required for management of LogicMonitor host groups (target=hostgroup).
displayname: ${13:hostname -f} # not required. The display name of a host in your LogicMonitor account or the desired display name of a device to manage.,Optional for managing hosts (target=host).

properties: ${14:[object Object]} # not required. A dictionary of properties to set on the LogicMonitor host or host group.,Optional for managing hosts and host groups (target=host or target=hostgroup; action=add or action=update).,This parameter will add or update existing properties in your LogicMonitor account.
alertenable: ${15|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. A boolean flag to turn alerting on or off for an object.,Optional for managing all hosts (action=add or action=update).
hostname: ${16:hostname -f} # not required. The hostname of a host in your LogicMonitor account, or the desired hostname of a device to manage.,Optional for managing hosts (target=host).
logicmonitor_facts:
password: ${1:null} # required. The password for the chosen LogicMonitor User.,If an md5 hash is used, the digest flag must be set to true.
company: ${2:null} # required. The LogicMonitor account company name. If you would log in to your account at "superheroes.logicmonitor.com" you would use "superheroes".
target: ${3|host,hostgroup|} # required. choices: host;hostgroup. The LogicMonitor object you wish to manage.
user: ${4:null} # required. A LogicMonitor user name. The module will authenticate and perform actions on behalf of this user.

collector: ${5:null} # not required. The fully qualified domain name of a collector in your LogicMonitor account.,This is optional for querying a LogicMonitor host when a displayname is specified.,This is required for querying a LogicMonitor host when a displayname is not specified.

fullpath: ${6:null} # not required. The fullpath of the hostgroup object you would like to manage.,Recommend running on a single ansible host.,Required for management of LogicMonitor host groups (target=hostgroup).
displayname: ${7:hostname -f} # not required. The display name of a host in your LogicMonitor account or the desired display name of a device to add into monitoring.
hostname: ${8:hostname -f} # not required. The hostname of a host in your LogicMonitor account, or the desired hostname of a device to add into monitoring.,Required for managing hosts (target=host).
logstash_plugin:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Install plugin with that name.
proxy_port: ${2:None} # not required. Proxy port to use during plugin installation.
version: ${3:None} # not required. Specify plugin Version of the plugin to install. If plugin exists with previous version, it will NOT be updated.
proxy_host: ${4:None} # not required. Proxy host to use during plugin installation.
plugin_bin: ${5:/usr/share/logstash/bin/logstash-plugin} # not required. Specify logstash-plugin to use for plugin management.
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Apply plugin state.
lvg:
vg: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the volume group.
vg_options: ${2:undefined} # not required. Additional options to pass to C(vgcreate) when creating the volume group.
pesize: ${3:4} # not required. The size of the physical extent in megabytes. Must be a power of 2.
force: ${4:no} # not required. If C(yes), allows to remove volume group with logical volumes.

pvs: ${5:undefined} # not required. List of comma-separated devices to use as physical devices in this volume group. Required when creating or resizing volume group.,The module will take care of running pvcreate if needed.
state: ${6|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Control if the volume group exists.
pv_options: ${7:undefined} # not required. Additional options to pass to C(pvcreate) when creating the volume group.
lvol:

size: ${1:undefined} # not required. The size of the logical volume, according to lvcreate(8) --size, by default in megabytes or optionally with one of [bBsSkKmMgGtTpPeE] units; or according to lvcreate(8) --extents as a percentage of [VG|PVS|FREE]; Float values must begin with a digit. Resizing using percentage values was not supported prior to 2.1.
thinpool: ${2:undefined} # not required. The thin pool volume name. When you want to create a thin provisioned volume, specify a thin pool volume name.
force: ${3:no} # not required. Shrink or remove operations of volumes requires this switch. Ensures that that filesystems get never corrupted/destroyed by mistake.
pvs: ${4:undefined} # not required. Comma separated list of physical volumes (e.g. /dev/sda,/dev/sdb).
opts: ${5:undefined} # not required. Free-form options to be passed to the lvcreate command.
snapshot: ${6:undefined} # not required. The name of the snapshot volume
resizefs: ${7:yes} # not required. Resize the underlying filesystem together with the logical volume.
active: ${8:yes} # not required. Whether the volume is activate and visible to the host.
lv: ${9:undefined} # not required. The name of the logical volume.
vg: ${10:undefined} # not required. The volume group this logical volume is part of.
state: ${11|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Control if the logical volume exists. If C(present) and the volume does not already exist then the C(size) option is required.
shrink: ${12:yes} # not required. Shrink if current size is higher than size requested.
lxc_container:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of a container.
backing_store: ${2|dir,lvm,loop,btrfs,overlayfs,zfs|} # not required. choices: dir;lvm;loop;btrfs;overlayfs;zfs. Backend storage type for the container.
template_options: ${3:undefined} # not required. Template options when building the container.
lxc_path: ${4:undefined} # not required. Place container under PATH
container_command: ${5:undefined} # not required. Run a command within a container.
zfs_root: ${6:undefined} # not required. Create zfs under given zfsroot.
container_log_level: ${7|INFO,ERROR,DEBUG|} # not required. choices: INFO;ERROR;DEBUG. Set the log level for a container where *container_log* was set.
vg_name: ${8:lxc} # not required. If Backend store is lvm, specify the name of the volume group.
archive_path: ${9:null} # not required. Path the save the archived container. If the path does not exist the archive method will attempt to create it.
clone_name: ${10:false} # not required. Name of the new cloned server. This is only used when state is clone.

clone_snapshot: ${11|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Create a snapshot a container when cloning. This is not supported by all container storage backends. Enabling this may fail if the backing store does not support snapshots.
lv_name: ${12:$CONTAINER_NAME} # not required. Name of the logical volume, defaults to the container name.
thinpool: ${13:undefined} # not required. Use LVM thin pool called TP.
template: ${14:ubuntu} # not required. Name of the template to use within an LXC create.
directory: ${15:undefined} # not required. Place rootfs directory under DIR.
archive: ${16|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Create an archive of a container. This will create a tarball of the running container.
archive_compression: ${17|gzip,bzip2,none|} # not required. choices: gzip;bzip2;none. Type of compression to use when creating an archive of a running container.
fs_size: ${18:5G} # not required. File system Size.
fs_type: ${19:ext4} # not required. Create fstype TYPE.
config: ${20:null} # not required. Path to the LXC configuration file.
container_log: ${21|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Enable a container log for host actions to the container.

state: ${22|started,stopped,restarted,absent,frozen|} # not required. choices: started;stopped;restarted;absent;frozen. Define the state of a container. If you clone a container using `clone_name` the newly cloned container created in a stopped state. The running container will be stopped while the clone operation is happening and upon completion of the clone the original container state will be restored.
container_config: ${23:undefined} # not required. list of 'key=value' options to use when configuring a container.
lxd_container:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of a container.
force_stop: ${2:false} # not required. If this is true, the C(lxd_container) forces to stop the container when it stops or restarts the container.
architecture: ${3:undefined} # not required. The architecture for the container (e.g. "x86_64" or "i686"). See U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#post-1)
ephemeral: ${4:undefined} # not required. Whether or not the container is ephemeral (e.g. true or false). See U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#post-1)

wait_for_ipv4_addresses: ${5:false} # not required. If this is true, the C(lxd_container) waits until IPv4 addresses are set to the all network interfaces in the container after starting or restarting.

trust_password: ${6:undefined} # not required. The client trusted password.,You need to set this password on the LXD server before running this module using the following command. lxc config set core.trust_password <some random password> See U(https://www.stgraber.org/2016/04/18/lxd-api-direct-interaction/),If trust_password is set, this module send a request for authentication before sending any requests.
cert_file: ${7:"{}/.config/lxc/client.crt" .format(os.environ["HOME"])} # not required. The client certificate file path.
key_file: ${8:"{}/.config/lxc/client.key" .format(os.environ["HOME"])} # not required. The client certificate key file path.

config: ${9:undefined} # not required. The config for the container (e.g. {"limits.cpu": "2"}). See U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#post-1),If the container already exists and its "config" value in metadata obtained from GET /1.0/containers/<name> U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#10containersname) are different, they this module tries to apply the configurations.,The key starts with 'volatile.' are ignored for this comparison.,Not all config values are supported to apply the existing container. Maybe you need to delete and recreate a container.
url: ${10:unix:/var/lib/lxd/unix.socket} # not required. The unix domain socket path or the https URL for the LXD server.
state: ${11|started,stopped,restarted,absent,frozen|} # not required. choices: started;stopped;restarted;absent;frozen. Define the state of a container.

source: ${12:undefined} # not required. The source for the container (e.g. { "type": "image", "mode": "pull", "server": "https://images.linuxcontainers.org", "protocol": "lxd", "alias": "ubuntu/xenial/amd64" }). See U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#post-1)

devices: ${13:undefined} # not required. The devices for the container (e.g. { "rootfs": { "path": "/dev/kvm", "type": "unix-char" }). See U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#post-1)

timeout: ${14:30} # not required. A timeout for changing the state of the container.,This is also used as a timeout for waiting until IPv4 addresses are set to the all network interfaces in the container after starting or restarting.
lxd_profile:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of a profile.
description: ${2:undefined} # not required. Description of the profile.

config: ${3:undefined} # not required. The config for the container (e.g. {"limits.memory": "4GB"}). See U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#patch-3),If the profile already exists and its "config" value in metadata obtained from GET /1.0/profiles/<name> U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#get-19) are different, they this module tries to apply the configurations.,Not all config values are supported to apply the existing profile. Maybe you need to delete and recreate a profile.

trust_password: ${4:undefined} # not required. The client trusted password.,You need to set this password on the LXD server before running this module using the following command. lxc config set core.trust_password <some random password> See U(https://www.stgraber.org/2016/04/18/lxd-api-direct-interaction/),If trust_password is set, this module send a request for authentication before sending any requests.
devices: ${5:undefined} # not required. The devices for the profile (e.g. {"rootfs": {"path": "/dev/kvm", "type": "unix-char"}). See U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#patch-3)
cert_file: ${6:"{}/.config/lxc/client.crt" .format(os.environ["HOME"])} # not required. The client certificate file path.
key_file: ${7:"{}/.config/lxc/client.key" .format(os.environ["HOME"])} # not required. The client certificate key file path.

new_name: ${8:undefined} # not required. A new name of a profile.,If this parameter is specified a profile will be renamed to this name. See U(https://github.com/lxc/lxd/blob/master/doc/rest-api.md#post-11)
url: ${9:unix:/var/lib/lxd/unix.socket} # not required. The unix domain socket path or the https URL for the LXD server.
state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Define the state of a profile.
macports:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. name of package to install/remove
update_cache: ${2|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. update the package db first
state: ${3|present,absent,active,inactive|} # not required. choices: present;absent;active;inactive. state of the package
mail:
subject: ${1:undefined} # required. The subject of the email being sent.
from: ${2:root} # not required. The email-address the mail is sent from. May contain address and phrase.
port: ${3:25} # not required. The mail server port.,This must be a valid integer between 1 and 65534
attach: ${4:} # not required. A list of pathnames of files to attach to the message.,Attached files will have their content-type set to C(application/octet-stream).
subtype: ${5|html,plain|} # not required. choices: html;plain. The minor mime type, can be either C(plain) or C(html).,The major type is always C(text).
body: ${6:$subject} # not required. The body of the email being sent.
bcc: ${7:undefined} # not required. The email-address(es) the mail is being 'blind' copied to.,This is a list, which may contain address and phrase portions.
host: ${8:localhost} # not required. The mail server.

secure: ${9|always,never,starttls,try|} # not required. choices: always;never;starttls;try. If C(always), the connection will only send email if the connection is Encrypted. If the server doesn't accept the encrypted connection it will fail.,If C(try), the connection will attempt to setup a secure SSL/TLS session, before trying to send.,If C(never), the connection will not attempt to setup a secure SSL/TLS session, before sending,If C(starttls), the connection will try to upgrade to a secure SSL/TLS connection, before sending. If it is unable to do so it will fail.
charset: ${10:utf-8} # not required. The character set of email being sent.
password: ${11:undefined} # not required. If SMTP requires password.
cc: ${12:undefined} # not required. The email-address(es) the mail is being copied to.,This is a list, which may contain address and phrase portions.
username: ${13:undefined} # not required. If SMTP requires username.
to: ${14:root} # not required. The email-address(es) the mail is being sent to.,This is a list, which may contain address and phrase portions.
timeout: ${15:20} # not required. Sets the timeout in seconds for connection attempts.
headers: ${16:} # not required. A list of headers which should be added to the message.,Each individual header is specified as C(header=value) (see example below).
make:
chdir: ${1:undefined} # required. cd into this directory before running make
target: ${2:none} # not required. The target to run
params: ${3:none} # not required. Any extra parameters to pass to make
file: ${4:none} # not required. Use file as a Makefile

manageiq_alert_profiles.description: Configuration of alert profiles for ManageIQ
body: manageiq_alert_profiles:
manageiq_connection: ${1:undefined} # required. ManageIQ connection configuration information.
alerts: ${2:undefined} # not required. List of alert descriptions to assign to this profile.,Required if state is "present"
notes: ${3:undefined} # not required. Optional notes for this profile

resource_type: ${4|Vm,ContainerNode,MiqServer,Host,Storage,EmsCluster,ExtManagementSystem,MiddlewareServer|} # not required. choices: Vm;ContainerNode;MiqServer;Host;Storage;EmsCluster;ExtManagementSystem;MiddlewareServer. The resource type for the alert profile in ManageIQ. Required when state is "present".
state: ${5|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. absent - alert profile should not exist,,present - alert profile should exist,
name: ${6:undefined} # not required. The unique alert profile name in ManageIQ.,Required when state is "absent" or "present".
manageiq_alerts:
manageiq_connection: ${1:undefined} # required. ManageIQ connection configuration information.
enabled: ${2:undefined} # not required. Enable or disable the alert. Required if state is "present".
description: ${3:undefined} # not required. The unique alert description in ManageIQ.,Required when state is "absent" or "present".

resource_type: ${4|Vm,ContainerNode,MiqServer,Host,Storage,EmsCluster,ExtManagementSystem,MiddlewareServer|} # not required. choices: Vm;ContainerNode;MiqServer;Host;Storage;EmsCluster;ExtManagementSystem;MiddlewareServer. The entity type for the alert in ManageIQ. Required when state is "present".
state: ${5|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. absent - alert should not exist,,present - alert should exist,
options: ${6:undefined} # not required. Additional alert options, such as notification type and frequency
expression_type: ${7|hash,miq|} # not required. choices: hash;miq. Expression type.
expression: ${8:undefined} # not required. The alert expression for ManageIQ.,Can either be in the "Miq Expression" format or the "Hash Expression format".,Required if state is "present".

manageiq_policies.description: Management of resource policy_profiles in ManageIQ.
body: manageiq_policies:
resource_name: ${1:null} # required. the name of the resource to which the profile should be [un]assigned

resource_type: ${2|provider,host,vm,blueprint,category,cluster,data store,group,resource pool,service,service template,template,tenant,user|} # required. choices: provider;host;vm;blueprint;category;cluster;data store;group;resource pool;service;service template;template;tenant;user. the type of the resource to which the profile should be [un]assigned
manageiq_connection: ${3:undefined} # required. ManageIQ connection configuration information.
policy_profiles: ${4:null} # not required. list of dictionaries, each includes the policy_profile 'name' key.,required if state is present or absent.

state: ${5|absent,present,list|} # not required. choices: absent;present;list. absent - policy_profiles should not exist,,present - policy_profiles should exist,,list - list current policy_profiles and policies.
manageiq_provider:
type: ${1|Openshift,Amazon,oVirt,VMware,Azure,Director,OpenStack,GCE|} # required. choices: Openshift;Amazon;oVirt;VMware;Azure;Director;OpenStack;GCE. The provider's type.
manageiq_connection: ${2:undefined} # required. ManageIQ connection configuration information.
name: ${3:undefined} # required. The provider's name.
provider: ${4:null} # not required. Default endpoint connection information, required if state is true.
tenant_mapping_enabled: ${5:false} # not required. Whether to enable mapping of existing tenants. defaults to False.
alerts: ${6:null} # not required. Alerts endpoint connection information.
zone: ${7:default} # not required. The ManageIQ zone name that will manage the provider.
subscription: ${8:null} # not required. Microsoft Azure subscription ID. defaults to None.
metrics: ${9:null} # not required. Metrics endpoint connection information.
host_default_vnc_port_end: ${10:null} # not required. The last port in the host VNC range. defaults to None.
host_default_vnc_port_start: ${11:null} # not required. The first port in the host VNC range. defaults to None.
ssh_keypair: ${12:null} # not required. SSH key pair used for SSH connections to all hosts in this provider.
provider_region: ${13:null} # not required. The provider region name to connect to (e.g. AWS region for Amazon).
api_version: ${14|v2,v3|} # not required. choices: v2;v3. The OpenStack Keystone API version. defaults to None.
azure_tenant_id: ${15:null} # not required. Tenant ID. defaults to None.
project: ${16:null} # not required. Google Compute Engine Project ID. defaults to None.
state: ${17|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. absent - provider should not exist, present - provider should be present.

manageiq_tags.description: Management of resource tags in ManageIQ.
body: manageiq_tags:
manageiq_connection: ${1:undefined} # required. ManageIQ connection configuration information.
resource_name: ${2:null} # required. the relevant resource name in manageiq

resource_type: ${3|provider,host,vm,blueprint,category,cluster,data store,group,resource pool,service,service template,template,tenant,user|} # required. choices: provider;host;vm;blueprint;category;cluster;data store;group;resource pool;service;service template;template;tenant;user. the relevant resource type in manageiq
state: ${4|absent,present,list|} # not required. choices: absent;present;list. absent - tags should not exist,,present - tags should exist,,list - list current tags.
tags: ${5:null} # not required. tags - list of dictionaries, each includes 'name' and 'category' keys.,required if state is present or absent.
manageiq_user:
userid: ${1:undefined} # required. The unique userid in manageiq, often mentioned as username.
manageiq_connection: ${2:undefined} # required. ManageIQ connection configuration information.
email: ${3:null} # not required. The users' E-mail address.
group: ${4:null} # not required. The name of the group to which the user belongs.
password: ${5:null} # not required. The users' password.
state: ${6|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. absent - user should not exist, present - user should be.
update_password: ${7|always,on_create|} # not required. choices: always;on_create. C(always) will update passwords unconditionally.  C(on_create) will only set the password for a newly created user.
name: ${8:null} # not required. The users' full name.
mattermost:

api_key: ${1:undefined} # required. Mattermost webhook api key. Log into your mattermost site, go to Menu -> Integration -> Incoming Webhook -> Add Incoming Webhook. This will give you full URL. api_key is the last part. http://mattermost.example.com/hooks/C(API_KEY)
text: ${2:undefined} # required. Text to send. Note that the module does not handle escaping characters.
url: ${3:undefined} # required. Mattermost url (i.e. http://mattermost.yourcompany.com).
validate_certs: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
channel: ${5:undefined} # not required. Channel to send the message to. If absent, the message goes to the channel selected for the I(api_key).
username: ${6:Ansible} # not required. This is the sender of the message (Username Override need to be enabled by mattermost admin, see mattermost doc.
icon_url: ${7:https://www.ansible.com/favicon.ico} # not required. Url for the message sender's icon.

maven_artifact.description: Downloads an Artifact from a Maven Repository
body: maven_artifact:
group_id: ${1:undefined} # required. The Maven groupId coordinate
artifact_id: ${2:undefined} # required. The maven artifactId coordinate
dest: ${3:false} # required. The path where the artifact should be written to,If file mode or ownerships are specified and destination path already exists, they affect the downloaded file
state: ${4|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. The desired state of the artifact
validate_certs: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be set to C(no) when no other option exists.
selevel: ${6:s0} # not required. Level part of the SELinux file context. This is the MLS/MCS attribute, sometimes known as the C(range). C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
version: ${7:latest} # not required. The maven version coordinate
owner: ${8:null} # not required. Name of the user that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).
seuser: ${9:null} # not required. User part of SELinux file context. Will default to system policy, if applicable. If set to C(_default), it will use the C(user) portion of the policy if available.
group: ${10:null} # not required. Name of the group that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).
repository_url: ${11:http://repo1.maven.org/maven2} # not required. The URL of the Maven Repository to download from.,Use s3://... if the repository is hosted on Amazon S3, added in version 2.2.
classifier: ${12:null} # not required. The maven classifier coordinate
password: ${13:null} # not required. The password to authenticate with to the Maven Repository. Use AWS secret access key of the repository is hosted on S3
extension: ${14:jar} # not required. The maven type/extension coordinate
serole: ${15:null} # not required. Role part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
setype: ${16:null} # not required. Type part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

mode: ${17:null} # not required. Mode the file or directory should be. For those used to I(/usr/bin/chmod) remember that modes are actually octal numbers (like C(0644) or C(01777)). Leaving off the leading zero will likely have unexpected results. As of version 1.8, the mode may be specified as a symbolic mode (for example, C(u+rwx) or C(u=rw,g=r,o=r)).

keep_name: ${18|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(yes), the downloaded artifact's name is preserved, i.e the version number remains part of it.,This option only has effect when C(dest) is a directory and C(version) is set to C(latest).

attributes: ${19:None} # not required. Attributes the file or directory should have. To get supported flags look at the man page for I(chattr) on the target system. This string should contain the attributes in the same order as the one displayed by I(lsattr).
timeout: ${20:10} # not required. Specifies a timeout in seconds for the connection attempt
username: ${21:null} # not required. The username to authenticate as to the Maven Repository. Use AWS secret key of the repository is hosted on S3

unsafe_writes: ${22:false} # not required. Normally this module uses atomic operations to prevent data corruption or inconsistent reads from the target files, sometimes systems are configured or just broken in ways that prevent this. One example are docker mounted files, they cannot be updated atomically and can only be done in an unsafe manner.,This boolean option allows ansible to fall back to unsafe methods of updating files for those cases in which you do not have any other choice. Be aware that this is subject to race conditions and can lead to data corruption.
meta:

free_form: ${1|noop,flush_handlers,refresh_inventory,clear_facts,clear_host_errors,end_play,reset_connection|} # required. choices: noop;flush_handlers;refresh_inventory;clear_facts;clear_host_errors;end_play;reset_connection. This module takes a free form command, as a string. There's not an actual option named "free form".  See the examples!,C(flush_handlers) makes Ansible run any handler tasks which have thus far been notified. Ansible inserts these tasks internally at certain points to implicitly trigger handler runs (after pre/post tasks, the final role execution, and the main tasks section of your plays).
,C(refresh_inventory) (added in 2.0) forces the reload of the inventory, which in the case of dynamic inventory scripts means they will be re-executed. This is mainly useful when additional hosts are created and users wish to use them instead of using the `add_host` module."
,C(noop) (added in 2.0) This literally does 'nothing'. It is mainly used internally and not recommended for general use.,C(clear_facts) (added in 2.1) causes the gathered facts for the hosts specified in the play's list of hosts to be cleared, including the fact cache.,C(clear_host_errors) (added in 2.1) clears the failed state (if any) from hosts specified in the play's list of hosts.,C(end_play) (added in 2.2) causes the play to end without failing the host.,C(reset_connection) (added in 2.3) interrupts a persistent connection (i.e. ssh + control persist)
mksysb:
storage_path: ${1:undefined} # required. Storage path where the mksysb will stored.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Backup name
extended_attrs: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Backup extended attributes.
new_image_data: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Creates a new file data.
create_map_files: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Creates a new MAP files.
use_snapshot: ${6|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Creates backup using snapshots.
backup_dmapi_fs: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Back up DMAPI filesystem files.
exclude_files: ${8|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Excludes files using C(/etc/rootvg.exclude).
backup_crypt_files: ${9|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Backup encrypted files.
software_packing: ${10|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Exclude files from packing option listed in C(/etc/exclude_packing.rootvg).
exclude_wpar_files: ${11|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Excludes WPAR files.
modprobe:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of kernel module to manage.
params: ${2:} # not required. Modules parameters.
state: ${3|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Whether the module should be present or absent.

mongodb_parameter.description: Change an administrative parameter on a MongoDB server.
body: mongodb_parameter:
value: ${1:undefined} # required. MongoDB administrative parameter value to set
param: ${2:undefined} # required. MongoDB administrative parameter to modify
database: ${3:undefined} # required. The name of the database to add/remove the user from
login_port: ${4:27017} # not required. The port to connect to
login_database: ${5:null} # not required. The database where login credentials are stored
ssl: ${6:false} # not required. Whether to use an SSL connection when connecting to the database
replica_set: ${7:null} # not required. Replica set to connect to (automatically connects to primary for writes)
param_type: ${8:str} # not required. Define the parameter value (str, int)
login_host: ${9:localhost} # not required. The host running the database
login_user: ${10:null} # not required. The username used to authenticate with
login_password: ${11:null} # not required. The password used to authenticate with

mongodb_user.description: Adds or removes a user from a MongoDB database.
body: mongodb_user:
database: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the database to add/remove the user from
name: ${2:null} # required. The name of the user to add or remove
login_port: ${3:27017} # not required. The port to connect to
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The database user state
password: ${5:null} # not required. The password to use for the user
login_password: ${6:null} # not required. The password used to authenticate with

roles: ${7:readWrite} # not required. The database user roles valid values could either be one or more of the following strings: 'read', 'readWrite', 'dbAdmin', 'userAdmin', 'clusterAdmin', 'readAnyDatabase', 'readWriteAnyDatabase', 'userAdminAnyDatabase', 'dbAdminAnyDatabase'
,Or the following dictionary '{ db: DATABASE_NAME, role: ROLE_NAME }'.,This param requires pymongo 2.5+. If it is a string, mongodb 2.4+ is also required. If it is a dictionary, mongo 2.6+  is required.
replica_set: ${8:null} # not required. Replica set to connect to (automatically connects to primary for writes)

ssl_cert_reqs: ${9|CERT_REQUIRED,CERT_OPTIONAL,CERT_NONE|} # not required. choices: CERT_REQUIRED;CERT_OPTIONAL;CERT_NONE. Specifies whether a certificate is required from the other side of the connection, and whether it will be validated if provided.
ssl: ${10:false} # not required. Whether to use an SSL connection when connecting to the database
login_host: ${11:localhost} # not required. The host running the database
login_user: ${12:null} # not required. The username used to authenticate with
login_database: ${13:null} # not required. The database where login credentials are stored
update_password: ${14|always,on_create|} # not required. choices: always;on_create. C(always) will update passwords if they differ.  C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users.

monit.description: Manage the state of a program monitored via Monit
body: monit:
state: ${1|present,started,stopped,restarted,monitored,unmonitored,reloaded|} # required. choices: present;started;stopped;restarted;monitored;unmonitored;reloaded. The state of service
name: ${2:null} # required. The name of the I(monit) program/process to manage

timeout: ${3:300} # not required. If there are pending actions for the service monitored by monit, then Ansible will check for up to this many seconds to verify the requested action has been performed. Ansible will sleep for five seconds between each check.

mount.description: Control active and configured mount points
body: mount:

state: ${1|absent,mounted,present,unmounted|} # required. choices: absent;mounted;present;unmounted. If C(mounted), the device will be actively mounted and appropriately configured in I(fstab). If the mount point is not present, the mount point will be created.,If C(unmounted), the device will be unmounted without changing I(fstab).,C(present) only specifies that the device is to be configured in I(fstab) and does not trigger or require a mount.,C(absent) specifies that the device mount's entry will be removed from I(fstab) and will also unmount the device and remove the mount point.
path: ${2:undefined} # required. Path to the mount point (e.g. C(/mnt/files)).,Before 2.3 this option was only usable as I(dest), I(destfile) and I(name).

dump: ${3:0} # not required. Dump (see fstab(5)). Note that if set to C(null) and I(state) set to C(present), it will cease to work and duplicate entries will be made with subsequent runs.,Has no effect on Solaris systems.
backup: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.
fstype: ${5:undefined} # not required. Filesystem type. Required when I(state) is C(present) or C(mounted).

fstab: ${6:/etc/fstab (/etc/vfstab on Solaris)} # not required. File to use instead of C(/etc/fstab). You shouldn't use this option unless you really know what you are doing. This might be useful if you need to configure mountpoints in a chroot environment.  OpenBSD does not allow specifying alternate fstab files with mount so do not use this on OpenBSD with any state that operates on the live filesystem.

passno: ${7:0} # not required. Passno (see fstab(5)). Note that if set to C(null) and I(state) set to C(present), it will cease to work and duplicate entries will be made with subsequent runs.,Deprecated on Solaris systems.
src: ${8:undefined} # not required. Device to be mounted on I(path). Required when I(state) set to C(present) or C(mounted).
opts: ${9:undefined} # not required. Mount options (see fstab(5), or vfstab(4) on Solaris).
boot: ${10:yes} # not required. Determines if the filesystem should be mounted on boot.,Only applies to Solaris systems.

mqtt.description: Publish a message on an MQTT topic for the IoT
body: mqtt:

payload: ${1:null} # required. Payload. The special string C("None") may be used to send a NULL (i.e. empty) payload which is useful to simply notify with the I(topic) or to clear previously retained messages.
topic: ${2:null} # required. MQTT topic name

retain: ${3:false} # not required. Setting this flag causes the broker to retain (i.e. keep) the message so that applications that subsequently subscribe to the topic can received the last retained message immediately.

keyfile: ${4:None} # not required. The path pointing to the PEM encoded client private key. If this is not None it will be used as client information for TLS based authentication. Support for this feature is broker dependent.
server: ${5:localhost} # not required. MQTT broker address/name
password: ${6:undefined} # not required. Password for C(username) to authenticate against the broker.
port: ${7:1883} # not required. MQTT broker port number

certfile: ${8:None} # not required. The path pointing to the PEM encoded client certificate. If this is not None it will be used as client information for TLS based authentication. Support for this feature is broker dependent.
qos: ${9|0,1,2|} # not required. choices: 0;1;2. QoS (Quality of Service)

ca_certs: ${10:None} # not required. The path to the Certificate Authority certificate files that are to be treated as trusted by this client. If this is the only option given then the client will operate in a similar manner to a web browser. That is to say it will require the broker to have a certificate signed by the Certificate Authorities in ca_certs and will communicate using TLS v1, but will not attempt any form of authentication. This provides basic network encryption but may not be sufficient depending on how the broker is configured.
username: ${11:undefined} # not required. Username to authenticate against the broker.
client_id: ${12:hostname + pid} # not required. MQTT client identifier

mssql_db.description: Add or remove MSSQL databases from a remote host.
body: mssql_db:
name: ${1:null} # required. name of the database to add or remove
login_port: ${2:1433} # not required. Port of the MSSQL server. Requires login_host be defined as other then localhost if login_port is used
login_password: ${3:null} # not required. The password used to authenticate with

autocommit: ${4|false,true|} # not required. choices: false;true. Automatically commit the change only if the import succeed. Sometimes it is necessary to use autocommit=true, since some content can't be changed within a transaction.
target: ${5:undefined} # not required. Location, on the remote host, of the dump file to read from or write to. Uncompressed SQL files (C(.sql)) files are supported.
login_host: ${6:undefined} # not required. Host running the database
login_user: ${7:null} # not required. The username used to authenticate with
state: ${8|present,absent,import|} # not required. choices: present;absent;import. The database state

mysql_db.description: Add or remove MySQL databases from a remote host.
body: mysql_db:

name: ${1:null} # required. name of the database to add or remove,name=all May only be provided if I(state) is C(dump) or C(import).,if name=all Works like --all-databases option for mysqldump (Added in 2.0)
quick: ${2:true} # not required. Option used for dumping large tables
single_transaction: ${3:false} # not required. Execute the dump in a single transaction
login_password: ${4:null} # not required. The password used to authenticate with.
ssl_cert: ${5:null} # not required. The path to a client public key certificate.
login_port: ${6:3306} # not required. Port of the MySQL server. Requires I(login_host) be defined as other then localhost if login_port is used.
ssl_ca: ${7:null} # not required. The path to a Certificate Authority (CA) certificate. This option, if used, must specify the same certificate as used by the server.
login_unix_socket: ${8:null} # not required. The path to a Unix domain socket for local connections.

target: ${9:undefined} # not required. Location, on the remote host, of the dump file to read from or write to. Uncompressed SQL files (C(.sql)) as well as bzip2 (C(.bz2)), gzip (C(.gz)) and xz (Added in 2.0) compressed files are supported.
collation: ${10:null} # not required. Collation mode (sorting). This only applies to new table/databases and does not update existing ones, this is a limitation of MySQL.
ssl_key: ${11:null} # not required. The path to the client private key.
login_user: ${12:null} # not required. The username used to authenticate with.
encoding: ${13:null} # not required. Encoding mode to use, examples include C(utf8) or C(latin1_swedish_ci)
connect_timeout: ${14:30} # not required. The connection timeout when connecting to the MySQL server.
state: ${15|present,absent,dump,import|} # not required. choices: present;absent;dump;import. The database state
config_file: ${16:~/.my.cnf} # not required. Specify a config file from which user and password are to be read.
login_host: ${17:localhost} # not required. Host running the database.
mysql_replication:
master_user: ${1:undefined} # not required. same as mysql variable
master_ssl_cipher: ${2:undefined} # not required. same as mysql variable
relay_log_file: ${3:undefined} # not required. same as mysql variable
login_port: ${4:3306} # not required. Port of the MySQL server. Requires I(login_host) be defined as other then localhost if login_port is used.
master_connect_retry: ${5:undefined} # not required. same as mysql variable
master_port: ${6:undefined} # not required. same as mysql variable
master_ssl_key: ${7:undefined} # not required. same as mysql variable
login_user: ${8:null} # not required. The username used to authenticate with.
connect_timeout: ${9:30} # not required. The connection timeout when connecting to the MySQL server.
login_unix_socket: ${10:null} # not required. The path to a Unix domain socket for local connections.
config_file: ${11:~/.my.cnf} # not required. Specify a config file from which user and password are to be read.
ssl_cert: ${12:null} # not required. The path to a client public key certificate.
master_log_file: ${13:undefined} # not required. same as mysql variable
master_ssl_cert: ${14:undefined} # not required. same as mysql variable
master_ssl: ${15|0,1|} # not required. choices: 0;1. same as mysql variable
master_ssl_ca: ${16:undefined} # not required. same as mysql variable
master_host: ${17:undefined} # not required. same as mysql variable
master_auto_position: ${18:null} # not required. does the host uses GTID based replication or not
ssl_ca: ${19:null} # not required. The path to a Certificate Authority (CA) certificate. This option, if used, must specify the same certificate as used by the server.
relay_log_pos: ${20:undefined} # not required. same as mysql variable
ssl_key: ${21:null} # not required. The path to the client private key.
master_password: ${22:undefined} # not required. same as mysql variable

mode: ${23|getslave,getmaster,changemaster,stopslave,startslave,resetslave,resetslaveall|} # not required. choices: getslave;getmaster;changemaster;stopslave;startslave;resetslave;resetslaveall. module operating mode. Could be getslave (SHOW SLAVE STATUS), getmaster (SHOW MASTER STATUS), changemaster (CHANGE MASTER TO), startslave (START SLAVE), stopslave (STOP SLAVE), resetslave (RESET SLAVE), resetslaveall (RESET SLAVE ALL)
master_log_pos: ${24:undefined} # not required. same as mysql variable
login_host: ${25:localhost} # not required. Host running the database.
login_password: ${26:null} # not required. The password used to authenticate with.
master_ssl_capath: ${27:undefined} # not required. same as mysql variable

mysql_user.description: Adds or removes a user from a MySQL database.
body: mysql_user:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. name of the user (role) to add or remove
login_port: ${2:3306} # not required. Port of the MySQL server. Requires I(login_host) be defined as other then localhost if login_port is used.
host: ${3:localhost} # not required. the 'host' part of the MySQL username
ssl_cert: ${4:null} # not required. The path to a client public key certificate.

priv: ${5:null} # not required. MySQL privileges string in the format: C(db.table:priv1,priv2).,Multiple privileges can be specified by separating each one using a forward slash: C(db.table:priv/db.table:priv).,The format is based on MySQL C(GRANT) statement.,Database and table names can be quoted, MySQL-style.,If column privileges are used, the C(priv1,priv2) part must be exactly as returned by a C(SHOW GRANT) statement. If not followed, the module will always report changes. It includes grouping columns by permission (C(SELECT(col1,col2)) instead of C(SELECT(col1),SELECT(col2))).
password: ${6:null} # not required. set the user's password.
host_all: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. override the host option, making ansible apply changes to all hostnames for a given user.  This option cannot be used when creating users
config_file: ${8:~/.my.cnf} # not required. Specify a config file from which user and password are to be read.
login_password: ${9:null} # not required. The password used to authenticate with.
encrypted: ${10|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Indicate that the 'password' field is a `mysql_native_password` hash
check_implicit_admin: ${11|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Check if mysql allows login as root/nopassword before trying supplied credentials.
ssl_ca: ${12:null} # not required. The path to a Certificate Authority (CA) certificate. This option, if used, must specify the same certificate as used by the server.
login_unix_socket: ${13:null} # not required. The path to a Unix domain socket for local connections.
ssl_key: ${14:null} # not required. The path to the client private key.
login_host: ${15:localhost} # not required. Host running the database.
login_user: ${16:null} # not required. The username used to authenticate with.
append_privs: ${17|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Append the privileges defined by priv to the existing ones for this user instead of overwriting existing ones.
sql_log_bin: ${18|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether binary logging should be enabled or disabled for the connection.
connect_timeout: ${19:30} # not required. The connection timeout when connecting to the MySQL server.
state: ${20|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the user should exist.  When C(absent), removes the user.
update_password: ${21|always,on_create|} # not required. choices: always;on_create. C(always) will update passwords if they differ.  C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users.
mysql_variables:
variable: ${1:undefined} # required. Variable name to operate
login_port: ${2:3306} # not required. Port of the MySQL server. Requires I(login_host) be defined as other then localhost if login_port is used.
ssl_cert: ${3:null} # not required. The path to a client public key certificate.
value: ${4:undefined} # not required. If set, then sets variable value to this
ssl_ca: ${5:null} # not required. The path to a Certificate Authority (CA) certificate. This option, if used, must specify the same certificate as used by the server.
login_unix_socket: ${6:null} # not required. The path to a Unix domain socket for local connections.
ssl_key: ${7:null} # not required. The path to the client private key.
login_user: ${8:null} # not required. The username used to authenticate with.
connect_timeout: ${9:30} # not required. The connection timeout when connecting to the MySQL server.
login_password: ${10:null} # not required. The password used to authenticate with.
config_file: ${11:~/.my.cnf} # not required. Specify a config file from which user and password are to be read.
login_host: ${12:localhost} # not required. Host running the database.
na_cdot_aggregate:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. Password for the specified user.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Whether the specified aggregate should exist or not.

username: ${3:undefined} # required. This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://goo.gl/BRu78Z).
name: ${4:undefined} # required. The name of the aggregate to manage.
hostname: ${5:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.

disk_count: ${6:undefined} # not required. Number of disks to place into the aggregate, including parity disks.,The disks in this newly-created aggregate come from the spare disk pool.,The smallest disks in this pool join the aggregate first, unless the C(disk-size) argument is provided.,Either C(disk-count) or C(disks) must be supplied. Range [0..2^31-1].,Required when C(state=present).

na_cdot_license.description: Manage NetApp cDOT protocol and feature licenses
body: na_cdot_license:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. Password for the specified user.

username: ${2:undefined} # required. This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://goo.gl/BRu78Z).
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.
remove_expired: ${4|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Remove licenses that have expired in the cluster.
licenses: ${5:undefined} # not required. List of licenses to add or remove.,Please note that trying to remove a non-existent license will throw an error.

serial_number: ${6:None} # not required. Serial number of the node associated with the license.,This parameter is used primarily when removing license for a specific service.,If this parameter is not provided, the cluster serial number is used by default.
remove_unused: ${7|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Remove licenses that have no controller affiliation in the cluster.
na_cdot_lun:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. Password for the specified user.
vserver: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the vserver to use.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Whether the specified lun should exist or not.

username: ${4:undefined} # required. This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://goo.gl/BRu78Z).
hostname: ${5:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.
name: ${6:undefined} # required. The name of the lun to manage.
size_unit: ${7|bytes,b,kb,mb,gb,tb,pb,eb,zb,yb|} # not required. choices: bytes;b;kb;mb;gb;tb;pb;eb;zb;yb. The unit used to interpret the size parameter.
size: ${8:undefined} # not required. The size of the lun in C(size_unit).,Required when C(state=present).
force_resize: ${9:false} # not required. Forcibly reduce the size. This is required for reducing the size of the LUN to avoid accidentally reducing the LUN size.
flexvol_name: ${10:undefined} # not required. The name of the FlexVol the lun should exist on.,Required when C(state=present).
force_remove: ${11:false} # not required. If "true", override checks that prevent a LUN from being destroyed if it is online and mapped.,If "false", destroying an online and mapped LUN will fail.

force_remove_fenced: ${12:false} # not required. If "true", override checks that prevent a LUN from being destroyed while it is fenced.,If "false", attempting to destroy a fenced LUN will fail.,The default if not specified is "false". This field is available in Data ONTAP 8.2 and later.
na_cdot_qtree:

username: ${1:undefined} # required. This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://goo.gl/BRu78Z).
password: ${2:undefined} # required. Password for the specified user.
vserver: ${3:undefined} # required. The name of the vserver to use.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Whether the specified Qtree should exist or not.
name: ${5:undefined} # required. The name of the Qtree to manage.
hostname: ${6:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.
flexvol_name: ${7:undefined} # not required. The name of the FlexVol the Qtree should exist on. Required when C(state=present).
na_cdot_svm:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. Password for the specified user.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Whether the specified SVM should exist or not.

username: ${3:undefined} # required. This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://goo.gl/BRu78Z).
name: ${4:undefined} # required. The name of the SVM to manage.
hostname: ${5:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.

root_volume_security_style: ${6|unix,ntfs,mixed,unified|} # not required. choices: unix;ntfs;mixed;unified. Security Style of the root volume.,When specified as part of the vserver-create, this field represents the security style for the Vserver root volume.,When specified as part of vserver-get-iter call, this will return the list of matching Vservers.,Possible values are 'unix', 'ntfs', 'mixed'.,The 'unified' security style, which applies only to Infinite Volumes, cannot be applied to a Vserver's root volume.,Valid options are "unix" for NFS, "ntfs" for CIFS, "mixed" for Mixed, "unified" for Unified.,Required when C(state=present)
root_volume_aggregate: ${7:undefined} # not required. The aggregate on which the root volume will be created.,Required when C(state=present).
root_volume: ${8:undefined} # not required. Root volume of the SVM. Required when C(state=present).
na_cdot_user:

authentication_method: ${1|community,password,publickey,domain,nsswitch,usm|} # required. choices: community;password;publickey;domain;nsswitch;usm. Authentication method for the application.,Not all authentication methods are valid for an application.,Valid authentication methods for each application are as denoted in I(authentication_choices_description).,password for console application,password, domain, nsswitch, cert for http application.,password, domain, nsswitch, cert for ontapi application.,community for snmp application (when creating SNMPv1 and SNMPv2 users).,usm and community for snmp application (when creating SNMPv3 users).,password for sp application.,password for rsh application.,password for telnet application.,password, publickey, domain, nsswitch for ssh application.
application: ${2|console,http,ontapi,rsh,snmp,sp,ssh,telnet|} # required. choices: console;http;ontapi;rsh;snmp;sp;ssh;telnet. Applications to grant access to.
vserver: ${3:undefined} # required. The name of the vserver to use.
password: ${4:undefined} # required. Password for the specified user.
state: ${5|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Whether the specified user should exist or not.

username: ${6:undefined} # required. This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://goo.gl/BRu78Z).
name: ${7:undefined} # required. The name of the user to manage.
hostname: ${8:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.
role_name: ${9:undefined} # not required. The name of the role. Required when C(state=present)

set_password: ${10:None} # not required. Password for the user account.,It is ignored for creating snmp users, but is required for creating non-snmp users.,For an existing user, this value will be used as the new password.
na_cdot_user_role:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. Password for the specified user.
vserver: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the vserver to use.
command_directory_name: ${3:undefined} # required. The command or command directory to which the role has an access.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Whether the specified user should exist or not.

username: ${5:undefined} # required. This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://goo.gl/BRu78Z).
name: ${6:undefined} # required. The name of the role to manage.
hostname: ${7:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.
access_level: ${8|none,readonly,all|} # not required. choices: none;readonly;all. The name of the role to manage.
na_cdot_volume:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. Password for the specified user.
vserver: ${2:None} # required. Name of the vserver to use.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Whether the specified volume should exist or not.

username: ${4:undefined} # required. This can be a Cluster-scoped or SVM-scoped account, depending on whether a Cluster-level or SVM-level API is required. For more information, please read the documentation U(https://goo.gl/BRu78Z).
name: ${5:undefined} # required. The name of the volume to manage.
hostname: ${6:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the ONTAP instance.
aggregate_name: ${7:undefined} # not required. The name of the aggregate the flexvol should exist on. Required when C(state=present).
size_unit: ${8|bytes,b,kb,mb,gb,tb,pb,eb,zb,yb|} # not required. choices: bytes;b;kb;mb;gb;tb;pb;eb;zb;yb. The unit used to interpret the size parameter.
infinite: ${9|True,False|} # not required. choices: True;False. Set True if the volume is an Infinite Volume.
size: ${10:undefined} # not required. The size of the volume in (size_unit). Required when C(state=present).
online: ${11|True,False|} # not required. choices: True;False. Whether the specified volume is online, or not.

nagios.description: Perform common tasks in Nagios related to downtime and notifications.
body: nagios:

action: ${1|downtime,delete_downtime,enable_alerts,disable_alerts,silence,unsilence,silence_nagios,unsilence_nagios,command,servicegroup_service_downtime,servicegroup_host_downtime|} # required. choices: downtime;delete_downtime;enable_alerts;disable_alerts;silence;unsilence;silence_nagios;unsilence_nagios;command;servicegroup_service_downtime;servicegroup_host_downtime. Action to take.,servicegroup options were added in 2.0.,delete_downtime options were added in 2.2.
command: ${2:undefined} # required. The raw command to send to nagios, which should not include the submitted time header or the line-feed B(Required) option when using the C(command) action.

services: ${3:undefined} # required. What to manage downtime/alerts for. Separate multiple services with commas. C(service) is an alias for C(services). B(Required) option when using the C(downtime), C(enable_alerts), and C(disable_alerts) actions.
author: ${4:Ansible} # not required. Author to leave downtime comments as. Only usable with the C(downtime) action.
cmdfile: ${5:auto-detected} # not required. Path to the nagios I(command file) (FIFO pipe). Only required if auto-detection fails.
comment: ${6:Scheduling downtime} # not required. Comment for C(downtime) action.

servicegroup: ${7:undefined} # not required. The Servicegroup we want to set downtimes/alerts for. B(Required) option when using the C(servicegroup_service_downtime) amd C(servicegroup_host_downtime).
host: ${8:null} # not required. Host to operate on in Nagios.
minutes: ${9:30} # not required. Minutes to schedule downtime for.,Only usable with the C(downtime) action.
nclu:
atomic: ${1:false} # not required. When true, equivalent to both I(commit) and I(abort) being true. Mutually exclusive with I(commit) and I(atomic).
description: ${2:Ansible-originated commit} # not required. Commit description that will be recorded to the commit log if I(commit) or I(atomic) are true.
abort: ${3:false} # not required. Boolean. When true, perform a 'net abort' before the block. This cleans out any uncommitted changes in the buffer. Mutually exclusive with I(atomic).

template: ${4:undefined} # not required. A single, multi-line string with jinja2 formatting. This string will be broken by lines, and each line will be run through net. Mutually exclusive with I(commands).
commands: ${5:undefined} # not required. A list of strings containing the net commands to run. Mutually exclusive with I(template).
commit: ${6:false} # not required. When true, performs a 'net commit' at the end of the block. Mutually exclusive with I(atomic).

net_banner.description: Manage multiline banners on network devices
body: net_banner:
banner: ${1|login,motd|} # required. choices: login;motd. Specifies which banner that should be configured on the remote device.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specifies whether or not the configuration is present in the current devices active running configuration.

text: ${3:null} # not required. The banner text that should be present in the remote device running configuration.  This argument accepts a multiline string, with no empty lines. Requires I(state=present).
net_interface:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the Interface.
description: ${2:undefined} # not required. Description of Interface.

tx_rate: ${3:undefined} # not required. Transmit rate in bits per second (bps).,This is state check parameter only.,Supports conditionals, see L(Conditionals in Networking Modules,../network/user_guide/network_working_with_command_output.html)

delay: ${4:10} # not required. Time in seconds to wait before checking for the operational state on remote device. This wait is applicable for operational state argument which are I(state) with values C(up)/C(down), I(tx_rate) and I(rx_rate).
mtu: ${5:undefined} # not required. Maximum size of transmit packet.
duplex: ${6|full,half,auto|} # not required. choices: full;half;auto. Interface link status
enabled: ${7:undefined} # not required. Configure interface link status.
speed: ${8:undefined} # not required. Interface link speed.

rx_rate: ${9:undefined} # not required. Receiver rate in bits per second (bps).,This is state check parameter only.,Supports conditionals, see L(Conditionals in Networking Modules,../network/user_guide/network_working_with_command_output.html)
