Shuts down all protocols, vPC domains, and interfaces except the management interface (using the shutdown command). This option is disruptive while C(system_mode_maintenance) (which uses the isolate command) is not.
system_mode_maintenance_timeout: ${4:null} # not required. Keeps the switch in maintenance mode for a specified number of minutes. Range is 5-65535.

provider: ${5:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

system_mode_maintenance_on_reload_reset_reason: ${6|hw_error,svc_failure,kern_failure,wdog_timeout,fatal_error,lc_failure,match_any,manual_reload|} # not required. choices: hw_error;svc_failure;kern_failure;wdog_timeout;fatal_error;lc_failure;match_any;manual_reload. Boots the switch into maintenance mode automatically in the event of a specified system crash.

system_mode_maintenance_dont_generate_profile: ${7|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. When C(system_mode_maintenance_dont_generate_profile=true) it prevents the dynamic searching of enabled protocols and executes commands configured in a maintenance-mode profile. Use this option if you want the system to use a maintenance-mode profile that you have created. When C(system_mode_maintenance_dont_generate_profile=false) it prevents the dynamic searching of enabled protocols and executes commands configured in a normal-mode profile. Use this option if you want the system to use a normal-mode profile that you have created.

nxos_gir_profile_management.description: Create a maintenance-mode or normal-mode profile for GIR.
body: nxos_gir_profile_management:
mode: ${1|maintenance,normal|} # required. choices: maintenance;normal. Configure the profile as Maintenance or Normal mode.
commands: ${2:null} # not required. List of commands to be included into the profile.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.

provider: ${4:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

nxos_hsrp.description: Manages HSRP configuration on NX-OS switches.
body: nxos_hsrp:
interface: ${1:undefined} # required. Full name of interface that is being managed for HSRP.
group: ${2:undefined} # required. HSRP group number.
vip: ${3:null} # not required. HSRP virtual IP address.

provider: ${4:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
auth_string: ${5:null} # not required. Authentication string.
preempt: ${6|enabled,disabled|} # not required. choices: enabled;disabled. Enable/Disable preempt.
priority: ${7:null} # not required. HSRP priority.
version: ${8|1,2|} # not required. choices: 1;2. HSRP version.
state: ${9|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.
auth_type: ${10|text,md5|} # not required. choices: text;md5. Authentication type.
nxos_igmp:
enforce_rtr_alert: ${1|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Enables or disables the enforce router alert option check for IGMPv2 and IGMPv3 packets.

provider: ${2:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
state: ${3|present,default|} # not required. choices: present;default. Manages desired state of the resource.
flush_routes: ${4|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Removes routes when the IGMP process is restarted. By default, routes are not flushed.
restart: ${5|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Restarts the igmp process (using an exec config command).
nxos_igmp_interface:
interface: ${1:undefined} # required. The full interface name for IGMP configuration. e.g. I(Ethernet1/2).

provider: ${2:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
group_timeout: ${3:null} # not required. Sets the group membership timeout for IGMPv2. Values can range from 3 to 65,535 seconds. The default is 260 seconds.
version: ${4|2,3|} # not required. choices: 2;3. IGMP version. It can be 2 or 3.
startup_query_interval: ${5:null} # not required. Query interval used when the IGMP process starts up. The range is from 1 to 18000. The default is 31.

querier_timeout: ${6:null} # not required. Sets the querier timeout that the software uses when deciding to take over as the querier. Values can range from 1 to 65535 seconds. The default is 255 seconds.
startup_query_count: ${7:null} # not required. Query count used when the IGMP process starts up. The range is from 1 to 10. The default is 2.

immediate_leave: ${8|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Enables the device to remove the group entry from the multicast routing table immediately upon receiving a leave message for the group. Use this command to minimize the leave latency of IGMPv2 group memberships on a given IGMP interface because the device does not send group-specific queries. The default is disabled.

last_member_qrt: ${9:null} # not required. Sets the query interval waited after sending membership reports before the software deletes the group state. Values can range from 1 to 25 seconds. The default is 1 second.
restart: ${10|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Restart IGMP.
oif_source: ${11:null} # not required. Configure a source for static outgoing interface (OIF).
oif_prefix: ${12:null} # not required. Configure a prefix for static outgoing interface (OIF).
query_mrt: ${13:null} # not required. Sets the response time advertised in IGMP queries. Values can range from 1 to 25 seconds. The default is 10 seconds.

report_llg: ${14|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Configures report-link-local-groups. Enables sending reports for groups in 224.0.0.0/24. Reports are always sent for nonlink local groups. By default, reports are not sent for link local groups.
oif_routemap: ${15:null} # not required. Configure a routemap for static outgoing interface (OIF).
query_interval: ${16:null} # not required. Sets the frequency at which the software sends IGMP host query messages. Values can range from 1 to 18000 seconds. The default is 125 seconds.
last_member_query_count: ${17:null} # not required. Sets the number of times that the software sends an IGMP query in response to a host leave message. Values can range from 1 to 5. The default is 2.
state: ${18|present,default|} # not required. choices: present;default. Manages desired state of the resource.
robustness: ${19:null} # not required. Sets the robustness variable. Values can range from 1 to 7. The default is 2.
nxos_igmp_snooping:
report_supp: ${1:null} # not required. Global IGMPv1/IGMPv2 Report Suppression.
snooping: ${2|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Enables/disables IGMP snooping on the switch.
v3_report_supp: ${3|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Global IGMPv3 Report Suppression and Proxy Reporting.

provider: ${4:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
state: ${5|present,default|} # not required. choices: present;default. Manage the state of the resource.
link_local_grp_supp: ${6|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Global link-local groups suppression.
group_timeout: ${7:null} # not required. Group membership timeout value for all VLANs on the device. Accepted values are integer in range 1-10080, I(never) and I(default).

nxos_install_os.description: Set boot options like boot, kickstart image and issu.
body: nxos_install_os:
system_image_file: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the system (or combined) image file on flash.

provider: ${2:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
kickstart_image_file: ${3:null} # not required. Name of the kickstart image file on flash. (Not required on all Nexus platforms)

issu: ${4|required,desired,yes,no|} # not required. choices: required;desired;yes;no. Upgrade using In Service Software Upgrade (ISSU). (Only supported on N9k platforms),Selecting 'required' or 'yes' means that upgrades will only proceed if the switch is capable of ISSU.,Selecting 'desired' means that upgrades will use ISSU if possible but will fall back to disruptive upgrade if needed.,Selecting 'no' means do not use ISSU. Forced disruptive.
nxos_interface:
name: ${1:null} # required. Full name of interface, i.e. Ethernet1/1, port-channel10.
state: ${2|present,absent,default|} # required. choices: present;absent;default. Specify desired state of the resource.

tx_rate: ${3:undefined} # not required. Transmit rate in bits per second (bps).,This is state check parameter only.,Supports conditionals, see L(Conditionals in Networking Modules,../network/user_guide/network_working_with_command_output.html)

provider: ${4:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
ip_forward: ${5|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Enable/Disable ip forward feature on SVIs.

rx_rate: ${6:undefined} # not required. Receiver rate in bits per second (bps).,This is state check parameter only.,Supports conditionals, see L(Conditionals in Networking Modules,../network/user_guide/network_working_with_command_output.html)
aggregate: ${7:undefined} # not required. List of Interfaces definitions.
description: ${8:null} # not required. Interface description.
delay: ${9:10} # not required. Time in seconds to wait before checking for the operational state on remote device. This wait is applicable for operational state arguments.
mtu: ${10:undefined} # not required. MTU for a specific interface. Must be an even number between 576 and 9216. Applicable for ethernet interface only.
admin_state: ${11|up,down|} # not required. choices: up;down. Administrative state of the interface.
fabric_forwarding_anycast_gateway: ${12|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Associate SVI with anycast gateway under VLAN configuration mode. Applicable for SVI interface only.
duplex: ${13|full,half,auto|} # not required. choices: full;half;auto. Interface link status. Applicable for ethernet interface only.
interface_type: ${14|loopback,portchannel,svi,nve|} # not required. choices: loopback;portchannel;svi;nve. Interface type to be unconfigured from the device.
neighbors: ${15:undefined} # not required. Check the operational state of given interface C(name) for LLDP neighbor.,The following suboptions are available. This is state check parameter only.

mode: ${16|layer2,layer3|} # not required. choices: layer2;layer3. Manage Layer 2 or Layer 3 state of the interface. This option is supported for ethernet and portchannel interface. Applicable for ethernet and portchannel interface only.
speed: ${17:undefined} # not required. Interface link speed. Applicable for ethernet interface only.

nxos_interface_ospf.description: Manages configuration of an OSPF interface instance.
body: nxos_interface_ospf:
interface: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of this cisco_interface resource. Valid value is a string.
ospf: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the ospf instance.
area: ${3:undefined} # required. Ospf area associated with this cisco_interface_ospf instance. Valid values are a string, formatted as an IP address (i.e. "0.0.0.0") or as an integer.
hello_interval: ${4:null} # not required. Time between sending successive hello packets. Valid values are an integer or the keyword 'default'.

message_digest_encryption_type: ${5|cisco_type_7,3des,default|} # not required. choices: cisco_type_7;3des;default. Specifies the scheme used for encrypting message_digest_password. Valid values are '3des' or 'cisco_type_7' encryption or 'default'.
message_digest_password: ${6:null} # not required. Specifies the message_digest password. Valid value is a string.
passive_interface: ${7|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Setting to true will prevent this interface from receiving HELLO packets. Valid values are 'true' and 'false'.

provider: ${8:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
cost: ${9:null} # not required. The cost associated with this cisco_interface_ospf instance.

message_digest_key_id: ${10:null} # not required. Md5 authentication key-id associated with the ospf instance. If this is present, message_digest_encryption_type, message_digest_algorithm_type and message_digest_password are mandatory. Valid value is an integer and 'default'.
message_digest: ${11|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Enables or disables the usage of message digest authentication. Valid values are 'true' and 'false'.

message_digest_algorithm_type: ${12|md5,default|} # not required. choices: md5;default. Algorithm used for authentication among neighboring routers within an area. Valid values are 'md5' and 'default'.
state: ${13|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
dead_interval: ${14:null} # not required. Time interval an ospf neighbor waits for a hello packet before tearing down adjacencies. Valid values are an integer or the keyword 'default'.

nxos_ip_interface.description: Manages L3 attributes for IPv4 and IPv6 interfaces.
body: nxos_ip_interface:
interface: ${1:undefined} # required. Full name of interface, i.e. Ethernet1/1, vlan10.
mask: ${2:null} # not required. Subnet mask for IPv4 or IPv6 Address in decimal format.
dot1q: ${3:null} # not required. Configures IEEE 802.1Q VLAN encapsulation on the subinterface. The range is from 2 to 4093.

provider: ${4:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
addr: ${5:null} # not required. IPv4 or IPv6 Address.
version: ${6|v4,v6|} # not required. choices: v4;v6. Version of IP address. If the IP address is IPV4 version should be v4. If the IP address is IPV6 version should be v6.
allow_secondary: ${7:false} # not required. Allow to configure IPv4 secondary addresses on interface.
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.
tag: ${9:0} # not required. Route tag for IPv4 or IPv6 Address in integer format.

nxos_l2_interface.description: Manage Layer-2 interface on Cisco NXOS devices.
body: nxos_l2_interface:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Full name of the interface excluding any logical unit number, i.e. Ethernet1/1.
access_vlan: ${2:undefined} # not required. Configure given VLAN in access port. If C(mode=access), used as the access VLAN ID.
native_vlan: ${3:undefined} # not required. Native VLAN to be configured in trunk port. If C(mode=trunk), used as the trunk native VLAN ID.

provider: ${4:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
mode: ${5|access,trunk|} # not required. choices: access;trunk. Mode in which interface needs to be configured.
trunk_allowed_vlans: ${6:undefined} # not required. List of allowed VLANs in a given trunk port. If C(mode=trunk), these are the only VLANs that will be configured on the trunk, i.e. "2-10,15".
trunk_vlans: ${7:undefined} # not required. List of VLANs to be configured in trunk port. If C(mode=trunk), used as the VLAN range to ADD or REMOVE from the trunk.
state: ${8|present,absent,unconfigured|} # not required. choices: present;absent;unconfigured. Manage the state of the Layer-2 Interface configuration.
aggregate: ${9:undefined} # not required. List of Layer-2 interface definitions.

nxos_l3_interface.description: Manage L3 interfaces on Cisco NXOS network devices
body: nxos_l3_interface:
ipv4: ${1:undefined} # not required. IPv4 of the L3 interface.
ipv6: ${2:undefined} # not required. IPv6 of the L3 interface.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the L3 interface configuration.

provider: ${4:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
aggregate: ${5:undefined} # not required. List of L3 interfaces definitions.
name: ${6:undefined} # not required. Name of the L3 interface.

nxos_linkagg.description: Manage link aggregation groups on Cisco NXOS devices.
body: nxos_linkagg:
group: ${1:undefined} # required. Channel-group number for the port-channel Link aggregation group.
min_links: ${2:null} # not required. Minimum number of ports required up before bringing up the link aggregation group.
members: ${3:null} # not required. List of interfaces that will be managed in the link aggregation group.
force: ${4|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. When true it forces link aggregation group members to match what is declared in the members param. This can be used to remove members.
purge: ${5:false} # not required. Purge links not defined in the I(aggregate) parameter.

provider: ${6:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
mode: ${7|active,passive,on|} # not required. choices: active;passive;on. Mode for the link aggregation group.
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the link aggregation group.
aggregate: ${9:undefined} # not required. List of link aggregation definitions.

nxos_lldp.description: Manage LLDP configuration on Cisco NXOS network devices.
body: nxos_lldp:
state: ${1|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the LLDP configuration. If value is I(present) lldp will be enabled else if it is I(absent) it will be disabled.

provider: ${2:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
nxos_logging:
dest: ${1|console,logfile,module,monitor|} # not required. choices: console;logfile;module;monitor. Destination of the logs.
purge: ${2:false} # not required. Purge logging not defined in the aggregate parameter.

provider: ${3:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
facility: ${4:undefined} # not required. Facility name for logging.
state: ${5|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the logging configuration.
dest_level: ${6:undefined} # not required. Set logging severity levels.
aggregate: ${7:undefined} # not required. List of logging definitions.
name: ${8:undefined} # not required. If value of C(dest) is I(logfile) it indicates file-name.
facility_level: ${9:undefined} # not required. Set logging serverity levels for facility based log messages.

nxos_mtu.description: Manages MTU settings on Nexus switch.
body: nxos_mtu:

provider: ${1:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.
interface: ${3:null} # not required. Full name of interface, i.e. Ethernet1/1.
sysmtu: ${4:null} # not required. System jumbo MTU. Must be an even number between 576 and 9216.
mtu: ${5:null} # not required. MTU for a specific interface. Must be an even number between 576 and 9216.
nxos_ntp:
server: ${1:null} # not required. Network address of NTP server.
vrf_name: ${2:null} # not required. Makes the device communicate with the given NTP server or peer over a specific VRF.

provider: ${3:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
peer: ${4:null} # not required. Network address of NTP peer.
source_addr: ${5:null} # not required. Local source address from which NTP messages are sent.
prefer: ${6|enabled,disabled|} # not required. choices: enabled;disabled. Makes given NTP server or peer the preferred NTP server or peer for the device.
source_int: ${7:null} # not required. Local source interface from which NTP messages are sent. Must be fully qualified interface name.
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.
key_id: ${9:null} # not required. Authentication key identifier to use with given NTP server or peer.
nxos_ntp_auth:
key_id: ${1:undefined} # required. Authentication key identifier (numeric).
md5string: ${2:null} # required. MD5 String.

provider: ${3:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.
authentication: ${5|on,off|} # not required. choices: on;off. Turns NTP authentication on or off.
trusted_key: ${6|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Whether the given key is required to be supplied by a time source for the device to synchronize to the time source.
auth_type: ${7|text,encrypt|} # not required. choices: text;encrypt. Whether the given md5string is in cleartext or has been encrypted. If in cleartext, the device will encrypt it before storing it.
nxos_ntp_options:
stratum: ${1:null} # not required. If C(master=true), an optional stratum can be supplied (1-15). The device default is 8.
master: ${2|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Sets whether the device is an authoritative NTP server.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.

provider: ${4:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
logging: ${5|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Sets whether NTP logging is enabled on the device.

nxos_nxapi.description: Manage NXAPI configuration on an NXOS device.
body: nxos_nxapi:

http_port: ${1:80} # not required. Configure the port with which the HTTP server will listen on for requests.  By default, NXAPI will bind the HTTP service to the standard HTTP port 80.  This argument accepts valid port values in the range of 1 to 65535.

https_port: ${2:443} # not required. Configure the port with which the HTTPS server will listen on for requests.  By default, NXAPI will bind the HTTPS service to the standard HTTPS port 443.  This argument accepts valid port values in the range of 1 to 65535.

sandbox: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. The NXAPI feature provides a web base UI for developers for entering commands.  This feature is initially disabled when the NXAPI feature is configured for the first time.  When the C(sandbox) argument is set to True, the developer sandbox URL will accept requests and when the value is set to False, the sandbox URL is unavailable. This is supported on NX-OS 7K series.

http: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Controls the operating state of the HTTP protocol as one of the underlying transports for NXAPI.  By default, NXAPI will enable the HTTP transport when the feature is first configured.  To disable the use of the HTTP transport, set the value of this argument to False.

state: ${5|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The C(state) argument controls whether or not the NXAPI feature is configured on the remote device.  When the value is C(present) the NXAPI feature configuration is present in the device running-config.  When the values is C(absent) the feature configuration is removed from the running-config.

provider: ${6:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

https: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Controls the operating state of the HTTPS protocol as one of the underlying transports for NXAPI.  By default, NXAPI will disable the HTTPS transport when the feature is first configured.  To enable the use of the HTTPS transport, set the value of this argument to True.

nxos_ospf.description: Manages configuration of an ospf instance.
body: nxos_ospf:
ospf: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the ospf instance.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.

provider: ${3:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

nxos_ospf_vrf.description: Manages a VRF for an OSPF router.
body: nxos_ospf_vrf:
ospf: ${1:null} # required. Name of the OSPF instance.
default_metric: ${2:null} # not required. Specify the default Metric value. Valid values are an integer or the keyword 'default'.

timer_throttle_lsa_hold: ${3:null} # not required. Specify the hold interval for rate-limiting Link-State Advertisement (LSA) generation. Valid values are an integer, in milliseconds, or the keyword 'default'.
vrf: ${4:default} # not required. Name of the resource instance. Valid value is a string. The name 'default' is a valid VRF representing the global OSPF.
timer_throttle_spf_start: ${5:null} # not required. Specify initial Shortest Path First (SPF) schedule delay. Valid values are an integer, in milliseconds, or the keyword 'default'.

provider: ${6:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
router_id: ${7:null} # not required. Router Identifier (ID) of the OSPF router VRF instance.
auto_cost: ${8:null} # not required. Specifies the reference bandwidth used to assign OSPF cost. Valid values are an integer, in Mbps, or the keyword 'default'.
passive_interface: ${9|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Setting to true will suppress routing update on interface. Valid values are 'true' and 'false'.

timer_throttle_lsa_max: ${10:null} # not required. Specify the max interval for rate-limiting Link-State Advertisement (LSA) generation. Valid values are an integer, in milliseconds, or the keyword 'default'.

timer_throttle_spf_max: ${11:null} # not required. Specify the maximum wait time between Shortest Path First (SPF) calculations. Valid values are an integer, in milliseconds, or the keyword 'default'.

timer_throttle_lsa_start: ${12:null} # not required. Specify the start interval for rate-limiting Link-State Advertisement (LSA) generation. Valid values are an integer, in milliseconds, or the keyword 'default'.
state: ${13|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of ospf vrf configuration.
timer_throttle_spf_hold: ${14:null} # not required. Specify minimum hold time between Shortest Path First (SPF) calculations. Valid values are an integer, in milliseconds, or the keyword 'default'.

log_adjacency: ${15|log,detail,default|} # not required. choices: log;detail;default. Controls the level of log messages generated whenever a neighbor changes state. Valid values are 'log', 'detail', and 'default'.

nxos_overlay_global.description: Configures anycast gateway MAC of the switch.
body: nxos_overlay_global:
anycast_gateway_mac: ${1:null} # required. Anycast gateway mac of the switch.

provider: ${2:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

nxos_pim.description: Manages configuration of a PIM instance.
body: nxos_pim:

ssm_range: ${1:undefined} # required. Configure group ranges for Source Specific Multicast (SSM). Valid values are multicast addresses or the keyword C(none) or keyword C(default). C(none) removes all SSM group ranges. C(default) will set ssm_range to the default multicast address. If you set multicast address, please ensure that it is not the same as the C(default), otherwise use the C(default) option.

provider: ${2:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
nxos_pim_interface:
interface: ${1:undefined} # required. Full name of the interface such as Ethernet1/33.
jp_policy_out: ${2:null} # required. Policy for join-prune messages (outbound).
hello_interval: ${3|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Hello interval in milliseconds for this interface.
jp_type_out: ${4|prefix,routemap|} # not required. choices: prefix;routemap. Type of policy mapped to C(jp_policy_out).
neighbor_type: ${5|prefix,routemap|} # not required. choices: prefix;routemap. Type of policy mapped to neighbor_policy.
neighbor_policy: ${6:null} # not required. Configures a neighbor policy for filtering adjacencies.
dr_prio: ${7:undefined} # not required. Configures priority for PIM DR election on interface.
border: ${8|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Configures interface to be a boundary of a PIM domain.
jp_type_in: ${9|prefix,routemap|} # not required. choices: prefix;routemap. Type of policy mapped to C(jp_policy_in).
jp_policy_in: ${10:null} # not required. Policy for join-prune messages (inbound).
hello_auth_key: ${11:null} # not required. Authentication for hellos on this interface.

provider: ${12:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
sparse: ${13|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Enable/disable sparse-mode on the interface.
state: ${14|present,default|} # not required. choices: present;default. Manages desired state of the resource.

nxos_pim_rp_address.description: Manages configuration of an PIM static RP address instance.
body: nxos_pim_rp_address:
rp_address: ${1:undefined} # required. Configures a Protocol Independent Multicast (PIM) static rendezvous point (RP) address. Valid values are unicast addresses.
state: ${2|present,absent,default|} # required. choices: present;absent;default. Specify desired state of the resource.
route_map: ${3:null} # not required. Route map policy for static RP. Valid values are route-map policy names.
prefix_list: ${4:null} # not required. Prefix list policy for static RP. Valid values are prefix-list policy names.
bidir: ${5|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Group range is treated in PIM bidirectional mode.
group_list: ${6:null} # not required. Group range for static RP. Valid values are multicast addresses.

provider: ${7:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

nxos_ping.description: Tests reachability using ping from Nexus switch.
body: nxos_ping:
dest: ${1:undefined} # required. IP address or hostname (resolvable by switch) of remote node.
count: ${2:2} # not required. Number of packets to send.
vrf: ${3:null} # not required. Outgoing VRF.
source: ${4:null} # not required. Source IP Address.
state: ${5|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Determines if the expected result is success or fail.

provider: ${6:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
nxos_portchannel:
group: ${1:undefined} # required. Channel-group number for the port-channel.
min_links: ${2:null} # not required. Min links required to keep portchannel up.
mode: ${3|active,passive,on|} # not required. choices: active;passive;on. Mode for the port-channel, i.e. on, active, passive.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.
force: ${5|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. When true it forces port-channel members to match what is declared in the members param. This can be used to remove members.
members: ${6:null} # not required. List of interfaces that will be managed in a given portchannel.

provider: ${7:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
nxos_reboot:

provider: ${1:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
confirm: ${2:false} # not required. Safeguard boolean. Set to true if you're sure you want to reboot.

nxos_rollback.description: Set a checkpoint or rollback to a checkpoint.
body: nxos_rollback:
rollback_to: ${1:null} # not required. Name of checkpoint file to rollback to. Mutually exclusive with checkpoint_file.
checkpoint_file: ${2:null} # not required. Name of checkpoint file to create. Mutually exclusive with rollback_to.

provider: ${3:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

nxos_smu.description: Perform SMUs on Cisco NX-OS devices.
body: nxos_smu:
pkg: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the remote package.

provider: ${2:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
file_system: ${3:null} # not required. The remote file system of the device. If omitted, devices that support a file_system parameter will use their default values.

nxos_snapshot.description: Manage snapshots of the running states of selected features.
body: nxos_snapshot:
action: ${1|create,add,compare,delete|} # required. choices: create;add;compare;delete. Define what snapshot action the module would perform.
compare_option: ${2|summary,ipv4routes,ipv6routes|} # not required. choices: summary;ipv4routes;ipv6routes. Snapshot options to be used when C(action=compare).

provider: ${3:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
snapshot1: ${4:null} # not required. First snapshot to be used when C(action=compare).
element_key2: ${5:null} # not required. Specify the tags used to distinguish among row entries, to be used when C(action=add).
snapshot_name: ${6:null} # not required. Snapshot name, to be used when C(action=create) or C(action=delete).

path: ${7:./} # not required. Specify the path of the file where new created snapshot or snapshots comparison will be stored, to be used when C(action=create) and C(save_snapshot_locally=true) or C(action=compare).
element_key1: ${8:null} # not required. Specify the tags used to distinguish among row entries, to be used when C(action=add).
show_command: ${9:null} # not required. Specify a new show command, to be used when C(action=add).
comparison_results_file: ${10:null} # not required. Name of the file where snapshots comparison will be store.
row_id: ${11:null} # not required. Specifies the tag of each row entry of the show command's XML output, to be used when C(action=add).
description: ${12:null} # not required. Snapshot description to be used when C(action=create).
save_snapshot_locally: ${13|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Specify to locally store a new created snapshot, to be used when C(action=create).
section: ${14:null} # not required. Used to name the show command output, to be used when C(action=add).
snapshot2: ${15:null} # not required. Second snapshot to be used when C(action=compare).
nxos_snmp_community:
community: ${1:undefined} # required. Case-sensitive community string.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.
acl: ${3:1} # not required. ACL name to filter snmp requests.
access: ${4|ro,rw|} # not required. choices: ro;rw. Access type for community.

provider: ${5:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
group: ${6:null} # not required. Group to which the community belongs.
nxos_snmp_contact:
contact: ${1:undefined} # required. Contact information.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.

provider: ${3:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
nxos_snmp_host:
snmp_host: ${1:undefined} # required. IP address of hostname of target host.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.
vrf: ${3:null} # not required. VRF to use to source traffic to source.

provider: ${4:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
v3: ${5|noauth,auth,priv|} # not required. choices: noauth;auth;priv. Use this when verion is v3. SNMPv3 Security level.
version: ${6|v2c,v3|} # not required. choices: v2c;v3. SNMP version.
src_intf: ${7:null} # not required. Source interface.
udp: ${8:null} # not required. UDP port number (0-65535).
community: ${9:null} # not required. Community string or v3 username.
vrf_filter: ${10:null} # not required. Name of VRF to filter.
snmp_type: ${11|trap,inform|} # not required. choices: trap;inform. type of message to send to host.
nxos_snmp_location:
location: ${1:undefined} # required. Location information.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.

provider: ${3:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
nxos_snmp_traps:

group: ${1|aaa,bridge,callhome,cfs,config,entity,feature-control,hsrp,license,link,lldp,ospf,pim,rf,rmon,snmp,storm-control,stpx,sysmgr,system,upgrade,vtp,all|} # required. choices: aaa;bridge;callhome;cfs;config;entity;feature-control;hsrp;license;link;lldp;ospf;pim;rf;rmon;snmp;storm-control;stpx;sysmgr;system;upgrade;vtp;all. Case sensitive group.
state: ${2|enabled,disabled|} # not required. choices: enabled;disabled. Manage the state of the resource.

provider: ${3:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
nxos_snmp_user:
user: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the user.
group: ${2:undefined} # required. Group to which the user will belong to.
privacy: ${3:null} # not required. Privacy password for the user.
pwd: ${4:null} # not required. Authentication password when using md5 or sha.
authentication: ${5|md5,sha|} # not required. choices: md5;sha. Authentication parameters for the user.
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.

provider: ${7:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
encrypt: ${8|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Enables AES-128 bit encryption when using privacy password.
nxos_static_route:
next_hop: ${1:undefined} # required. Next hop address or interface of static route. If interface, it must be the fully-qualified interface name.
prefix: ${2:undefined} # required. Destination prefix of static route.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.
vrf: ${4:default} # not required. VRF for static route.
pref: ${5:null} # not required. Preference or administrative difference of route (range 1-255).

provider: ${6:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
route_name: ${7:null} # not required. Name of the route. Used with the name parameter on the CLI.
aggregate: ${8:undefined} # not required. List of static route definitions
tag: ${9:null} # not required. Route tag value (numeric).
nxos_switchport:
interface: ${1:null} # required. Full name of the interface, i.e. Ethernet1/1.
mode: ${2|access,trunk|} # not required. choices: access;trunk. Mode for the Layer 2 port.
native_vlan: ${3:null} # not required. If C(mode=trunk), used as the trunk native VLAN ID.
trunk_allowed_vlans: ${4:null} # not required. if C(mode=trunk), these are the only VLANs that will be configured on the trunk, i.e. "2-10,15".
access_vlan: ${5:null} # not required. If C(mode=access), used as the access VLAN ID.
trunk_vlans: ${6:null} # not required. If C(mode=trunk), used as the VLAN range to ADD or REMOVE from the trunk.
state: ${7|present,absent,unconfigured|} # not required. choices: present;absent;unconfigured. Manage the state of the resource.

provider: ${8:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

nxos_system.description: Manage the system attributes on Cisco NXOS devices
body: nxos_system:

name_servers: ${1:undefined} # not required. List of DNS name servers by IP address to use to perform name resolution lookups.  This argument accepts either a list of DNS servers or a list of hashes that configure the name server and VRF name.  See examples.

domain_search: ${2:undefined} # not required. Configures a list of domain name suffixes to search when performing DNS name resolution. This argument accepts either a list of domain names or a list of dicts that configure the domain name and VRF name.  See examples.

domain_name: ${3:undefined} # not required. Configures the default domain name suffix to be used when referencing this node by its FQDN.  This argument accepts either a list of domain names or a list of dicts that configure the domain name and VRF name.  See examples.
system_mtu: ${4:undefined} # not required. Specifies the mtu, must be an integer.

state: ${5|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the configuration values in the device's current active configuration.  When set to I(present), the values should be configured in the device active configuration and when set to I(absent) the values should not be in the device active configuration

provider: ${6:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

domain_lookup: ${7:undefined} # not required. Enables or disables the DNS lookup feature in Cisco NXOS.  This argument accepts boolean values.  When enabled, the system will try to resolve hostnames using DNS and when disabled, hostnames will not be resolved.
hostname: ${8:undefined} # not required. Configure the device hostname parameter. This option takes an ASCII string value.
nxos_udld:
reset: ${1|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Ability to reset UDLD down interfaces.
msg_time: ${2:null} # not required. Message time in seconds for UDLD packets.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.

provider: ${4:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
aggressive: ${5|enabled,disabled|} # not required. choices: enabled;disabled. Toggles aggressive mode.
nxos_udld_interface:
mode: ${1|enabled,disabled,aggressive|} # required. choices: enabled;disabled;aggressive. Manages UDLD mode for an interface.
interface: ${2:undefined} # required. FULL name of the interface, i.e. Ethernet1/1-

provider: ${3:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource.

nxos_user.description: Manage the collection of local users on Nexus devices
body: nxos_user:
sshkey: ${1:null} # not required. The C(sshkey) argument defines the SSH public key to configure for the username.  This argument accepts a valid SSH key value.

purge: ${2:false} # not required. The C(purge) argument instructs the module to consider the resource definition absolute.  It will remove any previously configured usernames on the device with the exception of the `admin` user which cannot be deleted per nxos constraints.

role: ${3:null} # not required. The C(role) argument configures the role for the username in the device running configuration.  The argument accepts a string value defining the role name.  This argument does not check if the role has been configured on the device.

provider: ${4:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

configured_password: ${5:undefined} # not required. The password to be configured on the network device. The password needs to be provided in cleartext and it will be encrypted on the device. Please note that this option is not same as C(provider password).

state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The C(state) argument configures the state of the username definition as it relates to the device operational configuration.  When set to I(present), the username(s) should be configured in the device active configuration and when set to I(absent) the username(s) should not be in the device active configuration

update_password: ${7|on_create,always|} # not required. choices: on_create;always. Since passwords are encrypted in the device running config, this argument will instruct the module when to change the password.  When set to C(always), the password will always be updated in the device and when set to C(on_create) the password will be updated only if the username is created.

aggregate: ${8:null} # not required. The set of username objects to be configured on the remote Cisco Nexus device.  The list entries can either be the username or a hash of username and properties.  This argument is mutually exclusive with the C(name) argument.
name: ${9:null} # not required. The username to be configured on the remote Cisco Nexus device.  This argument accepts a string value and is mutually exclusive with the C(aggregate) argument.
nxos_vlan:

provider: ${1:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
vlan_state: ${2|active,suspend|} # not required. choices: active;suspend. Manage the vlan operational state of the VLAN This is being deprecated in favor of state.
vlan_range: ${3:null} # not required. Range of VLANs such as 2-10 or 2,5,10-15, etc.
purge: ${4:false} # not required. Purge VLANs not defined in the I(aggregate) parameter.
delay: ${5:10} # not required. Time in seconds to wait before checking for the operational state on remote device. This wait is applicable for operational state arguments.
admin_state: ${6|up,down|} # not required. choices: up;down. Manage the VLAN administrative state of the VLAN equivalent to shut/no shut in VLAN config mode.
interfaces: ${7:undefined} # not required. List of interfaces that should be associated to the VLAN.
mapped_vni: ${8:null} # not required. The Virtual Network Identifier (VNI) ID that is mapped to the VLAN. Valid values are integer and keyword 'default'. Range 4096-16773119.

associated_interfaces: ${9:undefined} # not required. This is a intent option and checks the operational state of the for given vlan C(name) for associated interfaces. If the value in the C(associated_interfaces) does not match with the operational state of vlan interfaces on device it will result in failure.
mode: ${10|ce,fabricpath|} # not required. choices: ce;fabricpath. Set VLAN mode to classical ethernet or fabricpath. This is a valid option for Nexus 5000 and 7000 series.
vlan_id: ${11:null} # not required. Single VLAN ID.
state: ${12|present,absent,active,suspend|} # not required. choices: present;absent;active;suspend. Manage the state of the resource. Active and Suspend will assume the vlan is present.
aggregate: ${13:undefined} # not required. List of VLANs definitions.
name: ${14:null} # not required. Name of VLAN.
nxos_vpc:
domain: ${1:undefined} # required. VPC domain
state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Manages desired state of the resource
delay_restore: ${3:null} # not required. manages delay restore command and config value in seconds
auto_recovery: ${4|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Enables/Disables auto recovery
pkl_dest: ${5:null} # not required. Destination (remote) IP address used for peer keepalive link

provider: ${6:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
pkl_vrf: ${7:management} # not required. VRF used for peer keepalive link
peer_gw: ${8|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Enables/Disables peer gateway
pkl_src: ${9:null} # not required. Source IP address used for peer keepalive link
role_priority: ${10:null} # not required. Role priority for device. Remember lower is better.
system_priority: ${11:null} # not required. System priority device.  Remember they must match between peers.
nxos_vpc_interface:
portchannel: ${1:undefined} # required. Group number of the portchannel that will be configured.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Manages desired state of the resource.
vpc: ${3:null} # not required. VPC group/id that will be configured on associated portchannel.

provider: ${4:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
peer_link: ${5:null} # not required. Set to true/false for peer link config on associated portchannel.
nxos_vrf:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of VRF to be managed.
description: ${2:null} # not required. Description of the VRF.
purge: ${3:false} # not required. Purge VRFs not defined in the I(aggregate) parameter.
delay: ${4:10} # not required. Time in seconds to wait before checking for the operational state on remote device. This wait is applicable for operational state arguments.
admin_state: ${5|up,down|} # not required. choices: up;down. Administrative state of the VRF.
interfaces: ${6:undefined} # not required. List of interfaces to check the VRF has been configured correctly.

provider: ${7:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

associated_interfaces: ${8:undefined} # not required. This is a intent option and checks the operational state of the for given vrf C(name) for associated interfaces. If the value in the C(associated_interfaces) does not match with the operational state of vrf interfaces on device it will result in failure.
aggregate: ${9:undefined} # not required. List of VRFs definitions.

rd: ${10:null} # not required. VPN Route Distinguisher (RD). Valid values are a string in one of the route-distinguisher formats (ASN2:NN, ASN4:NN, or IPV4:NN); the keyword 'auto', or the keyword 'default'.
state: ${11|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manages desired state of the resource.
vni: ${12:null} # not required. Specify virtual network identifier. Valid values are Integer or keyword 'default'.
nxos_vrf_af:
vrf: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the VRF.
safi: ${2|unicast,multicast|} # required. choices: unicast;multicast. Sub Address-Family Identifier (SAFI).,Deprecated in 2.4
afi: ${3|ipv4,ipv6|} # required. choices: ipv4;ipv6. Address-Family Identifier (AFI).
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
route_target_both_auto_evpn: ${5|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Enable/Disable the EVPN route-target 'auto' setting for both import and export target communities.

provider: ${6:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
nxos_vrf_interface:
interface: ${1:undefined} # required. Full name of interface to be managed, i.e. Ethernet1/1.
vrf: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of VRF to be managed.

provider: ${3:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manages desired state of the resource.

nxos_vrrp.description: Manages VRRP configuration on NX-OS switches.
body: nxos_vrrp:
interface: ${1:undefined} # required. Full name of interface that is being managed for VRRP.
group: ${2:undefined} # required. VRRP group number.
vip: ${3:null} # not required. VRRP virtual IP address.

provider: ${4:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
admin_state: ${5|shutdown,no shutdown|} # not required. choices: shutdown;no shutdown. Used to enable or disable the VRRP process.
authentication: ${6:null} # not required. Clear text authentication string.
preempt: ${7|True,False|} # not required. choices: True;False. Enable/Disable preempt.
priority: ${8:null} # not required. VRRP priority.
state: ${9|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify desired state of the resource.
nxos_vtp_domain:
domain: ${1:undefined} # required. VTP domain name.

provider: ${2:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
nxos_vtp_password:
vtp_password: ${1:null} # not required. VTP password
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Manage the state of the resource

provider: ${3:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
nxos_vtp_version:
version: ${1|1,2|} # required. choices: 1;2. VTP version number.

provider: ${2:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
nxos_vxlan_vtep:
interface: ${1:undefined} # required. Interface name for the VXLAN Network Virtualization Endpoint.
host_reachability: ${2|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Specify mechanism for host reachability advertisement.
description: ${3:null} # not required. Description of the NVE interface.
source_interface_hold_down_time: ${4:null} # not required. Suppresses advertisement of the NVE loopback address until the overlay has converged.
state: ${5|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.

provider: ${6:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
shutdown: ${7|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Administratively shutdown the NVE interface.
source_interface: ${8:null} # not required. Specify the loopback interface whose IP address should be used for the NVE interface.

nxos_vxlan_vtep_vni.description: Creates a Virtual Network Identifier member (VNI)
body: nxos_vxlan_vtep_vni:
interface: ${1:undefined} # required. Interface name for the VXLAN Network Virtualization Endpoint.
vni: ${2:undefined} # required. ID of the Virtual Network Identifier.
ingress_replication: ${3|bgp,static,default|} # not required. choices: bgp;static;default. Specifies mechanism for host reachability advertisement.
multicast_group: ${4:null} # not required. The multicast group (range) of the VNI. Valid values are string and keyword 'default'.

provider: ${5:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,This option is only required if you are using NX-API.,For more information please see the L(NXOS Platform Options guide, ../network/user_guide/platform_nxos.html).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
suppress_arp: ${6|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Suppress arp under layer 2 VNI.
peer_list: ${7:null} # not required. Set the ingress-replication static peer list. Valid values are an array, a space-separated string of ip addresses, or the keyword 'default'.

assoc_vrf: ${8|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. This attribute is used to identify and separate processing VNIs that are associated with a VRF and used for routing. The VRF and VNI specified with this command must match the configuration of the VNI under the VRF.
state: ${9|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the config should be present or not on the device.
oc:
token: ${1:undefined} # required. The token with which to authenticate against the OpenShift cluster.

state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. If the state is present, and the resource doesn't exist, it shall be created using the inline definition. If the state is present and the resource exists, the definition will be updated, again using an inline definition. If the state is absent, the resource will be deleted if it exists.
kind: ${3:undefined} # required. The kind of the resource upon which to take action.
validate_certs: ${4:true} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates for the target url will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
host: ${5:127.0.0.1} # not required. Hostname or address of the OpenShift API endpoint. By default, this is expected to be the current inventory host.
port: ${6:8443} # not required. The port number of the API endpoint.
inline: ${7:undefined} # not required. The inline definition of the resource. This is mutually exclusive with name, namespace and kind.
namespace: ${8:undefined} # not required. The namespace of the resource upon which to take action.
name: ${9:undefined} # not required. The name of the resource on which to take action.

office_365_connector_card.description: Use webhooks to create Connector Card messages within an Office 365 group
body: office_365_connector_card:
webhook: ${1:undefined} # required. The webhook URL is given to you when you create a new Connector.
sections: ${2:undefined} # not required. Contains a list of sections to display in the card.,For more information see https://dev.outlook.com/Connectors/reference.
actions: ${3:undefined} # not required. This array of objects will power the action links,found at the bottom of the card.
summary: ${4:undefined} # not required. A string used for summarizing card content.,This will be shown as the message subject.,This is required if the text parameter isn't populated.
title: ${5:undefined} # not required. A title for the Connector message. Shown at the top of the message.
color: ${6:undefined} # not required. Accent color used for branding or indicating status in the card.
text: ${7:undefined} # not required. The main text of the card.,This will be rendered below the sender information and optional title,,and above any sections or actions present.
ohai:
omapi_host:
key: ${1:undefined} # required. Sets the TSIG key content for authenticating against OMAPI server.
key_name: ${2:undefined} # required. Sets the TSIG key name for authenticating against OMAPI server.
macaddr: ${3:undefined} # required. Sets the lease host MAC address.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Create or remove OMAPI host.
statements: ${5:} # not required. Attach a list of OMAPI DHCP statements with host lease (without ending semicolon).
host: ${6:localhost} # not required. Sets OMAPI server host to interact with.
ddns: ${7:false} # not required. Enable dynamic DNS updates for this host.
port: ${8:7911} # not required. Sets the OMAPI server port to interact with.
ip: ${9:None} # not required. Sets the lease host IP address.
name: ${10:None} # not required. Sets the host lease hostname (mandatory if state=present).
oneandone_firewall_policy:
firewall_policy: ${1:undefined} # required. The identifier (id or name) of the firewall policy used with update state.
auth_token: ${2:undefined} # required. Authenticating API token provided by 1&1.
name: ${3:undefined} # required. Firewall policy name used with present state. Used as identifier (id or name) when used with absent state. maxLength=128

rules: ${4:undefined} # not required. A list of rules that will be set for the firewall policy. Each rule must contain protocol parameter, in addition to three optional parameters (port_from, port_to, and source)
description: ${5:undefined} # not required. Firewall policy description. maxLength=256
remove_rules: ${6:undefined} # not required. A list of rule ids that will be removed from an existing firewall policy. Used in combination with update state.
api_url: ${7:undefined} # not required. Custom API URL. Overrides the ONEANDONE_API_URL environement variable.

add_rules: ${8:undefined} # not required. A list of rules that will be added to an existing firewall policy. It is syntax is the same as the one used for rules parameter. Used in combination with update state.
wait_interval: ${9:5} # not required. Defines the number of seconds to wait when using the _wait_for methods
add_server_ips: ${10:undefined} # not required. A list of server identifiers (id or name) to be assigned to a firewall policy. Used in combination with update state.
wait: ${11|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the instance to be in state 'running' before returning
wait_timeout: ${12:600} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
state: ${13|present,absent,update|} # not required. choices: present;absent;update. Define a firewall policy state to create, remove, or update.
remove_server_ips: ${14:undefined} # not required. A list of server IP ids to be unassigned from a firewall policy. Used in combination with update state.
oneandone_load_balancer:
persistence_time: ${1:undefined} # required. Persistence time in seconds. Required if persistence is enabled. minimum=30, maximum=1200, multipleOf=1
method: ${2|ROUND_ROBIN,LEAST_CONNECTIONS|} # required. choices: ROUND_ROBIN;LEAST_CONNECTIONS. Balancing procedure.
health_check_interval: ${3:undefined} # required. Health check period in seconds. minimum=5, maximum=300, multipleOf=1
health_check_test: ${4|NONE,TCP,HTTP,ICMP|} # required. choices: NONE;TCP;HTTP;ICMP. Type of the health check. At the moment, HTTP is not allowed.
name: ${5:undefined} # required. Load balancer name used with present state. Used as identifier (id or name) when used with absent state. maxLength=128

rules: ${6:undefined} # required. A list of rule objects that will be set for the load balancer. Each rule must contain protocol, port_balancer, and port_server parameters, in addition to source parameter, which is optional.
auth_token: ${7:undefined} # required. Authenticating API token provided by 1&1.
load_balancer: ${8:undefined} # required. The identifier (id or name) of the load balancer used with update state.
persistence: ${9:undefined} # required. Persistence.
datacenter: ${10|US,ES,DE,GB|} # not required. choices: US;ES;DE;GB. ID or country code of the datacenter where the load balancer will be created.
remove_rules: ${11:undefined} # not required. A list of rule ids that will be removed from an existing load balancer. Used in combination with update state.
api_url: ${12:undefined} # not required. Custom API URL. Overrides the ONEANDONE_API_URL environement variable.
wait_timeout: ${13:600} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
add_server_ips: ${14:undefined} # not required. A list of server identifiers (id or name) to be assigned to a load balancer. Used in combination with update state.
wait: ${15|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the instance to be in state 'running' before returning
description: ${16:undefined} # not required. Description of the load balancer. maxLength=256
health_check_path: ${17:undefined} # not required. Url to call for cheking. Required for HTTP health check. maxLength=1000
remove_server_ips: ${18:undefined} # not required. A list of server IP ids to be unassigned from a load balancer. Used in combination with update state.

add_rules: ${19:undefined} # not required. A list of rules that will be added to an existing load balancer. It is syntax is the same as the one used for rules parameter. Used in combination with update state.
wait_interval: ${20:5} # not required. Defines the number of seconds to wait when using the _wait_for methods
health_check_parse: ${21:undefined} # not required. Regular expression to check. Required for HTTP health check. maxLength=64
state: ${22|present,absent,update|} # not required. choices: present;absent;update. Define a load balancer state to create, remove, or update.
oneandone_monitoring_policy:
processes: ${1:undefined} # required. Array of processes that will be monitoring.
ports: ${2:undefined} # required. Array of ports that will be monitoring.
monitoring_policy: ${3:undefined} # required. The identifier (id or name) of the monitoring policy used with update state.
agent: ${4:undefined} # required. Set true for using agent.
name: ${5:undefined} # required. Monitoring policy name used with present state. Used as identifier (id or name) when used with absent state. maxLength=128
email: ${6:undefined} # required. User's email. maxLength=128

thresholds: ${7:undefined} # required. Monitoring policy thresholds. Each of the suboptions have warning and critical, which both have alert and value suboptions. Warning is used to set limits for warning alerts, critical is used to set critical alerts. alert enables alert, and value is used to advise when the value is exceeded.
auth_token: ${8:undefined} # required. Authenticating API token provided by 1&1.
api_url: ${9:undefined} # not required. Custom API URL. Overrides the ONEANDONE_API_URL environement variable.
wait_timeout: ${10:600} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
update_processes: ${11:undefined} # not required. Processes to be updated on the monitoring policy.
remove_ports: ${12:undefined} # not required. Ports to remove from the monitoring policy.
update_ports: ${13:undefined} # not required. Ports to be updated on the monitoring policy.
description: ${14:undefined} # not required. Monitoring policy description. maxLength=256
wait: ${15|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the instance to be in state 'running' before returning
remove_processes: ${16:undefined} # not required. Processes to remove from the monitoring policy.
add_servers: ${17:undefined} # not required. Servers to add to the monitoring policy.
wait_interval: ${18:5} # not required. Defines the number of seconds to wait when using the _wait_for methods
add_processes: ${19:undefined} # not required. Processes to add to the monitoring policy.
add_ports: ${20:undefined} # not required. Ports to add to the monitoring policy.
state: ${21|present,absent,update|} # not required. choices: present;absent;update. Define a monitoring policy's state to create, remove, update.
remove_servers: ${22:undefined} # not required. Servers to remove from the monitoring policy.
oneandone_private_network:
auth_token: ${1:undefined} # required. Authenticating API token provided by 1&1.
private_network: ${2:undefined} # required. The identifier (id or name) of the network used with update state.
name: ${3:undefined} # required. Private network name used with present state. Used as identifier (id or name) when used with absent state.
wait_timeout: ${4:600} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
datacenter: ${5:undefined} # not required. The identifier of the datacenter where the private network will be created
network_address: ${6:undefined} # not required. Set a private network space, i.e. 192.168.1.0
description: ${7:undefined} # not required. Set a description for the network.
api_url: ${8:undefined} # not required. Custom API URL. Overrides the ONEANDONE_API_URL environement variable.
add_members: ${9:undefined} # not required. List of server identifiers (name or id) to be added to the private network.
subnet_mask: ${10:undefined} # not required. Set the netmask for the private network, i.e. 255.255.255.0
wait_interval: ${11:5} # not required. Defines the number of seconds to wait when using the _wait_for methods
remove_members: ${12:undefined} # not required. List of server identifiers (name or id) to be removed from the private network.
wait: ${13|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the instance to be in state 'running' before returning
state: ${14|present,absent,update|} # not required. choices: present;absent;update. Define a network's state to create, remove, or update.
oneandone_public_ip:
public_ip_id: ${1:undefined} # required. The ID of the public IP used with update and delete states.
auth_token: ${2:undefined} # required. Authenticating API token provided by 1&1.
wait_interval: ${3:5} # not required. Defines the number of seconds to wait when using the _wait_for methods
