interface: ${3|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
cert: ${4:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
ironic_url: ${5:None} # not required. If noauth mode is utilized, this is required to be set to the endpoint URL for the Ironic API.  Use with "auth" and "auth_type" settings set to None.
cacert: ${6:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
key: ${7:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
region_name: ${8:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.
wait: ${9:true} # not required. Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.
availability_zone: ${10:undefined} # not required. Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility

auth_type: ${11:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.
driver_info: ${12:undefined} # not required. Information for this server's driver. Will vary based on which driver is in use. Any sub-field which is populated will be validated during creation.
name: ${13:None} # not required. unique name identifier to be given to the resource.
api_timeout: ${14:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
verify: ${15:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.

skip_update_of_driver_password: ${16:false} # not required. Allows the code that would assert changes to nodes to skip the update if the change is a single line consisting of the password field.  As of Kilo, by default, passwords are always masked to API requests, which means the logic as a result always attempts to re-assert the password field.
properties: ${17:undefined} # not required. Definition of the physical characteristics of this server, used for scheduling purposes

uuid: ${18:None} # not required. globally unique identifier (UUID) to be given to the resource. Will be auto-generated if not specified, and name is specified.,Definition of a UUID will always take precedence to a name value.

auth: ${19:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
chassis_uuid: ${20:None} # not required. Associate the node with a pre-defined chassis.
state: ${21|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicates desired state of the resource

cloud: ${22:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.
timeout: ${23:180} # not required. How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.

os_ironic_inspect.description: Explicitly triggers baremetal node introspection in ironic.
body: os_ironic_inspect:
interface: ${1|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
api_timeout: ${2:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
availability_zone: ${3:undefined} # not required. Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
cert: ${4:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
verify: ${5:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.
cacert: ${6:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.

auth: ${7:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
ironic_url: ${8:None} # not required. If noauth mode is utilized, this is required to be set to the endpoint URL for the Ironic API. Use with "auth" and "auth_type" settings set to None.
key: ${9:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
region_name: ${10:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.
mac: ${11:None} # not required. unique mac address that is used to attempt to identify the host.
uuid: ${12:None} # not required. globally unique identifier (UUID) to identify the host.
wait: ${13:true} # not required. Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.

cloud: ${14:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.
timeout: ${15:1200} # not required. A timeout in seconds to tell the role to wait for the node to complete introspection if wait is set to True.

auth_type: ${16:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.
name: ${17:None} # not required. unique name identifier to identify the host in Ironic.

os_ironic_node.description: Activate/Deactivate Bare Metal Resources from OpenStack
body: os_ironic_node:
availability_zone: ${1:undefined} # not required. Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
cert: ${2:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
maintenance_reason: ${3:None} # not required. A string expression regarding the reason a node is in a maintenance mode.
ironic_url: ${4:None} # not required. If noauth mode is utilized, this is required to be set to the endpoint URL for the Ironic API.  Use with "auth" and "auth_type" settings set to None.
config_drive: ${5:None} # not required. A configdrive file or HTTP(S) URL that will be passed along to the node.
cacert: ${6:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
key: ${7:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
instance_info: ${8:undefined} # not required. Definition of the instance information which is used to deploy the node.  This information is only required when an instance is set to present.
region_name: ${9:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.
wait: ${10:false} # not required. A boolean value instructing the module to wait for node activation or deactivation to complete before returning.
interface: ${11|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.

auth_type: ${12:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.

deploy: ${13|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Indicates if the resource should be deployed. Allows for deployment logic to be disengaged and control of the node power or maintenance state to be changed.
api_timeout: ${14:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
verify: ${15:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.

auth: ${16:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.

power: ${17|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. A setting to allow power state to be asserted allowing nodes that are not yet deployed to be powered on, and nodes that are deployed to be powered off.
uuid: ${18:None} # not required. globally unique identifier (UUID) to be given to the resource.
maintenance: ${19:false} # not required. A setting to allow the direct control if a node is in maintenance mode.
timeout: ${20:180} # not required. An integer value representing the number of seconds to wait for the node activation or deactivation to complete.
state: ${21|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicates desired state of the resource

cloud: ${22:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.
os_keypair:
name: ${1:None} # required. Name that has to be given to the key pair
interface: ${2|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
api_timeout: ${3:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
availability_zone: ${4:undefined} # not required. Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
cert: ${5:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.

cacert: ${7:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
key: ${8:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
public_key: ${9:None} # not required. The public key that would be uploaded to nova and injected into VMs upon creation.
region_name: ${10:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.

auth: ${11:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
public_key_file: ${12:None} # not required. Path to local file containing ssh public key. Mutually exclusive with public_key.
wait: ${13:true} # not required. Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.

cloud: ${14:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.
timeout: ${15:180} # not required. How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.
state: ${16|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the resource be present or absent.

auth_type: ${17:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.
os_keystone_domain:

interface: ${2|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
api_timeout: ${3:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.

For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
wait: ${13:true} # not required. Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.

cloud: ${14:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.
timeout: ${15:180} # not required. How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.
state: ${16|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the resource be present or absent.

auth_type: ${17:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.

os_port.description: Add/Update/Delete ports from an OpenStack cloud.
body: os_port:

mac_address: ${5:None} # not required. MAC address of this port.

allowed_address_pairs: ${7:None} # not required. Allowed address pairs list.  Allowed address pairs are supported with dictionary structure. e.g.  allowed_address_pairs: - ip_address: 10.1.0.12 mac_address: ab:cd:ef:12:34:56 - ip_address: ...
region_name: ${8:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.
key: ${9:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.

admin_state_up: ${11:None} # not required. Sets admin state.

Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.
name: ${13:None} # not required. Name that has to be given to the port.
device_owner: ${14:None} # not required. The ID of the entity that uses this port.
api_timeout: ${15:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.

extra_dhcp_opts: ${16:None} # not required. Extra dhcp options to be assigned to this port.  Extra options are supported with dictionary structure. e.g.  extra_dhcp_opts: - opt_name: opt name1 opt_value: value1 - opt_name: ...
device_id: ${17:None} # not required. Device ID of device using this port.
verify: ${18:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.

auth_type: ${19:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.

no_security_groups: ${21:false} # not required. Do not associate a security group with this port.

cloud: ${11:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.
network: ${12:None} # not required. Number of networks to allow.
injected_path_size: ${13:None} # not required. Maximum path size.
per_volume_gigabytes: ${14:None} # not required. Maximum size in GB's of individual volumes.
pool: ${15:None} # not required. Number of load balancer pools to allow.
floatingip: ${16:None} # not required. Number of floating IP's to allow in Network.
snapshots_lvm: ${17:None} # not required. Number of LVM snapshots to allow.
injected_files: ${18:None} # not required. Number of injected files to allow.
subnet: ${19:None} # not required. Number of subnets to allow.

auth_type: ${20:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.
fixed_ips: ${21:None} # not required. Number of fixed IP's to allow.
router: ${22:None} # not required. Number of routers to allow.
timeout: ${23:180} # not required. How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.
state: ${24:present} # not required. A value of present sets the quota and a value of absent resets the quota to system defaults.
backup_gigabytes: ${25:None} # not required. Maximum size of backups in GB's.
server_groups: ${26:None} # not required. Number of server groups to allow.

auth: ${27:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
subnetpool: ${28:None} # not required. Number of subnet pools to allow.
cacert: ${29:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
interface: ${30|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
ram: ${31:None} # not required. Maximum amount of ram in MB to allow.
cert: ${32:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
port: ${33:None} # not required. Number of Network ports to allow, this needs to be greater than the instances limit.
api_timeout: ${34:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
key: ${35:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
floating_ips: ${36:None} # not required. Number of floating IP's to allow in Compute.
wait: ${37:true} # not required. Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.
backups: ${38:None} # not required. Maximum number of backups allowed.
loadbalancer: ${39:None} # not required. Number of load balancers to allow.
region_name: ${40:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.
verify: ${41:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.
cores: ${42:None} # not required. Maximum number of CPU's per project.
instances: ${43:None} # not required. Maximum number of instances allowed.
gigabytes: ${44:None} # not required. Maximum volume storage allowed for project.
properties: ${45:None} # not required. Number of properties to allow.
rbac_policy: ${46:None} # not required. Number of policies to allow.
server_group_members: ${47:None} # not required. Number of server group members to allow.
os_recordset:
recordset_type: ${1:undefined} # required. Recordset type
records: ${2:undefined} # required. List of recordset definitions
name: ${3:undefined} # required. Name of the recordset
zone: ${4:undefined} # required. Zone managing the recordset
interface: ${5|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
api_timeout: ${6:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
description: ${7:None} # not required. Description of the recordset
cert: ${8:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
ttl: ${9:None} # not required. TTL (Time To Live) value in seconds
verify: ${10:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.
cacert: ${11:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
key: ${12:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
region_name: ${13:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.
wait: ${14:true} # not required. Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.

auth: ${15:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
availability_zone: ${16:undefined} # not required. Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
timeout: ${17:180} # not required. How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.
state: ${18|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the resource be present or absent.

auth_type: ${19:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.

cloud: ${20:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.

os_router.description: Create or delete routers from OpenStack
body: os_router:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name to be give to the router
interface: ${2|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
api_timeout: ${3:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
availability_zone: ${4:undefined} # not required. Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
cert: ${5:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
verify: ${6:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.

interfaces: ${7:None} # not required. List of subnets to attach to the router internal interface. Default gateway associated with the subnet will be automatically attached with the router's internal interface. In order to provide an ip address different from the default gateway,parameters are passed as dictionary with keys as network name or ID(net), subnet name or ID (subnet) and the IP of port (portip) from the network. User defined portip is often required when a multiple router need to be connected to a single subnet for which the default gateway has been already used.
cacert: ${8:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
key: ${9:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
enable_snat: ${10:true} # not required. Enable Source NAT (SNAT) attribute.
region_name: ${11:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.

auth_type: ${12:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.

auth: ${13:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
project: ${14:None} # not required. Unique name or ID of the project.
wait: ${15:true} # not required. Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.
admin_state_up: ${16:true} # not required. Desired admin state of the created or existing router.

cloud: ${17:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.
timeout: ${18:180} # not required. How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.
state: ${19|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource
network: ${20:None} # not required. Unique name or ID of the external gateway network.,required I(interfaces) or I(enable_snat) are provided.

external_fixed_ips: ${21:None} # not required. The IP address parameters for the external gateway network. Each is a dictionary with the subnet name or ID (subnet) and the IP address to assign on the subnet (ip). If no IP is specified, one is automatically assigned from that subnet.

os_security_group.description: Add/Delete security groups from an OpenStack cloud.
body: os_security_group:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name that has to be given to the security group. This module requires that security group names be unique.
interface: ${2|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
api_timeout: ${3:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
description: ${4:None} # not required. Long description of the purpose of the security group
cert: ${5:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
verify: ${6:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.
cacert: ${7:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
key: ${8:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
region_name: ${9:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.

auth: ${10:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
wait: ${11:true} # not required. Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.

cloud: ${12:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.
availability_zone: ${13:undefined} # not required. Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
state: ${14|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the resource be present or absent.

auth_type: ${15:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.
timeout: ${16:180} # not required. How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.

os_security_group_rule.description: Add/Delete rule from an existing security group
body: os_security_group_rule:
security_group: ${1:undefined} # required. Name or ID of the security group
interface: ${2|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
cert: ${3:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
cacert: ${4:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
key: ${5:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
remote_ip_prefix: ${6:undefined} # not required. Source IP address(es) in CIDR notation (exclusive with remote_group)
wait: ${7:true} # not required. Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.
remote_group: ${8:undefined} # not required. Name or ID of the Security group to link (exclusive with remote_ip_prefix)
availability_zone: ${9:undefined} # not required. Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
region_name: ${10:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.

auth_type: ${11:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.
ethertype: ${12|IPv4,IPv6|} # not required. choices: IPv4;IPv6. Must be IPv4 or IPv6, and addresses represented in CIDR must match the ingress or egress rules. Not all providers support IPv6.
port_range_min: ${13:None} # not required. Starting port
state: ${14|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the resource be present or absent.
api_timeout: ${15:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
protocol: ${16|tcp,udp,icmp,112,None|} # not required. choices: tcp;udp;icmp;112;None. IP protocols TCP UDP ICMP 112 (VRRP)
verify: ${17:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.
direction: ${18|egress,ingress|} # not required. choices: egress;ingress. The direction in which the security group rule is applied. Not all providers support egress.

auth: ${19:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
timeout: ${20:180} # not required. How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.
port_range_max: ${21:None} # not required. Ending port

cloud: ${22:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.
os_server:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name that has to be given to the instance
image: ${2:undefined} # required. The name or id of the base image to boot.

meta: ${3:None} # not required. A list of key value pairs that should be provided as a metadata to the new instance or a string containing a list of key-value pairs. Eg:  meta: "key1=value1,key2=value2"
security_groups: ${4:None} # not required. Names of the security groups to which the instance should be added. This may be a YAML list or a comma separated string.
availability_zone: ${5:undefined} # not required. Availability zone in which to create the server.

nics: ${6:None} # not required. A list of networks to which the instance's interface should be attached. Networks may be referenced by net-id/net-name/port-id or port-name.,Also this accepts a string containing a list of (net/port)-(id/name) Eg: nics: "net-id=uuid-1,port-name=myport" Only one of network or nics should be supplied.
flavor_ram: ${7:1} # not required. The minimum amount of ram in MB that the flavor in which the new instance has to be created must have. Mutually exclusive with flavor.
cacert: ${8:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
volumes: ${9:} # not required. A list of preexisting volumes names or ids to attach to the instance
flavor: ${10:1} # not required. The name or id of the flavor in which the new instance has to be created. Mutually exclusive with flavor_ram
volume_size: ${11:undefined} # not required. The size of the volume to create in GB if booting from volume based on an image.
key: ${12:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
scheduler_hints: ${13:None} # not required. Arbitrary key/value pairs to the scheduler for custom use
floating_ips: ${14:None} # not required. list of valid floating IPs that pre-exist to assign to this node
userdata: ${15:None} # not required. Opaque blob of data which is made available to the instance
wait: ${16:yes} # not required. If the module should wait for the instance to be created.

cloud: ${17:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.

flavor_include: ${18:undefined} # not required. Text to use to filter flavor names, for the case, such as Rackspace, where there are multiple flavors that have the same ram count. flavor_include is a positive match filter - it must exist in the flavor name.
terminate_volume: ${19:false} # not required. If true, delete volume when deleting instance (if booted from volume)
network: ${20:None} # not required. Name or ID of a network to attach this instance to. A simpler version of the nics parameter, only one of network or nics should be supplied.
api_timeout: ${21:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
delete_fip: ${22:false} # not required. When I(state) is absent and this option is true, any floating IP associated with the instance will be deleted along with the instance.
boot_from_volume: ${23:false} # not required. Should the instance boot from a persistent volume created based on the image given. Mututally exclusive with boot_volume.
cert: ${24:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
key_name: ${25:None} # not required. The key pair name to be used when creating a instance
boot_volume: ${26:None} # not required. Volume name or id to use as the volume to boot from. Implies boot_from_volume. Mutually exclusive with image and boot_from_volume.

auth_type: ${27:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.

image_exclude: ${28:undefined} # not required. Text to use to filter image names, for the case, such as HP, where there are multiple image names matching the common identifying portions. image_exclude is a negative match filter - it is text that may not exist in the image name. Defaults to "(deprecated)"

reuse_ips: ${29:true} # not required. When I(auto_ip) is true and this option is true, the I(auto_ip) code will attempt to re-use unassigned floating ips in the project before creating a new one. It is important to note that it is impossible to safely do this concurrently, so if your use case involves concurrent server creation, it is highly recommended to set this to false and to delete the floating ip associated with a server when the server is deleted using I(delete_fip).
region_name: ${30:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.
interface: ${31|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
verify: ${32:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.
config_drive: ${33:no} # not required. Whether to boot the server with config drive enabled
auto_ip: ${34:yes} # not required. Ensure instance has public ip however the cloud wants to do that
timeout: ${35:180} # not required. The amount of time the module should wait for the instance to get into active state.
state: ${36|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the resource be present or absent.

auth: ${37:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
floating_ip_pools: ${38:None} # not required. Name of floating IP pool from which to choose a floating IP

os_server_action.description: Perform actions on Compute Instances from OpenStack
body: os_server_action:
server: ${1:undefined} # required. Name or ID of the instance
interface: ${2|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
api_timeout: ${3:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
availability_zone: ${4:undefined} # not required. Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
cert: ${5:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
verify: ${6:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.
cacert: ${7:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
key: ${8:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
image: ${9:null} # not required. Image the server should be rebuilt with
region_name: ${10:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.

auth: ${11:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
wait: ${12:yes} # not required. If the module should wait for the instance action to be performed.

action: ${13|stop,start,pause,unpause,lock,unlock,suspend,resume,rebuild|} # not required. choices: stop;start;pause;unpause;lock;unlock;suspend;resume;rebuild. Perform the given action. The lock and unlock actions always return changed as the servers API does not provide lock status.
timeout: ${14:180} # not required. The amount of time the module should wait for the instance to perform the requested action.

auth_type: ${15:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.

cloud: ${16:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.

os_server_facts.description: Retrieve facts about one or more compute instances
body: os_server_facts:
interface: ${1|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
api_timeout: ${2:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.

cloud: ${3:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.
server: ${4:None} # not required. restrict results to servers with names or UUID matching this glob expression (e.g., C<web*>).
cert: ${5:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
verify: ${6:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.
cacert: ${7:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
key: ${8:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
detailed: ${9:false} # not required. when true, return additional detail about servers at the expense of additional API calls.
region_name: ${10:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.
wait: ${11:true} # not required. Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.
availability_zone: ${12:undefined} # not required. Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
timeout: ${13:180} # not required. How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.

auth_type: ${14:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.

auth: ${15:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
os_server_group:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Server group name.
interface: ${2|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
api_timeout: ${3:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
availability_zone: ${4:undefined} # not required. Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
cert: ${5:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
verify: ${6:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.
cacert: ${7:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
key: ${8:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
region_name: ${9:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.

policies: ${10:undefined} # not required. A list of one or more policy names to associate with the server group. The list must contain at least one policy name. The current valid policy names are anti-affinity, affinity, soft-anti-affinity and soft-affinity.

auth: ${11:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
wait: ${12:true} # not required. Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.

cloud: ${13:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.
timeout: ${14:180} # not required. How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.
state: ${15|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource. When I(state) is 'present', then I(policies) is required.

auth_type: ${16:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.

volume: ${2:undefined} # required. Name or id of volume you want to attach to a server
interface: ${3|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.

availability_zone: ${5:undefined} # not required. Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
cert: ${6:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.

cacert: ${8:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
key: ${9:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
region_name: ${10:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.
device: ${11:None} # not required. Device you want to attach. Defaults to auto finding a device name.
wait: ${12:true} # not required. Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.

cloud: ${13:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.

state: ${15|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the resource be present or absent.

auth_type: ${16:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.

auth: ${17:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
os_stack:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the stack that should be created, name could be char and digit, no space
interface: ${2|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
api_timeout: ${3:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
template: ${4:None} # not required. Path of the template file to use for the stack creation
cert: ${5:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.

cloud: ${7:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.

parameters: ${9:None} # not required. Dictionary of parameters for the stack creation
verify: ${10:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.
cacert: ${11:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
key: ${12:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
region_name: ${13:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.

auth: ${14:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. timeout: ${17:3600} # not required. Maximum number of seconds to wait for the stack creation
state: ${18|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource

auth_type: ${19:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.

os_subnet.description: Add/Remove subnet to an OpenStack network
body: os_subnet:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the subnet that should be created. Although Neutron allows for non-unique subnet names, this module enforces subnet name uniqueness.
interface: ${2|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
ip_version: ${3:4} # not required. The IP version of the subnet 4 or 6
use_default_subnetpool: ${4:false} # not required. Use the default subnetpool for I(ip_version) to obtain a CIDR.
cert: ${5:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
cacert: ${6:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
allocation_pool_start: ${7:None} # not required. From the subnet pool the starting address from which the IP should be allocated.
no_gateway_ip: ${8:false} # not required. The gateway IP would not be assigned for this subnet
key: ${9:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
enable_dhcp: ${10:true} # not required. Whether DHCP should be enabled for this subnet.
ipv6_address_mode: ${11|dhcpv6-stateful,dhcpv6-stateless,slaac|} # not required. choices: dhcpv6-stateful;dhcpv6-stateless;slaac. IPv6 address mode
network_name: ${12:undefined} # not required. Name of the network to which the subnet should be attached,Required when I(state) is 'present'
wait: ${13:true} # not required. Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.
host_routes: ${14:None} # not required. A list of host route dictionaries for the subnet.
cidr: ${15:None} # not required. The CIDR representation of the subnet that should be assigned to the subnet. Required when I(state) is 'present' and a subnetpool is not specified.
availability_zone: ${16:undefined} # not required. Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
region_name: ${17:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.

auth_type: ${18:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.
api_timeout: ${19:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
verify: ${20:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.
gateway_ip: ${21:None} # not required. The ip that would be assigned to the gateway for this subnet
dns_nameservers: ${22:None} # not required. List of DNS nameservers for this subnet.
ipv6_ra_mode: ${23|dhcpv6-stateful,dhcpv6-stateless,slaac|} # not required. choices: dhcpv6-stateful;dhcpv6-stateless;slaac. IPv6 router advertisement mode

auth: ${24:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
project: ${25:None} # not required. Project name or ID containing the subnet (name admin-only)
allocation_pool_end: ${26:None} # not required. From the subnet pool the last IP that should be assigned to the virtual machines.
timeout: ${27:180} # not required. How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.
state: ${28|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource

cloud: ${29:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.

For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
os_user:

interface: ${2|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.

cacert: ${4:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
key: ${5:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.

enabled: ${7:true} # not required. Is the user enabled
wait: ${8:true} # not required. Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.

cloud: ${9:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. Provides default values for I(auth) and I(auth_type). This parameter is not needed if I(auth) is provided or if OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.
availability_zone: ${10:undefined} # not required. Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility

auth_type: ${11:undefined} # not required. Name of the auth plugin to use. If the cloud uses something other than password authentication, the name of the plugin should be indicated here and the contents of the I(auth) parameter should be updated accordingly.
api_timeout: ${12:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
description: ${13:undefined} # not required. Description about the user
password: ${14:None} # not required. Password for the user
verify: ${15:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.
email: ${16:None} # not required. Email address for the user
domain: ${17:None} # not required. Domain to create the user in if the cloud supports domains

auth: ${18:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
timeout: ${19:180} # not required. How long should ansible wait for the requested resource.
state: ${20|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the resource be present or absent.
update_password: ${21|always,on_create|} # not required. choices: always;on_create. C(always) will attempt to update password.  C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users.
default_project: ${22:None} # not required. Project name or ID that the user should be associated with by default

api_timeout: ${4:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.

For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.

os_user_role.description: Associate OpenStack Identity users and roles
body: os_user_role:
role: ${1:undefined} # required. Name or ID for the role.
interface: ${2|public,internal,admin|} # not required. choices: public;internal;admin. Endpoint URL type to fetch from the service catalog.
api_timeout: ${3:undefined} # not required. How long should the socket layer wait before timing out for API calls. If this is omitted, nothing will be passed to the requests library.
availability_zone: ${4:undefined} # not required. Ignored. Present for backwards compatibility
cert: ${5:undefined} # not required. A path to a client certificate to use as part of the SSL transaction.
verify: ${6:undefined} # not required. Whether or not SSL API requests should be verified. Before 2.3 this defaulted to True.
cacert: ${7:undefined} # not required. A path to a CA Cert bundle that can be used as part of verifying SSL API requests.
user: ${8:null} # not required. Name or ID for the user. If I(user) is not specified, then I(group) is required. Both may not be specified.
key: ${9:undefined} # not required. A path to a client key to use as part of the SSL transaction.
region_name: ${10:undefined} # not required. Name of the region.
domain: ${11:null} # not required. ID of the domain to scope the role association to. Valid only with keystone version 3, and required if I(project) is not specified.

auth: ${12:undefined} # not required. Dictionary containing auth information as needed by the cloud's auth plugin strategy. For the default I(password) plugin, this would contain I(auth_url), I(username), I(password), I(project_name) and any information about domains if the cloud supports them. For other plugins, this param will need to contain whatever parameters that auth plugin requires. This parameter is not needed if a named cloud is provided or OpenStack OS_* environment variables are present.
project: ${13:null} # not required. Name or ID of the project to scope the role association to. If you are using keystone version 2, then this value is required.
wait: ${14:true} # not required. Should ansible wait until the requested resource is complete.

cloud: ${15:undefined} # not required. Named cloud or cloud config to operate against. If I(cloud) is a string, it references a named cloud config as defined in an OpenStack clouds.yaml file. If I(cloud) is a dict, it contains a complete cloud configuration like would be in a section of clouds.yaml.

state: ${17|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the roles be present or absent on the user.
