osx_defaults.description: osx_defaults allows users to read, write, and delete Mac OS X user defaults from Ansible
body: osx_defaults:
key: ${1:undefined} # required. The key of the user preference
array_add: ${2|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Add new elements to the array for a key which has an array as its value.
type: ${3|array,bool,boolean,date,float,int,integer,string|} # not required. choices: array;bool;boolean;date;float;int;integer;string. The type of value to write.
host: ${4:null} # not required. The host on which the preference should apply. The special value "currentHost" corresponds to the "-currentHost" switch of the defaults commandline tool.
value: ${5:null} # not required. The value to write. Only required when state = present.
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The state of the user defaults
domain: ${7:NSGlobalDomain} # not required. The domain is a domain name of the form com.companyname.appname.
say:
msg: ${1:undefined} # required. What to say
voice: ${2:undefined} # not required. What voice to use
ovh_ip_loadbalancing_backend:
backend: ${1:undefined} # required. The IP address of the backend to update / modify / delete
endpoint: ${2:undefined} # required. The endpoint to use ( for instance ovh-eu)
application_secret: ${3:undefined} # required. The application secret to use
name: ${4:undefined} # required. Name of the LoadBalancing internal name (ip-X.X.X.X)
application_key: ${5:undefined} # required. The applicationKey to use
consumer_key: ${6:undefined} # required. The consumer key to use
weight: ${7:8} # not required. Determines the weight for this backend
probe: ${8|none,http,icmp,oco|} # not required. choices: none;http;icmp;oco. Determines the type of probe to use for this backend
timeout: ${9:120} # not required. The timeout in seconds used to wait for a task to be completed.
state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines whether the backend is to be created/modified or deleted
ovirt:
instance_name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the instance to use.
url: ${2:undefined} # required. The url of the oVirt instance.
password: ${3:undefined} # required. Password of the user to authenticate with.
user: ${4:undefined} # required. The user to authenticate with.
image: ${5:undefined} # not required. The template to use for the instance.
instance_ip: ${6:undefined} # not required. Define the instance's IP.
instance_key: ${7:undefined} # not required. Define the instance's Authorized key.
instance_disksize: ${8:undefined} # not required. Size of the instance's disk in GB.
instance_cpus: ${9:1} # not required. The instance's number of CPUs.
zone: ${10:undefined} # not required. Deploy the image to this oVirt cluster.
instance_hostname: ${11:undefined} # not required. Define the instance's Hostname.
instance_os: ${12:undefined} # not required. Type of Operating System.
resource_type: ${13|new,template|} # not required. choices: new;template. Whether you want to deploy an image or create an instance from scratch.
instance_netmask: ${14:undefined} # not required. Define the instance's Netmask.
sdomain: ${15:undefined} # not required. The Storage Domain where you want to create the instance's disk on.
disk_alloc: ${16|preallocated,thin|} # not required. choices: preallocated;thin. Define whether disk is thin or preallocated.
instance_network: ${17:rhevm} # not required. The logical network the machine should belong to.
region: ${18:undefined} # not required. The oVirt/RHEV datacenter where you want to deploy to.
instance_mem: ${19:undefined} # not required. The instance's amount of memory in MB.
instance_nic: ${20:undefined} # not required. The name of the network interface in oVirt/RHEV.
instance_cores: ${21:1} # not required. Define the instance's number of cores.
instance_dns: ${22:undefined} # not required. Define the instance's Primary DNS server.
instance_rootpw: ${23:undefined} # not required. Define the instance's Root password.

instance_type: ${24|desktop,server,high_performance|} # not required. choices: desktop;server;high_performance. Define whether the instance is a server, desktop or high_performance.,I(high_performance) is supported since Ansible 2.5 and oVirt/RHV 4.2.
state: ${25|absent,present,restarted,shutdown,started|} # not required. choices: absent;present;restarted;shutdown;started. Create, terminate or remove instances.
instance_domain: ${26:undefined} # not required. Define the instance's Domain.
disk_int: ${27|ide,virtio|} # not required. choices: ide;virtio. Interface type of the disk.

ovirt_affinity_group.description: Module to manage affinity groups in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_affinity_group:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the affinity group to manage.
cluster: ${3:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster of the affinity group.
vm_enforcing: ${4:undefined} # not required. If I(yes) VM cannot start if it does not satisfy the C(vm_rule).
host_enforcing: ${5:undefined} # not required. If I(yes) VM cannot start on host if it does not satisfy the C(host_rule).,This parameter is support since oVirt/RHV 4.1 version.

host_rule: ${6|negative,positive|} # not required. choices: negative;positive. If I(positive) I(all) VMs in this group should run on the this host.,If I(negative) I(no) VMs in this group should run on the this host.,This parameter is support since oVirt/RHV 4.1 version.

vm_rule: ${7|disabled,negative,positive|} # not required. choices: disabled;negative;positive. If I(positive) I(all) VMs in this group should run on the host defined by C(host_rule).,If I(negative) I(no) VMs in this group should run on the host defined by C(host_rule).,If I(disabled) this affinity group doesn't take effect.
nested_attributes: ${8:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
poll_interval: ${9:3} # not required. Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
wait: ${10:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.
description: ${11:undefined} # not required. Description of the affinity group.

fetch_nested: ${12:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
state: ${13|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Should the affinity group be present or absent.
timeout: ${14:180} # not required. The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
hosts: ${15:undefined} # not required. List of the hosts names, which should have assigned this affinity group.,This parameter is support since oVirt/RHV 4.1 version.
vms: ${16:undefined} # not required. List of the VMs names, which should have assigned this affinity group.

ovirt_affinity_label.description: Module to manage affinity labels in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_affinity_label:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the affinity label to manage.
cluster: ${3:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster where vms and hosts resides.
poll_interval: ${4:3} # not required. Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
hosts: ${5:undefined} # not required. List of the hosts names, which should have assigned this affinity label.
wait: ${6:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.
nested_attributes: ${7:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).

fetch_nested: ${8:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
state: ${9|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the affinity label be present or absent.
timeout: ${10:180} # not required. The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
vms: ${11:undefined} # not required. List of the VMs names, which should have assigned this affinity label.

ovirt_affinity_label_facts.description: Retrieve facts about one or more oVirt/RHV affinity labels
body: ovirt_affinity_label_facts:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
vm: ${2:undefined} # not required. Name of the VM, which affinity labels should be listed.
nested_attributes: ${3:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).

fetch_nested: ${4:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
host: ${5:undefined} # not required. Name of the host, which affinity labels should be listed.
name: ${6:undefined} # not required. Name of the affinity labels which should be listed.

ovirt_api_facts.description: Retrieve facts about the oVirt/RHV API
body: ovirt_api_facts:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
nested_attributes: ${2:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).

fetch_nested: ${3:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).

ovirt_auth.description: Module to manage authentication to oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_auth:
insecure: ${1:undefined} # not required. A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specifies if a token should be created or revoked.
password: ${3:undefined} # not required. The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.
username: ${4:undefined} # not required. The name of the user. For example: I(admin@internal) Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.
token: ${5:undefined} # not required. SSO token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.

compress: ${6:undefined} # not required. A boolean flag indicating if the SDK should ask the server to send compressed responses. The default is I(True). Note that this is a hint for the server, and that it may return uncompressed data even when this parameter is set to I(True).
kerberos: ${7:undefined} # not required. A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.

url: ${8:undefined} # not required. A string containing the base URL of the server. For example: I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.

ca_file: ${9:undefined} # not required. A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If C(ca_file) parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.
headers: ${10:undefined} # not required. A dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.

timeout: ${11:undefined} # not required. The maximum total time to wait for the response, in seconds. A value of zero (the default) means wait forever. If the timeout expires before the response is received an exception will be raised.

ovirt_cluster.description: Module to manage clusters in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_cluster:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the cluster to manage.

auth: ${2:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
serial_policy_value: ${3:undefined} # not required. Allows you to specify a custom serial number.,This parameter is used only when C(serial_policy) is I(custom).
fence_enabled: ${4:undefined} # not required. If I(True) enables fencing on the cluster.,Fencing is enabled by default.

migration_compressed: ${5|true,false,inherit|} # not required. choices: true;false;inherit. If I(True) compression is used during live migration of the virtual machine.,Used only when C(migration_policy) is set to I(legacy).,Following options are supported:,C(true) - Override the global setting to I(true).,C(false) - Override the global setting to I(false).,C(inherit) - Use value which is set globally.

fence_skip_if_connectivity_broken: ${6:undefined} # not required. If I(True) fencing will be temporarily disabled if the percentage of hosts in the cluster that are experiencing connectivity issues is greater than or equal to the defined threshold.,The threshold can be specified by C(fence_connectivity_threshold).
wait: ${7:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.

vm_reason: ${8:undefined} # not required. If I(True) enable an optional reason field when a virtual machine is shut down from the Manager, allowing the administrator to provide an explanation for the maintenance.

serial_policy: ${9:undefined} # not required. Specify a serial number policy for the virtual machines in the cluster.,Following options are supported:,C(vm) - Sets the virtual machine's UUID as its serial number.,C(host) - Sets the host's UUID as the virtual machine's serial number.,C(custom) - Allows you to specify a custom serial number in C(serial_policy_value).

migration_policy: ${10|legacy,minimal_downtime,suspend_workload,post_copy|} # not required. choices: legacy;minimal_downtime;suspend_workload;post_copy. A migration policy defines the conditions for live migrating virtual machines in the event of host failure.,Following policies are supported:,C(legacy) - Legacy behavior of 3.6 version.,C(minimal_downtime) - Virtual machines should not experience any significant downtime.,C(suspend_workload) - Virtual machines may experience a more significant downtime.,C(post_copy) - Virtual machines should not experience any significant downtime. If the VM migration is not converging for a long time, the migration will be switched to post-copy. Added in version I(2.4).
threads_as_cores: ${11:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the exposed host threads would be treated as cores which can be utilized by virtual machines.
cpu_arch: ${12|x86_64,ppc64,undefined|} # not required. choices: x86_64;ppc64;undefined. CPU architecture of cluster.
network: ${13:undefined} # not required. Management network of cluster to access cluster hosts.

external_network_providers: ${14:undefined} # not required. List of references to the external network providers available in the cluster. If the automatic deployment of the external network provider is supported, the networks of the referenced network provider are available on every host in the cluster.,External network provider is described by following dictionary:,C(name) - Name of the external network provider. Either C(name) or C(id) is required.,C(id) - ID of the external network provider. Either C(name) or C(id) is required.,This is supported since oVirt version 4.2.

switch_type: ${15|legacy,ovs|} # not required. choices: legacy;ovs. Type of switch to be used by all networks in given cluster. Either I(legacy) which is using linux brigde or I(ovs) using Open vSwitch.
mac_pool: ${16:undefined} # not required. MAC pool to be used by this cluster.,C(Note:),This is supported since oVirt version 4.1.
fence_skip_if_sd_active: ${17:undefined} # not required. If I(True) any hosts in the cluster that are Non Responsive and still connected to storage will not be fenced.
fence_connectivity_threshold: ${18:undefined} # not required. The threshold used by C(fence_skip_if_connectivity_broken).

host_reason: ${19:undefined} # not required. If I(True) enable an optional reason field when a host is placed into maintenance mode from the Manager, allowing the administrator to provide an explanation for the maintenance.

migration_bandwidth: ${20|auto,hypervisor_default,custom|} # not required. choices: auto;hypervisor_default;custom. The bandwidth settings define the maximum bandwidth of both outgoing and incoming migrations per host.,Following bandwidth options are supported:,C(auto) - Bandwidth is copied from the I(rate limit) [Mbps] setting in the data center host network QoS.,C(hypervisor_default) - Bandwidth is controlled by local VDSM setting on sending host.,C(custom) - Defined by user (in Mbps).
poll_interval: ${21:3} # not required. Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
ballooning: ${22:undefined} # not required. If I(True) enable memory balloon optimization. Memory balloon is used to re-distribute / reclaim the host memory based on VM needs in a dynamic way.
timeout: ${23:180} # not required. The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
migration_bandwidth_limit: ${24:undefined} # not required. Set the I(custom) migration bandwidth limit.,This parameter is used only when C(migration_bandwidth) is I(custom).
comment: ${25:undefined} # not required. Comment of the cluster.
rng_sources: ${26:undefined} # not required. List that specify the random number generator devices that all hosts in the cluster will use.,Supported generators are: I(hwrng) and I(random).
ha_reservation: ${27:undefined} # not required. If I(True) enable the oVirt/RHV to monitor cluster capacity for highly available virtual machines.
nested_attributes: ${28:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
scheduling_policy: ${29:undefined} # not required. Name of the scheduling policy to be used for cluster.
cpu_type: ${30:undefined} # not required. CPU codename. For example I(Intel SandyBridge Family).
compatibility_version: ${31:undefined} # not required. The compatibility version of the cluster. All hosts in this cluster must support at least this compatibility version.
virt: ${32:undefined} # not required. If I(True), hosts in this cluster will be used to run virtual machines.

memory_policy: ${33|disabled,server,desktop|} # not required. choices: disabled;server;desktop. I(disabled) - Disables memory page sharing.,I(server) - Sets the memory page sharing threshold to 150% of the system memory on each host.,I(desktop) - Sets the memory page sharing threshold to 200% of the system memory on each host.
state: ${34|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the cluster be present or absent
description: ${35:undefined} # not required. Description of the cluster.
spice_proxy: ${36:undefined} # not required. The proxy by which the SPICE client will connect to virtual machines.,The address must be in the following format: I(protocol://[host]:[port])
data_center: ${37:undefined} # not required. Datacenter name where cluster reside.

gluster: ${38:undefined} # not required. If I(True), hosts in this cluster will be used as Gluster Storage server nodes, and not for running virtual machines.,By default the cluster is created for virtual machine hosts.
ksm: ${39:undefined} # not required. I I(True) MoM enables to run Kernel Same-page Merging I(KSM) when necessary and when it can yield a memory saving benefit that outweighs its CPU cost.

migration_auto_converge: ${40|true,false,inherit|} # not required. choices: true;false;inherit. If I(True) auto-convergence is used during live migration of virtual machines.,Used only when C(migration_policy) is set to I(legacy).,Following options are supported:,C(true) - Override the global setting to I(true).,C(false) - Override the global setting to I(false).,C(inherit) - Use value which is set globally.
trusted_service: ${41:undefined} # not required. If (True) enable integration with an OpenAttestation server.

resilience_policy: ${42|do_not_migrate,migrate,migrate_highly_available|} # not required. choices: do_not_migrate;migrate;migrate_highly_available. The resilience policy defines how the virtual machines are prioritized in the migration.,Following values are supported:,C(do_not_migrate) -  Prevents virtual machines from being migrated. ,C(migrate) - Migrates all virtual machines in order of their defined priority.,C(migrate_highly_available) - Migrates only highly available virtual machines to prevent overloading other hosts.

fetch_nested: ${43:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
ksm_numa: ${44:undefined} # not required. If I(True) enables KSM C(ksm) for best berformance inside NUMA nodes.

ovirt_cluster_facts.description: Retrieve facts about one or more oVirt/RHV clusters
body: ovirt_cluster_facts:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
nested_attributes: ${2:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).

fetch_nested: ${3:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
pattern: ${4:undefined} # not required. Search term which is accepted by oVirt/RHV search backend.,For example to search cluster X from datacenter Y use following pattern: name=X and datacenter=Y

ovirt_datacenter.description: Module to manage data centers in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_datacenter:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the data center to manage.
local: ${3:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the data center should be local, I(False) if should be shared.,Default value is set by engine.
description: ${4:undefined} # not required. Description of the data center.
nested_attributes: ${5:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
wait: ${6:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.

mac_pool: ${7:undefined} # not required. MAC pool to be used by this datacenter.,IMPORTANT: This option is deprecated in oVirt/RHV 4.1. You should use C(mac_pool) in C(ovirt_clusters) module, as MAC pools are set per cluster since 4.1.
quota_mode: ${8|disabled,audit,enabled|} # not required. choices: disabled;audit;enabled. Quota mode of the data center. One of I(disabled), I(audit) or I(enabled)
poll_interval: ${9:3} # not required. Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
comment: ${10:undefined} # not required. Comment of the data center.
compatibility_version: ${11:undefined} # not required. Compatibility version of the data center.

force: ${12:false} # not required. This parameter can be used only when removing a data center. If I(True) data center will be forcibly removed, even though it contains some clusters. Default value is I(False), which means that only empty data center can be removed.

fetch_nested: ${13:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
state: ${14|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the data center be present or absent
timeout: ${15:180} # not required. The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.

ovirt_datacenter_facts.description: Retrieve facts about one or more oVirt/RHV datacenters
body: ovirt_datacenter_facts:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
nested_attributes: ${2:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).

fetch_nested: ${3:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
pattern: ${4:undefined} # not required. Search term which is accepted by oVirt/RHV search backend.,For example to search datacenter I(X) use following pattern: I(name=X)

ovirt_disk.description: Module to manage Virtual Machine and floating disks in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_disk:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
interface: ${2|virtio,ide,virtio_scsi|} # not required. choices: virtio;ide;virtio_scsi. Driver of the storage interface.

image_provider: ${3:undefined} # not required. When C(state) is I(exported) disk is exported to given Glance image provider.,C(**IMPORTANT**),There is no reliable way to achieve idempotency, so every time you specify this parameter the disk is exported, so please handle your playbook accordingly to not export the disk all the time. This option is valid only for template disks.
nested_attributes: ${4:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
bootable: ${5:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the disk should be bootable. By default when disk is created it isn't bootable.
storage_domain: ${6:undefined} # not required. Storage domain name where disk should be created. By default storage is chosen by oVirt/RHV engine.
wait: ${7:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.

sparsify: ${8:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the disk should be sparsified.,Sparsification frees space in the disk image that is not used by its filesystem. As a result, the image will occupy less space on the storage.,Note that this parameter isn't idempotent, as it's not possible to check if the disk should be or should not be sparsified.

sparse: ${9:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the disk should be sparse (also known as I(thin provision)). If the parameter is omitted, cow disks will be created as sparse and raw disks as I(preallocated),Note that this option isn't idempotent as it's not currently possible to change sparseness of the disk via API.

download_image_path: ${10:undefined} # not required. Path on a file system where disk should be downloaded.,Note that you must have an valid oVirt/RHV engine CA in your system trust store or you must provide it in C(ca_file) parameter.,Note that the disk is not downloaded when the file already exists, but you can forcibly download the disk when using C(force) I (true).
vm_id: ${11:undefined} # not required. ID of the Virtual Machine to manage. Either C(vm_id) or C(vm_name) is required if C(state) is I(attached) or I(detached).

logical_unit: ${12:undefined} # not required. Dictionary which describes LUN to be directly attached to VM:,C(address) - Address of the storage server. Used by iSCSI.,C(port) - Port of the storage server. Used by iSCSI.,C(target) - iSCSI target.,C(lun_id) - LUN id.,C(username) - CHAP Username to be used to access storage server. Used by iSCSI.,C(password) - CHAP Password of the user to be used to access storage server. Used by iSCSI.,C(storage_type) - Storage type either I(fcp) or I(iscsi).

storage_domains: ${13:undefined} # not required. Storage domain names where disk should be copied.,C(**IMPORTANT**),There is no reliable way to achieve idempotency, so every time you specify this parameter the disks are copied, so please handle your playbook accordingly to not copy the disks all the time. This is valid only for VM and floating disks, template disks works as expected.
quota_id: ${14:undefined} # not required. Disk quota ID to be used for disk. By default quota is chosen by oVirt/RHV engine.
timeout: ${15:180} # not required. The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
name: ${16:undefined} # not required. Name of the disk to manage. Either C(id) or C(name)/C(alias) is required.
profile: ${17:undefined} # not required. Disk profile name to be attached to disk. By default profile is chosen by oVirt/RHV engine.
size: ${18:undefined} # not required. Size of the disk. Size should be specified using IEC standard units. For example 10GiB, 1024MiB, etc.,Size can be only increased, not decreased.

upload_image_path: ${19:undefined} # not required. Path to disk image, which should be uploaded.,Note that currently we support only compatibility version 0.10 of the qcow disk.,Note that you must have an valid oVirt/RHV engine CA in your system trust store or you must provide it in C(ca_file) parameter.,Note that there is no reliable way to achieve idempotency, so if you want to upload the disk even if the disk with C(id) or C(name) exists, then please use C(force) I(true). If you will use C(force) I(false), which is default, then the disk image won't be uploaded.
force: ${20:undefined} # not required. Please take a look at C(image_path) documentation to see the correct usage of this parameter.
description: ${21:undefined} # not required. Description of the disk image to manage.
format: ${22|raw,cow|} # not required. choices: raw;cow. Specify format of the disk.,Note that this option isn't idempotent as it's not currently possible to change format of the disk via API.
id: ${23:undefined} # not required. ID of the disk to manage. Either C(id) or C(name) is required.
vm_name: ${24:undefined} # not required. Name of the Virtual Machine to manage. Either C(vm_id) or C(vm_name) is required if C(state) is I(attached) or I(detached).
poll_interval: ${25:3} # not required. Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
openstack_volume_type: ${26:undefined} # not required. Name of the openstack volume type. This is valid when working with cinder.
shareable: ${27:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the disk should be shareable. By default when disk is created it isn't shareable.

fetch_nested: ${28:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
state: ${29|present,absent,attached,detached|} # not required. choices: present;absent;attached;detached. Should the Virtual Machine disk be present/absent/attached/detached.

ovirt_disk_facts.description: Retrieve facts about one or more oVirt/RHV disks
body: ovirt_disk_facts:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
nested_attributes: ${2:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).

fetch_nested: ${3:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
pattern: ${4:undefined} # not required. Search term which is accepted by oVirt/RHV search backend.,For example to search Disk X from storage Y use following pattern: name=X and storage.name=Y

ovirt_external_provider.description: Module to manage external providers in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_external_provider:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
type: ${2|os_image,network,os_volume,foreman|} # not required. choices: os_image;network;os_volume;foreman. Type of the external provider.
description: ${3:undefined} # not required. Description of the external provider.
authentication_url: ${4:undefined} # not required. Keystone authentication URL of the openstack provider.,Applicable for those types: I(os_image), I(os_volume) and I(network).
read_only: ${5:undefined} # not required. Specify if the network should be read only.,Applicable if C(type) is I(network).
nested_attributes: ${6:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
password: ${7:undefined} # not required. Password of the user specified in C(username) parameter.,Applicable for all types.

fetch_nested: ${8:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
wait: ${9:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.
poll_interval: ${10:3} # not required. Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.

network_type: ${11|external,neutron|} # not required. choices: external;neutron. Type of the external network provider either external (for example OVN) or neutron.,Applicable if C(type) is I(network).
data_center: ${12:undefined} # not required. Name of the data center where provider should be attached.,Applicable for those type: I(os_volume).
url: ${13:undefined} # not required. URL where external provider is hosted.,Applicable for those types: I(os_image), I(os_volume), I(network) and I(foreman).
state: ${14|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the external be present or absent
username: ${15:undefined} # not required. Username to be used for login to external provider.,Applicable for all types.
tenant_name: ${16:undefined} # not required. Name of the tenant.,Applicable for those types: I(os_image), I(os_volume) and I(network).
name: ${17:undefined} # not required. Name of the external provider to manage.
timeout: ${18:180} # not required. The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.

ovirt_host_networks.description: Module to manage host networks in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_host_networks:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the host to manage networks for.
interface: ${3:undefined} # not required. Name of the network interface where logical network should be attached.
save: ${4:undefined} # not required. If I(true) network configuration will be persistent, by default they are temporary.
nested_attributes: ${5:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).

check: ${6:undefined} # not required. If I(true) verify connectivity between host and engine.,Network configuration changes will be rolled back if connectivity between engine and the host is lost after changing network configuration.
labels: ${7:undefined} # not required. List of names of the network label to be assigned to bond or interface.
poll_interval: ${8:3} # not required. Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.

networks: ${9:undefined} # not required. List of dictionary describing networks to be attached to interface or bond:,C(name) - Name of the logical network to be assigned to bond or interface.,C(boot_protocol) - Boot protocol one of the I(none), I(static) or I(dhcp).,C(address) - IP address in case of I(static) boot protocol is used.,C(prefix) - Routing prefix in case of I(static) boot protocol is used.,C(gateway) - Gateway in case of I(static) boot protocol is used.,C(version) - IP version. Either v4 or v6. Default is v4.
wait: ${10:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.
bond: ${11:undefined} # not required. Dictionary describing network bond:,C(name) - Bond name.,C(mode) - Bonding mode.,C(interfaces) - List of interfaces to create a bond.
state: ${12|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the host be present/absent.

fetch_nested: ${13:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
timeout: ${14:180} # not required. The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.

slot: ${3:undefined} # not required. Power management slot.

type: ${5:undefined} # not required. Type of the power management. oVirt/RHV predefined values are I(drac5), I(ipmilan), I(rsa), I(bladecenter), I(alom), I(apc), I(apc_snmp), I(eps), I(wti), I(rsb), I(cisco_ucs), I(drac7), I(hpblade), I(ilo), I(ilo2), I(ilo3), I(ilo4), I(ilo_ssh), but user can have defined custom type.
password: ${6:undefined} # not required. Password of the user specified in C(username) parameter.
nested_attributes: ${7:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
port: ${8:undefined} # not required. Power management interface port.
order: ${9:undefined} # not required. Integer value specifying, by default it's added at the end.
options: ${10:undefined} # not required. Dictionary of additional fence agent options.,Additional information about options can be found at U(https://fedorahosted.org/cluster/wiki/FenceArguments).
poll_interval: ${11:3} # not required. Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
wait: ${12:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.
encrypt_options: ${13:undefined} # not required. If (true) options will be encrypted when send to agent.

fetch_nested: ${14:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
state: ${15|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the host be present/absent.
username: ${16:undefined} # not required. Username to be used to connect to power management interface.
timeout: ${17:180} # not required. The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.

ovirt_host_storage_facts.description: Retrieve facts about one or more oVirt/RHV HostStorages (applicable only for block storage)
body: ovirt_host_storage_facts:
host: ${1:undefined} # required. Host to get device list from.

auth: ${2:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.

fcp: ${3:undefined} # not required. Dictionary with values for fibre channel storage type:,C(address) - Address of the fibre channel storage server.,C(port) - Port of the fibre channel storage server.,C(lun_id) - LUN id.
nested_attributes: ${4:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).

iscsi: ${5:undefined} # not required. Dictionary with values for iSCSI storage type:,C(address) - Address of the iSCSI storage server.,C(target) - The target IQN for the storage device.,C(username) - A CHAP user name for logging into a target.,C(password) - A CHAP password for logging into a target.

fetch_nested: ${6:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).

ovirt_hosts.description: Module to manage hosts in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_hosts:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the host to manage.

auth: ${2:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
cluster: ${3:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster, where host should be created.
address: ${4:undefined} # not required. Host address. It can be either FQDN (preferred) or IP address.
nested_attributes: ${5:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
wait: ${6:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.
public_key: ${7:false} # not required. I(True) if the public key should be used to authenticate to host.,It's required in case C(password) is not set.
poll_interval: ${8:3} # not required. Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.

kernel_params: ${9:undefined} # not required. List of kernel boot parameters.,Following are most common kernel parameters used for host:,Hostdev Passthrough & SR-IOV: intel_iommu=on,Nested Virtualization: kvm-intel.nested=1,Unsafe Interrupts: vfio_iommu_type1.allow_unsafe_interrupts=1,PCI Reallocation: pci=realloc,C(Note:),Modifying kernel boot parameters settings can lead to a host boot failure. Please consult the product documentation before doing any changes.,Kernel boot parameters changes require host deploy and restart. The host needs to be I(reinstalled) suceesfully and then to be I(rebooted) for kernel boot parameters to be applied.

hosted_engine: ${10:undefined} # not required. If I(deploy) it means this host should deploy also hosted engine components.,If I(undeploy) it means this host should un-deploy hosted engine components and this host will not function as part of the High Availability cluster.
override_iptables: ${11:undefined} # not required. If True host iptables will be overridden by host deploy script.,Note that C(override_iptables) is I(false) by default in oVirt/RHV.
activate: ${12:true} # not required. If C(state) is I(present) activate the host.,This parameter is good to disable, when you don't want to change the state of host when using I(present) C(state).
timeout: ${13:180} # not required. The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
force: ${14:false} # not required. If True host will be forcibly moved to desired state.
check_upgrade: ${15:true} # not required. If I(true) and C(state) is I(upgraded) run check for upgrade action before executing upgrade action.
password: ${16:undefined} # not required. Password of the root. It's required in case C(public_key) is set to I(False).
override_display: ${17:undefined} # not required. Override the display address of all VMs on this host with specified address.
spm_priority: ${18:undefined} # not required. SPM priority of the host. Integer value from 1 to 10, where higher number means higher priority.
kdump_integration: ${19|enabled,disabled|} # not required. choices: enabled;disabled. Specify if host will have enabled Kdump integration.
power_management_enabled: ${20:undefined} # not required. Enable or disable power management of the host.,For more comprehensive setup of PM use C(ovirt_host_pm) module.

iscsi: ${21:undefined} # not required. If C(state) is I(iscsidiscover) it means that the iscsi attribute is being used to discover targets,If C(state) is I(iscsilogin) it means that the iscsi attribute is being used to login to the specified targets passed as part of the iscsi attribute

fetch_nested: ${22:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).

state: ${23|present,absent,maintenance,upgraded,started,restarted,stopped,reinstalled,iscsidiscover,iscsilogin|} # not required. choices: present;absent;maintenance;upgraded;started;restarted;stopped;reinstalled;iscsidiscover;iscsilogin. State which should a host to be in after successful completion.,I(iscsilogin) and I(iscsidiscover) are supported since version 2.4.
comment: ${24:undefined} # not required. Description of the host.

ovirt_hosts_facts.description: Retrieve facts about one or more oVirt/RHV hosts
body: ovirt_hosts_facts:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
nested_attributes: ${2:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).

fetch_nested: ${3:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
pattern: ${4:undefined} # not required. Search term which is accepted by oVirt/RHV search backend.,For example to search host X from datacenter Y use following pattern: name=X and datacenter=Y

ovirt_mac_pools.description: Module to manage MAC pools in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_mac_pools:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the MAC pool to manage.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the mac pool be present or absent.

Default is I(true).,C(required) - I(true) if the network must remain operational for all hosts associated with this network.,C(display) - I(true) if the network should marked as display network.,C(migration) - I(true) if the network should marked as migration network.,C(gluster) - I(true) if the network should marked as gluster network.

In most LDAPs it's I(uid) of the user, but in Active Directory you must specify I(UPN) of the user.,Note that if user does not exist in the system this module will fail, you should ensure the user exists by using M(ovirt_users) module.

Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
authz_name: ${2:undefined} # required. Authorization provider of the user/group. In previous versions of oVirt/RHV known as domain.
group_name: ${3:undefined} # not required. Name of the group to manage.
nested_attributes: ${4:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
namespace: ${5:undefined} # not required. Namespace of the authorization provider, where user/group resides.

fetch_nested: ${6:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
user_name: ${7:undefined} # not required. Username of the user to manage. In most LDAPs it's I(uid) of the user, but in Active Directory you must specify I(UPN) of the user.

ovirt_quotas.description: Module to manage datacenter quotas in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_quotas:
data_center: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the datacenter where quota should be managed.

auth: ${2:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
name: ${3:undefined} # required. Name of the quota to manage.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the quota be present/absent.
cluster_grace: ${5:undefined} # not required. Cluster grace(hard limit) defined in percentage (1-100).
description: ${6:undefined} # not required. Description of the quota to manage.
cluster_threshold: ${7:undefined} # not required. Cluster threshold(soft limit) defined in percentage (0-100).
storage_grace: ${8:undefined} # not required. Storage grace(hard limit) defined in percentage (1-100).
nested_attributes: ${9:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
storage_threshold: ${10:undefined} # not required. Storage threshold(soft limit) defined in percentage (0-100).
poll_interval: ${11:3} # not required. Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
wait: ${12:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.

storages: ${13:undefined} # not required. List of dictionary of storage limits, which is valid to specific storage.,If storage isn't spefied it's valid to all storages in system:,C(storage) - Name of the storage.,C(size) - Size limit (in GiB).

clusters: ${14:undefined} # not required. List of dictionary of cluster limits, which is valid to specific cluster.,If cluster isn't spefied it's valid to all clusters in system:,C(cluster) - Name of the cluster.,C(memory) - Memory limit (in GiB).,C(cpu) - CPU limit.

fetch_nested: ${15:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
timeout: ${16:180} # not required. The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
