ovirt_storage_connections.description: Module to manage storage connections in oVirt
body: ovirt_storage_connections:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
address: ${2:undefined} # not required. Address of the storage server. E.g.: myserver.mydomain.com
type: ${3:undefined} # not required. Storage type. For example: I(nfs), I(iscsi), etc.
nfs_version: ${4:undefined} # not required. NFS version. One of: I(auto), I(v3), I(v4) or I(v4_1).
nested_attributes: ${5:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
nfs_timeout: ${6:undefined} # not required. The time in tenths of a second to wait for a response before retrying NFS requests. Range 0 to 65535.
port: ${7:undefined} # not required. Port of the iSCSI storage server.
target: ${8:undefined} # not required. The target IQN for the storage device.
path: ${9:undefined} # not required. Path of the mount point of the storage. E.g.: /path/to/my/data
poll_interval: ${10:3} # not required. Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
mount_options: ${11:undefined} # not required. Option which will be passed when mounting storage.
wait: ${12:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.
timeout: ${13:180} # not required. The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
storage: ${14:undefined} # not required. Name of the storage domain to be used with storage connection.

force: ${15:undefined} # not required. This parameter is releven only when updating a connection.,If I(true) the storage domain don't have to be in I(MAINTENANCE) state, so the storage connection is updated.
password: ${16:undefined} # not required. A CHAP password for logging into a target.
username: ${17:undefined} # not required. A CHAP username for logging into a target.
vfs_type: ${18:undefined} # not required. Virtual File System type.
id: ${19:undefined} # not required. Id of the storage connection to manage.

fetch_nested: ${20:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
state: ${21|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the storage connection be present or absent.
nfs_retrans: ${22:undefined} # not required. The number of times to retry a request before attempting further recovery actions. Range 0 to 65535.

ovirt_storage_domains.description: Module to manage storage domains in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_storage_domains:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.

discard_after_delete: ${2:undefined} # not required. If I(True) storage domain blocks will be discarded upon deletion. Enabled by default.,This parameter is relevant only for block based storage domains.
name: ${3:undefined} # not required. Name of the storage domain to manage. (Not required when state is I(imported))
backup: ${4:undefined} # not required. Boolean flag which indicates whether the storage domain is configured as backup or not.
warning_low_space: ${5:undefined} # not required. Inidcates the minimum percentage of a free space in a storage domain to present a warning.
localfs: ${6:undefined} # not required. Dictionary with values for localfs storage type:,C(path) - Path of the mount point. E.g.: /path/to/my/data,Note that these parameters are not idempotent.
poll_interval: ${7:3} # not required. Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
wipe_after_delete: ${8:undefined} # not required. Boolean flag which indicates whether the storage domain should wipe the data after delete.

posixfs: ${9:undefined} # not required. Dictionary with values for PosixFS storage type:,C(path) - Path of the mount point. E.g.: /path/to/my/data,C(vfs_type) - Virtual File System type.,C(mount_options) - Option which will be passed when mounting storage.,Note that these parameters are not idempotent.
wait: ${10:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.

domain_function: ${11|data,iso,export|} # not required. choices: data;iso;export. Function of the storage domain.,This parameter isn't idempotent, it's not possible to change domain function of storage domain.
host: ${12:undefined} # not required. Host to be used to mount storage.

glusterfs: ${13:undefined} # not required. Dictionary with values for GlusterFS storage type:,C(address) - Address of the Gluster server. E.g.: myserver.mydomain.com,C(path) - Path of the mount point. E.g.: /path/to/my/data,C(mount_options) - Option which will be passed when mounting storage.,Note that these parameters are not idempotent.
timeout: ${14:180} # not required. The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
destroy: ${15:undefined} # not required. Logical remove of the storage domain. If I(true) retains the storage domain's data for import.,This parameter is relevant only when C(state) is I(absent).
description: ${16:undefined} # not required. Description of the storage domain.
format: ${17:undefined} # not required. If I(True) storage domain will be formatted after removing it from oVirt/RHV.,This parameter is relevant only when C(state) is I(absent).

iscsi: ${18:undefined} # not required. Dictionary with values for iSCSI storage type:,C(address) - Address of the iSCSI storage server.,C(port) - Port of the iSCSI storage server.,C(target) - The target IQN for the storage device.,C(lun_id) - LUN id(s).,C(username) - A CHAP user name for logging into a target.,C(password) - A CHAP password for logging into a target.,C(override_luns) - If I(True) ISCSI storage domain luns will be overridden before adding.,C(target_lun_map) - List of dictionary containing targets and LUNs.",Note that these parameters are not idempotent.,Parameter C(target_lun_map) is supported since Ansible 2.5.
data_center: ${19:undefined} # not required. Data center name where storage domain should be attached.,This parameter isn't idempotent, it's not possible to change data center of storage domain.

nfs: ${20:undefined} # not required. Dictionary with values for NFS storage type:,C(address) - Address of the NFS server. E.g.: myserver.mydomain.com,C(path) - Path of the mount point. E.g.: /path/to/my/data,C(version) - NFS version. One of: I(auto), I(v3), I(v4) or I(v4_1).,C(timeout) - The time in tenths of a second to wait for a response before retrying NFS requests. Range 0 to 65535.,C(retrans) - The number of times to retry a request before attempting further recovery actions. Range 0 to 65535.,C(mount_options) - Option which will be passed when mounting storage.,Note that these parameters are not idempotent.
id: ${21:undefined} # not required. Id of the storage domain to be imported.
nested_attributes: ${22:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
critical_space_action_blocker: ${23:undefined} # not required. Inidcates the minimal free space the storage domain should contain in percentages.
comment: ${24:undefined} # not required. Comment of the storage domain.

fcp: ${25:undefined} # not required. Dictionary with values for fibre channel storage type:,C(address) - Address of the fibre channel storage server.,C(port) - Port of the fibre channel storage server.,C(lun_id) - LUN id.,C(override_luns) - If I(True) FCP storage domain luns will be overridden before adding.,Note that these parameters are not idempotent.

fetch_nested: ${26:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).

state: ${27|present,absent,maintenance,unattached,update_ovf_store|} # not required. choices: present;absent;maintenance;unattached;update_ovf_store. Should the storage domain be present/absent/maintenance/unattached/imported/update_ovf_store,I(imported) is supported since version 2.4.,I(update_ovf_store) is supported since version 2.5, currently if C(wait) is (true), we don't wait for update.

nested_attributes: ${2:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).

unregistered: ${3:undefined} # not required. Flag which indicates whether to get unregistered virtual machines which contain one or more disks which reside on a storage domain or diskless virtual machines.

fetch_nested: ${4:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).

ovirt_templates.description: Module to manage virtual machine templates in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_templates:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
cluster: ${2:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster, where template should be created/imported.
allow_partial_import: ${3:undefined} # not required. Boolean indication whether to allow partial registration of a template when C(state) is registered.
nested_attributes: ${4:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).

storage_domain: ${5:undefined} # not required. When C(state) is I(imported) this parameter specifies the name of the destination data storage domain. When C(state) is I(registered) this parameter specifies the name of the data storage domain of the unregistered template.

role_mappings: ${6:undefined} # not required. Mapper which maps role name between Template's OVF and the destination role this Template should be registered to, relevant when C(state) is registered. Role mapping is described by the following dictionary:,C(source_name): The name of the source role.,C(dest_name): The name of the destination role.
timeout: ${7:180} # not required. The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
poll_interval: ${8:3} # not required. Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
image_disk: ${9:undefined} # not required. When C(state) is I(imported) and C(image_provider) is used this parameter specifies the name of disk to be imported as template.
wait: ${10:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.
cpu_profile: ${11:undefined} # not required. CPU profile to be set to template.

cluster_mappings: ${12:undefined} # not required. Mapper which maps cluster name between Template's OVF and the destination cluster this Template should be registered to, relevant when C(state) is registered. Cluster mapping is described by the following dictionary:,C(source_name): The name of the source cluster.,C(dest_name): The name of the destination cluster.

domain_mappings: ${13:undefined} # not required. Mapper which maps aaa domain name between Template's OVF and the destination aaa domain this Template should be registered to, relevant when C(state) is registered. The aaa domain mapping is described by the following dictionary:,C(source_name): The name of the source aaa domain.,C(dest_name): The name of the destination aaa domain.
name: ${14:undefined} # not required. Name of the template to manage.
description: ${15:undefined} # not required. Description of the template.

vnic_profile_mappings: ${16:undefined} # not required. Mapper which maps an external virtual NIC profile to one that exists in the engine when C(state) is registered. vnic_profile is described by the following dictionary:,C(source_network_name): The network name of the source network.,C(source_profile_name): The prfile name related to the source network.,C(target_profile_id): The id of the target profile id to be mapped to in the engine.
image_provider: ${17:undefined} # not required. When C(state) is I(imported) this parameter specifies the name of the image provider to be used.
export_domain: ${18:undefined} # not required. When C(state) is I(exported) or I(imported) this parameter specifies the name of the export storage domain.

seal: ${19:false} # not required. 'Sealing' is an operation that erases all machine-specific configurations from a filesystem: This includes SSH keys, UDEV rules, MAC addresses, system ID, hostname, etc. If I(true) subsequent virtual machines made from this template will avoid configuration inheritance.,This parameter is used only when C(state) I(present).
id: ${20:undefined} # not required. ID of the template to be registered.
exclusive: ${21:undefined} # not required. When C(state) is I(exported) this parameter indicates if the existing templates with the same name should be overwritten.
vm: ${22:undefined} # not required. Name of the VM, which will be used to create template.

clone_permissions: ${23:false} # not required. If I(True) then the permissions of the VM (only the direct ones, not the inherited ones) will be copied to the created template.,This parameter is used only when C(state) I(present).

fetch_nested: ${24:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).

state: ${25|present,absent,exported,imported,registered|} # not required. choices: present;absent;exported;imported;registered. Should the template be present/absent/exported/imported/registered. When C(state) is I(registered) and the unregistered template's name belongs to an already registered in engine template in the same DC then we fail to register the unregistered template.

template_image_disk_name: ${26:undefined} # not required. When C(state) is I(imported) and C(image_provider) is used this parameter specifies the new name for imported disk, if omitted then I(image_disk) name is used by default. This parameter is used only in case of importing disk image from Glance domain.

ovirt_vmpools.description: Module to manage VM pools in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_vmpools:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the VM pool to manage.
cluster: ${3:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster, where VM pool should be created.

type: ${4|manual,automatic|} # not required. choices: manual;automatic. Type of the VM pool. Either manual or automatic.,C(manual) - The administrator is responsible for explicitly returning the virtual machine to the pool. The virtual machine reverts to the original base image after the administrator returns it to the pool.,C(Automatic) - When the virtual machine is shut down, it automatically reverts to its base image and is returned to the virtual machine pool.,Default value is set by engine.
description: ${5:undefined} # not required. Description of the VM pool.
vm_count: ${6:undefined} # not required. Number of VMs in the pool.,Default value is set by engine.
vm_per_user: ${7:undefined} # not required. Maximum number of VMs a single user can attach to from this pool.,Default value is set by engine.
nested_attributes: ${8:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
poll_interval: ${9:3} # not required. Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
wait: ${10:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.
template: ${11:undefined} # not required. Name of the template, which will be used to create VM pool.

fetch_nested: ${12:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
state: ${13|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Should the VM pool be present/absent.,Note that when C(state) is I(absent) all VMs in VM pool are stopped and removed.
timeout: ${14:180} # not required. The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.
prestarted: ${15:undefined} # not required. Number of pre-started VMs defines the number of VMs in run state, that are waiting to be attached to Users.,Default value is set by engine.

ovirt_vms.description: Module to manage Virtual Machines in oVirt/RHV
body: ovirt_vms:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
lease: ${2:undefined} # not required. Name of the storage domain this virtual machine lease reside on.,NOTE - Supported since oVirt 4.1.

affinity_label_mappings: ${3:undefined} # not required. Mappper which maps affinity label name between VM's OVF and the destination label this VM should be registered to, relevant when C(state) is registered.
serial_policy_value: ${4:undefined} # not required. Allows you to specify a custom serial number.,This parameter is used only when C(serial_policy) is I(custom).

nics: ${5:undefined} # not required. List of NICs, which should be attached to Virtual Machine. NIC is described by following dictionary.,C(name) - Name of the NIC.,C(profile_name) - Profile name where NIC should be attached.,C(interface) -  Type of the network interface. One of following I(virtio), I(e1000), I(rtl8139), default is I(virtio).,C(mac_address) - Custom MAC address of the network interface, by default it's obtained from MAC pool.,NOTE - This parameter is used only when C(state) is I(running) or I(present) and is able to only create NICs. To manage NICs of the VM in more depth please use M(ovirt_nics) module instead.

placement_policy: ${6:undefined} # not required. The configuration of the virtual machine's placement policy.,Placement policy can be one of the following values:,C(migratable) - Allow manual and automatic migration.,C(pinned) - Do not allow migration.,C(user_migratable) - Allow manual migration only.,If no value is passed, default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.
poll_interval: ${7:3} # not required. Number of the seconds the module waits until another poll request on entity status is sent.
kernel_params: ${8:undefined} # not required. Kernel command line parameters (formatted as string) to be used with the kernel specified by C(kernel_path) option.

affinity_group_mappings: ${9:undefined} # not required. Mapper which maps affinty name between VM's OVF and the destination affinity this VM should be registered to, relevant when C(state) is registered.

memory_max: ${10:undefined} # not required. Upper bound of virtual machine memory up to which memory hot-plug can be performed. Prefix uses IEC 60027-2 standard (for example 1GiB, 1024MiB).,Default value is set by engine.
serial_console: ${11:undefined} # not required. I(True) enable VirtIO serial console, I(False) to disable it. By default is chosen by oVirt/RHV engine.

vnic_profile_mappings: ${12:undefined} # not required. Mapper which maps an external virtual NIC profile to one that exists in the engine when C(state) is registered. vnic_profile is described by the following dictionary:,C(source_network_name): The network name of the source network.,C(source_profile_name): The prfile name related to the source network.,C(target_profile_id): The id of the target profile id to be mapped to in the engine.

cluster_mappings: ${13:undefined} # not required. Mapper which maps cluster name between VM's OVF and the destination cluster this VM should be registered to, relevant when C(state) is registered. Cluster mapping is described by the following dictionary:,C(source_name): The name of the source cluster.,C(dest_name): The name of the destination cluster.

high_availability_priority: ${14:undefined} # not required. Indicates the priority of the virtual machine inside the run and migration queues. Virtual machines with higher priorities will be started and migrated before virtual machines with lower priorities. The value is an integer between 0 and 100. The higher the value, the higher the priority.,If no value is passed, default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.

operating_system: ${15|debian_7,freebsd,freebsdx64,other,other_linux,other_linux_ppc64,other_ppc64,rhel_3,rhel_4,rhel_4x64,rhel_5,rhel_5x64,rhel_6,rhel_6x64,rhel_6_ppc64,rhel_7x64,rhel_7_ppc64,sles_11,sles_11_ppc64,ubuntu_12_04,ubuntu_12_10,ubuntu_13_04,ubuntu_13_10,ubuntu_14_04,ubuntu_14_04_ppc64,windows_10,windows_10x64,windows_2003,windows_2003x64,windows_2008,windows_2008x64,windows_2008r2x64,windows_2008R2x64,windows_2012x64,windows_2012R2x64,windows_7,windows_7x64,windows_8,windows_8x64,windows_xp|} # not required. choices: debian_7;freebsd;freebsdx64;other;other_linux;other_linux_ppc64;other_ppc64;rhel_3;rhel_4;rhel_4x64;rhel_5;rhel_5x64;rhel_6;rhel_6x64;rhel_6_ppc64;rhel_7x64;rhel_7_ppc64;sles_11;sles_11_ppc64;ubuntu_12_04;ubuntu_12_10;ubuntu_13_04;ubuntu_13_10;ubuntu_14_04;ubuntu_14_04_ppc64;windows_10;windows_10x64;windows_2003;windows_2003x64;windows_2008;windows_2008x64;windows_2008r2x64;windows_2008R2x64;windows_2012x64;windows_2012R2x64;windows_7;windows_7x64;windows_8;windows_8x64;windows_xp. Operating system of the Virtual Machine.,Default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.

cloud_init_persist: ${16:undefined} # not required. If I(true) the C(cloud_init) or C(sysprep) parameters will be saved for the virtual machine and won't be virtual machine won't be started as run-once.
cpu_sockets: ${17:undefined} # not required. Number of virtual CPUs sockets of the Virtual Machine.,Default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.

rng_device: ${18:undefined} # not required. Random number generator (RNG). You can choose of one the following devices I(urandom), I(random) or I(hwrng).,In order to select I(hwrng), you must have it enabled on cluster first.,/dev/urandom is used for cluster version >= 4.1, and /dev/random for cluster version <= 4.0

cpu_pinning: ${19:undefined} # not required. CPU Pinning topology to map virtual machine CPU to host CPU.,CPU Pinning topology is a list of dictionary which can have following values:,C(cpu) - Number of the host CPU.,C(vcpu) - Number of the virtual machine CPU.

clone_permissions: ${20:no} # not required. If I(yes) then the permissions of the template (only the direct ones, not the inherited ones) will be copied to the created virtual machine.,This parameter is used only when C(state) is I(running) or I(present) and VM didn't exist before.
comment: ${21:undefined} # not required. Comment of the Virtual Machine.

sysprep: ${22:undefined} # not required. Dictionary with values for Windows Virtual Machine initialization using sysprep.,C(host_name) - Hostname to be set to Virtual Machine when deployed.,C(active_directory_ou) - Active Directory Organizational Unit, to be used for login of user.,C(org_name) - Organization name to be set to Windows Virtual Machine.,C(domain) - Domain to be set to Windows Virtual Machine.,C(timezone) - Timezone to be set to Windows Virtual Machine.,C(ui_language) - UI language of the Windows Virtual Machine.,C(system_locale) - System localization of the Windows Virtual Machine.,C(input_locale) - Input localization of the Windows Virtual Machine.,C(windows_license_key) - License key to be set to Windows Virtual Machine.,C(user_name) - Username to be used for set password to Windows Virtual Machine.,C(root_password) - Password to be set for username to Windows Virtual Machine.
soundcard_enabled: ${23:undefined} # not required. If I(true), the sound card is added to the virtual machine.

lun_mappings: ${24:undefined} # not required. Mapper which maps lun between VM's OVF and the destination lun this VM should contain, relevant when C(state) is registered. lun_mappings is described by the following dictionary: - C(logical_unit_id): The logical unit number to identify a logical unit, - C(logical_unit_port): The port being used to connect with the LUN disk. - C(logical_unit_portal): The portal being used to connect with the LUN disk. - C(logical_unit_address): The address of the block storage host. - C(logical_unit_target): The iSCSI specification located on an iSCSI server - C(logical_unit_username): Username to be used to connect to the block storage host. - C(logical_unit_password): Password to be used to connect to the block storage host. - C(storage_type): The storage type which the LUN reside on (iscsi or fcp)
allow_partial_import: ${25:undefined} # not required. Boolean indication whether to allow partial registration of Virtual Machine when C(state) is registered.
nested_attributes: ${26:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
reassign_bad_macs: ${27:undefined} # not required. Boolean indication whether to reassign bad macs when C(state) is registered.
kernel_path: ${28:undefined} # not required. Path to a kernel image used to boot the virtual machine.,Kernel image must be stored on either the ISO domain or on the host's storage.
cpu_cores: ${29:undefined} # not required. Number of virtual CPUs cores of the Virtual Machine.,Default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.

xen: ${30:undefined} # not required. Dictionary of values to be used to connect to XEN and import a virtual machine to oVirt.,Dictionary can contain following values.,C(url) - The URL to be passed to the I(virt-v2v) tool for conversion. For example I(xen+ssh://root@zen.server). This is required parameter.,C(drivers_iso) - The name of the ISO containing drivers that can be used during the I(virt-v2v) conversion process.,C(sparse) - Specifies the disk allocation policy of the resulting virtual machine. I(true) for sparse, I(false) for preallocated. Default value is I(true).,C(storage_domain) - Specifies the target storage domain for converted disks. This is required parameter.

disks: ${31:undefined} # not required. List of disks, which should be attached to Virtual Machine. Disk is described by following dictionary.,C(name) - Name of the disk. Either C(name) or C(id) is reuqired.,C(id) - ID of the disk. Either C(name) or C(id) is reuqired.,C(interface) - Interface of the disk, either I(virtio) or I(IDE), default is I(virtio).,C(bootable) - I(True) if the disk should be bootable, default is non bootable.,C(activate) - I(True) if the disk should be activated, default is activated.,NOTE - This parameter is used only when C(state) is I(running) or I(present) and is able to only attach disks. To manage disks of the VM in more depth please use M(ovirt_disks) module instead.

disk_format: ${32|cow,raw|} # not required. choices: cow;raw. Specify format of the disk.,If C(cow) format is used, disk will by created as sparse, so space will be allocated for the volume as needed, also known as I(thin provision).,If C(raw) format is used, disk storage will be allocated right away, also known as I(preallocated).,Note that this option isn't idempotent as it's not currently possible to change format of the disk via API.,This parameter is considered only when C(template) and C(storage domain) is provided.

cloud_init_nics: ${33:undefined} # not required. List of dictionaries representing network interafaces to be setup by cloud init.,This option is used, when user needs to setup more network interfaces via cloud init.,If one network interface is enough, user should use C(cloud_init) I(nic_*) parameters. C(cloud_init) I(nic_*) parameters are merged with C(cloud_init_nics) parameters.,Dictionary can contain following values.,C(nic_boot_protocol) - Set boot protocol of the network interface of Virtual Machine. Can be one of C(none), C(dhcp) or C(static).,C(nic_ip_address) - If boot protocol is static, set this IP address to network interface of Virtual Machine.,C(nic_netmask) - If boot protocol is static, set this netmask to network interface of Virtual Machine.,C(nic_gateway) - If boot protocol is static, set this gateway to network interface of Virtual Machine.,C(nic_name) - Set name to network interface of Virtual Machine.,C(nic_on_boot) - If I(True) network interface will be set to start on boot.
quota_id: ${34:undefined} # not required. Virtual Machine quota ID to be used for disk. By default quota is chosen by oVirt/RHV engine.
boot_menu: ${35:undefined} # not required. I(True) enable menu to select boot device, I(False) to disable it. By default is chosen by oVirt/RHV engine.

state: ${36|absent,next_run,present,registered,running,stopped,suspended|} # not required. choices: absent;next_run;present;registered;running;stopped;suspended. Should the Virtual Machine be running/stopped/present/absent/suspended/next_run/registered. When C(state) is I(registered) and the unregistered VM's name belongs to an already registered in engine VM in the same DC then we fail to register the unregistered template.,I(present) state will create/update VM and don't change its state if it already exists.,I(running) state will create/update VM and start it.,I(next_run) state updates the VM and if the VM has next run configuration it will be rebooted.,Please check I(notes) to more detailed description of states.,I(registered) is supported since 2.4.

initrd_path: ${37:undefined} # not required. Path to an initial ramdisk to be used with the kernel specified by C(kernel_path) option.,Ramdisk image must be stored on either the ISO domain or on the host's storage.

graphical_console: ${38:undefined} # not required. Assign graphical console to the virtual machine.,Graphical console is a dictionary which can have following values:,C(headless_mode) - If I(true) disable the graphics console for this virtual machine.,C(protocol) - Graphical protocol, one of I(VNC), I(SPICE), or both.
force: ${39:no} # not required. Please check to I(Synopsis) to more detailed description of force parameter, it can behave differently in different situations.

watchdog: ${40:undefined} # not required. Assign watchdog device for the virtual machine.,Watchdogs is a dictionary which can have following values:,C(model) - Model of the watchdog device. For example: I(i6300esb), I(diag288) or I(null).,C(action) - Watchdog action to be performed when watchdog is triggered. For example: I(none), I(reset), I(poweroff), I(pause) or I(dump).

memory_guaranteed: ${41:undefined} # not required. Amount of minimal guaranteed memory of the Virtual Machine. Prefix uses IEC 60027-2 standard (for example 1GiB, 1024MiB).,C(memory_guaranteed) parameter can't be lower than C(memory) parameter.,Default value is set by engine.
instance_type: ${42:undefined} # not required. Name of virtual machine's hardware configuration.,By default no instance type is used.
smartcard_enabled: ${43:undefined} # not required. If I(true), use smart card authentication.

ballooning_enabled: ${44:undefined} # not required. If I(true), use memory ballooning.,Memory balloon is a guest device, which may be used to re-distribute / reclaim the host memory based on VM needs in a dynamic way. In this way it's possible to create memory over commitment states.
cluster: ${45:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster, where Virtual Machine should be created.,Required if creating VM.

type: ${46|desktop,server,high_performance|} # not required. choices: desktop;server;high_performance. Type of the Virtual Machine.,Default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.,I(high_performance) is supported since Ansible 2.5 and oVirt/RHV 4.2.

delete_protected: ${47:undefined} # not required. If I(yes) Virtual Machine will be set as delete protected.,If I(no) Virtual Machine won't be set as delete protected.,If no value is passed, default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.

fetch_nested: ${48:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).

use_latest_template_version: ${49:undefined} # not required. Specify if latest template version should be used, when running a stateless VM.,If this parameter is set to I(yes) stateless VM is created.

clone: ${50:no} # not required. If I(yes) then the disks of the created virtual machine will be cloned and independent of the template.,This parameter is used only when C(state) is I(running) or I(present) and VM didn't exist before.

serial_policy: ${51:undefined} # not required. Specify a serial number policy for the Virtual Machine.,Following options are supported.,C(vm) - Sets the Virtual Machine's UUID as its serial number.,C(host) - Sets the host's UUID as the Virtual Machine's serial number.,C(custom) - Allows you to specify a custom serial number in C(serial_policy_value).
io_threads: ${52:undefined} # not required. Number of IO threads used by virtual machine. I(0) means IO threading disabled.
cpu_threads: ${53:undefined} # not required. Number of virtual CPUs sockets of the Virtual Machine.,Default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.

domain_mappings: ${54:undefined} # not required. Mapper which maps aaa domain name between VM's OVF and the destination aaa domain this VM should be registered to, relevant when C(state) is registered. The aaa domain mapping is described by the following dictionary:,C(source_name): The name of the source aaa domain.,C(dest_name): The name of the destination aaa domain.
name: ${55:undefined} # not required. Name of the Virtual Machine to manage.,If VM don't exists C(name) is required. Otherwise C(id) or C(name) can be used.
sso: ${56:undefined} # not required. I(True) enable Single Sign On by Guest Agent, I(False) to disable it. By default is chosen by oVirt/RHV engine.
template_version: ${57:undefined} # not required. Version number of the template to be used for VM.,By default the latest available version of the template is used.

template: ${58:undefined} # not required. Name of the template, which should be used to create Virtual Machine.,Required if creating VM.,If template is not specified and VM doesn't exist, VM will be created from I(Blank) template.

boot_devices: ${59|cdrom,hd,network|} # not required. choices: cdrom;hd;network. List of boot devices which should be used to boot. For example C([ cdrom, hd ]).,Default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.
timezone: ${60:undefined} # not required. Sets time zone offset of the guest hardware clock.,For example C(Etc/GMT)

vmware: ${61:undefined} # not required. Dictionary of values to be used to connect to VMware and import a virtual machine to oVirt.,Dictionary can contain following values.,C(username) - The username to authenticate against the VMware.,C(password) - The password to authenticate against the VMware.,C(url) - The URL to be passed to the I(virt-v2v) tool for conversion. For example I(vpx://wmware_user@vcenter-host/DataCenter/Cluster/esxi-host?no_verify=1),C(drivers_iso) - The name of the ISO containing drivers that can be used during the I(virt-v2v) conversion process.,C(sparse) - Specifies the disk allocation policy of the resulting virtual machine. I(true) for sparse, I(false) for preallocated. Default value is I(true).,C(storage_domain) - Specifies the target storage domain for converted disks. This is required parameter.

kvm: ${62:undefined} # not required. Dictionary of values to be used to connect to kvm and import a virtual machine to oVirt.,Dictionary can contain following values.,C(name) - The name of the KVM virtual machine.,C(username) - The username to authenticate against the KVM.,C(password) - The password to authenticate against the KVM.,C(url) - The URL to be passed to the I(virt-v2v) tool for conversion. For example I(qemu:///system). This is required parameter.,C(drivers_iso) - The name of the ISO containing drivers that can be used during the I(virt-v2v) conversion process.,C(sparse) - Specifies the disk allocation policy of the resulting virtual machine. I(true) for sparse, I(false) for preallocated. Default value is I(true).,C(storage_domain) - Specifies the target storage domain for converted disks. This is required parameter.
timeout: ${63:180} # not required. The amount of time in seconds the module should wait for the instance to get into desired state.

storage_domain: ${64:undefined} # not required. Name of the storage domain where all template disks should be created.,This parameter is considered only when C(template) is provided.,IMPORTANT - This parameter is not idempotent, if the VM exists and you specfiy different storage domain, disk won't move.
memory: ${65:undefined} # not required. Amount of memory of the Virtual Machine. Prefix uses IEC 60027-2 standard (for example 1GiB, 1024MiB).,Default value is set by engine.

high_availability: ${66:undefined} # not required. If I(yes) Virtual Machine will be set as highly available.,If I(no) Virtual Machine won't be set as highly available.,If no value is passed, default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.

role_mappings: ${67:undefined} # not required. Mapper which maps role name between VM's OVF and the destination role this VM should be registered to, relevant when C(state) is registered. Role mapping is described by the following dictionary:,C(source_name): The name of the source role.,C(dest_name): The name of the destination role.
cpu_shares: ${68:undefined} # not required. Set a CPU shares for this Virtual Machine.,Default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.
wait: ${69:undefined} # not required. I(True) if the module should wait for the entity to get into desired state.

host: ${70:undefined} # not required. Specify host where Virtual Machine should be running. By default the host is chosen by engine scheduler.,This parameter is used only when C(state) is I(running) or I(present).

cpu_mode: ${71:undefined} # not required. CPU mode of the virtual machine. It can be some of the following: I(host_passthrough), I(host_model) or I(custom).,For I(host_passthrough) CPU type you need to set C(placement_policy) to I(pinned).,If no value is passed, default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.

cloud_init: ${72:undefined} # not required. Dictionary with values for Unix-like Virtual Machine initialization using cloud init.,C(host_name) - Hostname to be set to Virtual Machine when deployed.,C(timezone) - Timezone to be set to Virtual Machine when deployed.,C(user_name) - Username to be used to set password to Virtual Machine when deployed.,C(root_password) - Password to be set for user specified by C(user_name) parameter.,C(authorized_ssh_keys) - Use this SSH keys to login to Virtual Machine.,C(regenerate_ssh_keys) - If I(True) SSH keys will be regenerated on Virtual Machine.,C(custom_script) - Cloud-init script which will be executed on Virtual Machine when deployed.  This is appended to the end of the cloud-init script generated by any other options.,C(dns_servers) - DNS servers to be configured on Virtual Machine.,C(dns_search) - DNS search domains to be configured on Virtual Machine.,C(nic_boot_protocol) - Set boot protocol of the network interface of Virtual Machine. Can be one of C(none), C(dhcp) or C(static).,C(nic_ip_address) - If boot protocol is static, set this IP address to network interface of Virtual Machine.,C(nic_netmask) - If boot protocol is static, set this netmask to network interface of Virtual Machine.,C(nic_gateway) - If boot protocol is static, set this gateway to network interface of Virtual Machine.,C(nic_name) - Set name to network interface of Virtual Machine.,C(nic_on_boot) - If I(True) network interface will be set to start on boot.

stateless: ${73:undefined} # not required. If I(yes) Virtual Machine will be set as stateless.,If I(no) Virtual Machine will be unset as stateless.,If no value is passed, default value is set by oVirt/RHV engine.
description: ${74:undefined} # not required. Description of the Virtual Machine.

cd_iso: ${75:undefined} # not required. ISO file from ISO storage domain which should be attached to Virtual Machine.,If you pass empty string the CD will be ejected from VM.,If used with C(state) I(running) or I(present) and VM is running the CD will be attached to VM.,If used with C(state) I(running) or I(present) and VM is down the CD will be attached to VM persistently.
id: ${76:undefined} # not required. ID of the Virtual Machine to manage.
usb_support: ${77:undefined} # not required. I(True) enable USB support, I(False) to disable it. By default is chosen by oVirt/RHV engine.

custom_properties: ${78:undefined} # not required. Properties sent to VDSM to configure various hooks.,Custom properties is a list of dictionary which can have following values:,C(name) - Name of the custom property. For example: I(hugepages), I(vhost), I(sap_agent), etc.,C(regexp) - Regular expression to set for custom property.,C(value) - Value to set for custom property.

ovirt_vms_facts.description: Retrieve facts about one or more oVirt/RHV virtual machines
body: ovirt_vms_facts:

auth: ${1:undefined} # required. Dictionary with values needed to create HTTP/HTTPS connection to oVirt:,C(username)[I(required)] - The name of the user, something like I(admin@internal). Default value is set by I(OVIRT_USERNAME) environment variable.,C(password)[I(required)] - The password of the user. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_PASSWORD) environment variable.,C(url)[I(required)] - A string containing the base URL of the server, usually something like `I(https://server.example.com/ovirt-engine/api)`. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_URL) environment variable.,C(token) - Token to be used instead of login with username/password. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_TOKEN) environment variable.,C(insecure) - A boolean flag that indicates if the server TLS certificate and host name should be checked.,C(ca_file) - A PEM file containing the trusted CA certificates. The certificate presented by the server will be verified using these CA certificates. If `C(ca_file)` parameter is not set, system wide CA certificate store is used. Default value is set by I(OVIRT_CAFILE) environment variable.,C(kerberos) - A boolean flag indicating if Kerberos authentication should be used instead of the default basic authentication.,C(headers) - Dictionary of HTTP headers to be added to each API call.
max: ${2:undefined} # not required. The maximum number of results to return.
case_sensitive: ${3:undefined} # not required. If I(true) performed search will take case into account.
nested_attributes: ${4:undefined} # not required. Specifies list of the attributes which should be fetched from the API.,This parameter apply only when C(fetch_nested) is I(true).
all_content: ${5:undefined} # not required. If I(true) all the attributes of the virtual machines should be included in the response.

fetch_nested: ${6:undefined} # not required. If I(True) the module will fetch additional data from the API.,It will fetch IDs of the VMs disks, snapshots, etc. User can configure to fetch other attributes of the nested entities by specifying C(nested_attributes).
pattern: ${7:undefined} # not required. Search term which is accepted by oVirt/RHV search backend.,For example to search VM X from cluster Y use following pattern: name=X and cluster=Y
pacemaker_cluster:
state: ${1|cleanup,offline,online,restart|} # required. choices: cleanup;offline;online;restart. Indicate desired state of the cluster
node: ${2:undefined} # not required. Specify which node of the cluster you want to manage. None == the cluster status itself, 'all' == check the status of all nodes.
timeout: ${3:300} # not required. Timeout when the module should considered that the action has failed
force: ${4:yes} # not required. Force the change of the cluster state
package:
state: ${1:undefined} # required. Whether to install (C(present), or remove (C(absent)) a package. Other states depend on the underlying package module, i.e C(latest).

name: ${2:undefined} # required. Package name, or package specifier with version, like C(name-1.0).,Be aware that packages are not always named the same and this module will not 'translate' them per distro.

use: ${3:auto} # not required. The required package manager module to use (yum, apt, etc). The default 'auto' will use existing facts or try to autodetect it.,You should only use this field if the automatic selection is not working for some reason.
package_facts:
manager: ${1|auto,rpm,apt|} # not required. choices: auto;rpm;apt. The package manager used by the system so we can query the package information

packet_device.description: Manage a bare metal server in the Packet Host.
body: packet_device:
project_id: ${1:undefined} # required. ID of project of the device.
count: ${2:1} # not required. The number of devices to create. Count number can be included in hostname via the %d string formatter.

wait_timeout: ${3:900} # not required. How long (seconds) to wait either for automatic IP address assignment, or for the device to reach the C(active) I(state).,If I(wait_for_public_IPv) is set and I(state) is C(active), the module will wait for both events consequently, applying the timeout twice.
features: ${4:undefined} # not required. Dict with "features" for device creation. See Packet API docs for details.

ipxe_script_url: ${5:undefined} # not required. URL of custom iPXE script for provisioning.,More about custome iPXE for Packet devices at U(https://help.packet.net/technical/infrastructure/custom-ipxe).
plan: ${6:undefined} # not required. Plan slug for device creation. See Packet API for current list - U(https://www.packet.net/developers/api/plans/).
device_ids: ${7:undefined} # not required. List of device IDs on which to operate.
facility: ${8:undefined} # not required. Facility slug for device creation. See Packet API for current list - U(https://www.packet.net/developers/api/facilities/).
locked: ${9:false} # not required. Whether to lock a created device.

hostnames: ${10:undefined} # not required. A hostname of a device, or a list of hostnames.,If given string or one-item list, you can use the C("%d") Python string format to expand numbers from I(count).,If only one hostname, it might be expanded to list if I(count)>1.
user_data: ${11:undefined} # not required. Userdata blob made available to the machine
operating_system: ${12:undefined} # not required. OS slug for device creation. See Packet API for current list - U(https://www.packet.net/developers/api/operatingsystems/).
always_pxe: ${13:false} # not required. Persist PXE as the first boot option.,Normally, the PXE process happens only on the first boot. Set this arg to have your device continuously boot to iPXE.
auth_token: ${14:undefined} # not required. Packet api token. You can also supply it in env var C(PACKET_API_TOKEN).
count_offset: ${15:1} # not required. From which number to start the count.

state: ${16|present,absent,active,inactive,rebooted|} # not required. choices: present;absent;active;inactive;rebooted. Desired state of the device.,If set to C(present) (the default), the module call will return immediately after the device-creating HTTP request successfully returns.,If set to C(active), the module call will block until all the specified devices are in state active due to the Packet API, or until I(wait_timeout).

wait_for_public_IPv: ${17|4,6|} # not required. choices: 4;6. Whether to wait for the instance to be assigned a public IPv4/IPv6 address.,If set to 4, it will wait until IPv4 is assigned to the instance.,If set to 6, wait until public IPv6 is assigned to the instance.

packet_sshkey.description: Create/delete an SSH key in Packet host.
body: packet_sshkey:
id: ${1:undefined} # not required. UUID of the key which you want to remove.
fingerprint: ${2:undefined} # not required. Fingerprint of the key which you want to remove.
key_file: ${3:undefined} # not required. File with the public key.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the target.
label: ${5:undefined} # not required. Label for the key. If you keep it empty, it will be read from key string.
key: ${6:undefined} # not required. Public Key string ({type} {base64 encoded key} {description}).
auth_token: ${7:undefined} # not required. Packet api token. You can also supply it in env var C(PACKET_API_TOKEN).
pacman:
update_cache: ${1:false} # not required. Whether or not to refresh the master package lists. This can be run as part of a package installation or as a separate step.
upgrade: ${2:false} # not required. Whether or not to upgrade whole system.
force: ${3:false} # not required. When removing package - force remove package, without any checks. When update_cache - force redownload repo databases.
recurse: ${4:false} # not required. When removing a package, also remove its dependencies, provided that they are not required by other packages and were not explicitly installed by a user.
state: ${5|absent,latest,present|} # not required. choices: absent;latest;present. Desired state of the package.
name: ${6:undefined} # not required. Name or list of names of the packages to install, upgrade, or remove.
pagerduty:
token: ${1||} # required. choices: . A pagerduty token, generated on the pagerduty site. Can be used instead of user/passwd combination.
user: ${2||} # required. choices: . PagerDuty user ID.
passwd: ${3||} # required. choices: . PagerDuty user password.
state: ${4|running,started,ongoing,absent|} # required. choices: running;started;ongoing;absent. Create a maintenance window or get a list of ongoing windows.
requester_id: ${5||} # required. choices: . ID of user making the request. Only needed when using a token and creating a maintenance_window.
name: ${6||} # required. choices: . PagerDuty unique subdomain.
desc: ${7||} # not required. choices: . Short description of maintenance window.
validate_certs: ${8|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
hours: ${9||} # not required. choices: . Length of maintenance window in hours.
minutes: ${10||} # not required. choices: . Maintenance window in minutes (this is added to the hours).
service: ${11||} # not required. choices: . A comma separated list of PagerDuty service IDs.

pagerduty_alert.description: Trigger, acknowledge or resolve PagerDuty incidents
body: pagerduty_alert:
service_key: ${1:undefined} # required. The GUID of one of your "Generic API" services.,This is the "service key" listed on a Generic API's service detail page.
api_key: ${2:undefined} # required. The pagerduty API key (readonly access), generated on the pagerduty site.
state: ${3|triggered,acknowledged,resolved|} # required. choices: triggered;acknowledged;resolved. Type of event to be sent.
name: ${4:undefined} # required. PagerDuty unique subdomain.

desc: ${5:Created via Ansible} # not required. For C(triggered) I(state) - Required. Short description of the problem that led to this trigger. This field (or a truncated version) will be used when generating phone calls, SMS messages and alert emails. It will also appear on the incidents tables in the PagerDuty UI. The maximum length is 1024 characters.,For C(acknowledged) or C(resolved) I(state) - Text that will appear in the incident's log associated with this event.
client_url: ${6:undefined} # not required. The URL of the monitoring client that is triggering this event.

incident_key: ${7:undefined} # not required. Identifies the incident to which this I(state) should be applied.,For C(triggered) I(state) - If there's no open (i.e. unresolved) incident with this key, a new one will be created. If there's already an open incident with a matching key, this event will be appended to that incident's log. The event key provides an easy way to "de-dup" problem reports.,For C(acknowledged) or C(resolved) I(state) - This should be the incident_key you received back when the incident was first opened by a trigger event. Acknowledge events referencing resolved or nonexistent incidents will be discarded.
client: ${8:undefined} # not required. The name of the monitoring client that is triggering this event.
pam_limits:

limit_item: ${1|core,data,fsize,memlock,nofile,rss,stack,cpu,nproc,as,maxlogins,maxsyslogins,priority,locks,sigpending,msgqueue,nice,rtprio,chroot|} # required. choices: core;data;fsize;memlock;nofile;rss;stack;cpu;nproc;as;maxlogins;maxsyslogins;priority;locks;sigpending;msgqueue;nice;rtprio;chroot. The limit to be set
limit_type: ${2|hard,soft,-|} # required. choices: hard;soft;-. Limit type, see C(man limits) for an explanation
value: ${3:undefined} # required. The value of the limit.
domain: ${4:undefined} # required. A username, @groupname, wildcard, uid/gid range.
dest: ${5:/etc/security/limits.conf} # not required. Modify the limits.conf path.

use_max: ${6|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If set to C(yes), the maximal value will be used or conserved. If the specified value is superior to the value in the file, file content is replaced with the new value, else content is not modified.
backup: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.
comment: ${8:} # not required. Comment associated with the limit.

use_min: ${9|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If set to C(yes), the minimal value will be used or conserved. If the specified value is inferior to the value in the file, file content is replaced with the new value, else content is not modified.
pamd:
type: ${1:undefined} # required. The type of the PAM rule being modified.  The type, control and module_path all must match a rule to be modified.
module_path: ${2:undefined} # required. The module path of the PAM rule being modified.  The type, control and module_path all must match a rule to be modified.

control: ${3:undefined} # required. The control of the PAM rule being modified.  This may be a complicated control with brackets.  If this is the case, be sure to put "[bracketed controls]" in quotes.  The type, control and module_path all must match a rule to be modified.
name: ${4:undefined} # required. The name generally refers to the PAM service file to change, for example system-auth.
new_module_path: ${5:undefined} # not required. The new module path to be assigned to the new rule.

module_arguments: ${6:undefined} # not required. When state is 'updated', the module_arguments will replace existing module_arguments.  When state is 'args_absent' args matching those listed in module_arguments will be removed.  When state is 'args_present' any args listed in module_arguments are added if missing from the existing rule.  Furthermore, if the module argument takes a value denoted by '=', the value will be changed to that specified in module_arguments.  Note that module_arguments is a list.  Please see the examples for usage.
new_control: ${7:undefined} # not required. The new control to assign to the new rule.

state: ${8|updated,before,after,args_present,args_absent,absent|} # not required. choices: updated;before;after;args_present;args_absent;absent. The default of 'updated' will modify an existing rule if type, control and module_path all match an existing rule.  With 'before', the new rule will be inserted before a rule matching type, control and module_path.  Similarly, with 'after', the new rule will be inserted after an existing rule matching type, control and module_path.  With either 'before' or 'after' new_type, new_control, and new_module_path must all be specified.  If state is 'args_absent' or 'args_present', new_type, new_control, and new_module_path will be ignored.  State 'absent' will remove the rule.  The 'absent' state was added in version 2.4 and is only available in Ansible versions >= 2.4.
path: ${9:/etc/pam.d/} # not required. This is the path to the PAM service files
new_type: ${10:undefined} # not required. The new type to assign to the new rule.

panos_admin.description: Add or modify PAN-OS user accounts password.
body: panos_admin:
admin_password: ${1:undefined} # required. password for admin user
password: ${2:undefined} # required. password for authentication
ip_address: ${3:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device
username: ${4:admin} # not required. username for authentication
role: ${5:null} # not required. role for admin user
admin_username: ${6:admin} # not required. username for admin user
commit: ${7:true} # not required. commit if changed

panos_admpwd.description: change admin password of PAN-OS device using SSH with SSH key
body: panos_admpwd:
ip_address: ${1:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device
key_filename: ${2:undefined} # required. filename of the SSH Key to use for authentication
newpassword: ${3:undefined} # required. password to configure for admin on the PAN-OS device
username: ${4:admin} # not required. username for initial authentication

panos_cert_gen_ssh.description: generates a self-signed certificate using SSH protocol with SSH key
body: panos_cert_gen_ssh:
cert_friendly_name: ${1:null} # required. Human friendly certificate name (not CN but just a friendly name).
signed_by: ${2:null} # required. Undersigning authority (CA) that MUST already be presents on the device.
password: ${3:null} # required. Password credentials to use for auth. Either I(key_filename) or I(password) is required.
ip_address: ${4:null} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device being configured.
cert_cn: ${5:null} # required. Certificate CN (common name) embedded in the certificate signature.
key_filename: ${6:null} # required. Location of the filename that is used for the auth. Either I(key_filename) or I(password) is required.
rsa_nbits: ${7:2048} # not required. Number of bits used by the RSA algorithm for the certificate generation.

panos_check.description: check if PAN-OS device is ready for configuration
body: panos_check:
ip_address: ${1:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device
password: ${2:undefined} # required. password for authentication
interval: ${3:0} # not required. time waited between checks
timeout: ${4:0} # not required. timeout of API calls
username: ${5:admin} # not required. username for authentication
panos_commit:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. password for authentication
ip_address: ${2:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device
username: ${3:admin} # not required. username for authentication
sync: ${4:true} # not required. if commit should be synchronous
interval: ${5:0.5} # not required. interval for checking commit job
timeout: ${6:None} # not required. timeout for commit job
panos_dag:
password: ${1:null} # required. password for authentication
dag_filter: ${2:null} # required. dynamic filter user by the dynamic address group
ip_address: ${3:null} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device
dag_name: ${4:null} # required. name of the dynamic address group
commit: ${5:true} # not required. commit if changed
username: ${6:admin} # not required. username for authentication

panos_dag_tags.description: Create tags for DAG's on PAN-OS devices.
body: panos_dag_tags:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. password for authentication
ip_address: ${2:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device
tag_names: ${3:undefined} # not required. The list of the tags that will be added or removed from the IP address.
api_key: ${4:undefined} # not required. API key that can be used instead of I(username)/I(password) credentials.
ip_to_register: ${5:undefined} # not required. IP that will be registered with the given tag names.

devicegroup: ${6:undefined} # not required. - Device groups are used for the Panorama interaction with Firewall(s). The group must exists on Panorama. If device group is not define we assume that we are contacting Firewall.
commit: ${7:true} # not required. commit if changed
operation: ${8:undefined} # not required. The action to be taken. Supported values are I(add)/I(update)/I(find)/I(delete).
description: ${9:undefined} # not required. The purpose / objective of the static Address Group
username: ${10:admin} # not required. username for authentication
panos_import:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. Password for device authentication.
ip_address: ${2:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device.
file: ${3:None} # not required. Location of the file to import into device.
username: ${4:admin} # not required. Username for device authentication.
url: ${5:None} # not required. URL of the file that will be imported to device.
category: ${6:software} # not required. Category of file uploaded. The default is software.

panos_interface.description: configure data-port network interface for DHCP
body: panos_interface:
if_name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the interface to configure.
zone_name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the zone for the interface. If the zone does not exist it is created but if the zone exists and it is not of the layer3 type the operation will fail.
password: ${3:undefined} # required. Password credentials to use for auth.
ip_address: ${4:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device being configured.
create_default_route: ${5:false} # not required. Whether or not to add default route with router learned via DHCP.
username: ${6:admin} # not required. Username credentials to use for auth.
commit: ${7:true} # not required. Commit if changed
panos_lic:
ip_address: ${1:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device
auth_code: ${2:undefined} # required. authcode to be applied
password: ${3:undefined} # required. password for authentication
username: ${4:admin} # not required. username for authentication
force: ${5:false} # not required. whether to apply authcode even if device is already licensed
panos_loadcfg:
ip_address: ${1:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device
password: ${2:undefined} # required. password for authentication
file: ${3:None} # not required. configuration file to load
username: ${4:admin} # not required. username for authentication
commit: ${5:true} # not required. commit if changed

panos_match_rule.description: Test for match against a security rule on PAN-OS devices or Panorama management console.
body: panos_match_rule:
source_ip: ${1:undefined} # required. The source IP address.
ip_address: ${2:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device being configured.
password: ${3:undefined} # required. Password credentials to use for auth unless I(api_key) is set.
vsys_id: ${4:vsys1} # required. ID of the VSYS object.
application: ${5:undefined} # not required. The application.
to_interface: ${6:undefined} # not required. The inbound interface in a NAT rule.
destination_ip: ${7:undefined} # not required. The destination IP address.
source_port: ${8:undefined} # not required. The source port.
source_user: ${9:undefined} # not required. The source user or group.
api_key: ${10:undefined} # not required. API key that can be used instead of I(username)/I(password) credentials.
source_zone: ${11:undefined} # not required. The source zone.
protocol: ${12:undefined} # not required. The IP protocol number from 1 to 255.
destination_port: ${13:undefined} # not required. The destination port.
rule_type: ${14:security} # not required. Type of rule. Valid types are I(security) or I(nat).
category: ${15:undefined} # not required. URL category
username: ${16:admin} # not required. Username credentials to use for auth unless I(api_key) is set.
destination_zone: ${17:undefined} # not required. The destination zone.
panos_mgtconfig:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. password for authentication
ip_address: ${2:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device
dns_server_primary: ${3:None} # not required. address of primary DNS server
commit: ${4:true} # not required. commit if changed
panorama_primary: ${5:None} # not required. address of primary Panorama server
panorama_secondary: ${6:None} # not required. address of secondary Panorama server
dns_server_secondary: ${7:None} # not required. address of secondary DNS server
username: ${8:admin} # not required. username for authentication
panos_nat_policy:
from_zone: ${1:undefined} # required. list of source zones
ip_address: ${2:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device
password: ${3:undefined} # required. password for authentication
to_zone: ${4:undefined} # required. destination zone
rule_name: ${5:undefined} # required. name of the SNAT rule
dnat_address: ${6:None} # not required. dnat translated address
snat_interface: ${7:None} # not required. snat interface
snat_address: ${8:None} # not required. snat translated address
snat_type: ${9:None} # not required. type of source translation
dnat_port: ${10:None} # not required. dnat translated port
destination: ${11:any} # not required. list of destination addresses
commit: ${12:true} # not required. commit if changed
snat_interface_address: ${13:None} # not required. snat interface address
snat_bidirectional: ${14:false} # not required. bidirectional flag
source: ${15:any} # not required. list of source addresses
username: ${16:admin} # not required. username for authentication
override: ${17:false} # not required. attempt to override rule if one with the same name already exists
service: ${18:any} # not required. service
panos_nat_rule:
source_zone: ${1:undefined} # required. list of source zones
ip_address: ${2:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device being configured.
password: ${3:undefined} # required. Password credentials to use for auth unless I(api_key) is set.
rule_name: ${4:undefined} # required. name of the SNAT rule
destination_zone: ${5:undefined} # required. destination zone
dnat_address: ${6:None} # not required. dnat translated address
source_ip: ${7:any} # not required. list of source addresses
destination_ip: ${8:any} # not required. list of destination addresses
service: ${9:any} # not required. service
dnat_port: ${10:None} # not required. dnat translated port
api_key: ${11:undefined} # not required. API key that can be used instead of I(username)/I(password) credentials.
username: ${12:admin} # not required. Username credentials to use for auth unless I(api_key) is set.
snat_address_type: ${13:translated-address} # not required. type of source translation. Supported values are I(translated-address)/I(translated-address).
commit: ${14:true} # not required. Commit configuration if changed.
snat_dynamic_address: ${15:None} # not required. Source NAT translated address. Used with Dynamic-IP and Dynamic-IP-and-Port.
snat_interface_address: ${16:None} # not required. snat interface address
snat_bidirectional: ${17:false} # not required. bidirectional flag
operation: ${18:undefined} # not required. The action to be taken.  Supported values are I(add)/I(update)/I(find)/I(delete).
snat_interface: ${19:None} # not required. snat interface
snat_static_address: ${20:None} # not required. Source NAT translated address. Used with Static-IP translation.
snat_type: ${21:None} # not required. type of source translation

panos_object.description: create/read/update/delete object in PAN-OS or Panorama
body: panos_object:
ip_address: ${1:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device or Panorama management console being configured.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. Password credentials to use for authentication.
operation: ${3:undefined} # required. The operation to be performed.  Supported values are I(add)/I(delete)/I(find).
address: ${4:undefined} # not required. The IP address of the host or network in CIDR notation.
dynamic_value: ${5:undefined} # not required. The filter match criteria to be used in a dynamic addressgroup definition.
static_value: ${6:undefined} # not required. A group of address objects to be used in an addressgroup definition.
addressobject: ${7:undefined} # not required. The name of the address object.
source_port: ${8:undefined} # not required. The source port to be used in a service object definition.
address_type: ${9:undefined} # not required. The type of address object definition.  Valid types are I(ip-netmask) and I(ip-range).
description: ${10:undefined} # not required. The description of the object.

color: ${11:undefined} # not required. - The color of the tag object.  Valid values are I(red, green, blue, yellow, copper, orange, purple, gray, light green, cyan, light gray, blue gray, lime, black, gold, and brown).
protocol: ${12:undefined} # not required. The IP protocol to be used in a service object definition.  Valid values are I(tcp) or I(udp).
api_key: ${13:undefined} # not required. API key that can be used instead of I(username)/I(password) credentials.
devicegroup: ${14:None} # not required. - The name of the Panorama device group. The group must exist on Panorama. If device group is not defined it is assumed that we are contacting a firewall.
destination_port: ${15:undefined} # not required. The destination port to be used in a service object definition.
tag_name: ${16:undefined} # not required. The name of an object or rule tag.
serviceobject: ${17:undefined} # not required. The name of the service object.
servicegroup: ${18:undefined} # not required. A group of service objects.
addressgroup: ${19:undefined} # not required. A static group of address objects or dynamic address group.
username: ${20:admin} # not required. Username credentials to use for authentication.
services: ${21:undefined} # not required. The group of service objects used in a servicegroup definition.

panos_op.description: execute arbitrary OP commands on PANW devices (e.g. show interface all)
body: panos_op:
ip_address: ${1:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device or Panorama management console being configured.
cmd: ${2:undefined} # required. The OP command to be performed.
password: ${3:undefined} # required. Password credentials to use for authentication.
username: ${4:admin} # not required. Username credentials to use for authentication.
api_key: ${5:undefined} # not required. API key that can be used instead of I(username)/I(password) credentials.
panos_pg:
pg_name: ${1:undefined} # required. name of the security profile group
ip_address: ${2:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device
password: ${3:undefined} # required. password for authentication
url_filtering: ${4:None} # not required. name of the url filtering profile
wildfire: ${5:None} # not required. name of the wildfire analysis profile
file_blocking: ${6:None} # not required. name of the file blocking profile
username: ${7:admin} # not required. username for authentication
virus: ${8:None} # not required. name of the anti-virus profile
commit: ${9:true} # not required. commit if changed
data_filtering: ${10:None} # not required. name of the data filtering profile
vulnerability: ${11:None} # not required. name of the vulnerability profile
spyware: ${12:None} # not required. name of the spyware profile

panos_query_rules.description: PANOS module that allows search for security rules in PANW NGFW devices.
body: panos_query_rules:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. Password credentials to use for authentication.
ip_address: ${2:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS firewall or Panorama management console being queried.
protocol: ${3:None} # not required. The protocol used to be queried.  Must be either I(tcp) or I(udp).
api_key: ${4:undefined} # not required. API key that can be used instead of I(username)/I(password) credentials.
source_zone: ${5:None} # not required. Name of the source security zone to be queried.
application: ${6:None} # not required. Name of the application or application group to be queried.
source_ip: ${7:None} # not required. The source IP address to be queried.
destination_port: ${8:None} # not required. The destination port to be queried.
tag_name: ${9:None} # not required. Name of the rule tag to be queried.
destination_ip: ${10:None} # not required. The destination IP address to be queried.
source_port: ${11:None} # not required. The source port to be queried.
devicegroup: ${12:None} # not required. The Panorama device group in which to conduct the query.
username: ${13:admin} # not required. Username credentials to use for authentication.
destination_zone: ${14:None} # not required. Name of the destination security zone to be queried.
panos_restart:
ip_address: ${1:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device
password: ${2:undefined} # required. password for authentication
username: ${3:admin} # not required. username for authentication
panos_sag:
static_match_filter: ${1:null} # required. Static filter user by the address group
password: ${2:null} # required. password for authentication
ip_address: ${3:null} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device
operation: ${4:null} # required. The operation to perform Supported values are I(add)/I(list)/I(delete).
sag_name: ${5:null} # required. name of the dynamic address group
api_key: ${6:undefined} # not required. API key that can be used instead of I(username)/I(password) credentials.
