devicegroup: ${7:None} # not required. - The name of the Panorama device group. The group must exist on Panorama. If device group is not defined it is assumed that we are contacting a firewall.
commit: ${8:true} # not required. commit if changed
description: ${9:null} # not required. The purpose / objective of the static Address Group
username: ${10:admin} # not required. username for authentication
tags: ${11:null} # not required. Tags to be associated with the address group

panos_security_policy.description: Create security rule policy on PanOS devices.
body: panos_security_policy:
ip_address: ${1:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device being configured.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. Password credentials to use for auth unless I(api_key) is set.
rule_name: ${3:undefined} # required. Name of the security rule.
destination: ${4:any} # not required. List of destination addresses.
from_zone: ${5:any} # not required. List of source zones.
action: ${6:allow} # not required. Action to apply once rules maches.
application: ${7:any} # not required. List of applications.
file_blocking: ${8:None} # not required. Name of the already defined file_blocking profile.
source_user: ${9:any} # not required. Use users to enforce policy for individual users or a group of users.
description: ${10:None} # not required. Description for the security rule.
source: ${11:any} # not required. List of source addresses.
url_filtering: ${12:None} # not required. Name of the already defined url_filtering profile.

hip_profiles: ${13:any} # not required. If you are using GlobalProtect with host information profile (HIP) enabled, you can also base the policy on information collected by GlobalProtect. For example, the user access level can be determined HIP that notifies the firewall about the user's local configuration.
api_key: ${14:undefined} # not required. API key that can be used instead of I(username)/I(password) credentials.
log_end: ${15:true} # not required. Whether to log at session end.

devicegroup: ${16:None} # not required. Device groups are used for the Panorama interaction with Firewall(s). The group must exists on Panorama. If device group is not define we assume that we are contacting Firewall.
username: ${17:admin} # not required. Username credentials to use for auth unless I(api_key) is set.
commit: ${18:true} # not required. Commit configuration if changed.
to_zone: ${19:any} # not required. List of destination zones.
service: ${20:application-default} # not required. List of services.

group_profile: ${21:None} # not required. Security profile group that is already defined in the system. This property supersedes antivirus, vulnerability, spyware, url_filtering, file_blocking, data_filtering, and wildfire_analysis properties.
rule_type: ${22:universal} # not required. Type of security rule (version 6.1 of PanOS and above).
log_start: ${23:false} # not required. Whether to log at session start.
data_filtering: ${24:None} # not required. Name of the already defined data_filtering profile.
vulnerability: ${25:None} # not required. Name of the already defined vulnerability profile.
antivirus: ${26:None} # not required. Name of the already defined antivirus profile.
spyware: ${27:None} # not required. Name of the already defined spyware profile.
wildfire_analysis: ${28:None} # not required. Name of the already defined wildfire_analysis profile.
tag: ${29:None} # not required. Administrative tags that can be added to the rule. Note, tags must be already defined.

panos_security_rule.description: Create security rule policy on PAN-OS devices or Panorama management console.
body: panos_security_rule:
ip_address: ${1:undefined} # required. IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device being configured.
rule_name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the security rule.
password: ${3:undefined} # required. Password credentials to use for auth unless I(api_key) is set.
action: ${4:allow} # not required. Action to apply once rules maches.
application: ${5:any} # not required. List of applications.
file_blocking: ${6:None} # not required. Name of the already defined file_blocking profile.
source_ip: ${7:any} # not required. List of source addresses.
data_filtering: ${8:None} # not required. Name of the already defined data_filtering profile.
destination_ip: ${9:any} # not required. List of destination addresses.
api_key: ${10:undefined} # not required. API key that can be used instead of I(username)/I(password) credentials.
url_filtering: ${11:None} # not required. Name of the already defined url_filtering profile.

hip_profiles: ${12:any} # not required. - If you are using GlobalProtect with host information profile (HIP) enabled, you can also base the policy on information collected by GlobalProtect. For example, the user access level can be determined HIP that notifies the firewall about the user's local configuration.
description: ${13:None} # not required. Description for the security rule.
log_end: ${14:true} # not required. Whether to log at session end.
source_zone: ${15:any} # not required. List of source zones.
username: ${16:admin} # not required. Username credentials to use for auth unless I(api_key) is set.
commit: ${17:true} # not required. Commit configuration if changed.
log_start: ${18:false} # not required. Whether to log at session start.

group_profile: ${19:None} # not required. - Security profile group that is already defined in the system. This property supersedes antivirus, vulnerability, spyware, url_filtering, file_blocking, data_filtering, and wildfire_analysis properties.
tag_name: ${20:None} # not required. Administrative tags that can be added to the rule. Note, tags must be already defined.
rule_type: ${21:universal} # not required. Type of security rule (version 6.1 of PanOS and above).
destination_zone: ${22:any} # not required. List of destination zones.
operation: ${23:add} # not required. The action to be taken.  Supported values are I(add)/I(update)/I(find)/I(delete).

devicegroup: ${24:None} # not required. - Device groups are used for the Panorama interaction with Firewall(s). The group must exists on Panorama. If device group is not define we assume that we are contacting Firewall.
vulnerability: ${25:None} # not required. Name of the already defined vulnerability profile.
antivirus: ${26:None} # not required. Name of the already defined antivirus profile.
source_user: ${27:any} # not required. Use users to enforce policy for individual users or a group of users.
spyware: ${28:None} # not required. Name of the already defined spyware profile.
wildfire_analysis: ${29:None} # not required. Name of the already defined wildfire_analysis profile.
service: ${30:application-default} # not required. List of services.
parted:
device: ${1:undefined} # required. The block device (disk) where to operate.

part_end: ${2:100%} # not required. Where the partition will end as offset from the beginning of the disk, that is, the "distance" from the start of the disk. The distance can be specified with all the units supported by parted (except compat) and it is case sensitive. E.g. C(10GiB), C(15%).
flags: ${3:undefined} # not required. A list of the flags that has to be set on the partition.

part_type: ${4|primary,extended,logical|} # not required. choices: primary;extended;logical. Is one of 'primary', 'extended' or 'logical' and may be specified only with 'msdos' or 'dvh' partition tables. A name must be specified for a 'gpt' partition table. Neither part-type nor name may be used with a 'sun' partition table.

part_start: ${5:0%} # not required. Where the partition will start as offset from the beginning of the disk, that is, the "distance" from the start of the disk. The distance can be specified with all the units supported by parted (except compat) and it is case sensitive. E.g. C(10GiB), C(15%).
label: ${6|aix,amiga,bsd,dvh,gpt,loop,mac,msdos,pc98,sun|} # not required. choices: aix;amiga;bsd;dvh;gpt;loop;mac;msdos;pc98;sun. Creates a new disk label.

number: ${7:undefined} # not required. The number of the partition to work with or the number of the partition that will be created. Required when performing any action on the disk, except fetching information.
align: ${8|none,cylinder,minimal,optimal|} # not required. choices: none;cylinder;minimal;optimal. Set alignment for newly created partitions.
state: ${9|present,absent,info|} # not required. choices: present;absent;info. If to create or delete a partition. If set to C(info) the module will only return the device information.

unit: ${10|s,B,KB,KiB,MB,MiB,GB,GiB,TB,TiB,%,cyl,chs,compact|} # not required. choices: s;B;KB;KiB;MB;MiB;GB;GiB;TB;TiB;%;cyl;chs;compact. Selects the current default unit that Parted will use to display locations and capacities on the disk and to interpret those given by the user if they are not suffixed by an unit. When fetching information about a disk, it is always recommended to specify a unit.
name: ${11:undefined} # not required. Sets the name for the partition number (GPT, Mac, MIPS and PC98 only).

patch.description: Apply patch files using the GNU patch tool
body: patch:
src: ${1:undefined} # required. Path of the patch file as accepted by the GNU patch tool. If C(remote_src) is 'no', the patch source file is looked up from the module's I(files) directory.

dest: ${2:undefined} # not required. Path of the file on the remote machine to be patched.,The names of the files to be patched are usually taken from the patch file, but if there's just one file to be patched it can specified with this option.
backup: ${3|no,yes|} # not required. choices: no;yes. Passes C(--backup --version-control=numbered) to patch, producing numbered backup copies.
remote_src: ${4|no,yes|} # not required. choices: no;yes. If C(no), it will search for src at originating/master machine, if C(yes) it will go to the remote/target machine for the C(src).

strip: ${5:0} # not required. Number that indicates the smallest prefix containing leading slashes that will be stripped from each file name found in the patch file. For more information see the strip parameter of the GNU patch tool.
basedir: ${6:undefined} # not required. Path of a base directory in which the patch file will be applied. May be omitted when C(dest) option is specified, otherwise required.

binary: ${7|no,yes|} # not required. choices: no;yes. Setting to C(yes) will disable patch's heuristic for transforming CRLF line endings into LF. Line endings of src and dest must match. If set to C(no), C(patch) will replace CRLF in C(src) files on POSIX.
pause:
echo: ${1|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Contols whether or not keyboard input is shown when typing.,Has no effect if 'seconds' or 'minutes' is set.
seconds: ${2:null} # not required. A positive number of seconds to pause for.
prompt: ${3:null} # not required. Optional text to use for the prompt message.
minutes: ${4:null} # not required. A positive number of minutes to pause for.
pear:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the package to install, upgrade, or remove.
executable: ${2:null} # not required. Path to the pear executable
state: ${3|present,absent,latest|} # not required. choices: present;absent;latest. Desired state of the package.

ping.description: Try to connect to host, verify a usable python and return C(pong) on success
body: ping:
data: ${1:pong} # not required. Data to return for the C(ping) return value.,If this parameter is set to C(crash), the module will cause an exception.
pingdom:
passwd: ${1||} # required. choices: . Pingdom user password.
state: ${2|running,paused|} # required. choices: running;paused. Define whether or not the check should be running or paused.
uid: ${3||} # required. choices: . Pingdom user ID.
checkid: ${4||} # required. choices: . Pingdom ID of the check.
key: ${5||} # required. choices: . Pingdom API key.
pip:
chdir: ${1:undefined} # not required. cd into this directory before running the command

executable: ${2:undefined} # not required. The explicit executable or a pathname to the executable to be used to run pip for a specific version of Python installed in the system. For example C(pip-3.3), if there are both Python 2.7 and 3.3 installations in the system and you want to run pip for the Python 3.3 installation. It cannot be specified together with the 'virtualenv' parameter (added in 2.1). By default, it will take the appropriate version for the python interpreter use by ansible, e.g. pip3 on python 3, and pip2 or pip on python 2.
requirements: ${3:undefined} # not required. The path to a pip requirements file, which should be local to the remote system. File can be specified as a relative path if using the chdir option.

virtualenv_python: ${4:undefined} # not required. The Python executable used for creating the virtual environment. For example C(python3.5), C(python2.7). When not specified, the Python version used to run the ansible module is used. This parameter should not be used when C(virtualenv_command) is using C(pyvenv) or the C(-m venv) module.
version: ${5:undefined} # not required. The version number to install of the Python library specified in the I(name) parameter.

virtualenv_command: ${6:virtualenv} # not required. The command or a pathname to the command to create the virtual environment with. For example C(pyvenv), C(virtualenv), C(virtualenv2), C(~/bin/virtualenv), C(/usr/local/bin/virtualenv).
editable: ${7:no} # not required. Pass the editable flag.
extra_args: ${8:undefined} # not required. Extra arguments passed to pip.

umask: ${9:undefined} # not required. The system umask to apply before installing the pip package. This is useful, for example, when installing on systems that have a very restrictive umask by default (e.g., 0077) and you want to pip install packages which are to be used by all users. Note that this requires you to specify desired umask mode in octal, with a leading 0 (e.g., 0077).

virtualenv: ${10:undefined} # not required. An optional path to a I(virtualenv) directory to install into. It cannot be specified together with the 'executable' parameter (added in 2.1). If the virtualenv does not exist, it will be created before installing packages. The optional virtualenv_site_packages, virtualenv_command, and virtualenv_python options affect the creation of the virtualenv.

virtualenv_site_packages: ${11:no} # not required. Whether the virtual environment will inherit packages from the global site-packages directory.  Note that if this setting is changed on an already existing virtual environment it will not have any effect, the environment must be deleted and newly created.

state: ${12|absent,forcereinstall,latest,present|} # not required. choices: absent;forcereinstall;latest;present. The state of module,The 'forcereinstall' option is only available in Ansible 2.1 and above.
name: ${13:undefined} # not required. The name of a Python library to install or the url of the remote package.,As of 2.2 you can supply a list of names.

pkg5.description: Manages packages with the Solaris 11 Image Packaging System
body: pkg5:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. An FRMI of the package(s) to be installed/removed/updated.,Multiple packages may be specified, separated by C(,).
accept_licenses: ${2:no} # not required. Accept any licences.
state: ${3|absent,latest,present|} # not required. choices: absent;latest;present. Whether to install (I(present), I(latest)), or remove (I(absent)) a package.

pkg5_publisher.description: Manages Solaris 11 Image Packaging System publishers
body: pkg5_publisher:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The publisher's name.
enabled: ${2|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Is the repository enabled or disabled?
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether to ensure that a publisher is present or absent.
sticky: ${4|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Packages installed from a sticky repository can only receive updates from that repository.
origin: ${5:null} # not required. A path or URL to the repository.,Multiple values may be provided.
mirror: ${6:null} # not required. A path or URL to the repository mirror.,Multiple values may be provided.

pkgin.description: Package manager for SmartOS, NetBSD, et al.
body: pkgin:
update_cache: ${1|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Update repository database. Can be run with other steps or on it's own.
upgrade: ${2|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Upgrade main packages to their newer versions
force: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Force package reinstall
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Intended state of the package
full_upgrade: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Upgrade all packages to their newer versions
name: ${6:null} # not required. Name of package to install/remove;,multiple names may be given, separated by commas
clean: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Clean packages cache
pkgng:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name or list of names of packages to install/remove.
jail: ${2:undefined} # not required. Pkg will execute in the given jail name or id.,Can not be used together with I(chroot) or I(rootdir) options.

annotation: ${3:undefined} # not required. A comma-separated list of keyvalue-pairs of the form C(<+/-/:><key>[=<value>]). A C(+) denotes adding an annotation, a C(-) denotes removing an annotation, and C(:) denotes modifying an annotation. If setting or modifying annotations, a value must be provided.
autoremove: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Remove automatically installed packages which are no longer needed.
cached: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Use local package base instead of fetching an updated one.

pkgsite: ${6:undefined} # not required. For pkgng versions before 1.1.4, specify packagesite to use for downloading packages. If not specified, use settings from C(/usr/local/etc/pkg.conf).,For newer pkgng versions, specify a the name of a repository configured in C(/usr/local/etc/pkg/repos).

rootdir: ${7:undefined} # not required. For pkgng versions 1.5 and later, pkg will install all packages within the specified root directory.,Can not be used together with I(chroot) or I(jail) options.
chroot: ${8:undefined} # not required. Pkg will chroot in the specified environment.,Can not be used together with I(rootdir) or I(jail) options.
state: ${9|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the package.
pkgutil:

state: ${1|present,absent,latest|} # required. choices: present;absent;latest. Whether to install (C(present)), or remove (C(absent)) a package.,The upgrade (C(latest)) operation will update/install the package to the latest version available.,Note: The module has a limitation that (C(latest)) only works for one package, not lists of them.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Package name, e.g. (C(CSWnrpe))
site: ${3:undefined} # not required. Specifies the repository path to install the package from.,Its global definition is done in C(/etc/opt/csw/pkgutil.conf).
update_catalog: ${4:false} # not required. If you want to refresh your catalog from the mirror, set this to (C(yes)).

pn_cluster.description: CLI command to create/delete a cluster.
body: pn_cluster:
pn_name: ${1:undefined} # required. Specify the name of the cluster.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Specify action to perform. Use 'present' to create cluster and 'absent' to delete cluster.
pn_clipassword: ${3:undefined} # not required. Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_cluster_node1: ${4:undefined} # not required. Specify the name of the first switch in the cluster.,Required for 'cluster-create'.
pn_validate: ${5|validate,no-validate|} # not required. choices: validate;no-validate. Validate the inter-switch links and state of switches in the cluster.
pn_cliswitch: ${6:undefined} # not required. Target switch to run the cli on.
pn_cliusername: ${7:undefined} # not required. Provide login username if user is not root.
pn_cluster_node2: ${8:undefined} # not required. Specify the name of the second switch in the cluster.,Required for 'cluster-create'.

pn_ospf.description: CLI command to add/remove ospf protocol to a vRouter.
body: pn_ospf:
pn_network_ip: ${1:undefined} # required. Specify the network IP (IPv4 or IPv6) address.
pn_vrouter_name: ${2:undefined} # required. Specify the name of the vRouter.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Assert the state of the ospf. Use 'present' to add ospf and 'absent' to remove ospf.
pn_ospf_area: ${4:undefined} # not required. Stub area number for the configuration. Required for vrouter-ospf-add.
pn_cliusername: ${5:undefined} # not required. Provide login username if user is not root.
pn_cliswitch: ${6:undefined} # not required. Target switch to run the CLI on.
pn_clipassword: ${7:undefined} # not required. Provide login password if user is not root.

pn_ospfarea.description: CLI command to add/remove ospf area to/from a vrouter.
body: pn_ospfarea:
pn_vrouter_name: ${1:undefined} # required. Specify the name of the vRouter.
pn_ospf_area: ${2:undefined} # required. Specify the OSPF area number.
pn_cliusername: ${3:undefined} # required. Login username.
pn_clipassword: ${4:undefined} # required. Login password.

state: ${5|present,absent,update|} # required. choices: present;absent;update. State the action to perform. Use 'present' to add ospf-area, 'absent' to remove ospf-area and 'update' to modify ospf-area.
pn_cliswitch: ${6:undefined} # not required. Target switch(es) to run the CLI on.
pn_quiet: ${7:true} # not required. Enable/disable system information.
pn_stub_type: ${8|none,stub,stub-no-summary,nssa,nssa-no-summary|} # not required. choices: none;stub;stub-no-summary;nssa;nssa-no-summary. Specify the OSPF stub type.
pn_prefix_listout: ${9:undefined} # not required. OSPF prefix list for filtering outgoing packets.
pn_prefix_listin: ${10:undefined} # not required. OSPF prefix list for filtering incoming packets.

pn_show.description: Run show commands on nvOS device.
body: pn_show:
pn_command: ${1:undefined} # required. The C(pn_command) takes a CLI show command as value.
pn_parameters: ${2:undefined} # not required. Display output using a specific parameter. Use 'all' to display possible output. List of comma separated parameters.
pn_cliusername: ${3:undefined} # not required. Provide login username if user is not root.
pn_cliswitch: ${4:undefined} # not required. Target switch(es) to run the cli on.
pn_clipassword: ${5:undefined} # not required. Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_options: ${6:undefined} # not required. Specify formatting options.

pn_trunk.description: CLI command to create/delete/modify a trunk.
body: pn_trunk:
pn_name: ${1:undefined} # required. Specify the name for the trunk configuration.
state: ${2|present,absent,update|} # required. choices: present;absent;update. State the action to perform. Use 'present' to create trunk, 'absent' to delete trunk and 'update' to modify trunk.
pn_lacp_fallback: ${3|bundle,individual|} # not required. choices: bundle;individual. Specify the LACP fallback mode as bundles or individual.
pn_host: ${4:undefined} # not required. Host facing port control setting.
pn_cliswitch: ${5:undefined} # not required. Target switch(es) to run the cli on.
pn_loopvlans: ${6:undefined} # not required. Specify a list of looping vlans.
pn_unknown_ucast_level: ${7:undefined} # not required. Specify an unknown unicast level in percent. The default value is 100%.
pn_edge_switch: ${8:undefined} # not required. Specify if the switch is an edge switch.
pn_broadcast_level: ${9:undefined} # not required. Specify a broadcast level in percent. The default value is 100%.
pn_ports: ${10:undefined} # not required. Specify the port number(s) for the link(s) to aggregate into the trunk.,Required for trunk-create.
pn_routing: ${11:undefined} # not required. Specify if the port participates in routing on the network.
pn_unknown_mcast_level: ${12:undefined} # not required. Specify an unknown multicast level in percent. The default value is 100%.
pn_pause: ${13:undefined} # not required. Specify if pause frames are sent.
pn_egress_rate_limit: ${14:undefined} # not required. Specify an egress port data rate limit for the configuration.
pn_mirror_receive: ${15:undefined} # not required. Specify if the configuration receives mirrored traffic.
pn_port_macaddr: ${16:undefined} # not required. Specify the MAC address of the port.
pn_loopback: ${17:undefined} # not required. Specify loopback if you want to use loopback.
pn_lacp_fallback_timeout: ${18:undefined} # not required. Specify the LACP fallback timeout in seconds. The range is between 30 and 60 seconds with a default value of 50 seconds.
pn_description: ${19:undefined} # not required. Specify a description for the trunk configuration.
pn_jumbo: ${20:undefined} # not required. Specify if the port can receive jumbo frames.
pn_lacp_priority: ${21:undefined} # not required. Specify the LACP priority. This is a number between 1 and 65535 with a default value of 32768.
pn_cliusername: ${22:undefined} # not required. Provide login username if user is not root.
pn_clipassword: ${23:undefined} # not required. Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_speed: ${24|disable,10m,100m,1g,2.5g,10g,40g|} # not required. choices: disable;10m;100m;1g;2.5g;10g;40g. Specify the port speed or disable the port.
pn_lacp_timeout: ${25|slow,fast|} # not required. choices: slow;fast. Specify the LACP time out as slow (30 seconds) or fast (4seconds). The default value is slow.
pn_lacp_mode: ${26|off,passive,active|} # not required. choices: off;passive;active. Specify the LACP mode for the configuration.
pn_vlag:
state: ${1|present,absent,update|} # required. choices: present;absent;update. State the action to perform. Use 'present' to create vlag, 'absent' to delete vlag and 'update' to modify vlag.
pn_name: ${2:undefined} # required. The C(pn_name) takes a valid name for vlag configuration.
pn_port: ${3:undefined} # not required. Specify the local VLAG port.,Required for vlag-create.
pn_lacp_fallback: ${4|bundle,individual|} # not required. choices: bundle;individual. Specify the LACP fallback mode as bundles or individual.
pn_cliswitch: ${5:undefined} # not required. Target switch(es) to run this command on.
pn_failover_action: ${6|move,ignore|} # not required. choices: move;ignore. Specify the failover action as move or ignore.
pn_peer_switch: ${7:undefined} # not required. Specify the fabric-name of the peer switch.
pn_lacp_fallback_timeout: ${8:undefined} # not required. Specify the LACP fallback timeout in seconds. The range is between 30 and 60 seconds with a default value of 50 seconds.
pn_peer_port: ${9:undefined} # not required. Specify the peer VLAG port.,Required for vlag-create.
pn_cliusername: ${10:undefined} # not required. Provide login username if user is not root.

pn_mode: ${11|active-active,active-standby|} # not required. choices: active-active;active-standby. Specify the mode for the VLAG. Active-standby indicates one side is active and the other side is in standby mode. Active-active indicates that both sides of the vlag are up by default.
pn_clipassword: ${12:undefined} # not required. Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_lacp_timeout: ${13|slow,fast|} # not required. choices: slow;fast. Specify the LACP timeout as slow(30 seconds) or fast(4 seconds).
pn_lacp_mode: ${14|off,passive,active|} # not required. choices: off;passive;active. Specify the LACP mode.

pn_vlan.description: CLI command to create/delete a VLAN.
body: pn_vlan:
state: ${1|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. State the action to perform. Use 'present' to create vlan and 'absent' to delete vlan.
pn_vlanid: ${2:undefined} # required. Specify a VLAN identifier for the VLAN. This is a value between 2 and 4092.
pn_untagged_ports: ${3:undefined} # not required. Specifies the ports that should have untagged packets mapped to the VLAN. Untagged packets are packets that do not contain IEEE 802.1Q VLAN tags.
pn_clipassword: ${4:undefined} # not required. Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_scope: ${5|fabric,local|} # not required. choices: fabric;local. Specify a scope for the VLAN.,Required for vlan-create.
pn_stats: ${6:undefined} # not required. Specify if you want to collect statistics for a VLAN. Statistic collection is enabled by default.
pn_description: ${7:undefined} # not required. Specify a description for the VLAN.
pn_cliswitch: ${8:undefined} # not required. Target switch(es) to run the cli on.
pn_cliusername: ${9:undefined} # not required. Provide login username if user is not root.
pn_ports: ${10:undefined} # not required. Specifies the switch network data port number, list of ports, or range of ports. Port numbers must ne in the range of 1 to 64.

pn_vrouter.description: CLI command to create/delete/modify a vrouter.
body: pn_vrouter:
pn_name: ${1:undefined} # required. Specify the name of the vRouter.
state: ${2|present,absent,update|} # required. choices: present;absent;update. State the action to perform. Use 'present' to create vrouter, 'absent' to delete vrouter and 'update' to modify vrouter.
pn_bgp_redistribute: ${3|static,connected,rip,ospf|} # not required. choices: static;connected;rip;ospf. Specify how BGP routes are redistributed.
pn_bgp_options: ${4:undefined} # not required. Specify other BGP options as a whitespaces separated string within single quotes ''.
pn_service_state: ${5|enable,disable|} # not required. choices: enable;disable. Specify to enable or disable vRouter service.
pn_ospf_redistribute: ${6|static,connected,bgp,rip|} # not required. choices: static;connected;bgp;rip. Specify how OSPF routes are redistributed.
pn_hw_vrrp_id: ${7:undefined} # not required. Specifies the VRRP ID for a hardware vrouter.
pn_router_id: ${8:undefined} # not required. Specify the vRouter IP address.
pn_ospf_options: ${9:undefined} # not required. Specify other OSPF options as a whitespaces separated string within single quotes ''.
pn_rip_redistribute: ${10|static,connected,ospf,bgp|} # not required. choices: static;connected;ospf;bgp. Specify how RIP routes are redistributed.
pn_clipassword: ${11:undefined} # not required. Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_vnet: ${12:undefined} # not required. Specify the name of the VNET.,Required for vrouter-create.
pn_bgp_as: ${13:undefined} # not required. Specify the Autonomous System Number(ASN) if the vRouter runs Border Gateway Protocol(BGP).
pn_cliswitch: ${14:undefined} # not required. Target switch(es) to run the CLI on.
pn_cliusername: ${15:undefined} # not required. Provide login username if user is not root.

pn_router_type: ${16|hardware,software|} # not required. choices: hardware;software. Specify if the vRouter uses software or hardware.,Note that if you specify hardware as router type, you cannot assign IP addresses using DHCP. You must specify a static IP address.
pn_bgp_max_paths: ${17:undefined} # not required. Specify the maximum number of paths for BGP. This is a number between 1 and 255 or 0 to unset.
pn_service_type: ${18|dedicated,shared|} # not required. choices: dedicated;shared. Specify if the vRouter is a dedicated or shared VNET service.
pn_vrouterbgp:
pn_vrouter_name: ${1:undefined} # required. Specify a name for the vRouter service.
state: ${2|present,absent,update|} # required. choices: present;absent;update. State the action to perform. Use 'present' to add bgp, 'absent' to remove bgp and 'update' to modify bgp.
pn_bfd: ${3:undefined} # not required. Specify if you want BFD protocol support for fault detection.
pn_max_prefix: ${4:undefined} # not required. Specify the maximum number of prefixes.
pn_cliswitch: ${5:undefined} # not required. Target switch(es) to run the cli on.
pn_multiprotocol: ${6|ipv4-unicast,ipv6-unicast|} # not required. choices: ipv4-unicast;ipv6-unicast. Specify a multi-protocol for BGP.
pn_override_capability: ${7:undefined} # not required. Specify if you want to override capability.
pn_weight: ${8:undefined} # not required. Specify a default weight value between 0 and 65535 for the neighbor routes.
pn_default_originate: ${9:undefined} # not required. Specify if you want announce default routes to the neighbor or not.
pn_route_reflector: ${10:undefined} # not required. Specify if a route reflector client is used.
pn_next_hop_self: ${11:undefined} # not required. Specify if the next-hop is the same router or not.
pn_route_mapout: ${12:undefined} # not required. Specify outbound route map for neighbor.
pn_clipassword: ${13:undefined} # not required. Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_route_mapin: ${14:undefined} # not required. Specify inbound route map for neighbor.
pn_prefix_listin: ${15:undefined} # not required. Specify the prefix list to filter traffic inbound.
pn_neighbor: ${16:undefined} # not required. Specify a neighbor IP address to use for BGP.,Required for vrouter-bgp-add.
pn_max_prefix_warn: ${17:undefined} # not required. Specify if you want a warning message when the maximum number of prefixes is exceeded.
pn_keepalive: ${18:undefined} # not required. Specify BGP neighbor keepalive interval in seconds.

pn_ebgp: ${19:undefined} # not required. Specify a value for external BGP to accept or attempt BGP connections to external peers, not directly connected, on the network. This is a value between 1 and 255.
pn_holdtime: ${20:undefined} # not required. Specify BGP neighbor holdtime in seconds.
pn_prefix_listout: ${21:undefined} # not required. Specify the prefix list to filter traffic outbound.
pn_soft_reconfig: ${22:undefined} # not required. Specify if you want a soft reconfiguration of inbound traffic.
pn_cliusername: ${23:undefined} # not required. Provide login username if user is not root.
pn_remote_as: ${24:undefined} # not required. Specify the remote Autonomous System(AS) number. This value is between 1 and 4294967295.,Required for vrouter-bgp-add.
pn_password: ${25:undefined} # not required. Specify a password, if desired.
pn_vrouterif:
pn_vrouter_name: ${1:undefined} # required. Specify the name of the vRouter interface.

state: ${2|present,absent,update|} # required. choices: present;absent;update. State the action to perform. Use 'present' to add vrouter interface, 'absent' to remove vrouter interface and 'update' to modify vrouter interface.
pn_alias: ${3:undefined} # not required. Specify an alias for the interface.

pn_exclusive: ${4:undefined} # not required. Specify if the interface is exclusive to the configuration. Exclusive means that other configurations cannot use the interface. Exclusive is specified when you configure the interface as span interface and allows higher throughput through the interface.
pn_nic_enable: ${5:undefined} # not required. Specify if the NIC is enabled or not
pn_cliswitch: ${6:undefined} # not required. Target switch to run the cli on.
pn_assignment: ${7|none,dhcp,dhcpv6,autov6|} # not required. choices: none;dhcp;dhcpv6;autov6. Specify the DHCP method for IP address assignment.
pn_nic_str: ${8:undefined} # not required. Specify the type of NIC. Used for vrouter-interface remove/modify.
pn_interface_ip: ${9:undefined} # not required. Specify the IP address of the interface in x.x.x.x/n format.
pn_clipassword: ${10:undefined} # not required. Provide login password if user is not root.
pn_vlan: ${11:undefined} # not required. Specify the VLAN identifier. This is a value between 1 and 4092.
pn_vrrp_id: ${12:undefined} # not required. Specify the ID for the VRRP interface. The IDs on both vRouters must be the same IS number.
pn_l3port: ${13:undefined} # not required. Specify a Layer 3 port for the interface.
pn_interface: ${14|mgmt,data,span|} # not required. choices: mgmt;data;span. Specify if the interface is management, data or span interface.
pn_vxlan: ${15:undefined} # not required. Specify the VXLAN identifier. This is a value between 1 and 16777215.
pn_cliusername: ${16:undefined} # not required. Provide login username if user is not root.
pn_vrrp_priority: ${17:undefined} # not required. Specify the priority for the VRRP interface. This is a value between 1 (lowest) and 255 (highest).
pn_vrrp_adv_int: ${18:undefined} # not required. Specify a VRRP advertisement interval in milliseconds. The range is from 30 to 40950 with a default value of 1000.
pn_secondary_macs: ${19:undefined} # not required. Specify a secondary MAC address for the interface.
pn_vrouterlbif:
pn_interface_ip: ${1:undefined} # required. Specify the IP address.
pn_vrouter_name: ${2:undefined} # required. Specify the name of the vRouter.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. State the action to perform. Use 'present' to add vrouter loopback interface and 'absent' to remove vrouter loopback interface.
pn_index: ${4:undefined} # not required. Specify the interface index from 1 to 255.
pn_cliusername: ${5:undefined} # not required. Provide login username if user is not root.
pn_cliswitch: ${6:undefined} # not required. Target switch(es) to run the cli on.
pn_clipassword: ${7:undefined} # not required. Provide login password if user is not root.
portage:

depclean: ${1|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Remove packages not needed by explicitly merged packages (--depclean),If no package is specified, clean up the world's dependencies,Otherwise, --depclean serves as a dependency aware version of --unmerge
newuse: ${2|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Include installed packages where USE flags have changed (--newuse)
keepgoing: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Continue as much as possible after an error.
onlydeps: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Only merge packages' dependencies but not the packages (--onlydeps)
noreplace: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Do not re-emerge installed packages (--noreplace)

changed_use: ${6|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Include installed packages where USE flags have changed, except when,flags that the user has not enabled are added or removed,(--changed-use)
nodeps: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Only merge packages but not their dependencies (--nodeps)
jobs: ${8:None} # not required. Specifies the number of packages to build simultaneously.
sync: ${9|web,yes,no|} # not required. choices: web;yes;no. Sync package repositories first,If yes, perform "emerge --sync",If web, perform "emerge-webrsync"
getbinpkg: ${10|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Prefer packages specified at PORTAGE_BINHOST in make.conf
loadavg: ${11:None} # not required. Specifies that no new builds should be started if there are,other builds running and the load average is at least LOAD
deep: ${12|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Consider the entire dependency tree of packages (--deep)
usepkgonly: ${13|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Merge only binaries (no compiling). This sets getbinpkg=yes.
update: ${14|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Update packages to the best version available (--update)
package: ${15:null} # not required. Package atom or set, e.g. C(sys-apps/foo) or C(>foo-2.13) or C(@world)
quiet: ${16|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Run emerge in quiet mode (--quiet)
state: ${17|present,installed,emerged,absent,removed,unmerged,latest|} # not required. choices: present;installed;emerged;absent;removed;unmerged;latest. State of the package atom
verbose: ${18|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Run emerge in verbose mode (--verbose)
oneshot: ${19|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Do not add the packages to the world file (--oneshot)

portinstall.description: Installing packages from FreeBSD's ports system
body: portinstall:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. name of package to install/remove
use_packages: ${2|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. use packages instead of ports whenever available
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. state of the package

postgresql_db.description: Add or remove PostgreSQL databases from a remote host.
body: postgresql_db:
name: ${1:null} # required. name of the database to add or remove
login_password: ${2:null} # not required. The password used to authenticate with
template: ${3:null} # not required. Template used to create the database
target_opts: ${4:undefined} # not required. Further arguments for pg_dump or pg_restore. Used when state is "dump" or "restore"
port: ${5:5432} # not required. Database port to connect to.

ssl_mode: ${6|disable,allow,prefer,require,verify-ca,verify-full|} # not required. choices: disable;allow;prefer;require;verify-ca;verify-full. Determines whether or with what priority a secure SSL TCP/IP connection will be negotiated with the server.,See https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/libpq-ssl.html for more information on the modes.,Default of C(prefer) matches libpq default.

ssl_rootcert: ${7:null} # not required. Specifies the name of a file containing SSL certificate authority (CA) certificate(s).,If the file exists, the server's certificate will be verified to be signed by one of these authorities.
login_unix_socket: ${8:null} # not required. Path to a Unix domain socket for local connections
target: ${9:undefined} # not required. File to back up or restore from. Used when state is "dump" or "restore"
maintenance_db: ${10:postgres} # not required. The value specifies the initial database (which is also called as maintenance DB) that Ansible connects to.
owner: ${11:null} # not required. Name of the role to set as owner of the database

lc_ctype: ${12:null} # not required. Character classification (LC_CTYPE) to use in the database (e.g. lower, upper, ...) Must match LC_CTYPE of template database unless C(template0) is used as template.
login_host: ${13:null} # not required. Host running the database
lc_collate: ${14:null} # not required. Collation order (LC_COLLATE) to use in the database. Must match collation order of template database unless C(template0) is used as template.
login_user: ${15:postgres} # not required. The username used to authenticate with
encoding: ${16:null} # not required. Encoding of the database

state: ${17|present,absent,dump,restore|} # not required. choices: present;absent;dump;restore. The database state. present implies that the database should be created if necessary.
absent implies that the database should be removed if present.
dump requires a target definition to which the database will be backed up.
(Added in 2.4) restore also requires a target definition from which the database will be restored.
(Added in 2.4) The format of the backup will be detected based on the target name.
Supported compression formats for dump and restore are: .bz2, .gz, and .xz
Supported formats for dump and restore are: .sql and .tar

postgresql_ext.description: Add or remove PostgreSQL extensions from a database.
body: postgresql_ext:
db: ${1:null} # required. name of the database to add or remove the extension to/from
name: ${2:null} # required. name of the extension to add or remove
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The database extension state
login_host: ${4:localhost} # not required. Host running the database
login_user: ${5:null} # not required. The username used to authenticate with
login_password: ${6:null} # not required. The password used to authenticate with
port: ${7:5432} # not required. Database port to connect to.

postgresql_lang.description: Adds, removes or changes procedural languages with a PostgreSQL database.
body: postgresql_lang:
lang: ${1:null} # required. name of the procedural language to add, remove or change
trust: ${2|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. make this language trusted for the selected db
login_password: ${3:null} # not required. Password used to authenticate with PostgreSQL (must match C(login_user))
force_trust: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. marks the language as trusted, even if it's marked as untrusted in pg_pltemplate.,use with care!
db: ${5:null} # not required. name of database where the language will be added, removed or changed
port: ${6:5432} # not required. Database port to connect to.
login_host: ${7:localhost} # not required. Host running PostgreSQL where you want to execute the actions.
cascade: ${8|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. when dropping a language, also delete object that depend on this language.,only used when C(state=absent).
login_user: ${9:postgres} # not required. User used to authenticate with PostgreSQL
state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The state of the language for the selected database

fail_on_drop: ${11|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. if C(yes), fail when removing a language. Otherwise just log and continue,in some cases, it is not possible to remove a language (used by the db-system). When         dependencies block the removal, consider using C(cascade).

postgresql_privs.description: Grant or revoke privileges on PostgreSQL database objects.
body: postgresql_privs:

roles: ${1:undefined} # required. Comma separated list of role (user/group) names to set permissions for.,The special value C(PUBLIC) can be provided instead to set permissions for the implicitly defined PUBLIC group.,Alias: I(role)
database: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of database to connect to.,Alias: I(db)
privs: ${3:undefined} # not required. Comma separated list of privileges to grant/revoke.,Alias: I(priv)

type: ${4|table,sequence,function,database,schema,language,tablespace,group|} # not required. choices: table;sequence;function;database;schema;language;tablespace;group. Type of database object to set privileges on.

grant_option: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether C(role) may grant/revoke the specified privileges/group memberships to others.,Set to C(no) to revoke GRANT OPTION, leave unspecified to make no changes.,I(grant_option) only has an effect if I(state) is C(present).,Alias: I(admin_option)
login_unix_socket: ${6:null} # not required. Path to a Unix domain socket for local connections
password: ${7:null} # not required. The password to authenticate with.,Alias: I(login_password))
login_password: ${8:null} # not required. The password used to authenticate with
port: ${9:5432} # not required. Database port to connect to.

ssl_mode: ${10|disable,allow,prefer,require,verify-ca,verify-full|} # not required. choices: disable;allow;prefer;require;verify-ca;verify-full. Determines whether or with what priority a secure SSL TCP/IP connection will be negotiated with the server.,See https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/libpq-ssl.html for more information on the modes.,Default of C(prefer) matches libpq default.

objs: ${11:undefined} # not required. Comma separated list of database objects to set privileges on.,If I(type) is C(table) or C(sequence), the special value C(ALL_IN_SCHEMA) can be provided instead to specify all database objects of type I(type) in the schema specified via I(schema). (This also works with PostgreSQL < 9.0.),If I(type) is C(database), this parameter can be omitted, in which case privileges are set for the database specified via I(database).,If I(type) is I(function), colons (":") in object names will be replaced with commas (needed to specify function signatures, see examples),Alias: I(obj)
unix_socket: ${12:null} # not required. Path to a Unix domain socket for local connections.,Alias: I(login_unix_socket)
state: ${13|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. If C(present), the specified privileges are granted, if C(absent) they are revoked.

ssl_rootcert: ${14:null} # not required. Specifies the name of a file containing SSL certificate authority (CA) certificate(s). If the file exists, the server's certificate will be verified to be signed by one of these authorities.
login_host: ${15:null} # not required. Host running the database

schema: ${16:undefined} # not required. Schema that contains the database objects specified via I(objs).,May only be provided if I(type) is C(table), C(sequence) or C(function). Defaults to  C(public) in these cases.
login: ${17:postgres} # not required. The username to authenticate with.,Alias: I(login_user)
host: ${18:null} # not required. Database host address. If unspecified, connect via Unix socket.,Alias: I(login_host)
login_user: ${19:postgres} # not required. The username used to authenticate with

postgresql_schema.description: Add or remove PostgreSQL schema from a remote host
body: postgresql_schema:
name: ${1:null} # required. Name of the schema to add or remove.
login_password: ${2:null} # not required. The password used to authenticate with.
port: ${3:5432} # not required. Database port to connect to.
login_unix_socket: ${4:null} # not required. Path to a Unix domain socket for local connections.
owner: ${5:null} # not required. Name of the role to set as owner of the schema.
login_host: ${6:localhost} # not required. Host running the database.
login_user: ${7:null} # not required. The username used to authenticate with.
database: ${8:postgres} # not required. Name of the database to connect to.
state: ${9|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The schema state.

postgresql_user.description: Adds or removes a users (roles) from a PostgreSQL database.
body: postgresql_user:
name: ${1:null} # required. name of the user (role) to add or remove
priv: ${2:null} # not required. PostgreSQL privileges string in the format: C(table:priv1,priv2)

no_password_changes: ${3|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. if C(yes), don't inspect database for password changes. Effective when C(pg_authid) is not accessible (such as AWS RDS). Otherwise, make password changes as necessary.
port: ${4:5432} # not required. Database port to connect to.

ssl_rootcert: ${5:null} # not required. Specifies the name of a file containing SSL certificate authority (CA) certificate(s). If the file exists, the server's certificate will be verified to be signed by one of these authorities.
db: ${6:null} # not required. name of database where permissions will be granted
login_user: ${7:postgres} # not required. User (role) used to authenticate with PostgreSQL

role_attr_flags: ${8|[NO]SUPERUSER,[NO]CREATEROLE,[NO]CREATEDB,[NO]INHERIT,[NO]LOGIN,[NO]REPLICATION,[NO]BYPASSRLS|} # not required. choices: [NO]SUPERUSER;[NO]CREATEROLE;[NO]CREATEDB;[NO]INHERIT;[NO]LOGIN;[NO]REPLICATION;[NO]BYPASSRLS. PostgreSQL role attributes string in the format: CREATEDB,CREATEROLE,SUPERUSER,Note that '[NO]CREATEUSER' is deprecated.

expires: ${9:null} # not required. The date at which the user's password is to expire.,If set to C('infinity'), user's password never expire.,Note that this value should be a valid SQL date and time type.
conn_limit: ${10:null} # not required. Specifies the user connection limit.

password: ${11:null} # not required. set the user's password, before 1.4 this was required.,When passing an encrypted password, the encrypted parameter must also be true, and it must be generated with the format C('str[\"md5\"] + md5[ password + username ]'), resulting in a total of 35 characters.  An easy way to do this is: C(echo \"md5`echo -n \"verysecretpasswordJOE\" | md5`\"). Note that if the provided password string is already in MD5-hashed format, then it is used as-is, regardless of encrypted parameter.

encrypted: ${12:false} # not required. whether the password is stored hashed in the database. boolean. Passwords can be passed already hashed or unhashed, and postgresql ensures the stored password is hashed when encrypted is set.

ssl_mode: ${13|disable,allow,prefer,require,verify-ca,verify-full|} # not required. choices: disable;allow;prefer;require;verify-ca;verify-full. Determines whether or with what priority a secure SSL TCP/IP connection will be negotiated with the server.,See https://www.postgresql.org/docs/current/static/libpq-ssl.html for more information on the modes.,Default of C(prefer) matches libpq default.
login_unix_socket: ${14:null} # not required. Path to a Unix domain socket for local connections
fail_on_user: ${15|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. if C(yes), fail when user can't be removed. Otherwise just log and continue
login_host: ${16:localhost} # not required. Host running PostgreSQL.
login_password: ${17:null} # not required. Password used to authenticate with PostgreSQL
state: ${18|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The user (role) state

profitbricks.description: Create, destroy, start, stop, and reboot a ProfitBricks virtual machine.
body: profitbricks:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the virtual machine.
image: ${2:undefined} # required. The system image ID for creating the virtual machine, e.g. a3eae284-a2fe-11e4-b187-5f1f641608c8.
datacenter: ${3:null} # not required. The datacenter to provision this virtual machine.
count: ${4:1} # not required. The number of virtual machines to create.
auto_increment: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether or not to increment a single number in the name for created virtual machines.
remove_boot_volume: ${6|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. remove the bootVolume of the virtual machine you're destroying.
volume_size: ${7:10} # not required. The size in GB of the boot volume.
wait_timeout: ${8:600} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
bus: ${9|IDE,VIRTIO|} # not required. choices: IDE;VIRTIO. The bus type for the volume.
wait: ${10|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the instance to be in state 'running' before returning
ram: ${11:2048} # not required. The amount of memory to allocate to the virtual machine.
location: ${12|us/las,de/fra,de/fkb|} # not required. choices: us/las;de/fra;de/fkb. The datacenter location. Use only if you want to create the Datacenter or else this value is ignored.
subscription_user: ${13:null} # not required. The ProfitBricks username. Overrides the PB_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environment variable.
image_password: ${14:undefined} # not required. Password set for the administrative user.
cores: ${15:2} # not required. The number of CPU cores to allocate to the virtual machine.
cpu_family: ${16|AMD_OPTERON,INTEL_XEON|} # not required. choices: AMD_OPTERON;INTEL_XEON. The CPU family type to allocate to the virtual machine.
ssh_keys: ${17:undefined} # not required. Public SSH keys allowing access to the virtual machine.
subscription_password: ${18:null} # not required. THe ProfitBricks password. Overrides the PB_PASSWORD environment variable.
assign_public_ip: ${19:false} # not required. This will assign the machine to the public LAN. If no LAN exists with public Internet access it is created.
instance_ids: ${20:undefined} # not required. list of instance ids, currently only used when state='absent' to remove instances.
state: ${21|running,stopped,absent,present|} # not required. choices: running;stopped;absent;present. create or terminate instances
lan: ${22:1} # not required. The ID of the LAN you wish to add the servers to.

profitbricks_datacenter.description: Create or destroy a ProfitBricks Virtual Datacenter.
body: profitbricks_datacenter:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the virtual datacenter.
location: ${2|us/las,de/fra,de/fkb|} # not required. choices: us/las;de/fra;de/fkb. The datacenter location.
wait_timeout: ${3:600} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
subscription_user: ${4:undefined} # not required. The ProfitBricks username. Overrides the PB_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environment variable.
description: ${5:undefined} # not required. The description of the virtual datacenter.
subscription_password: ${6:undefined} # not required. THe ProfitBricks password. Overrides the PB_PASSWORD environment variable.
wait: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the datacenter to be created before returning
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. create or terminate datacenters
profitbricks_nic:
datacenter: ${1:undefined} # required. The datacenter in which to operate.
server: ${2:undefined} # required. The server name or ID.
lan: ${3:undefined} # required. The LAN to place the NIC on. You can pass a LAN that doesn't exist and it will be created. Required on create.
name: ${4:undefined} # required. The name or ID of the NIC. This is only required on deletes, but not on create.
wait_timeout: ${5:600} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
subscription_user: ${6:undefined} # not required. The ProfitBricks username. Overrides the PB_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environment variable.
subscription_password: ${7:undefined} # not required. THe ProfitBricks password. Overrides the PB_PASSWORD environment variable.
wait: ${8|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the operation to complete before returning
state: ${9|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource
profitbricks_volume:
datacenter: ${1:undefined} # required. The datacenter in which to create the volumes.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the volumes. You can enumerate the names using auto_increment.
image: ${3:undefined} # required. The system image ID for the volume, e.g. a3eae284-a2fe-11e4-b187-5f1f641608c8. This can also be a snapshot image ID.
count: ${4:1} # not required. The number of volumes you wish to create.
auto_increment: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether or not to increment a single number in the name for created virtual machines.
licence_type: ${6|LINUX,WINDOWS,UNKNOWN,OTHER|} # not required. choices: LINUX;WINDOWS;UNKNOWN;OTHER. The licence type for the volume. This is used when the image is non-standard.
subscription_user: ${7:undefined} # not required. The ProfitBricks username. Overrides the PB_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environment variable.
wait_timeout: ${8:600} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
bus: ${9|IDE,VIRTIO|} # not required. choices: IDE;VIRTIO. The bus type.
wait: ${10|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the datacenter to be created before returning
size: ${11:10} # not required. The size of the volume.
image_password: ${12:undefined} # not required. Password set for the administrative user.
ssh_keys: ${13:undefined} # not required. Public SSH keys allowing access to the virtual machine.
subscription_password: ${14:undefined} # not required. THe ProfitBricks password. Overrides the PB_PASSWORD environment variable.
disk_type: ${15|HDD,SSD|} # not required. choices: HDD;SSD. The disk type of the volume.
state: ${16|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. create or terminate datacenters
instance_ids: ${17:undefined} # not required. list of instance ids, currently only used when state='absent' to remove instances.
profitbricks_volume_attachments:
datacenter: ${1:undefined} # required. The datacenter in which to operate.
server: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the server you wish to detach or attach the volume.
volume: ${3:undefined} # required. The volume name or ID.
wait_timeout: ${4:600} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
subscription_user: ${5:undefined} # not required. The ProfitBricks username. Overrides the PB_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environment variable.
subscription_password: ${6:undefined} # not required. THe ProfitBricks password. Overrides the PB_PASSWORD environment variable.
wait: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the operation to complete before returning
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource

proxmox.description: management of instances in Proxmox VE cluster
body: proxmox:
api_user: ${1:undefined} # required. the user to authenticate with
api_host: ${2:undefined} # required. the host of the Proxmox VE cluster
ostemplate: ${3:null} # not required. the template for VM creating,required only for C(state=present)
validate_certs: ${4:false} # not required. enable / disable https certificate verification
onboot: ${5:false} # not required. specifies whether a VM will be started during system bootup
ip_address: ${6:null} # not required. specifies the address the container will be assigned
searchdomain: ${7:null} # not required. sets DNS search domain for a container
vmid: ${8:null} # not required. the instance id,if not set, the next available VM ID will be fetched from ProxmoxAPI.,if not set, will be fetched from PromoxAPI based on the hostname
disk: ${9:3} # not required. hard disk size in GB for instance
nameserver: ${10:null} # not required. sets DNS server IP address for a container
memory: ${11:512} # not required. memory size in MB for instance
storage: ${12:local} # not required. target storage
pool: ${13:null} # not required. Proxmox VE resource pool
state: ${14|present,started,absent,stopped,restarted|} # not required. choices: present;started;absent;stopped;restarted. Indicate desired state of the instance

force: ${15:false} # not required. forcing operations,can be used only with states C(present), C(stopped), C(restarted),with C(state=present) force option allow to overwrite existing container,with states C(stopped) , C(restarted) allow to force stop instance
password: ${16:null} # not required. the instance root password,required only for C(state=present)
cores: ${17:1} # not required. Specify number of cores per socket.
cpuunits: ${18:1000} # not required. CPU weight for a VM
cpus: ${19:1} # not required. numbers of allocated cpus for instance
pubkey: ${20:null} # not required. Public key to add to /root/.ssh/authorized_keys. This was added on Proxmox 4.2, it is ignored for earlier versions
api_password: ${21:null} # not required. the password to authenticate with,you can use PROXMOX_PASSWORD environment variable
node: ${22:null} # not required. Proxmox VE node, when new VM will be created,required only for C(state=present),for another states will be autodiscovered
netif: ${23:null} # not required. specifies network interfaces for the container. As a hash/dictionary defining interfaces.
mounts: ${24:null} # not required. specifies additional mounts (separate disks) for the container. As a hash/dictionary defining mount points
swap: ${25:0} # not required. swap memory size in MB for instance
timeout: ${26:30} # not required. timeout for operations
unprivileged: ${27:false} # not required. Indicate if the container should be unprivileged
hostname: ${28:null} # not required. the instance hostname,required only for C(state=present),must be unique if vmid is not passed

proxmox_kvm.description: Management of Qemu(KVM) Virtual Machines in Proxmox VE cluster.
body: proxmox_kvm:
api_user: ${1:undefined} # required. Specify the user to authenticate with.
api_host: ${2:undefined} # required. Specify the target host of the Proxmox VE cluster.
lock: ${3|migrate,backup,snapshot,rollback|} # not required. choices: migrate;backup;snapshot;rollback. Lock/unlock the VM.
onboot: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Specifies whether a VM will be started during system bootup.

net: ${5:null} # not required. A hash/dictionary of network interfaces for the VM. C(net='{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - C(net[n]) where 0 ≤ n ≤ N.,Values allowed are - C("model="XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX",brigde="value",rate="value",tag="value",firewall="1|0",trunks="vlanid"").,Model is one of C(e1000 e1000-82540em e1000-82544gc e1000-82545em i82551 i82557b i82559er ne2k_isa ne2k_pci pcnet rtl8139 virtio vmxnet3).,C(XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX) should be an unique MAC address. This is automatically generated if not specified.,The C(bridge) parameter can be used to automatically add the interface to a bridge device. The Proxmox VE standard bridge is called 'vmbr0'.,Option C(rate) is used to limit traffic bandwidth from and to this interface. It is specified as floating point number, unit is 'Megabytes per second'.,If you specify no bridge, we create a kvm 'user' (NATed) network device, which provides DHCP and DNS services.

vga: ${6|std,cirrus,vmware,qxl,serial0,serial1,serial2,serial3,qxl2,qxl3,qxl4|} # not required. choices: std;cirrus;vmware;qxl;serial0;serial1;serial2;serial3;qxl2;qxl3;qxl4. Select VGA type. If you want to use high resolution modes (>= 1280x1024x16) then you should use option 'std' or 'vmware'.

ide: ${7:null} # not required. A hash/dictionary of volume used as IDE hard disk or CD-ROM. C(ide='{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - C(ide[n]) where 0 ≤ n ≤ 3.,Values allowed are - C("storage:size,format=value").,C(storage) is the storage identifier where to create the disk.,C(size) is the size of the disk in GB.,C(format) is the drive's backing file's data format. C(qcow2|raw|subvol).
sockets: ${8:1} # not required. Sets the number of CPU sockets. (1 - N).
agent: ${9|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Specify if the QEMU GuestAgent should be enabled/disabled.
tablet: ${10|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Enables/disables the USB tablet device.

scsi: ${11:null} # not required. A hash/dictionary of volume used as SCSI hard disk or CD-ROM. C(scsi='{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - C(sata[n]) where 0 ≤ n ≤ 13.,Values allowed are -  C("storage:size,format=value").,C(storage) is the storage identifier where to create the disk.,C(size) is the size of the disk in GB.,C(format) is the drive's backing file's data format. C(qcow2|raw|subvol).

ostype: ${12|other,wxp,w2k,w2k3,w2k8,wvista,win7,win8,l24,l26,solaris|} # not required. choices: other;wxp;w2k;w2k3;w2k8;wvista;win7;win8;l24;l26;solaris. Specifies guest operating system. This is used to enable special optimization/features for specific operating systems.,The l26 is Linux 2.6/3.X Kernel.
snapname: ${13:null} # not required. The name of the snapshot. Used only with clone.
autostart: ${14|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Specify, if the VM should be automatically restarted after crash (currently ignored in PVE API).

state: ${15|present,started,absent,stopped,restarted,current|} # not required. choices: present;started;absent;stopped;restarted;current. Indicates desired state of the instance.,If C(current), the current state of the VM will be fecthed. You can access it with C(results.status)

full: ${16|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Create a full copy of all disk. This is always done when you clone a normal VM.,For VM templates, we try to create a linked clone by default.,Used only with clone

startup: ${17:null} # not required. Startup and shutdown behavior. C([[order=]\d+] [,up=\d+] [,down=\d+]).,Order is a non-negative number defining the general startup order.,Shutdown in done with reverse ordering.

shares: ${18:null} # not required. Rets amount of memory shares for auto-ballooning. (0 - 50000).,The larger the number is, the more memory this VM gets.,The number is relative to weights of all other running VMs.,Using 0 disables auto-ballooning, this means no limit.
target: ${19:null} # not required. Target node. Only allowed if the original VM is on shared storage.,Used only with clone
revert: ${20:null} # not required. Revert a pending change.
reboot: ${21|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Allow reboot. If set to yes, the VM exit on reboot.

parallel: ${22:null} # not required. A hash/dictionary of map host parallel devices. C(parallel='{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - (parallel[n]) where 0 ≤ n ≤ 2.,Values allowed are - C("/dev/parport\d+|/dev/usb/lp\d+").

serial: ${23:null} # not required. A hash/dictionary of serial device to create inside the VM. C('{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - serial[n](str; required) where 0 ≤ n ≤ 3.,Values allowed are - C((/dev/.+|socket)).,/!\ If you pass through a host serial device, it is no longer possible to migrate such machines - use with special care.
bootdisk: ${24:null} # not required. Enable booting from specified disk. C((ide|sata|scsi|virtio)\d+)
startdate: ${25:null} # not required. Sets the initial date of the real time clock.,Valid format for date are C('now') or C('2016-09-25T16:01:21') or C('2016-09-25').
force: ${26|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Allow to force stop VM.,Can be used only with states C(stopped), C(restarted).
format: ${27|cloop,cow,qcow,qcow2,qed,raw,vmdk|} # not required. choices: cloop;cow;qcow;qcow2;qed;raw;vmdk. Target drive's backing file's data format.,Used only with clone
cpu: ${28:kvm64} # not required. Specify emulated CPU type.
watchdog: ${29:null} # not required. Creates a virtual hardware watchdog device.
api_password: ${30:null} # not required. Specify the password to authenticate with.,You can use C(PROXMOX_PASSWORD) environment variable.
node: ${31:null} # not required. Proxmox VE node, where the new VM will be created.,Only required for C(state=present).,For other states, it will be autodiscovered.
smbios: ${32:null} # not required. Specifies SMBIOS type 1 fields.
vcpus: ${33:null} # not required. Sets number of hotplugged vcpus.

update: ${34|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(yes), the VM will be update with new value.,Cause of the operations of the API and security reasons, I have disabled the update of the following parameters,C(net, virtio, ide, sata, scsi). Per example updating C(net) update the MAC address and C(virtio) create always new disk...
cpuunits: ${35:1000} # not required. Specify CPU weight for a VM.,You can disable fair-scheduler configuration by setting this to 0
boot: ${36:cnd} # not required. Specify the boot order -> boot on floppy C(a), hard disk C(c), CD-ROM C(d), or network C(n).,You can combine to set order.

validate_certs: ${37|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
hugepages: ${38|any,2,1024|} # not required. choices: any;2;1024. Enable/disable hugepages memory.
skiplock: ${39:null} # not required. Ignore locks,Only root is allowed to use this option.
freeze: ${40|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Specify if PVE should freeze CPU at startup (use 'c' monitor command to start execution).

scsihw: ${41|lsi,lsi53c810,virtio-scsi-pci,virtio-scsi-single,megasas,pvscsi|} # not required. choices: lsi;lsi53c810;virtio-scsi-pci;virtio-scsi-single;megasas;pvscsi. Specifies the SCSI controller model.
name: ${42:null} # not required. Specifies the VM name. Only used on the configuration web interface.,Required only for C(state=present).
localtime: ${43|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Sets the real time clock to local time.,This is enabled by default if ostype indicates a Microsoft OS.

numa: ${44:null} # not required. A hash/dictionaries of NUMA topology. C(numa='{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - C(numa[n]) where 0 ≤ n ≤ N.,Values allowed are - C("cpu="<id[-id];...>",hostnodes="<id[-id];...>",memory="number",policy="(bind|interleave|preferred)"").,C(cpus) CPUs accessing this NUMA node.,C(hostnodes) Host NUMA nodes to use.,C(memory) Amount of memory this NUMA node provides.,C(policy) NUMA allocation policy.

hotplug: ${45:null} # not required. Selectively enable hotplug features.,This is a comma separated list of hotplug features C('network', 'disk', 'cpu', 'memory' and 'usb').,Value 0 disables hotplug completely and value 1 is an alias for the default C('network,disk,usb').
delete: ${46:null} # not required. Specify a list of settings you want to delete.
template: ${47|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Enables/disables the template.
clone: ${48:null} # not required. Name of VM to be cloned. If C(vmid) is setted, C(clone) can take arbitrary value but required for intiating the clone.

virtio: ${49:null} # not required. A hash/dictionary of volume used as VIRTIO hard disk. C(virtio='{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - C(virto[n]) where 0 ≤ n ≤ 15.,Values allowed are -  C("storage:size,format=value").,C(storage) is the storage identifier where to create the disk.,C(size) is the size of the disk in GB.,C(format) is the drive's backing file's data format. C(qcow2|raw|subvol).
bios: ${50|seabios,ovmf|} # not required. choices: seabios;ovmf. Specify the BIOS implementation.
args: ${51:-serial unix:/var/run/qemu-server/VMID.serial,server,nowait} # not required. Pass arbitrary arguments to kvm.,This option is for experts only!
tdf: ${52|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Enables/disables time drift fix.

hostpci: ${53:null} # not required. Specify a hash/dictionary of map host pci devices into guest. C(hostpci='{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - C(hostpci[n]) where 0 ≤ n ≤ N.,Values allowed are -  C("host="HOSTPCIID[;HOSTPCIID2...]",pcie="1|0",rombar="1|0",x-vga="1|0"").,The C(host) parameter is Host PCI device pass through. HOSTPCIID syntax is C(bus:dev.func) (hexadecimal numbers).,C(pcie=boolean) I(default=0) Choose the PCI-express bus (needs the q35 machine model).,C(rombar=boolean) I(default=1) Specify whether or not the device's ROM will be visible in the guest's memory map.,C(x-vga=boolean) I(default=0) Enable vfio-vga device support.,/!\ This option allows direct access to host hardware. So it is no longer possible to migrate such machines - use with special care.
migrate_speed: ${54:null} # not required. Sets maximum speed (in MB/s) for migrations.,A value of 0 is no limit.
kvm: ${55|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Enable/disable KVM hardware virtualization.
vmid: ${56:null} # not required. Specifies the VM ID. Instead use I(name) parameter.,If vmid is not set, the next available VM ID will be fetched from ProxmoxAPI.
timeout: ${57:30} # not required. Timeout for operations.

sata: ${58:null} # not required. A hash/dictionary of volume used as sata hard disk or CD-ROM. C(sata='{"key":"value", "key":"value"}').,Keys allowed are - C(sata[n]) where 0 ≤ n ≤ 5.,Values allowed are -  C("storage:size,format=value").,C(storage) is the storage identifier where to create the disk.,C(size) is the size of the disk in GB.,C(format) is the drive's backing file's data format. C(qcow2|raw|subvol).
memory: ${59:512} # not required. Memory size in MB for instance.
machine: ${60:null} # not required. Specifies the Qemu machine type.,type => C((pc|pc(-i440fx)?-\d+\.\d+(\.pxe)?|q35|pc-q35-\d+\.\d+(\.pxe)?))
acpi: ${61|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Specify if ACPI should be enables/disabled.
pool: ${62:null} # not required. Add the new VM to the specified pool.
balloon: ${63:0} # not required. Specify the amount of RAM for the VM in MB.,Using zero disables the balloon driver.
keyboard: ${64:null} # not required. Sets the keyboard layout for VNC server.
cpulimit: ${65:null} # not required. Specify if CPU usage will be limited. Value 0 indicates no CPU limit.,If the computer has 2 CPUs, it has total of '2' CPU time
description: ${66:null} # not required. Specify the description for the VM. Only used on the configuration web interface.,This is saved as comment inside the configuration file.
cores: ${67:1} # not required. Specify number of cores per socket.
protection: ${68|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Enable/disable the protection flag of the VM. This will enable/disable the remove VM and remove disk operations.
migrate_downtime: ${69:null} # not required. Sets maximum tolerated downtime (in seconds) for migrations.
digest: ${70:null} # not required. Specify if to prevent changes if current configuration file has different SHA1 digest.,This can be used to prevent concurrent modifications.
newid: ${71:null} # not required. VMID for the clone. Used only with clone.,If newid is not set, the next available VM ID will be fetched from ProxmoxAPI.
storage: ${72:null} # not required. Target storage for full clone.

proxmox_template.description: management of OS templates in Proxmox VE cluster
body: proxmox_template:
api_user: ${1:undefined} # required. the user to authenticate with
api_host: ${2:undefined} # required. the host of the Proxmox VE cluster
node: ${3:null} # required. Proxmox VE node, when you will operate with template
content_type: ${4|vztmpl,iso|} # not required. choices: vztmpl;iso. content type,required only for C(state=present)
validate_certs: ${5:false} # not required. enable / disable https certificate verification
template: ${6:null} # not required. the template name,required only for states C(absent), C(info)
api_password: ${7:null} # not required. the password to authenticate with,you can use PROXMOX_PASSWORD environment variable
src: ${8:null} # not required. path to uploaded file,required only for C(state=present)
force: ${9:false} # not required. can be used only with C(state=present), exists template will be overwritten
timeout: ${10:30} # not required. timeout for operations
state: ${11|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the template
storage: ${12:local} # not required. target storage

proxysql_backend_servers.description: Adds or removes mysql hosts from proxysql admin interface.
body: proxysql_backend_servers:
hostname: ${1:undefined} # required. The ip address at which the mysqld instance can be contacted.
load_to_runtime: ${2:true} # not required. Dynamically load config to runtime memory.
save_to_disk: ${3:true} # not required. Save config to sqlite db on disk to persist the configuration.

use_ssl: ${4:undefined} # not required. If I(use_ssl) is set to C(True), connections to this server will be made using SSL connections. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(use_ssl) is C(False).
config_file: ${5:} # not required. Specify a config file from which I(login_user) and I(login_password) are to be read.
max_connections: ${6:undefined} # not required. The maximum number of connections ProxySQL will open to this backend server. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(max_connections) is 1000.

weight: ${7:undefined} # not required. The bigger the weight of a server relative to other weights, the higher the probability of the server being chosen from the hostgroup. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(weight) is 1.

max_replication_lag: ${8:undefined} # not required. If greater than 0, ProxySQL will reguarly monitor replication lag. If replication lag goes above I(max_replication_lag), proxysql will temporarily shun the server until replication catches up. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(max_replication_lag) is 0.

max_latency_ms: ${9:undefined} # not required. Ping time is monitored regularly. If a host has a ping time greater than I(max_latency_ms) it is excluded from the connection pool (although the server stays ONLINE). If omitted the proxysql database default for I(max_latency_ms) is 0.
port: ${10:3306} # not required. The port at which the mysqld instance can be contacted.
hostgroup_id: ${11:0} # not required. The hostgroup in which this mysqld instance is included. An instance can be part of one or more hostgroups.
login_port: ${12:6032} # not required. The port used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.

comment: ${13:} # not required. Text field that can be used for any purposed defined by the user. Could be a description of what the host stores, a reminder of when the host was added or disabled, or a JSON processed by some checker script.
login_user: ${14:None} # not required. The username used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
login_password: ${15:None} # not required. The password used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
state: ${16|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. When C(present) - adds the host, when C(absent) - removes the host.
