compression: ${17:undefined} # not required. If the value of I(compression) is greater than 0, new connections to that server will use compression. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(compression) is 0.
login_host: ${18:127.0.0.1} # not required. The host used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.

status: ${19|ONLINE,OFFLINE_SOFT,OFFLINE_HARD|} # not required. choices: ONLINE;OFFLINE_SOFT;OFFLINE_HARD. ONLINE - Backend server is fully operational. OFFLINE_SOFT - When a server is put into C(OFFLINE_SOFT) mode, connections are kept in use until the current transaction is completed. This allows to gracefully detach a backend. OFFLINE_HARD - When a server is put into C(OFFLINE_HARD) mode, the existing connections are dropped, while new incoming connections aren't accepted either.
If omitted the proxysql database default for I(status) is C(ONLINE).

proxysql_global_variables.description: Gets or sets the proxysql global variables.
body: proxysql_global_variables:
variable: ${1:undefined} # required. Defines which variable should be returned, or if I(value) is specified which variable should be updated.
login_port: ${2:6032} # not required. The port used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.
login_user: ${3:None} # not required. The username used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
value: ${4:undefined} # not required. Defines a value the variable specified using I(variable) should be set to.
config_file: ${5:} # not required. Specify a config file from which I(login_user) and I(login_password) are to be read.
login_password: ${6:None} # not required. The password used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
load_to_runtime: ${7:true} # not required. Dynamically load config to runtime memory.
save_to_disk: ${8:true} # not required. Save config to sqlite db on disk to persist the configuration.
login_host: ${9:127.0.0.1} # not required. The host used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.

proxysql_manage_config.description: Writes the proxysql configuration settings between layers.
body: proxysql_manage_config:

action: ${1|LOAD,SAVE|} # required. choices: LOAD;SAVE. The supplied I(action) combines with the supplied I(direction) to provide the semantics of how we want to move the I(config_settings) between the I(config_layers).

direction: ${2|FROM,TO|} # required. choices: FROM;TO. FROM - denotes we're reading values FROM the supplied I(config_layer) and writing to the next layer. TO - denotes we're reading from the previous layer and writing TO the supplied I(config_layer)."

config_layer: ${3|MEMORY,DISK,RUNTIME,CONFIG|} # required. choices: MEMORY;DISK;RUNTIME;CONFIG. RUNTIME - represents the in-memory data structures of ProxySQL used by the threads that are handling the requests. MEMORY - (sometimes also referred as main) represents the in-memory SQLite3 database. DISK - represents the on-disk SQLite3 database. CONFIG - is the classical config file. You can only LOAD FROM the config file.

config_settings: ${4|MYSQL USERS,MYSQL SERVERS,MYSQL QUERY RULES,MYSQL VARIABLES,ADMIN VARIABLES,SCHEDULER|} # required. choices: MYSQL USERS;MYSQL SERVERS;MYSQL QUERY RULES;MYSQL VARIABLES;ADMIN VARIABLES;SCHEDULER. The I(config_settings) specifies which configuration we're writing.
login_port: ${5:6032} # not required. The port used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.
login_user: ${6:None} # not required. The username used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
login_password: ${7:None} # not required. The password used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
config_file: ${8:} # not required. Specify a config file from which I(login_user) and I(login_password) are to be read.
login_host: ${9:127.0.0.1} # not required. The host used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.

proxysql_mysql_users.description: Adds or removes mysql users from proxysql admin interface.
body: proxysql_mysql_users:
username: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the user connecting to the mysqld or ProxySQL instance.
login_port: ${2:6032} # not required. The port used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.
login_password: ${3:None} # not required. The password used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.

transaction_persistent: ${4:undefined} # not required. If this is set for the user with which the MySQL client is connecting to ProxySQL (thus a "frontend" user), transactions started within a hostgroup will remain within that hostgroup regardless of any other rules. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(transaction_persistent) is C(False).
password: ${5:undefined} # not required. Password of the user connecting to the mysqld or ProxySQL instance.
config_file: ${6:} # not required. Specify a config file from which I(login_user) and I(login_password) are to be read.
backend: ${7:true} # not required. If I(backend) is set to C(True), this (username, password) pair is used for authenticating to the ProxySQL instance.
load_to_runtime: ${8:true} # not required. Dynamically load config to runtime memory.
default_schema: ${9:undefined} # not required. The schema to which the connection should change to by default.
login_user: ${10:None} # not required. The username used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.

default_hostgroup: ${11:undefined} # not required. If there is no matching rule for the queries sent by this user, the traffic it generates is sent to the specified hostgroup. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(use_ssl) is 0.

active: ${12:undefined} # not required. A user with I(active) set to C(False) will be tracked in the database, but will be never loaded in the in-memory data structures. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(active) is C(True).
login_host: ${13:127.0.0.1} # not required. The host used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.

max_connections: ${14:undefined} # not required. The maximum number of connections ProxySQL will open to the backend for this user. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(max_connections) is 10000.
frontend: ${15:true} # not required. If I(frontend) is set to C(True), this (username, password) pair is used for authenticating to the mysqld servers against any hostgroup.

fast_forward: ${16:undefined} # not required. If I(fast_forward) is set to C(True), I(fast_forward) will bypass the query processing layer (rewriting, caching) and pass through the query directly as is to the backend server. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(fast_forward) is C(False).
state: ${17|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. When C(present) - adds the user, when C(absent) - removes the user.
save_to_disk: ${18:true} # not required. Save config to sqlite db on disk to persist the configuration.

use_ssl: ${19:undefined} # not required. If I(use_ssl) is set to C(True), connections by this user will be made using SSL connections. If omitted the proxysql database default for I(use_ssl) is C(False).

proxysql_query_rules.description: Modifies query rules using the proxysql admin interface.
body: proxysql_query_rules:
login_port: ${1:6032} # not required. The port used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.
mirror_flagOUT: ${2:undefined} # not required. Enables query mirroring. If set I(mirror_flagOUT) can be used to evaluates the mirrored query against the specified chain of rules.
proxy_addr: ${3:undefined} # not required. Match incoming traffic on a specific local IP.
cache_ttl: ${4:undefined} # not required. The number of milliseconds for which to cache the result of the query. Note in ProxySQL 1.1 I(cache_ttl) was in seconds.
schemaname: ${5:undefined} # not required. Filtering criteria matching schemaname. If I(schemaname) is non-NULL, a query will match only if the connection uses schemaname as its default schema.
load_to_runtime: ${6:true} # not required. Dynamically load config to runtime memory.
error_msg: ${7:undefined} # not required. Query will be blocked, and the specified error_msg will be returned to the client.
proxy_port: ${8:undefined} # not required. Match incoming traffic on a specific local port.

negate_match_pattern: ${9:undefined} # not required. If I(negate_match_pattern) is set to C(True), only queries not matching the query text will be considered as a match. This acts as a NOT operator in front of the regular expression matching against match_pattern.

destination_hostgroup: ${10:undefined} # not required. Route matched queries to this hostgroup. This happens unless there is a started transaction and the logged in user has I(transaction_persistent) set to C(True) (see M(proxysql_mysql_users)).
client_addr: ${11:undefined} # not required. Match traffic from a specific source.
flagIN: ${12:undefined} # not required. Used in combination with I(flagOUT) and I(apply) to create chains of rules.
match_digest: ${13:undefined} # not required. Regular expression that matches the query digest. The dialect of regular expressions used is that of re2 - https://github.com/google/re2
apply: ${14:undefined} # not required. Used in combination with I(flagIN) and I(flagOUT) to create chains of rules. Setting apply to True signifies the last rule to be applied.
login_host: ${15:127.0.0.1} # not required. The host used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.

retries: ${16:undefined} # not required. The maximum number of times a query needs to be re-executed in case of detected failure during the execution of the query. If retries is not specified, the global variable mysql-query_retries_on_failure applies.
config_file: ${17:} # not required. Specify a config file from which I(login_user) and I(login_password) are to be read.

delay: ${18:undefined} # not required. Number of milliseconds to delay the execution of the query. This is essentially a throttling mechanism and QoS, and allows a way to give priority to queries over others. This value is added to the mysql-default_query_delay global variable that applies to all queries.
rule_id: ${19:undefined} # not required. The unique id of the rule. Rules are processed in rule_id order.
flagOUT: ${20:undefined} # not required. Used in combination with I(flagIN) and apply to create chains of rules. When set, I(flagOUT) signifies the I(flagIN) to be used in the next chain of rules.
log: ${21:undefined} # not required. Query will be logged.

force_delete: ${22:false} # not required. By default we avoid deleting more than one schedule in a single batch, however if you need this behaviour and you're not concerned about the schedules deleted, you can set I(force_delete) to C(True).
active: ${23:undefined} # not required. A rule with I(active) set to C(False) will be tracked in the database, but will be never loaded in the in-memory data structures.
comment: ${24:undefined} # not required. Free form text field, usable for a descriptive comment of the query rule.
login_user: ${25:None} # not required. The username used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
login_password: ${26:None} # not required. The password used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
match_pattern: ${27:undefined} # not required. Regular expression that matches the query text. The dialect of regular expressions used is that of re2 - https://github.com/google/re2
digest: ${28:undefined} # not required. Match queries with a specific digest, as returned by stats_mysql_query_digest.digest.

timeout: ${29:undefined} # not required. The maximum timeout in milliseconds with which the matched or rewritten query should be executed. If a query run for longer than the specific threshold, the query is automatically killed. If timeout is not specified, the global variable mysql-default_query_timeout applies.
state: ${30|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. When C(present) - adds the rule, when C(absent) - removes the rule.
username: ${31:undefined} # not required. Filtering criteria matching username.  If I(username) is non-NULL, a query will match only if the connection is made with the correct username.

replace_pattern: ${32:undefined} # not required. This is the pattern with which to replace the matched pattern. Note that this is optional, and when omitted, the query processor will only cache, route, or set other parameters without rewriting.
save_to_disk: ${33:true} # not required. Save config to sqlite db on disk to persist the configuration.
mirror_hostgroup: ${34:undefined} # not required. Enables query mirroring. If set I(mirror_hostgroup) can be used to mirror queries to the same or different hostgroup.

proxysql_replication_hostgroups.description: Manages replication hostgroups using the proxysql admin interface.
body: proxysql_replication_hostgroups:
reader_hostgroup: ${1:undefined} # required. Id of the reader hostgroup.
writer_hostgroup: ${2:undefined} # required. Id of the writer hostgroup.
login_port: ${3:6032} # not required. The port used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.
config_file: ${4:} # not required. Specify a config file from which I(login_user) and I(login_password) are to be read.
comment: ${5:undefined} # not required. Text field that can be used for any purposed defined by the user.
login_user: ${6:None} # not required. The username used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
login_password: ${7:None} # not required. The password used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. When C(present) - adds the replication hostgroup, when C(absent) - removes the replication hostgroup.
load_to_runtime: ${9:true} # not required. Dynamically load config to runtime memory.
save_to_disk: ${10:true} # not required. Save config to sqlite db on disk to persist the configuration.
login_host: ${11:127.0.0.1} # not required. The host used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.

proxysql_scheduler.description: Adds or removes schedules from proxysql admin interface.
body: proxysql_scheduler:
filename: ${1:undefined} # required. Full path of the executable to be executed.
login_port: ${2:6032} # not required. The port used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.
login_password: ${3:None} # not required. The password used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
config_file: ${4:} # not required. Specify a config file from which I(login_user) and I(login_password) are to be read.
load_to_runtime: ${5:true} # not required. Dynamically load config to runtime memory.
arg1: ${6:undefined} # not required. Argument that can be passed to the job.
arg5: ${7:undefined} # not required. Argument that can be passed to the job.

force_delete: ${8:false} # not required. By default we avoid deleting more than one schedule in a single batch, however if you need this behaviour and you're not concerned about the schedules deleted, you can set I(force_delete) to C(True).
active: ${9:true} # not required. A schedule with I(active) set to C(False) will be tracked in the database, but will be never loaded in the in-memory data structures.
arg2: ${10:undefined} # not required. Argument that can be passed to the job.
arg3: ${11:undefined} # not required. Argument that can be passed to the job.
login_user: ${12:None} # not required. The username used to authenticate to ProxySQL admin interface.
arg4: ${13:undefined} # not required. Argument that can be passed to the job.
state: ${14|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. When C(present) - adds the schedule, when C(absent) - removes the schedule.
interval_ms: ${15:10000} # not required. How often (in millisecond) the job will be started. The minimum value for I(interval_ms) is 100 milliseconds.
login_host: ${16:127.0.0.1} # not required. The host used to connect to ProxySQL admin interface.
save_to_disk: ${17:true} # not required. Save config to sqlite db on disk to persist the configuration.
comment: ${18:undefined} # not required. Text field that can be used for any purposed defined by the user.
pubnub_blocks:
keyset: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of application's keys set which is bound to managed blocks.
application: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of target PubNub application for which blocks configuration on specific C(keyset) will be done.
name: ${3:undefined} # required. Name of managed block which will be later visible on admin.pubnub.com.

validate_certs: ${4:true} # not required. This key allow to try skip certificates check when performing REST API calls. Sometimes host may have issues with certificates on it and this will cause problems to call PubNub REST API.,If check should be ignored C(False) should be passed to this parameter.
changes: ${5:[object Object]} # not required. List of fields which should be changed by block itself (doesn't affect any event handlers).,Possible options for change is: C(name).
description: ${6:New block} # not required. Short block description which will be later visible on admin.pubnub.com. Used only if block doesn't exists and won't change description for existing block.
password: ${7:undefined} # not required. Password which match to account to which specified C(email) belong.,Not required if C(cache) contains result of previous module call (in same play).

event_handlers: ${8:} # not required. List of event handlers which should be updated for specified block C(name).,Each entry for new event handler should contain: C(name), C(src), C(channels), C(event). C(name) used as event handler name which can be used later to make changes to it.,C(src) is full path to file with event handler code.,C(channels) is name of channel from which event handler is waiting for events.,C(event) is type of event which is able to trigger event handler: I(js-before-publish), I(js-after-publish), I(js-after-presence).,Each entry for existing handlers should contain C(name) (so target handler can be identified). Rest parameters (C(src), C(channels) and C(event)) can be added if changes required for them.,It is possible to rename event handler by adding C(changes) key to event handler payload and pass dictionary, which will contain single key C(name), where new name should be passed.,To remove particular event handler it is possible to set C(state) for it to C(absent) and it will be removed.
account: ${9:undefined} # not required. Name of PubNub account for from which C(application) will be used to manage blocks.,User's account will be used if value not set or empty.
email: ${10:undefined} # not required. Email from account for which new session should be started.,Not required if C(cache) contains result of previous module call (in same play).

cache: ${11:[object Object]} # not required. In case if single play use blocks management module few times it is preferred to enabled 'caching' by making previous module to share gathered artifacts and pass them to this parameter.
state: ${12|started,stopped,present,absent|} # not required. choices: started;stopped;present;absent. Intended block state after event handlers creation / update process will be completed.

pulp_repo.description: Add or remove Pulp repos from a remote host.
body: pulp_repo:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the repo to add or remove. This correlates to repo-id in Pulp.
relative_url: ${2:null} # required. Relative URL for the local repository.

url_password: ${3:undefined} # not required. The password for use in HTTP basic authentication to the pulp API. If the I(url_username) parameter is not specified, the I(url_password) parameter will not be used.

force_basic_auth: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. httplib2, the library used by the M(uri) module only sends authentication information when a webservice responds to an initial request with a 401 status. Since some basic auth services do not properly send a 401, logins will fail. This option forces the sending of the Basic authentication header upon initial request.
importer_ssl_ca_cert: ${5:null} # not required. CA certificate string used to validate the feed source SSL certificate. This can be the file content or the path to the file.

importer_ssl_client_key: ${6:null} # not required. Private key to the certificate specified in I(importer_ssl_client_cert), assuming it is not included in the certificate file itself. This can be the file content or the path to the file.

client_key: ${7:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted file that contains your private key to be used for SSL client authentication. If C(client_cert) contains both the certificate and key, this option is not required.
url_username: ${8:undefined} # not required. The username for use in HTTP basic authentication to the pulp API.
proxy_port: ${9:null} # not required. Proxy port setting for the pulp repository importer.
feed: ${10:null} # not required. Upstream feed URL to receive updates from.
pulp_host: ${11:http://127.0.0.1} # not required. URL of the pulp server to connect to.
publish_distributor: ${12:undefined} # not required. Distributor to use when state is C(publish). The default is to publish all distributors.
use_proxy: ${13:true} # not required. If C(no), it will not use a proxy, even if one is defined in an environment variable on the target hosts.
serve_http: ${14:false} # not required. Make the repo available over HTTP.

client_cert: ${15:undefined} # not required. PEM formatted certificate chain file to be used for SSL client authentication. This file can also include the key as well, and if the key is included, C(client_key) is not required.
http_agent: ${16:ansible-httpget} # not required. Header to identify as, generally appears in web server logs.
serve_https: ${17:true} # not required. Make the repo available over HTTPS.
proxy_host: ${18:null} # not required. Proxy url setting for the pulp repository importer. This is in the format scheme://host.
force: ${19:false} # not required. If C(yes) do not get a cached copy.
repo_type: ${20:rpm} # not required. Repo plugin type to use (i.e. C(rpm), C(docker)).
wait_for_completion: ${21|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Wait for asynchronous tasks to complete before returning.

importer_ssl_client_cert: ${22:null} # not required. Certificate used as the client certificate when synchronizing the repository. This is used to communicate authentication information to the feed source. The value to this option must be the full path to the certificate. The specified file may be the certificate itself or a single file containing both the certificate and private key. This can be the file content or the path to the file.

validate_certs: ${23|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
add_export_distributor: ${24:false} # not required. Whether or not to add the export distributor to new C(rpm) repositories.
url: ${25:undefined} # not required. HTTP, HTTPS, or FTP URL in the form (http|https|ftp)://[user[:pass]]@host.domain[:port]/path

state: ${26|present,absent,sync,publish|} # not required. choices: present;absent;sync;publish. The repo state. A state of C(sync) will queue a sync of the repo. This is asynchronous but not delayed like a scheduled sync. A state of C(publish) will use the repository's distributor to publish the content.
puppet:
logdest: ${1|stdout,syslog|} # not required. choices: stdout;syslog. Where the puppet logs should go, if puppet apply is being used.
facter_basename: ${2:ansible} # not required. Basename of the facter output file.
manifest: ${3:undefined} # not required. Path to the manifest file to run puppet apply on.
modulepath: ${4:undefined} # not required. Path to an alternate location for puppet modules.
facts: ${5:undefined} # not required. A dict of values to pass in as persistent external facter facts.
certname: ${6:undefined} # not required. The name to use when handling certificates.
tags: ${7:undefined} # not required. A comma-separated list of puppet tags to be used.
environment: ${8:undefined} # not required. Puppet environment to be used.
execute: ${9:undefined} # not required. Execute a specific piece of Puppet code.,It has no effect with a puppetmaster.
puppetmaster: ${10:None} # not required. The hostname of the puppetmaster to contact.
timeout: ${11:30m} # not required. How long to wait for I(puppet) to finish.

purefa_hg.description: Manage hostgroups on Pure Storage FlashArrays
body: purefa_hg:
api_token: ${1:undefined} # required. FlashArray API token for admin privilaged user.
fa_url: ${2:undefined} # required. FlashArray management IPv4 address or Hostname.
hostgroup: ${3:undefined} # required. The name of the hostgroup.
host: ${4:undefined} # not required. List of existing hosts to add to hostgroup.
volume: ${5:undefined} # not required. List of existing volumes to add to hostgroup.
state: ${6|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Define whether the hostgroup should exist or not.

purefa_host.description: Manage hosts on Pure Storage FlashArrays
body: purefa_host:
api_token: ${1:undefined} # required. FlashArray API token for admin privilaged user.
fa_url: ${2:undefined} # required. FlashArray management IPv4 address or Hostname.
host: ${3:undefined} # required. The name of the host.
state: ${4|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Define whether the host should exist or not.,When removing host all connected volumes will be disconnected.
iqn: ${5:undefined} # not required. List of IQNs of the host if protocol is iscsi.
volume: ${6:undefined} # not required. Volume name to map to the host.
protocol: ${7|fc,iscsi|} # not required. choices: fc;iscsi. Defines the host connection protocol for volumes.
wwns: ${8:undefined} # not required. List of wwns of the host if protocol is fc.

purefa_pg.description: Manage protection groups on Pure Storage FlashArrays
body: purefa_pg:
fa_url: ${1:undefined} # required. FlashArray management IPv4 address or Hostname.
pgroup: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the protection group.
api_token: ${3:undefined} # required. FlashArray API token for admin privilaged user.
enabled: ${4:yes} # not required. Define whether to enabled snapshots for the protection group.
state: ${5|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Define whether the protection group should exist or not.
volume: ${6:undefined} # not required. List of existing volumes to add to protection group.
hostgroup: ${7:undefined} # not required. List of existing hostgroups to add to protection group.
host: ${8:undefined} # not required. List of existing hosts to add to protection group.
eradicate: ${9:no} # not required. Define whether to eradicate the protection group on delete and leave in trash.

purefa_snap.description: Manage volume snapshots on Pure Storage FlashArrays
body: purefa_snap:
fa_url: ${1:undefined} # required. FlashArray management IPv4 address or Hostname.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the source volume.
api_token: ${3:undefined} # required. FlashArray API token for admin privilaged user.
target: ${4:undefined} # not required. Name of target volume if creating from snapshot.
overwrite: ${5:no} # not required. Define whether to overwrite existing volume when creating from snapshot.
state: ${6|absent,copy,present|} # not required. choices: absent;copy;present. Define whether the volume snapshot should exist or not.
suffix: ${7:undefined} # not required. Suffix of snapshot name.
eradicate: ${8:no} # not required. Define whether to eradicate the snapshot on delete or leave in trash.

purefa_volume.description: Manage volumes on Pure Storage FlashArrays
body: purefa_volume:
api_token: ${1:undefined} # required. FlashArray API token for admin privilaged user.
fa_url: ${2:undefined} # required. FlashArray management IPv4 address or Hostname.
name: ${3:undefined} # required. The name of the volume.
target: ${4:undefined} # not required. The name of the target volume, if copying.
overwrite: ${5:no} # not required. Define whether to overwrite a target volume if it already exisits.
size: ${6:undefined} # not required. Volume size in M, G, T or P units.
eradicate: ${7:no} # not required. Define whether to eradicate the volume on delete or leave in trash.
state: ${8|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Define whether the volume should exist or not.
pushbullet:
api_key: ${1:undefined} # required. Push bullet API token
title: ${2:undefined} # required. Title of the notification.
device: ${3:null} # not required. The device NAME you wish to send a push notification, as seen on the Pushbullet main page.
channel: ${4:null} # not required. The channel TAG you wish to broadcast a push notification, as seen on the "My Channels" > "Edit your channel" at Pushbullet page.
body: ${5:undefined} # not required. Body of the notification, e.g. Details of the fault you're alerting.
push_type: ${6|note,link|} # not required. choices: note;link. Thing you wish to push.
pushover:
msg: ${1:undefined} # required. What message you wish to send.
user_key: ${2:undefined} # required. Pushover issued authentication key for your user.
app_token: ${3:undefined} # required. Pushover issued token identifying your pushover app.
pri: ${4:undefined} # not required. Message priority (see U(https://pushover.net) for details.)
rabbitmq_binding:
destination_type: ${1|queue,exchange|} # required. choices: queue;exchange. Either queue or exchange
destination: ${2:undefined} # required. destination exchange or queue for the binding
name: ${3:undefined} # required. source exchange to create binding on
login_port: ${4:15672} # not required. rabbitMQ management api port
login_password: ${5:false} # not required. rabbitMQ password for connection
routing_key: ${6:#} # not required. routing key for the binding,default is
vhost: ${7:/} # not required. rabbitMQ virtual host,default vhost is /
login_host: ${8:localhost} # not required. rabbitMQ host for connection
login_user: ${9:guest} # not required. rabbitMQ user for connection
arguments: ${10:[object Object]} # not required. extra arguments for exchange. If defined this argument is a key/value dictionary
state: ${11|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the exchange should be present or absent,Only present implemented atm
rabbitmq_exchange:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the exchange to create
login_port: ${2:15672} # not required. rabbitMQ management api port
vhost: ${3:/} # not required. rabbitMQ virtual host
exchange_type: ${4|fanout,direct,headers,topic|} # not required. choices: fanout;direct;headers;topic. type for the exchange
durable: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. whether exchange is durable or not
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the exchange should be present or absent,Only present implemented atm
auto_delete: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. if the exchange should delete itself after all queues/exchanges unbound from it
login_host: ${8:localhost} # not required. rabbitMQ host for connection
login_user: ${9:guest} # not required. rabbitMQ user for connection
arguments: ${10:[object Object]} # not required. extra arguments for exchange. If defined this argument is a key/value dictionary
login_password: ${11:false} # not required. rabbitMQ password for connection
internal: ${12|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. exchange is available only for other exchanges

rabbitmq_parameter.description: Adds or removes parameters to RabbitMQ
body: rabbitmq_parameter:
component: ${1:null} # required. Name of the component of which the parameter is being set
name: ${2:null} # required. Name of the parameter being set
node: ${3:rabbit} # not required. erlang node name of the rabbit we wish to configure
vhost: ${4:/} # not required. vhost to apply access privileges.
value: ${5:null} # not required. Value of the parameter, as a JSON term
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify if user is to be added or removed
rabbitmq_plugin:
names: ${1:undefined} # required. Comma-separated list of plugin names.
state: ${2|enabled,disabled|} # not required. choices: enabled;disabled. Specify if plugins are to be enabled or disabled.
prefix: ${3:undefined} # not required. Specify a custom install prefix to a Rabbit.
new_only: ${4:no} # not required. Only enable missing plugins.,Does not disable plugins that are not in the names list.

rabbitmq_policy.description: Manage the state of policies in RabbitMQ.
body: rabbitmq_policy:
tags: ${1:null} # required. A dict or string describing the policy.
pattern: ${2:null} # required. A regex of queues to apply the policy to.
name: ${3:null} # required. The name of the policy to manage.
vhost: ${4:/} # not required. The name of the vhost to apply to.
apply_to: ${5|all,exchanges,queues|} # not required. choices: all;exchanges;queues. What the policy applies to. Requires RabbitMQ 3.2.0 or later.
priority: ${6:0} # not required. The priority of the policy.
node: ${7:rabbit} # not required. Erlang node name of the rabbit we wish to configure.
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The state of the policy.
rabbitmq_queue:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the queue to create
login_port: ${2:15672} # not required. rabbitMQ management api port
login_user: ${3:guest} # not required. rabbitMQ user for connection
auto_expires: ${4:forever} # not required. How long a queue can be unused before it is automatically deleted (milliseconds)
vhost: ${5:/} # not required. rabbitMQ virtual host
max_priority: ${6:None} # not required. Maximum number of priority levels for the queue to support.,If not set, the queue will not support message priorities.,Larger numbers indicate higher priority.
arguments: ${7:[object Object]} # not required. extra arguments for queue. If defined this argument is a key/value dictionary
dead_letter_exchange: ${8:None} # not required. Optional name of an exchange to which messages will be republished if they,are rejected or expire
state: ${9|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the queue should be present or absent,Only present implemented atm
durable: ${10|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. whether queue is durable or not
max_length: ${11:no limit} # not required. How many messages can the queue contain before it starts rejecting
auto_delete: ${12|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. if the queue should delete itself after all queues/queues unbound from it
login_host: ${13:localhost} # not required. rabbitMQ host for connection
dead_letter_routing_key: ${14:None} # not required. Optional replacement routing key to use when a message is dead-lettered.,Original routing key will be used if unset
login_password: ${15:false} # not required. rabbitMQ password for connection
message_ttl: ${16:forever} # not required. How long a message can live in queue before it is discarded (milliseconds)

rabbitmq_user.description: Adds or removes users to RabbitMQ
body: rabbitmq_user:
user: ${1:null} # required. Name of user to add
vhost: ${2:/} # not required. vhost to apply access privileges.,This option will be ignored when permissions option is used.
force: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Deletes and recreates the user.
tags: ${4:null} # not required. User tags specified as comma delimited

read_priv: ${5:^$} # not required. Regular expression to restrict configure actions on a resource for the specified vhost.,By default all actions are restricted.,This option will be ignored when permissions option is used.
password: ${6:null} # not required. Password of user to add.,To change the password of an existing user, you must also specify C(force=yes).

configure_priv: ${7:^$} # not required. Regular expression to restrict configure actions on a resource for the specified vhost.,By default all actions are restricted.,This option will be ignored when permissions option is used.
node: ${8:rabbit} # not required. erlang node name of the rabbit we wish to configure

write_priv: ${9:^$} # not required. Regular expression to restrict configure actions on a resource for the specified vhost.,By default all actions are restricted.,This option will be ignored when permissions option is used.
state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify if user is to be added or removed

permissions: ${11:} # not required. a list of dicts, each dict contains vhost, configure_priv, write_priv, and read_priv, and represents a permission rule for that vhost.,This option should be preferable when you care about all permissions of the user.,You should use vhost, configure_priv, write_priv, and read_priv options instead if you care about permissions for just some vhosts.

rabbitmq_vhost.description: Manage the state of a virtual host in RabbitMQ
body: rabbitmq_vhost:
name: ${1:null} # required. The name of the vhost to manage
node: ${2:rabbit} # not required. erlang node name of the rabbit we wish to configure
tracing: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Enable/disable tracing for a vhost
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The state of vhost

raw.description: Executes a low-down and dirty SSH command
body: raw:
free_form: ${1:undefined} # required. the raw module takes a free form command to run. There is no parameter actually named 'free form'; see the examples!

executable: ${2:undefined} # not required. change the shell used to execute the command. Should be an absolute path to the executable.,when using privilege escalation (C(become)), a default shell will be assigned if one is not provided as privilege escalation requires a shell.

rax.description: create / delete an instance in Rackspace Public Cloud
body: rax:
meta: ${1:null} # not required. A hash of metadata to associate with the instance
region: ${2:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.
count: ${3:1} # not required. number of instances to launch

auto_increment: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether or not to increment a single number with the name of the created servers. Only applicable when used with the I(group) attribute or meta key.
tenant_id: ${5:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.
instance_ids: ${6:undefined} # not required. list of instance ids, currently only used when state='absent' to remove instances
extra_create_args: ${7:undefined} # not required. A hash of key/value pairs to be used when creating a new server. This is considered an advanced option, use it wisely and with caution.
auth_endpoint: ${8:https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/} # not required. The URI of the authentication service.
flavor: ${9:null} # not required. flavor to use for the instance
wait_timeout: ${10:300} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
key_name: ${11:null} # not required. key pair to use on the instance
boot_volume_size: ${12:100} # not required. Size of the volume to create in Gigabytes. This is only required with I(image) and I(boot_from_volume).

networks: ${13:public,private} # not required. The network to attach to the instances. If specified, you must include ALL networks including the public and private interfaces. Can be C(id) or C(label).
wait: ${14|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the instance to be in state 'running' before returning
extra_client_args: ${15:undefined} # not required. A hash of key/value pairs to be used when creating the cloudservers client. This is considered an advanced option, use it wisely and with caution.
api_key: ${16:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
credentials: ${17:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
files: ${18:null} # not required. Files to insert into the instance. remotefilename:localcontent
group: ${19:undefined} # not required. host group to assign to server, is also used for idempotent operations to ensure a specific number of instances
env: ${20:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).

boot_from_volume: ${21|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether or not to boot the instance from a Cloud Block Storage volume. If C(yes) and I(image) is specified a new volume will be created at boot time. I(boot_volume_size) is required with I(image) to create a new volume at boot time.
verify_ssl: ${22:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
boot_volume: ${23:undefined} # not required. Cloud Block Storage ID or Name to use as the boot volume of the instance
user_data: ${24:undefined} # not required. Data to be uploaded to the servers config drive. This option implies I(config_drive). Can be a file path or a string
image: ${25:null} # not required. image to use for the instance. Can be an C(id), C(human_id) or C(name). With I(boot_from_volume), a Cloud Block Storage volume will be created with this image
tenant_name: ${26:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.
boot_volume_terminate: ${27:false} # not required. Whether the I(boot_volume) or newly created volume from I(image) will be terminated when the server is terminated
count_offset: ${28:1} # not required. number count to start at
name: ${29:null} # not required. Name to give the instance
config_drive: ${30|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Attach read-only configuration drive to server as label config-2
state: ${31|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource
username: ${32:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
identity_type: ${33:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.

exact_count: ${34|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Explicitly ensure an exact count of instances, used with state=active/present. If specified as C(yes) and I(count) is less than the servers matched, servers will be deleted to match the count. If the number of matched servers is fewer than specified in I(count) additional servers will be added.
disk_config: ${35|auto,manual|} # not required. choices: auto;manual. Disk partitioning strategy

rax_cbs.description: Manipulate Rackspace Cloud Block Storage Volumes
body: rax_cbs:
size: ${1:100} # required. Size of the volume to create in Gigabytes
volume_type: ${2|SATA,SSD|} # required. choices: SATA;SSD. Type of the volume being created
state: ${3|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource
name: ${4:null} # required. Name to give the volume being created
meta: ${5:null} # not required. A hash of metadata to associate with the volume
env: ${6:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
credentials: ${7:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
description: ${8:null} # not required. Description to give the volume being created
verify_ssl: ${9:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
tenant_id: ${10:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.
auth_endpoint: ${11:https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/} # not required. The URI of the authentication service.
snapshot_id: ${12:null} # not required. The id of the snapshot to create the volume from
image: ${13:null} # not required. image to use for bootable volumes. Can be an C(id), C(human_id) or C(name). This option requires C(pyrax>=1.9.3)
identity_type: ${14:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.
wait_timeout: ${15:300} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
region: ${16:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.
wait: ${17|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the volume to be in state 'available' before returning
api_key: ${18:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
username: ${19:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
tenant_name: ${20:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.

rax_cbs_attachments.description: Manipulate Rackspace Cloud Block Storage Volume Attachments
body: rax_cbs_attachments:
server: ${1:null} # required. Name or id of the server to attach/detach
volume: ${2:null} # required. Name or id of the volume to attach/detach
state: ${3|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource
env: ${4:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
credentials: ${5:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
api_key: ${6:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
verify_ssl: ${7:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
tenant_id: ${8:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.
auth_endpoint: ${9:https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/} # not required. The URI of the authentication service.
region: ${10:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.
identity_type: ${11:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.
wait_timeout: ${12:300} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
device: ${13:null} # not required. The device path to attach the volume to, e.g. /dev/xvde.,Before 2.4 this was a required field. Now it can be left to null to auto assign the device name.
wait: ${14|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the volume to be in 'in-use'/'available' state before returning
username: ${15:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
tenant_name: ${16:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.

rax_cdb.description: create/delete or resize a Rackspace Cloud Databases instance
body: rax_cdb:
env: ${1:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
cdb_type: ${2:MySQL} # not required. type of instance (i.e. MySQL, MariaDB, Percona)
api_key: ${3:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
verify_ssl: ${4:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
credentials: ${5:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
volume: ${6:2} # not required. Volume size of the database 1-150GB
tenant_id: ${7:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.
auth_endpoint: ${8:https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/} # not required. The URI of the authentication service.
flavor: ${9:1} # not required. flavor to use for the instance 1 to 6 (i.e. 512MB to 16GB)
cdb_version: ${10|5.1,5.6,10|} # not required. choices: 5.1;5.6;10. version of database (MySQL supports 5.1 and 5.6, MariaDB supports 10, Percona supports 5.6)
identity_type: ${11:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.
wait_timeout: ${12:300} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
region: ${13:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.
wait: ${14|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the instance to be in state 'running' before returning
state: ${15|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource
username: ${16:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
tenant_name: ${17:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.
name: ${18:null} # not required. Name of the databases server instance

rax_cdb_database.description: create / delete a database in the Cloud Databases
body: rax_cdb_database:
env: ${1:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource
collate: ${3:utf8_general_ci} # not required. Set of rules for comparing characters in a character set
verify_ssl: ${4:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
tenant_id: ${5:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.
auth_endpoint: ${6:https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/} # not required. The URI of the authentication service.
cdb_id: ${7:null} # not required. The databases server UUID
region: ${8:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.
identity_type: ${9:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.
character_set: ${10:utf8} # not required. Set of symbols and encodings
api_key: ${11:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
credentials: ${12:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
username: ${13:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
tenant_name: ${14:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.
name: ${15:null} # not required. Name to give to the database

rax_cdb_user.description: create / delete a Rackspace Cloud Database
body: rax_cdb_user:
db_password: ${1:null} # not required. Database user password
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource
credentials: ${3:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
api_key: ${4:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
verify_ssl: ${5:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
tenant_id: ${6:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.
auth_endpoint: ${7:https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/} # not required. The URI of the authentication service.
cdb_id: ${8:null} # not required. The databases server UUID
region: ${9:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.
databases: ${10:} # not required. Name of the databases that the user can access
env: ${11:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
db_username: ${12:null} # not required. Name of the database user
identity_type: ${13:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.

host: ${14:%} # not required. Specifies the host from which a user is allowed to connect to the database. Possible values are a string containing an IPv4 address or "%" to allow connecting from any host
username: ${15:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
tenant_name: ${16:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.

rax_clb.description: create / delete a load balancer in Rackspace Public Cloud
body: rax_clb:
meta: ${1:null} # not required. A hash of metadata to associate with the instance
env: ${2:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).

protocol: ${3|DNS_TCP,DNS_UDP,FTP,HTTP,HTTPS,IMAPS,IMAPv4,LDAP,LDAPS,MYSQL,POP3,POP3S,SMTP,TCP,TCP_CLIENT_FIRST,UDP,UDP_STREAM,SFTP|} # not required. choices: DNS_TCP;DNS_UDP;FTP;HTTP;HTTPS;IMAPS;IMAPv4;LDAP;LDAPS;MYSQL;POP3;POP3S;SMTP;TCP;TCP_CLIENT_FIRST;UDP;UDP_STREAM;SFTP. Protocol for the balancer being created
api_key: ${4:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
auth_endpoint: ${5:https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/} # not required. The URI of the authentication service.
verify_ssl: ${6:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
credentials: ${7:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
username: ${8:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
tenant_id: ${9:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.
port: ${10:80} # not required. Port for the balancer being created
identity_type: ${11:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.
region: ${12:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.
tenant_name: ${13:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.
wait_timeout: ${14:300} # not required. how long before wait gives up, in seconds
type: ${15|PUBLIC,SERVICENET|} # not required. choices: PUBLIC;SERVICENET. type of interface for the balancer being created
wait: ${16|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. wait for the balancer to be in state 'running' before returning
timeout: ${17:30} # not required. timeout for communication between the balancer and the node
state: ${18|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource
vip_id: ${19:undefined} # not required. Virtual IP ID to use when creating the load balancer for purposes of sharing an IP with another load balancer of another protocol

algorithm: ${20|RANDOM,LEAST_CONNECTIONS,ROUND_ROBIN,WEIGHTED_LEAST_CONNECTIONS,WEIGHTED_ROUND_ROBIN|} # not required. choices: RANDOM;LEAST_CONNECTIONS;ROUND_ROBIN;WEIGHTED_LEAST_CONNECTIONS;WEIGHTED_ROUND_ROBIN. algorithm for the balancer being created
name: ${21:null} # not required. Name to give the load balancer

rax_clb_nodes.description: add, modify and remove nodes from a Rackspace Cloud Load Balancer
body: rax_clb_nodes:
load_balancer_id: ${1:undefined} # required. Load balancer id
env: ${2:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
address: ${3:undefined} # not required. IP address or domain name of the node
type: ${4|primary,secondary|} # not required. choices: primary;secondary. Type of node
api_key: ${5:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
node_id: ${6:undefined} # not required. Node id
auth_endpoint: ${7:https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/} # not required. The URI of the authentication service.
verify_ssl: ${8:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
credentials: ${9:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
username: ${10:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
condition: ${11|enabled,disabled,draining|} # not required. choices: enabled;disabled;draining. Condition for the node, which determines its role within the load balancer
port: ${12:undefined} # not required. Port number of the load balanced service on the node
region: ${13:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.
identity_type: ${14:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.
wait_timeout: ${15:30} # not required. How long to wait before giving up and returning an error
wait: ${16|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Wait for the load balancer to become active before returning
state: ${17|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the node
weight: ${18:undefined} # not required. Weight of node
tenant_name: ${19:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.
tenant_id: ${20:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.

rax_clb_ssl.description: Manage SSL termination for a Rackspace Cloud Load Balancer.
body: rax_clb_ssl:
loadbalancer: ${1:undefined} # required. Name or ID of the load balancer on which to manage SSL termination.
secure_traffic_only: ${2:false} # not required. If "true", the load balancer will *only* accept secure traffic.
secure_port: ${3:443} # not required. The port to listen for secure traffic.
credentials: ${4:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
api_key: ${5:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
private_key: ${6:undefined} # not required. The private SSL key as a string in PEM format.
verify_ssl: ${7:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
env: ${8:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
tenant_id: ${9:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.

https_redirect: ${10:undefined} # not required. If "true", the load balancer will redirect HTTP traffic to HTTPS.,Requires "secure_traffic_only" to be true. Incurs an implicit wait if SSL,termination is also applied or removed.
auth_endpoint: ${11:https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/} # not required. The URI of the authentication service.
region: ${12:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.
identity_type: ${13:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.
wait_timeout: ${14:300} # not required. How long before "wait" gives up, in seconds.
enabled: ${15:true} # not required. If set to "false", temporarily disable SSL termination without discarding,existing credentials.
certificate: ${16:undefined} # not required. The public SSL certificates as a string in PEM format.
intermediate_certificate: ${17:undefined} # not required. One or more intermediate certificate authorities as a string in PEM,format, concatenated into a single string.
wait: ${18:false} # not required. Wait for the balancer to be in state "running" before turning.
state: ${19|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. If set to "present", SSL termination will be added to this load balancer.,If "absent", SSL termination will be removed instead.
username: ${20:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
tenant_name: ${21:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.

rax_dns.description: Manage domains on Rackspace Cloud DNS
body: rax_dns:
env: ${1:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource
api_key: ${3:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
ttl: ${4:3600} # not required. Time to live of domain in seconds
tenant_id: ${5:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.
verify_ssl: ${6:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
auth_endpoint: ${7:https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/} # not required. The URI of the authentication service.
region: ${8:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.
identity_type: ${9:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.
email: ${10:undefined} # not required. Email address of the domain administrator
comment: ${11:undefined} # not required. Brief description of the domain. Maximum length of 160 characters
credentials: ${12:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
username: ${13:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
tenant_name: ${14:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.
name: ${15:undefined} # not required. Domain name to create

rax_dns_record.description: Manage DNS records on Rackspace Cloud DNS
body: rax_dns_record:
type: ${1|A,AAAA,CNAME,MX,NS,SRV,TXT,PTR|} # required. choices: A;AAAA;CNAME;MX;NS;SRV;TXT;PTR. DNS record type
data: ${2:undefined} # required. IP address for A/AAAA record, FQDN for CNAME/MX/NS, or text data for SRV/TXT
name: ${3:undefined} # required. FQDN record name to create
env: ${4:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
api_key: ${5:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
server: ${6:undefined} # not required. Server ID to create a PTR record for. Only used with type=PTR
credentials: ${7:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
ttl: ${8:3600} # not required. Time to live of record in seconds
tenant_id: ${9:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.
verify_ssl: ${10:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
auth_endpoint: ${11:https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/} # not required. The URI of the authentication service.
identity_type: ${12:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.
region: ${13:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.
priority: ${14:undefined} # not required. Required for MX and SRV records, but forbidden for other record types. If specified, must be an integer from 0 to 65535.

overwrite: ${15:true} # not required. Add new records if data doesn't match, instead of updating existing record with matching name. If there are already multiple records with matching name and overwrite=true, this module will fail.
domain: ${16:undefined} # not required. Domain name to create the record in. This is an invalid option when type=PTR
comment: ${17:undefined} # not required. Brief description of the domain. Maximum length of 160 characters
loadbalancer: ${18:undefined} # not required. Load Balancer ID to create a PTR record for. Only used with type=PTR
state: ${19|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource
username: ${20:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
tenant_name: ${21:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.

rax_facts.description: Gather facts for Rackspace Cloud Servers
body: rax_facts:
env: ${1:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
address: ${2:undefined} # not required. Server IP address to retrieve facts for, will match any IP assigned to the server
api_key: ${3:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
verify_ssl: ${4:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
tenant_id: ${5:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.
auth_endpoint: ${6:https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/} # not required. The URI of the authentication service.
region: ${7:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.
identity_type: ${8:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.
id: ${9:undefined} # not required. Server ID to retrieve facts for
credentials: ${10:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
username: ${11:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
tenant_name: ${12:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.
name: ${13:null} # not required. Server name to retrieve facts for
rax_files:
container: ${1:undefined} # required. The container to use for container or metadata operations.
meta: ${2:undefined} # not required. A hash of items to set as metadata values on a container
api_key: ${3:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
type: ${4|file,meta|} # not required. choices: file;meta. Type of object to do work on, i.e. metadata object or a container object
ttl: ${5:undefined} # not required. In seconds, set a container-wide TTL for all objects cached on CDN edge nodes. Setting a TTL is only appropriate for containers that are public
credentials: ${6:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.

clear_meta: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Optionally clear existing metadata when applying metadata to existing containers. Selecting this option is only appropriate when setting type=meta
verify_ssl: ${8:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.

rax_files_objects.description: Upload, download, and delete objects in Rackspace Cloud Files
body: rax_files_objects:
container: ${1:null} # required. The container to use for file object operations.

dest: ${2:undefined} # not required. The destination of a "get" operation; i.e. a local directory, "/home/user/myfolder". Used to specify the destination of an operation on a remote object; i.e. a file name, "file1", or a comma-separated list of remote objects, "file1,file2,file17"
meta: ${3:null} # not required. A hash of items to set as metadata values on an uploaded file or folder
type: ${4|file,meta|} # not required. choices: file;meta. Type of object to do work on,Metadata object or a file object

method: ${5|get,put,delete|} # not required. choices: get;put;delete. The method of operation to be performed.  For example, put to upload files to Cloud Files, get to download files from Cloud Files or delete to delete remote objects in Cloud Files
api_key: ${6:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
verify_ssl: ${7:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
env: ${8:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).

clear_meta: ${9|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Optionally clear existing metadata when applying metadata to existing objects. Selecting this option is only appropriate when setting type=meta
tenant_id: ${10:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.
auth_endpoint: ${11:https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/} # not required. The URI of the authentication service.
region: ${12:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.
identity_type: ${13:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.

src: ${14:null} # not required. Source from which to upload files.  Used to specify a remote object as a source for an operation, i.e. a file name, "file1", or a comma-separated list of remote objects, "file1,file2,file17".  src and dest are mutually exclusive on remote-only object operations
credentials: ${15:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
expires: ${16:null} # not required. Used to set an expiration on a file or folder uploaded to Cloud Files. Requires an integer, specifying expiration in seconds

structure: ${17|true,no|} # not required. choices: true;no. Used to specify whether to maintain nested directory structure when downloading objects from Cloud Files.  Setting to false downloads the contents of a container to a single, flat directory
state: ${18|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource
username: ${19:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
tenant_name: ${20:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.

rax_mon_alarm.description: Create or delete a Rackspace Cloud Monitoring alarm.
body: rax_mon_alarm:
entity_id: ${1:undefined} # required. ID of the entity this alarm is attached to. May be acquired by registering the value of a rax_mon_entity task.
notification_plan_id: ${2:undefined} # required. ID of the notification plan to trigger if this alarm fires. May be acquired by registering the value of a rax_mon_notification_plan task.
label: ${3:undefined} # required. Friendly name for this alarm, used to achieve idempotence. Must be a String between 1 and 255 characters long.
check_id: ${4:undefined} # required. ID of the check that should be alerted on. May be acquired by registering the value of a rax_mon_check task.
metadata: ${5:undefined} # not required. Arbitrary key/value pairs to accompany the alarm. Must be a hash of String keys and values between 1 and 255 characters long.
api_key: ${6:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
verify_ssl: ${7:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
credentials: ${8:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
auth_endpoint: ${9:https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/} # not required. The URI of the authentication service.
tenant_id: ${10:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.
identity_type: ${11:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.
region: ${12:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.

criteria: ${13:undefined} # not required. Alarm DSL that describes alerting conditions and their output states. Must be between 1 and 16384 characters long. See http://docs.rackspace.com/cm/api/v1.0/cm-devguide/content/alerts-language.html for a reference on the alerting language.
env: ${14:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
disabled: ${15|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If yes, create this alarm, but leave it in an inactive state. Defaults to no.
state: ${16|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Ensure that the alarm with this C(label) exists or does not exist.
username: ${17:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
tenant_name: ${18:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.

rax_mon_check.description: Create or delete a Rackspace Cloud Monitoring check for an existing entity.
body: rax_mon_check:
entity_id: ${1:undefined} # required. ID of the rax_mon_entity to target with this check.
label: ${2:undefined} # required. Defines a label for this check, between 1 and 64 characters long.

check_type: ${3|remote.dns,remote.ftp-banner,remote.http,remote.imap-banner,remote.mssql-banner,remote.mysql-banner,remote.ping,remote.pop3-banner,remote.postgresql-banner,remote.smtp-banner,remote.smtp,remote.ssh,remote.tcp,remote.telnet-banner,agent.filesystem,agent.memory,agent.load_average,agent.cpu,agent.disk,agent.network,agent.plugin|} # required. choices: remote.dns;remote.ftp-banner;remote.http;remote.imap-banner;remote.mssql-banner;remote.mysql-banner;remote.ping;remote.pop3-banner;remote.postgresql-banner;remote.smtp-banner;remote.smtp;remote.ssh;remote.tcp;remote.telnet-banner;agent.filesystem;agent.memory;agent.load_average;agent.cpu;agent.disk;agent.network;agent.plugin. The type of check to create. C(remote.) checks may be created on any rax_mon_entity. C(agent.) checks may only be created on rax_mon_entities that have a non-null C(agent_id).
tenant_id: ${4:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.
auth_endpoint: ${5:https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/} # not required. The URI of the authentication service.
env: ${6:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
disabled: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If "yes", ensure the check is created, but don't actually use it yet.

target_alias: ${8:undefined} # not required. One of `target_alias` and `target_hostname` is required for remote.* checks, but prohibited for agent.* checks. Use the corresponding key in the entity's `ip_addresses` hash to resolve an IP address to target.
credentials: ${9:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
tenant_name: ${10:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.
details: ${11:undefined} # not required. Additional details specific to the check type. Must be a hash of strings between 1 and 255 characters long, or an array or object containing 0 to 256 items.
period: ${12:undefined} # not required. The number of seconds between each time the check is performed. Must be greater than the minimum period set on your account.
metadata: ${13:undefined} # not required. Hash of arbitrary key-value pairs to accompany this check if it fires. Keys and values must be strings between 1 and 255 characters long.
api_key: ${14:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).

target_hostname: ${15:undefined} # not required. One of `target_hostname` and `target_alias` is required for remote.* checks, but prohibited for agent.* checks. The hostname this check should target. Must be a valid IPv4, IPv6, or FQDN.
verify_ssl: ${16:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
region: ${17:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.

monitoring_zones_poll: ${18:undefined} # not required. Comma-separated list of the names of the monitoring zones the check should run from. Available monitoring zones include mzdfw, mzhkg, mziad, mzlon, mzord and mzsyd. Required for remote.* checks; prohibited for agent.* checks.
timeout: ${19:undefined} # not required. The number of seconds this check will wait when attempting to collect results. Must be less than the period.
state: ${20|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Ensure that a check with this C(label) exists or does not exist.
username: ${21:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
identity_type: ${22:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.

rax_mon_entity.description: Create or delete a Rackspace Cloud Monitoring entity
body: rax_mon_entity:
label: ${1:undefined} # required. Defines a name for this entity. Must be a non-empty string between 1 and 255 characters long.
metadata: ${2:undefined} # not required. Hash of arbitrary C(name), C(value) pairs that are passed to associated rax_mon_alarms. Names and values must all be between 1 and 255 characters long.
credentials: ${3:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
api_key: ${4:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
verify_ssl: ${5:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
tenant_id: ${6:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.

identity_type: ${8:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.
region: ${9:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.
tenant_name: ${10:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.
env: ${11:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
agent_id: ${12:undefined} # not required. Rackspace monitoring agent on the target device to which this entity is bound. Necessary to collect C(agent.) rax_mon_checks against this entity.
state: ${13|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Ensure that an entity with this C(name) exists or does not exist.
username: ${14:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).

named_ip_addresses: ${15:undefined} # not required. Hash of IP addresses that may be referenced by name by rax_mon_checks added to this entity. Must be a dictionary of with keys that are names between 1 and 64 characters long, and values that are valid IPv4 or IPv6 addresses.

state: ${12|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Ensure that the notification with this C(label) exists or does not exist.
username: ${13:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
tenant_name: ${14:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.

username: ${14:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).

rax_scaling_group:
min_entities: ${1:undefined} # required. The minimum number of entities that are allowed in the scaling group. Must be an integer between 0 and 1000.

body: rax_scaling_policy:

name: ${3:undefined} # required. Name to give the policy
cooldown: ${4:undefined} # not required. The period of time, in seconds, that must pass before any scaling can occur after the previous scaling. Must be an integer between 0 and 86400 (24 hrs).
desired_capacity: ${5:undefined} # not required. The desired server capacity of the scaling the group; that is, how many servers should be in the scaling group.
credentials: ${6:null} # not required. File to find the Rackspace credentials in. Ignored if I(api_key) and I(username) are provided.
api_key: ${7:undefined} # not required. Rackspace API key, overrides I(credentials).
verify_ssl: ${8:undefined} # not required. Whether or not to require SSL validation of API endpoints.
is_percent: ${9:false} # not required. Whether the value in I(change) is a percent value

change: ${10:undefined} # not required. The change, either as a number of servers or as a percentage, to make in the scaling group. If this is a percentage, you must set I(is_percent) to C(true) also.
tenant_id: ${11:undefined} # not required. The tenant ID used for authentication.
auth_endpoint: ${12:https://identity.api.rackspacecloud.com/v2.0/} # not required. The URI of the authentication service.
at: ${13:undefined} # not required. The UTC time when this policy will be executed. The time must be formatted according to C(yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss.SSS) such as C(2013-05-19T08:07:08Z)
identity_type: ${14:rackspace} # not required. Authentication mechanism to use, such as rackspace or keystone.
env: ${15:undefined} # not required. Environment as configured in I(~/.pyrax.cfg), see U(https://github.com/rackspace/pyrax/blob/master/docs/getting_started.md#pyrax-configuration).
region: ${16:DFW} # not required. Region to create an instance in.
cron: ${17:undefined} # not required. The time when the policy will be executed, as a cron entry. For example, if this is parameter is set to C(1 0 * * *)
state: ${18|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the resource
username: ${19:undefined} # not required. Rackspace username, overrides I(credentials).
tenant_name: ${20:undefined} # not required. The tenant name used for authentication.

rds.description: create, delete, or modify an Amazon rds instance
body: rds:

command: ${1|create,replicate,delete,facts,modify,promote,snapshot,reboot,restore|} # required. choices: create;replicate;delete;facts;modify;promote;snapshot;reboot;restore. Specifies the action to take. The 'reboot' option is available starting at version 2.0
region: ${2:undefined} # required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used.
