reload: ${5:yes} # not required. Reload SELinux policy after commit.
serverless:
service_path: ${1:undefined} # required. The path to the root of the Serverless Service to be operated on.

deploy: ${2:true} # not required. Whether or not to deploy artifacts after building them. When this option is `false` all the functions will be built, but no stack update will be run to send them out. This is mostly useful for generating artifacts to be stored/deployed elsewhere.
serverless_bin_path: ${3:undefined} # not required. The path of a serverless framework binary relative to the 'service_path' eg. node_module/.bin/serverless
functions: ${4:} # not required. A list of specific functions to deploy. If this is not provided, all functions in the service will be deployed.
state: ${5|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Goal state of given stage/project
stage: ${6:undefined} # not required. The name of the serverless framework project stage to deploy to. This uses the serverless framework default "dev".
region: ${7:us-east-1} # not required. AWS region to deploy the service to
service:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the service.

pattern: ${2:undefined} # not required. If the service does not respond to the status command, name a substring to look for as would be found in the output of the I(ps) command as a stand-in for a status result.  If the string is found, the service will be assumed to be running.

use: ${3:auto} # not required. The service module actually uses system specific modules, normally through auto detection, this setting can force a specific module.,Normally it uses the value of the 'ansible_service_mgr' fact and falls back to the old 'service' module when none matching is found.
enabled: ${4:undefined} # not required. Whether the service should start on boot. B(At least one of state and enabled are required.)
arguments: ${5:undefined} # not required. Additional arguments provided on the command line

state: ${6|reloaded,restarted,running,started,stopped|} # not required. choices: reloaded;restarted;running;started;stopped. C(started)/C(stopped) are idempotent actions that will not run commands unless necessary.  C(restarted) will always bounce the service.  C(reloaded) will always reload. B(At least one of state and enabled are required.) Note that reloaded will start the service if it is not already started, even if your chosen init system wouldn't normally.
runlevel: ${7:default} # not required. For OpenRC init scripts (ex: Gentoo) only.  The runlevel that this service belongs to.

sleep: ${8:undefined} # not required. If the service is being C(restarted) then sleep this many seconds between the stop and start command. This helps to workaround badly behaving init scripts that exit immediately after signaling a process to stop.

service_facts.description: Return service state information as fact data
body: service_facts:

set_fact.description: Set host facts from a task
body: set_fact:
key_value: ${1:null} # required. The C(set_fact) module takes key=value pairs as variables to set in the playbook scope. Or alternatively, accepts complex arguments using the C(args:) statement.
cacheable: ${2:false} # not required. This boolean indicates if the facts set will also be added to the fact cache, if fact caching is enabled.

set_stats.description: Set stats for the current ansible run
body: set_stats:
data: ${1:undefined} # required. A dictionary of which each key represents a stat (or variable) you want to keep track of
per_host: ${2:false} # not required. boolean that indicates if the stats is per host or for all hosts in the run.
aggregate: ${3:true} # not required. boolean that indicates if the provided value is aggregated to the existing stat C(yes) or will replace it C(no)
setup:
gather_timeout: ${1:10} # not required. Set the default timeout in seconds for individual fact gathering

fact_path: ${2:/etc/ansible/facts.d} # not required. path used for local ansible facts (*.fact) - files in this dir will be run (if executable) and their results be added to ansible_local facts if a file is not executable it is read. Check notes for Windows options. (from 2.1 on) File/results format can be json or ini-format
filter: ${3:*} # not required. if supplied, only return facts that match this shell-style (fnmatch) wildcard.

gather_subset: ${4:all} # not required. if supplied, restrict the additional facts collected to the given subset. Possible values: all, min, hardware, network, virtual, ohai, and facter Can specify a list of values to specify a larger subset. Values can also be used with an initial C(!) to specify that that specific subset should not be collected.  For instance: !hardware, !network, !virtual, !ohai, !facter. If !all is specified then only the min subset is collected. To avoid collecting even the min subset, specify !all and !min subsets. To collect only specific facts, use !all, !min, and specify the particular fact subsets. Use the filter parameter if you do not want to display some collected facts.
sf_account_manager:
state: ${1|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Whether the specified account should exist or not.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. Password for the specified user.
username: ${3:undefined} # required. Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://goo.gl/ddJa4Q).
name: ${4:undefined} # required. Unique username for this account. (May be 1 to 64 characters in length).
hostname: ${5:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.

target_secret: ${6:undefined} # not required. CHAP secret to use for the target (mutual CHAP authentication).,Should be 12-16 characters long and impenetrable.,The CHAP target secrets must be unique and cannot be the same as the initiator CHAP secret.,If not specified, a random secret is created.
new_name: ${7:None} # not required. New name for the user account.
account_id: ${8:None} # not required. The ID of the account to manage or update.

initiator_secret: ${9:undefined} # not required. CHAP secret to use for the initiator. Should be 12-16 characters long and impenetrable.,The CHAP initiator secrets must be unique and cannot be the same as the target CHAP secret.,If not specified, a random secret is created.
status: ${10:undefined} # not required. Status of the account.
attributes: ${11:undefined} # not required. List of Name/Value pairs in JSON object format.

sf_check_connections.description: Check connectivity to MVIP and SVIP.
body: sf_check_connections:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. Password for the specified user.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://goo.gl/ddJa4Q).
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.
svip: ${4:None} # not required. Optionally, use to test connection of a different SVIP.,This is not needed to test the connection to the target cluster.
mvip: ${5:None} # not required. Optionally, use to test connection of a different MVIP.,This is not needed to test the connection to the target cluster.
skip: ${6|svip,mvip|} # not required. choices: svip;mvip. Skip checking connection to SVIP or MVIP.
sf_snapshot_schedule_manager:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. Password for the specified user.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Whether the specified schedule should exist or not.
username: ${3:undefined} # required. Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://goo.gl/ddJa4Q).
hostname: ${4:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.
name: ${5:undefined} # required. Name for the snapshot schedule.
time_interval_hours: ${6:0} # not required. Time interval in hours.
volumes: ${7:undefined} # not required. Volume IDs that you want to set the snapshot schedule for.,At least 1 volume ID is required for creating a new schedule.,required when C(state=present)
time_interval_days: ${8:1} # not required. Time interval in days.
snapshot_name: ${9:undefined} # not required. Name for the created snapshots.

starting_date: ${10:undefined} # not required. Starting date for the schedule.,Required when C(state=present).,Please use two '-' in the above format, or you may see an error- TypeError, is not JSON serializable description.,Format: C(2016--12--01T00:00:00Z)
recurring: ${11:undefined} # not required. Should the schedule recur?
time_interval_minutes: ${12:0} # not required. Time interval in minutes.
retention: ${13:undefined} # not required. Retention period for the snapshot.,Format is 'HH:mm:ss'.
schedule_id: ${14:undefined} # not required. The schedule ID for the schedule that you want to update or delete.
paused: ${15:undefined} # not required. Pause / Resume a schedule.
sf_volume_access_group_manager:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. Password for the specified user.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Whether the specified volume access group should exist or not.
username: ${3:undefined} # required. Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://goo.gl/ddJa4Q).
name: ${4:undefined} # required. Name of the volume access group. It is not required to be unique, but recommended.
hostname: ${5:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.
virtual_network_id: ${6:None} # not required. The ID of the SolidFire Virtual Network ID to associate the volume access group with.
volume_access_group_id: ${7:None} # not required. The ID of the volume access group to modify or delete.
volumes: ${8:None} # not required. List of volumes to initially include in the volume access group. If unspecified, the access group will start without any volumes.
virtual_network_tags: ${9:None} # not required. The ID of the VLAN Virtual Network Tag to associate the volume access group with.
initiators: ${10:None} # not required. List of initiators to include in the volume access group. If unspecified, the access group will start out without configured initiators.
attributes: ${11:None} # not required. List of Name/Value pairs in JSON object format.
sf_volume_manager:
account_id: ${1:undefined} # required. Account ID for the owner of this volume.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. Password for the specified user.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Whether the specified volume should exist or not.
username: ${4:undefined} # required. Please ensure that the user has the adequate permissions. For more information, please read the official documentation U(https://goo.gl/ddJa4Q).
name: ${5:undefined} # required. The name of the volume to manage.
hostname: ${6:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the SolidFire cluster.
size_unit: ${7|bytes,b,kb,mb,gb,tb,pb,eb,zb,yb|} # not required. choices: bytes;b;kb;mb;gb;tb;pb;eb;zb;yb. The unit used to interpret the size parameter.
size: ${8:undefined} # not required. The size of the volume in (size_unit).,Required when C(state = present).

volume_id: ${9:None} # not required. The ID of the volume to manage or update.,In order to create multiple volumes with the same name, but different volume_ids, please declare the I(volume_id) parameter with an arbitrary value. However, the specified volume_id will not be assigned to the newly created volume (since it's an auto-generated property).
qos: ${10:None} # not required. Initial quality of service settings for this volume. Configure as dict in playbooks.
attributes: ${11:None} # not required. A YAML dictionary of attributes that you would like to apply on this volume.
512emulation: ${12:undefined} # not required. Should the volume provide 512-byte sector emulation?,Required when C(state=present)

access: ${13|readOnly,readWrite,locked,replicationTarget|} # not required. choices: readOnly;readWrite;locked;replicationTarget. Access allowed for the volume.,readOnly: Only read operations are allowed.,readWrite: Reads and writes are allowed.,locked: No reads or writes are allowed.,replicationTarget: Identify a volume as the target volume for a paired set of volumes. If the volume is not paired, the access status is locked.,If unspecified, the access settings of the clone will be the same as the source.
shell:
free_form: ${1:null} # required. The shell module takes a free form command to run, as a string.  There's not an actual option named "free form".  See the examples!
chdir: ${2:null} # not required. cd into this directory before running the command
executable: ${3:null} # not required. change the shell used to execute the command. Should be an absolute path to the executable.
creates: ${4:null} # not required. a filename, when it already exists, this step will B(not) be run.
stdin: ${5:null} # not required. Set the stdin of the command directly to the specified value.
removes: ${6:null} # not required. a filename, when it does not exist, this step will B(not) be run.
warn: ${7:true} # not required. if command warnings are on in ansible.cfg, do not warn about this particular line if set to no/false.

sl_vm.description: create or cancel a virtual instance in SoftLayer
body: sl_vm:
memory: ${1:undefined} # required. Amount of memory to be assigned to new virtual instance.
disks: ${2:25} # required. List of disk sizes to be assigned to new virtual instance.
cpus: ${3:undefined} # required. Count of cpus to be assigned to new virtual instance.
datacenter: ${4:undefined} # not required. Datacenter for the virtual instance to be deployed.
image_id: ${5:undefined} # not required. Image Template to be used for new virtual instance.
tags: ${6:undefined} # not required. Tag or list of tags to be provided to a virtual instance.
ssh_keys: ${7:undefined} # not required. List of ssh keys by their Id to be assigned to a virtual instance.
public_vlan: ${8:undefined} # not required. VLAN by its Id to be assigned to the public NIC.
post_uri: ${9:undefined} # not required. URL of a post provisioning script to be loaded and executed on virtual instance.
hourly: ${10:yes} # not required. Flag to determine if the instance should be hourly billed.
wait: ${11:yes} # not required. Flag used to wait for active status before returning.
private: ${12:no} # not required. Flag to determine if the instance should be private only.
nic_speed: ${13:10} # not required. NIC Speed to be assigned to new virtual instance.
local_disk: ${14:yes} # not required. Flag to determine if local disk should be used for the new instance.
wait_time: ${15:600} # not required. Time in seconds before wait returns.
os_code: ${16:undefined} # not required. OS Code to be used for new virtual instance.
domain: ${17:undefined} # not required. Domain name to be provided to a virtual instance.
instance_id: ${18:undefined} # not required. Instance Id of the virtual instance to perform action option.
dedicated: ${19:no} # not required. Flag to determine if the instance should be deployed in dedicated space.
private_vlan: ${20:undefined} # not required. VLAN by its Id to be assigned to the private NIC.
state: ${21|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Create, or cancel a virtual instance.,Specify C(present) for create, C(absent) to cancel.
hostname: ${22:undefined} # not required. Hostname to be provided to a virtual instance.
slack:

token: ${1:undefined} # required. Slack integration token.  This authenticates you to the slack service. Prior to 1.8, a token looked like C(3Ffe373sfhRE6y42Fg3rvf4GlK).  In 1.8 and above, ansible adapts to the new slack API where tokens look like C(G922VJP24/D921DW937/3Ffe373sfhRE6y42Fg3rvf4GlK).  If tokens are in the new format then slack will ignore any value of domain.  If the token is in the old format the domain is required.  Ansible has no control of when slack will get rid of the old API.  When slack does that the old format will stop working.  ** Please keep in mind the tokens are not the API tokens but are the webhook tokens.  In slack these are found in the webhook URL which are obtained under the apps and integrations. The incoming webhooks can be added in that area.  In some cases this may be locked by your Slack admin and you must request access.  It is there that the incoming webhooks can be added.  The key is on the end of the URL given to you in that section.
validate_certs: ${2|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
icon_emoji: ${3:None} # not required. Emoji for the message sender. See Slack documentation for options. (if I(icon_emoji) is set, I(icon_url) will not be used)

domain: ${4:None} # not required. Slack (sub)domain for your environment without protocol. (i.e. C(example.slack.com)) In 1.8 and beyond, this is deprecated and may be ignored.  See token documentation for information.
attachments: ${5:None} # not required. Define a list of attachments. This list mirrors the Slack JSON API.,For more information, see also in the (U(https://api.slack.com/docs/attachments)).
channel: ${6:None} # not required. Channel to send the message to. If absent, the message goes to the channel selected for the I(token).
icon_url: ${7:undefined} # not required. Url for the message sender's icon (default C(https://www.ansible.com/favicon.ico))

msg: ${8:None} # not required. Message to send. Note that the module does not handle escaping characters. Plain-text angle brackets and ampersands should be converted to HTML entities (e.g. & to &) before sending. See Slack's documentation (U(https://api.slack.com/docs/message-formatting)) for more.
parse: ${9|full,none|} # not required. choices: full;none. Setting for the message parser at Slack
username: ${10:Ansible} # not required. This is the sender of the message.

color: ${11|normal,good,warning,danger|} # not required. choices: normal;good;warning;danger. Allow text to use default colors - use the default of 'normal' to not send a custom color bar at the start of the message
link_names: ${12|1,0|} # not required. choices: 1;0. Automatically create links for channels and usernames in I(msg).
slackpkg:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. name of package to install/remove
update_cache: ${2|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. update the package database first
state: ${3|present,absent,latest|} # not required. choices: present;absent;latest. state of the package, you can use "installed" as an alias for C(present) and removed as one for C(absent).

slurp.description: Slurps a file from remote nodes
body: slurp:
src: ${1:undefined} # required. The file on the remote system to fetch. This I(must) be a file, not a directory.
smartos_image_facts:

filters: ${1:None} # not required. Criteria for selecting image. Can be any value from image manifest and 'published_date', 'published', 'source', 'clones', and 'size'. More informaton can be found at U(https://smartos.org/man/1m/imgadm) under 'imgadm list'.

snmp_facts.description: Retrieve facts for a device using SNMP.
body: snmp_facts:
version: ${1|v2,v2c,v3|} # required. choices: v2;v2c;v3. SNMP Version to use, v2/v2c or v3
host: ${2:undefined} # required. Set to target snmp server (normally {{inventory_hostname}})
privkey: ${3:undefined} # not required. Encryption key, required if version is authPriv
authkey: ${4:undefined} # not required. Authentication key, required if version is v3
privacy: ${5|des,aes|} # not required. choices: des;aes. Encryption algorithm, required if level is authPriv
integrity: ${6|md5,sha|} # not required. choices: md5;sha. Hashing algorithm, required if version is v3
community: ${7:undefined} # not required. The SNMP community string, required if version is v2/v2c
level: ${8|authPriv,authNoPriv|} # not required. choices: authPriv;authNoPriv. Authentication level, required if version is v3
username: ${9:undefined} # not required. Username for SNMPv3, required if version is v3
snow_record:
instance: ${1:undefined} # required. The service now instance name
password: ${2:undefined} # required. Password for username
username: ${3:undefined} # required. User to connect to ServiceNow as

state: ${4|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. If C(present) is supplied with a C(number) argument, the module will attempt to update the record with the supplied data.  If no such record exists, a new one will be created.  C(absent) will delete a record.
data: ${5:undefined} # not required. key, value pairs of data to load into the record. See Examples. Required for C(state:present)
number: ${6:undefined} # not required. Record number to update. Required for C(state:absent)
attachment: ${7:undefined} # not required. Attach a file to the record
table: ${8:incident} # not required. Table to query for records
lookup_field: ${9:number} # not required. Changes the field that C(number) uses to find records

sns.description: Send Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) messages
body: sns:
topic: ${1:undefined} # required. The topic you want to publish to.
msg: ${2:undefined} # required. Default message to send.

message_structure: ${3|json,string|} # required. choices: json;string. The payload format to use for the message.,This must be 'json' to support non-default messages (`http`, `https`, `email`, `sms`, `sqs`). It must be 'string' to support message_attributes.
aws_secret_key: ${4:None} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
sqs: ${6:undefined} # not required. Message to send to SQS-only subscription
subject: ${7:undefined} # not required. Subject line for email delivery.
sms: ${8:undefined} # not required. Message to send to SMS-only subscription
http: ${9:undefined} # not required. Message to send to HTTP-only subscription

ec2_url: ${10:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
region: ${11:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used.
https: ${12:undefined} # not required. Message to send to HTTPS-only subscription
email: ${13:undefined} # not required. Message to send to email-only subscription
validate_certs: ${14:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_access_key: ${15:None} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.

message_attributes: ${16:None} # not required. Dictionary of message attributes. These are optional structured data entries to be sent along to the endpoint.,This is in AWS's distinct Name/Type/Value format; see example below.
security_token: ${17:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

sns_topic.description: Manages AWS SNS topics and subscriptions
body: sns_topic:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name or ARN of the SNS topic to converge
validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.

purge_subscriptions: ${5:true} # not required. Whether to purge any subscriptions not listed here. NOTE: AWS does not allow you to purge any PendingConfirmation subscriptions, so if any exist and would be purged, they are silently skipped. This means that somebody could come back later and confirm the subscription. Sorry. Blame Amazon.
delivery_policy: ${6:None} # not required. Delivery policy to apply to the SNS topic

region: ${7:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_url: ${8:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
policy: ${9:None} # not required. Policy to apply to the SNS topic
aws_access_key: ${10:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${11:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.
state: ${12|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Whether to create or destroy an SNS topic
display_name: ${13:None} # not required. Display name of the topic
subscriptions: ${14:} # not required. List of subscriptions to apply to the topic. Note that AWS requires subscriptions to be confirmed, so you will need to confirm any new subscriptions.
solaris_zone:

state: ${1|absent,attached,configured,detached,installed,present,running,started,stopped|} # required. choices: absent;attached;configured;detached;installed;present;running;started;stopped. C(present), configure and install the zone.,C(installed), synonym for C(present).,C(running), if the zone already exists, boot it, otherwise, configure and install the zone first, then boot it.,C(started), synonym for C(running).,C(stopped), shutdown a zone.,C(absent), destroy the zone.,C(configured), configure the ready so that it's to be attached.,C(attached), attach a zone, but do not boot it.,C(detached), shutdown and detach a zone
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Zone name.
root_password: ${3:undefined} # not required. The password hash for the root account. If not specified, the zone's root account will not have a password.
create_options: ${4:empty string} # not required. Extra options to the zonecfg(1M) create command.

attach_options: ${5:empty string} # not required. Extra options to the zoneadm attach command. For example, this can be used to specify whether a minimum or full update of packages is required and if any packages need to be deleted. For valid values, see zoneadm(1M)
sparse: ${6:no} # not required. Whether to create a sparse (C(true)) or whole root (C(false)) zone.
path: ${7:undefined} # not required. The path where the zone will be created. This is required when the zone is created, but not used otherwise.

install_options: ${8:empty string} # not required. Extra options to the zoneadm(1M) install command. To automate Solaris 11 zone creation, use this to specify the profile XML file, e.g. install_options="-c sc_profile.xml"

config: ${9:empty string} # not required. The zonecfg configuration commands for this zone. See zonecfg(1M) for the valid options and syntax. Typically this is a list of options separated by semi-colons or new lines, e.g. "set auto-boot=true;add net;set physical=bge0;set address=10.1.1.1;end"
timeout: ${10:600} # not required. Timeout, in seconds, for zone to boot.

sorcery.description: Package manager for Source Mage GNU/Linux
body: sorcery:
update_cache: ${1|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether or not to update grimoire collection before casting spells
cache_valid_time: ${2:null} # not required. Time in seconds to invalidate grimoire collection on update,especially useful for SCM and rsync grimoires,makes sense only in pair with C(update_cache)
update: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether or not to update sorcery scripts at the very first stage

depends: ${4:null} # not required. Comma-separated list of _optional_ dependencies to build a spell (or make sure it is built) with; use +/- in front of dependency to turn it on/off ('+' is optional though),this option is ignored if C(name) parameter is equal to '*' or contains more than one spell,providers must be supplied in the form recognized by Sorcery, e.g. 'openssl(SSL)'

state: ${5|present,latest,absent,cast,dispelled,rebuild|} # not required. choices: present;latest;absent;cast;dispelled;rebuild. Whether to cast, dispel or rebuild a package,state C(cast) is an equivalent of C(present), not C(latest),state C(latest) always triggers C(update_cache=yes),state C(rebuild) implies cast of all specified spells, not only those existed before

name: ${6:null} # not required. Name of the spell,multiple names can be given, separated by commas,special value '*' in conjunction with states C(latest) or C(rebuild) will update or rebuild the whole system respectively

spotinst_aws_elastigroup.description: Create, update or delete Spotinst AWS Elastigroups
body: spotinst_aws_elastigroup:
image_id: ${1:undefined} # required. (String) The image Id used to launch the instance.; In case of conflict between Instance type and image type, an error will be returned
key_pair: ${2:undefined} # required. (String) Specify a Key Pair to attach to the instances
security_group_ids: ${3:undefined} # required. (List of Strings) One or more security group IDs. ; In case of update it will override the existing Security Group with the new given array
name: ${4:undefined} # required. (String) Unique name for elastigroup to be created, updated or deleted

availability_zones: ${5:undefined} # required. (List of Objects) a list of hash/dictionaries of Availability Zones that are configured in the elastigroup; '[{"key":"value", "key":"value"}]'; keys allowed are name (String), subnet_id (String), placement_group_name (String),
availability_vs_cost: ${6|availabilityOriented,costOriented,balanced|} # required. choices: availabilityOriented;costOriented;balanced. (String) The strategy orientation.
min_size: ${7:undefined} # required. (Integer) The lower limit number of instances that you can scale down to

product: ${8|Linux/UNIX,SUSE Linux,Windows,Linux/UNIX (Amazon VPC),SUSE Linux (Amazon VPC),Windows|} # required. choices: Linux/UNIX;SUSE Linux;Windows;Linux/UNIX (Amazon VPC);SUSE Linux (Amazon VPC);Windows. (String) Operation system type._
target: ${9:undefined} # required. (Integer) The number of instances to launch
spot_instance_types: ${10:undefined} # required. (List of Strings) Spot instance type that will be provisioned.
on_demand_instance_type: ${11:undefined} # required. (String) On-demand instance type that will be provisioned
max_size: ${12:undefined} # required. (Integer) The upper limit number of instances that you can scale up to
monitoring: ${13:undefined} # required. (Boolean) Describes whether instance Enhanced Monitoring is enabled
unit: ${14|instance,weight|} # required. choices: instance;weight. (String) The capacity unit to launch instances by.

up_scaling_policies: ${15:undefined} # not required. (List of Objects) a list of hash/dictionaries of scaling policies to configure in the elastigroup; '[{"key":"value", "key":"value"}]'; keys allowed are - policy_name (String, required), namespace (String, required), metric_name (String, required), dimensions (List of Objects, Keys allowed are name (String, required) and value (String)), statistic (String, required) evaluation_periods (String, required), period (String, required), threshold (String, required), cooldown (String, required), unit (String, required), operator (String, required), action_type (String, required), adjustment (String), min_target_capacity (String), target (String), maximum (String), minimum (String)

down_scaling_policies: ${16:undefined} # not required. (List of Objects) a list of hash/dictionaries of scaling policies to configure in the elastigroup; '[{"key":"value", "key":"value"}]'; keys allowed are - policy_name (String, required), namespace (String, required), metric_name (String, required), dimensions ((List of Objects), Keys allowed are name (String, required) and value (String)), statistic (String, required), evaluation_periods (String, required), period (String, required), threshold (String, required), cooldown (String, required), unit (String, required), operator (String, required), action_type (String, required), adjustment (String), max_target_capacity (String), target (String), maximum (String), minimum (String)
terminate_at_end_of_billing_hour: ${17:undefined} # not required. (Boolean) terminate at the end of billing hour
tags: ${18:undefined} # not required. (List of tagKey:tagValue paris) a list of tags to configure in the elastigroup. Please specify list of keys and values (key colon value);
iam_role_arn: ${19:undefined} # not required. (String) The instance profile iamRole arn,Only use iam_role_arn, or iam_role_name
spin_up_time: ${20:undefined} # not required. (Integer) spin up time, in seconds, for the instance

scheduled_tasks: ${21:undefined} # not required. (List of Objects) a list of hash/dictionaries of scheduled tasks to configure in the elastigroup; '[{"key":"value", "key":"value"}]'; keys allowed are - adjustment (Integer), scale_target_capacity (Integer), scale_min_capacity (Integer), scale_max_capacity (Integer), adjustment_percentage (Integer), batch_size_percentage (Integer), cron_expression (String), frequency (String), grace_period (Integer), task_type (String, required), is_enabled (Boolean)
health_check_unhealthy_duration_before_replacement: ${22:undefined} # not required. (Integer) Minimal mount of time instance should be unhealthy for us to consider it unhealthy.

block_device_mappings: ${23:undefined} # not required. (List of Objects) a list of hash/dictionaries of Block Device Mappings for elastigroup instances; You can specify virtual devices and EBS volumes.; '[{"key":"value", "key":"value"}]'; keys allowed are device_name (List of Strings), virtual_name (String), no_device (String), ebs (Object, expects the following keys- delete_on_termination(Boolean), encrypted(Boolean), iops (Integer), snapshot_id(Integer), volume_type(String), volume_size(Integer))
fallback_to_od: ${24:undefined} # not required. (Boolean) In case of no spots available, Elastigroup will launch an On-demand instance instead

network_interfaces: ${25:undefined} # not required. (List of Objects) a list of hash/dictionaries of network interfaces to add to the elastigroup; '[{"key":"value", "key":"value"}]'; keys allowed are - description (String), device_index (Integer), secondary_private_ip_address_count (Integer), associate_public_ip_address (Boolean), delete_on_termination (Boolean), groups (List of Strings), network_interface_id (String), private_ip_address (String), subnet_id (String), associate_ipv6_address (Boolean), private_ip_addresses (List of Objects, Keys are privateIpAddress (String, required) and primary (Boolean))
elastic_ips: ${26:undefined} # not required. (List of Strings) List of ElasticIps Allocation Ids to associate to the group instances

on_demand_count: ${27:undefined} # not required. (Integer) Required if risk is not set,Number of on demand instances to launch. All other instances will be spot instances.; Either set this parameter or the risk parameter
mesosphere: ${28:undefined} # not required. (Object) The Mesosphere integration configuration. Expects the following key - api_server (String)

persistence: ${29:undefined} # not required. (Object) The Stateful elastigroup configration.; Accepts the following keys - should_persist_root_device (Boolean), should_persist_block_devices (Boolean), should_persist_private_ip (Boolean)
load_balancers: ${30:undefined} # not required. (List of Strings) List of classic ELB names
ecs: ${31:undefined} # not required. (Object) The ECS integration configuration.; Expects the following key - cluster_name (String)
ignore_changes: ${32|image_id,target|} # not required. choices: image_id;target. (List of Strings) list of fields on which changes should be ignored when updating
iam_role_name: ${33:undefined} # not required. (String) The instance profile iamRole name,Only use iam_role_arn, or iam_role_name
ebs_optimized: ${34:undefined} # not required. (Boolean) Enable EBS optimization for supported instances which are not enabled by default.; Note - additional charges will be applied.
signals: ${35:undefined} # not required. (List of Objects) a list of hash/dictionaries of signals to configure in the elastigroup; keys allowed are - name (String, required), timeout (Integer)
account_id: ${36:undefined} # not required. (String) Optional parameter that allows to set an account-id inside the module configuration By default this is retrieved from the credentials path
credentials_path: ${37:undefined} # not required. (String) Optional parameter that allows to set a non-default credentials path. Default is ~/.spotinst/credentials

ebs_volume_pool: ${38:undefined} # not required. (List of Objects) a list of hash/dictionaries of EBS devices to reattach to the elastigroup when available; '[{"key":"value", "key":"value"}]'; keys allowed are - volume_ids (List of Strings), device_name (String)
kubernetes: ${39:undefined} # not required. (Object) The Kubernetes integration configuration. Expects the following keys - api_server (String), token (String)
tenancy: ${40|default,dedicated|} # not required. choices: default;dedicated. (String) dedicated vs shared tenancy
utilize_reserved_instances: ${41:undefined} # not required. (Boolean) In case of any available Reserved Instances, Elastigroup will utilize your reservations before purchasing Spot instances.
wait_for_instances: ${42:undefined} # not required. (Boolean) Whether or not the elastigroup creation / update actions should wait for the instances to spin
lifetime_period: ${43:undefined} # not required. (String) lifetime period

chef: ${44:undefined} # not required. (Object) The Chef integration configuration.; Expects the following keys - chef_server (String), organization (String), user (String), pem_key (String), chef_version (String)

target_tracking_policies: ${45:undefined} # not required. (List of Objects) a list of hash/dictionaries of target tracking policies to configure in the elastigroup; '[{"key":"value", "key":"value"}]'; keys allowed are - policy_name (String, required), namespace (String, required), source (String, required), metric_name (String, required), statistic (String, required), unit (String, required), cooldown (String, required), target (String, required)
wait_timeout: ${46:undefined} # not required. (Integer) How long the module should wait for instances before failing the action.; Only works if wait_for_instances is True.
state: ${47|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. (String) create or delete the elastigroup
risk: ${48:undefined} # not required. (Integer) required if on demand is not set. The percentage of Spot instances to launch (0 - 100).
right_scale: ${49:undefined} # not required. (Object) The Rightscale integration configuration.; Expects the following keys - account_id (String), refresh_token (String)

uniqueness_by: ${50|id,name|} # not required. choices: id;name. (String) If your group names are not unique, you may use this feature to update or delete a specific group. Whenever this property is set, you must set a group_id in order to update or delete a group, otherwise a group will be created.

roll_config: ${51:undefined} # not required. (Object) Roll configuration.; If you would like the group to roll after updating, please use this feature. Accepts the following keys - batch_size_percentage(Integer, Required), grace_period - (Integer, Required), health_check_type(String, Optional)

id: ${52:undefined} # not required. (String) The group id if it already exists and you want to update, or delete it. This will not work unless the uniqueness_by field is set to id. When this is set, and the uniqueness_by field is set, the group will either be updated or deleted, but not created.
target_group_arns: ${53:undefined} # not required. (List of Strings) List of target group arns instances should be registered to
shutdown_script: ${54:undefined} # not required. (String) The Base64-encoded shutdown script that executes prior to instance termination. Encode before setting.
user_data: ${55:undefined} # not required. (String) Base64-encoded MIME user data. Encode before setting the value.
rancher: ${56:undefined} # not required. (Object) The Rancher integration configuration.; Expects the following keys - access_key (String), secret_key (String), master_host (String)
health_check_grace_period: ${57:300} # not required. (Integer) The amount of time, in seconds, after the instance has launched to start and check its health.
opsworks: ${58:undefined} # not required. (Object) The elastigroup OpsWorks integration configration.; Expects the following key - layer_id (String)
health_check_type: ${59|ELB,HCS,TARGET_GROUP,MLB,EC2|} # not required. choices: ELB;HCS;TARGET_GROUP;MLB;EC2. (String) The service to use for the health check.
draining_timeout: ${60:undefined} # not required. (Integer) Time for instance to be drained from incoming requests and deregistered from ELB before termination.

sqs_queue.description: Creates or deletes AWS SQS queues.
body: sqs_queue:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the queue.
maximum_message_size: ${2:null} # not required. The maximum message size in bytes.
delivery_delay: ${3:null} # not required. The delivery delay in seconds.
profile: ${4:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
validate_certs: ${5:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
receive_message_wait_time: ${6:null} # not required. The receive message wait time in seconds.
message_retention_period: ${7:null} # not required. The message retention period in seconds.

region: ${8:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_url: ${9:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
aws_secret_key: ${10:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
policy: ${11:null} # not required. The json dict policy to attach to queue
aws_access_key: ${12:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
default_visibility_timeout: ${13:null} # not required. The default visibility timeout in seconds.
redrive_policy: ${14:null} # not required. json dict with the redrive_policy (see example)
state: ${15|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Create or delete the queue
security_token: ${16:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

sros_command.description: Run commands on remote devices running Nokia SR OS
body: sros_command:

commands: ${1:undefined} # required. List of commands to send to the remote SR OS device over the configured provider. The resulting output from the command is returned. If the I(wait_for) argument is provided, the module is not returned until the condition is satisfied or the number of retries has expired.

match: ${2|any,all|} # not required. choices: any;all. The I(match) argument is used in conjunction with the I(wait_for) argument to specify the match policy.  Valid values are C(all) or C(any).  If the value is set to C(all) then all conditionals in the wait_for must be satisfied.  If the value is set to C(any) then only one of the values must be satisfied.

retries: ${3:10} # not required. Specifies the number of retries a command should by tried before it is considered failed. The command is run on the target device every retry and evaluated against the I(wait_for) conditions.

wait_for: ${4:null} # not required. List of conditions to evaluate against the output of the command. The task will wait for each condition to be true before moving forward. If the conditional is not true within the configured number of retries, the task fails. See examples.

interval: ${5:1} # not required. Configures the interval in seconds to wait between retries of the command. If the command does not pass the specified conditions, the interval indicates how long to wait before trying the command again.
provider: ${6:null} # not required. A dict object containing connection details.

sros_config.description: Manage Nokia SR OS device configuration
body: sros_config:

defaults: ${1|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. This argument specifies whether or not to collect all defaults when getting the remote device running config.  When enabled, the module will get the current config by issuing the command C(show running-config all).

force: ${2|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. The force argument instructs the module to not consider the current devices running-config.  When set to true, this will cause the module to push the contents of I(src) into the device without first checking if already configured.,Note this argument should be considered deprecated.  To achieve the equivalent, set the C(match=none) which is idempotent.  This argument will be removed in a future release.

save: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. The C(save) argument instructs the module to save the running- config to the startup-config at the conclusion of the module running.  If check mode is specified, this argument is ignored.

backup: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. This argument will cause the module to create a full backup of the current C(running-config) from the remote device before any changes are made.  The backup file is written to the C(backup) folder in the playbook root directory.  If the directory does not exist, it is created.
provider: ${5:null} # not required. A dict object containing connection details.

replace: ${6|line,block|} # not required. choices: line;block. Instructs the module on the way to perform the configuration on the device.  If the replace argument is set to I(line) then the modified lines are pushed to the device in configuration mode.  If the replace argument is set to I(block) then the entire command block is pushed to the device in configuration mode if any line is not correct.

src: ${7:null} # not required. Specifies the source path to the file that contains the configuration or configuration template to load.  The path to the source file can either be the full path on the Ansible control host or a relative path from the playbook or role root directory.  This argument is mutually exclusive with I(lines), I(parents).

match: ${8|line,strict,exact,none|} # not required. choices: line;strict;exact;none. Instructs the module on the way to perform the matching of the set of commands against the current device config.  If match is set to I(line), commands are matched line by line.  If match is set to I(strict), command lines are matched with respect to position.  If match is set to I(exact), command lines must be an equal match.  Finally, if match is set to I(none), the module will not attempt to compare the source configuration with the running configuration on the remote device.

after: ${9:null} # not required. The ordered set of commands to append to the end of the command stack if a change needs to be made.  Just like with I(before) this allows the playbook designer to append a set of commands to be executed after the command set.

config: ${10:null} # not required. The C(config) argument allows the playbook designer to supply the base configuration to be used to validate configuration changes necessary.  If this argument is provided, the module will not download the running-config from the remote node.

before: ${11:null} # not required. The ordered set of commands to push on to the command stack if a change needs to be made.  This allows the playbook designer the opportunity to perform configuration commands prior to pushing any changes without affecting how the set of commands are matched against the system.

lines: ${12:null} # not required. The ordered set of commands that should be configured in the section.  The commands must be the exact same commands as found in the device running-config.  Be sure to note the configuration command syntax as some commands are automatically modified by the device config parser.  The I(lines) argument only supports current context lines.  See EXAMPLES

parents: ${13:null} # not required. The ordered set of parents that uniquely identify the section or hierarchy the commands should be checked against.  If the parents argument is omitted, the commands are checked against the set of top level or global commands.
sros_rollback:

remote_max_checkpoints: ${1:null} # not required. The I(remote_max_checkpoints) argument configures the maximum number of rollback files that can be transferred and saved to a remote location.  Valid values for this argument are in the range of 1 to 50

local_max_checkpoints: ${2:null} # not required. The I(local_max_checkpoints) argument configures the maximum number of rollback files that can be saved on the devices local compact flash.  Valid values for this argument are in the range of 1 to 50

state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. The I(state) argument specifies the state of the configuration entries in the devices active configuration.  When the state value is set to C(true) the configuration is present in the devices active configuration.  When the state value is set to C(false) the configuration values are removed from the devices active configuration.
provider: ${4:null} # not required. A dict object containing connection details.

rollback_location: ${5:null} # not required. The I(rollback_location) specifies the location and filename of the rollback checkpoint files.   This argument supports any valid local or remote URL as specified in SR OS
rescue_location: ${6:null} # not required. The I(rescue_location) specifies the location of the rescue file.  This argument supports any valid local or remote URL as specified in SR OS

stackdriver.description: Send code deploy and annotation events to stackdriver
body: stackdriver:
key: ${1:null} # required. API key.
revision_id: ${2:null} # not required. The revision of the code that was deployed. Required for deploy events
event_epoch: ${3:null} # not required. Unix timestamp of where the event should appear in the timeline, defaults to now. Be careful with this.
deployed_by: ${4:Ansible} # not required. The person or robot responsible for deploying the code
annotated_by: ${5:Ansible} # not required. The person or robot who the annotation should be attributed to.
repository: ${6:null} # not required. The repository (or project) deployed
event: ${7|annotation,deploy|} # not required. choices: annotation;deploy. The type of event to send, either annotation or deploy
instance_id: ${8:null} # not required. id of an EC2 instance that this event should be attached to, which will limit the contexts where this event is shown
level: ${9|INFO,WARN,ERROR|} # not required. choices: INFO;WARN;ERROR. one of INFO/WARN/ERROR, defaults to INFO if not supplied.  May affect display.
msg: ${10:null} # not required. The contents of the annotation message, in plain text.  Limited to 256 characters. Required for annotation.
deployed_to: ${11:null} # not required. The environment code was deployed to. (ie: development, staging, production)

stacki_host.description: Add or remove host to stacki front-end
body: stacki_host:
stacki_user: ${1:undefined} # required. Username for authenticating with Stacki API, but if not specified, the environment variable C(stacki_user) is used instead.
stacki_password: ${2:undefined} # required. Password for authenticating with Stacki API, but if not specified, the environment variable C(stacki_password) is used instead.
stacki_endpoint: ${3:undefined} # required. URL for the Stacki API Endpoint.
name: ${4:undefined} # required. Name of the host to be added to Stacki.
prim_intf: ${5:undefined} # not required. Name of the primary network interface.
force_install: ${6:undefined} # not required. Set value to True to force node into install state if it already exists in stacki.
prim_intf_ip: ${7:undefined} # not required. IP Address for the primary network interface.
prim_intf_mac: ${8:undefined} # not required. MAC Address for the primary PXE boot network interface.

stat.description: Retrieve file or file system status
body: stat:
path: ${1:undefined} # required. The full path of the file/object to get the facts of.
get_checksum: ${2:yes} # not required. Whether to return a checksum of the file (default sha1).

checksum_algorithm: ${3|md5,sha1,sha224,sha256,sha384,sha512|} # not required. choices: md5;sha1;sha224;sha256;sha384;sha512. Algorithm to determine checksum of file. Will throw an error if the host is unable to use specified algorithm.,The remote host has to support the hashing method specified, C(md5) can be unavailable if the host is FIPS-140 compliant.

get_mime: ${4:yes} # not required. Use file magic and return data about the nature of the file. this uses the 'file' utility found on most Linux/Unix systems.,This will add both `mime_type` and 'charset' fields to the return, if possible.,In 2.3 this option changed from 'mime' to 'get_mime' and the default changed to 'Yes'.
get_attributes: ${5:yes} # not required. Get file attributes using lsattr tool if present.

get_md5: ${6:no} # not required. Whether to return the md5 sum of the file.,Will return None if not a regular file or if we're unable to use md5 (Common for FIPS-140 compliant systems).,The default of this option changed from C(yes) to C(no) in Ansible 2.5 and will be removed altogether in Ansible 2.9.,Use C(get_checksum=true) with C(checksum_algorithm=md5) to return an md5 hash under the C(checksum) return value.
follow: ${7:no} # not required. Whether to follow symlinks.

statusio_maintenance.description: Create maintenance windows for your status.io dashboard
body: statusio_maintenance:
api_id: ${1:undefined} # required. Your unique API ID from status.io
api_key: ${2:undefined} # required. Your unique API Key from status.io
statuspage: ${3:undefined} # required. Your unique StatusPage ID from status.io
containers: ${4:None} # not required. The given name of your container (data center)
title: ${5:A new maintenance window} # not required. A descriptive title for the maintenance window
maintenance_notify_24_hr: ${6:false} # not required. Notify subscribers 24 hours before maintenance start time
maintenance_notify_now: ${7:false} # not required. Notify subscribers now
components: ${8:None} # not required. The given name of your component (server name)
desc: ${9:Created by Ansible} # not required. Message describing the maintenance window
all_infrastructure_affected: ${10:false} # not required. If it affects all components and containers
maintenance_id: ${11:None} # not required. The maintenance id number when deleting a maintenance window
maintenance_notify_1_hr: ${12:false} # not required. Notify subscribers 1 hour before maintenance start time
minutes: ${13:10} # not required. The length of time in UTC that the maintenance will run             (starting from playbook runtime)
maintenance_notify_72_hr: ${14:false} # not required. Notify subscribers 72 hours before maintenance start time
automation: ${15:false} # not required. Automatically start and end the maintenance window
url: ${16:https://api.status.io} # not required. Status.io API URL. A private apiary can be used instead.
state: ${17|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Desired state of the package.
start_date: ${18:None} # not required. Date maintenance is expected to start (Month/Day/Year) (UTC),End Date is worked out from start_date + minutes
start_time: ${19:None} # not required. Time maintenance is expected to start (Hour:Minutes) (UTC),End Time is worked out from start_time + minutes

sts_assume_role.description: Assume a role using AWS Security Token Service and obtain temporary credentials
body: sts_assume_role:
role_session_name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the role's session - will be used by CloudTrail
role_arn: ${2:undefined} # required. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the role that the caller is assuming (http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/Using_Identifiers.html#Identifiers_ARNs)
validate_certs: ${3:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.
external_id: ${4:null} # not required. A unique identifier that is used by third parties to assume a role in their customers' accounts.
aws_secret_key: ${5:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
profile: ${6:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${7:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
mfa_token: ${8:null} # not required. The value provided by the MFA device, if the trust policy of the role being assumed requires MFA.

region: ${9:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)

ec2_url: ${10:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.

duration_seconds: ${11:null} # not required. The duration, in seconds, of the role session. The value can range from 900 seconds (15 minutes) to 3600 seconds (1 hour). By default, the value is set to 3600 seconds.
mfa_serial_number: ${12:null} # not required. The identification number of the MFA device that is associated with the user who is making the AssumeRole call.
policy: ${13:null} # not required. Supplemental policy to use in addition to assumed role's policies.
security_token: ${14:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

sts_session_token.description: Obtain a session token from the AWS Security Token Service
body: sts_session_token:
validate_certs: ${1:yes} # not required. When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

duration_seconds: ${2:null} # not required. The duration, in seconds, of the session token. See http://docs.aws.amazon.com/STS/latest/APIReference/API_GetSessionToken.html#API_GetSessionToken_RequestParameters for acceptable and default values.
aws_secret_key: ${3:null} # not required. AWS secret key. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY, AWS_SECRET_KEY, or EC2_SECRET_KEY environment variable is used.
mfa_serial_number: ${4:null} # not required. The identification number of the MFA device that is associated with the user who is making the GetSessionToken call.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Uses a boto profile. Only works with boto >= 2.24.0.
aws_access_key: ${6:null} # not required. AWS access key. If not set then the value of the AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_ACCESS_KEY or EC2_ACCESS_KEY environment variable is used.
security_token: ${7:null} # not required. AWS STS security token. If not set then the value of the AWS_SECURITY_TOKEN or EC2_SECURITY_TOKEN environment variable is used.

ec2_url: ${8:null} # not required. Url to use to connect to EC2 or your Eucalyptus cloud (by default the module will use EC2 endpoints). Ignored for modules where region is required. Must be specified for all other modules if region is not used. If not set then the value of the EC2_URL environment variable, if any, is used.
mfa_token: ${9:null} # not required. The value provided by the MFA device, if the trust policy of the user requires MFA.

region: ${10:undefined} # not required. The AWS region to use. If not specified then the value of the AWS_REGION or EC2_REGION environment variable, if any, is used. See U(http://docs.aws.amazon.com/general/latest/gr/rande.html#ec2_region)
subversion:
dest: ${1:undefined} # required. Absolute path where the repository should be deployed.
repo: ${2:undefined} # required. The subversion URL to the repository.
executable: ${3:undefined} # not required. Path to svn executable to use. If not supplied, the normal mechanism for resolving binary paths will be used.
force: ${4:no} # not required. If C(yes), modified files will be discarded. If C(no), module will fail if it encounters modified files. Prior to 1.9 the default was C(yes).
password: ${5:undefined} # not required. C(--password) parameter passed to svn.
update: ${6:yes} # not required. If C(no), do not retrieve new revisions from the origin repository.
checkout: ${7:yes} # not required. If C(no), do not check out the repository if it does not exist locally.
switch: ${8:yes} # not required. If C(no), do not call svn switch before update.
revision: ${9:HEAD} # not required. Specific revision to checkout.
username: ${10:undefined} # not required. C(--username) parameter passed to svn.
export: ${11:no} # not required. If C(yes), do export instead of checkout/update.

supervisorctl.description: Manage the state of a program or group of programs running via supervisord
body: supervisorctl:
state: ${1|present,started,stopped,restarted,absent|} # required. choices: present;started;stopped;restarted;absent. The desired state of program/group.

name: ${2:null} # required. The name of the supervisord program or group to manage.,The name will be taken as group name when it ends with a colon I(:),Group support is only available in Ansible version 1.6 or later.
config: ${3:null} # not required. The supervisor configuration file path
password: ${4:null} # not required. password to use for authentication
server_url: ${5:null} # not required. URL on which supervisord server is listening
supervisorctl_path: ${6:null} # not required. path to supervisorctl executable
username: ${7:null} # not required. username to use for authentication
svc:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the service to manage.
enabled: ${2:undefined} # not required. Wheater the service is enabled or not, if disabled it also implies stopped. Make note that a service can be enabled and downed (no auto restart).
service_dir: ${3:/service} # not required. directory svscan watches for services

state: ${4|killed,once,reloaded,restarted,started,stopped|} # not required. choices: killed;once;reloaded;restarted;started;stopped. C(Started)/C(stopped) are idempotent actions that will not run commands unless necessary.  C(restarted) will always bounce the svc (svc -t) and C(killed) will always bounce the svc (svc -k). C(reloaded) will send a sigusr1 (svc -1). C(once) will run a normally downed svc once (svc -o), not really an idempotent operation.
service_src: ${5:undefined} # not required. directory where services are defined, the source of symlinks to service_dir.
downed: ${6:no} # not required. Should a 'down' file exist or not, if it exists it disables auto startup. defaults to no. Downed does not imply stopped.
svr4pkg:

state: ${1|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Whether to install (C(present)), or remove (C(absent)) a package.,If the package is to be installed, then I(src) is required.,The SVR4 package system doesn't provide an upgrade operation. You need to uninstall the old, then install the new package.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Package name, e.g. C(SUNWcsr)

src: ${3:undefined} # not required. Specifies the location to install the package from. Required when C(state=present).,Can be any path acceptable to the C(pkgadd) command's C(-d) option. e.g.: C(somefile.pkg), C(/dir/with/pkgs), C(http:/server/mypkgs.pkg).,If using a file or directory, they must already be accessible by the host. See the M(copy) module for a way to get them there.

zone: ${4|current,all|} # not required. choices: current;all. Whether to install the package only in the current zone, or install it into all zones.,The installation into all zones works only if you are working with the global zone.
response_file: ${5:undefined} # not required. Specifies the location of a response file to be used if package expects input on install. (added in Ansible 1.4)
category: ${6|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Install/Remove category instead of a single package.
proxy: ${7:undefined} # not required. HTTP[s] proxy to be used if C(src) is a URL.

swdepot.description: Manage packages with swdepot package manager (HP-UX)
body: swdepot:
state: ${1|present,latest,absent|} # required. choices: present;latest;absent. whether to install (C(present), C(latest)), or remove (C(absent)) a package.
name: ${2||} # required. choices: . package name.
depot: ${3||} # not required. choices: . The source repository from which install or upgrade a package.

swupd.description: Manages updates and bundles in ClearLinux systems.
body: swupd:

manifest: ${1:null} # not required. The manifest contains information about the bundles at certaion version of the OS. Specify a Manifest version to verify against that version or leave unspecified to verify against the current version.
format: ${2:null} # not required. The format suffix for version file downloads. For example [1,2,3,staging,etc]. If not specified, the default format is used.
verify: ${3:null} # not required. Verify content for OS version.
contenturl: ${4:null} # not required. URL pointing to the contents of available bundles. If not specified, the contents are retrieved from clearlinux.org.
update: ${5:false} # not required. Updates the OS to the latest version.
url: ${6:null} # not required. Overrides both I(contenturl) and I(versionurl).

state: ${7|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicates the desired (I)bundle state. C(present) ensures the bundle is installed while C(absent) ensures the (I)bundle is not installed.
name: ${8:null} # not required. Name of the (I)bundle to install or remove.
versionurl: ${9:null} # not required. URL for version string download.

synchronize.description: A wrapper around rsync to make common tasks in your playbooks quick and easy.
body: synchronize:
dest: ${1:undefined} # required. Path on the destination host that will be synchronized from the source; The path can be absolute or relative.
src: ${2:undefined} # required. Path on the source host that will be synchronized to the destination; The path can be absolute or relative.
partial: ${3:no} # not required. Tells rsync to keep the partial file which should make a subsequent transfer of the rest of the file much faster.
rsync_timeout: ${4:0} # not required. Specify a --timeout for the rsync command in seconds.
private_key: ${5:undefined} # not required. Specify the private key to use for SSH-based rsync connections (e.g. C(~/.ssh/id_rsa))
dirs: ${6:no} # not required. Transfer directories without recursing
delete: ${7:no} # not required. Delete files in C(dest) that don't exist (after transfer, not before) in the C(src) path. This option requires C(recursive=yes).
owner: ${8:the value of the archive option} # not required. Preserve owner (super user only)
checksum: ${9:no} # not required. Skip based on checksum, rather than mod-time & size; Note that that "archive" option is still enabled by default - the "checksum" option will not disable it.
recursive: ${10:the value of the archive option} # not required. Recurse into directories.
rsync_opts: ${11:null} # not required. Specify additional rsync options by passing in an array.
use_ssh_args: ${12:no} # not required. Use the ssh_args specified in ansible.cfg
group: ${13:the value of the archive option} # not required. Preserve group
links: ${14:the value of the archive option} # not required. Copy symlinks as symlinks.
verify_host: ${15:no} # not required. Verify destination host key.

set_remote_user: ${16:true} # not required. put user@ for the remote paths. If you have a custom ssh config to define the remote user for a host that does not match the inventory user, you should set this parameter to "no".
times: ${17:the value of the archive option} # not required. Preserve modification times
archive: ${18:yes} # not required. Mirrors the rsync archive flag, enables recursive, links, perms, times, owner, group flags and -D.
compress: ${19:yes} # not required. Compress file data during the transfer. In most cases, leave this enabled unless it causes problems.

mode: ${20|pull,push|} # not required. choices: pull;push. Specify the direction of the synchronization. In push mode the localhost or delegate is the source; In pull mode the remote host in context is the source.
existing_only: ${21:no} # not required. Skip creating new files on receiver.

dest_port: ${22:Value of ansible_ssh_port for this host, remote_port config setting, or the value from ssh client configuration if none of those are set} # not required. Port number for ssh on the destination host. Prior to ansible 2.0, the ansible_ssh_port inventory var took precedence over this value.
copy_links: ${23:no} # not required. Copy symlinks as the item that they point to (the referent) is copied, rather than the symlink.
rsync_path: ${24:undefined} # not required. Specify the rsync command to run on the remote host. See C(--rsync-path) on the rsync man page.
link_dest: ${25:null} # not required. add a destination to hard link against during the rsync.
perms: ${26:the value of the archive option} # not required. Preserve permissions.
sysctl:
name: ${1:null} # required. The dot-separated path (aka I(key)) specifying the sysctl variable.
sysctl_file: ${2:/etc/sysctl.conf} # not required. Specifies the absolute path to C(sysctl.conf), if not C(/etc/sysctl.conf).
value: ${3:null} # not required. Desired value of the sysctl key.

reload: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If C(yes), performs a I(/sbin/sysctl -p) if the C(sysctl_file) is updated. If C(no), does not reload I(sysctl) even if the C(sysctl_file) is updated.
sysctl_set: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Verify token value with the sysctl command and set with -w if necessary
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the entry should be present or absent in the sysctl file.
ignoreerrors: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Use this option to ignore errors about unknown keys.
syslogger:
msg: ${1:undefined} # required. This is the message to place in syslog
log_pid: ${2:no} # not required. Log the pid in brackets

facility: ${3|kern,user,mail,daemon,auth,lpr,news,uucp,cron,syslog,local0,local1,local2,local3,local4,local5,local6,local7|} # not required. choices: kern;user;mail;daemon;auth;lpr;news;uucp;cron;syslog;local0;local1;local2;local3;local4;local5;local6;local7. Set the log facility
priority: ${4|emerg,alert,crit,err,warning,notice,info,debug|} # not required. choices: emerg;alert;crit;err;warning;notice;info;debug. Set the log priority
systemd:
enabled: ${1:undefined} # not required. Whether the service should start on boot. B(At least one of state and enabled are required.)
user: ${2:no} # not required. run systemctl talking to the service manager of the calling user, rather than the service manager of the system.
masked: ${3:undefined} # not required. Whether the unit should be masked or not, a masked unit is impossible to start.
no_block: ${4:no} # not required. Do not synchronously wait for the requested operation to finish. Enqueued job will continue without Ansible blocking on its completion.

state: ${5|reloaded,restarted,started,stopped|} # not required. choices: reloaded;restarted;started;stopped. C(started)/C(stopped) are idempotent actions that will not run commands unless necessary. C(restarted) will always bounce the service. C(reloaded) will always reload.
daemon_reload: ${6:no} # not required. run daemon-reload before doing any other operations, to make sure systemd has read any changes.
name: ${7:undefined} # not required. Name of the service. When using in a chroot environment you always need to specify the full name i.e. (crond.service).

taiga_issue.description: Creates/deletes an issue in a Taiga Project Management Platform
body: taiga_issue:
subject: ${1:undefined} # required. The issue subject.
project: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the project containing the issue. Must exist previously.
issue_type: ${3:undefined} # required. The issue type. Must exist previously.
description: ${4:} # not required. The issue description.
tags: ${5:} # not required. A lists of tags to be assigned to the issue.
severity: ${6:Normal} # not required. The issue severity. Must exist previously.
taiga_host: ${7:https://api.taiga.io} # not required. The hostname of the Taiga instance.
status: ${8:New} # not required. The issue status. Must exist previously.
attachment: ${9:None} # not required. Path to a file to be attached to the issue.
state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the issue should be present or not.
priority: ${11:Normal} # not required. The issue priority. Must exist previously.
attachment_description: ${12:} # not required. A string describing the file to be attached to the issue.

telegram.description: module for sending notifications via telegram
body: telegram:
msg: ${1:undefined} # required. What message you wish to send.
chat_id: ${2:undefined} # required. Telegram group or user chat_id
token: ${3:undefined} # required. Token identifying your telegram bot.

msg_format: ${4|plain,markdown,html|} # not required. choices: plain;markdown;html. Message format. Formatting options `markdown` and `html` described in Telegram API docs (https://core.telegram.org/bots/api#formatting-options). If option `plain` set, message will not be formatted.

telnet.description: Executes a low-down and dirty telnet command
body: telnet:
command: ${1:undefined} # required. List of commands to be executed in the telnet session.
host: ${2:remote_addr} # not required. The host/target on which to execute the command
password: ${3:undefined} # not required. The password for login
pause: ${4:1} # not required. Seconds to pause between each command issued
port: ${5:23} # not required. Remote port to use
user: ${6:remote_user} # not required. The user for login
login_prompt: ${7:login: } # not required. Login or username prompt to expect
timeout: ${8:120} # not required. timeout for remote operations
password_prompt: ${9:Password: } # not required. Login or username prompt to expect
prompts: ${10:$} # not required. List of prompts expected before sending next command
tempfile:
state: ${1|directory,file|} # not required. choices: directory;file. Whether to create file or directory.
prefix: ${2:ansible.} # not required. Prefix of file/directory name created by module.
path: ${3:undefined} # not required. Location where temporary file or directory should be created. If path is not specified default system temporary directory will be used.
suffix: ${4:} # not required. Suffix of file/directory name created by module.

template.description: Templates a file out to a remote server
body: template:
dest: ${1:undefined} # required. Location to render the template to on the remote machine.
src: ${2:undefined} # required. Path of a Jinja2 formatted template on the Ansible controller. This can be a relative or absolute path.
selevel: ${3:s0} # not required. Level part of the SELinux file context. This is the MLS/MCS attribute, sometimes known as the C(range). C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

force: ${4:yes} # not required. the default is C(yes), which will replace the remote file when contents are different than the source.  If C(no), the file will only be transferred if the destination does not exist.

unsafe_writes: ${5:false} # not required. Normally this module uses atomic operations to prevent data corruption or inconsistent reads from the target files, sometimes systems are configured or just broken in ways that prevent this. One example are docker mounted files, they cannot be updated atomically and can only be done in an unsafe manner.,This boolean option allows ansible to fall back to unsafe methods of updating files for those cases in which you do not have any other choice. Be aware that this is subject to race conditions and can lead to data corruption.
block_start_string: ${6:{%} # not required. The string marking the beginning of a block.
variable_end_string: ${7:}}} # not required. The string marking the end of a print statement.
serole: ${8:null} # not required. Role part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
trim_blocks: ${9:no} # not required. If this is set to True the first newline after a block is removed (block, not variable tag!).

newline_sequence: ${10|
,,
|} # not required. choices: 
;;
. Specify the newline sequence to use for templating files.
setype: ${11:null} # not required. Type part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
backup: ${12:no} # not required. Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.

mode: ${13:null} # not required. Mode the file or directory should be. For those used to I(/usr/bin/chmod) remember that modes are actually octal numbers (like C(0644) or C(01777)). Leaving off the leading zero will likely have unexpected results. As of version 1.8, the mode may be specified as a symbolic mode (for example, C(u+rwx) or C(u=rw,g=r,o=r)).
owner: ${14:null} # not required. Name of the user that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).

attributes: ${15:None} # not required. Attributes the file or directory should have. To get supported flags look at the man page for I(chattr) on the target system. This string should contain the attributes in the same order as the one displayed by I(lsattr).
seuser: ${16:null} # not required. User part of SELinux file context. Will default to system policy, if applicable. If set to C(_default), it will use the C(user) portion of the policy if available.

validate: ${17:None} # not required. The validation command to run before copying into place. The path to the file to validate is passed in via '%s' which must be present as in the example below. The command is passed securely so shell features like expansion and pipes won't work.
block_end_string: ${18:%}} # not required. The string marking the end of a block.
variable_start_string: ${19:{{} # not required. The string marking the beginning of a print statement.
