append: ${24:no} # not required. If C(yes), will only add groups, not set them to just the list in I(groups).
generate_ssh_key: ${25:no} # not required. Whether to generate a SSH key for the user in question. This will B(not) overwrite an existing SSH key.
update_password: ${26|always,on_create|} # not required. choices: always;on_create. C(always) will update passwords if they differ.  C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users.

shell: ${27:undefined} # not required. Optionally set the user's shell.,On Mac OS X, before version 2.5, the default shell for non-system users was /usr/bin/false. Since 2.5, the default shell for non-system users on Mac OS X is /bin/bash.
comment: ${28:undefined} # not required. Optionally sets the description (aka I(GECOS)) of user account.

vca_fw.description: add remove firewall rules in a gateway  in a vca
body: vca_fw:
fw_rules: ${1:false} # required. A list of firewall rules to be added to the gateway, Please see examples on valid entries
host: ${2:None} # not required. The authentication host to be used when service type is vcd.
password: ${3:None} # not required. The vca password, if not set the environment variable C(VCA_PASS) is checked for the password.
vdc_name: ${4:None} # not required. The name of the vdc where the gateway is located.
api_version: ${5:5.7} # not required. The api version to be used with the vca.
verify_certs: ${6:true} # not required. If the certificates of the authentication is to be verified.
gateway_name: ${7:gateway} # not required. The name of the gateway of the vdc where the rule should be added.
instance_id: ${8:None} # not required. The instance id in a vchs environment to be used for creating the vapp.
service_type: ${9|vca,vchs,vcd|} # not required. choices: vca;vchs;vcd. The type of service we are authenticating against.
org: ${10:None} # not required. The org to login to for creating vapp. This option is required when the C(service_type) is I(vdc).
state: ${11|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. If the object should be added or removed.
username: ${12:None} # not required. The vca username or email address, if not set the environment variable C(VCA_USER) is checked for the username.

vca_nat.description: add remove nat rules in a gateway  in a vca
body: vca_nat:
nat_rules: ${1:false} # required. A list of rules to be added to the gateway, Please see examples on valid entries
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. If the object should be added or removed.
host: ${3:None} # not required. The authentication host to be used when service type is vcd.
password: ${4:None} # not required. The vca password, if not set the environment variable C(VCA_PASS) is checked for the password.
vdc_name: ${5:None} # not required. The name of the vdc where the gateway is located.
api_version: ${6:5.7} # not required. The api version to be used with the vca.
verify_certs: ${7:true} # not required. If the certificates of the authentication is to be verified.
purge_rules: ${8:false} # not required. If set to true, it will delete all rules in the gateway that are not given as parameter to this module.
gateway_name: ${9:gateway} # not required. The name of the gateway of the vdc where the rule should be added.
instance_id: ${10:None} # not required. The instance id in a vchs environment to be used for creating the vapp.
service_type: ${11|vca,vchs,vcd|} # not required. choices: vca;vchs;vcd. The type of service we are authenticating against.
org: ${12:None} # not required. The org to login to for creating vapp. This option is required when the C(service_type) is I(vdc).
username: ${13:None} # not required. The vca username or email address, if not set the environment variable C(VCA_USER) is checked for the username.
vca_vapp:
vapp_name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the vCloud Air vApp instance
operation: ${2|noop,poweron,poweroff,suspend,shutdown,reboot,reset|} # not required. choices: noop;poweron;poweroff;suspend;shutdown;reboot;reset. Specifies an operation to be performed on the vApp.
verify_certs: ${3:true} # not required. If the certificates of the authentication is to be verified.

network_name: ${4:None} # not required. The name of the network that should be attached to the virtual machine in the vApp.  The virtual network specified must already be created in the vCloud Air VDC.  If the I(state) is not 'absent' then the I(network_name) argument must be provided.
org: ${5:None} # not required. The org to login to for creating vapp, mostly set when the service_type is vdc.
host: ${6:None} # not required. The authentication host to be used when service type  is vcd.

vm_cpus: ${7:None} # not required. The number of vCPUs to configure for the VM in the vApp.   If the I(vm_name) argument is provided, then this becomes a per VM setting otherwise it is applied to all VMs in the vApp.
password: ${8:None} # not required. The vCloud Air password to use during authentication
vdc_name: ${9:None} # not required. The name of the virtual data center (VDC) where the vm should be created or contains the vAPP.
api_version: ${10:5.7} # not required. The api version to be used with the vca

vm_memory: ${11:None} # not required. The amount of memory in MB to allocate to VMs in the vApp.  If the I(vm_name) argument is provided, then this becomes a per VM setting otherise it is applied to all VMs in the vApp.

template_name: ${12:None} # not required. The name of the vApp template to use to create the vApp instance.  If the I(state) is not `absent` then the I(template_name) value must be provided.  The I(template_name) must be previously uploaded to the catalog specified by I(catalog_name)
gateway_name: ${13:gateway} # not required. The name of the gateway of the vdc where the rule should be added.
vm_name: ${14:None} # not required. The name of the virtual machine instance in the vApp to manage.
instance_id: ${15:None} # not required. The instance id in a vchs environment to be used for creating the vapp
service_type: ${16|vca,vchs,vcd|} # not required. choices: vca;vchs;vcd. The type of service we are authenticating against
network_mode: ${17|pool,dhcp,static|} # not required. choices: pool;dhcp;static. Configures the mode of the network connection.
state: ${18|present,absent,deployed,undeployed|} # not required. choices: present;absent;deployed;undeployed. Configures the state of the vApp.
username: ${19:None} # not required. The vCloud Air username to use during authentication
vcenter_folder:
folder_name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of folder to be managed.,This is case sensitive parameter.,Folder name should be under 80 characters. This is a VMware restriction.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${3:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
datacenter: ${4:undefined} # required. Name of the datacenter.
hostname: ${5:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${6:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.

folder_type: ${7|datastore,host,network,vm|} # not required. choices: datastore;host;network;vm. This is type of folder.,If set to C(vm), then 'VM and Template Folder' is created under datacenter.,If set to C(host), then 'Host and Cluster Folder' is created under datacenter.,If set to C(datastore), then 'Storage Folder' is created under datacenter.,If set to C(network), then 'Network Folder' is created under datacenter.,This parameter is required, if C(state) is set to C(present) and parent_folder is absent.,This option is ignored, if C(parent_folder) is set.

parent_folder: ${8:undefined} # not required. Name of the parent folder under which new folder needs to be created.,This is case sensitive parameter.,Please specify unique folder name as there is no way to detect duplicate names.,If user wants to create a folder under '/DC0/vm/vm_folder', this value will be 'vm_folder'.
port: ${9:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of folder.,If set to C(present) without parent folder parameter, then folder with C(folder_type) is created.,If set to C(present) with parent folder parameter,  then folder in created under parent folder. C(folder_type) is ignored.,If set to C(absent), then folder is unregistered and destroyed.
vcenter_license:
license: ${1:undefined} # required. The license key to manage in vSphere vCenter.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${3:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${4:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${5:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
labels: ${6:[object Object]} # not required. The optional labels of the license key to manage in vSphere vCenter.,This is dictionary with key/value pair.
port: ${7:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
state: ${8|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Whether to add (C(present)) or remove (C(absent)) the license key.

vdirect_commit.description: Commits pending configuration changes on Radware devices
body: vdirect_commit:
vdirect_password: ${1:None} # required. vDirect server password, may be set as C(VDIRECT_PASSWORD) environment variable.
vdirect_ip: ${2:undefined} # required. Primary vDirect server IP address, may be set as C(VDIRECT_IP) environment variable.
vdirect_user: ${3:None} # required. vDirect server username, may be set as C(VDIRECT_USER) environment variable.
devices: ${4:undefined} # required. List of Radware Alteon device names for commit operations.
sync: ${5:yes} # not required. If C(no), sync action will not be performed. Relevant for ADC devices only.
save: ${6:yes} # not required. If C(no), save action will not be performed. Relevant for ADC devices only.

vdirect_validate_certs: ${7:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated,,may be set as C(VDIRECT_VALIDATE_CERTS) or C(VDIRECT_VERIFY) environment variable.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
vdirect_secondary_ip: ${8:None} # not required. Secondary vDirect server IP address, may be set as C(VDIRECT_SECONDARY_IP) environment variable.
vdirect_timeout: ${9:60} # not required. Amount of time to wait for async operation completion [seconds],,may be set as C(VDIRECT_TIMEOUT) environment variable.

vdirect_use_ssl: ${10:yes} # not required. If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection,,may be set as C(VDIRECT_HTTPS) or C(VDIRECT_USE_SSL) environment variable.
vdirect_http_port: ${11:2188} # not required. vDirect server HTTP port number, may be set as C(VDIRECT_HTTP_PORT) environment variable.
vdirect_https_port: ${12:2189} # not required. vDirect server HTTPS port number, may be set as C(VDIRECT_HTTPS_PORT) environment variable.
vdirect_wait: ${13:yes} # not required. Wait for async operation to complete, may be set as C(VDIRECT_WAIT) environment variable.
apply: ${14:yes} # not required. If C(no), apply action will not be performed. Relevant for ADC devices only.

vdirect_file.description: Uploads a new or updates an existing runnable file into Radware vDirect server
body: vdirect_file:
vdirect_password: ${1:None} # required. vDirect server password, may be set as VDIRECT_PASSWORD environment variable.
vdirect_ip: ${2:undefined} # required. Primary vDirect server IP address, may be set as VDIRECT_IP environment variable.
file_name: ${3:undefined} # required. vDirect runnable file name to be uploaded.,May be velocity configuration template (.vm) or workflow template zip file (.zip).
vdirect_user: ${4:None} # required. vDirect server username, may be set as VDIRECT_USER environment variable.

vdirect_validate_certs: ${5:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated,,may be set as VDIRECT_VALIDATE_CERTS or VDIRECT_VERIFY environment variable.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
vdirect_secondary_ip: ${6:None} # not required. Secondary vDirect server IP address, may be set as VDIRECT_SECONDARY_IP environment variable.
vdirect_timeout: ${7:60} # not required. Amount of time to wait for async operation completion [seconds],,may be set as VDIRECT_TIMEOUT environment variable.
vdirect_use_ssl: ${8:yes} # not required. If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection,,may be set as VDIRECT_HTTPS or VDIRECT_USE_SSL environment variable.
vdirect_http_port: ${9:2188} # not required. vDirect server HTTP port number, may be set as VDIRECT_HTTP_PORT environment variable.
vdirect_https_port: ${10:2189} # not required. vDirect server HTTPS port number, may be set as VDIRECT_HTTPS_PORT environment variable.
vdirect_wait: ${11:yes} # not required. Wait for async operation to complete, may be set as VDIRECT_WAIT environment variable.

vdirect_runnable.description: Runs templates and workflow actions in Radware vDirect server
body: vdirect_runnable:
runnable_type: ${1:undefined} # required. vDirect runnable type.,May be ConfigurationTemplate, WorkflowTemplate or a Workflow.
vdirect_password: ${2:None} # required. vDirect server password, may be set as C(VDIRECT_PASSWORD) environment variable.
vdirect_ip: ${3:undefined} # required. Primary vDirect server IP address, may be set as C(VDIRECT_IP) environment variable.
runnable_name: ${4:undefined} # required. vDirect runnable name to run.,May be configuration template name, workflow template name or workflow instance name.
vdirect_user: ${5:None} # required. vDirect server username, may be set as C(VDIRECT_USER) environment variable.
action_name: ${6:undefined} # not required. Workflow action name to run.,Required if I(runnable_type=Workflow).
parameters: ${7:undefined} # not required. Action parameters dictionary. In case of ConfigurationTemplate runnable type,,the device connection details should always be passed as a parameter.

vdirect_validate_certs: ${8:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated,,may be set as C(VDIRECT_VALIDATE_CERTS) or C(VDIRECT_VERIFY) environment variable.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
vdirect_secondary_ip: ${9:None} # not required. Secondary vDirect server IP address, may be set as C(VDIRECT_SECONDARY_IP) environment variable.
vdirect_timeout: ${10:60} # not required. Amount of time to wait for async operation completion [seconds],,may be set as C(VDIRECT_TIMEOUT) environment variable.

vdirect_use_ssl: ${11:yes} # not required. If C(no), an HTTP connection will be used instead of the default HTTPS connection,,may be set as C(VDIRECT_HTTPS) or C(VDIRECT_USE_SSL) environment variable.
vdirect_http_port: ${12:2188} # not required. vDirect server HTTP port number, may be set as C(VDIRECT_HTTP_PORT) environment variable.
vdirect_https_port: ${13:2189} # not required. vDirect server HTTPS port number, may be set as C(VDIRECT_HTTPS_PORT) environment variable.
vdirect_wait: ${14:yes} # not required. Wait for async operation to complete, may be set as C(VDIRECT_WAIT) environment variable.
vdo:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the VDO volume.

state: ${2|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Whether this VDO volume should be "present" or "absent". If a "present" VDO volume does not exist, it will be created.  If a "present" VDO volume already exists, it will be modified, by updating the configuration, which will take effect when the VDO volume is restarted. Not all parameters of an existing VDO volume can be modified; the "statusparamkeys" list contains the parameters that can be modified after creation. If an "absent" VDO volume does not exist, it will not be removed.

deduplication: ${3|enabled,disabled|} # not required. choices: enabled;disabled. Configures whether deduplication is enabled.  The default for a created volume is 'enabled'.  Existing volumes will maintain their previously configured setting unless a different value is specified in the playbook.

indexmem: ${4:undefined} # not required. Specifies the amount of index memory in gigabytes.  The default is 0.25.  The special decimal values 0.25, 0.5, and 0.75 can be used, as can any positive integer. This option is only available when creating a new volume, and cannot be changed for an existing volume.

logicalthreads: ${5:undefined} # not required. Specifies the number of threads across which to subdivide parts of the VDO processing based on logical block addresses.  Valid values are integer values from 1 to 100 (lower numbers are preferable due to overhead). The default is 1.  Existing volumes will maintain their previously configured setting unless a different value is specified in the playbook.

physicalthreads: ${6:undefined} # not required. Specifies the number of threads across which to subdivide parts of the VDO processing based on physical block addresses.  Valid values are integer values from 1 to 16 (lower numbers are preferable due to overhead). The physical space used by the VDO volume must be larger than (slabsize * physicalthreads).  The default is 1.  Existing volumes will maintain their previously configured setting unless a different value is specified in the playbook.
device: ${7:undefined} # not required. The full path of the device to use for VDO storage. This is required if "state" is "present".

readcachesize: ${8:undefined} # not required. Specifies the extra VDO device read cache size in megabytes.  This is in addition to a system-defined minimum.  Using a value with a suffix of K, M, G, or T is optional.  The default value is 0.  1.125 MB of memory per bio thread will be used per 1 MB of read cache specified (for example, a VDO volume configured with 4 bio threads will have a read cache memory usage overhead of 4.5 MB per 1 MB of read cache specified). Existing volumes will maintain their previously configured setting unless a different value is specified in the playbook.

writepolicy: ${9|auto,sync,async|} # not required. choices: auto;sync;async. Specifies the write policy of the VDO volume.  The 'sync' mode acknowledges writes only after data is on stable storage.  The 'async' mode acknowledges writes when data has been cached for writing to stable storage.  The default (and highly recommended) 'auto' mode checks the storage device to determine whether it supports flushes.  Devices that support flushes will result in a VDO volume in 'async' mode, while devices that do not support flushes will run in sync mode. Existing volumes will maintain their previously configured setting unless a different value is specified in the playbook.

readcache: ${10|enabled,disabled|} # not required. choices: enabled;disabled. Enables or disables the read cache.  The default is 'disabled'.  Choosing 'enabled' enables a read cache which may improve performance for workloads of high deduplication, read workloads with a high level of compression, or on hard disk storage.  Existing volumes will maintain their previously configured setting unless a different value is specified in the playbook.

indexmode: ${11:undefined} # not required. Specifies the index mode of the Albireo index.  The default is 'dense', which has a deduplication window of 1 GB of index memory per 1 TB of incoming data, requiring 10 GB of index data on persistent storage. The 'sparse' mode has a deduplication window of 1 GB of index memory per 10 TB of incoming data, but requires 100 GB of index data on persistent storage.  This option is only available when creating a new volume, and cannot be changed for an existing volume.

blockmapcachesize: ${12:undefined} # not required. The amount of memory allocated for caching block map pages, in megabytes (or may be issued with an LVM-style suffix of K, M, G, or T).  The default (and minimum) value is 128M.  The value specifies the size of the cache; there is a 15% memory usage overhead. Each 1.25G of block map covers 1T of logical blocks, therefore a small amount of block map cache memory can cache a significantly large amount of block map data.  Existing volumes will maintain their previously configured setting unless a different value is specified in the playbook.

cputhreads: ${13:undefined} # not required. Specifies the number of threads to use for CPU-intensive work such as hashing or compression.  Valid values are integer values from 1 to 100 (lower numbers are preferable due to overhead).  The default is 2. Existing volumes will maintain their previously configured setting unless a different value is specified in the playbook.

activated: ${14|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. The "activate" status for a VDO volume.  If this is set to "no", the VDO volume cannot be started, and it will not start on system startup.  However, on initial creation, a VDO volume with "activated" set to "off" will be running, until stopped.  This is the default behavior of the "vdo create" command; it provides the user an opportunity to write a base amount of metadata (filesystem, LVM headers, etc.) to the VDO volume prior to stopping the volume, and leaving it deactivated until ready to use.

emulate512: ${15:undefined} # not required. Enables 512-byte emulation mode, allowing drivers or filesystems to access the VDO volume at 512-byte granularity, instead of the default 4096-byte granularity. Default is 'disabled'; only recommended when a driver or filesystem requires 512-byte sector level access to a device.  This option is only available when creating a new volume, and cannot be changed for an existing volume.

ackthreads: ${16:undefined} # not required. Specifies the number of threads to use for acknowledging completion of requested VDO I/O operations. Valid values are integer values from 1 to 100 (lower numbers are preferable due to overhead).  The default is 1.  Existing volumes will maintain their previously configured setting unless a different value is specified in the playbook.

logicalsize: ${17:undefined} # not required. The logical size of the VDO volume (in megabytes, or LVM suffix format).  If not specified for a new volume, this defaults to the same size as the underlying storage device, which is specified in the 'device' parameter. Existing volumes will maintain their size if the logicalsize parameter is not specified, or is smaller than or identical to the current size.  If the specified size is larger than the current size, a growlogical operation will be performed.

growphysical: ${18:false} # not required. Specifies whether to attempt to execute a growphysical operation, if there is enough unused space on the device.  A growphysical operation will be executed if there is at least 64 GB of free space, relative to the previous physical size of the affected VDO volume.

biothreads: ${19:undefined} # not required. Specifies the number of threads to use for submitting I/O operations to the storage device.  Valid values are integer values from 1 to 100 (lower numbers are preferable due to overhead).  The default is 4. Existing volumes will maintain their previously configured setting unless a different value is specified in the playbook.

compression: ${20|enabled,disabled|} # not required. choices: enabled;disabled. Configures whether compression is enabled.  The default for a created volume is 'enabled'.  Existing volumes will maintain their previously configured setting unless a different value is specified in the playbook.
running: ${21|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether this VDO volume is running.  A VDO volume must be activated in order to be started.

slabsize: ${22:undefined} # not required. The size of the increment by which the physical size of a VDO volume is grown, in megabytes (or may be issued with an LVM-style suffix of K, M, G, or T).  Must be a power of two between 128M and 32G.  The default is 2G, which supports volumes having a physical size up to 16T. The maximum, 32G, supports a physical size of up to 256T. This option is only available when creating a new volume, and cannot be changed for an existing volume.
vertica_configuration:
value: ${1:undefined} # required. Value of the parameter to be set.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the parameter to update.
cluster: ${3:localhost} # not required. Name of the Vertica cluster.
db: ${4:null} # not required. Name of the Vertica database.
login_user: ${5:dbadmin} # not required. The username used to authenticate with.
login_password: ${6:null} # not required. The password used to authenticate with.
port: ${7:5433} # not required. Vertica cluster port to connect to.
vertica_facts:
cluster: ${1:localhost} # not required. Name of the cluster running the schema.
login_password: ${2:null} # not required. The password used to authenticate with.
port: ${3:5433} # not required. Database port to connect to.
db: ${4:null} # not required. Name of the database running the schema.
login_user: ${5:dbadmin} # not required. The username used to authenticate with.

vertica_role.description: Adds or removes Vertica database roles and assigns roles to them.
body: vertica_role:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the role to add or remove.
cluster: ${2:localhost} # not required. Name of the Vertica cluster.
assigned_roles: ${3:null} # not required. Comma separated list of roles to assign to the role.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether to create C(present), drop C(absent) or lock C(locked) a role.
port: ${5:5433} # not required. Vertica cluster port to connect to.
db: ${6:null} # not required. Name of the Vertica database.
login_user: ${7:dbadmin} # not required. The username used to authenticate with.
login_password: ${8:null} # not required. The password used to authenticate with.

vertica_schema.description: Adds or removes Vertica database schema and roles.
body: vertica_schema:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the schema to add or remove.
cluster: ${2:localhost} # not required. Name of the Vertica cluster.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether to create C(present), or drop C(absent) a schema.
usage_roles: ${4:null} # not required. Comma separated list of roles to create and grant usage access to the schema.
create_roles: ${5:null} # not required. Comma separated list of roles to create and grant usage and create access to the schema.
port: ${6:5433} # not required. Vertica cluster port to connect to.
owner: ${7:null} # not required. Name of the user to set as owner of the schema.
db: ${8:null} # not required. Name of the Vertica database.
login_user: ${9:dbadmin} # not required. The username used to authenticate with.
login_password: ${10:null} # not required. The password used to authenticate with.

vertica_user.description: Adds or removes Vertica database users and assigns roles.
body: vertica_user:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the user to add or remove.
cluster: ${2:localhost} # not required. Name of the Vertica cluster.
state: ${3|present,absent,locked|} # not required. choices: present;absent;locked. Whether to create C(present), drop C(absent) or lock C(locked) a user.
roles: ${4:null} # not required. Comma separated list of roles to assign to the user.
profile: ${5:null} # not required. Sets the user's profile.

password: ${6:null} # not required. The user's password encrypted by the MD5 algorithm.,The password must be generated with the format C("md5" + md5[password + username]), resulting in a total of 35 characters. An easy way to do this is by querying the Vertica database with select 'md5'||md5('<user_password><user_name>').
expired: ${7:null} # not required. Sets the user's password expiration.
port: ${8:5433} # not required. Vertica cluster port to connect to.
resource_pool: ${9:null} # not required. Sets the user's resource pool.
ldap: ${10:null} # not required. Set to true if users are authenticated via LDAP.,The user will be created with password expired and set to I($ldap$).
db: ${11:null} # not required. Name of the Vertica database.
login_user: ${12:dbadmin} # not required. The username used to authenticate with.
login_password: ${13:null} # not required. The password used to authenticate with.

virt.description: Manages virtual machines supported by libvirt
body: virt:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. name of the guest VM being managed. Note that VM must be previously defined with xml.

command: ${2|create,define,destroy,freemem,get_xml,info,list_vms,nodeinfo,pause,shutdown,start,status,stop,undefine,unpause,virttype|} # not required. choices: create;define;destroy;freemem;get_xml;info;list_vms;nodeinfo;pause;shutdown;start;status;stop;undefine;unpause;virttype. In addition to state management, various non-idempotent commands are available.
autostart: ${3:undefined} # not required. start VM at host startup.
xml: ${4:undefined} # not required. XML document used with the define command.
uri: ${5:qemu:///system} # not required. libvirt connection uri.

state: ${6|destroyed,paused,running,shutdown|} # not required. choices: destroyed;paused;running;shutdown. Note that there may be some lag for state requests like C(shutdown) since these refer only to VM states. After starting a guest, it may not be immediately accessible.
virt_net:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. name of the network being managed. Note that network must be previously defined with xml.

command: ${2|define,create,start,stop,destroy,undefine,get_xml,list_nets,facts,info,status,modify|} # not required. choices: define;create;start;stop;destroy;undefine;get_xml;list_nets;facts;info;status;modify. in addition to state management, various non-idempotent commands are available. See examples. Modify was added in version 2.1
autostart: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Specify if a given storage pool should be started automatically on system boot.
xml: ${4:undefined} # not required. XML document used with the define command.
uri: ${5:qemu:///system} # not required. libvirt connection uri.

state: ${6|active,inactive,present,absent|} # not required. choices: active;inactive;present;absent. specify which state you want a network to be in. If 'active', network will be started. If 'present', ensure that network is present but do not change its state; if it's missing, you need to specify xml argument. If 'inactive', network will be stopped. If 'undefined' or 'absent', network will be removed from I(libvirt) configuration.
virt_pool:

command: ${1|define,build,create,start,stop,destroy,delete,undefine,get_xml,list_pools,facts,info,status|} # not required. choices: define;build;create;start;stop;destroy;delete;undefine;get_xml;list_pools;facts;info;status. in addition to state management, various non-idempotent commands are available. See examples.

mode: ${2|new,repair,resize,no_overwrite,overwrite,normal,zeroed|} # not required. choices: new;repair;resize;no_overwrite;overwrite;normal;zeroed. Pass additional parameters to 'build' or 'delete' commands.
autostart: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Specify if a given storage pool should be started automatically on system boot.
xml: ${4:undefined} # not required. XML document used with the define command.
uri: ${5:qemu:///system} # not required. I(libvirt) connection uri.

state: ${6|active,inactive,present,absent,undefined,deleted|} # not required. choices: active;inactive;present;absent;undefined;deleted. specify which state you want a storage pool to be in. If 'active', pool will be started. If 'present', ensure that pool is present but do not change its state; if it's missing, you need to specify xml argument. If 'inactive', pool will be stopped. If 'undefined' or 'absent', pool will be removed from I(libvirt) configuration. If 'deleted', pool contents will be deleted and then pool undefined.
name: ${7:undefined} # not required. name of the storage pool being managed. Note that pool must be previously defined with xml.

vmadm.description: Manage SmartOS virtual machines and zones.
body: vmadm:
brand: ${1|joyent,joyent-minimal,kvm,lx|} # required. choices: joyent;joyent-minimal;kvm;lx. Type of virtual machine.

state: ${2|present,absent,stopped,restarted|} # required. choices: present;absent;stopped;restarted. States for the VM to be in. Please note that C(present), C(stopped) and C(restarted) operate on a VM that is currently provisioned. C(present) means that the VM will be created if it was absent, and that it will be in a running state. C(absent) will shutdown the zone before removing it. C(stopped) means the zone will be created if it doesn't exist already, before shutting it down.
filesystems: ${3:undefined} # not required. Mount additional filesystems into an OS VM.
archive_on_delete: ${4:undefined} # not required. When enabled, the zone dataset will be mounted on C(/zones/archive) upon removal.
spice_password: ${5:undefined} # not required. Password required to connect to SPICE. By default no password is set. Please note this can be read from the Global Zone.
nics: ${6:undefined} # not required. A list of nics to add, valid properties are documented in vmadm(1M).
docker: ${7:undefined} # not required. Docker images need this flag enabled along with the I(brand) set to C(lx).
dns_domain: ${8:undefined} # not required. Domain value for C(/etc/hosts).
qemu_opts: ${9:undefined} # not required. Additional qemu arguments for KVM guests. This overwrites the default arguments provided by vmadm(1M) and should only be used for debugging.
cpu_cap: ${10:undefined} # not required. Sets a limit on the amount of CPU time that can be used by a VM. Use C(0) for no cap.
internal_metadata: ${11:undefined} # not required. Metadata to be set and associated with this VM, this contains operator generated keys.
zfs_snapshot_limit: ${12:undefined} # not required. Number of snapshots the VM can have.
kernel_version: ${13:undefined} # not required. Kernel version to emulate for LX VMs.
zpool: ${14:undefined} # not required. ZFS pool the VM's zone dataset will be created in.
indestructible_zoneroot: ${15:undefined} # not required. Adds an C(@indestructible) snapshot to zoneroot.
name: ${16:undefined} # not required. Name of the VM. vmadm(1M) uses this as an optional name.
ram: ${17:undefined} # not required. Amount of virtual RAM for a KVM guest (in MiBs).
customer_metadata: ${18:undefined} # not required. Metadata to be set and associated with this VM, this contain customer modifiable keys.
virtio_txtimer: ${19:undefined} # not required. Timeout (in nanoseconds) for the TX timer of virtio NICs.
limit_priv: ${20:undefined} # not required. Set (comma separated) list of privileges the zone is allowed to use.
mdata_exec_timeout: ${21:undefined} # not required. Timeout in seconds (or 0 to disable) for the C(svc:/smartdc/mdata:execute) service that runs user-scripts in the zone.
image_uuid: ${22:undefined} # not required. Image UUID.
indestructible_delegated: ${23:undefined} # not required. Adds an C(@indestructible) snapshot to delegated datasets.
qemu_extra_opts: ${24:undefined} # not required. Additional qemu cmdline arguments for KVM guests.
vnc_password: ${25:undefined} # not required. Password required to connect to VNC. By default no password is set. Please note this can be read from the Global Zone.
routes: ${26:undefined} # not required. Dictionary that maps destinations to gateways, these will be set as static routes in the VM.
zfs_data_compression: ${27:undefined} # not required. Specifies compression algorithm used for this VMs data dataset. This option only has effect on delegated datasets.
hostname: ${28:undefined} # not required. Zone/VM hostname.
max_locked_memory: ${29:undefined} # not required. Total amount of memory (in MiBs) on the host that can be locked by this VM.
zfs_root_compression: ${30:undefined} # not required. Specifies compression algorithm used for this VMs root dataset. This option only has effect on the zoneroot dataset.
zfs_io_priority: ${31:undefined} # not required. IO throttle priority value relative to other VMs.
autoboot: ${32:undefined} # not required. Whether or not a VM is booted when the system is rebooted.
zfs_data_recsize: ${33:undefined} # not required. Suggested block size (power of 2) for files in the delegated dataset's filesystem.
quota: ${34:undefined} # not required. Quota on zone filesystems (in MiBs).
zfs_filesystem_limit: ${35:undefined} # not required. Maximum number of filesystems the VM can have.
cpu_type: ${36|qemu64,host|} # not required. choices: qemu64;host. Control the type of virtual CPU exposed to KVM VMs.
cpu_shares: ${37:undefined} # not required. Sets a limit on the number of fair share scheduler (FSS) CPU shares for a VM. This limit is relative to all other VMs on the system.
vga: ${38:undefined} # not required. Specify VGA emulation used by KVM VMs.
disks: ${39:undefined} # not required. A list of disks to add, valid properties are documented in vmadm(1M).
max_lwps: ${40:undefined} # not required. Maximum number of lightweight processes this VM is allowed to have running.
max_swap: ${41:undefined} # not required. Maximum amount of virtual memory (in MiBs) the VM is allowed to use.
maintain_resolvers: ${42:undefined} # not required. Resolvers in C(/etc/resolv.conf) will be updated when updating the I(resolvers) property.
zfs_root_recsize: ${43:undefined} # not required. Suggested block size (power of 2) for files in the zoneroot dataset's filesystem.
nowait: ${44:undefined} # not required. Consider the provisioning complete when the VM first starts, rather than when the VM has rebooted.
force: ${45:undefined} # not required. Force a particular action (i.e. stop or delete a VM).
resolvers: ${46:undefined} # not required. List of resolvers to be put into C(/etc/resolv.conf).
virtio_txburst: ${47:undefined} # not required. Number of packets that can be sent in a single flush of the tx queue of virtio NICs.
firewall_enabled: ${48:undefined} # not required. Enables the firewall, allowing fwadm(1M) rules to be applied.
nic_driver: ${49:undefined} # not required. Default value for a virtual NIC model for KVM guests.
spice_opts: ${50:undefined} # not required. Addition options for SPICE-enabled KVM VMs.
max_physical_memory: ${51:undefined} # not required. Maximum amount of memory (in MiBs) on the host that the VM is allowed to use.
vcpus: ${52:undefined} # not required. Number of virtual CPUs for a KVM guest.
fs_allowed: ${53:undefined} # not required. Comma separated list of filesystem types this zone is allowed to mount.
uuid: ${54:undefined} # not required. UUID of the VM. Can either be a full UUID or C(*) for all VMs.
vnc_port: ${55:undefined} # not required. TCP port to listen of the VNC server. Or set C(0) for random, or C(-1) to disable.
disk_driver: ${56:undefined} # not required. Default value for a virtual disk model for KVM guests.
boot: ${57:undefined} # not required. Set the boot order for KVM VMs.
delegate_dataset: ${58:undefined} # not required. Whether to delegate a ZFS dataset to an OS VM.

internal_metadata_namespace: ${59:undefined} # not required. List of namespaces to be set as I(internal_metadata-only); these namespaces will come from I(internal_metadata) rather than I(customer_metadata).
tmpfs: ${60:undefined} # not required. Amount of memory (in MiBs) that will be available in the VM for the C(/tmp) filesystem.

vmware_cfg_backup.description: Backup / Restore / Reset ESXi host configuration
body: vmware_cfg_backup:
username: ${1:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.

dest: ${4:undefined} # not required. The destination where the ESXi configuration bundle will be saved. The I(dest) can be a folder or a file.,If I(dest) is a folder, the backup file will be saved in the folder with the default filename generated from the ESXi server.,If I(dest) is a file, the backup file will be saved with that filename. The file extension will always be .tgz.
src: ${5:undefined} # not required. The file containing the ESXi configuration that will be restored.
port: ${6:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
validate_certs: ${7:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.

state: ${8|saved,absent,loaded|} # not required. choices: saved;absent;loaded. If C(saved), the .tgz backup bundle will be saved in I(dest).,If C(absent), the host configuration will be reset to default values.,If C(loaded), the backup file in I(src) will be loaded to the ESXi host rewriting the hosts settings.
esxi_hostname: ${9:undefined} # not required. Name of ESXi server.
vmware_cluster:
hostname: ${1:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
datacenter_name: ${3:undefined} # required. The name of the datacenter the cluster will be created in.
username: ${4:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
cluster_name: ${5:undefined} # required. The name of the cluster that will be created.
validate_certs: ${6:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
enable_ha: ${7:no} # not required. If set to C(yes) will enable HA when the cluster is created.
port: ${8:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
state: ${9|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Create (C(present)) or remove (C(absent)) a VMware vSphere cluster.
enable_vsan: ${10:no} # not required. If set to C(yes) will enable vSAN when the cluster is created.
enable_drs: ${11:no} # not required. If set to C(yes) will enable DRS when the cluster is created.
vmware_datacenter:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter
datacenter_name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the datacenter the cluster will be created in.
username: ${3:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter
hostname: ${4:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter API server
validate_certs: ${5:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${6:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
state: ${7|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. If the datacenter should be present or absent
vmware_datastore_facts:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
cluster: ${4:undefined} # not required. Cluster to search for datastores,This is required if datacenter is not supplied
validate_certs: ${5:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
datacenter: ${6:undefined} # not required. Datacenter to search for datastores,This is required if cluster is not supplied
port: ${7:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
name: ${8:undefined} # not required. Name of a datastore to match
vmware_dns_config:
domainname: ${1:undefined} # required. The domain the ESXi host should be apart of.
dns_servers: ${2:undefined} # required. The DNS servers that the host should be configured to use.
password: ${3:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
change_hostname_to: ${4:undefined} # required. The hostname that an ESXi host should be changed to.
username: ${5:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${6:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${7:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${8:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

vmware_drs_rule_facts.description: Gathers facts about DRS rule on the given cluster
body: vmware_drs_rule_facts:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${4:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.

datacenter: ${5:undefined} # not required. Name of the datacenter.,DRS facts for all the clusters from the given datacenter will be returned.,This is required parameter if C(cluster_name) parameter is not provided.
port: ${6:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
cluster_name: ${7:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster.,DRS facts for the given cluster will be returned.,This is required parameter if C(datacenter) parameter is not provided.

vmware_dvs_host.description: Add or remove a host from distributed virtual switch
body: vmware_dvs_host:
username: ${1:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
switch_name: ${3:undefined} # required. The name of the Distributed vSwitch.
vmnics: ${4:undefined} # required. The ESXi hosts vmnics to use with the Distributed vSwitch.
state: ${5|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. If the host should be present or absent attached to the vSwitch.
esxi_hostname: ${6:undefined} # required. The ESXi hostname.
hostname: ${7:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${8:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${9:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

vmware_dvs_portgroup.description: Create or remove a Distributed vSwitch portgroup.
body: vmware_dvs_portgroup:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
switch_name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the distributed vSwitch the port group should be created on.
portgroup_name: ${3:undefined} # required. The name of the portgroup that is to be created or deleted.
username: ${4:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
state: ${5|present,absent|} # required. choices: present;absent. Determines if the portgroup should be present or not.
num_ports: ${6:undefined} # required. The number of ports the portgroup should contain.
portgroup_type: ${7|earlyBinding,lateBinding,ephemeral|} # required. choices: earlyBinding;lateBinding;ephemeral. See VMware KB 1022312 regarding portgroup types.
vlan_id: ${8:undefined} # required. The VLAN ID that should be configured with the portgroup, use 0 for no VLAN.,If C(vlan_trunk) is configured to be I(true), this can be a range, example: 1-4094.
hostname: ${9:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${10:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.

network_policy: ${11:[object Object]} # not required. Dictionary which configures the different security values for portgroup.,Valid attributes are:,- C(promiscuous) (bool): indicates whether promiscuous mode is allowed. (default: false),- C(forged_transmits) (bool): indicates whether forged transmits are allowed. (default: false),- C(mac_changes) (bool): indicates whether mac changes are allowed. (default: false)

teaming_policy: ${12:[object Object]} # not required. Dictionary which configures the different teaming values for portgroup.,Valid attributes are:,- C(load_balance_policy) (string): Network adapter teaming policy. (default: loadbalance_srcid),   - choices: [ loadbalance_ip, loadbalance_srcmac, loadbalance_srcid, failover_explicit],- C(inbound_policy) (bool): Indicate whether or not the teaming policy is applied to inbound frames as well. (default: False),- C(notify_switches) (bool): Indicate whether or not to notify the physical switch if a link fails. (default: True),- C(rolling_order) (bool): Indicate whether or not to use a rolling policy when restoring links. (default: False)
port: ${13:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
vlan_trunk: ${14:false} # not required. Indicates whether this is a VLAN trunk or not.

port_policy: ${15:[object Object]} # not required. Dictionary which configures the advanced policy settings for the portgroup.,Valid attributes are:,- C(block_override) (bool): indicates if the block policy can be changed per port. (default: true),- C(ipfix_override) (bool): indicates if the ipfix policy can be changed per port. (default: false),- C(live_port_move) (bool): indicates if a live port can be moved in or out of the portgroup. (default: false),- C(network_rp_override) (bool): indicates if the network resource pool can be changed per port. (default: false),- C(port_config_reset_at_disconnect) (bool): indicates if the configuration of a port is reset automatically after disconnect. (default: true),- C(security_override) (bool): indicates if the security policy can be changed per port. (default: false),- C(shaping_override) (bool): indicates if the shaping policy can be changed per port. (default: false),- C(traffic_filter_override) (bool): indicates if the traffic filter can be changed per port. (default: false),- C(uplink_teaming_override) (bool): indicates if the uplink teaming policy can be changed per port. (default: false),- C(vendor_config_override) (bool): indicates if the vendor config can be changed per port. (default: false),- C(vlan_override) (bool): indicates if the vlan can be changed per port. (default: false)

vmware_dvswitch.description: Create or remove a distributed vSwitch
body: vmware_dvswitch:
discovery_proto: ${1|cdp,lldp|} # required. choices: cdp;lldp. Link discovery protocol between Cisco and Link Layer discovery
mtu: ${2:undefined} # required. The switch maximum transmission unit
switch_name: ${3:undefined} # required. The name of the switch to create or remove
password: ${4:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
datacenter_name: ${5:undefined} # required. The name of the datacenter that will contain the dvSwitch
uplink_quantity: ${6:undefined} # required. Quantity of uplink per ESXi host added to the switch
username: ${7:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${8:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
discovery_operation: ${9|both,none,advertise,listen|} # not required. choices: both;none;advertise;listen. Select the discovery operation
validate_certs: ${10:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${11:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

switch_version: ${12:undefined} # not required. The version of the switch to create. Can be 6.5.0, 6.0.0, 5.5.0, 5.1.0, 5.0.0 with a vcenter running vSphere 6.5,Needed if you have a vcenter version > ESXi version to join DVS. If not specified version=version of vcenter
state: ${13|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Create or remove dvSwitch
vmware_guest:
hostname: ${1:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the VM to work with.,VM names in vCenter are not necessarily unique, which may be problematic, see C(name_match).,This parameter is case sensitive.
password: ${3:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${4:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
cluster: ${5:undefined} # not required. The cluster name where the virtual machine will run.,This parameter is case sensitive.
validate_certs: ${6:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
datacenter: ${7:ha-datacenter} # not required. Destination datacenter for the deploy operation.,This parameter is case sensitive.

customvalues: ${8:undefined} # not required. Define a list of custom values to set on virtual machine.,A custom value object takes two fields C(key) and C(value).,Incorrect key and values will be ignored.
linked_clone: ${9:no} # not required. Whether to create a Linked Clone from the snapshot specified.
port: ${10:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

hardware: ${11:undefined} # not required. Manage virtual machine's hardware attributes.,All parameters case sensitive.,Valid attributes are:, - C(hotadd_cpu) (boolean): Allow virtual CPUs to be added while the VM is running., - C(hotremove_cpu) (boolean): Allow virtual CPUs to be removed while the VM is running. version_added: 2.5, - C(hotadd_memory) (boolean): Allow memory to be added while the VM is running., - C(memory_mb) (integer): Amount of memory in MB., - C(nested_virt) (bool): Enable nested virtualization. version_added: 2.5, - C(num_cpus) (integer): Number of CPUs., - C(num_cpu_cores_per_socket) (integer): Number of Cores Per Socket. Value should be multiple of C(num_cpus)., - C(scsi) (string): Valid values are C(buslogic), C(lsilogic), C(lsilogicsas) and C(paravirtual) (default)., - C(memory_reservation) (integer): Amount of memory in MB to set resource limits for memory. version_added: 2.5, - C(memory_reservation_lock) (boolean): If set true, memory resource reservation for VM will always be equal to the VM's memory size. version_added: 2.5, - C(max_connections) (integer): Maximum number of active remote display connections for the virtual machines. version_added: 2.5., - C(mem_limit) (integer): The memory utilization of a virtual machine will not exceed this limit. Unit is MB. version_added: 2.5, - C(mem_reservation) (integer): The amount of memory resource that is guaranteed available to the virtual machine. Unit is MB. version_added: 2.5, - C(cpu_limit) (integer): The CPU utilization of a virtual machine will not exceed this limit. Unit is MHz. version_added: 2.5, - C(cpu_reservation) (integer): The amount of CPU resource that is guaranteed available to the virtual machine. Unit is MHz. version_added: 2.5

uuid: ${12:undefined} # not required. UUID of the instance to manage if known, this is VMware's unique identifier.,This is required if name is not supplied.,Please note that a supplied UUID will be ignored on VM creation, as VMware creates the UUID internally.

disk: ${13:undefined} # not required. A list of disks to add.,This parameter is case sensitive.,Resizing disks is not supported.,Removing existing disks of virtual machine is not supported.,Valid attributes are:, - C(size_[tb,gb,mb,kb]) (integer): Disk storage size in specified unit., - C(type) (string): Valid values are:,     - C(thin) thin disk,     - C(eagerzeroedthick) eagerzeroedthick disk, added in version 2.5,     Default: C(None) thick disk, no eagerzero., - C(datastore) (string): Datastore to use for the disk. If C(autoselect_datastore) is enabled, filter datastore selection., - C(autoselect_datastore) (bool): select the less used datastore. Specify only if C(datastore) is not specified.

networks: ${14:undefined} # not required. A list of networks (in the order of the NICs).,All parameters and VMware object names are case sensetive.,One of the below parameters is required per entry:, - C(name) (string): Name of the portgroup for this interface., - C(vlan) (integer): VLAN number for this interface.,Optional parameters per entry (used for virtual hardware):, - C(device_type) (string): Virtual network device (one of C(e1000), C(e1000e), C(pcnet32), C(vmxnet2), C(vmxnet3) (default), C(sriov))., - C(mac) (string): Customize mac address.,Optional parameters per entry (used for OS customization):, - C(type) (string): Type of IP assignment (either C(dhcp) or C(static))., - C(ip) (string): Static IP address (implies C(type: static))., - C(netmask) (string): Static netmask required for C(ip)., - C(gateway) (string): Static gateway., - C(dns_servers) (string): DNS servers for this network interface (Windows)., - C(domain) (string): Domain name for this network interface (Windows)., - C(wake_on_lan) (bool): Indicates if wake-on-LAN is enabled on this virtual network adapter. version_added: 2.5, - C(start_connected) (bool): Indicates that virtual network adapter starts with associated virtual machine powers on. version_added: 2.5, - C(allow_guest_control) (bool): Enables guest control over whether the connectable device is connected. version_added: 2.5

template: ${15:undefined} # not required. Template or existing VM used to create VM.,If this value is not set, VM is created without using a template.,If the VM exists already this setting will be ignored.,This parameter is case sensitive.
esxi_hostname: ${16:undefined} # not required. The ESXi hostname where the virtual machine will run.,This parameter is case sensitive.

guest_id: ${17:undefined} # not required. Set the guest ID.,This parameter is case sensitive.,Examples:,  VM with RHEL7 64 bit, will be 'rhel7_64Guest',  VM with CensOS 64 bit, will be 'centos64Guest',  VM with Ubuntu 64 bit, will be 'ubuntu64Guest',This field is required when creating a VM.,Valid values are referenced here: U(https://www.vmware.com/support/developer/converter-sdk/conv55_apireference/vim.vm.GuestOsDescriptor.GuestOsIdentifier.html)
annotation: ${18:undefined} # not required. A note or annotation to include in the virtual machine.
force: ${19:no} # not required. Ignore warnings and complete the actions.,This parameter is useful while removing virtual machine which is powered on state.

cdrom: ${20:undefined} # not required. A CD-ROM configuration for the VM.,Valid attributes are:, - C(type) (string): The type of CD-ROM, valid options are C(none), C(client) or C(iso). With C(none) the CD-ROM will be disconnected but present., - C(iso_path) (string): The datastore path to the ISO file to use, in the form of C([datastore1] path/to/file.iso). Required if type is set C(iso).

wait_for_ip_address: ${21:no} # not required. Wait until vCenter detects an IP address for the VM.,This requires vmware-tools (vmtoolsd) to properly work after creation.,vmware-tools needs to be installed on given virtual machine in order to work with this parameter.
is_template: ${22:no} # not required. Flag the instance as a template.,This will mark VM instance as template.
resource_pool: ${23:undefined} # not required. Affect machine to the given resource pool.,This parameter is case sensitive.,Resource pool should be child of the selected host parent.
name_match: ${24|first,last|} # not required. choices: first;last. If multiple VMs matching the name, use the first or last found.
snapshot_src: ${25:undefined} # not required. Name of the existing snapshot to use to create a clone of a VM.,This parameter is case sensitive.

state: ${26|present,absent,poweredon,poweredoff,restarted,suspended,shutdownguest,rebootguest|} # not required. choices: present;absent;poweredon;poweredoff;restarted;suspended;shutdownguest;rebootguest. Specify state of the virtual machine be in.,If C(state) is set to C(present) and VM exists, ensure the VM configuration conforms to task arguments.

customization: ${27:undefined} # not required. Parameters for OS customization when cloning from template.,All parameters and VMware object names are case sensetive.,Common parameters (Linux/Windows):, - C(dns_servers) (list): List of DNS servers to configure., - C(dns_suffix) (list): List of domain suffixes, aka DNS search path (default: C(domain) parameter)., - C(domain) (string): DNS domain name to use., - C(hostname) (string): Computer hostname (default: shorted C(name) parameter).,Parameters related to Windows customization:, - C(autologon) (bool): Auto logon after VM customization (default: False)., - C(autologoncount) (int): Number of autologon after reboot (default: 1)., - C(domainadmin) (string): User used to join in AD domain (mandatory with C(joindomain))., - C(domainadminpassword) (string): Password used to join in AD domain (mandatory with C(joindomain))., - C(fullname) (string): Server owner name (default: Administrator)., - C(joindomain) (string): AD domain to join (Not compatible with C(joinworkgroup))., - C(joinworkgroup) (string): Workgroup to join (Not compatible with C(joindomain), default: WORKGROUP)., - C(orgname) (string): Organisation name (default: ACME)., - C(password) (string): Local administrator password., - C(productid) (string): Product ID., - C(runonce) (list): List of commands to run at first user logon., - C(timezone) (int): Timezone (See U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms912391.aspx)).

folder: ${28:undefined} # not required. Destination folder, absolute path to find an existing guest or create the new guest.,The folder should include the datacenter. ESX's datacenter is ha-datacenter.,This parameter is case sensitive.,Examples:,   folder: /ha-datacenter/vm,   folder: ha-datacenter/vm,   folder: /datacenter1/vm,   folder: datacenter1/vm,   folder: /datacenter1/vm/folder1,   folder: datacenter1/vm/folder1,   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm,   folder: folder1/datacenter1/vm,   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm/folder2

vmware_guest_facts.description: Gather facts about a single VM
body: vmware_guest_facts:
datacenter: ${1:undefined} # required. Destination datacenter for the deploy operation
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${4:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
name_match: ${5|first,last|} # not required. choices: first;last. If multiple VMs matching the name, use the first or last found
validate_certs: ${6:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.

folder: ${7:/vm} # not required. Destination folder, absolute or relative path to find an existing guest.,This is required if name is supplied.,The folder should include the datacenter. ESX's datacenter is ha-datacenter,Examples:,   folder: /ha-datacenter/vm,   folder: ha-datacenter/vm,   folder: /datacenter1/vm,   folder: datacenter1/vm,   folder: /datacenter1/vm/folder1,   folder: datacenter1/vm/folder1,   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm,   folder: folder1/datacenter1/vm,   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm/folder2,   folder: vm/folder2,   folder: folder2
port: ${8:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
name: ${9:undefined} # not required. Name of the VM to work with,This is required if UUID is not supplied.
uuid: ${10:undefined} # not required. UUID of the instance to manage if known, this is VMware's unique identifier.,This is required if name is not supplied.

vmware_guest_file_operation.description: Files operation in a VMware guest operating system without network
body: vmware_guest_file_operation:
vm_password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password used to login-in to the virtual machine.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
vm_username: ${3:undefined} # required. The user to login in to the virtual machine.
vm_id: ${4:undefined} # required. Name of the virtual machine to work with.
username: ${5:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${6:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
cluster: ${7:undefined} # not required. The cluster hosting the virtual machine.,If set, it will help to speed up virtual machine search.
validate_certs: ${8:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
datacenter: ${9:undefined} # not required. The datacenter hosting the virtual machine.,If set, it will help to speed up virtual machine search.

copy: ${10:undefined} # not required. Copy file to vm without requiring network.,Valid attributes are:,  src: file source absolute or relative,  dest: file destination, path must be exist,  overwrite: False or True (not required, default False)

vm_id_type: ${11|uuid,dns_name,inventory_path,vm_name|} # not required. choices: uuid;dns_name;inventory_path;vm_name. The VMware identification method by which the virtual machine will be identified.
port: ${12:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

folder: ${13:undefined} # not required. Destination folder, absolute path to find an existing guest or create the new guest.,The folder should include the datacenter. ESX's datacenter is ha-datacenter,Used only if C(vm_id_type) is C(inventory_path).,Examples:,   folder: /ha-datacenter/vm,   folder: ha-datacenter/vm,   folder: /datacenter1/vm,   folder: datacenter1/vm,   folder: /datacenter1/vm/folder1,   folder: datacenter1/vm/folder1,   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm,   folder: folder1/datacenter1/vm,   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm/folder2,   folder: vm/folder2,   folder: folder2

fetch: ${14:undefined} # not required. Get file from virtual machine without requiring network.,Valid attributes are:,  src: The file on the remote system to fetch. This I(must) be a file, not a directory,  dest: file destination on localhost, path must be exist

directory: ${15:undefined} # not required. Create or delete directory.,Valid attributes are:,  path: directory path to create or remove,  operation: Valid values are create, delete,  recurse (boolean): Not required, default (false)

vmware_guest_find.description: Find the folder path(s) for a virtual machine by name or UUID
body: vmware_guest_find:
datacenter: ${1:undefined} # required. Destination datacenter for the find operation.,Deprecated in 2.5, will be removed in 2.9 release.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${3:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${4:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${5:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
uuid: ${6:undefined} # not required. UUID of the instance to manage if known, this is VMware's BIOS UUID.,This is required if name is not supplied.
port: ${7:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
name: ${8:undefined} # not required. Name of the VM to work with.,This is required if uuid is not supplied.

vmware_guest_powerstate.description: Manages power states of virtual machines in vCenter
body: vmware_guest_powerstate:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
name_match: ${4|first,last|} # not required. choices: first;last. If multiple virtual machines matching the name, use the first or last found.
validate_certs: ${5:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
force: ${6:false} # not required. Ignore warnings and complete the actions.,This parameter is useful while forcing virtual machine state.
port: ${7:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

scheduled_at: ${8:undefined} # not required. Date and time in string format at which specificed task needs to be performed.,The required format for date and time - 'dd/mm/yyyy hh:mm'.,Scheduling task requires vCenter server. A standalone ESXi server does not support this option.
uuid: ${9:undefined} # not required. UUID of the instance to manage if known, this is VMware's unique identifier.,This is required if name is not supplied.

state: ${10|powered-off,powered-on,reboot-guest,restarted,shutdown-guest,suspended,present|} # not required. choices: powered-off;powered-on;reboot-guest;restarted;shutdown-guest;suspended;present. Set the state of the virtual machine.
name: ${11:undefined} # not required. Name of the virtual machine to work with.,Virtual machine names in vCenter are not necessarily unique, which may be problematic, see C(name_match).

folder: ${12:/vm} # not required. Destination folder, absolute or relative path to find an existing guest or create the new guest.,The folder should include the datacenter. ESX's datacenter is ha-datacenter,Examples:,   folder: /ha-datacenter/vm,   folder: ha-datacenter/vm,   folder: /datacenter1/vm,   folder: datacenter1/vm,   folder: /datacenter1/vm/folder1,   folder: datacenter1/vm/folder1,   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm,   folder: folder1/datacenter1/vm,   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm/folder2,   folder: vm/folder2,   folder: folder2

vmware_guest_snapshot.description: Manages virtual machines snapshots in vCenter
body: vmware_guest_snapshot:
datacenter: ${1:undefined} # required. Destination datacenter for the deploy operation
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
state: ${4|present,absent,revert,remove_all|} # required. choices: present;absent;revert;remove_all. Manage snapshots attached to a specific virtual machine.
username: ${5:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${6:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
description: ${7:} # not required. Define an arbitrary description to attach to snapshot.
name: ${8:undefined} # not required. Name of the VM to work with,This is required if uuid is not supplied.
remove_children: ${9:false} # not required. If set to C(true) and state is set to C(absent), then entire snapshot subtree is set for removal.
port: ${10:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

memory_dump: ${11:false} # not required. If set to C(true), memory dump of virtual machine is also included in snapshot.,Note that memory snapshots take time and resources, this will take longer time to create.,If virtual machine does not provide capability to take memory snapshot, then this flag is set to C(false).
snapshot_name: ${12:undefined} # not required. Sets the snapshot name to manage.,This param is required only if state is not C(remove_all)
new_snapshot_name: ${13:undefined} # not required. Value to rename the existing snapshot to
uuid: ${14:undefined} # not required. UUID of the instance to manage if known, this is VMware's unique identifier.,This is required if name is not supplied.

folder: ${15:undefined} # not required. Destination folder, absolute or relative path to find an existing guest.,This is required if name is supplied.,The folder should include the datacenter. ESX's datacenter is ha-datacenter,Examples:,   folder: /ha-datacenter/vm,   folder: ha-datacenter/vm,   folder: /datacenter1/vm,   folder: datacenter1/vm,   folder: /datacenter1/vm/folder1,   folder: datacenter1/vm/folder1,   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm,   folder: folder1/datacenter1/vm,   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm/folder2,   folder: vm/folder2,   folder: folder2
new_description: ${16:undefined} # not required. Value to change the description of an existing snapshot to
name_match: ${17|first,last|} # not required. choices: first;last. If multiple VMs matching the name, use the first or last found

quiesce: ${18:false} # not required. If set to C(true) and virtual machine is powered on, it will quiesce the file system in virtual machine.,Note that VMWare Tools are required for this flag.,If virtual machine is powered off or VMware Tools are not available, then this flag is set to C(false).,If virtual machine does not provide capability to take quiesce snapshot, then this flag is set to C(false).

vmware_guest_tools_wait.description: Wait for VMware tools to become available
body: vmware_guest_tools_wait:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${2:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${3:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
name_match: ${4|first,last|} # not required. choices: first;last. If multiple VMs match the name, use the first or last found.
validate_certs: ${5:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
uuid: ${6:undefined} # not required. UUID of the VM  for which to wait until the tools become available, if known. This is VMware's unique identifier.,This is required if C(name) is not supplied.
port: ${7:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
name: ${8:undefined} # not required. Name of the VM for which to wait until the tools become available.,This is required if uuid is not supplied.

folder: ${9:/vm} # not required. Destination folder, absolute or relative path to find an existing guest.,This is required if C(name) is supplied.,The folder should include the datacenter. ESX's datacenter is C(ha-datacenter).,Examples:,   folder: /ha-datacenter/vm,   folder: ha-datacenter/vm,   folder: /datacenter1/vm,   folder: datacenter1/vm,   folder: /datacenter1/vm/folder1,   folder: datacenter1/vm/folder1,   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm,   folder: folder1/datacenter1/vm,   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm/folder2

vmware_host.description: Add / Remove ESXi host to / from vCenter
body: vmware_host:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
datacenter_name: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the datacenter to add the host.
esxi_hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. ESXi hostname to manage.
username: ${4:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
cluster_name: ${5:undefined} # required. Name of the cluster to add the host.,Required parameter from version 2.5.
hostname: ${6:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${7:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${8:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
esxi_password: ${9:undefined} # not required. ESXi password.,Required for adding a host.,Optional for reconnect.,Unused for removing.,No longer required parameter from version 2.5.

esxi_ssl_thumbprint: ${10:} # not required. Specifying the hostsystem's certificate's thumbprint.,Use following command to get hostsystem's certificate's thumbprint - ,# openssl x509 -in /etc/vmware/ssl/rui.crt -fingerprint -sha1 -noout

state: ${11|present,absent,add_or_reconnect,reconnect|} # not required. choices: present;absent;add_or_reconnect;reconnect. present: add the host if it's absent else do nothing.,absent: remove the host if it's present else do nothing.,add_or_reconnect: add the host if it's absent else reconnect it.,reconnect: reconnect the host if it's present else fail.
esxi_username: ${12:undefined} # not required. ESXi username.,Required for adding a host.,Optional for reconnect.,Unused for removing.,No longer required parameter from version 2.5.

vmware_host_acceptance.description: Manage acceptance level of ESXi host
body: vmware_host_acceptance:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.

acceptance_level: ${4|community,partner,vmware_accepted,vmware_certified|} # not required. choices: community;partner;vmware_accepted;vmware_certified. Name of acceptance level.,If set to C(partner), then accept only partner and VMware signed and certified VIBs.,If set to C(vmware_certified), then accept only VIBs that are signed and certified by VMware.,If set to C(vmware_accepted), then accept VIBs that have been accepted by VMware.,If set to C(community), then accept all VIBs, even those that are not signed.
validate_certs: ${5:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${6:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

state: ${7|list,present|} # not required. choices: list;present. Set or list acceptance level of the given ESXi host.,If set to C(list), then will return current acceptance level of given host system/s.,If set to C(present), then will set given acceptance level.
esxi_hostname: ${8:undefined} # not required. ESXi hostname.,Acceptance level of this ESXi host system will be managed.,If C(cluster_name) is not given, this parameter is required.

cluster_name: ${9:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster.,Acceptance level of all ESXi host system in the given cluster will be managed.,If C(esxi_hostname) is not given, this parameter is required.

vmware_host_config_facts.description: Gathers facts about an ESXi host's advance configuration information
body: vmware_host_config_facts:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${4:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${5:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
esxi_hostname: ${6:undefined} # not required. ESXi hostname to gather facts from.,If C(cluster_name) is not given, this parameter is required.
cluster_name: ${7:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster from which the ESXi host belong to.,If C(esxi_hostname) is not given, this parameter is required.

vmware_host_config_manager.description: Manage advance configurations about an ESXi host
body: vmware_host_config_manager:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${4:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
options: ${5:[object Object]} # not required. A dictionary of advance configuration parameter.,Invalid configuration parameters are ignored.
port: ${6:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
esxi_hostname: ${7:undefined} # not required. ESXi hostname.,Settings are applied to this ESXi host system.,If C(cluster_name) is not given, this parameter is required.
cluster_name: ${8:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster.,Settings are applied to every ESXi host system in given cluster.,If C(esxi_hostname) is not given, this parameter is required.

vmware_host_datastore.description: Manage a datastore on ESXi host
body: vmware_host_datastore:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
datastore_type: ${2|nfs,vmfs|} # required. choices: nfs;vmfs. Type of the datastore to configure (nfs/vmfs).
datacenter_name: ${3:undefined} # required. Name of the datacenter to add the datastore.
