datastore_name: ${4:undefined} # required. Name of the datastore to add/remove.
username: ${5:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
esxi_hostname: ${6:undefined} # required. ESXi hostname to manage the datastore.
hostname: ${7:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${8:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
vmfs_version: ${9:undefined} # not required. VMFS version to use for datastore creation.,Unused if datastore type is not set to C(vmfs) and state is not set to C(present).
nfs_path: ${10:undefined} # not required. Resource path on NFS host.,Required if datastore type is set to C(nfs) and state is set to C(present), else unused.
port: ${11:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
nfs_ro: ${12:false} # not required. ReadOnly or ReadWrite mount.,Unused if datastore type is not set to C(nfs) and state is not set to C(present).
nfs_server: ${13:undefined} # not required. NFS host serving nfs datastore.,Required if datastore type is set to C(nfs) and state is set to C(present), else unused.

state: ${14|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. present: Mount datastore on host if datastore is absent else do nothing.,absent: Umount datastore if datastore is present else do nothing.
vmfs_device_name: ${15:undefined} # not required. Name of the device to be used as VMFS datastore.,Required for VMFS datastore type and state is set to C(present), else unused.

vmware_host_dns_facts.description: Gathers facts about an ESXi host's DNS configuration information
body: vmware_host_dns_facts:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.

esxi_hostname: ${6:undefined} # not required. ESXi hostname to gather facts from.,If C(cluster_name) is not given, this parameter is required.
cluster_name: ${7:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster from which the ESXi host belong to.,If C(esxi_hostname) is not given, this parameter is required.

vmware_host_facts.description: Gathers facts about remote vmware host
body: vmware_host_facts:
hostname: ${1:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.

vmware_host_firewall_facts.description: Gathers facts about an ESXi host's firewall configuration information
body: vmware_host_firewall_facts:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.

esxi_hostname: ${6:undefined} # not required. ESXi hostname to gather facts from.,If C(cluster_name) is not given, this parameter is required.
cluster_name: ${7:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster from which the ESXi host belong to.,If C(esxi_hostname) is not given, this parameter is required.

vmware_host_firewall_manager.description: Manage firewall configurations about an ESXi host
body: vmware_host_firewall_manager:
username: ${1:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.

rules: ${4:} # not required. A list of Rule set which needs to be managed.,Each member of list is rule set name and state to be set the rule.,Both rule name and rule state are required parameters.,Please see examples for more information.
port: ${5:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
validate_certs: ${6:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
esxi_hostname: ${7:undefined} # not required. ESXi hostname.,Firewall settings are applied to this ESXi host system.,If C(cluster_name) is not given, this parameter is required.

cluster_name: ${8:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster.,Firewall settings are applied to every ESXi host system in given cluster.,If C(esxi_hostname) is not given, this parameter is required.

vmware_host_lockdown.description: Manage administrator permission for the local administrative account for the ESXi host
body: vmware_host_lockdown:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${4:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${5:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of hosts system,If set to C(present), all host systems will be set in lockdown mode.,If host system is already in lockdown mode and set to C(present), no action will be taken.,If set to C(absent), all host systems will be removed from lockdown mode.,If host system is already out of lockdown mode and set to C(absent), no action will be taken.
esxi_hostname: ${7:undefined} # not required. List of ESXi hostname to manage lockdown.,Required parameter, if C(cluster_name) is not set.,See examples for specifications.
cluster_name: ${8:undefined} # not required. Name of cluster.,All host systems from given cluster used to manage lockdown.,Required parameter, if C(esxi_hostname) is not set.

vmware_host_ntp.description: Manage NTP configurations about an ESXi host
body: vmware_host_ntp:
username: ${1:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
ntp_servers: ${3:undefined} # required. IP or FQDN of NTP server/s.,This accepts a list of NTP servers. For multiple servers, please look at the examples.
hostname: ${4:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${5:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${6:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

state: ${7|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. present: Add NTP server/s, if it specified server/s are absent else do nothing.,absent: Remove NTP server/s, if specified server/s are present else do nothing.
esxi_hostname: ${8:undefined} # not required. ESXi hostname.,NTP settings are applied to this ESXi host system.,If C(cluster_name) is not given, this parameter is required.

cluster_name: ${9:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster.,NTP settings are applied to every ESXi host system in the given cluster.,If C(esxi_hostname) is not given, this parameter is required.

body: vmware_host_package_facts:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.

hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${4:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${5:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
esxi_hostname: ${6:undefined} # not required. ESXi hostname.,Package facts about this ESXi server will be returned.,If C(cluster_name) is not given, this parameter is required.

cluster_name: ${7:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster.,Package facts about each ESXi server will be returned for given cluster.,If C(esxi_hostname) is not given, this parameter is required.

vmware_host_service_facts.description: Gathers facts about an ESXi host's services
body: vmware_host_service_facts:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${4:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${5:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
esxi_hostname: ${6:undefined} # not required. ESXi hostname.,Service facts about this ESXi server will be returned.,If C(cluster_name) is not given, this parameter is required.

cluster_name: ${7:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster.,Service facts about each ESXi server will be returned for given cluster.,If C(esxi_hostname) is not given, this parameter is required.

vmware_host_service_manager.description: Manage services on a given ESXi host
body: vmware_host_service_manager:
username: ${1:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
service_name: ${3:undefined} # required. Name of Service to be managed. This is brief identifier for the service, for example, ntpd, vxsyslogd etc.,This value should be a valid ESXi service name.
hostname: ${4:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${5:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.

service_policy: ${6|automatic,off,on|} # not required. choices: automatic;off;on. Set of valid service policy strings.,If set C(on), then service should be started when the host starts up.,If set C(automatic), then service should run if and only if it has open firewall ports.,If set C(off), then Service should not be started when the host starts up.
port: ${7:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

state: ${8|absent,present,restart,start,stop|} # not required. choices: absent;present;restart;start;stop. Desired state of service.,State value 'start' and 'present' has same effect.,State value 'stop' and 'absent' has same effect.
esxi_hostname: ${9:undefined} # not required. ESXi hostname.,Service settings are applied to this ESXi host system.,If C(cluster_name) is not given, this parameter is required.

cluster_name: ${10:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster.,Service settings are applied to every ESXi host system/s in given cluster.,If C(esxi_hostname) is not given, this parameter is required.

vmware_host_vmnic_facts.description: Gathers facts about vmnics available on the given ESXi host
body: vmware_host_vmnic_facts:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${4:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${5:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
esxi_hostname: ${6:undefined} # not required. ESXi hostname.,Vmnic facts about this ESXi server will be returned.,If C(cluster_name) is not given, this parameter is required.

cluster_name: ${7:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster.,Vmnic facts about each ESXi server will be returned for the given cluster.,If C(esxi_hostname) is not given, this parameter is required.

vmware_local_role_manager.description: Manage local roles on an ESXi host
body: vmware_local_role_manager:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
local_role_name: ${2:undefined} # required. The local role name to be managed.
username: ${3:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${4:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${5:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the role.,If the role already exists when C(state=present), the role info is updated.
port: ${7:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

local_privilege_ids: ${8:} # not required. The list of privileges that role needs to have.,Please see U(https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.0/com.vmware.vsphere.security.doc/GUID-ED56F3C4-77D0-49E3-88B6-B99B8B437B62.html)
force_remove: ${9:false} # not required. If set to C(False) then prevents the role from being removed if any permissions are using it.

vmware_local_user_manager.description: Manage local users on an ESXi host
body: vmware_local_user_manager:
local_user_name: ${1:undefined} # required. The local user name to be changed.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${3:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${4:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${5:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${6:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
local_user_password: ${7:undefined} # not required. The password to be set.
local_user_description: ${8:undefined} # not required. Description for the user.
state: ${9|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Indicate desired state of the user. If the user already exists when C(state=present), the user info is updated

vmware_maintenancemode.description: Place a host into maintenance mode
body: vmware_maintenancemode:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
esxi_hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. Name of the host as defined in vCenter.
hostname: ${4:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
evacuate: ${5:false} # not required. If set to C(True), evacuate all powered off VMs.
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Enter or exit maintenance mode.
port: ${7:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
validate_certs: ${8:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
timeout: ${9:0} # not required. Specify a timeout for the operation.
vsan: ${10|ensureObjectAccessibility,evacuateAllData,noAction|} # not required. choices: ensureObjectAccessibility;evacuateAllData;noAction. Specify which VSAN compliant mode to enter.

vmware_migrate_vmk.description: Migrate a VMK interface from VSS to VDS
body: vmware_migrate_vmk:
device: ${1:undefined} # required. VMK interface name
migrate_portgroup_name: ${2:undefined} # required. Portgroup name to migrate VMK interface to
current_switch_name: ${3:undefined} # required. Switch VMK interface is currently on
username: ${4:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
current_portgroup_name: ${5:undefined} # required. Portgroup name VMK interface is currently on
password: ${6:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
esxi_hostname: ${7:undefined} # required. ESXi hostname to be managed
migrate_switch_name: ${8:undefined} # required. Switch name to migrate VMK interface to
hostname: ${9:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${10:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${11:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
vmware_portgroup:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
switch_name: ${2:undefined} # required. vSwitch to modify.
portgroup_name: ${3:undefined} # required. Portgroup name to add.
username: ${4:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
vlan_id: ${5:undefined} # required. VLAN ID to assign to portgroup.
hostname: ${6:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${7:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.

network_policy: ${8:[object Object]} # not required. Network policy specifies layer 2 security settings for a portgroup such as promiscuous mode, where guest adapter listens to all the packets, MAC address changes and forged transmits.,Dict which configures the different security values for portgroup.,Valid attributes are:,- C(promiscuous_mode) (bool): indicates whether promiscuous mode is allowed. (default: false),- C(forged_transmits) (bool): indicates whether forged transmits are allowed. (default: false),- C(mac_changes) (bool): indicates whether mac changes are allowed. (default: false)
port: ${9:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
hosts: ${10:undefined} # not required. List of name of host or hosts on which portgroup needs to be added.,This option is required if C(cluster_name) is not specified.
state: ${11|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Determines if the portgroup should be present or not.

cluster_name: ${12:undefined} # not required. Name of cluster name for host membership.,Portgroup will be created on all hosts of the given cluster.,This option is required if C(hosts) is not specified.
vmware_resource_pool:
cluster: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the cluster to add the host.
datacenter: ${2:undefined} # required. Name of the datacenter to add the host.
password: ${3:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
resource_pool: ${4:undefined} # required. Resource pool name to manage.
username: ${5:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${6:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${7:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
mem_reservation: ${8:0} # not required. Amount of resource that is guaranteed available to the virtual machine or resource pool.
mem_limit: ${9:-1} # not required. The utilization of a virtual machine/resource pool will not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources.,The default value -1 indicates no limit.
mem_expandable_reservations: ${10:true} # not required. In a resource pool with an expandable reservation, the reservation on a resource pool can grow beyond the specified value.
port: ${11:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
cpu_limit: ${12:-1} # not required. The utilization of a virtual machine/resource pool will not exceed this limit, even if there are available resources.,The default value -1 indicates no limit.
cpu_expandable_reservations: ${13:true} # not required. In a resource pool with an expandable reservation, the reservation on a resource pool can grow beyond the specified value.
cpu_reservation: ${14:0} # not required. Amount of resource that is guaranteed available to the virtual machine or resource pool.
cpu_shares: ${15|high,custom,low,normal|} # not required. choices: high;custom;low;normal. Memory shares are used in case of resource contention.
state: ${16|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Add or remove the resource pool
mem_shares: ${17|high,custom,low,normal|} # not required. choices: high;custom;low;normal. Memory shares are used in case of resource contention.

vmware_target_canonical_facts.description: Return canonical (NAA) from an ESXi host
body: vmware_target_canonical_facts:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
target_id: ${2:undefined} # required. The target id based on order of scsi device
username: ${3:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${4:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${5:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${6:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

vmware_vm_facts.description: Return basic facts pertaining to a vSphere virtual machine guest
body: vmware_vm_facts:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${4:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.

vm_type: ${5|all,vm,template|} # not required. choices: all;vm;template. If set to C(vm), then facts are gathered for virtual machines only.,If set to C(template), then facts are gathered for virtual machine templates only.,If set to C(all), then facts are gathered for all virtual machines and virtual machine templates.
port: ${6:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

vmware_vm_shell.description: Run commands in a VMware guest operating system
body: vmware_vm_shell:
vm_password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password used to login-in to the virtual machine.
vm_shell: ${2:undefined} # required. The absolute path to the program to start.,On Linux, shell is executed via bash.
password: ${3:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
vm_username: ${4:undefined} # required. The user to login-in to the virtual machine.
vm_id: ${5:undefined} # required. Name of the virtual machine to work with.
username: ${6:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${7:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
cluster: ${8:undefined} # not required. The cluster hosting the virtual machine.,If set, it will help to speed up virtual machine search.
validate_certs: ${9:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
datacenter: ${10:undefined} # not required. The datacenter hosting the virtual machine.,If set, it will help to speed up virtual machine search.
vm_shell_cwd: ${11:undefined} # not required. The current working directory of the application from which it will be run.

vm_id_type: ${12|uuid,dns_name,inventory_path,vm_name|} # not required. choices: uuid;dns_name;inventory_path;vm_name. The VMware identification method by which the virtual machine will be identified.
vm_shell_env: ${13:undefined} # not required. Comma separated list of environment variable, specified in the guest OS notation.
port: ${14:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

folder: ${15:/vm} # not required. Destination folder, absolute or relative path to find an existing guest or create the new guest.,The folder should include the datacenter. ESX's datacenter is ha-datacenter,Examples:,   folder: /ha-datacenter/vm,   folder: ha-datacenter/vm,   folder: /datacenter1/vm,   folder: datacenter1/vm,   folder: /datacenter1/vm/folder1,   folder: datacenter1/vm/folder1,   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm,   folder: folder1/datacenter1/vm,   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm/folder2,   folder: vm/folder2,   folder: folder2
vm_shell_args: ${16: } # not required. The argument to the program.

vmware_vm_vm_drs_rule.description: Configure VMware DRS Affinity rule for virtual machine in given cluster
body: vmware_vm_vm_drs_rule:
drs_rule_name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the DRS rule to manage.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${3:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
cluster_name: ${4:undefined} # required. Desired cluster name where virtual machines are present for the DRS rule.
hostname: ${5:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${6:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.

affinity_rule: ${7:true} # not required. If set to C(True), the DRS rule will be an Affinity rule.,If set to C(False), the DRS rule will be an Anti-Affinity rule.,Effective only if C(state) is set to C(present).
vms: ${8:undefined} # not required. List of virtual machines name for which DRS rule needs to be applied.,Required if C(state) is set to C(present).
port: ${9:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
enabled: ${10:false} # not required. If set to C(True), the DRS rule will be enabled.,Effective only if C(state) is set to C(present).
mandatory: ${11:false} # not required. If set to C(True), the DRS rule will be mandatory.,Effective only if C(state) is set to C(present).

state: ${12|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. If set to C(present), then the DRS rule is created if not present.,If set to C(present), then the DRS rule is deleted and created if present already.,If set to C(absent), then the DRS rule is deleted if present.

vmware_vm_vss_dvs_migrate.description: Migrates a virtual machine from a standard vswitch to distributed
body: vmware_vm_vss_dvs_migrate:
vm_name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the virtual machine to migrate to a dvSwitch
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
dvportgroup_name: ${3:undefined} # required. Name of the portgroup to migrate to the virtual machine to
username: ${4:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${5:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${6:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${7:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

vmware_vmkernel.description: Manage a VMware VMkernel Interface aka. Virtual NICs of host system.
body: vmware_vmkernel:
portgroup_name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the port group for the VMKernel interface.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${3:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
esxi_hostname: ${4:undefined} # required. Name of ESXi host to which VMKernel is to be managed.,From version 2.5 onwards, this parameter is required.
hostname: ${5:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${6:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
subnet_mask: ${7:undefined} # not required. The Subnet Mask for the VMKernel interface.,Use C(network) parameter with C(subnet_mask) instead.,Deprecated option, will be removed in version 2.9.
port: ${8:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
mtu: ${9:1500} # not required. The MTU for the VMKernel interface.,The default value of 1500 is valid from version 2.5 and onwards.

vswitch_name: ${10:undefined} # not required. The name of the vSwitch where to add the VMKernel interface.,Required parameter only if C(state) is set to C(present).,Optional parameter from version 2.5 and onwards.
ip_address: ${11:undefined} # not required. The IP Address for the VMKernel interface.,Use C(network) parameter with C(ip_address) instead.,Deprecated option, will be removed in version 2.9.
enable_vsan: ${12:undefined} # not required. Enable the VMKernel interface for VSAN traffic.
enable_vmotion: ${13:undefined} # not required. Enable the VMKernel interface for vMotion traffic.

network: ${14:undefined} # not required. A dictionary of network details.,Following parameter is required:, - C(type) (string): Type of IP assignment (either C(dhcp) or C(static)).,Following parameters are required in case of C(type) is set to C(static), - C(ip_address) (string): Static IP address (implies C(type: static))., - C(netmask) (string): Static netmask required for C(ip).
enable_mgmt: ${15:undefined} # not required. Enable the VMKernel interface for Management traffic.
enable_ft: ${16:undefined} # not required. Enable the VMKernel interface for Fault Tolerance traffic.

state: ${17|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. If set to C(present), VMKernel is created with the given specifications.,If set to C(absent), VMKernel is removed from the given configurations.,If set to C(present) and VMKernel exists then VMKernel configurations are updated.
vlan_id: ${18:undefined} # not required. The VLAN ID for the VMKernel interface.,Required parameter only if C(state) is set to C(present).,Optional parameter from version 2.5 and onwards.

vmware_vmkernel_facts.description: Gathers VMKernel facts about an ESXi host
body: vmware_vmkernel_facts:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${4:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${5:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
esxi_hostname: ${6:undefined} # not required. ESXi hostname.,VMKernel facts about this ESXi server will be returned.,If C(cluster_name) is not given, this parameter is required.

cluster_name: ${7:undefined} # not required. Name of the cluster.,VMKernel facts about each ESXi server will be returned for the given cluster.,If C(esxi_hostname) is not given, this parameter is required.
vmware_vmkernel_ip_config:
subnet_mask: ${1:undefined} # required. Subnet Mask to assign to VMkernel interface
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${3:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
ip_address: ${4:undefined} # required. IP address to assign to VMkernel interface
vmk_name: ${5:undefined} # required. VMkernel interface name
hostname: ${6:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${7:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${8:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

vmware_vmotion.description: Move a virtual machine using vMotion
body: vmware_vmotion:
vm_name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the VM to perform a vMotion on
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${3:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
destination_host: ${4:undefined} # required. Name of the end host the VM should be running on
hostname: ${5:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${6:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
port: ${7:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

vmware_vsan_cluster.description: Configure VSAN clustering on an ESXi host
body: vmware_vsan_cluster:
password: ${1:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${3:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${4:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
cluster_uuid: ${5:undefined} # not required. Desired cluster UUID
port: ${6:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.

vmware_vswitch.description: Add or remove a VMware Standard Switch to an ESXi host
body: vmware_vswitch:
switch: ${1:undefined} # required. vSwitch name to add.,Alias C(switch) is added in version 2.4.
username: ${2:undefined} # required. The username of the vSphere vCenter.
password: ${3:undefined} # required. The password of the vSphere vCenter.
hostname: ${4:undefined} # required. The hostname or IP address of the vSphere vCenter.
validate_certs: ${5:True} # not required. Allows connection when SSL certificates are not valid. Set to false when certificates are not trusted.
number_of_ports: ${6:128} # not required. Number of port to configure on vSwitch.
port: ${7:443} # not required. The port number of the vSphere vCenter or ESXi server.
nics: ${8:undefined} # not required. A list of vmnic names or vmnic name to attach to vSwitch.,Alias C(nics) is added in version 2.4.
mtu: ${9:1500} # not required. MTU to configure on vSwitch.
state: ${10|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Add or remove the switch.
esxi_hostname: ${11:undefined} # not required. Manage the vSwitch using this ESXi host system

vr_account_facts.description: Gather facts about the Vultr account.
body: vr_account_facts:
validate_certs: ${1:true} # not required. Validate SSL certs of the Vultr API.
api_timeout: ${2:60} # not required. HTTP timeout to Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_TIMEOUT) is used as default, when defined.
api_key: ${3:undefined} # not required. API key of the Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_KEY) is used as default, when defined.
api_account: ${4:default} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(vultr.ini) file.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ACCOUNT) is used as default, when defined.
api_endpoint: ${5:https://api.vultr.com} # not required. URL to API endpint (without trailing slash).,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ENDPOINT) is used as default, when defined.
api_retries: ${6:5} # not required. Amount of retries in case of the Vultr API retuns an HTTP 503 code.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_RETRIES) is used as default, when defined.
vr_dns_domain:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The domain name.
validate_certs: ${2:true} # not required. Validate SSL certs of the Vultr API.
api_timeout: ${3:60} # not required. HTTP timeout to Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_TIMEOUT) is used as default, when defined.
server_ip: ${4:undefined} # not required. The default server IP.,Use M(vr_dns_record) to change it once the domain is created.,Required if C(state=present).
api_key: ${5:undefined} # not required. API key of the Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_KEY) is used as default, when defined.
api_account: ${6:default} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(vultr.ini) file.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ACCOUNT) is used as default, when defined.
state: ${7|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the DNS domain.
api_endpoint: ${8:https://api.vultr.com} # not required. URL to API endpint (without trailing slash).,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ENDPOINT) is used as default, when defined.
api_retries: ${9:5} # not required. Amount of retries in case of the Vultr API retuns an HTTP 503 code.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_RETRIES) is used as default, when defined.
vr_dns_record:
domain: ${1:undefined} # required. The domain the record is related to.
validate_certs: ${2:true} # not required. Validate SSL certs of the Vultr API.
api_timeout: ${3:60} # not required. HTTP timeout to Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_TIMEOUT) is used as default, when defined.
api_key: ${4:undefined} # not required. API key of the Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_KEY) is used as default, when defined.
ttl: ${5:300} # not required. TTL of the record.
data: ${6:undefined} # not required. Data of the record.,Required if C(state=present) or C(multiple=yes).
api_endpoint: ${7:https://api.vultr.com} # not required. URL to API endpint (without trailing slash).,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ENDPOINT) is used as default, when defined.
api_retries: ${8:5} # not required. Amount of retries in case of the Vultr API retuns an HTTP 503 code.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_RETRIES) is used as default, when defined.
priority: ${9:0} # not required. Priority of the record.
api_account: ${10:default} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(vultr.ini) file.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ACCOUNT) is used as default, when defined.

multiple: ${11:false} # not required. Whether to use more than one record with similar C(name) including no name and C(record_type).,Only allowed for a few record types, e.g. C(record_type=A), C(record_type=NS) or C(record_type=MX).,C(data) will not be updated, instead it is used as a key to find existing records.
state: ${12|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the DNS record.
record_type: ${13|A,AAAA,CNAME,MX,SRV,ALIAS,SPF,TXT,NS|} # not required. choices: A;AAAA;CNAME;MX;SRV;ALIAS;SPF;TXT;NS. Type of the record.
name: ${14:} # not required. The record name (subrecord).
vr_firewall_group:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the firewall group.
validate_certs: ${2:true} # not required. Validate SSL certs of the Vultr API.
api_timeout: ${3:60} # not required. HTTP timeout to Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_TIMEOUT) is used as default, when defined.
api_key: ${4:undefined} # not required. API key of the Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_KEY) is used as default, when defined.
api_account: ${5:default} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(vultr.ini) file.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ACCOUNT) is used as default, when defined.
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the firewall group.
api_endpoint: ${7:https://api.vultr.com} # not required. URL to API endpint (without trailing slash).,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ENDPOINT) is used as default, when defined.
api_retries: ${8:5} # not required. Amount of retries in case of the Vultr API retuns an HTTP 503 code.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_RETRIES) is used as default, when defined.
vr_firewall_rule:
group: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the firewall group.
validate_certs: ${2:true} # not required. Validate SSL certs of the Vultr API.
api_timeout: ${3:60} # not required. HTTP timeout to Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_TIMEOUT) is used as default, when defined.
protocol: ${4|icmp,tcp,udp,gre|} # not required. choices: icmp;tcp;udp;gre. Protocol of the firewall rule.
ip_version: ${5|v4,v6|} # not required. choices: v4;v6. IP address version
api_endpoint: ${6:https://api.vultr.com} # not required. URL to API endpint (without trailing slash).,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ENDPOINT) is used as default, when defined.
api_retries: ${7:5} # not required. Amount of retries in case of the Vultr API retuns an HTTP 503 code.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_RETRIES) is used as default, when defined.
start_port: ${8:undefined} # not required. Start port for the firewall rule.,Required if C(protocol) is tcp or udp and C(state=present).
api_account: ${9:default} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(vultr.ini) file.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ACCOUNT) is used as default, when defined.
end_port: ${10:undefined} # not required. End port for the firewall rule.,Only considered if C(protocol) is tcp or udp and C(state=present).
api_key: ${11:undefined} # not required. API key of the Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_KEY) is used as default, when defined.
state: ${12|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the firewall rule.
cidr: ${13:0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0 depending on C(ip_version)} # not required. Network in CIDR format,The CIDR format must match with the C(ip_type) value.,Required if C(state=present).
vr_server:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the server.
validate_certs: ${2:true} # not required. Validate SSL certs of the Vultr API.
plan: ${3:undefined} # not required. Plan to use for the server.,Required if the server does not yet exist.
api_key: ${4:undefined} # not required. API key of the Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_KEY) is used as default, when defined.
api_endpoint: ${5:https://api.vultr.com} # not required. URL to API endpint (without trailing slash).,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ENDPOINT) is used as default, when defined.
auto_backup_enabled: ${6:undefined} # not required. Whether to enable automatic backups or not.
api_retries: ${7:5} # not required. Amount of retries in case of the Vultr API retuns an HTTP 503 code.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_RETRIES) is used as default, when defined.
ipv6_enabled: ${8:undefined} # not required. Whether to enable IPv6 or not.
notify_activate: ${9:undefined} # not required. Whether to send an activation email when the server is ready or not.,Only considered on creation.
reserved_ip_v4: ${10:undefined} # not required. IP address of the floating IP to use as the main IP of this server.,Only considered on creation.
os: ${11:undefined} # not required. The operating system.,Required if the server does not yet exist.
hostname: ${12:undefined} # not required. Hostname to assign to this server.
api_timeout: ${13:60} # not required. HTTP timeout to Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_TIMEOUT) is used as default, when defined.
force: ${14:undefined} # not required. Force stop/start the server if required to apply changes,Otherwise a running server will not be changed.
private_network_enabled: ${15:undefined} # not required. Whether to enable private networking or not.
firewall_group: ${16:undefined} # not required. The firewall group to assign this server to.
user_data: ${17:undefined} # not required. User data to be passed to the server.
ssh_keys: ${18:undefined} # not required. List of SSH keys passed to the server on creation.
region: ${19:undefined} # not required. Region the server is deployed into.,Required if the server does not yet exist.
api_account: ${20:default} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(vultr.ini) file.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ACCOUNT) is used as default, when defined.
startup_script: ${21:undefined} # not required. Name of the startup script to execute on boot.,Only considered while creating the server.
state: ${22|present,absent,restarted,reinstalled,started,stopped|} # not required. choices: present;absent;restarted;reinstalled;started;stopped. State of the server.
tag: ${23:undefined} # not required. Tag for the server.
vr_ssh_key:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the ssh key.
validate_certs: ${2:true} # not required. Validate SSL certs of the Vultr API.
api_timeout: ${3:60} # not required. HTTP timeout to Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_TIMEOUT) is used as default, when defined.
api_key: ${4:undefined} # not required. API key of the Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_KEY) is used as default, when defined.
ssh_key: ${5:undefined} # not required. SSH public key.,Required if C(state=present).
state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the ssh key.
api_endpoint: ${7:https://api.vultr.com} # not required. URL to API endpint (without trailing slash).,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ENDPOINT) is used as default, when defined.
api_retries: ${8:5} # not required. Amount of retries in case of the Vultr API retuns an HTTP 503 code.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_RETRIES) is used as default, when defined.
api_account: ${9:default} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(vultr.ini) file.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ACCOUNT) is used as default, when defined.
vr_startup_script:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The script name.
validate_certs: ${2:true} # not required. Validate SSL certs of the Vultr API.
script: ${3:undefined} # not required. The script source code.,Required if (state=present).
script_type: ${4|boot,pxe|} # not required. choices: boot;pxe. The script type, can not be changed once created.
api_account: ${5:default} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(vultr.ini) file.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ACCOUNT) is used as default, when defined.
api_retries: ${6:5} # not required. Amount of retries in case of the Vultr API retuns an HTTP 503 code.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_RETRIES) is used as default, when defined.
api_key: ${7:undefined} # not required. API key of the Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_KEY) is used as default, when defined.
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the script.
api_endpoint: ${9:https://api.vultr.com} # not required. URL to API endpint (without trailing slash).,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ENDPOINT) is used as default, when defined.
api_timeout: ${10:60} # not required. HTTP timeout to Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_TIMEOUT) is used as default, when defined.
vr_user:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the user
validate_certs: ${2:true} # not required. Validate SSL certs of the Vultr API.
api_timeout: ${3:60} # not required. HTTP timeout to Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_TIMEOUT) is used as default, when defined.

acls: ${4|manage_users,subscriptions,provisioning,billing,support,abuse,dns,upgrade|} # not required. choices: manage_users;subscriptions;provisioning;billing;support;abuse;dns;upgrade. List of ACLs this users should have, see U(https://www.vultr.com/api/#user_user_list).,Required if C(state=present).,One or more of the choices list, some depend on each other.
force: ${5|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Password will only be changed with enforcement.
password: ${6:undefined} # not required. Password of the user.,Only considered while creating a user or when C(force=yes).
api_enabled: ${7|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. Whether the API is enabled or not.
api_endpoint: ${8:https://api.vultr.com} # not required. URL to API endpint (without trailing slash).,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ENDPOINT) is used as default, when defined.
api_retries: ${9:5} # not required. Amount of retries in case of the Vultr API retuns an HTTP 503 code.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_RETRIES) is used as default, when defined.
email: ${10:undefined} # not required. Email of the user.,Required if C(state=present).
api_account: ${11:default} # not required. Name of the ini section in the C(vultr.ini) file.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_ACCOUNT) is used as default, when defined.
api_key: ${12:undefined} # not required. API key of the Vultr API.,The ENV variable C(VULTR_API_KEY) is used as default, when defined.
state: ${13|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the user.

vsphere_copy.description: Copy a file to a vCenter datastore
body: vsphere_copy:
datacenter: ${1:undefined} # required. The datacenter on the vCenter server that holds the datastore.
password: ${2:undefined} # required. The password to authenticate on the vCenter server.
datastore: ${3:undefined} # required. The datastore on the vCenter server to push files to.
src: ${4:undefined} # required. The file to push to vCenter
path: ${5:undefined} # required. The file to push to the datastore on the vCenter server.
login: ${6:undefined} # required. The login name to authenticate on the vCenter server.
host: ${7:undefined} # required. The vCenter server on which the datastore is available.
validate_certs: ${8:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be set to C(no) when no other option exists.

vsphere_guest.description: Create/delete/manage a guest VM through VMware vSphere.
body: vsphere_guest:
guest: ${1:undefined} # required. The virtual server name you wish to manage.
password: ${2:null} # required. Password of the user to connect to vcenter as.
vcenter_hostname: ${3:null} # required. The hostname of the vcenter server the module will connect to, to create the guest.
username: ${4:null} # required. Username to connect to vcenter as.
cluster: ${5:None} # not required. The name of the cluster to create the VM in. By default this is derived from the host you tell the module to build the guest on.

validate_certs: ${6:true} # not required. Validate SSL certs.  Note, if running on python without SSLContext support (typically, python < 2.7.9) you will have to set this to C(no) as pysphere does not support validating certificates on older python. Prior to 2.1, this module would always validate on python >= 2.7.9 and never validate on python <= 2.7.8.

vm_hw_version: ${7:null} # not required. Desired hardware version identifier (for example, "vmx-08" for vms that needs to be managed with vSphere Client). Note that changing hardware version of existing vm is not supported.
vm_hardware: ${8:null} # not required. A key, value list of VM config settings. Must include ['memory_mb', 'num_cpus', 'osid', 'scsi'].
power_on_after_clone: ${9:true} # not required. Specifies if the VM should be powered on after the clone.
vm_nic: ${10:null} # not required. A key, value list of nics, their types and what network to put them on.
vmware_guest_facts: ${11:null} # not required. Gather facts from vCenter on a particular VM
esxi: ${12:null} # not required. Dictionary which includes datacenter and hostname on which the VM should be created. For standalone ESXi hosts, ha-datacenter should be used as the datacenter name

from_template: ${13:false} # not required. Specifies if the VM should be deployed from a template (mutually exclusive with 'state' parameter). No guest customization changes to hardware such as CPU, RAM, NICs or Disks can be applied when launching from template.
vm_extra_config: ${14:null} # not required. A key, value pair of any extra values you want set or changed in the vmx file of the VM. Useful to set advanced options on the VM.
template_src: ${15:None} # not required. Name of the source template to deploy from
snapshot_to_clone: ${16:none} # not required. A string that when specified, will create a linked clone copy of the VM. Snapshot must already be taken in vCenter.
force: ${17:no} # not required. Boolean. Allows you to run commands which may alter the running state of a guest. Also used to reconfigure and destroy.
resource_pool: ${18:None} # not required. The name of the resource_pool to create the VM in.
vm_disk: ${19:null} # not required. A key, value list of disks and their sizes and which datastore to keep it in.

state: ${20|present,powered_off,absent,powered_on,restarted,reconfigured|} # not required. choices: present;powered_off;absent;powered_on;restarted;reconfigured. Indicate desired state of the vm. 'reconfigured' only applies changes to 'vm_cdrom', 'memory_mb', and 'num_cpus' in vm_hardware parameter. The 'memory_mb' and 'num_cpus' changes are applied to powered-on vms when hot-plugging is enabled for the guest.

vyos_banner.description: Manage multiline banners on VyOS devices
body: vyos_banner:
banner: ${1|pre-login,post-login|} # required. choices: pre-login;post-login. Specifies which banner that should be configured on the remote device.
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specifies whether or not the configuration is present in the current devices active running configuration.

provider: ${3:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,For more information please see the L(Network Guide, ../network/getting_started/network_differences.html#multiple-communication-protocols).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

text: ${4:null} # not required. The banner text that should be present in the remote device running configuration. This argument accepts a multiline string, with no empty lines. Requires I(state=present).

vyos_command.description: Run one or more commands on VyOS devices
body: vyos_command:

commands: ${1:undefined} # required. The ordered set of commands to execute on the remote device running VyOS.  The output from the command execution is returned to the playbook.  If the I(wait_for) argument is provided, the module is not returned until the condition is satisfied or the number of retries has been exceeded.

match: ${2|any,all|} # not required. choices: any;all. The I(match) argument is used in conjunction with the I(wait_for) argument to specify the match policy. Valid values are C(all) or C(any).  If the value is set to C(all) then all conditionals in the wait_for must be satisfied.  If the value is set to C(any) then only one of the values must be satisfied.

retries: ${3:10} # not required. Specifies the number of retries a command should be tried before it is considered failed. The command is run on the target device every retry and evaluated against the I(wait_for) conditionals.

wait_for: ${4:null} # not required. Specifies what to evaluate from the output of the command and what conditionals to apply.  This argument will cause the task to wait for a particular conditional to be true before moving forward.  If the conditional is not true by the configured I(retries), the task fails. See examples.

interval: ${5:1} # not required. Configures the interval in seconds to wait between I(retries) of the command. If the command does not pass the specified conditions, the interval indicates how long to wait before trying the command again.

provider: ${6:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,For more information please see the L(Network Guide, ../network/getting_started/network_differences.html#multiple-communication-protocols).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

vyos_config.description: Manage VyOS configuration on remote device
body: vyos_config:

src: ${1:null} # not required. The C(src) argument specifies the path to the source config file to load.  The source config file can either be in bracket format or set format.  The source file can include Jinja2 template variables.

backup: ${2|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. The C(backup) argument will backup the current devices active configuration to the Ansible control host prior to making any changes.  The backup file will be located in the backup folder in the root of the playbook

match: ${3|line,none|} # not required. choices: line;none. The C(match) argument controls the method used to match against the current active configuration.  By default, the desired config is matched against the active config and the deltas are loaded.  If the C(match) argument is set to C(none) the active configuration is ignored and the configuration is always loaded.

comment: ${4:configured by vyos_config} # not required. Allows a commit description to be specified to be included when the configuration is committed.  If the configuration is not changed or committed, this argument is ignored.

save: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. The C(save) argument controls whether or not changes made to the active configuration are saved to disk.  This is independent of committing the config.  When set to True, the active configuration is saved.

config: ${6:null} # not required. The C(config) argument specifies the base configuration to use to compare against the desired configuration.  If this value is not specified, the module will automatically retrieve the current active configuration from the remote device.

provider: ${7:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,For more information please see the L(Network Guide, ../network/getting_started/network_differences.html#multiple-communication-protocols).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
lines: ${8:null} # not required. The ordered set of configuration lines to be managed and compared with the existing configuration on the remote device.

vyos_facts.description: Collect facts from remote devices running VyOS
body: vyos_facts:

provider: ${1:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,For more information please see the L(Network Guide, ../network/getting_started/network_differences.html#multiple-communication-protocols).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

gather_subset: ${2:!config} # not required. When supplied, this argument will restrict the facts collected to a given subset.  Possible values for this argument include all, default, config, and neighbors.  Can specify a list of values to include a larger subset.  Values can also be used with an initial C(M(!)) to specify that a specific subset should not be collected.

vyos_interface.description: Manage Interface on VyOS network devices
body: vyos_interface:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the Interface.
description: ${2:undefined} # not required. Description of Interface.

delay: ${3:10} # not required. Time in seconds to wait before checking for the operational state on remote device. This wait is applicable for operational state argument which are I(state) with values C(up)/C(down) and I(neighbors).
mtu: ${4:undefined} # not required. Maximum size of transmit packet.
neighbors: ${5:undefined} # not required. Check the operational state of given interface C(name) for LLDP neighbor.,The following suboptions are available.
duplex: ${6|full,half,auto|} # not required. choices: full;half;auto. Interface link status.

provider: ${7:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,For more information please see the L(Network Guide, ../network/getting_started/network_differences.html#multiple-communication-protocols).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
enabled: ${8:undefined} # not required. Interface link status.
speed: ${9:undefined} # not required. Interface link speed.

state: ${10|present,absent,up,down|} # not required. choices: present;absent;up;down. State of the Interface configuration, C(up) means present and operationally up and C(down) means present and operationally C(down)
aggregate: ${11:undefined} # not required. List of Interfaces definitions.

vyos_l3_interface.description: Manage L3 interfaces on VyOS network devices
body: vyos_l3_interface:
ipv4: ${1:undefined} # not required. IPv4 of the L3 interface.
ipv6: ${2:undefined} # not required. IPv6 of the L3 interface.
state: ${3|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the L3 interface configuration.

provider: ${4:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,For more information please see the L(Network Guide, ../network/getting_started/network_differences.html#multiple-communication-protocols).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
aggregate: ${5:undefined} # not required. List of L3 interfaces definitions
name: ${6:undefined} # not required. Name of the L3 interface.

vyos_linkagg.description: Manage link aggregation groups on VyOS network devices
body: vyos_linkagg:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the link aggregation group.

mode: ${2|802.3ad,active-backup,broadcast,round-robin,transmit-load-balance,adaptive-load-balance,xor-hash,on|} # not required. choices: 802.3ad;active-backup;broadcast;round-robin;transmit-load-balance;adaptive-load-balance;xor-hash;on. Mode of the link aggregation group.
state: ${3|present,absent,up,down|} # not required. choices: present;absent;up;down. State of the link aggregation group.
members: ${4:undefined} # not required. List of members of the link aggregation group.

provider: ${5:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,For more information please see the L(Network Guide, ../network/getting_started/network_differences.html#multiple-communication-protocols).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
aggregate: ${6:undefined} # not required. List of link aggregation definitions.

vyos_lldp.description: Manage LLDP configuration on VyOS network devices
body: vyos_lldp:
state: ${1|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the LLDP configuration.

provider: ${2:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,For more information please see the L(Network Guide, ../network/getting_started/network_differences.html#multiple-communication-protocols).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

vyos_lldp_interface.description: Manage LLDP interfaces configuration on VyOS network devices
body: vyos_lldp_interface:
state: ${1|present,absent,enabled,disabled|} # not required. choices: present;absent;enabled;disabled. State of the LLDP configuration.

provider: ${2:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,For more information please see the L(Network Guide, ../network/getting_started/network_differences.html#multiple-communication-protocols).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
aggregate: ${3:undefined} # not required. List of interfaces LLDP should be configured on.
name: ${4:undefined} # not required. Name of the interface LLDP should be configured on.
vyos_logging:
dest: ${1|console,file,global,host,user|} # not required. choices: console;file;global;host;user. Destination of the logs.
facility: ${2:undefined} # not required. Set logging facility.
level: ${3:undefined} # not required. Set logging severity levels.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the logging configuration.

provider: ${5:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,For more information please see the L(Network Guide, ../network/getting_started/network_differences.html#multiple-communication-protocols).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
aggregate: ${6:undefined} # not required. List of logging definitions.
name: ${7:undefined} # not required. If value of C(dest) is I(file) it indicates file-name, for I(user) it indicates username and for I(host) indicates the host name to be notified.

vyos_static_route.description: Manage static IP routes on Vyatta VyOS network devices
body: vyos_static_route:
mask: ${1:undefined} # not required. Network prefix mask of the static route.
prefix: ${2:undefined} # not required. Network prefix of the static route. C(mask) param should be ignored if C(prefix) is provided with C(mask) value C(prefix/mask).
next_hop: ${3:undefined} # not required. Next hop IP of the static route.
admin_distance: ${4:undefined} # not required. Admin distance of the static route.
state: ${5|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the static route configuration.

provider: ${6:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,For more information please see the L(Network Guide, ../network/getting_started/network_differences.html#multiple-communication-protocols).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.
aggregate: ${7:undefined} # not required. List of static route definitions

vyos_system.description: Run `set system` commands on VyOS devices
body: vyos_system:
name_servers: ${1:null} # not required. A list of name servers to use with the device. Mutually exclusive with I(domain_search)
domain_search: ${2:undefined} # not required. A list of domain names to search. Mutually exclusive with I(name_server)
domain_name: ${3:undefined} # not required. The new domain name to apply to the device.
state: ${4|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether to apply (C(present)) or remove (C(absent)) the settings.
host_name: ${5:undefined} # not required. Configure the device hostname parameter. This option takes an ASCII string value.

provider: ${6:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,For more information please see the L(Network Guide, ../network/getting_started/network_differences.html#multiple-communication-protocols).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

vyos_user.description: Manage the collection of local users on VyOS device
body: vyos_user:

purge: ${1:false} # not required. Instructs the module to consider the resource definition absolute. It will remove any previously configured usernames on the device with the exception of the `admin` user (the current defined set of users).

provider: ${2:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,For more information please see the L(Network Guide, ../network/getting_started/network_differences.html#multiple-communication-protocols).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

configured_password: ${3:undefined} # not required. The password to be configured on the VyOS device. The password needs to be provided in clear and it will be encrypted on the device. Please note that this option is not same as C(provider password).
level: ${4:undefined} # not required. The C(level) argument configures the level of the user when logged into the system. This argument accepts string values admin or operator.
full_name: ${5:undefined} # not required. The C(full_name) argument provides the full name of the user account to be created on the remote device. This argument accepts any text string value.

state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Configures the state of the username definition as it relates to the device operational configuration. When set to I(present), the username(s) should be configured in the device active configuration and when set to I(absent) the username(s) should not be in the device active configuration

update_password: ${7|on_create,always|} # not required. choices: on_create;always. Since passwords are encrypted in the device running config, this argument will instruct the module when to change the password.  When set to C(always), the password will always be updated in the device and when set to C(on_create) the password will be updated only if the username is created.

aggregate: ${8:undefined} # not required. The set of username objects to be configured on the remote VyOS device. The list entries can either be the username or a hash of username and properties. This argument is mutually exclusive with the C(name) argument.

name: ${9:undefined} # not required. The username to be configured on the VyOS device. This argument accepts a string value and is mutually exclusive with the C(aggregate) argument. Please note that this option is not same as C(provider username).

vyos_vlan.description: Manage VLANs on VyOS network devices
body: vyos_vlan:
interfaces: ${1:undefined} # required. List of interfaces that should be associated to the VLAN.
vlan_id: ${2:undefined} # required. ID of the VLAN. Range 0-4094.
address: ${3:undefined} # not required. Configure Virtual interface address.
purge: ${4:false} # not required. Purge VLANs not defined in the I(aggregate) parameter.
delay: ${5:10} # not required. Delay the play should wait to check for declarative intent params values.

provider: ${6:null} # not required. B(Deprecated),Starting with Ansible 2.5 we recommend using C(connection: network_cli).,For more information please see the L(Network Guide, ../network/getting_started/network_differences.html#multiple-communication-protocols).,HORIZONTALLINE,A dict object containing connection details.

associated_interfaces: ${7:undefined} # not required. This is a intent option and checks the operational state of the for given vlan C(name) for associated interfaces. If the value in the C(associated_interfaces) does not match with the operational state of vlan on device it will result in failure.
name: ${8:undefined} # not required. Name of the VLAN.
state: ${9|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the VLAN configuration.
aggregate: ${10:undefined} # not required. List of VLANs definitions.

wait_for.description: Waits for a condition before continuing
body: wait_for:

state: ${1|absent,drained,present,started,stopped|} # not required. choices: absent;drained;present;started;stopped. Either C(present), C(started), or C(stopped), C(absent), or C(drained).,When checking a port C(started) will ensure the port is open, C(stopped) will check that it is closed, C(drained) will check for active connections.,When checking for a file or a search string C(present) or C(started) will ensure that the file or string is present before continuing, C(absent) will check that file is absent or removed.
delay: ${2:0} # not required. Number of seconds to wait before starting to poll.
search_regex: ${3:undefined} # not required. Can be used to match a string in either a file or a socket connection.,Defaults to a multiline regex.
port: ${4:undefined} # not required. Port number to poll.
sleep: ${5:1} # not required. Number of seconds to sleep between checks, before 2.3 this was hardcoded to 1 second.
path: ${6:undefined} # not required. Path to a file on the filesystem that must exist before continuing.
exclude_hosts: ${7:undefined} # not required. List of hosts or IPs to ignore when looking for active TCP connections for C(drained) state.
msg: ${8:null} # not required. This overrides the normal error message from a failure to meet the required conditions.
connect_timeout: ${9:5} # not required. Maximum number of seconds to wait for a connection to happen before closing and retrying.
host: ${10:127.0.0.1} # not required. A resolvable hostname or IP address to wait for.

timeout: ${11:300} # not required. Maximum number of seconds to wait for, when used with another condition it will force an error.,When used without other conditions it is equivalent of just sleeping.
active_connection_states: ${12:ESTABLISHED,FIN_WAIT1,FIN_WAIT2,SYN_RECV,SYN_SENT,TIME_WAIT} # not required. The list of TCP connection states which are counted as active connections.

wait_for_connection.description: Waits until remote system is reachable/usable
body: wait_for_connection:
connect_timeout: ${1:5} # not required. Maximum number of seconds to wait for a connection to happen before closing and retrying.
sleep: ${2:1} # not required. Number of seconds to sleep between checks.
delay: ${3:0} # not required. Number of seconds to wait before starting to poll.
timeout: ${4:600} # not required. Maximum number of seconds to wait for.

wakeonlan.description: Send a magic Wake-on-LAN (WoL) broadcast packet
body: wakeonlan:
mac: ${1:undefined} # required. MAC address to send Wake-on-LAN broadcast packet for.
port: ${2:7} # not required. UDP port to use for magic Wake-on-LAN packet.
broadcast: ${3:255.255.255.255} # not required. Network broadcast address to use for broadcasting magic Wake-on-LAN packet.

webfaction_app.description: Add or remove applications on a Webfaction host
body: webfaction_app:
type: ${1:undefined} # required. The type of application to create. See the Webfaction docs at http://docs.webfaction.com/xmlrpc-api/apps.html for a list.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the application
login_name: ${3:undefined} # required. The webfaction account to use
login_password: ${4:undefined} # required. The webfaction password to use
state: ${5|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the application should exist
extra_info: ${6:null} # not required. Any extra parameters required by the app
machine: ${7:undefined} # not required. The machine name to use (optional for accounts with only one machine)
autostart: ${8:no} # not required. Whether the app should restart with an autostart.cgi script
port_open: ${9:false} # not required. IF the port should be opened

webfaction_db.description: Add or remove a database on Webfaction
body: webfaction_db:
type: ${1|mysql,postgresql|} # required. choices: mysql;postgresql. The type of database to create.
login_name: ${2:undefined} # required. The webfaction account to use
login_password: ${3:undefined} # required. The webfaction password to use
name: ${4:undefined} # required. The name of the database
state: ${5|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the database should exist
machine: ${6:undefined} # not required. The machine name to use (optional for accounts with only one machine)
password: ${7:None} # not required. The password for the new database user.

webfaction_domain.description: Add or remove domains and subdomains on Webfaction
body: webfaction_domain:
login_name: ${1:undefined} # required. The webfaction account to use
name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the domain
login_password: ${3:undefined} # required. The webfaction password to use
subdomains: ${4:null} # not required. Any subdomains to create.
state: ${5|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the domain should exist

webfaction_mailbox.description: Add or remove mailboxes on Webfaction
body: webfaction_mailbox:
mailbox_name: ${1:undefined} # required. The name of the mailbox
mailbox_password: ${2:null} # required. The password for the mailbox
login_name: ${3:undefined} # required. The webfaction account to use
login_password: ${4:undefined} # required. The webfaction password to use
state: ${5|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the mailbox should exist

webfaction_site.description: Add or remove a website on a Webfaction host
body: webfaction_site:
login_password: ${1:undefined} # required. The webfaction password to use
host: ${2:undefined} # required. The webfaction host on which the site should be created.
login_name: ${3:undefined} # required. The webfaction account to use
name: ${4:undefined} # required. The name of the website
site_apps: ${5:undefined} # not required. A mapping of URLs to apps
subdomains: ${6:null} # not required. A list of subdomains associated with this site.
state: ${7|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the website should exist
https: ${8:false} # not required. Whether or not to use HTTPS

win_acl.description: Set file/directory/registry permissions for a system user or group
body: win_acl:
user: ${1:undefined} # required. User or Group to add specified rights to act on src file/folder or registry key.
path: ${2:undefined} # required. The path to the file or directory.

rights: ${3:undefined} # required. The rights/permissions that are to be allowed/denied for the specified user or group for the item at C(path).,If C(path) is a file or directory, rights can be any right under MSDN FileSystemRights U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.security.accesscontrol.filesystemrights=.aspx).,If C(path) is a registry key, rights can be any right under MSDN RegistryRights U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.security.accesscontrol.registryrights.aspx).
type: ${4|allow,deny|} # required. choices: allow;deny. Specify whether to allow or deny the rights specified.

inherit: ${5|ContainerInherit,None,ObjectInherit|} # not required. choices: ContainerInherit;None;ObjectInherit. Inherit flags on the ACL rules.,Can be specified as a comma separated list, e.g. C(ContainerInherit), C(ObjectInherit).,For more information on the choices see MSDN InheritanceFlags enumeration at U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.security.accesscontrol.inheritanceflags.aspx).
state: ${6|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Specify whether to add C(present) or remove C(absent) the specified access rule.

propagation: ${7|InheritOnly,None,NoPropagateInherit|} # not required. choices: InheritOnly;None;NoPropagateInherit. Propagation flag on the ACL rules.,For more information on the choices see MSDN PropagationFlags enumeration at U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.security.accesscontrol.propagationflags.aspx).
win_acl_inheritance:
path: ${1:undefined} # required. Path to be used for changing inheritance
state: ${2|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify whether to enable I(present) or disable I(absent) ACL inheritance

reorganize: ${3|false,true|} # not required. choices: false;true. For P(state) = I(absent), indicates if the inherited ACE's should be copied from the parent directory. This is necessary (in combination with removal) for a simple ACL instead of using multiple ACE deny entries.,For P(state) = I(present), indicates if the inherited ACE's should be deduplicated compared to the parent directory. This removes complexity of the ACL structure.

win_audit_policy_system.description: Used to make changes to the system wide Audit Policy.
body: win_audit_policy_system:
audit_type: ${1|success,failure,none|} # required. choices: success;failure;none. The type of event you would like to audit for.,Accepts a list. See examples.
subcategory: ${2:undefined} # not required. Single string value for the subcategory you would like to adjust the policy on.,Cannot be used with I(category). You must define one or the other.

category: ${3:undefined} # not required. Single string value for the category you would like to adjust the policy on.,Cannot be used with I(subcategory). You must define one or the other.,Changing this setting causes all subcategories to be adjusted to the defined I(audit_type).

win_audit_rule.description: Adds an audit rule to files, folders, or registry keys
body: win_audit_rule:
user: ${1:undefined} # required. The user or group to adjust rules for.
path: ${2:undefined} # required. Path to the file, folder, or registry key.,Registry paths should be in Powershell format, beginning with an abbreviation for the root such as, 'hklm:\software'.

rights: ${3:undefined} # required. Comma seperated list of the rights desired. Only required for adding a rule.,If I(path) is a file or directory, rights can be any right under MSDN FileSystemRights U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.security.accesscontrol.filesystemrights.aspx).,If I(path) is a registry key, rights can be any right under MSDN RegistryRights U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.security.accesscontrol.registryrights.aspx).
audit_flags: ${4|Success,Failure|} # required. choices: Success;Failure. Defines whether to log on failure, success, or both.,To log both define as comma seperated list "Success, Failure".

propagation_flags: ${5|None,InherityOnly,NoPropagateInherit|} # not required. choices: None;InherityOnly;NoPropagateInherit. Propagation flag on the audit rules.,This value is ignored when the path type is a file.,For more information on the choices see MSDN PropagationFlags enumeration at U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.security.accesscontrol.propagationflags.aspx).

state: ${6|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Whether the rule should be C(present) or C(absent).,For absent, only I(path), I(user), and I(state) are required.,Specifying C(absent) will remove all rules matching the defined I(user).

inheritance_flags: ${7|ContainerInherit,ObjectInherit|} # not required. choices: ContainerInherit;ObjectInherit. Defines what objects inside of a folder or registry key will inherit the settings.,If you are setting a rule on a file, this value has to be changed to C(none).,For more information on the choices see MSDN PropagationFlags enumeration at U(https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.security.accesscontrol.inheritanceflags.aspx).
win_certificate_store:
thumbprint: ${1:undefined} # not required. The thumbprint as a hex string to either export or remove.,See the examples for how to specify the thumbprint.

password: ${2:undefined} # not required. The password of the pkcs12 certificate key.,This is used when reading a pkcs12 certificate file or the password to set when C(state=exported) and C(file_type=pkcs12).,If the pkcs12 file has no password set or no password should be set on the exported file, do not set this option.
