desktop_interact: ${6:no} # not required. Whether to allow the service user to interact with the desktop.,This should only be set to true when using the LocalSystem username.
start_mode: ${7|auto,manual,disabled,delayed|} # not required. choices: auto;manual;disabled;delayed. Set the startup type for the service.,C(delayed) added in Ansible 2.3
path: ${8:undefined} # not required. The path to the executable to set for the service.

dependencies: ${9:undefined} # not required. A list of service dependencies to set for this particular service.,This should be a list of service names and not the display name of the service.,This works by C(dependency_action) to either add/remove or set the services in this list.
username: ${10:undefined} # not required. The username to set the service to start as.,This and the C(password) argument must be supplied together.
display_name: ${11:undefined} # not required. The display name to set for the service.

force_dependent_services: ${12:no} # not required. If C(yes), stopping or restarting a service with dependent services will force the dependent services to stop or restart also.,If C(no), stopping or restarting a service with dependent services may fail.
win_share:
path: ${1:undefined} # required. Share directory.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. Share name.
description: ${3:undefined} # not required. Share description
caching_mode: ${4|BranchCache,Documents,Manual,None,Programs,Unknown|} # not required. choices: BranchCache;Documents;Manual;None;Programs;Unknown. Set the CachingMode for this share.
change: ${5:undefined} # not required. Specify user list that should get read and write access on share, separated by comma.
list: ${6:no} # not required. Specify whether to allow or deny file listing, in case user got no permission on share.
read: ${7:undefined} # not required. Specify user list that should get read access on share, separated by comma.
deny: ${8:undefined} # not required. Specify user list that should get no access, regardless of implied access on share, separated by comma.
full: ${9:undefined} # not required. Specify user list that should get full access on share, separated by comma.
state: ${10|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Specify whether to add C(present) or remove C(absent) the specified share.
encrypt: ${11:no} # not required. Sets whether to encrypt the traffic to the share or not.

win_shell.description: Execute shell commands on target hosts.
body: win_shell:
free_form: ${1:undefined} # required. The C(win_shell) module takes a free form command to run.  There is no parameter actually named 'free form'. See the examples!
chdir: ${2:undefined} # not required. set the specified path as the current working directory before executing a command
executable: ${3:undefined} # not required. change the shell used to execute the command (eg, C(cmd)). The target shell must accept a C(/c) parameter followed by the raw command line to be executed.
creates: ${4:undefined} # not required. a path or path filter pattern; when the referenced path exists on the target host, the task will be skipped.
stdin: ${5:undefined} # not required. Set the stdin of the command directly to the specified value.
removes: ${6:undefined} # not required. a path or path filter pattern; when the referenced path B(does not) exist on the target host, the task will be skipped.
win_shortcut:
dest: ${1:undefined} # required. Destination file for the shortcuting file.,File name should have a C(.lnk) or C(.url) extension.
windowstyle: ${2|maximized,minimized,normal|} # not required. choices: maximized;minimized;normal. Influences how the application is displayed when it is launched.
directory: ${3:undefined} # not required. Working directory for executable defined in C(src).
description: ${4:undefined} # not required. Description for the shortcut.,This is usually shown when hoovering the icon.

hotkey: ${5:undefined} # not required. Key combination for the shortcut.,This is a combination of one or more modifiers and a key.,Possible modifiers are Alt, Ctrl, Shift, Ext.,Possible keys are [A-Z] and [0-9].
args: ${6:undefined} # not required. Additional arguments for the executable defined in C(src).
src: ${7:undefined} # not required. Executable or URL the shortcut points to.,The executable needs to be in your PATH, or has to be an absolute path to the executable.

icon: ${8:undefined} # not required. Icon used for the shortcut.,File name should have a C(.ico) extension.,The file name is followed by a comma and the number in the library file (.dll) or use 0 for an image file.
state: ${9|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. When C(present), creates or updates the shortcut.,When C(absent), removes the shortcut if it exists.

win_stat.description: returns information about a Windows file
body: win_stat:
path: ${1:undefined} # required. The full path of the file/object to get the facts of; both forward and back slashes are accepted.

checksum_algorithm: ${2|md5,sha1,sha256,sha384,sha512|} # not required. choices: md5;sha1;sha256;sha384;sha512. Algorithm to determine checksum of file. Will throw an error if the host is unable to use specified algorithm.
get_checksum: ${3:yes} # not required. Whether to return a checksum of the file (default sha1)

get_md5: ${4:no} # not required. Whether to return the checksum sum of the file. Between Ansible 1.9 and 2.2 this is no longer an MD5, but a SHA1 instead. As of Ansible 2.3 this is back to an MD5. Will return None if host is unable to use specified algorithm.,The default of this option changed from C(yes) to C(no) in Ansible 2.5 and will be removed altogether in Ansible 2.9.,Use C(get_checksum=true) with C(checksum_algorithm=md5) to return an md5 hash under the C(checksum) return value.
win_tempfile:
state: ${1|file,directory|} # not required. choices: file;directory. Whether to create file or directory.
prefix: ${2:ansible.} # not required. Prefix of file/directory name created by module.
path: ${3:%TEMP%} # not required. Location where temporary file or directory should be created.,If path is not specified default system temporary directory (%TEMP%) will be used.
suffix: ${4:} # not required. Suffix of file/directory name created by module.

win_template.description: Templates a file out to a remote server.
body: win_template:
dest: ${1:undefined} # required. Location to render the template to on the remote machine.
src: ${2:undefined} # required. Path of a Jinja2 formatted template on the local server. This can be a relative or absolute path.

force: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. the default is C(yes), which will replace the remote file when contents are different than the source.  If C(no), the file will only be transferred if the destination does not exist.
block_start_string: ${4:{%} # not required. The string marking the beginning of a block.
variable_end_string: ${5:}}} # not required. The string marking the end of a print statement.
trim_blocks: ${6:no} # not required. If this is set to True the first newline after a block is removed (block, not variable tag!).

newline_sequence: ${7|
,,
|} # not required. choices: 
;;
. Specify the newline sequence to use for templating files.
block_end_string: ${8:%}} # not required. The string marking the end of a block.
variable_start_string: ${9:{{} # not required. The string marking the beginning of a print statement.
win_timezone:
timezone: ${1:undefined} # required. Timezone to set to. Example Central Standard Time

win_toast.description: Sends Toast windows notification to logged in users on Windows 10 or later hosts
body: win_toast:
expire: ${1:45} # not required. How long in seconds before the notification expires.
msg: ${2:Hello, World!} # not required. The message to appear inside the notification.  May include \n to format the message to appear within the Action Center.
popup: ${3:true} # not required. If false, the notification will not pop up and will only appear in the Action Center.
title: ${4:Notification HH:mm} # not required. The notification title, which appears in the pop up..
group: ${5:Powershell} # not required. Which notification group to add the notification to.
tag: ${6:Ansible} # not required. The tag to add to the notification.

win_unzip.description: Unzips compressed files and archives on the Windows node
body: win_unzip:
src: ${1:undefined} # required. File to be unzipped (provide absolute path).
dest: ${2:undefined} # required. Destination of zip file (provide absolute path of directory). If it does not exist, the directory will be created.
creates: ${3:undefined} # not required. If this file or directory exists the specified src will not be extracted.
delete_archive: ${4:no} # not required. Remove the zip file, after unzipping.
recurse: ${5:no} # not required. Recursively expand zipped files within the src file.,Setting to a value of C(yes) requires the PSCX module to be installed.
win_updates:

reboot: ${1:no} # not required. Ansible will automatically reboot the remote host if it is required and continue to install updates after the reboot.,This can be used instead of using a M(win_reboot) task after this one and ensures all updates for that category is installed in one go.,Async does not work when C(reboot=True).
reboot_timeout: ${2:1200} # not required. The time in seconds to wait until the host is back online from a reboot.,This is only used if C(reboot=True) and a reboot is required.

category_names: ${3|Application,Connectors,CriticalUpdates,DefinitionUpdates,DeveloperKits,FeaturePacks,Guidance,SecurityUpdates,ServicePacks,Tools,UpdateRollups,Updates|} # not required. choices: Application;Connectors;CriticalUpdates;DefinitionUpdates;DeveloperKits;FeaturePacks;Guidance;SecurityUpdates;ServicePacks;Tools;UpdateRollups;Updates. A scalar or list of categories to install updates from

blacklist: ${4:undefined} # not required. A list of update titles or KB numbers that can be used to specify which updates are to be excluded from installation.,If an available update does match one of the entries, then it is skipped and not installed.,Each entry can either be the KB article or Update title as a regex according to the PowerShell regex rules.

whitelist: ${5:undefined} # not required. A list of update titles or KB numbers that can be used to specify which updates are to be searched or installed.,If an available update does not match one of the entries, then it is skipped and not installed.,Each entry can either be the KB article or Update title as a regex according to the PowerShell regex rules.,The whitelist is only validated on updates that were found based on I(category_names). It will not force the module to install an update if it was not in the category specified.

state: ${6|installed,searched|} # not required. choices: installed;searched. Controls whether found updates are returned as a list or actually installed.,This module also supports Ansible check mode, which has the same effect as setting state=searched
log_path: ${7:undefined} # not required. If set, C(win_updates) will append update progress to the specified file. The directory must already exist.
win_uri:
url: ${1:undefined} # required. Supports FTP, HTTP or HTTPS URLs in the form of (ftp|http|https)://host.domain:port/path.
dest: ${2:undefined} # not required. Output the response body to a file.
creates: ${3:undefined} # not required. A filename, when it already exists, this step will be skipped.

method: ${4|CONNECT,DELETE,GET,HEAD,MERGE,OPTIONS,PATCH,POST,PUT,REFRESH,TRACE|} # not required. choices: CONNECT;DELETE;GET;HEAD;MERGE;OPTIONS;PATCH;POST;PUT;REFRESH;TRACE. The HTTP Method of the request or response.

force_basic_auth: ${5:no} # not required. By default the authentication information is only sent when a webservice responds to an initial request with a 401 status. Since some basic auth services do not properly send a 401, logins will fail.,This option forces the sending of the Basic authentication header upon the initial request.

follow_redirects: ${6|all,none,safe|} # not required. choices: all;none;safe. Whether or not the C(win_uri) module should follow redirects.,C(all) will follow all redirects.,C(none) will not follow any redirects.,C(safe) will follow only "safe" redirects, where "safe" means that the client is only doing a C(GET) or C(HEAD) on the URI to which it is being redirected.

client_cert: ${7:undefined} # not required. Specifies the client certificate (.pfx) that is used for a secure web request.,The WinRM connection must be authenticated with C(CredSSP) if the certificate file is not password protected.,Other authentication types can set I(client_cert_password) when the cert is password protected.
removes: ${8:undefined} # not required. A filename, when it does not exist, this step will be skipped.
status_code: ${9:200} # not required. A valid, numeric, HTTP status code that signifies success of the request.,Can also be comma separated list of status codes.
validate_certs: ${10:yes} # not required. If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated.  This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

timeout: ${11:30} # not required. Specifies how long the request can be pending before it times out (in seconds).,The value 0 (zero) specifies an indefinite time-out.,A Domain Name System (DNS) query can take up to 15 seconds to return or time out. If your request contains a host name that requires resolution, and you set C(timeout) to a value greater than zero, but less than 15 seconds, it can take 15 seconds or more before your request times out.

return_content: ${12:no} # not required. Whether or not to return the body of the response as a "content" key in the dictionary result. If the reported Content-type is "application/json", then the JSON is additionally loaded into a key called C(json) in the dictionary results.
content_type: ${13:undefined} # not required. Sets the "Content-Type" header.
password: ${14:undefined} # not required. Password to use for authentication.

use_basic_parsing: ${15:yes} # not required. As of Ansible 2.5, this option is no longer valid and cannot be changed from C(yes), this option will be removed in Ansible 2.7.,Before Ansible 2.5, this module relies upon 'Invoke-WebRequest', which by default uses the Internet Explorer Engine to parse a webpage.,There's an edge-case where if a user hasn't run IE before, this will fail.,The only advantage to using the Internet Explorer praser is that you can traverse the DOM in a powershell script.,That isn't useful for Ansible, so by default we toggle 'UseBasicParsing'. However, you can toggle that off here.
user: ${16:undefined} # not required. Username to use for authentication.
client_cert_password: ${17:undefined} # not required. The password for the client certificate (.pfx) file that is used for a secure web request.
body: ${18:undefined} # not required. The body of the HTTP request/response to the web service.
headers: ${19:undefined} # not required. Extra headers to set on the request, see the examples for more details on how to set this.

maximum_redirection: ${20:5} # not required. Specifies how many times C(win_uri) redirects a connection to an alternate Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) before the connection fails.,If C(maximum_redirection) is set to 0 (zero) or C(follow_redirects) is set to C(none), or set to C(safe) when not doing C(GET) or C(HEAD) it prevents all redirection.
win_user:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the user to create, remove or modify.
description: ${2:null} # not required. Description of the user
password: ${3:null} # not required. Optionally set the user's password to this (plain text) value.
account_locked: ${4|no|} # not required. choices: no. C(no) will unlock the user account if locked.
password_expired: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. C(yes) will require the user to change their password at next login. C(no) will clear the expired password flag.
fullname: ${6:null} # not required. Full name of the user
account_disabled: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. C(yes) will disable the user account.  C(no) will clear the disabled flag.
password_never_expires: ${8|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. C(yes) will set the password to never expire.  C(no) will allow the password to expire.

groups: ${9:undefined} # not required. Adds or removes the user from this comma-separated lis of groups, depending on the value of I(groups_action). When I(groups_action) is C(replace) and I(groups) is set to the empty string ('groups='), the user is removed from all groups.

groups_action: ${10|replace,add,remove|} # not required. choices: replace;add;remove. If C(replace), the user is added as a member of each group in I(groups) and removed from any other groups.  If C(add), the user is added to each group in I(groups) where not already a member.  If C(remove), the user is removed from each group in I(groups).

state: ${11|present,absent,query|} # not required. choices: present;absent;query. When C(present), creates or updates the user account.  When C(absent), removes the user account if it exists.  When C(query) (new in 1.9), retrieves the user account details without making any changes.
update_password: ${12|always,on_create|} # not required. choices: always;on_create. C(always) will update passwords if they differ.  C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users.
user_cannot_change_password: ${13|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. C(yes) will prevent the user from changing their password.  C(no) will allow the user to change their password.
win_user_right:

users: ${1:undefined} # required. A list of users or groups to add/remove on the User Right.,These can be in the form DOMAIN\user-group, user-group@DOMAIN.COM for domain users/groups.,For local users/groups it can be in the form user-group, .\user-group, SERVERNAME\user-group where SERVERNAME is the name of the remote server.,You can also add special local accounts like SYSTEM and others.

name: ${2:undefined} # required. The name of the User Right as shown by the C(Constant Name) value from U(https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dd349804.aspx).,The module will return an error if the right is invalid.

action: ${3|set,add,remove|} # not required. choices: set;add;remove. C(add) will add the users/groups to the existing right.,C(remove) will remove the users/groups from the existing right.,C(set) will replace the users/groups of the existing right.

win_wait_for.description: Waits for a condition before continuing
body: win_wait_for:

host: ${1:127.0.0.1} # not required. A resolvable hostname or IP address to wait for.,If C(state=drained) then it will only check for connections on the IP specified, you can use '0.0.0.0' to use all host IPs.
delay: ${2:undefined} # not required. The number of seconds to wait before starting to poll.
port: ${3:undefined} # not required. The port number to poll on C(host).

path: ${4:undefined} # not required. The path to a file on the filesystem to check.,If C(state) is present or started then it will wait until the file exists.,If C(state) is absent then it will wait until the file does not exist.
exclude_hosts: ${5:undefined} # not required. The list of hosts or IPs to ignore when looking for active TCP connections when C(state=drained).

search_regex: ${6:undefined} # not required. Can be used to match a string in a file.,If C(state) is present or started then it will wait until the regex matches.,If C(state) is absent then it will wait until the regex does not match.,Defaults to a multiline regex.
connect_timeout: ${7:5} # not required. The maximum number of seconds to wait for a connection to happen before closing and retrying.

state: ${8|present,started,stopped,absent,drained|} # not required. choices: present;started;stopped;absent;drained. When checking a port, C(started) will ensure the port is open, C(stopped) will check that is it closed and C(drained) will check for active connections.,When checking for a file or a search string C(present) or C(started) will ensure that the file or string is present, C(absent) will check that the file or search string is absent or removed.
sleep: ${9:1} # not required. Number of seconds to sleep between checks.
timeout: ${10:300} # not required. The maximum number of seconds to wait for.

win_wakeonlan.description: Send a magic Wake-on-LAN (WoL) broadcast packet
body: win_wakeonlan:
mac: ${1:undefined} # required. MAC address to send Wake-on-LAN broadcast packet for.
port: ${2:7} # not required. UDP port to use for magic Wake-on-LAN packet.
broadcast: ${3:255.255.255.255} # not required. Network broadcast address to use for broadcasting magic Wake-on-LAN packet.

win_webpicmd.description: Installs packages using Web Platform Installer command-line
body: win_webpicmd:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Name of the package to be installed

win_whoami.description: Returns information about the current user and process
body: win_whoami:
xattr:
path: ${1:undefined} # required. The full path of the file/object to get the facts of.,Before 2.3 this option was only usable as I(name).
value: ${2:undefined} # not required. The value to set the named name/key to, it automatically sets the C(state) to 'set'.

state: ${3|absent,all,keys,present,read|} # not required. choices: absent;all;keys;present;read. defines which state you want to do. C(read) retrieves the current value for a C(key) (default) C(present) sets C(name) to C(value), default if value is set C(all) dumps all data C(keys) retrieves all keys C(absent) deletes the key
key: ${4:undefined} # not required. The name of a specific Extended attribute key to set/retrieve.
follow: ${5:yes} # not required. If C(yes), dereferences symlinks and sets/gets attributes on symlink target, otherwise acts on symlink itself.
xbps:

recurse: ${1|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. When removing a package, also remove its dependencies, provided that they are not required by other packages and were not explicitly installed by a user.
upgrade: ${2|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether or not to upgrade whole system
state: ${3|present,absent,latest|} # not required. choices: present;absent;latest. Desired state of the package.
name: ${4:null} # not required. Name of the package to install, upgrade, or remove.
update_cache: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether or not to refresh the master package lists. This can be run as part of a package installation or as a separate step.
xenserver_facts:

xml.description: Manage bits and pieces of XML files or strings
body: xml:
path: ${1:undefined} # required. Path to the file to operate on. File must exist ahead of time.,This parameter is required, unless C(xmlstring) is given.
xmlstring: ${2:undefined} # required. A string containing XML on which to operate.,This parameter is required, unless C(path) is given.
content: ${3|attribute,text|} # not required. choices: attribute;text. Search for a given C(xpath) and get content.,This parameter requires C(xpath) to be set.
count: ${4:no} # not required. Search for a given C(xpath) and provide the count of any matches.,This parameter requires C(xpath) to be set.
pretty_print: ${5:no} # not required. Pretty print XML output.
xpath: ${6:/} # not required. A valid XPath expression describing the item(s) you want to manipulate.,Operates on the document root, C(/), by default.

value: ${7:undefined} # not required. Desired state of the selected attribute.,Either a string, or to unset a value, the Python C(None) keyword (YAML Equivalent, C(null)).,Elements default to no value (but present).,Attributes default to an empty string.
print_match: ${8:no} # not required. Search for a given C(xpath) and print out any matches.,This parameter requires C(xpath) to be set.

add_children: ${9:undefined} # not required. Add additional child-element(s) to a selected element for a given C(xpath).,Child elements must be given in a list and each item may be either a string (eg. C(children=ansible) to add an empty C(<ansible/>) child element), or a hash where the key is an element name and the value is the element value.,This parameter requires C(xpath) to be set.
backup: ${10:no} # not required. Create a backup file including the timestamp information so you can get the original file back if you somehow clobbered it incorrectly.

set_children: ${11:undefined} # not required. Set the child-element(s) of a selected element for a given C(xpath).,Removes any existing children.,Child elements must be specified as in C(add_children).,This parameter requires C(xpath) to be set.
attribute: ${12:undefined} # not required. The attribute to select when using parameter C(value).,This is a string, not prepended with C(@).
input_type: ${13|xml,yaml|} # not required. choices: xml;yaml. Type of input for C(add_children) and C(set_children).
state: ${14|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. Set or remove an xpath selection (node(s), attribute(s)).
namespaces: ${15:undefined} # not required. The namespace C(prefix:uri) mapping for the XPath expression.,Needs to be a C(dict), not a C(list) of items.

yum.description: Manages packages with the I(yum) package manager
body: yum:

name: ${1:undefined} # required. A package name , or package specifier with version, like C(name-1.0).,If a previous version is specified, the task also needs to turn C(allow_downgrade) on. See the C(allow_downgrade) documentation for caveats with downgrading packages.,When using state=latest, this can be '*' which means run C(yum -y update).,You can also pass a url or a local path to a rpm file (using state=present). To operate on several packages this can accept a comma separated list of packages or (as of 2.0) a list of packages.

validate_certs: ${2:yes} # not required. This only applies if using a https url as the source of the rpm. e.g. for localinstall. If set to C(no), the SSL certificates will not be validated.,This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates as it avoids verifying the source site.,Prior to 2.1 the code worked as if this was set to C(yes).
update_cache: ${3:no} # not required. Force yum to check if cache is out of date and redownload if needed. Has an effect only if state is I(present) or I(latest).
update_only: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. When using latest, only update installed packages. Do not install packages.,Has an effect only if state is I(latest)
skip_broken: ${5:no} # not required. Resolve depsolve problems by removing packages that are causing problems from the trans‐ action.
installroot: ${6:/} # not required. Specifies an alternative installroot, relative to which all packages will be installed.

enablerepo: ${7:undefined} # not required. I(Repoid) of repositories to enable for the install/update operation. These repos will not persist beyond the transaction. When specifying multiple repos, separate them with a ",".
disable_gpg_check: ${8:no} # not required. Whether to disable the GPG checking of signatures of packages being installed. Has an effect only if state is I(present) or I(latest).
enable_plugin: ${9:undefined} # not required. I(Plugin) name to enable for the install/update operation. The enabled plugin will not persist beyond the transaction.
security: ${10:no} # not required. If set to C(yes), and C(state=latest) then only installs updates that have been marked security related.

list: ${11:undefined} # not required. Package name to run the equivalent of yum list <package> against. In addition to listing packages, use can also list the following: C(installed), C(updates), C(available) and C(repos).
exclude: ${12:undefined} # not required. Package name(s) to exclude when state=present, or latest
conf_file: ${13:undefined} # not required. The remote yum configuration file to use for the transaction.
disable_plugin: ${14:undefined} # not required. I(Plugin) name to disable for the install/update operation. The disabled plugins will not persist beyond the transaction.

disablerepo: ${15:undefined} # not required. I(Repoid) of repositories to disable for the install/update operation. These repos will not persist beyond the transaction. When specifying multiple repos, separate them with a ",".

state: ${16|absent,installed,latest,present,removed|} # not required. choices: absent;installed;latest;present;removed. Whether to install (C(present) or C(installed), C(latest)), or remove (C(absent) or C(removed)) a package.

allow_downgrade: ${17:no} # not required. Specify if the named package and version is allowed to downgrade a maybe already installed higher version of that package. Note that setting allow_downgrade=True can make this module behave in a non-idempotent way. The task could end up with a set of packages that does not match the complete list of specified packages to install (because dependencies between the downgraded package and others can cause changes to the packages which were in the earlier transaction).
yum_repository:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. Unique repository ID.,This parameter is only required if I(state) is set to C(present) or C(absent).
setype: ${2:null} # not required. Type part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

bandwidth: ${3:0} # not required. Maximum available network bandwidth in bytes/second. Used with the I(throttle) option.,If I(throttle) is a percentage and bandwidth is C(0) then bandwidth throttling will be disabled. If I(throttle) is expressed as a data rate (bytes/sec) then this option is ignored. Default is C(0) (no bandwidth throttling).
selevel: ${4:s0} # not required. Level part of the SELinux file context. This is the MLS/MCS attribute, sometimes known as the C(range). C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).

failovermethod: ${5|roundrobin,priority|} # not required. choices: roundrobin;priority. C(roundrobin) randomly selects a URL out of the list of URLs to start with and proceeds through each of them as it encounters a failure contacting the host.,C(priority) starts from the first I(baseurl) listed and reads through them sequentially.
repo_gpgcheck: ${6|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. This tells yum whether or not it should perform a GPG signature check on the repodata from this repository.

ssl_check_cert_permissions: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether yum should check the permissions on the paths for the certificates on the repository (both remote and local).,If we can't read any of the files then yum will force I(skip_if_unavailable) to be C(yes). This is most useful for non-root processes which use yum on repos that have client cert files which are readable only by root.

metalink: ${8:null} # not required. Specifies a URL to a metalink file for the repomd.xml, a list of mirrors for the entire repository are generated by converting the mirrors for the repomd.xml file to a I(baseurl).,This, the I(baseurl) or I(mirrorlist) parameters are required if I(state) is set to C(present).
cost: ${9:1000} # not required. Relative cost of accessing this repository. Useful for weighing one repo's packages as greater/less than any other.
s3_enabled: ${10|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Enables support for S3 repositories.,This option only works if the YUM S3 plugin is installed.
proxy_password: ${11:null} # not required. Username to use for proxy.
owner: ${12:null} # not required. Name of the user that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).

include: ${13:null} # not required. Include external configuration file. Both, local path and URL is supported. Configuration file will be inserted at the position of the I(include=) line. Included files may contain further include lines. Yum will abort with an error if an inclusion loop is detected.

includepkgs: ${14:null} # not required. List of packages you want to only use from a repository. This should be a space separated list. Shell globs using wildcards (eg. C(*) and C(?)) are allowed. Substitution variables (e.g. C($releasever)) are honored here.,The list can also be a regular YAML array.
password: ${15:null} # not required. Password to use with the username for basic authentication.
serole: ${16:null} # not required. Role part of SELinux file context, C(_default) feature works as for I(seuser).
async: ${17|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If set to C(yes) Yum will download packages and metadata from this repo in parallel, if possible.

ui_repoid_vars: ${18:releasever basearch} # not required. When a repository id is displayed, append these yum variables to the string if they are used in the I(baseurl)/etc. Variables are appended in the order listed (and found).

baseurl: ${19:null} # not required. URL to the directory where the yum repository's 'repodata' directory lives.,It can also be a list of multiple URLs.,This, the I(metalink) or I(mirrorlist) parameters are required if I(state) is set to C(present).

deltarpm_percentage: ${20:75} # not required. When the relative size of delta vs pkg is larger than this, delta is not used. Use C(0) to turn off delta rpm processing. Local repositories (with file:// I(baseurl)) have delta rpms turned off by default.

exclude: ${21:null} # not required. List of packages to exclude from updates or installs. This should be a space separated list. Shell globs using wildcards (eg. C(*) and C(?)) are allowed.,The list can also be a regular YAML array.

attributes: ${22:None} # not required. Attributes the file or directory should have. To get supported flags look at the man page for I(chattr) on the target system. This string should contain the attributes in the same order as the one displayed by I(lsattr).
gpgcheck: ${23|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Tells yum whether or not it should perform a GPG signature check on packages.
timeout: ${24:30} # not required. Number of seconds to wait for a connection before timing out.
state: ${25|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. State of the repo file.

unsafe_writes: ${26:false} # not required. Normally this module uses atomic operations to prevent data corruption or inconsistent reads from the target files, sometimes systems are configured or just broken in ways that prevent this. One example are docker mounted files, they cannot be updated atomically and can only be done in an unsafe manner.,This boolean option allows ansible to fall back to unsafe methods of updating files for those cases in which you do not have any other choice. Be aware that this is subject to race conditions and can lead to data corruption.

ip_resolve: ${27|4,6,IPv4,IPv6,whatever|} # not required. choices: 4;6;IPv4;IPv6;whatever. Determines how yum resolves host names.,C(4) or C(IPv4) - resolve to IPv4 addresses only.,C(6) or C(IPv6) - resolve to IPv6 addresses only.
mirrorlist_expire: ${28:21600} # not required. Time (in seconds) after which the mirrorlist locally cached will expire.,Default value is 6 hours.
reposdir: ${29:/etc/yum.repos.d} # not required. Directory where the C(.repo) files will be stored.
enablegroups: ${30|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Determines whether yum will allow the use of package groups for this repository.

throttle: ${31:null} # not required. Enable bandwidth throttling for downloads.,This option can be expressed as a absolute data rate in bytes/sec. An SI prefix (k, M or G) may be appended to the bandwidth value.
sslclientkey: ${32:null} # not required. Path to the SSL client key yum should use to connect to repos/remote sites.
enabled: ${33|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. This tells yum whether or not use this repository.
file: ${34:null} # not required. File name without the C(.repo) extension to save the repo in. Defaults to the value of I(name).
keepcache: ${35|0,1|} # not required. choices: 0;1. Either C(1) or C(0). Determines whether or not yum keeps the cache of headers and packages after successful installation.
proxy: ${36:null} # not required. URL to the proxy server that yum should use. Set to C(_none_) to disable the global proxy setting.

http_caching: ${37|all,packages,none|} # not required. choices: all;packages;none. Determines how upstream HTTP caches are instructed to handle any HTTP downloads that Yum does.,C(all) means that all HTTP downloads should be cached.,C(packages) means that only RPM package downloads should be cached (but not repository metadata downloads).,C(none) means that no HTTP downloads should be cached.
seuser: ${38:null} # not required. User part of SELinux file context. Will default to system policy, if applicable. If set to C(_default), it will use the C(user) portion of the policy if available.
priority: ${39:99} # not required. Enforce ordered protection of repositories. The value is an integer from 1 to 99.,This option only works if the YUM Priorities plugin is installed.

deltarpm_metadata_percentage: ${40:100} # not required. When the relative size of deltarpm metadata vs pkgs is larger than this, deltarpm metadata is not downloaded from the repo. Note that you can give values over C(100), so C(200) means that the metadata is required to be half the size of the packages. Use C(0) to turn off this check, and always download metadata.
group: ${41:null} # not required. Name of the group that should own the file/directory, as would be fed to I(chown).
gpgcakey: ${42:null} # not required. A URL pointing to the ASCII-armored CA key file for the repository.
retries: ${43:10} # not required. Set the number of times any attempt to retrieve a file should retry before returning an error. Setting this to C(0) makes yum try forever.
description: ${44:null} # not required. A human readable string describing the repository.,This parameter is only required if I(state) is set to C(present).
sslcacert: ${45:null} # not required. Path to the directory containing the databases of the certificate authorities yum should use to verify SSL certificates.
metadata_expire: ${46:21600} # not required. Time (in seconds) after which the metadata will expire.,Default value is 6 hours.

skip_if_unavailable: ${47|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. If set to C(yes) yum will continue running if this repository cannot be contacted for any reason. This should be set carefully as all repos are consulted for any given command.
protect: ${48|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Protect packages from updates from other repositories.
sslverify: ${49|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Defines whether yum should verify SSL certificates/hosts at all.

mode: ${50:null} # not required. Mode the file or directory should be. For those used to I(/usr/bin/chmod) remember that modes are actually octal numbers (like C(0644) or C(01777)). Leaving off the leading zero will likely have unexpected results. As of version 1.8, the mode may be specified as a symbolic mode (for example, C(u+rwx) or C(u=rw,g=r,o=r)).
sslclientcert: ${51:null} # not required. Path to the SSL client certificate yum should use to connect to repos/remote sites.

keepalive: ${52|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. This tells yum whether or not HTTP/1.1 keepalive should be used with this repository. This can improve transfer speeds by using one connection when downloading multiple files from a repository.
gpgkey: ${53:null} # not required. A URL pointing to the ASCII-armored GPG key file for the repository.,It can also be a list of multiple URLs.
proxy_username: ${54:null} # not required. Password for this proxy.
mirrorlist: ${55:null} # not required. Specifies a URL to a file containing a list of baseurls.,This, the I(baseurl) or I(metalink) parameters are required if I(state) is set to C(present).
username: ${56:null} # not required. Username to use for basic authentication to a repo or really any url.

metadata_expire_filter: ${57|never,read-only:past,read-only:present,read-only:future|} # not required. choices: never;read-only:past;read-only:present;read-only:future. Filter the I(metadata_expire) time, allowing a trade of speed for accuracy if a command doesn't require it. Each yum command can specify that it requires a certain level of timeliness quality from the remote repos. from "I'm about to install/upgrade, so this better be current" to "Anything that's available is good enough".,C(never) - Nothing is filtered, always obey I(metadata_expire).,C(read-only:past) - Commands that only care about past information are filtered from metadata expiring. Eg. I(yum history) info (if history needs to lookup anything about a previous transaction, then by definition the remote package was available in the past).,C(read-only:present) - Commands that are balanced between past and future. Eg. I(yum list yum).,C(read-only:future) - Commands that are likely to result in running other commands which will require the latest metadata. Eg. I(yum check-update).,Note that this option does not override "yum clean expire-cache".
zabbix_group:
login_password: ${1:undefined} # required. Zabbix user password.
host_groups: ${2:undefined} # required. List of host groups to create or delete.
login_user: ${3:undefined} # required. Zabbix user name.
server_url: ${4:undefined} # required. Url of Zabbix server, with protocol (http or https). C(url) is an alias for C(server_url).

validate_certs: ${5|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. If set to False, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
http_login_password: ${6:None} # not required. Basic Auth password
timeout: ${7:10} # not required. The timeout of API request(seconds).
state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Create or delete host group.
http_login_user: ${9:None} # not required. Basic Auth login
zabbix_host:
server_url: ${1:undefined} # required. Url of Zabbix server, with protocol (http or https). C(url) is an alias for C(server_url).
login_password: ${2:undefined} # required. Zabbix user password.
login_user: ${3:undefined} # required. Zabbix user name.
host_name: ${4:undefined} # required. Name of the host in Zabbix.,host_name is the unique identifier used and cannot be updated using this module.

inventory_zabbix: ${5:undefined} # not required. Add Facts for a zabbix inventory (e.g. Tag) (see example below).,Please review the interface documentation for more information on the supported properties,https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/3.2/manual/api/reference/host/object#host_inventory

validate_certs: ${6|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. If set to False, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
ipmi_username: ${7:undefined} # not required. IPMI username.,also see the last note in the I(ipmi_authtype) documentation
ipmi_password: ${8:undefined} # not required. IPMI password.,also see the last note in the I(ipmi_authtype) documentation
link_templates: ${9:None} # not required. List of templates linked to the host.

tls_connect: ${10:1} # not required. Specifies what encryption to use for outgoing connections.,The tls_connect parameter accepts values of 1 to 7,Possible values, 1 (no encryption), 2 (PSK), 4 (certificate).,Values can be combined.,Works only with >= Zabbix 3.0
http_login_password: ${11:None} # not required. Basic Auth password
proxy: ${12:None} # not required. The name of the Zabbix Proxy to be used

tls_accept: ${13:1} # not required. Specifies what types of connections are allowed for incoming connections.,The tls_accept parameter accepts values of 1 to 7,Possible values, 1 (no encryption), 2 (PSK), 4 (certificate).,Values can be combined.,Works only with >= Zabbix 3.0
http_login_user: ${14:None} # not required. Basic Auth login
tls_issuer: ${15:undefined} # not required. Required certificate issuer.,Works only with >= Zabbix 3.0
description: ${16:undefined} # not required. Description of the host in Zabbix.
tls_psk: ${17:undefined} # not required. The preshared key, at least 32 hex digits. Required if either tls_connect or tls_accept has PSK enabled.,Works only with >= Zabbix 3.0
tls_subject: ${18:undefined} # not required. Required certificate subject.,Works only with >= Zabbix 3.0

ipmi_privilege: ${19:undefined} # not required. IPMI privilege level.,Please review the Host object documentation for more information on the supported properties,https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/3.4/manual/api/reference/host/object,Possible values are C(1) (callback), C(2) (user), C(3) (operator), C(4) (admin), C(5) (OEM), with C(2) being the API default.,also see the last note in the I(ipmi_authtype) documentation

interfaces: ${20:} # not required. List of interfaces to be created for the host (see example below).,Available keys are: I(dns), I(ip), I(main), I(port), I(type), I(useip), and I(bulk).,Please review the interface documentation for more information on the supported properties,https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/2.0/manual/appendix/api/hostinterface/definitions#host_interface,If an interface definition is incomplete, this module will attempt to fill in sensible values.,I(type) can also be C(agent), C(snmp), C(ipmi), or C(jmx) instead of its numerical value.
host_groups: ${21:undefined} # not required. List of host groups the host is part of.
force: ${22|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Overwrite the host configuration, even if already present

tls_psk_identity: ${23:undefined} # not required. PSK value is a hard to guess string of hexadecimal digits.,It is a unique name by which this specific PSK is referred to by Zabbix components,Do not put sensitive information in PSK identity string, it is transmitted over the network unencrypted.,Works only with >= Zabbix 3.0

ipmi_authtype: ${24:undefined} # not required. IPMI authentication algorithm.,Please review the Host object documentation for more information on the supported properties,https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/3.4/manual/api/reference/host/object,Possible values are, C(0) (none), C(1) (MD2), C(2) (MD5), C(4) (straight), C(5) (OEM), C(6) (RMCP+), with -1 being the API default.,Please note that the Zabbix API will treat absent settings as default when updating any of the I(ipmi_)-options; this means that if you attempt to set any of the four options individually, the rest will be reset to default values.
inventory_mode: ${25|automatic,manual,disabled|} # not required. choices: automatic;manual;disabled. Configure the inventory mode.
timeout: ${26:10} # not required. The timeout of API request(seconds).

state: ${27|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the host.,On C(present), it will create if host does not exist or update the host if the associated data is different.,On C(absent) will remove a host if it exists.
status: ${28|enabled,disabled|} # not required. choices: enabled;disabled. Monitoring status of the host.
visible_name: ${29:undefined} # not required. Visible name of the host in Zabbix.
zabbix_hostmacro:
server_url: ${1:undefined} # required. Url of Zabbix server, with protocol (http or https). C(url) is an alias for C(server_url).
macro_value: ${2:undefined} # required. Value of the host macro.
host_name: ${3:undefined} # required. Name of the host.
login_user: ${4:undefined} # required. Zabbix user name.
macro_name: ${5:undefined} # required. Name of the host macro.
login_password: ${6:undefined} # required. Zabbix user password.

validate_certs: ${7|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. If set to False, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

state: ${8|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the macro.,On C(present), it will create if macro does not exist or update the macro if the associated data is different.,On C(absent) will remove a macro if it exists.
force: ${9|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Only updates an existing macro if set to C(yes).
http_login_password: ${10:None} # not required. Basic Auth password
timeout: ${11:10} # not required. The timeout of API request(seconds).
http_login_user: ${12:None} # not required. Basic Auth login
zabbix_maintenance:
desc: ${1:Created by Ansible} # required. Short description of maintenance window.
server_url: ${2:undefined} # required. Url of Zabbix server, with protocol (http or https). C(url) is an alias for C(server_url).
login_password: ${3:undefined} # required. Zabbix user password.
login_user: ${4:undefined} # required. Zabbix user name.
name: ${5:undefined} # required. Unique name of maintenance window.

validate_certs: ${6|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. If set to False, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

host_names: ${7:null} # not required. Hosts to manage maintenance window for. Separate multiple hosts with commas. C(host_name) is an alias for C(host_names). B(Required) option when C(state) is I(present) and no C(host_groups) specified.

host_groups: ${8:null} # not required. Host groups to manage maintenance window for. Separate multiple groups with commas. C(host_group) is an alias for C(host_groups). B(Required) option when C(state) is I(present) and no C(host_names) specified.
collect_data: ${9:true} # not required. Type of maintenance. With data collection, or without.
http_login_password: ${10:None} # not required. Basic Auth password
timeout: ${11:10} # not required. The timeout of API request(seconds).
state: ${12|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. Create or remove a maintenance window.
http_login_user: ${13:None} # not required. Basic Auth login
minutes: ${14:10} # not required. Length of maintenance window in minutes.
zabbix_proxy:
server_url: ${1:undefined} # required. Url of Zabbix server, with protocol (http or https). C(url) is an alias for C(server_url).
login_password: ${2:undefined} # required. Zabbix user password.
login_user: ${3:undefined} # required. Zabbix user name.
proxy_name: ${4:undefined} # required. Name of the proxy in Zabbix.

validate_certs: ${5|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. If set to False, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
tls_issuer: ${6:undefined} # not required. Certificate issuer.
description: ${7:undefined} # not required. Description of the proxy..
tls_psk: ${8:undefined} # not required. The preshared key, at least 32 hex digits. Required if either I(tls_connect) or I(tls_accept) has PSK enabled.
tls_subject: ${9:undefined} # not required. Certificate subject.
tls_connect: ${10|no_encryption,PSK,certificate|} # not required. choices: no_encryption;PSK;certificate. Connections to proxy.

interface: ${11:[object Object]} # not required. Dictionary with params for the interface when proxy is in passive mode,Available values are: dns, ip, main, port, type and useip.,Please review the interface documentation for more information on the supported properties,U(https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/3.2/manual/api/reference/proxy/object#proxy_interface)
tls_psk_identity: ${12:undefined} # not required. PSK identity. Required if either I(tls_connect) or I(tls_accept) has PSK enabled.
http_login_password: ${13:None} # not required. Basic Auth password
tls_accept: ${14|no_encryption,PSK,certificate|} # not required. choices: no_encryption;PSK;certificate. Connections from proxy.
timeout: ${15:10} # not required. The timeout of API request(seconds).

state: ${16|present,absent|} # not required. choices: present;absent. State of the proxy.,On C(present), it will create if proxy does not exist or update the proxy if the associated data is different.,On C(absent) will remove a proxy if it exists.
http_login_user: ${17:None} # not required. Basic Auth login
status: ${18|active,passive|} # not required. choices: active;passive. Type of proxy. (4 - active, 5 - passive)
zabbix_screen:

screens: ${1:undefined} # required. List of screens to be created/updated/deleted(see example).,If the screen(s) already been added, the screen(s) name won't be updated.,When creating or updating screen(s), C(screen_name), C(host_group) are required.,When deleting screen(s), the C(screen_name) is required.,The available states are: C(present) (default) and C(absent). If the screen(s) already exists, and the state is not C(absent), the screen(s) will just be updated as needed.
login_user: ${2:undefined} # required. Zabbix user name.
server_url: ${3:undefined} # required. Url of Zabbix server, with protocol (http or https). C(url) is an alias for C(server_url).
login_password: ${4:undefined} # required. Zabbix user password.

validate_certs: ${5|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. If set to False, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
http_login_password: ${6:None} # not required. Basic Auth password
timeout: ${7:10} # not required. The timeout of API request(seconds).
http_login_user: ${8:None} # not required. Basic Auth login
zabbix_template:
login_password: ${1:undefined} # required. Zabbix user password.
server_url: ${2:undefined} # required. Url of Zabbix server, with protocol (http or https). C(url) is an alias for C(server_url).
template_name: ${3:undefined} # required. Name of zabbix template
login_user: ${4:undefined} # required. Zabbix user name.

validate_certs: ${5|true,false|} # not required. choices: true;false. If set to False, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.
clear_templates: ${6:undefined} # not required. List of templates cleared from the template.,see templates_clear in https://www.zabbix.com/documentation/3.0/manual/api/reference/template/update
template_json: ${7:undefined} # not required. JSON dump of template to import
link_templates: ${8:undefined} # not required. List of templates linked to the template.
macros: ${9:undefined} # not required. List of templates macro
http_login_password: ${10:None} # not required. Basic Auth password
timeout: ${11:10} # not required. The timeout of API request(seconds).
state: ${12|present,absent,dump|} # not required. choices: present;absent;dump. state present create/update template, absent delete template
http_login_user: ${13:None} # not required. Basic Auth login
template_groups: ${14:undefined} # not required. List of template groups to create or delete.
zfs:

state: ${1|absent,present|} # required. choices: absent;present. Whether to create (C(present)), or remove (C(absent)) a file system, snapshot or volume. All parents/children will be created/destroyed as needed to reach the desired state.
name: ${2:undefined} # required. File system, snapshot or volume name e.g. C(rpool/myfs).
extra_zfs_properties: ${3:undefined} # not required. A dictionary of zfs properties to be set.,See the zfs(8) man page for more information.
origin: ${4:undefined} # not required. Snapshot from which to create a clone.

key_value: ${5:undefined} # not required. (**DEPRECATED**) This will be removed in Ansible-2.9.  Set these values in the,C(extra_zfs_properties) option instead.,The C(zfs) module takes key=value pairs for zfs properties to be set.,See the zfs(8) man page for more information.
zfs_facts:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. ZFS dataset name.
properties: ${2:all} # not required. Specifies which dataset properties should be queried in comma-separated format. For more information about dataset properties, check zfs(1M) man page.
depth: ${3:None} # not required. Specifiies recurion depth.

type: ${4|all,filesystem,volume,snapshot,bookmark|} # not required. choices: all;filesystem;volume;snapshot;bookmark. Specifies which datasets types to display. Multiple values have to be provided in comma-separated form.
parsable: ${5:false} # not required. Specifies if property values should be displayed in machine friendly format.
recurse: ${6:false} # not required. Specifies if properties for any children should be recursively displayed.

znode.description: Create, delete, retrieve, and update znodes using ZooKeeper
body: znode:
name: ${1:undefined} # required. The path of the znode.
hosts: ${2:undefined} # required. A list of ZooKeeper servers (format '[server]:[port]').
value: ${3:None} # not required. The value assigned to the znode.
op: ${4:None} # not required. An operation to perform. Mutually exclusive with state.
timeout: ${5:300} # not required. The amount of time to wait for a node to appear.
state: ${6:None} # not required. The state to enforce. Mutually exclusive with op.
recursive: ${7:false} # not required. Recursively delete node and all its children.
zpool_facts:
parsable: ${1:false} # not required. Specifies if property values should be displayed in machine friendly format.
properties: ${2:all} # not required. Specifies which dataset properties should be queried in comma-separated format. For more information about dataset properties, check zpool(1M) man page.
name: ${3:undefined} # not required. ZFS pool name.

zypper.description: Manage packages on SUSE and openSUSE
body: zypper:

name: ${1:undefined} # required. Package name C(name) or package specifier or a list of either.,Can include a version like C(name=1.0), C(name>3.4) or C(name<=2.7). If a version is given, C(oldpackage) is implied and zypper is allowed to update the package within the version range given.,You can also pass a url or a local path to a rpm file.,When using state=latest, this can be '*', which updates all installed packages.
update_cache: ${2|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Run the equivalent of C(zypper refresh) before the operation. Disabled in check mode.
type: ${3|package,patch,pattern,product,srcpackage,application|} # not required. choices: package;patch;pattern;product;srcpackage;application. The type of package to be operated on.
force: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Adds C(--force) option to I(zypper). Allows to downgrade packages and change vendor or architecture.

oldpackage: ${5|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Adds C(--oldpackage) option to I(zypper). Allows to downgrade packages with less side-effects than force. This is implied as soon as a version is specified as part of the package name.
extra_args: ${6:undefined} # not required. Add additional options to C(zypper) command.,Options should be supplied in a single line as if given in the command line.

disable_recommends: ${7|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Corresponds to the C(--no-recommends) option for I(zypper). Default behavior (C(yes)) modifies zypper's default behavior; C(no) does install recommended packages.

disable_gpg_check: ${8|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether to disable to GPG signature checking of the package signature being installed. Has an effect only if state is I(present) or I(latest).

state: ${9|present,latest,absent,dist-upgrade|} # not required. choices: present;latest;absent;dist-upgrade. C(present) will make sure the package is installed. C(latest)  will make sure the latest version of the package is installed. C(absent)  will make sure the specified package is not installed. C(dist-upgrade) will make sure the latest version of all installed packages from all enabled repositories is installed.,When using C(dist-upgrade), I(name) should be C('*').
zypper_repository:
overwrite_multiple: ${1|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Overwrite multiple repository entries, if repositories with both name and URL already exist.
description: ${2:none} # not required. A description of the repository
autorefresh: ${3|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Enable autorefresh of the repository.
enabled: ${4|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Set repository to enabled (or disabled).
priority: ${5:undefined} # not required. Set priority of repository. Packages will always be installed from the repository with the smallest priority number.,Needs zypper version >= 1.12.25.
runrefresh: ${6|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Refresh the package list of the given repository.,Can be used with repo=* to refresh all repositories.
repo: ${7:none} # not required. URI of the repository or .repo file. Required when state=present.

auto_import_keys: ${8|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Automatically import the gpg signing key of the new or changed repository.,Has an effect only if state is I(present). Has no effect on existing (unchanged) repositories or in combination with I(absent).,Implies runrefresh.,Only works with C(.repo) files if `name` is given explicitly.
disable_gpg_check: ${9|yes,no|} # not required. choices: yes;no. Whether to disable GPG signature checking of all packages. Has an effect only if state is I(present).,Needs zypper version >= 1.6.2.
state: ${10|absent,present|} # not required. choices: absent;present. A source string state.
name: ${11:none} # not required. A name for the repository. Not required when adding repofiles.
